name: 'ABLA
meaning: Means "full-figured" in Arabic. The 7th-century Arabic poet Antara dedicated much of his poetry to a woman named Abla.

name: AADA
meaning: Finnish short form of ADELE and other names beginning with the same sound.

name: AAFJE
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Germanic element alf "elf".

name: AAGE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of ÁKI.

name: AALIYAH
meaning: Feminine form of AALI. It was popularized in the English-speaking world by the singer Aaliyah Haughton (1979-2001), who was known simply as Aaliyah.

name: AAMIR  (1)
meaning: Variant transcription of 'AAMIR, as well as the usual Urdu transcription.

name: AAREN
meaning: Variant or feminine form of AARON.

name: AARON
meaning: From the Hebrew name אַהֲרֹן('Aharon) which is most likely of unknown Egyptian origin. Other theories claim a Hebrew derivation, and suggest meanings such as "high mountain" or "exalted". In the Old Testament this name is borne by the older brother of Moses. He acted as a spokesman for his brother when they appealed to the pharaoh to release the Israelites from slavery. Aaron's rod produced miracles and plagues to intimidate the pharaoh. After the departure from Egypt and arrival at Mount Sinai, God installed Aaron as the first high priest of the Israelites and promised that his descendants would form the priesthood....[more]

name: AARTI
meaning: From the name of a Hindu ritual in which offerings of lamps or candles are made to various gods, derived from Sanskrit आरात्रिक(aratrika).

name: AATTO
meaning: Finnish form of ADOLF. It also means "eve, evening before" in Finnish, as the day before an important holiday.

name: ABADDON
meaning: Means "ruin, destruction" in Hebrew. In Revelation in the New Testament this is another name of the angel of the abyss.

name: ABBAS
meaning: Means "austere" in Arabic. This was the name of the Prophet Muhammad's uncle. It was also borne by a son of Ali, the fourth caliph.

name: ABBE
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element adal meaning "noble".

name: ABBÁN
meaning: Means "little abbot", derived from Irish abb "abbot" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of a 6th-century Irish saint, the son of King Cormac of Leinster.

name: ABD AL-AZIZ
meaning: Means "servant of the powerful" from Arabic عبد ال('abd al) meaning "servant of the" combined with عزيز('aziz) meaning "powerful". This was the name of the first king of modern Saudi Arabia.

name: ABD AL-HAMID
meaning: Means "servant of the praiseworthy" from Arabic عبد ال('abd al) meaning "servant of the" combined with حميد(hamid) meaning "praiseworthy". This was the name of two sultans of the Ottoman Empire.

name: ABD AL-KARIM
meaning: Means "servant of the generous" from Arabic عبد ال('abd al) meaning "servant of the" combined with كريم(karim) meaning "generous".

name: ABD AL-LATIF
meaning: Means "servant of the gentle" from Arabic عبد ال('abd al) meaning "servant of the" combined with لطيف(latif) meaning "gentle".

name: ABD AL-MALIK
meaning: Means "servant of the king" from Arabic عبد ال('abd al) meaning "servant of the" combined with ملك(malik) meaning "king". This was the name of the fifth Umayyad caliph, who made Arabic the official language of the empire.

name: ABD AL-QADIR
meaning: Means "servant of the capable, powerful" from Arabic عبد ال('abd al) meaning "servant of the" combined with قادر(qadir) meaning "capable, powerful". This was the name of a 19th-century Algerian resistance leader.

name: ABD AL-RAHMAN
meaning: Means "servant of the merciful" from Arabic عبد ال('abd al) meaning "servant of the" combined with رحمن(rahman) meaning "merciful". This was the name of two early caliphs of the Umayyad dynasty in Spain.

name: ABD AL-RASHID
meaning: Means "servant of the rightly guided" from Arabic عبد ال('abd al) meaning "servant of the" combined with رشد(rashid) meaning "rightly guided".

name: ABD AL-WALI
meaning: Means "servant of the guardian" from Arabic عبد ال('abd al) meaning  "servant of the" combined with ولِي(wali) meaning "guardian, friend".

name: ABD ALLAH
meaning: Means "servant of ALLAH" from Arabic عبد('abd) meaning "servant of" combined with الله(Allah). This was the name of the Prophet Muhammad's father. He died before his son's birth.

name: ABDIAS
meaning: Form of OBADIAH used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: ABDIOU
meaning: Form of OBADIAH used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: ABDUL
meaning: First part of compound Arabic names beginning with عبد ال('Abd al) meaning "servant of the" (such as عبد العزيز('Abd al-'Aziz) "servant of the powerful").

name: ABDULLAH
meaning: Variant transcription of ABD ALLAH, as well as the regular Turkish, Malay and Indonesian form.

name: ABDULLOHI
meaning: Tajik variant form of ABD ALLAH.

name: ABEDNEGO
meaning: Means "servant of Nebo" in Akkadian, Nebo being the Babylonian god of wisdom. In the Old Testament Abednego is the Babylonian name given to Azariah, one of the three men cast into a blazing furnace but saved from harm by God, as told in the Book of Daniel.

name: ABEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name הֶבֶל(Hevel) meaning "breath". In the Old Testament he is the second son of Adam and Eve, murdered out of envy by his brother Cain. In England, this name came into use during the Middle Ages, and it was common during the Puritan era.

name: ABENE
meaning: Derived from Basque abe meaning "pillar". It is a Basque equivalent of Pilar.

name: ABENI
meaning: Means "we asked for her, and behold, we got her" in Yoruba.

name: ABERASH
meaning: Possibly means "giving off light, shining" in Amharic.

name: ABHIJIT
meaning: From Sanskrit अभिजित(abhijita) meaning "victorious". This is the Sanskrit name for the star Vega.

name: ABIA
meaning: Biblical Greek and Latin form of 'AVIYAH.

name: ABIAH
meaning: Variant of ABIJAH which also appears in the English Bible.

name: ABIDAN
meaning: Means "my father is judge" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is a Benjamite prince.

name: ABIDEMI
meaning: Means "born during father's absence" in Yoruba.

name: ABIEL
meaning: Means "God is my father" in Hebrew. This was the name of the grandfather of Saul in the Old Testament.

name: ABIGAIL
meaning: From the Hebrew name אֲבִיגָיִל('Avigayil) meaning "my father is joy", derived from the roots אָב('av) meaning "father" and גִּיל(gil) meaning "joy". In the Old Testament this is the name of Nabal's wife. After Nabal's death she became the third wife of King David....[more]

name: ABIHU
meaning: Means "he is my father" in Hebrew. This is the name of a son of Aaron in the Old Testament. He and his brother Nadab were killed by God because they presented him with unauthorized fire.

name: ABIJAH
meaning: Means "my father is YAHWEH" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of several characters, both male and female, including the second king of Judah.

name: ABILENE
meaning: From a place name mentioned briefly in the New Testament. It is probably from Hebrew אָבֵל('avel) meaning "meadow, grassy area". It has occasionally been used as a given name in modern times.

name: ABIMAEL
meaning: Meaning uncertain, though the first element is likely Hebrew אָב('av) meaning "father". In the Old Testament he is listed as a descendant of Shem.

name: ABIMELECH
meaning: Means "my father is king" in Hebrew. This is the name of several characters in the Old Testament including a king of Gerar who takes Abraham's wife Sarah, but is forced by God to give her back.

name: ABIODUN
meaning: Means "born on a festival" in Yoruba.

name: ABIRAM
meaning: Means "my father is exalted" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament, Abiram is swallowed by an earthquake after rebelling against the leadership of Moses.

name: ABISHAG
meaning: Means "my father strays" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament Abishag is a young woman who tends King David in his old age.

name: ABISHAI
meaning: Means "my father is a gift" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is one of King David's heroes.

name: ABITAL
meaning: Means "my father is the night dew" in Hebrew. She is the fifth wife of David in the Old Testament.

name: ABNER
meaning: Means "my father is a light" in Hebrew, from אָב('av) meaning "father" and נִיר(nir) meaning "lamp, light". In the Old Testament, Abner was a cousin of Saul and the commander of his army. After he killed Asahel he was himself slain by Asahel's brother Joab. It has been used as an English Christian given name since the Protestant Reformation. It was popular with the Puritans, who brought it to America in the 17th century.

name: ABOUBACAR
meaning: Form of ABU BAKR used in western Africa.

name: ABRAAM
meaning: Biblical Greek form of ABRAHAM, as well as a Georgian form.

name: ABRAHAM
meaning: This name may be viewed either as meaning "father of many" in Hebrew or else as a contraction of ABRAM(1) and הָמוֹן(hamon) meaning "many, multitude". The biblical patriarch Abraham was originally named Abram but God changed his name (see Genesis 17:5). With his father Terah, he led his wife Sarah, his nephew Lot and their other followers from Ur into Canaan. He is regarded by Jews as being the founder of the Hebrews through his son Isaac and by Muslims as being the founder of the Arabs through his son Ishmael....[more]

name: ABRAM  (1)
meaning: Means "high father" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament God changed Abram's name to Abraham (see Genesis 17:5).

name: ABRAM  (2)
meaning: Russian and Georgian form of ABRAHAM.

name: ABSALOM
meaning: From the Hebrew name אַבְשָׁלוֹם('Avshalom) meaning "my father is peace", derived from אָב('av) meaning "father" and שָׁלוֹם(shalom) meaning "peace". In the Old Testament he is a son of King David. He avenged his sister Tamar by arranging the murder of her rapist, their half-brother Amnon. He later led a revolt against his father. While fleeing on the back of a mule he got his head caught in a tree and was killed by Joab.

name: ABU
meaning: Means "father of" in Arabic. This is commonly used as an element in a kunya, which is a type of Arabic nickname. The element is combined with the name of one of the bearer's children (usually the eldest son). In some cases the kunya is figurative, not referring to an actual child, as in the case of the Muslim caliph Abu Bakr.

name: ABU AL-FADL
meaning: Combination of ABU and FADL. This was another name for Abbas, the son of the fourth caliph Ali.

name: ABU BAKR
meaning: Combination of ABU and BAKR. Abu Bakr was a companion and father-in-law of the Prophet Muhammad and the first caliph of the Muslim world. His name was in fact a kunya (a nickname) formed using Abu; his real name was Abd Allah. Shia Muslims hold a more negative view of Abu Bakr, hence this name is more widely used among Sunnis.

name: ABUBAKAR
meaning: Form of ABU BAKR used in Nigeria.

name: ACA
meaning: Serbian and Macedonian diminutive of ALEKSANDAR.

name: ACACIA
meaning: From the name of a type of tree, ultimately deriving from Greek ακη(ake) "thorn, point".

name: ACANTHA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Ακανθα(Akantha), which meant "thorn, prickle". In Greek legend she was a nymph loved by Apollo.

name: ACE  (1)
meaning: From the English word meaning "highest rank". More commonly a nickname, it is occasionally used as a given name.

name: ACHAB
meaning: Latin form of AHAB used in some versions of the Vulgate.

name: ACHAICUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Αχαικος(Achaikos), which referred to the region in Greece called Αχαια(Achaia), situated on the northern coast of the Peloponnese. In the New Testament this is the name of a Corinthian Christian who aids Saint Paul.

name: ACHAN
meaning: Possibly a variation of the Hebrew word עֲכָר('akhar) meaning "trouble". In the Old Testament, Achan is stoned to death because he steals forbidden items during the assault on Jericho.

name: ACHILLE
meaning: French and Italian form of ACHILLES.

name: ACHILLES
meaning: From the Greek Αχιλλευς(Achilleus) which is of unknown meaning, perhaps derived from Greek αχος(achos) "pain" or else from the name of the Achelous River. This was the name of a warrior in Greek legend, one of the central characters in Homer's 'Iliad'. The bravest of the Greek heroes in the war against the Trojans, he was eventually killed by an arrow to his heel, the only vulnerable part of his body....[more]

name: ACHIM  (2)
meaning: Possibly means "he will establish" in Hebrew. In the New Testament this name is listed as an ancestor of Jesus.

name: ACO
meaning: Macedonian and Serbian diminutive of ALEKSANDAR.

name: ADA
meaning: Short form of ADELAIDE and other names beginning with the same sound. This name was borne by Augusta Ada King (1815-1852), the Countess of Lovelace (known as Ada Lovelace), a daughter of Lord Byron. She was an assistant to Charles Babbage, the inventor of an early mechanical computer.

name: ADAH
meaning: Means "adornment" in Hebrew. This was the name of the wives of both Lamech and Esau in the Old Testament.

name: ADAIR
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the given name EDGAR.

name: ADALBERN
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements adal "noble" and bern "bear".

name: ADALBERT
meaning: Old Germanic form of ALBERT. This is the name of a patron saint of Bohemia, Poland and Prussia.

name: ADALET
meaning: Means "justice" in Turkish, ultimately from Arabic.

name: ADALFARUS
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements adal "noble" and fara "journey".

name: ADALHARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements adal "noble" and hard "brave, hardy". Saint Adalhard or Adalard was a cousin of Charlemagne who became a abbot of Corbie.

name: ADALIA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Persian origin. In Book of Esther in the Old Testament this is the name of a son of Haman the Agagite.

name: ADALLINDIS
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements adal "noble" and lind "soft, tender, flexible".

name: ADALWIN
meaning: From the Germanic elements adal "noble" and win "friend".

name: ADALYN
meaning: Variant of ADELINE using the popular name suffix lyn.

name: ADALYNN
meaning: Variant of ADELINE using the popular name suffix lyn.

name: ADAM
meaning: This is the Hebrew word for "man". It could be ultimately derived from Hebrew אדם('adam) meaning "to be red", referring to the ruddy colour of human skin, or from Akkadian adamu meaning "to make"....[more]

name: ADDE
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element adal meaning "noble".

name: ADDISON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of ADAM". Its recent popularity as a feminine name stems from its similarity in sound to Madison.

name: ADE  (1)
meaning: Means "crown" in Yoruba, also a short form of other Yoruba names beginning with this element.

name: ADEBAYO
meaning: Means "the crown meets joy" in Yoruba.

name: ADEBOLA
meaning: Means "the crown has met wealth" in Yoruba.

name: ADEBOWALE
meaning: Means "the crown has come home" in Yoruba.

name: ADEDAYO
meaning: Means "the crown becomes joy" in Yoruba.

name: ADEGOKE
meaning: Means "the crown has been exalted" in Yoruba.

name: ADEL
meaning: Persian form of ADIL, as well as a variant transcription of the Arabic name.

name: ADELA
meaning: Originally a short form of names beginning with the Germanic element adal meaning "noble". Saint Adela was a 7th-century Frankish princess who founded a monastery at Pfazel in France. This name was also borne by a daughter of William the Conqueror.

name: ADELAIDA
meaning: Spanish and Hungarian form of ADELAIDE.

name: ADELAIDE
meaning: From the French form of the Germanic name Adalheidis, which was composed of the elements adal "noble" and heid "kind, sort, type". It was borne in the 10th century by Saint Adelaide, the wife of the Holy Roman emperor Otto the Great. The name became common in Britain in the 19th century due to the popularity of the German-born wife of King William IV, for whom the city of Adelaide in Australia was named in 1836.

name: ADELARDO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of ADALHARD.

name: ADELBERT
meaning: German and Dutch variant of ADALBERT.

name: ADELHEID
meaning: German and Dutch form of ADELAIDE.

name: ADELINA
meaning: From a Latinized Germanic name which was derived from the element adal meaning "noble".

name: ADELINE
meaning: French and English form of ADELINA.

name: ADELITA
meaning: Spanish diminutive of ADELA. It is used especially in Mexico, where it is the name of a folk song about a female soldier.

name: ADELMAR
meaning: From the Germanic elements adal "noble" and mari "famous".

name: ADELYN
meaning: Variant of ADELINE using the popular name suffix lyn.

name: ADEODATUS
meaning: Latin name meaning "given by God". This was the name of a son of Saint Augustine and two popes (who are also known by the related name Deusdedit).

name: ADERYN
meaning: Means "bird" in Welsh. This is a modern Welsh name.

name: ADETOKUNBO
meaning: Means "the crown came from over the sea" in Yoruba.

name: ADHARA
meaning: Derived from Arabic عذارى('adhara) meaning "maidens". This is the name of the second brightest star (after Sirius) in the constellation Canis Major.

name: ADI  (2)
meaning: Means "first" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit आदि(adi).

name: ADI  (3)
meaning: Diminutive of ADOLF (German) or ADRIAN (Romanian) as well as other names beginning with the same sound.

name: ADIL
meaning: Means "fair, honest, just" from Arabic عدل('adala) "to act justly". This name was borne by several sultans of Bijapur.

name: ADILET
meaning: Means "justice" in Kyrgyz, ultimately from Arabic.

name: ADINA  (1)
meaning: From Hebrew עֲדִינָא('adina') meaning "slender, delicate". This name is borne by a soldier in the Old Testament. It is also used in modern Hebrew as a feminine name, typically spelled עֲדִינָה.

name: ADINA  (2)
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly a short form of ADELINA.

name: ADINO
meaning: Means "ornament" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of one of King David's mighty men.

name: ADIR
meaning: Means "strong, mighty" in Hebrew. This word is used in the Hebrew Bible to describe God.

name: ADISA
meaning: Means "one who is clear" in Yoruba.

name: ADITI
meaning: Means "boundless, entire" or "freedom, security" in Sanskrit. This is the name of an ancient Hindu goddess of the sky and fertility. According to the Vedas she is the mother of the gods.

name: ADITYA
meaning: Means "belonging to ADITI" in Sanskrit. This is a name for the seven (or eight) Hindu gods who are the children of Aditi. It is also another name for the sun god Surya.

name: ADLAI
meaning: Contracted form of ADALIA. This is the name of the father of one of King David's herdsmen in the Old Testament.

name: ADNAN
meaning: Means "settler" in Arabic. According to tradition, Adnan was an ancestor of the Prophet Muhammad and the northern Arabian tribes.

name: ADOLF
meaning: From the Germanic name Adalwolf, which meant "noble wolf" from the Germanic elements adal "noble" and wulf. It was borne by several Swedish kings as a first or second name, most notably by Gustav II Adolf in the 17th century. Association with Adolf Hitler (1889-1945), the leader of the Nazi party in Germany during World War II, has lessened the use of this name.

name: ADOLFO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of ADOLF.

name: ADOLPH
meaning: English form of ADOLF, rarely used since World War II.

name: ADONAI
meaning: Means "my lord" in Hebrew. This was the title used to refer to the God of the Israelites, Yahweh, whose name was forbidden to be spoken.

name: ADONIJAH
meaning: Means "my lord is YAHWEH" in Hebrew. This is the name of one of King David's sons in the Old Testament. Though he was the eldest surviving son of David, he was passed over as heir to the throne in favour of Solomon.

name: ADONIRAM
meaning: Means "my lord is exalted" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of an overseer of tribute under the kings David, Solomon and Rehoboam. He was stoned to death when the Israelites revolted.

name: ADONIS
meaning: From the Semitic Adonai, which means "lord". In Greek myth Adonis was a handsome young shepherd killed while hunting a wild boar. The anemone flower is said to have sprung from his blood. Because he was loved by Aphrodite, Zeus allowed him to be restored to life for part of each year. The Greeks borrowed this character from various Semitic traditions, hence the Semitic origins of the name.

name: ADORACIÓN
meaning: Means "adoration" in Spanish. This name refers to the event that is known in Christian tradition as the Adoration of the Magi, which is when the three Magi presented gifts to the infant Jesus and worshipped him.

name: ADRASTEA
meaning: Latinized form of ADRASTEIA. One of Jupiter's moons bears this name.

name: ADRASTEIA
meaning: Feminine form of ADRASTOS. In Greek mythology this name was borne by a nymph who fostered the infant Zeus. This was also another name of the goddess Nemesis.

name: ADRASTOS
meaning: Means "not inclined to run away" in Greek. This was the name of a king of Argos in Greek legend.

name: ADRIAN
meaning: Form of Hadrianus (see HADRIAN). Several saints and six popes have borne this name, including the only English pope, Adrian IV, and the only Dutch pope, Adrian VI. As an English name, it has been in use since the Middle Ages, though it was not popular until modern times.

name: ADRIANO
meaning: Italian and Portuguese form of ADRIAN.

name: ADRIANUS
meaning: Official Dutch form of ADRIAN, used on birth certificates but not commonly in daily life.

name: ADRIEL
meaning: Means "flock of God" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a man who married Saul's daughter Merab.

name: ADRIJAN
meaning: Croatian and Macedonian form of ADRIAN.

name: ADRIJANA
meaning: Slovene, Serbian, Croatian and Macedonian feminine form of ADRIAN.

name: ADRIÁN
meaning: Spanish and Hungarian form of Hadrianus (see HADRIAN).

name: AEGLE
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Αιγλη(Aigle) which meant "light, radiance, glory". This was the name of several characters in Greek myth, including one of the Heliades and one of the Hesperides.

name: AELIANUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was a derivative of AELIUS.

name: AELIUS
meaning: Roman family name which was possibly derived from the Greek word ‘ηλιος(helios) meaning "sun". This was the family name of the Roman emperor Hadrian.

name: AELLA
meaning: Means "whirlwind" in Greek. In Greek myth this was the name of an Amazon warrior killed by Herakles during his quest for Hippolyta's girdle.

name: AENEAS
meaning: Latin form of the Greek name Αινειας(Aineias), derived from Greek αινη(aine) meaning "praise". In Greek legend he was a son of Aphrodite and was one of the chief heroes who defended Troy from the Greeks. The Roman poet Virgil continued his story in the 'Aeneid', in which Aeneas travels to Italy and founds the Roman state.

name: AENOR
meaning: Probably a Latinized form of a Germanic name of unknown meaning. This was the name of the mother of Eleanor of Aquitaine.

name: AERON  (1)
meaning: Either derived from Welsh aeron meaning "berry" or else from the name of a river in Wales.

name: AERON  (2)
meaning: Welsh form of AGRONA. In Welsh mythology Aeron was often portrayed as a masculine deity.

name: AERONWEN
meaning: Combination of AERON(1) and the suffix gwen meaning "white, fair, blessed".

name: AERONWY
meaning: Combination of AERON(1) and the suffix wy meaning "river".

name: AESCHYLUS
meaning: From the Greek name Αισχυλος(Aischylos), derived from αισχος(aischos) "shame". This was the name of a 5th-century BC Athenian historian.

name: AESON
meaning: From the Greek Αισων(Aison), which is of unknown meaning. Aeson was the father of Jason in Greek mythology.

name: AESOP
meaning: From the Greek Αισωπος(Aisopos), which is of unknown meaning. This was the name of a Greek fabulist of the 6th century BC, famous for such tales as 'The Tortoise and the Hare'.

name: AETIUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was probably derived from Greek αετος(aetos) "eagle". A famous bearer was the 5th-century Roman general Flavius Aetius, who defeated Attila the Hun at the Battle of Chalons.

name: AFANEN
meaning: Means "raspberry" in Welsh. This is a modern Welsh name.

name: AFON
meaning: Means "river" in Welsh. This is a Welsh name of recent origin.

name: AFONSO
meaning: Portuguese and Galician form of ALFONSO.

name: AFRA  (1)
meaning: Originally used by the Romans as a nickname for a woman from Africa. This was the name of two early saints.

name: AFRICA  (1)
meaning: From the name of the continent, which is of Latin origin, possibly from the Afri people who lived near Carthage in North Africa. This rare name is used most often by African-American parents.

name: AFRICANUS
meaning: Roman cognomen derived from the place name AFRICA, which in Roman times referred only to North Africa. This was the agnomen of the 3rd-century BC Roman general Scipio Africanus, who was honoured with it after his victory over Carthage in the Second Punic War. His descendants used it as a cognomen.

name: AFËRDITA
meaning: Means "daybreak, morning" in Albanian, from afër "nearby, close" and ditë "day".

name: AGAMEMNON
meaning: Possibly meaning "very steadfast" in Greek. In Greek mythology he was the brother of Menelaus. He led the Greek expedition to Troy to recover his brother's wife Helen. After the Trojan War Agamemnon was killed by his wife Clytemnestra.

name: AGAPE
meaning: Derived from Greek αγαπη(agape) meaning "love". This name was borne by at least two early saints.

name: AGAPETUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Agapetos (see AGAPITO).

name: AGAPIOS
meaning: Masculine form of AGAPE. This was the name of a saint from Caesarea who was martyred during the persecutions of the Roman emperor Diocletian.

name: AGAPITO
meaning: From the Late Latin name Agapitus or Agapetus which was derived from the Greek name Αγαπητος(Agapetos) meaning "beloved". The name Agapetus was borne by two popes.

name: AGAR
meaning: Form of HAGAR used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: AGATHA
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Αγαθη(Agathe), derived from Greek αγαθος(agathos) meaning "good". Saint Agatha was a 3rd-century martyr from Sicily who was tortured and killed after spurning the advances of a Roman official. The saint was widely revered in the Middle Ages, and her name has been used throughout Christian Europe (in various spellings). The mystery writer Agatha Christie (1890-1976) was a famous modern bearer of this name.

name: AGATHANGELOS
meaning: Means "bearer of good news", derived from Greek αγαθος(agathos) "good" and αγγελος(angelos) "messenger, angel". Saint Agathangelus of Rome was a 4th-century deacon who was martyred during the persecutions of the emperor Diocletian.

name: AGAUE
meaning: Means "illustrious, noble" in Greek. This was the mother of Pentheus in Greek myth.

name: AGE  (1)
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element agil meaning "edge (of a sword), blade".

name: AGI
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element ag meaning "edge of a sword".

name: AGILULF
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements agil "edge (of a sword), blade" and wulf "wolf". This name was borne by a 6th-century king of the Lombards and by an 8th-century bishop of Cologne and saint.

name: AGLAIA
meaning: Means "splendour, beauty" in Greek. In Greek mythology she was one of the three Graces or Χαριτες (Charites). This name was also borne by a 4th-century saint from Rome.

name: AGNAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Agnarr, derived from agi "awe, terror" or egg "edge of a sword" combined with arr "warrior".

name: AGNES
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name ‘Αγνη(Hagne), derived from Greek ‘αγνος(hagnos) meaning "chaste". Saint Agnes was a virgin martyred during the persecutions of the Roman emperor Diocletian. The name became associated with Latin agnus "lamb", resulting in the saint's frequent depiction with a lamb by her side. Due to her renown, the name became common in Christian Europe, being especially popular in England in the Middle Ages.

name: AGNESA
meaning: Slovak and Albanian form of AGNES.

name: AGNESE
meaning: Italian and Latvian form of AGNES.

name: AGNETE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian variant of AGNES.

name: AGNETHE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian variant of AGNES.

name: AGNI
meaning: Means "fire" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the ancient Hindu fire god, usually depicted as red-skinned with three legs, seven arms, and two faces.

name: AGNIJA
meaning: Serbian, Macedonian and Latvian form of AGNES.

name: AGNÈS
meaning: French and Catalan form of AGNES.

name: AGOSTINA
meaning: Italian feminine form of Augustinus (see AUGUSTINE(1)).

name: AGRIPPA
meaning: Roman cognomen of unknown meaning, possibly from Greek αγριος(agrios) "wild" and ‘ιππος(hippos) "horse" or possibly of Etruscan origin. It was also used as a praenomen, or given name, by the Furia and Menenia families. In the New Testament this name was borne by Herod Agrippa (a grandson of Herod the Great), the king of Israel who put the apostle James to death. It was also borne by the 1st-century BC Roman general Marcus Vipsanius Agrippa.

name: AGRIPPINA
meaning: Feminine derivative of AGRIPPA. This name was borne by the scheming mother of the Roman emperor Nero, who eventually had her killed. This was also the name of a 3rd-century Roman saint who is venerated in Sicily.

name: AGRONA
meaning: Derived from the old Celtic element agro meaning "battle, slaughter". This was the name of the Brythonic goddess of war and death.

name: AGUSTINA
meaning: Spanish feminine form of Augustinus (see AUGUSTINE(1)).

name: AH
meaning: From the Chinese character 阿(ā) which has no distinct meaning. It is not normally given as a name, but it can be prefixed to another name to make it a diminutive.

name: AHAB
meaning: Means "uncle", from Hebrew אָח('ach) "brother" and אֲב('av) "father". This was the name of a king of Israel, the husband of Jezebel, as told in the Old Testament. He was admonished by Elijah for his sinful behaviour. This name was later used by Herman Melville in his novel 'Moby-Dick' (1851), where it belongs to a sea captain obsessively hunting for a white whale.

name: AHENOBARBUS
meaning: From a Roman cognomen meaning "bronze beard" in Latin. This name was borne by a series of consuls of the late Roman Republic.

name: AHINOAM
meaning: Means "my brother is pleasant" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of wives of both Saul and David.

name: AHMED
meaning: Variant transcription and Turkish and Bosnian form of AHMAD. This was the name of three Ottoman sultans.

name: AHMOSE
meaning: From Egyptian Iah-ms meaning "born of Iah", derived from the name of the Egyptian god IAH combined with mesu "be born". This was the name of the first pharaoh of the 18th dynasty. He defeated the Hyksos and drove them from Egypt.

name: AHOTH
meaning: Form of EHUD used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: AHRIMAN
meaning: Modern Persian form of ANGRA MAINYU.

name: AHTAHKAKOOP
meaning: Means "star blanket" in Cree. This was the name of an early 19th-century Cree chief.

name: AHTI
meaning: Meaning unknown. This is the name of the Finnish god of the ocean, rivers and fishing.

name: AHURA MAZDA
meaning: Means "lord of wisdom" in Avestan. In Persian mythology Ahura Mazda was the supreme creator, and the god of light, truth, and goodness.

name: AI  (1)
meaning: From Japanese 愛(ai) meaning "love, affection", 藍(ai) meaning "indigo", or other kanji with the same pronunciation.

name: AI  (2)
meaning: From Chinese 爱(ài) meaning "love, affection", 蔼(ǎi) meaning "friendly, lush", or other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: AIBEK
meaning: Derived from Turkic ay "moon" combined with the Turkish military title beg meaning "chieftain, master".

name: AIDA
meaning: Variant of AYDA. This name was used in Verdi's opera 'Aida' (1871), where it belongs to an Ethiopian princess held captive in Egypt.

name: AIDAN
meaning: Anglicized form of AODHÁN. In the latter part of the 20th century it became popular in America due to its sound, since it uses the same fashionable aden suffix sound found in such names as Braden and Hayden.

name: AIKE
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element agil meaning "edge (of a sword), blade".

name: AIKO
meaning: From Japanese 愛(ai) meaning "love, affection" and 子(ko) meaning "child", as well as other character combinations.

name: AILBHE
meaning: Possibly derived from the old Gaelic root albho meaning "white". In Irish legend this was the name of a female warrior of the Fianna. It was also the name of a 6th-century masculine saint.

name: AILILL
meaning: Means "elf" in Irish Gaelic. This name occurs frequently in Irish legend, borne for example by the husband of Queen Medb.

name: AILSA
meaning: From Ailsa Craig, the name of an island off the west coast of Scotland, which is of uncertain derivation.

name: AIMAN  (1)
meaning: Means "beauty of the moon" in Kazakh.

name: AIMI
meaning: From Japanese 愛(ai) meaning "love, affection" and 美(mi) meaning "beautiful". Other combinations of kanji characters are possible.

name: AIMÉ
meaning: From Old French Amé, the masculine form of Amée (see AMY).

name: AINA  (1)
meaning: Variant of AINO. It also means "always" in Finnish.

name: AINA  (3)
meaning: From Japanese 愛(ai) meaning "love, affection" and 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens", as well as other character combinations.

name: AINHOA
meaning: From the name of a town in southwest France where there is a famous image of the Virgin Mary.

name: AINO
meaning: Means "the only one" in Finnish. In the Finnish epic the 'Kalevala' this is the name of a girl who drowns herself when she finds out she must marry the old man Väinämöinen.

name: AINSLEY
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name: either Annesley in Nottinghamshire or Ansley in Warwickshire. The place names themselves derive from Old English anne "alone, solitary" or ansetl "hermitage" and leah "woodland, clearing".

name: AIOLOS
meaning: Means "quick-moving, nimble" in Greek. This was the name of the Greek god of the winds.

name: AIRI
meaning: From Japanese 愛(ai) meaning "love, affection" combined with 莉(ri) meaning "white jasmine" or 梨(ri) meaning "pear". Other combinations of kanji characters are possible.

name: AISHA
meaning: Means "alive" in Arabic. This was the name of Muhammad's third wife, the daughter of Abu Bakr. Some time after Muhammad's death she went to war against Ali, the fourth caliph, but was defeated. This name is used more by Sunni Muslims and less by Shias....[more]

name: AISHAH
meaning: Variant Arabic transcription of AISHA, as well as the usual Malay form.

name: AISHWARYA
meaning: Means "prosperity, wealth" in Sanskrit. A famous bearer is the Indian actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan (1973-).

name: AISLING
meaning: Means "dream" or "vision" in Irish Gaelic. This name was created in the 20th century.

name: AITHAN
meaning: Form of ETHAN used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: AITOR
meaning: Possibly means "good fathers" from Basque aita "father" and on "good". This was the name of a legendary ancestor of the Basques.

name: AJAX
meaning: From the Greek name Αιας(Aias), perhaps deriving from Greek αιαστης(aiastes) "mourner" or αια(aia) "earth, land". In Greek mythology this was the name of two of the heroes who fought for the Greeks in the Trojan War, the son of Telamon and the son of Oileus. When the armour of the slain hero Achilles was not given to Ajax Telamonian, he became mad with jealousy and killed himself.

name: AJAY
meaning: Means "unconquered", from Sanskrit अ(a) meaning "not" and जय(jaya) meaning "victory, conquest".

name: AJIT
meaning: Means "unconquered, invincible", from Sanskrit अ(a) meaning "not" and जित(jita) meaning "conquered". This is a name of the gods Shiva and Vishnu, and of a future Buddha.

name: AKACHI
meaning: Means "the hand of God" in Igbo.

name: AKAKIOS
meaning: From a Greek word meaning "innocent, not evil", derived from α(a), a negative prefix, combined with κακη(kake) "evil". This was the name of three early saints, two of whom were martyred.

name: AKANE
meaning: From Japanese 茜(akane) meaning "deep red, dye from the rubia plant". Other kanji or combinations of kanji can form this name as well.

name: AKARI
meaning: From Japanese 明(aka) meaning "bright" or 朱(aka) meaning "vermilion red" combined with 里(ri) meaning "village" or 莉(ri) meaning "white jasmine". Other combinations of kanji characters can also form this name.

name: AKBAR
meaning: Means "greater, greatest" in Arabic. This was the name of a 16th-century Mughal ruler who expanded the empire to include most of India.

name: AKEMI
meaning: From Japanese 明(ake) meaning "bright" and 美(mi) meaning "beautiful". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: AKHENATON
meaning: Possibly means "spirit of ATON" in Egyptian. Akhenaton was a 14th-century BC Egyptian pharaoh of the New Kingdom, who is best known for promoting the monotheistic worship of the sun god Aton. He changed his name from Amenhotep IV in order to honour the god. After his death polytheism resumed.

name: AKHMAD
meaning: Chechen and Ingush form of AHMAD.

name: AKI  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 晶(aki) meaning "clear, crystal", 明(aki) meaning "bright" or 秋(aki) meaning "autumn". It can also come from 亜(a) meaning "second, Asia" combined with 希(ki) meaning "hope". Other kanji or combinations of kanji can form this name too.

name: AKIBA
meaning: Form of YAAKOV. Akiba ben Joseph was a prominent 1st-century Jewish sage.

name: AKIKO
meaning: From Japanese 晶(aki) meaning "clear, crystal", 明(aki) meaning "bright" or 秋(aki) meaning "autumn" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other combinations of kanji characters are possible.

name: AKILINA
meaning: Russian form of the Roman name Aquilina, a feminine derivative of AQUILA.

name: AKINYI
meaning: Means "born in the morning" in Luo.

name: AKIO
meaning: From Japanese 昭(aki) meaning "bright, luminous" combined with 夫(o) meaning "man, husband", 男(o) meaning "male" or 雄(o) meaning "hero, manly". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: AKIRA
meaning: From Japanese 昭(akira) meaning "bright", 明(akira) meaning "bright" or 亮(akira) meaning "clear". Other kanji with the same pronunciation can also form this name.

name: AKRAM
meaning: Means "most generous" in Arabic (a superlative form of Karim).

name: AL
meaning: Short form of ALBERT and other names beginning with Al. A notable bearer is American actor Al Pacino (1940-).

name: AL-AMIR
meaning: Means "the commander, the prince" in Arabic. This was the name of a 10th-century Fatimid imam.

name: ALA AL-DIN
meaning: Means "excellence of religion" from Arabic علاء('ala) meaning "excellence, elevation" combined with دين(din) meaning "religion, faith". This was the name of several sultans of Delhi.

name: ALABA
meaning: Means "second child after twins" in Yoruba.

name: ALADDIN
meaning: Anglicized form of ALA AL-DIN. This is the name of a mischievous boy in one of the tales of 'The 1001 Nights'. He is trapped in a cave by a magician but escapes with the help of a genie.

name: ALAINA
meaning: Variant of ALANA, probably influenced by ELAINE.

name: ALAN
meaning: The meaning of this name is not known for certain. It was used in Brittany at least as early as the 6th century, and it possibly means either "little rock" or "handsome" in Breton. Alternatively, it may derive from the tribal name of the Alans, an Iranian people who migrated into Europe in the 4th and 5th centuries....[more]

name: ALANIS
meaning: Feminine form of ALAN. Canadian musician Alanis Morissette (1974-) was named after her father Alan. Her parents apparently decided to use this particular spelling after seeing this word in a Greek newspaper.

name: ALANNAH
meaning: Variant of ALANA. It has been influenced by the affectionate Anglo-Irish word alannah, from the Irish Gaelic phrase a leanbh meaning "O child".

name: ALARIC
meaning: From the Gothic name Alareiks which meant "ruler of all", derived from the Germanic element ala "all" combined with ric "ruler, power". This was the name of a king of the Visigoths who sacked Rome in the 5th century.

name: ALAZNE
meaning: Means "miracle" in Basque. It is a Basque equivalent of Milagros.

name: ALBA  (1)
meaning: This name is derived from two distinct names, ALBA(2) and ALBA(3), with distinct origins, Latin and Germanic. Over time these names have become confused with one another. To further complicate the matter, alba means "dawn" in Italian, Spanish and Catalan. This may be the main inspiration behind its use in Italy and Spain.

name: ALBA  (3)
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element alf meaning "elf".

name: ALBAER
meaning: Limburgish form of ALBERT. Its spelling has been influenced by the French pronunciation of Albert.

name: ALBAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Albanus which meant "from Alba". Alba (from Latin albus "white") was the name of various places within the Roman Empire, including the city Alba Longa. This name was borne by Saint Alban, the first British martyr (4th century). According to tradition, he sheltered a fugitive priest in his house. When his house was searched, he disguised himself as the priest, was arrested in his stead, and was beheaded. As an English name, Alban was occasionally used in the Middle Ages and was revived in the 18th century, though it is now uncommon.

name: ALBENA
meaning: Created by Bulgarian writer Yordan Yovkov for the heroine in his drama 'Albena' (1930). He may have based it on ablen, the name of a type of peony (a flowering plant).

name: ALBERICH
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements alf "elf" and ric "power". Alberich was the name of the sorcerer king of the dwarfs in Germanic mythology. He also appears in the 'Nibelungenlied' as a dwarf who guards the treasure of the Nibelungen.

name: ALBERT
meaning: From the Germanic name Adalbert, which was composed of the elements adal "noble" and beraht "bright". This name was common among medieval German royalty. The Normans introduced it to England, where it replaced the Old English cognate Æðelberht. Though it became rare in England by the 17th century, it was repopularized in the 19th century by the German-born Prince Albert, the husband of Queen Victoria....[more]

name: ALBERTA
meaning: Feminine form of ALBERT. This is the name of a Canadian province, which was named in honour of a daughter of Queen Victoria.

name: ALBERTE  (2)
meaning: French and Danish feminine form of ALBERT.

name: ALBERTO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of ALBERT.

name: ALBINA
meaning: Feminine form of ALBINUS. Saint Albina was a 3rd-century martyr from Caesarea.

name: ALBINO
meaning: Italian, Portuguese and Spanish form of ALBINUS.

name: ALBINUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was a derivative of ALBUS. Saint Albinus (also called Aubin) was a 6th-century bishop of Angers in Brittany.

name: ALBOIN
meaning: Form of ALFWIN. This was the name of a 6th-century king of the Lombards who began the Lombard conquest of Italy.

name: ALBORZ
meaning: From the name of a mountain range (of unknown etymology) in northern Iran.

name: ALBUS
meaning: Roman cognomen meaning "white, bright" in Latin.

name: ALBÍNA
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of ALBINA.

name: ALCAEUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Αλκαιος(Alkaios), derived from αλκη(alke) "strength". This was the name of a 7th-century BC lyric poet from the island of Lesbos.

name: ALCIBIADES
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Αλκιβιαδης(Alkibiades), derived from αλκη(alke) "strength" and βια(bia) "force" with the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides). This was the name of a notable Greek statesman and general during the Peloponnesian War. He changed allegiance from Athens to Sparta and back again during the course of the war.

name: ALCIDE
meaning: Italian and French form of ALCIDES.

name: ALCIDES
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Αλκειδης(Alkeides), derived from αλκη(alke) "strength" and the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides). This was another name for the hero Herakles.

name: ALCIPPE
meaning: From Greek Αλκιππη(Alkippe), derived from αλκη(alke) "strength" and ‘ιππος(hippos) "horse". This was the name of a daughter of Ares in Greek myth. Her father killed Halirrhotis, a son of Poseidon, when he attempted to rape her, leading to a murder trial in which Ares was quickly acquitted.

name: ALCMENE
meaning: From Greek Αλκμηνη(Alkmene), derived from αλκη(alke) "strength" and μηνη(mene) "moon". In Greek mythology Alcmene was the wife of Amphitryon. She was the mother of Herakles by Zeus, who bedded her by disguising himself as her absent husband.

name: ALCYONE
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Αλκυονη(Alkyone), derived from the word αλκυων(alkyon) meaning "kingfisher". In Greek myth this name belonged to a daughter of Aeolus and the wife of Ceyx. After her husband was killed in a shipwreck she threw herself into the water, but the gods saved her and turned them both into kingfishers. This is also the name of the brightest of the Pleiades, the seven stars in the constellation Taurus.

name: ALDEBRAND
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements ald meaning "old" and brand meaning "sword" or "fire". Saint Aldebrand was a 12th-century bishop of Fossombrone in Italy.

name: ALDEGUND
meaning: Germanic name, derived from the elements ald "old" and gund "war". Saint Algegund (or Aldegundis) was a 7th-century Frankish abbess.

name: ALDEN
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the Old English given name EALDWINE.

name: ALDERT
meaning: Frisian form of a Germanic name, either ALDHARD or ADALHARD.

name: ALDHARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ald "old" and hard "brave, hardy".

name: ALDINA  (2)
meaning: Bosian feminine form of ALA AL-DIN.

name: ALDO
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element ald "old", and possibly also with adal "noble".

name: ALDONA
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of a 14th-century Polish queen, the daughter of a Grand Duke of Lithuania.

name: ALDOUS
meaning: Probably a diminutive of names beginning with the Old English element eald "old". It has been in use as an English given name since the Middle Ages, mainly in East Anglia. The British author Aldous Huxley (1894-1963) was a famous bearer of this name.

name: ALDRIC
meaning: From a Germanic name, derived from the elements ald "old" and ric "ruler, power". Saint Aldric was a 9th-century bishop of Le Mans.

name: ALDWIN
meaning: From a Germanic name, derived from the elements ald "old" and win "friend".

name: ALE  (1)
meaning: Finnish short form of ALEKSANTERI or ALEKSI, an Italian short form of ALESSANDRO, and a Spanish short form of ALEJANDRO or ALEJANDRA.

name: ALE  (2)
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element adal meaning "noble".

name: ALECTO
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Αληκτω(Alekto) which was derived from αληκτος(alektos) "unceasing". This was the name of one of the Furies or Ερινυες(Erinyes) in Greek mythology.

name: ALED
meaning: From the name of a Welsh river, of uncertain meaning.

name: ALEIXO
meaning: Portuguese and Galician form of ALEXIS.

name: ALEKS
meaning: Short form of ALEKSEY or ALEKSANDR.

name: ALEKSANDR
meaning: Russian and Armenian form of ALEXANDER. This name was borne by the 19th-century Russian poet Aleksandr Pushkin.

name: ALEKSEY
meaning: Russian form of ALEXIS. This was the name of a 17th-century czar of Russia.

name: ALEMAYEHU
meaning: Means "I have seen the world" in Amharic.

name: ALEN
meaning: Croatian and Slovene form of ALAN.

name: ALENA
meaning: Short form of MAGDALENA or HELENA.

name: ALESIA
meaning: Possibly a variant of ALICIA, or maybe from the ancient Gaulish city of Alesia.

name: ALESSANDRO
meaning: Italian form of ALEXANDER. A famous bearer was Alessandro Volta (1745-1827), the Italian physicist who invented the battery.

name: ALETA
meaning: Possibly a variant of ALETHEA. This was the name of the wife of the title character in the comic strip 'Prince Valiant' which first appeared in 1937.

name: ALETHEA
meaning: Derived from Greek αληθεια(aletheia) meaning "truth". This name was coined in the 16th century.

name: ALEX
meaning: Short form of ALEXANDER, ALEXANDRA, and other names beginning with Alex.

name: ALEXANDER
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Αλεξανδρος(Alexandros), which meant "defending men" from Greek αλεξω(alexo) "to defend, help" and ανηρ(aner) "man" (genitive ανδρος). In Greek mythology this was another name of the hero Paris, and it also belongs to several characters in the New Testament. However, the most famous bearer was Alexander the Great, king of Macedon. In the 4th century BC he built a huge empire out of Greece, Egypt, Persia, and parts of India. Due to his fame, and later medieval tales involving him, use of his name spread throughout Europe....[more]

name: ALEXANDRA
meaning: Feminine form of ALEXANDER. In Greek mythology this was a Mycenaean epithet of the goddess Hera, and an alternate name of Cassandra. It was borne by several early Christian saints, and also by the wife of Nicholas II, the last czar of Russia. She was from Germany and had the birth name Alix, but was renamed Александра(Aleksandra) upon joining the Russian Church.

name: ALEXANDRE
meaning: Form of ALEXANDER. This name was borne by the 19th-century French author Alexandre Dumas (1802-1870), who wrote 'The Three Musketeers'.

name: ALEXANDRIA
meaning: Feminine form of ALEXANDER. Alexander the Great founded several cities by this name (or renamed them) as he extended his empire eastward. The most notable of these is Alexandria in Egypt, founded by Alexander in 331 BC.

name: ALEXANDRINA
meaning: Elaborated form of ALEXANDRA. This was the first name of Queen Victoria; her middle name was Victoria.

name: ALEXANDRINE
meaning: French elaborated form of ALEXANDRA. This was the name of a Danish queen, the wife of King Christian X.

name: ALEXANDROS
meaning: Ancient and modern Greek form of ALEXANDER.

name: ALEXEJ
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of ALEXIS.

name: ALEXINA
meaning: Feminine form of ALEX, or a diminutive of ALEXIS.

name: ALEXIS
meaning: From the Greek name Αλεξις(Alexis), which meant "helper" or "defender", derived from Greek αλεξω(alexo) "to defend, to help". This was the name of a 3rd-century BC Greek comic poet, and also of several saints. It is used somewhat interchangeably with the related name Αλεξιος or Alexius, borne by five Byzantine emperors. In the English-speaking world it is more commonly used as a feminine name.

name: ALEXIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Αλεξιος(Alexios), a derivative of Αλεξις (see ALEXIS). This was the name of five Byzantine emperors. It was also borne by a 5th-century Syrian saint who is especially venerated in the Eastern Church.

name: ALF  (1)
meaning: Derived from Old Norse alfr "elf". In Norse legend this was the name of king, the suitor of a reluctant maiden named Alfhild. She avoided marrying him by disguising herself as a warrior, but when they fought she was so impressed by his strength that she changed her mind.

name: ALFBERN
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements alf "elf" and bern "bear".

name: ALFHARD
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements alf "elf" and hard "brave, hardy".

name: ALFHER
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements alf "elf" and hari "army, warrior" (making it a cognate of ALVAR).

name: ALFHILD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Alfhildr which was composed of the elements alfr "elf" and hildr "battle". In Norse legend Alfhild was a maiden who disguised herself as a warrior in order to avoid marriage to King Alf. Her life was perhaps based on that of a 9th-century Viking pirate.

name: ALFONS
meaning: German, Dutch and Polish form of ALFONSO.

name: ALFONSO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of a Visigothic Germanic name, probably meaning "noble and ready", from the element adal "noble" combined with funs "ready". Other theories claim the first element is hadu or hild (see ILDEFONSO), both of which mean "battle". It is possible that two or more names merged into a single form. This was the name of six kings of Portugal and kings of several ancient regions of Spain.

name: ALFRED
meaning: Derived from the Old English name Ælfræd, composed of the elements ælf "elf" and ræd "counsel". Alfred the Great was a 9th-century king of Wessex who fought unceasingly against the Danes living in northeast England. He was also a scholar, and he translated many Latin books into Old English. His fame helped to ensure the usage of this name even after the Norman conquest, when most Old English names were replaced by Norman ones. It became rare by the end of the Middle Ages, but was revived in the 18th century....[more]

name: ALFREDO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of ALFRED.

name: ALFRÉD
meaning: Hungarian and Slovak form of ALFRED.

name: ALFWIN
meaning: From the Germanic elements alf "elf" and win "friend".

name: ALGAR
meaning: Means "elf spear" from Old English ælf "elf" and gar "spear". This Old English name was rarely used after the Norman conquest, being absorbed by similar-sounding names and Norman and Scandinavian cognates. It was briefly revived in the 19th century.

name: ALGER
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name ALGAR.

name: ALGERNON
meaning: Originally a Norman French nickname, derived from aux gernons "having a moustache", which was applied to William de Percy, a companion of William the Conqueror. It was first used a given name in the 15th century (for a descendant of William de Percy).

name: ALHAJI
meaning: Means "pilgrim" in Hausa, a derivative of Arabic حَجِّي(hajji) meaning "pilgrimage, hajj".

name: ALI  (1)
meaning: Means "lofty, sublime" in Arabic. Ali was a cousin and son-in-law of the Prophet Muhammad and the fourth caliph to rule the Muslim world. His followers were the original Shia Muslims, who regard him as the first rightful caliph....[more]

name: ALI  (2)
meaning: Diminutive of ALISON, ALEXANDRA or other names beginning with the same sound.

name: ALICE
meaning: From the Old French name Aalis, a short form of Adelais, itself a short form of the Germanic name Adalheidis (see ADELAIDE). This name became popular in France and England in the 12th century. It was borne by the heroine of Lewis Carroll's 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland' (1865) and 'Through the Looking Glass' (1871).

name: ALIKHAN
meaning: Combination of the name ALI(1) and the Turkic title khan which means "ruler, leader".

name: ALIKI
meaning: Greek form of ALICE. It also corresponds with the Greek word αλικη meaning "scarlet".

name: ALIMJAN
meaning: Uyghur elaboration of ALIM using the suffix جان(jan) meaning "dear".

name: ALIN
meaning: Possibly a Romanian masculine form of ALINA. Alternatively it may derive from Romanian alina "to soothe".

name: ALINA
meaning: Short form of ADELINA and names that end in alina.

name: ALINAFE
meaning: Means "he is with us" in Chewa.

name: ALINE
meaning: Medieval short form of ADELINE. As an English name, in modern times it has sometimes been regarded as a variant of EILEEN. This was the name of a popular 1965 song by the French singer Christophe.

name: ALIPRAND
meaning: From the Germanic elements alja meaning "other, foreign" and brand meaning "sword" or "fire".

name: ALISA
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian, Bosnian and Finnish form of ALICE.

name: ALISON
meaning: Norman French diminutive of Aalis (see ALICE). It was common in England, Scotland and France in the Middle Ages, and was later revived in England in the 20th century via Scotland. Unlike most other English names ending in son, it is not derived from a surname.

name: ALIYA  (1)
meaning: Kazakh and Tatar form of ALIYAH(1). It is also a variant transcription of Arabic ALIYAH(1).

name: ALIYAH  (2)
meaning: Means "to ascend" in Hebrew. This is also a Hebrew word referring to immigration to Israel.

name: ALJAŽ
meaning: Derived from a Slovene surname, which is of unknown meaning.

name: ALJOŠA
meaning: Slovene, Croatian and Serbian form of ALYOSHA.

name: ALKE
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element adal meaning "noble".

name: ALKIVIADIS
meaning: Modern Greek form of Alkibiades (see ALCIBIADES).

name: ALLA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of German origin.

name: ALLAH
meaning: Derived from Arabic الإله(al-ilah) meaning "the deity". It is primarily used to refer to the Islamic God, though it was originally used by pre-Islamic Arabs, and is sometimes used by Arabic-speaking Christians and Jews.

name: ALLAN
meaning: Variant of ALAN. The American author Edgar Allan Poe (1809-1849) got his middle name from the surname of the parents who adopted him.

name: ALLE
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element adal meaning "noble".

name: ALLEGRA
meaning: Means "cheerful, lively" in Italian. It was borne by a short-lived illegitimate daughter of Lord Byron (1817-1822).

name: ALLEN
meaning: Variant of ALAN. A famous bearer of this name was Allen Ginsberg (1926-1997), an American beat poet. Another is the American film director and actor Woody Allen (1935-), who took the stage name Allen from his real first name.

name: ALLI
meaning: Finnish diminutive of names beginning with Al. This is also the Finnish word for a type of duck.

name: ALLIE
meaning: Diminutive of ALISON, ALEXANDRA or other names beginning with the same sound.

name: ALLON
meaning: Means "oak" in Hebrew. This name is mentioned briefly in the Old Testament.

name: ALLY  (1)
meaning: Diminutive of ALISON, ALEXANDRA or other names beginning with the same sound.

name: ALLYN
meaning: Variant or feminine form of ALAN.

name: ALMA  (1)
meaning: This name became popular after the Battle of Alma (1854), which took place near the River Alma in Crimea and ended in a victory for Britain and France. However, the name was in rare use before the battle; it was probably inspired by Latin almus "nourishing". It also coincides with the Spanish word meaning "the soul".

name: ALMAS
meaning: Means "diamond" in Arabic, ultimately from Persian.

name: ALMAST
meaning: Means "diamond" in Armenian, ultimately from Persian.

name: ALMIRA  (1)
meaning: Variant of ELMIRA. Handel used it for the title character in his opera 'Almira' (1705).

name: ALMUDENA
meaning: Derived from Arabic المدينة(al-mudaynah) meaning "the citadel". It was in a building by this name that a concealed statue of the Virgin Mary was discovered during the Reconquista in Madrid. The Virgin of Almudena, that is Mary, is the patron saint of Madrid.

name: ALODIA
meaning: Possibly from a Visigothic name derived from the Germanic elements alja "other, foreign" and aud "riches, wealth". Saint Alodia was a 9th-century Spanish martyr with her sister Nunilo.

name: ALOIS
meaning: German and Czech form of ALOYSIUS.

name: ALOJZ
meaning: Slovene, Slovak and Croatian form of ALOYSIUS.

name: ALOJZIJA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian feminine form of ALOYSIUS.

name: ALOYSIUS
meaning: Latinized form of Aloys, an old Occitan form of LOUIS. This was the name of a 16th-century Italian saint, Aloysius Gonzaga. The name has been in occasional use among Catholics since his time.

name: ALPHA
meaning: From the name of the first letter in the Greek alphabet, Α.

name: ALPHAEUS
meaning: From Αλφαιος(Alphaios), the Greek form of a Hebrew name that meant "changing". In the New Testament this is the name of the fathers of the apostles James and Levi.

name: ALPHONSUS
meaning: Latinized form of ALFONSO. This name was borne by Saint Alphonsus Liguori, an 18th-century Italian bishop who is regarded as a Doctor of the Church.

name: ALPIN
meaning: Anglicized form of the Gaelic name Ailpein, possibly derived from a Pictish word meaning "white". This was the name of two kings of Dál Riata and two kings of the Picts in the 8th and 9th centuries.

name: ALTA
meaning: Possibly from Latin altus or Italian/Spanish alto meaning "high".

name: ALTAIR
meaning: Means "the flyer" in Arabic. This is the name of a star in the constellation Aquila.

name: ALTE  (2)
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element ald meaning "old".

name: ALTER
meaning: Means "old" in Yiddish. This name was traditionally given to a sickly newborn by Jewish parents in order to confuse the Angel of Death, in the hopes that he would go looking for somebody younger or somebody else.

name: ALTHEA
meaning: From the Greek name Αλθαια(Althaia), perhaps related to Greek αλθος(althos) "healing". In Greek myth she was the mother of Meleager. Soon after her son was born she was told that he would die as soon as a piece of wood that was burning on her fire was fully consumed. She immediately extinguished the piece of wood and sealed it in a chest, but in a fit of rage many years later she took it out and set it alight, thereby killing her son.

name: ALTON
meaning: From an Old English surname which was derived from a place name meaning "town at the source of the river".

name: ALTWIDUS
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ald "old" and witu "forest".

name: ALUDRA
meaning: Derived from Arabic العذرا(al-'adhra) meaning "the maiden". This is the name of a star in the constellation Canis Major.

name: ALUN
meaning: Welsh form of ALAN. This name appears in the Mabinogion, a collection of tales from Welsh myth.

name: ALVA  (2)
meaning: Variant of ALVAH. A famous bearer of this name was the inventor Thomas Alva Edison (1847-1931).

name: ALVAH
meaning: Means "his highness" in Hebrew. This name is mentioned in the Old Testament as belonging to a descendant of Esau.

name: ALVAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Alfarr, formed of the elements alfr "elf" and arr "warrior".

name: ALVIN
meaning: From a medieval form of any of the Old English names ÆLFWINE, ÆÐELWINE or EALDWINE. It was revived in the 19th century, in part from a surname which was derived from the Old English names.

name: ALVIS
meaning: Means "all wise" in Old Norse. In Norse mythology this was the name of a dwarf who was to marry Thor's daughter Thrud. Thor was not pleased with this so he tricked Alvis by asking him questions until the sun rose, at which time the dwarf was turned into stone.

name: ALWILDA
meaning: Latinized form of ALFHILD. This was the name of a legendary female Scandinavian pirate, also called Awilda.

name: ALWIN
meaning: From either of the two Germanic names ALFWIN or ADALWIN.

name: ALWYN
meaning: From the name of the River Alwen in Wales.

name: ALYONA
meaning: Originally a Russian diminutive of YELENA. It is now used independently.

name: ALYSSA
meaning: Variant of ALICIA. The spelling has probably been influenced by that of the alyssum flower, the name of which is derived from Greek α(a), a negative prefix, combined with λυσσα(lyssa) "madness, rabies", since it was believed to cure madness.

name: ALÍCIA
meaning: Catalan form of ALICE, as well as a Portuguese variant.

name: ALİ
meaning: Turkish and Azerbaijani form of ALI(1).

name: AMABILIS
meaning: Late Latin name meaning "lovable". Saint Amabilis was a 5th-century priest in Riom, central France.

name: AMADEO
meaning: Italian variant of AMADEUS. This was the name of a 19th-century king of Spain (born in Italy).

name: AMADEUS
meaning: Means "love of God", derived from Latin amare "to love" and Deus "God". A famous bearer was the Austrian composer Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756-1791), who was actually born Wolfgang Theophilus Mozart but preferred the Latin translation of his Greek middle name. This name was also assumed as a middle name by the German novelist E. T. A. Hoffmann (1776-1822), who took it in honour of Mozart.

name: AMADI  (2)
meaning: Means "seemed destined to die at birth" in Yoruba.

name: AMADOU
meaning: Form of AHMAD used in parts of western Africa.

name: AMAIA
meaning: Means "the end" in Basque. This is also the name of a mountain and a village in the Basque region of Spain.

name: AMAL  (1)
meaning: Means "hope, aspiration" in Arabic. It is related to Amaal.

name: AMAL  (2)
meaning: Means "work" in Hebrew. This was the name of an Asherite in the Old Testament.

name: AMALA
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit अमल(amala) meaning "clean, pure".

name: AMALBERT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements amal meaning "work, labour" and beraht meaning "bright".

name: AMALIA
meaning: Latinized form of the Germanic name Amala, a short form of names beginning with the element amal meaning "work".

name: AMALIE
meaning: Norwegian, Danish and German form of AMALIA.

name: AMALIJA
meaning: Lithuanian, Slovene and Croatian form of AMALIA.

name: AMALRIC
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements amal meaning "work, labour" and ric meaning "power". This was the name of a 6th-century king of the Visigoths, as well as two 12th-century rulers of the Latin Kingdom of Jerusalem.

name: AMALTHEA
meaning: From the Greek Αμαλθεια(Amaltheia), derived from μαλθασσω(malthasso) meaning "to soften, to soothe". In Greek myth she was a goat who nursed the infant Zeus.

name: AMANCIO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of AMANTIUS.

name: AMANDA
meaning: In part this is a feminine form of AMANDUS. However, it was not used during the Middle Ages. In the 17th century it was recreated by authors and poets who based it directly on Latin amanda meaning "lovable, worthy of love". Notably, the playwright Colley Cibber used it for a character in his play 'Love's Last Shift' (1696). It came into regular use during the 19th century.

name: AMANDEEP
meaning: From Punjabi ਅਮਨ(aman) meaning "peace" (ultimately from Arabic) and Sanskrit दीप(dipa) meaning "lamp, light".

name: AMANDO
meaning: Portuguese, Spanish and Italian form of AMANDUS.

name: AMANDUS
meaning: Derived from Latin amanda meaning "lovable, worthy of love". Saint Amandus was a 5th-century bishop of Bordeaux. It was also borne by a 7th-century French saint who evangelized in Flanders.

name: AMANTIUS
meaning: Means "loving" in Latin. This was the name of several early saints. It has sometimes been confused with the name Amandus.

name: AMARANTA
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of AMARANTHA.

name: AMARANTHA
meaning: From the name of the amaranth flower, which is derived from Greek αμαραντος(amarantos) meaning "unfading". Αμαραντος(Amarantos) was also an Ancient Greek given name.

name: AMARDEEP
meaning: From Sanskrit अमर(amara) meaning "immortal" and दीप(dipa) meaning "lamp, light".

name: AMARIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH has said" in Hebrew. This was the name of several Old Testament characters.

name: AMARJEET
meaning: From Sanskrit अमर(amara) meaning "immortal" and जिति(jiti) meaning "victory, conquering".

name: AMARYLLIS
meaning: Derived from Greek αμαρυσσω(amarysso) "to sparkle". This was the name of a heroine in Virgil's epic poem 'Eclogues'. The amaryllis flower is named for her.

name: AMATERASU
meaning: Means "shining over heaven", from Japanese 天(ama) meaning "heaven, sky" and 照(terasu) meaning "shine". This was the name of the Japanese sun goddess, the ruler of the heavens. At one time the Japanese royal family claimed descent from her.

name: AMATOR
meaning: Late Latin name meaning "lover (of God)". Saint Amator was a 5th-century bishop of Auxerre.

name: AMATUS
meaning: Late Latin name meaning "beloved". The 7th-century Saint Amatus was the first abbot of Remiremont Abbey.

name: AMBER
meaning: From the English word amber that denotes either the gemstone, which is formed from fossil resin, or the orange-yellow colour. The word ultimately derives from Arabic عنبر('anbar). It began to be used as a given name in the late 19th century, but it only became popular after the release of Kathleen Winsor's novel 'Forever Amber' (1944).

name: AMBERLY
meaning: Elaboration of AMBER, influenced by the spelling of the name KIMBERLY.

name: AMBROSE
meaning: From the Late Latin name Ambrosius, which was derived from the Greek name Αμβροσιος(Ambrosios) meaning "immortal". Saint Ambrose was a 4th-century theologian and bishop of Milan, who is considered a Doctor of the Church. Due to the saint, the name came into general use in Christian Europe, though it was never particularly common in England.

name: AMBROŽ
meaning: Slovene and Czech form of Ambrosius (see AMBROSE).

name: AMEDEO
meaning: Italian form of AMADEUS. A notable bearer of this name was Amedeo Avogadro (1776-1856), an Italian chemist most famous for the constant that now bears his name: Avogadro's Number. Another famous bearer was the Italian painter and sculptor Amedeo Modigliani (1884-1920).

name: AMELIA
meaning: Variant of AMALIA, though it is sometimes confused with EMILIA, which has a different origin. The name became popular in England after the German House of Hanover came to the British throne in the 18th century - it was borne by daughters of George II and George III. Another famous bearer was Amelia Earhart (1897-1937), the first woman to make a solo flight over the Atlantic Ocean.

name: AMENEMHET
meaning: Means "AMON is foremost" in Egyptian. This was the name of four Egyptian pharaohs, including the founder of the 12th dynasty.

name: AMENHOTEP
meaning: From the Egyptian Ymnhtp meaning "peace of Amon", derived from the name of the Egyptian god AMON combined with htp "peace, satisfaction". This was the name of four pharaohs of the New Kingdom, including Amenhotep III, known as the Magnificent, who ruled over Egypt during a time of great prosperity.

name: AMERETAT
meaning: Means "immortality" in Avestan. This was the name of a Zoroastrian goddess (one of the Amesha Spenta) of plants and long life.

name: AMERICA
meaning: In the English-speaking world, this name is usually given in reference to the United States of America (see AMERIGO). It came into use as an American name in the 19th century.

name: AMERIGO
meaning: Medieval Italian form of EMMERICH. Amerigo Vespucci (1451-1512) was the Italian explorer who gave the continent of America its name (from Americus, the Latin form of his name).

name: AMETHYST
meaning: From the name of the purple semi-precious stone, which is derived from the Greek negative prefix α(a) and μεθυστος(methystos) meaning "intoxicated, drunk", as it was believed to be a remedy against drunkenness.

name: AMI  (1)
meaning: Means "trustworthy, reliable" in Hebrew. This was the name of a servant of King Solomon in the Old Testament.

name: AMI  (3)
meaning: From Japanese 亜(a) meaning "second, Asia" and 美(mi) meaning "beautiful". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: AMICE
meaning: Medieval name derived from Latin amicus meaning "friend". This was a popular name in the Middle Ages, though it has since become uncommon.

name: AMICHAI
meaning: Means "my people are alive" in Hebrew.

name: AMIHAN
meaning: Means "north wind, winter storm" in Tagalog.

name: AMILIA
meaning: Variant of either AMALIA or EMILIA.

name: AMIN
meaning: Derived from Arabic امين(amin) meaning "truthful". This was the name of the sixth Abbasid caliph.

name: AMINA
meaning: Bosnian form of AMINAH(2). It is also a variant transcription of Arabic AMINAH(1) or AMINAH(2).

name: AMINAH  (1)
meaning: Derived from Arabic أمن(amina) meaning "feel safe". This was the name of the Prophet Muhammad's mother, who died when he was young.

name: AMINTA
meaning: Form of AMYNTAS used by the Italian poet Torquato Tasso for his play 'Aminta' (1573). In the play Aminta is a shepherd who falls in love with a nymph.

name: AMIR  (1)
meaning: Means "commander, prince" in Arabic. This was originally a title, which has come into English as the Arabic loanword emir.

name: AMIRAN
meaning: Variant of AMIRANI. This is the name of the central character in the medieval Georgian romance 'Amiran-Darejaniani' by Moses of Khoni. The author was inspired by the mythical Amirani and the stories surrounding him, and loosely based his tale on them.

name: AMIRANI
meaning: Meaning unknown, probably of Proto-Kartvelian origin. This is the name of a hero from Georgian mythology whose story is similar to that of Prometheus from Greek mythology.

name: AMIS
meaning: Medieval name, a masculine form of AMICE. It appears in the medieval French poem 'Amis and Amiles', about two friends who make sacrifices for one another.

name: AMISTA
meaning: Means "loyalty" in Chamorro, derived from Spanish amistad "friendship".

name: AMITABH
meaning: Means "immeasurable splendour" in Sanskrit. A famous bearer is Indian actor Amitabh Bachchan (1942-).

name: AMITTAI
meaning: Means "my truth" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the father of the prophet Jonah.

name: AMITY
meaning: From the English word meaning "friendship", ultimately deriving from Latin amicitia.

name: AMMIEL
meaning: Means "God is my kinsman" in Hebrew. This is the name of one of the spies sent out by Moses in the Old Testament.

name: AMNON
meaning: Means "faithful" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the eldest son of King David. He was killed by his brother Absalom in revenge for the rape of his sister Tamar.

name: AMON
meaning: From Αμμων(Ammon), the Greek form of Egyptian Ymn (reconstructed as Yamanu) which meant "the hidden one". In early Egyptian mythology he was a god of the air, creativity and fertility, who was particularly revered in Thebes. Later, during the Middle Kingdom, his attributes were combined with those of the god Ra and he was worshipped as the supreme solar deity Amon-Ra.

name: AMON-RA
meaning: Combination of the names of the gods AMON and RA. During the later Middle Kingdom the attributes of these two deities were merged.

name: AMOR
meaning: Means "love" in Latin. This was another name for the Roman god Cupid. It also means "love" in Spanish and Portuguese, and the name can be derived directly from this vocabulary word.

name: AMOS
meaning: From Hebrew עָמַס('amas) meaning "load, burden". Amos is one of the twelve minor prophets of the Old Testament, the author of the Book of Amos, which speaks against greed, corruption and oppression of the poor. Written about the 8th century BC, it is among the oldest of the prophetic books. As an English name, Amos has been used since the Protestant Reformation, and was popular among the Puritans.

name: AMPELIO
meaning: Italian form of Ampelius, the Latin form of the Greek name Αμπελιος(Ampelios), which was derived from αμπελος(ampelos) meaning "vine". Saint Ampelius was a 7th-century bishop of Milan.

name: AMPORN
meaning: Derived from Thai อํา(am) "hidden, concealed" and พร(phon) "blessing".

name: AMRAM
meaning: Means "exalted nation" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament, Amram is the father of Moses.

name: AMRIT
meaning: Means "immortal" from Sanskrit अ(a) meaning "not" and मृत(mrta) meaning "dead". In Hindu texts it refers to a drink which gives immortality.

name: AMSE
meaning: Originally a short form of the Germanic name ADELMAR.

name: AMULIUS
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Roman mythology Amulius overthrew his brother Numitor, king of Alba Longa, but was eventually deposed by Numitor's grandsons Romulus and Remus.

name: AMUND
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse name Agmundr, from the element egg "edge of a sword" or agi "awe, terror" combined with mundr "protection".

name: AMY
meaning: English form of the Old French name Amée meaning "beloved" (modern French aimée), a vernacular form of the Latin Amata. As an English name, it was in use in the Middle Ages (though not common) and was revived in the 19th century.

name: AMYAS
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps a derivative of AMIS. Alternatively, it may come from a surname which originally indicated that the bearer was from the city of Amiens in France. Edmund Spenser used this name for a minor character in his epic poem 'The Faerie Queene' (1590).

name: AMYNTAS
meaning: Derived from Greek αμυντωρ(amyntor) meaning "defender". This was the name of several kings of Macedon.

name: AMÁLIA
meaning: Hungarian, Portuguese and Slovak form of AMALIA.

name: AMÉRICA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese feminine form of AMERIGO.

name: AMÉRICO
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of AMERIGO.

name: AMÍLCAR
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of HAMILCAR.

name: AN  (1)
meaning: From Chinese 安(ān) meaning "peace, quiet" or other characters with a similar pronunciation. As a Vietnamese name, it is derived from Sino-Vietnamese 安 meaning "safe, secure".

name: AN  (2)
meaning: Means "heaven, sky" in Sumerian. An was the Sumerian god of the heavens.

name: ANACLETO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of ANACLETUS.

name: ANACLETUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ανακλητος(Anakletos), derived from ανακλητος(anakletos) meaning "invoked". This was the name of the third pope.

name: ANAH
meaning: Means "answer" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this name belongs to one female character and two male characters.

name: ANAHITA
meaning: Means "immaculate, undefiled" from Avestan a "not" and ahit "unclean". This was the name of the Persian goddess of fertility and water. She was sometimes identified with Artemis, Aphrodite and Athena.

name: ANAIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH has answered" in Hebrew. This is the name of a minor character in the Old Testament.

name: ANAKIN
meaning: Meaning unknown. This is the name of a character (also known as Darth Vader) in the 'Star Wars' movie saga, created by George Lucas. Lucas may have based it on the surname of his friend and fellow director Ken Annakin.

name: ANAN  (2)
meaning: Means "cloud" in Hebrew. This name is mentioned very briefly in the Old Testament.

name: ANANI
meaning: Means "my cloud" in Hebrew. This name is mentioned in the Old Testament as belonging to a descendant of King David.

name: ANANIAS
meaning: From ‘Ανανιας(Hananias), the Greek form of HANANIAH. In Acts in the New Testament this is the name of three characters: a disciple in Damascus, the husband of Sapphira, and the high priest of the Jews who tries Paul.

name: ANANTA
meaning: Means "infinite, endless" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the masculine form अनन्त / अनंत (an epithet of the Hindu god Vishnu) and the feminine form अनन्ता / अनंता (an epithet of the goddess Parvati).

name: ANARA
meaning: Means "pomegranate" in Kazakh and Kyrgyz, ultimately from Persian.

name: ANARGYROS
meaning: From the Greek term αναργυρος(anargyros) meaning "poor, incorruptible", derived from Greek α(a), a negative prefix, combined with αργυρος(argyros) "silver". This term referred to saints who did not accept payment for their services.

name: ANAS
meaning: Means "friendliness" in Arabic. This was the name of one of the Prophet Muhammad's companions.

name: ANASTAS
meaning: Russian and Bulgarian form of ANASTASIUS.

name: ANASTASIA
meaning: Feminine form of ANASTASIUS. This was the name of a 4th-century Dalmatian saint who was martyred during the persecutions of the Roman emperor Diocletian. Due to her, the name has been common in Eastern Orthodox Christianity (in various spellings). As an English name it has been in use since the Middle Ages. A famous bearer was the youngest daughter of the last Russian tsar Nicholas II, who was rumoured to have escaped the execution of her family in 1918.

name: ANASTASIJA
meaning: Latvian, Lithuanian, Macedonian and Serbian form of ANASTASIA.

name: ANASTASIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of ANASTASIUS.

name: ANASTASIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Αναστασιος(Anastasios) which meant "resurrection" from Greek αναστασις(anastasis) (composed of the elements ανα(ana) "up" and στασις(stasis) "standing"). This was the name of numerous early saints and martyrs, including a 7th-century monk and writer from Alexandria who is especially venerated in the Eastern Church.

name: ANASTASIY
meaning: Older Russian and Bulgarian form of ANASTASIUS.

name: ANASTASIYA
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian and Bulgarian form of ANASTASIA. This name was borne by the wife of the Russian czar Ivan the Terrible.

name: ANASTAZIJA
