meaning: Croatian and Slovene form of ANASTASIA.

name: ANAT  (1)
meaning: Possibly derived from a Semitic root meaning "water spring". Anat was a goddess of fertility, hunting and war worshipped in many regions of the ancient near east. She was the sister and consort of the god Hadad.

name: ANAT  (2)
meaning: Original Hebrew form of ANATH(1). In modern times it is often used as a feminine name.

name: ANATH  (1)
meaning: Means "answer" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the father of Shamgar.

name: ANATOLIA
meaning: Feminine form of ANATOLIUS. This was the name of a 3rd-century Italian saint and martyr.

name: ANATOLIUS
meaning: From the Greek Ανατολιος(Anatolios), derived from ανατολη(anatole) meaning "sunrise". Saint Anatolius was a 3rd-century philosopher from Alexandria.

name: ANATOLIY
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of ANATOLIUS.

name: ANAXAGORAS
meaning: Derived from Greek αναξ(anax) meaning "master, lord" and αγορα(agora) meaning "assembly, marketplace". This name was borne by a 5th-century BC Greek philosopher.

name: ANAÏS
meaning: Occitan and Catalan form of ANNA.

name: ANDEBERT
meaning: From the Germanic element and "wrath, zeal" combined with beraht "bright".

name: ANDERS
meaning: Scandinavian form of Andreas (see ANDREW). A famous bearer was the Swedish physicist Anders Jonas Ångström (1814-1874).

name: ANDERSON
meaning: From a surname meaning "son of ANDREW".

name: ANDILE
meaning: Means "they have increased" in Zulu, Xhosa and Ndebele.

name: ANDOR  (1)
meaning: From the Old Norse name Arnþórr, derived from the element arn "eagle" combined with the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR).

name: ANDRA
meaning: Feminine form of ANDREI or ANDREW. As an English name it has only been used since the 20th century.

name: ANDRADA
meaning: Possibly a feminine form of ANDREI.

name: ANDRASTE
meaning: Possibly means "invincible" in Celtic. This was the name of a Briton goddess of victory who was invoked by Boudicca before her revolt.

name: ANDREA  (1)
meaning: Italian form of Andreas (see ANDREW). A notable bearer of this name was Andrea Verrocchio, a Renaissance sculptor who taught Leonardo da Vinci and Perugino.

name: ANDREA  (2)
meaning: Feminine form of ANDREW. As an English name, it has been used since the 17th century, though it was not common until the 20th century.

name: ANDREAS
meaning: Ancient Greek and Latin form of ANDREW. It is also the form used in modern Greek, German and Welsh.

name: ANDREI
meaning: Romanian form of ANDREW, and a variant Russian and Bulgarian transcription of ANDREY.

name: ANDREJA  (1)
meaning: Slovene and Croatian feminine form of ANDREJ.

name: ANDREW
meaning: English form of the Greek name Ανδρεας(Andreas), which was derived from ανδρειος(andreios) "manly, masculine", a derivative of ανηρ(aner) "man". In the New Testament the apostle Andrew, the first disciple to join Jesus, is the brother of Simon Peter. According to tradition, he later preached in the Black Sea region, with some legends saying he was crucified on an X-shaped cross. Andrew, being a Greek name, was probably only a nickname or a translation of his real Hebrew name, which is not known....[more]

name: ANDREY
meaning: Russian and Bulgarian form of ANDREW.

name: ANDRIA
meaning: Georgian, Corsican and Sardinian form of ANDREW.

name: ANDRIANA
meaning: Feminine form of ANDREAS (Greek) or ANDREY (Bulgarian).

name: ANDRIJA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of ANDREW.

name: ANDRIS
meaning: Latvian form and Hungarian diminutive of ANDREW.

name: ANDRO
meaning: Croatian form of ANDREW, as well as a Georgian short form of ANDRIA.

name: ANDROCLES
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Ανδροκλης(Androkles) which meant "glory of a man", derived from ανηρ(aner) "man" (genitive ανδρος) and κλεος(kleos) "glory". This was the name of a man who pulled a thorn from a lion's paw in one of Aesop's fables.

name: ANDROMACHE
meaning: Derived from the Greek elements ανηρ(aner) meaning "man" (genitive ανδρος) and μαχη(mache) meaning "battle". In Greek legend she was the wife of the Trojan hero Hector. After the fall of Troy Neoptolemus killed her son Astyanax and took her as a concubine.

name: ANDROMEDA
meaning: Means "to be mindful of a man" from the Greek element ανηρ(aner) "man" (genitive ανδρος) combined with μεδομαι(medomai) "to be mindful of". In Greek mythology Andromeda was an Ethiopian princess rescued from sacrifice by the hero Perseus. A constellation in the northern sky is named for her. This is also the name of a nearby galaxy, given because it resides (from our point of view) within the constellation.

name: ANDRONICUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Ανδρονικος(Andronikos) which meant "victory of a man", from ανηρ(aner) meaning "man" (genitive ανδρος) and νικη(nike) meaning "victory". This name was used by Shakespeare in his play 'Titus Andronicus' (1593).

name: ANDRÉ
meaning: French and Portuguese form of Andreas (see ANDREW).

name: ANDRÉS
meaning: Spanish and Icelandic form of ANDREW.

name: ANDY
meaning: Diminutive of ANDREW or sometimes ANDREA(2). American pop artist and filmmaker Andy Warhol (1928-1987) was a famous bearer of this name.

name: ANE  (2)
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Germanic element arn "eagle".

name: ANEIRIN
meaning: Welsh name, originally spelled Neirin, which possibly means "noble". This was the name of a 6th-century Welsh poet.

name: ANEMONE
meaning: From the name of the anemone flower, which derives from Greek ανεμος(anemos) "wind".

name: ANETA
meaning: Polish and Czech diminutive of ANNA.

name: ANFISA
meaning: Russian form of the Greek name Ανθουσα(Anthousa), which was derived from Greek ανθος(anthos) "flower". This was the name of a 9th-century Byzantine saint.

name: ANGEL
meaning: From the medieval Latin masculine name Angelus which was derived from the name of the heavenly creature (itself derived from the Greek word αγγελος(angelos) meaning "messenger"). It has never been very common in the English-speaking world, where it is sometimes used as a feminine name in modern times.

name: ANGELA
meaning: Feminine form of Angelus (see ANGEL). As an English name, it came into use in the 18th century.

name: ANGELICA
meaning: Derived from Latin angelicus meaning "angelic", ultimately related to Greek αγγελος(angelos) "messenger". The poets Boiardo and Ariosto used this name in their 'Orlando' poems (1495 and 1532), where it belongs to Orlando's love interest. It has been used as a given name since the 18th century.

name: ANGELINA
meaning: Latinate diminutive of ANGELA. A famous bearer is American actress Angelina Jolie (1975-).

name: ANGERONA
meaning: Possibly from Latin angor "strangulation, torment" or angustus "narrow, constricted". Angerona was the Roman goddess of the winter solstice, death, and silence.

name: ANGHARAD
meaning: Means "more love" in Welsh. In the Mabinogion, a collection of tales from Welsh myth, Angharad Golden-hand is the lover of Peredur.

name: ANGRA MAINYU
meaning: Means "evil spirit" in Avestan. In Persian mythology Angra Mainyu was the god of darkness, death and destruction, the enemy of Ahura Mazda.

name: ANGÈLE
meaning: French feminine form of Angelus (see ANGEL).

name: ANGÉLA
meaning: Hungarian feminine form of Angelus (see ANGEL).

name: ANGÉLICA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of ANGELICA.

name: ANH
meaning: This name is frequently combined with a middle name to create a compound name; the meaning of Anh changes depending on the Sino-Vietnamese characters underlying the compound. It is often from Sino-Vietnamese 英(anh) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero", though in compounds it often takes on the meaning "intelligent, bright".

name: ANI  (2)
meaning: From the name of an old Armenian city, of unknown meaning. Now in eastern Turkey, in the 10th and 11th centuries it was the capital of the Kingdom of Armenia, though it was later abandoned and is now only ruins.

name: ANIA
meaning: Polish diminutive of ANNA, and a variant Russian transcription of ANYA.

name: ANICA
meaning: Slovene, Croatian and Serbian diminutive of ANNA.

name: ANICETUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ανικητος(Aniketos), meaning "unconquerable". This was the name of an early pope.

name: ANIKA  (1)
meaning: German, Dutch, Danish and Slovene diminutive of ANNA or ANA.

name: ANIL
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit अनिल(anila) "air, wind". This is another name of Vayu, the Hindu god of the wind.

name: ANIMA  (1)
meaning: Means "minuteness" from Sanskrit अणिमन(animan). In yoga texts, this is the name of the ability to make oneself infinitely small so to be invisible.

name: ANIMA  (2)
meaning: Means "soul, spirit" in Latin. In Jungian psychology the anima is an individual's true inner self, or soul.

name: ANIRUDDHA
meaning: Means "unobstructed, ungovernable" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the grandson of the Hindu god Krishna.

name: ANISE
meaning: From the English word for the herb, also called aniseed.

name: ANISH
meaning: Means "supreme, paramount, without a ruler", from the Sanskrit negative prefix अ(a) and ईश(isha) meaning "ruler, lord".

name: ANISSA
meaning: Combination of ANNA and the popular name suffix issa. This name was first brought to public attention by the child actress Anissa Jones (1958-1976).

name: ANITA  (1)
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese, Croatian and Slovene diminutive of ANA.

name: ANIYA
meaning: Modern name, possibly based on ANYA or AALIYAH.

name: ANKE
meaning: Low German and Dutch diminutive of ANNA and other names beginning with An.

name: ANN
meaning: English form of ANNE(1). In the English-speaking world, both this spelling and Anne have been used since the Middle Ages, though Ann became much more popular during the 19th century.

name: ANNA
meaning: Form of Channah (see HANNAH) used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament. Many later Old Testament translations, including the English, use the Hannah spelling instead of Anna. The name appears briefly in the New Testament belonging to a prophetess who recognized Jesus as the Messiah. It was a popular name in the Byzantine Empire from an early date, and in the Middle Ages it became common among Western Christians due to veneration of Saint Anna (usually known as Saint Anne in English), the name traditionally assigned to the mother of the Virgin Mary. In the English-speaking world, this form came into general use in the 18th century, joining Ann and Anne....[more]

name: ANNABEL
meaning: Variant of AMABEL influenced by the name ANNA. This name appears to have arisen in Scotland in the Middle Ages.

name: ANNABELLA
meaning: Latinate form of ANNABEL. It can also be taken as a combination of ANNA and BELLA.

name: ANNABELLE
meaning: Variant of ANNABEL. It can also be taken as a combination of ANNA and BELLE.

name: ANNAGÜL
meaning: Derived from Turkmen anna "Friday" and gül "flower, rose".

name: ANNAS
meaning: Contracted form of ANANIAS. This was the name of one of the high priests of the Jews in the New Testament.

name: ANNE  (1)
meaning: French form of ANNA. In the 13th-century it was imported to England, where it was also commonly spelled Ann. The name was borne by a 17th-century English queen and also by the second wife of Henry VIII, Anne Boleyn (the mother of Queen Elizabeth I), who was eventually beheaded in the Tower of London. This is also the name of the heroine in 'Anne of Green Gables' (1908) by Canadian author L. M. Montgomery.

name: ANNE  (2)
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Germanic element arn "eagle".

name: ANNELIEN
meaning: Combination of ANNA and lien (from names such as CAROLIEN).

name: ANNETTE
meaning: French diminutive of ANNE(1). It has also been widely used in the English-speaking world, and it became popular in America in the late 1950s due to the fame of actress Annette Funicello (1942-).

name: ANNUNZIATA
meaning: Means "announced" in Italian, referring to the event in the New Testament in which the angel Gabriel tells the Virgin Mary of the imminent birth of Jesus.

name: ANONA
meaning: Meaning unknown. It was possibly inspired by an American song by this name written by Vivian Grey in 1903 and recorded by musician Vess Ossman. The lyrics tell of a Native American woman named Anona from Arizona.

name: ANOUK
meaning: Dutch and French diminutive of ANNA.

name: ANSA
meaning: Derived from Finnish ansio "virtue" or ansa "trap".

name: ANSALDO
meaning: Italian form of a Germanic name composed of the elements ans "god" and wald "power, leader, ruler".

name: ANSEL
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name ANSELM. A famous bearer was American photographer Ansel Adams (1902-1984).

name: ANSELM
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ans "god" and helm "helmet, protection". This name was brought to England in the late 11th century by Saint Anselm, who was born in northern Italy. He was archbishop of Canterbury and a Doctor of the Church.

name: ANSELMO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of ANSELM.

name: ANSGAR
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ans "god" and ger "spear". Saint Ansgar was a 9th-century missionary who tried to convert the Danes and Norwegians.

name: ANSHEL
meaning: Yiddish form of ANSELM, used as a vernacular form of Asher.

name: ANSO
meaning: Short form of Germanic names beginning with the element ans meaning "god".

name: ANSON
meaning: From a surname meaning "son of AGNES".

name: ANTE  (2)
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Germanic element and "wrath, zeal".

name: ANTELMO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of ANTHELM.

name: ANTHEA
meaning: From the Greek Ανθεια(Antheia), derived from ανθος(anthos) meaning "flower, blossom". This was an epithet of the Greek goddess Hera.

name: ANTHELM
meaning: From the Germanic element and "wrath, zeal" combined with helm "helmet, protection". Saint Anthelm was a 12th-century bishop of Belley in France.

name: ANTHONY
meaning: English form of the Roman family name Antonius, which is of unknown Etruscan origin. The most notable member of the Roman family was the general Marcus Antonius (called Mark Antony in English), who for a period in the 1st century BC ruled the Roman Empire jointly with Augustus. When their relationship turned sour, he and his mistress Cleopatra were attacked and forced to commit suicide, as related in Shakespeare's tragedy 'Antony and Cleopatra' (1606)....[more]

name: ANTIGONE
meaning: Derived from Greek αντι(anti) "against, compared to, like" and γονη(gone) "birth, offspring". In Greek legend Antigone was the daughter of Oedipus and Jocasta. King Creon of Thebes declared that her slain brother Polynices was to remain unburied, a great dishonour. She disobeyed and gave him a proper burial, and for this she was sealed alive in a cave.

name: ANTIGONUS
meaning: From the Greek name Αντιγονος(Antigonos), derived from αντι(anti) "against, compared to, like" and γονευς(goneus) "ancestor". This was the name of one of Alexander the Great's generals. After Alexander died, he took control of most of Asia Minor.

name: ANTIMAN
meaning: Means "condor of the sun" in Mapuche.

name: ANTINANCO
meaning: Means "eagle of the sun" in Mapuche.

name: ANTIOCHUS
meaning: From the Greek name Αντιοχος(Antiochos), derived from Greek αντι(anti) "against, compared to, like" and οχη(oche) "support". This was the name of several rulers of the Seleucid Empire.

name: ANTIOPE
meaning: Derived from the Greek elements αντι(anti) "against, compared to, like" and οψ(ops) "voice". This was the name of several figures in Greek mythology, including a daughter of Ares who was one of the queens of the Amazons. She was kidnapped and married by Theseus.

name: ANTIPATER
meaning: From the Greek name Αντιπατρος(Antipatros), which meant "like the father" from Greek αντι(anti) "against, compared to, like" and πατηρ(pater) "father" (genitive πατρος). This was the name of an officer of Alexander the Great who became the regent of Macedon during Alexander's absence.

name: ANTJE
meaning: Frisian, Dutch and Low German diminutive of ANNA.

name: ANTO
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of Antonius (see ANTHONY).

name: ANTOINETTE
meaning: Feminine diminutive of ANTOINE. This name was borne by Marie Antoinette, the queen of France during the French Revolution. She was executed by guillotine.

name: ANTONI
meaning: Polish and Catalan form of Antonius (see ANTHONY).

name: ANTONIJA
meaning: Croatian, Serbian and Slovene form of ANTONIA.

name: ANTONIN
meaning: French form of Antoninus (see ANTONINO). This name was borne by the French playwright Antonin Artaud (1896-1948).

name: ANTONINO
meaning: Italian form of the Roman name Antoninus, which was derived from Antonius (see ANTHONY). There were several early saints named Antoninus, including the patron saint of Sorrento. This was also the name of a 2nd-century Roman emperor.

name: ANTONINUS
meaning: Roman family name, a derivative of ANTONIUS.

name: ANTONIO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of Antonius (see ANTHONY). A famous bearer was the Italian Renaissance painter Antonio Pisanello (c. 1395-1455). It is also the name of the main character in 'The Merchant of Venice' (1596) by William Shakespeare.

name: ANTONIUS
meaning: Ancient Roman form of ANTHONY. This is also the official Dutch form of the name, used on birth certificates but commonly rendered Anton or Antoon in daily life.

name: ANTONY
meaning: Variant of ANTHONY. This was formerly the usual English spelling of the name, but during the 17th century the h began to be added.

name: ANTONÍN
meaning: Czech form of Antoninus (see ANTONINO). A famous bearer was the Czech composer Antonín Dvořák (1841-1904).

name: ANTOON
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish form of Antonius (see ANTHONY).

name: ANTWAN
meaning: Variant of ANTOINE, in use since the 1960s.

name: ANTÍA
meaning: Galician feminine form of Antonius (see ANTHONY).

name: ANTÓNIA
meaning: Portuguese, Slovak and Hungarian feminine form of Antonius (see ANTHONY).

name: ANTÔNIA
meaning: Brazilian Portuguese feminine form of Antonius (see ANTHONY).

name: ANTÔNIO
meaning: Brazilian Portuguese form of Antonius (see ANTHONY).

name: ANU  (1)
meaning: Finnish and Estonian diminutive of ANNA.

name: ANUBIS
meaning: Latinized form of Ανουβις(Anoubis), the Greek form of Egyptian Inpw (reconstructed as Anapa) which possibly meant "royal child". Anubis was the Egyptian god who led the dead to the underworld. He was often depicted as a man with the head of a jackal.

name: ANUJ
meaning: Means "born later, younger" in Sanskrit. This name is sometimes given to the younger sibling of an older child.

name: ANUSH
meaning: Means "sweet" in Armenian. This was the name of an 1890 novel by the Armenia writer Hovhannes Tumanyan. It was adapted into an opera in 1912 by Armen Tigranian.

name: ANWAR
meaning: Means "brighter, more luminous" in Arabic. This name was borne by Egyptian president Anwar Sadat (1918-1981), who was assassinated three years after being awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.

name: ANZO
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element ant meaning "giant".

name: ANZOR
meaning: Possibly derived from the Georgian noble title აზნაური(aznauri), ultimately from Middle Persian aznawar meaning "noble".

name: ANÍBAL
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of HANNIBAL.

name: ANĐELA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of ANGELA.

name: ANĐELKA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of ANGELA.

name: ANĐELKO
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of ANGEL.

name: AOD
meaning: Form of EHUD used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: AODH
meaning: From the old Irish name Áed, which meant "fire". This was a very popular name in early Ireland, being borne by numerous figures in Irish mythology and several high kings. It has been traditionally Anglicized as Hugh.

name: AODHÁN
meaning: From the old Irish name Áedán, a diminutive of Áed (see AODH). This was the name of an Irish monk and saint of the 7th century. It was also borne by several characters in Irish mythology.

name: AOI
meaning: From Japanese 葵(aoi) meaning "hollyhock, althea" or an adjectival form of 碧(ao) meaning "green, blue". Other kanji with the same reading can form this name as well.

name: AOIBHEANN
meaning: Means "beautiful sheen" in Irish Gaelic. This was the name of the mother of Saint Enda. It was also borne by Irish royalty.

name: AOIDE
meaning: Means "song" in Greek. In Greek mythology she was one of the original three muses, the muse of song.

name: AOIFE
meaning: Means "beauty" from the Gaelic word aoibh. In Irish legend Aoife was a warrior princess. In war against her sister Scathach, she was defeated in single combat by the hero Cúchulainn. Eventually she was reconciled with her sister and became the lover of Cúchulainn. This name is sometimes used as a Gaelic form of EVE or EVA.

name: AONGHUS
meaning: Possibly meaning "one strength" derived from Irish óen "one" and gus "force, strength, energy". Aonghus (sometimes surnamed Mac Og meaning "young son") was the Irish god of love and youth. The name was also borne by an 8th-century Pictish king and several Irish kings.

name: APARNA
meaning: Means "leafless, not having eaten leaves" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu goddess Parvati.

name: APHRA
meaning: Meaning uncertain; possibly a variant of AFRA(1), or possibly a variant of Aphrah, a biblical place name meaning "dust". This name was born by the English writer Aphra Behn (1640-1689).

name: APHRODISIOS
meaning: Ancient Greek personal name which was derived from the name of the Greek goddess APHRODITE.

name: APHRODITE
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Phoenician origin. Aphrodite was the Greek goddess of love, equal to the Roman goddess Venus. She was the wife of Hephaestus and the mother of Eros, and she was often associated with the myrtle tree and doves. The Greeks connected her name with αφρος(aphros) "foam", resulting in the story that she was born from the foam of the sea.

name: APOLENA
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of APOLLONIA.

name: APOLLINAIRE
meaning: French form of APOLLINARIS. It was adopted as a surname by the Polish-French poet Guillaume Apollinaire (1880-1918), who based it on his Polish middle name Apolinary.

name: APOLLINARIS
meaning: Ancient Greek name derived from the name of the god APOLLO. This was the name of several early saints and martyrs, including a bishop of Ravenna and a bishop of Hierapolis.

name: APOLLO
meaning: From Greek Απολλων(Apollon), which is of unknown meaning, though perhaps related to Indo-European *apelo "strength". Another theory states that Apollo can be equated with Appaliunas, an Anatolian god whose name possibly means "father lion" or "father light". The Greeks later associated Apollo's name with the Greek verb απολλυμι(apollymi) meaning "to destroy". In Greek mythology Apollo was the son of Zeus and Leto and the twin of Artemis. He was the god of prophecy, medicine, music, art, law, beauty, and wisdom. Later he also became the god of the sun and light.

name: APOLLODOROS
meaning: Means "gift of Apollo" from the name of the god APOLLO combined with Greek δωρον(doron) "gift".

name: APOLLONIA
meaning: Feminine form of APOLLONIOS. This was the name of a 3rd-century saint and martyr from Alexandria.

name: APOLLONIOS
meaning: From an ancient Greek personal name which was derived from the name of the Greek god APOLLO. It was borne by a Greek poet of the 3rd century BC. Several saints have also had this name.

name: APOLONIA
meaning: Spanish and Polish form of APOLLONIA.

name: APOSTOL
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of APOSTOLOS.

name: APPHIA
meaning: Greek form of a Hebrew name which possibly meant "increasing". This is a name mentioned in Paul's epistle to Philemon in the New Testament.

name: APPIUS
meaning: This was a Roman praenomen, or given name, used predominantly by the Claudia family. Its etymology is unknown. A famous bearer of this name was Appius Claudius Caecus, a Roman statesman of the 3rd century BC. He was responsible for the Aqua Appia (the first Roman aqueduct) and the Appian Way (a road between Rome and Capua), both of which were named for him.

name: APRIL
meaning: From the name of the month, probably originally derived from Latin aperire "to open", referring to the opening of flowers. It has only been commonly used as a given name since the 1940s.

name: APURVA
meaning: Means "unpreceded, new" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the masculine form अपूर्व and the feminine form अपूर्वा.

name: AQIL
meaning: Means "intelligent, wise" in Arabic. This transcription represents two different Arabic names.

name: AQISSIAQ
meaning: Means "ptarmigan" in Greenlandic (a ptarmigan is a type of bird which lives in cold regions).

name: AQUILA
meaning: From a Roman cognomen which meant "eagle" in Latin. In Acts in the New Testament Paul lives with Aquila and his wife Priscilla (or Prisca) for a time.

name: AQUILINA
meaning: Feminine form of AQUILINUS. This was the name of a 3rd-century saint from Byblos.

name: AQUILINUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was a derivative of AQUILA.

name: ARA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Sumerian origin. In Armenian legend this was the name of an Armenian king who was so handsome that the Assyrian queen Semiramis went to war to capture him. During the war Ara was slain.

name: ARABELLA
meaning: Medieval Scottish name, probably a variant of ANNABEL. It has long been associated with Latin orabilis meaning "invokable".

name: ARABINDA
meaning: Bengali and Odia variant of ARAVIND.

name: ARACELI
meaning: Means "altar of the sky" from Latin ara "altar" and coeli "sky". This is an epithet of the Virgin Mary in her role as the patron saint of Lucena, Spain.

name: ARACHNE
meaning: Means "spider" in Greek. In Greek myth Arachne was a mortal woman who defeated Athena in a weaving contest. After this Arachne hanged herself, but Athena brought her back to life in the form of a spider.

name: ARAGORN
meaning: Meaning unexplained, though the first element is presumably Sindarin ara "noble, kingly". This is the name of a character in 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954) by J. R. R. Tolkien. In the book Aragorn is the heir of the Dúnedain kings of the north.

name: ARAMAZD
meaning: From a combination of the mythological figures ARA and AHURA MAZDA. This was the name of the supreme creator god in pre-Christian Armenian mythology.

name: ARAMINTA
meaning: Meaning unknown. This name was (first?) used by William Congreve in his comedy 'The Old Bachelor' (1693) and later by Sir John Vanbrugh in his comedy 'The Confederacy' (1705). This was the real name of abolitionist Harriet Tubman (1820-1913), who was born Araminta Ross.

name: ARAMIS
meaning: The surname of one of the musketeers in 'The Three Musketeers' (1844) by Alexandre Dumas. Dumas based the character on Henri d'Aramitz, whose surname was derived from the French village of Aramits.

name: ARAN  (1)
meaning: From the name of the Aran Islands off the west coast of Ireland.

name: ARAN  (2)
meaning: Means "wild goat" in Hebrew. This is the name of a son of Dishan in the Old Testament.

name: ARANKA
meaning: Derived from Hungarian arany meaning "gold". It is used as a vernacular form of AURÉLIA.

name: ARANTZAZU
meaning: From the name of a place near the Spanish town of Oñati where there is a sanctuary dedicated to the Virgin Mary. Its name is derived from Basque arantza "thornbush".

name: ARARAT
meaning: From the name of a mountain in eastern Turkey (formerly part of Armenia), the place where Noah's Ark came to rest according to the Old Testament.

name: ARASH
meaning: Possibly means either "truthfulness" or "bright" in Persian. In Persian legend Arash was a Persian archer who was ordered by the Turans to shoot an arrow, the landing place of which would determine the new location of the Persian-Turan border. Arash climbed a mountain and fired his arrow with such strength that it flew for several hours and landed on the banks of the far-away Oxus River.

name: ARATA
meaning: From Japanese 新(arata) meaning "fresh, new". Other kanji or kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: ARAWN
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of the god of the underworld, called Annwfn, in Welsh mythology.

name: ARAX
meaning: From the name of a river (also called the Aras) which flows through Armenia.

name: ARCADIA
meaning: Feminine form of ARCADIUS. This is the name of a region on the Greek Peloponnese, long idealized for its natural beauty.

name: ARCHANA
meaning: Means "honouring, praising" in Sanskrit. This is the name of a Hindu ritual.

name: ARCHELAUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Αρχελαος(Archelaos), which meant "master of the people" from αρχος(archos) "master" and λαος(laos) "people". This was the name of a son of Herod the Great. He ruled over Judea, Samaria and Idumea.

name: ARCHER
meaning: From an English surname meaning "bowman, archer", of Old French origin.

name: ARCHIBALD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ercan "genuine" and bald "bold". The first element was altered due to the influence of Greek names beginning with the element αρχος(archos) meaning "master". The Normans brought this name to England. It first became common in Scotland in the Middle Ages.

name: ARCHIE
meaning: Diminutive of ARCHIBALD. This name is borne by Archie Andrews, an American comic-book character created in 1941.

name: ARCHIL
meaning: Meaning unknown, of Persian origin. This was the name of an 8th-century Georgian noble who was executed for refusing to convert to Islam.

name: ARCHIMEDES
meaning: Derived from the Greek elements αρχος(archos) "master" and μηδομαι(medomai) "to think, to plan". This was the name of a 3rd-century BC Greek mathematician, astronomer and inventor.

name: ARCHIPPOS
meaning: Means "master of horses" from the Greek elements αρχος(archos) "master" and ‘ιππος(hippos) "horse".

name: ARDASHIR
meaning: From the Middle Persian form of Artakhshathra (see ARTAXERXES). This was the name of a 3rd-century king of Persia who defeated the Parthians and founded the Sassanid Empire. He also established Zoroastrianism as the state religion.

name: ARDEN
meaning: From an English surname, originally taken from various place names, which were derived from a Celtic word meaning "high".

name: ARDGHAL
meaning: Means "high valour", derived from the Irish elements ard "high" and gal "valour".

name: ARELI
meaning: Means "lion of God, hero" in Hebrew. This was the name of a son of Gad in the Old Testament.

name: AREND
meaning: Dutch and German variant of ARNOLD. This is also the Dutch word for "eagle".

name: ARES
meaning: Perhaps from either Greek αρη(are) "bane, ruin" or αρσην(arsen) "male". Ares was the blood-thirsty god of war in Greek mythology, a son of Zeus and Hera.

name: ARETAS
meaning: Greek form of an Aramaic name, of unknown meaning. This was the name of four Nabataean kings of Petra in Jordan, including the first king (2nd century BC). King Aretas IV is mentioned briefly in the New Testament.

name: ARETHA
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek αρετη(arete) meaning "virtue". This name was popularized in the 1960s by American singer Aretha Franklin (1942-).

name: ARETHUSA
meaning: From Greek Αρεθουσα(Arethousa), which is possibly derived from αρδω(ardo) "water" and θοος(thoos) "quick, nimble". This was the name of a nymph in Greek mythology who was transformed into a fountain.

name: ARGIDER
meaning: Derived from Basque argi "light" and eder "beautiful".

name: ARGUS
meaning: From the Greek Αργος(Argos), derived from αργος(argos) meaning "glistening, shining". In Greek myth this name belonged to both the man who built the Argo and a man with a hundred eyes.

name: ARIA  (1)
meaning: Means "song, melody" in Italian (literally means "air"). An aria is an elaborate vocal solo, the type usually performed in operas. As an English name, it has only been in use since the 20th century. It is not common in Italy.

name: ARIADNA
meaning: Spanish, Catalan, Russian and Polish form of ARIADNE.

name: ARIADNE
meaning: Means "most holy", composed of the Cretan Greek elements αρι(ari) "most" and αδνος(adnos) "holy". In Greek mythology, Ariadne was the daughter of King Minos. She fell in love with Theseus and helped him to escape the Labyrinth and the Minotaur, but was later abandoned by him. Eventually she married the god Dionysus.

name: ARIANRHOD
meaning: Possibly means "silver wheel" or "round wheel" in Welsh. In Welsh myth Arianrhod was the mother of the brothers Dylan and Lleu Llaw Gyffes. In earlier myths she was a goddess of the moon.

name: ARIDAI
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Persian origin. In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the ten sons of Haman killed by the Jews.

name: ARIEH
meaning: Means "lion" in Hebrew. This was the name of an officer of King Pekahiah in the Old Testament.

name: ARIEL
meaning: Means "lion of God" in Hebrew, from אֲרִי('ari) meaning "lion" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". In the Old Testament it is used as another name for the city of Jerusalem. Shakespeare used it as the name of a spirit in his play 'The Tempest' (1611), and one of the moons of Uranus bears this name in his honour. As an English name, it became more common for females in the 1980s, especially after it was used for the title character in the Walt Disney film 'The Little Mermaid' (1989).

name: ARIES
meaning: Means "ram" in Latin. This is the name of a constellation and the first sign of the zodiac. Some Roman legends state that the ram in the constellation was the one who supplied the Golden Fleece sought by Jason.

name: ARIS  (1)
meaning: Modern Greek form of ARES. It is also used as a short form of ARISTOTELIS.

name: ARISTA
meaning: Means "ear of corn" in Latin. This is the name of a star, also known as Spica, in the constellation Virgo.

name: ARISTAEUS
meaning: From the Greek name Αρισταιος(Aristaios), derived from αριστος(aristos) "best". This was the name of a minor Greek god of agriculture, hunting and cattle. He was the son of Apollo and the mortal Cyrene.

name: ARISTARCHUS
meaning: From the Greek name Αρισταρχος(Aristarchos), derived from αριστος(aristos) "best" and αρχος(archos) "master". This name was borne by Aristarchus of Samos, a 3rd-century BC Greek astronomer and mathematician.

name: ARISTIDE
meaning: French and Italian form of ARISTIDES.

name: ARISTIDES
meaning: From the Greek name Αριστειδης(Aristeides), derived from αριστος(aristos) "best" and the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides). This name was borne by the 5th-century BC Athenian statesman Aristides the Just, who was renowned for his integrity. It was also the name of a 2nd-century saint.

name: ARISTOCLES
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Αριστοκλης(Aristokles) which meant "the best glory", derived from αριστος(aristos) "best" and κλεος(kleos) "glory". This was the real name of the philosopher Plato.

name: ARISTODEMOS
meaning: Derived from the Greek elements αριστος(aristos) "best" and δημος(demos) "the people". This was the name of a descendant of Herakles in Greek legend.

name: ARISTOMACHE
meaning: Derived from the Greek elements αριστος(aristos) "best" and μαχη(mache) "battle".

name: ARISTON
meaning: Derived from Greek αριστος(aristos) meaning "the best".

name: ARISTOPHANES
meaning: Derived from the Greek elements αριστος(aristos) "best" and φανης(phanes) "appearing". This was the name of a 5th-century BC Athenian playwright.

name: ARISTOTLE
meaning: From the Greek name Αριστοτελης(Aristoteles) which meant "the best purpose", derived from αριστος(aristos) "best" and τελος(telos) "purpose, aim". This was the name of a Greek philosopher of the 4th century BC who made lasting contributions to Western thought, including the fields of logic, metaphysics, ethics and biology.

name: ARITRA
meaning: From Sanskrit अरित्र(aritra) meaning "propelling, an oar".

name: ARJA
meaning: Variant of IRJA. The Finnish poet Eino Leino used it in his poem 'Arja and Selinä' (1916), though belonging to a male character.

name: ARJUNA
meaning: Means "white, clear" in Sanskrit. This is the name of a hero in Hindu texts, the son of the god Indra and the princess Kunti.

name: ARKADIOS
meaning: From an ancient Greek name meaning "of Arcadia". Arcadia was a region in Greece, its name deriving from αρκτος(arktos) "bear". This was the name of a 3rd-century saint and martyr.

name: ARKADIY
meaning: Russian form of ARKADIOS. This is the name of one of the main characters in Ivan Turgenev's 'Fathers and Sons' (1862).

name: ARKE
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element arn meaning "eagle".

name: ARLEN
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly from a surname.

name: ARLIE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "eagle wood" in Old English. This name can also be a diminutive of ARLENE.

name: ARLINE
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly invented by Michael William Balfe for the main character in his opera 'The Bohemian Girl' (1843).

name: ARLO
meaning: Meaning uncertain. It was perhaps inspired by the fictional place name Arlo Hill from the poem 'The Faerie Queene' (1590) by Edmund Spenser. Spenser probably got Arlo by altering the real Irish place name Aherlow, which is Gaelic meaning "between two highlands".

name: ARLOTTO
meaning: Medieval Italian name, recorded in Latin as Arlotus. It is possibly from Old French herlot meaning "vagabond, tramp".

name: ARMANDO
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Portuguese form of HERMAN.

name: ARMAS
meaning: Means "beloved" in Finnish (an archaic poetic word).

name: ARMAZI
meaning: Possibly related to the name of the Armenian god ARAMAZD or the Zoroastrian god AHURA MAZDA. In pre-Christian Georgian mythology Armazi was the supreme god.

name: ARMEL
meaning: From the old Welsh name Arthfael, which was composed of the elements arth "bear" and mael "prince". This was the name of a 6th-century Welsh saint who founded abbeys in Brittany.

name: ARMEN
meaning: Derived from the name of the country of ARMENIA (which is in fact named Հայաստան(Hayastan) in Armenian).

name: ARMIDA
meaning: Probably created by the 16th-century Italian poet Torquato Tasso for his epic poem 'Jerusalem Delivered' (1580). In the poem Armida is a beautiful enchantress who bewitches many of the crusaders.

name: ARMIDE
meaning: French form of ARMIDA. This is the name of operas by Jean-Baptiste Lully (in 1686) and Christoph Willibald Gluck (in 1777), both of which were based on 'Jerusalem Delivered' by Torquato Tasso.

name: ARMINIUS
meaning: Latinized form of a Germanic name which was probably derived from the element ermen meaning "whole, universal". Other theories claim that it is related to HERMAN. Arminius was a 1st-century ruler of the Cherusci who led a rebellion against the Roman Empire.

name: ARNBJÖRG
meaning: Old Norse name derived from the elements arn meaning "eagle" and björg meaning "help, save, rescue".

name: ARNE  (1)
meaning: Originally an Old Norse short form of names beginning with the element arn meaning "eagle".

name: ARNFINN
meaning: Norwegian form of Arnfinnr, which was derived from the elements arn "eagle" and Finnr "Sámi, person from Finland".

name: ARNFRIED
meaning: From a Germanic name derived from the elements arn "eagle" and frid "peace".

name: ARNO
meaning: Short form of ARNOUD or ARNOLD.

name: ARNOLD
meaning: From a Germanic name meaning "eagle power", derived from the elements arn "eagle" and wald "power". The Normans brought it to England, where it replaced the Old English cognate Earnweald. It died out as an English name after the Middle Ages, but it was revived in the 19th century....[more]

name: ARNOŠT
meaning: Czech and Sorbian form of ERNEST.

name: ARNULF
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements arn "eagle" and wulf "wolf".

name: ARON
meaning: Polish, Croatian and Scandinavian form of AARON.

name: ARRAN
meaning: From the name of an island off the west coast of Scotland in the Firth of Clyde.

name: ARSENIO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of ARSENIOS.

name: ARSENIOS
meaning: Means "virile" in Greek. Saint Arsenius was a 5th-century deacon who was tutor to the two sons of the Roman emperor Theodosius. The two sons, Arcadius and Honorius, divided the empire into eastern and western halves upon their father's death.

name: ARSLAN
meaning: Turkish variant and Turkmen form of ASLAN.

name: ARTAXERXES
meaning: Greek form of the Persian name Artakhshathra meaning "righteous ruler". This was the name of several Achaemenid Persian rulers. It was also borne by the founder of the Sassanid Empire, usually known by the Middle Persian form Ardashir.

name: ARTEM
meaning: Ukrainian and Belarusian form of ARTEMIOS. It is also a variant transcription of Russian ARTYOM.

name: ARTEMIDOROS
meaning: Means "gift of Artemis" from the name of the goddess ARTEMIS combined with Greek δωρον(doron) "gift". This was the name of a Greek author of the 2nd century who wrote about the interpretation of dreams.

name: ARTEMIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of ARTEMIOS.

name: ARTEMIOS
meaning: From an ancient Greek name which was derived from the name of the Greek goddess ARTEMIS. This was the name of a 4th-century general in the Roman army who is venerated as a saint in the Orthodox Church.

name: ARTEMIS
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly related either to Greek αρτεμης(artemes) "safe" or αρταμος(artamos) "a butcher". Artemis was the Greek goddess of the moon and hunting, the twin of Apollo and the daughter of Zeus and Leto. She was known as Diana to the Romans.

name: ARTEMISIA
meaning: Feminine form of ARTEMISIOS. This was the name of the 4th-century BC builder of the Mausoleum, one of the seven wonders of the world. She built it in memory of her husband, the Carian prince Mausolus.

name: ARTEMISIOS
meaning: From an ancient Greek name which was derived from the name of the Greek goddess ARTEMIS.

name: ARTEMON
meaning: From an ancient Greek name which was derived from the name of the Greek goddess ARTEMIS.

name: ARTHIT
meaning: Means "sun" in Thai, derived from the name of the Hindu god ADITYA.

name: ARTHUR
meaning: The meaning of this name is unknown. It could be derived from the Celtic elements artos "bear" combined with viros "man" or rigos "king". Alternatively it could be related to an obscure Roman family name Artorius. Arthur is the name of the central character in Arthurian legend, a 6th-century king of the Britons who resisted Saxon invaders. He may or may not have been a real person. He first appears in Welsh poems and chronicles (some possibly as early as the 7th century) but his character was not developed until the chronicles of the 12th-century Geoffrey of Monmouth....[more]

name: ARTURO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of ARTHUR.

name: ARUNA
meaning: Means "reddish brown" in Sanskrit. The Hindu god Aruna (अरुणा) is the charioteer who drives the sun god Surya across the sky. The feminine form अरुणा is transcribed the same way. The modern masculine form is Arun.

name: ARUNDHATI
meaning: The name of a star (also called Alcor), which was named after a type of climbing plant, possibly meaning "not restrained" in Sanskrit. In Hindu belief it is the name of the sage Vasishtha's wife, who is identified with the star.

name: ARUSHI
meaning: Means "hitting, killing" in Sanskrit. In Hindu mythology this is the name of a daughter of Manu.

name: ARVEL
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly a variant of ARWEL.

name: ARVID
meaning: From the Old Norse name Arnviðr, derived from the elements arn "eagle" and viðr "tree".

name: ARWA
meaning: Possibly means "mountain goats" in Arabic. This was the name of a 12th-century queen of Yemen.

name: ARWEL
meaning: Old Welsh name of unknown meaning.

name: ARWEN
meaning: Means "noble maiden" in Sindarin. In 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954) by J. R. R. Tolkien, Arwen was the daughter of Elrond and the lover of Aragorn.

name: ARWYN
meaning: From the Welsh intensifying prefix ar- and gwyn meaning "white, fair".

name: ARYA
meaning: From an old Indo-Iranian root meaning "Aryan, noble". In India, this is a transcription of both the masculine form आर्य and the feminine form आर्या. In Iran it is only a masculine name.

name: ARZU
meaning: Turkish and Uyghur form of AREZOO.

name: ARİF
meaning: Turkish and Azerbaijani form of ARIF.

name: ASA
meaning: Possibly means "healer" in Hebrew. This name was borne by the third king of Judah, as told in the Old Testament.

name: ASAPH
meaning: Means "collector" in Hebrew. This name belongs to several minor characters in the Old Testament.

name: ASBJØRN
meaning: Norwegian and Danish form of ÁSBJÖRN.

name: ASCELIN
meaning: Derived from a diminutive of the Germanic element asc meaning "ash tree".

name: ASCENSIÓN
meaning: Means "ascension" in Spanish. This name is given in reference to the Ascension of Jesus into heaven.

name: ASCO
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element asc meaning "ash tree".

name: ASEN
meaning: Meaning unknown, probably of Turkic origin. This was the name of a 12th-century Bulgarian emperor (Ivan Asen I) and several of his successors.

name: ASENATH
meaning: Means "devoted to the goddess NEITH" in Ancient Egyptian. In the Old Testament this is the name of Joseph's Egyptian wife. She was the mother of Manasseh and Ephraim.

name: ASENETH
meaning: Form of ASENATH used in the Latin Bible.

name: ASENNETH
meaning: Form of ASENATH used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: ASER
meaning: Form of ASHER used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: ASGER
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ásgeirr, derived from the elements áss meaning "god" and geirr meaning "spear".

name: ASH
meaning: Short form of ASHLEY. It can also come directly from the English word denoting either the tree or the residue of fire.

name: ASHA  (1)
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit आशा(asha) meaning "wish, desire, hope".

name: ASHA  (2)
meaning: Means "life" in Swahili, related to AISHA.

name: ASHANTI
meaning: From the name of an African people who reside in southern Ghana. It possibly means "warlike" in the Twi language.

name: ASHER
meaning: Means "happy, blessed" in Hebrew. Asher in the Old Testament is a son of Jacob by Leah's handmaid Zilpah, and the ancestor of one of the twelve tribes of Israel. The meaning of his name is explained in Genesis 30:13.

name: ASHERAH
meaning: Perhaps derived from Semitic roots meaning "she who walks in the sea". This was the name of an ancient Israelite goddess who was worshipped before the advent of monotheism.

name: ASHLEY
meaning: From an English surname which was originally derived from place names meaning "ash tree clearing", from a combination of Old English æsc and leah. Until the 1960s it was more commonly given to boys in the United States, but it is now most often used on girls.

name: ASHLYN
meaning: Combination of ASHLEY and the popular name suffix lyn.

name: ASHOKA
meaning: Means "without sorrow" in Sanskrit. This name was borne by Ashoka the Great, a 3rd-century BC emperor of India.

name: ASHTAD
meaning: Means "justice" in Persian. This was the name of a Yazata (or angel) in Zoroastrianism.

name: ASHTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name which meant "ash tree town" in Old English.

name: ASHTORETH
meaning: From עַשְׁתֹרֶת('Ashtoret), the Hebrew form of the name of a Phoenician goddess of love, war and fertility. Her name is cognate to that of the Babylonian goddess ISHTAR.

name: ASHWIN
meaning: From Sanskrit अश्विन्(ashvin) meaning "possessed of horses". The Ashvins are twin Hindu gods of the sunrise and sunset.

name: ASIA  (1)
meaning: From the name of the continent, which is perhaps derived from Akkadian asu, meaning "east".

name: ASIM
meaning: Turkish form of ASIM(1). This name is spelled with a Turkish dotless i, as Asım.

name: ASK
meaning: Derived from Old Norse askr "ash tree". In Norse mythology Ask and his wife Embla were the first humans created by the gods.

name: ASKLEPIADES
meaning: Ancient Greek personal name which was derived from the name of the Greek god ASKLEPIOS combined with the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides). It was borne by several Greek physicians.

name: ASKLEPIOS
meaning: Possibly means "cut up" in Greek. Asklepios (Aesculapius to the Romans) was the god of healing and medicine in Greek mythology.

name: ASLAN
meaning: From Turkic arslan meaning "lion". This was a byname or title borne by several medieval Turkic rulers, including the Seljuk sultan Alp Arslan (a byname meaning "brave lion") who drove the Byzantines from Anatolia in the 11th century. The name Aslan was later used by the author C. S. Lewis for the main protagonist (a lion) in his 'Chronicles of Narnia' series of books, first appearing in 1950.

name: ASLANBEK
meaning: Derived from Turkish aslan meaning "lion" combined with the Turkish military title beg meaning "chieftain, master".

name: ASLAUG
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements áss meaning "god" and laug possibly meaning "betrothed woman".

name: ASMAA
meaning: Means "appellations, names" in Arabic. This was the name of a daughter of Abu Bakr, the first caliph of the Muslims.

name: ASPASIA
meaning: Derived from Greek ασπασιος(aspasios) meaning "welcome, embrace". This was the name of the lover of Pericles (5th century BC).

name: ASPEN
meaning: From the English word for the tree, derived from Old English æspe. It is also the name of a ski resort in Colorado.

name: ASRA
meaning: Means "travel at night" in Arabic. It is related to Isra.

name: ASSE
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element asc meaning "ash tree" or ans meaning "god".

name: ASSUMPTA
meaning: Latinate form of ASUNCIÓN, used especially in Ireland.

name: ASTAROTH
meaning: From Ashtaroth, the plural form of ASHTORETH used in the bible to refer to Phoenician idols. This spelling was used in late medieval demonology texts to refer to a type of (masculine) demon.

name: ASTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from either a place name meaning "east town" in Old English or from the given name ÆÐELSTAN.

name: ASTOR
meaning: From a surname derived from Occitan astur meaning "hawk".

name: ASTRA
meaning: Means "star", ultimately from Greek αστηρ(aster). This name has only been (rarely) used since the 20th century.

name: ASTRAEA
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Αστραια(Astraia), derived from Greek αστηρ(aster) meaning "star". Astraea was a Greek goddess of justice and innocence. After wickedness took root in the world she left the earth and became the constellation Virgo.

name: ASTRID
meaning: Modern form of ÁSTRÍÐR. This name was borne by the Swedish writer Astrid Lindgren (1907-2002), the author of 'Pippi Longstocking'.

name: ASTROPHEL
meaning: Probably intended to mean "star lover", from Greek αστηρ(aster) "star" and φιλος(philos) "lover, friend". This name was first used by the 16th-century poet Sir Philip Sidney in his collection of sonnets 'Astrophel and Stella'.

name: ASUKA
meaning: From Japanese 明日(asu) meaning "tomorrow" and 香(ka) meaning "fragrance", or from 飛(asu) meaning "to fly" and 鳥(ka) meaning "bird". Other kanji combinations can be possible as well.

name: ASUNCIÓN
meaning: Means "assumption" in Spanish. This name is given in reference to the assumption of the Virgin Mary into heaven.

name: ASWATHI
meaning: From Sanskrit अशवत्थ(ashvattha) meaning "sacred fig tree".

name: ATALANTA
meaning: From the Greek Αταλαντη(Atalante) meaning "equal in weight", derived from αταλαντος(atalantos), a word related to ταλαντον(talanton) meaning "a scale, a balance". In Greek legend she was a fast-footed maiden who refused to marry anyone who could not beat her in a race. She was eventually defeated by Hippomenes, who dropped three golden apples during the race causing her to stop to pick them up.

name: ATANAS
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of ATHANASIUS.

name: ATANASIJA
meaning: Serbian and Macedonian feminine form of ATHANASIUS.

name: ATARAH
meaning: Means "crown" in Hebrew. She was a minor Old Testament character, the wife of Jerahmeel.

name: ATAULLAH
meaning: Means "gift of ALLAH" from Arabic عطاء('ata) "gift" combined with الله(Allah).

name: ATHALIAH
meaning: Possibly means "YAHWEH is exalted" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is both a feminine and masculine name. It was borne by the daughter of Ahab and Jezebel, who later came to rule Judah as a queen.

name: ATHANARIC
meaning: From the Gothic name Athanareiks, derived from the Germanic element athana meaning "year" combined with ric meaning "power, ruler". Athanaric was a 4th-century ruler of the Visigoths.

name: ATHANASIUS
meaning: From the Greek name Αθανασιος(Athanasios) meaning "immortal", from Greek α(a), a negative prefix, combined with θανατος(thanatos) "death". Saint Athanasius was a 4th-century bishop of Alexandria who strongly opposed Arianism.

name: ATHAULF
meaning: Germanic name derived from atta "father" and wulf "wolf". This was the name of a 5th-century king of the Visigoths.

name: ATHENA
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps derived from Greek αθηρ(ather) "sharp" and αινη(aine) "praise". Athena was the Greek goddess of wisdom and warfare, the daughter of Zeus and the patron goddess of the city of Athens in Greece. She is associated with the olive tree and the owl.

name: ATHENAIS
meaning: Ancient Greek personal name which was derived from the name of the Greek goddess ATHENA.

name: ATHOL
meaning: From the name of a district in Scotland which was derived from Gaelic ath Fodhla "new Ireland".

name: ATLAS
meaning: Possibly means "enduring" from Greek τλαω(tlao) meaning "to endure". In Greek mythology he was a Titan punished by Zeus by being forced to support the heavens on his shoulders.

name: ATON
meaning: Means "solar disk" in Egyptian. Aton was an Egyptian god of the sun, depicted as a solar disk with long rays extending downwards. The worship of Aton was especially extensive during the reign of the pharaoh Akhenaton, who proclaimed Aton was the only god.

name: ATROPOS
meaning: Means "inevitable, inflexible" in Greek, derived from the negative prefix α(a) combined with τροπος(tropos) "direction, manner, fashion". Atropos was one of the three Fates or Μοιραι (Moirai) in Greek mythology. When her sister Lachesis decided that a person's life was at an end, Atropos would choose the manner of death and cut the person's life thread.

name: ATSE
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element adal meaning "noble".

name: ATSUKO
meaning: From Japanese 温(atsu) meaning "warm", 篤(atsu) meaning "deep, true, sincere" or 敦(atsu) meaning "honest" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: ATTE
meaning: Finnish diminutive of ANTERO and other names beginning with A.

name: ATTICUS
meaning: From a Roman name meaning "from Attica" in Latin. Attica is the region surrounding Athens in Greece. The author Harper Lee used this name in her novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird' (1960).

name: ATTILA
meaning: Possibly means "little father" from Gothic atta "father" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of a 5th-century leader of the Huns, a nomadic people from Central Asia who had expanded into Eastern Europe by the 4th century. Attila was the name given to him by his Gothic-speaking subjects in Eastern Europe; his real name may have been Avithohol.

name: ATTILIO
meaning: Italian form of the Roman family name Atilius, which is of unknown Etruscan origin. Marcus Atilius Regulus was a Roman consul and hero of the First Punic War.

name: ATUM
meaning: Means "completion" in Egyptian. This was the name of an Egyptian creator god. He was first prominently worshipped in Heliopolis during the Old Kingdom.

name: AUBERON
meaning: Norman French derivative of a Germanic name, probably ALBERICH.

name: AUBREY
meaning: Norman French form of the Germanic name ALBERICH. As an English masculine name it was common in the Middle Ages, and was revived in the 19th century. Since the mid-1970s it has more frequently been given to girls, due to Bread's 1972 song 'Aubrey' along with its similarity to the established feminine name Audrey.

name: AUDHILD
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements auðr "wealth, fortune" and hildr "battle".

name: AUDLEY
meaning: From a surname which was taken from a place name meaning "EALDGYÐ's clearing" in Old English.

name: AUDRA  (2)
meaning: Variant of AUDREY, used since the 19th century.

name: AUDREY
meaning: Medieval diminutive of ÆÐELÞRYÐ. This was the name of a 7th-century saint, a princess of East Anglia who founded a monastery at Ely. It was also borne by a character in Shakespeare's comedy 'As You Like It' (1599). At the end of the Middle Ages the name became rare due to association with the word tawdry (which was derived from St. Audrey, the name of a fair where cheap lace was sold), but it was revived in the 19th century. A famous bearer was British actress Audrey Hepburn (1929-1993).

name: AUGUST
meaning: German, Polish, Scandinavian and Catalan form of AUGUSTUS.

name: AUGUSTA
meaning: Feminine form of AUGUSTUS. It was introduced to Britain when King George III, a member of the German House of Hanover, gave this name to his second daughter in the 18th century.

name: AUGUSTINE  (1)
meaning: From the Roman name Augustinus, itself derived from the Roman name AUGUSTUS. Saint Augustine of Hippo was a 5th-century Christian theologian and author from North Africa. For his contributions to Christian philosophy he is known as a Doctor of the Church. Due to his renown, the name came into general use in the Christian world. It became popular in England in the Middle Ages partly because of a second saint by this name, Augustine of Canterbury, a 6th-century Italian monk sent to England to convert the Anglo-Saxons.

name: AUGUSTINE  (2)
meaning: French feminine form of Augustinus (see AUGUSTINE(1)).

name: AUGUSTO
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Portuguese form of AUGUSTUS.

name: AUGUSTUS
meaning: Means "great" or "venerable", derived from Latin augere "to increase". Augustus was the title given to Octavian, the first Roman emperor. He was the adopted son of Julius Caesar who rose to power through a combination of military skill and political prowess. This was also the name of three kings of Poland.

name: AUGUSTÍN
meaning: Slovak and Czech form of Augustinus (see AUGUSTINE(1)).

name: AUKE
meaning: Possibly a Frisian diminutive of AUGUSTINUS or AURELIUS.

name: AULUS
meaning: Possibly from Latin avulus "little grandfather", though it could be from the Etruscan name Aule, which was possibly derived from avils meaning "years". This was a Roman praenomen, or given name. Folk etymology connects it to Latin aula "palace".

name: AURA
meaning: From the word aura (derived from Latin, ultimately from Greek αυρα meaning "breeze") for a distinctive atmosphere or illumination.

name: AURANGZEB
meaning: Means "honouring the throne" in Persian. This was the name of a 17th-century Mughal emperor of India.

name: AUREA
meaning: Late Latin name which was derived from aureus "golden". This was the name of a 3rd-century saint from Ostia (near Rome), as well as an 11th-century Spanish saint.

name: AUREL
meaning: German, Romanian, Czech and Slovak form of AURELIUS.

name: AURELIANO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of AURELIANUS.

name: AURELIANUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was originally derived from the Roman family name AURELIUS.

name: AURELIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of AURELIUS.

name: AURELIUS
meaning: Roman family name which was derived from Latin aureus "golden, gilded". Marcus Aurelius was a 2nd-century Roman emperor and philosophical writer. This was also the name of several early saints.

name: AUREOLE
meaning: From the English word meaning "radiant halo", ultimately derived from Latin aureolus "golden".

name: AUROBINDO
meaning: Bengali and Odia variant of ARAVIND.

name: AURORA
meaning: Means "dawn" in Latin. Aurora was the Roman goddess of the morning. It has occasionally been used as a given name since the Renaissance.

name: AUSTIN
meaning: Medieval contracted form of AUGUSTINE(1). Modern use of the name is probably also partly inspired by the common surname Austin, which is of the same origin. This is also the name of a city in Texas.

name: AUSTĖJA
meaning: Means "to weave" in Lithuanian. This was the name of the Lithuanian goddess of bees.

name: AUTUMN
meaning: From the name of the season, ultimately from Latin autumnus. This name has been in general use since the 1960s.

name: AUXENTIOS
meaning: Derived from Greek αυξανω(auxano) meaning "to increase, to grow". This name was borne by a few early saints.

name: AVA  (1)
meaning: Variant of EVE. A famous bearer was the American actress Ava Gardner (1922-1990).

name: AVA  (3)
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element avi, of unknown meaning, possibly "desired". This was the name of a 9th-century Frankish saint. It was also borne by a 12th-century poet from Melk, Austria.

name: AVALON
meaning: From the name of the island paradise to which King Arthur was brought after his death. The name of this island is perhaps related to Welsh afal meaning "apple", a fruit which was often linked with paradise.

name: AVANTI
meaning: From the name of an ancient kingdom of central India which had its capital at Ujjain.

name: AVE
meaning: Possibly from the name of the prayer Ave Maria, in which Ave is Latin meaning "greetings, salutations".

name: AVELINE
meaning: From the Norman French form of the Germanic name Avelina, a diminutive of AVILA. The Normans introduced this name to Britain. After the Middle Ages it became rare as an English name, though it persisted in America until the 19th century.

name: AVERILL
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from the feminine given name EOFORHILD.

name: AVERY
meaning: From a surname which was itself derived from the Norman French form of the given names ALBERICH or ALFRED.

name: AVGUST
meaning: Slovene, Russian and Ukrainian form of AUGUSTUS.

name: AVI
meaning: Means "my father" in Hebrew. It is also a diminutive of AVRAHAM or AVIRAM.

name: AVILA
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element avi, of unknown meaning, possibly "desired". This name is also given in honour of the 16th-century mystic Saint Teresa of Ávila, Ávila being the name of the town in Spain where she was born.

name: AVILIUS
meaning: Roman family name of unknown meaning. Saint Avilius was a 1st-century patriarch of Alexandria.

name: AVIS
meaning: Probably a Latinized form of the Germanic name Aveza, which was derived from the element avi, of unknown meaning, possibly "desired". The Normans introduced this name to England and it became moderately common during the Middle Ages, at which time it was associated with Latin avis "bird".

name: AVITUS
meaning: From a Roman family name which meant "ancestral" in Latin. This was the name of an emperor who briefly reigned over the Western Roman Empire in the 5th century. It was also the name of several saints, including a 6th-century bishop of Vienne.

name: AVTANDIL
meaning: Created by the Georgian poet Shota Rustaveli for his 12th-century epic 'The Knight in the Panther's Skin'. Rustaveli based it on Persian آفتاب(aftab) "sunshine" and دل(dil) "heart". In the poem Avtandil is a knight who is sent by Tinatin to search for the mysterious knight of the title.

name: AWITI
meaning: Means "thrown away" in Luo, possibly used for a child born prematurely.

name: AYA
meaning: From Japanese 彩(aya) meaning "colour", 綾(aya) meaning "design", or other kanji characters with the same pronunciation.

name: AYAKA
meaning: From Japanese 彩(aya) meaning "colour" combined with 花(ka) or 華(ka) which both mean "flower". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: AYAKO
meaning: From Japanese 彩(aya) meaning "colour", 綾(aya) meaning "design" or 絢(aya) meaning "brilliant fabric design, kimono design" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other combinations of kanji characters are also possible.

name: AYAME
meaning: From Japanese 菖蒲(ayame) meaning "iris". Other kanji or combinations of kanji can also form this name.

name: AYANDA
meaning: Means "they are increasing" in Zulu, Xhosa and Ndebele.

name: AYANE
meaning: From Japanese 彩(aya) meaning "colour", 綾(aya) meaning "design" or 絢(aya) meaning "brilliant fabric design, kimono design" combined with 音(ne) meaning "sound". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: AYANO
meaning: From Japanese 彩(aya) meaning "colour" or 綾(aya) meaning "design" combined with 乃(no), a possessive particle. Other combinations of kanji characters can also form this name.

name: AYELET
meaning: Means "gazelle, hind". It is taken from the Hebrew phrase אַיֶלֶת הַשַׁחַר('ayelet hashachar), literally "gazelle of dawn", which is a name of the morning star.

name: AYGUL
meaning: Azerbaijani and Uyghur form of AYGÜL.

name: AYGÜN
meaning: Derived from the Turkic elements ay "moon" and gün "sun".

name: AYLA  (3)
meaning: Created for the novel 'Clan of the Cave Bear' (1980) by author Jean M. Auel. In the novel Ayla is an orphaned Cro-Magnon girl adopted by Neanderthals. Ayla is the Neanderthal pronunciation of her real name, which is not given.

name: AYLEN
meaning: Possibly means either "happiness" or "clear" in Mapuche.

name: AYLMER
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of ELMER.

name: AYLİN
meaning: Means "of the moon" in Turkish and Azerbaijani, from Turkic ay "moon".

name: AYN
meaning: This name was assumed by Ayn Rand (1905-1982), originally named Alice Rosenbaum, a Russian-American writer and philosopher. She apparently based it on a Finnish name she had heard, but never seen written.

name: AYNUR
meaning: Means "moon light" in Turkish, Azerbaijani, Kazakh and Uyghur, ultimately from Turkic ay meaning "moon" and Arabic نور(nur) meaning "light".

name: AYO
meaning: Means "joy" in Yoruba, or a short form of names containing that element.

name: AYODELE
meaning: Means "joy has come home" in Yoruba.

name: AYOKUNLE
meaning: Means "joy has filled the home" in Yoruba.

name: AYOMIDE
meaning: Means "my joy has arrived" in Yoruba.

name: AYSEL
meaning: Means "moon flood" in Turkish and Azerbaijani, from Turkic ay "moon" and sel "flood, stream".

name: AYSU
meaning: Derived from Turkish ay meaning "moon" and su meaning "water".

name: AYSUN
meaning: Means "as beautiful as the moon" in Turkish.

name: AYTAÇ
meaning: Derived from Turkish ay meaning "moon" and taç meaning "crown" (of Persian origin).

name: AYTEN
meaning: Derived from Turkish ay meaning "moon" and ten meaning "skin" (of Persian origin).

name: AYUMU
meaning: From Japanese 歩(ayu) meaning "walk" and 夢(mu) meaning "dream, vision". Other combinations of kanji are also possible.

name: AZAD
meaning: Means "free" in Persian. This word has derivatives in several other languages, such as Hindi, Turkish and Armenian.

name: AZALEA
meaning: From the name of the flower, ultimately derived from Greek αζαλεος(azaleos) "dry".

name: AZAREL
meaning: Means "God has helped" in Hebrew. This is the name of several minor Old Testament characters.

name: AZARIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH has helped" in Hebrew, derived from עָזַר('azar) meaning "help" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. This is the name of many Old Testament characters including of one of the three men the Babylonian king ordered cast into a fiery furnace. His Babylonian name was Abednego.

name: AZARIAS
meaning: Form of AZARIAH used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: AZAZEL
meaning: Means "scapegoat" in Hebrew. This is the name of the recipient of a sacrificial goat in the Old Testament. The identity of Azazel is not clear; it may in fact be the name of the place where the goat is to be sacrificed, or it may be the name of some sort of evil desert demon.

name: AZAZIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH is strong" in Hebrew. This is the name of three minor characters in the Old Testament.

name: AZEL
meaning: Means "reserved" in Hebrew. This is both the name of a minor character and a place name in the Old Testament.

name: AZIZ
meaning: Means "powerful, respected, beloved", derived from Arabic عزّ('azza) meaning "to be powerful" or "to be cherished". In Islamic tradition العزيز(al-'Aziz) is one of the 99 names of Allah. A notable bearer of the name was Al-'Aziz, a 10th-century Fatimid caliph.

name: AZRAEL
meaning: Variant of AZRIEL. This was the name of an angel in Jewish and Muslim tradition who separated the soul from the body upon death. He is sometimes referred to as the Angel of Death.

name: AZRIEL
meaning: Means "my help is God", derived from Hebrew עָזַר('azar) meaning "help" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". This was the name of three minor characters in the Old Testament.

name: AZUBAH
meaning: Means "forsaken" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of Caleb's wife.

name: AZUBUIKE
meaning: Means "the past is your strength" or "your back is your strength" in Igbo.

name: AZURE
meaning: From the English word that means "sky blue". It is ultimately (via Old French, Latin and Arabic) from Persian لاجورد(lajvard) meaning "azure, lapis lazuli".

name: AÐALBJÖRG
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements aðal "noble" and björg "help, save, rescue".

name: AÐALSTEINN
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements aðal "noble" and steinn "stone".

name: AÝNA
meaning: Means "mirror" in Turkmen, ultimately from Persian آینه(ayneh).

name: AÝNABAT
meaning: Derived from Turkmen aý "moon" and nabat "sugar".

name: BA'AL
meaning: Derived from Semitic ba'al meaning "lord" or "possessor". This was the name of various local deities, often associated with storms and fertility, who were worshipped by the Canaanites, Phoenicians, and other peoples of the ancient Near East.

name: BAAK
meaning: Originally a short form of names starting with the Germanic element badu "fight, struggle".

name: BABAK
meaning: Means "little father" in Persian. This was the name of the father of Ardashir, the founder of the Sassanid Empire in Persia. It was also borne by the 9th-century resistance leader Babak Khorramdin.

name: BABUR
meaning: From a Persian word meaning "tiger". This was the nickname of Zahir ud-Din Muhammad, the 16th-century founder of the Mughal Empire in India.

name: BABYLAS
meaning: Derived from the name of the ancient Mesopotamian city of Babylon. Saint Babylas was a 3rd-century patriarch of Antioch who was martyred during the reign of the Roman emperor Decius.

name: BACCHUS
meaning: From Greek Βακχος(Bakchos), derived from ιαχο(iacho) meaning "to shout". This was another name of the Greek god Dionysos, and it was also the name that the Romans commonly used for him.

name: BADA
meaning: Old English name probably derived from beadu meaning "battle".

name: BADEMUS
meaning: Latinized form of a Persian name of unknown meaning. Saint Bademus was a 4th-century Persian martyr who was a victim of Shapur II's persecutions.

name: BADULF
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements badu "fight, struggle" and wulf "wolf".

name: BADURAD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements badu "fight, struggle" and rad "counsel".

name: BAER
meaning: Short form of ALBAER and other Limburgish names ending in baer, often derived from the Germanic element beraht meaning "bright".

name: BAGADATA
meaning: Old Persian name derived from baga "god" and data "given". This was the name of a 3rd-century BC Persian satrap under the Seleucid Empire.

name: BAGGI
meaning: Derived from Old Norse baggi meaning "bag, pack".

name: BAGRAT
meaning: Armenian and Georgian form of BAGADATA. This name was borne by several Georgian kings, though it is now uncommon there.

name: BAHADUR
meaning: Persian form of the Turkic word bagatur meaning "hero, warrior, brave".

name: BAHARGÜL
meaning: Derived from Turkmen bahar meaning "spring" and gül meaning "flower, rose" (both roots ultimately of Persian origin).

name: BAHMAN
meaning: Modern Persian form of Avestan Vohu Manah meaning "good mind". This was the name of a Zoroastrian god (one of the Amesha Spenta) associated with domestic animals. It is also the name of the eleventh month in the Iranian calendar.

name: BAHRAM
meaning: Modern Persian form of Avestan Verethragna meaning "victory over resistance". This was the name of a Zoroastrian god (one of the Amesha Spenta) associated with victory and war. This name was borne by several Sassanid emperors. It is also the Persian name for the planet Mars.

name: BAI
meaning: From Chinese 白(bái) meaning "white, pure", 百(bǎi) meaning "one hundred, many" or 柏(bǎi) meaning "cypress tree, cedar" (which is usually only masculine). Other Chinese characters can form this name as well. This name was borne in the 8th century by the Tang dynasty poet Li Bai, whose given was 白.

name: BAILEY
meaning: From a surname derived from Middle English baili meaning "bailiff", originally denoting one who was a bailiff.

name: BAISHAN
meaning: Means "knife" in Apache. This was the name of a 19th-century chief of the Chiricahua Apache.

name: BAKR
meaning: Means "young camel" in Arabic. Abu Bakr was a father-in-law of the Prophet Muhammad and the first caliph of the Muslim world.

name: BALA  (1)
meaning: Means "young" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the masculine form बाल and the feminine form बाला (a minor Hindu goddess).

name: BALADEVA
meaning: Means "god of strength" from Sanskrit बल(bala) meaning "strength" combined with देव(deva) meaning "god". Baladeva (also called Balarama) is the name of the older brother of the Hindu god Krishna.

name: BALAKRISHNA
meaning: From Sanskrit बल(bala) meaning "strength, might" combined with the name of the Hindu god KRISHNA.

name: BALBINA
meaning: Feminine form of BALBINUS. Saint Balbina was a 2nd-century Roman woman martyred with her father Quirinus.

name: BALBINO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of BALBINUS.

name: BALBINUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was a derivative of BALBUS.

name: BALBUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which meant "stammerer" in Latin. This was a family name of the mother of Emperor Augustus, Atia Balba Caesonia.

name: BALDER
meaning: Means "prince" from Old Norse. In Norse mythology Balder was the son of Odin and Frigg. Because of the disturbing dreams he had when he was young, his mother extracted an oath from every thing in the world that it would not harm him. However the evil fire god Loki learned that she had overlooked mistletoe. Being jealous, he tricked the blind god Hoder into throwing a branch of mistletoe at Balder, which killed him.

name: BALDO
meaning: Originally a short form of names containing the Germanic element bald "bold, brave", such as BALDOVINO and TEOBALDO.

name: BALDOMERO
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements bald "bold, brave" and mari "famous".

name: BALDRIC
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements bald "bold, brave" and ric "power, rule". The Normans introduced this name to Britain, and it was common in the Middle Ages.

name: BALDUR
meaning: German and Icelandic form of BALDER.

name: BALDWIN
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements bald "bold, brave" and win "friend". In the Middle Ages this was a popular name in Flanders and among the Normans, who brought it to Britain. It was borne by one of the leaders of the First Crusade, an 11th-century nobleman from Flanders. After the crusaders conquered Jerusalem, he was crowned as the king of the Kingdom of Jerusalem.

name: BALFOUR
meaning: From a Scottish surname, originally from various place names, which meant "village pasture" in Gaelic.

name: BALTASAR  (2)
meaning: Form of BELSHAZZAR used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: BALTASSAR
meaning: Form of BELSHAZZAR used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: BALTHAZAR
meaning: Variant of BELSHAZZAR. Baltazar is the name traditionally assigned to one of the wise men (also known as the Magi, or three kings) who visited the newborn Jesus.

name: BALWINDER
meaning: From Sanskrit बल(bala) meaning "strength, might" combined with the name of the Hindu god INDRA.

name: BAMBI
meaning: Derived from Italian bambina meaning "young girl". The American novelist Marjorie Benton Cooke used it in her novel 'Bambi' (1914). This was also the name of a male deer in a cartoon by Walt Disney, which was based on a 1923 novel by Swiss author Felix Salten.

name: BANDILE
meaning: Means "they have increased" in Zulu, Xhosa and Ndebele.

name: BAO
meaning: From Chinese 宝(bǎo) meaning "treasure, jewel, precious, rare", 褒(bāo) meaning "praise, honour" or 苞(bāo) meaning "bud" (which is usually only feminine). Other Chinese characters are possible as well.

name: BAPTIST
meaning: German form of BAPTISTE. It is often paired with the name Johann, in honour of Saint John the Baptist.

name: BAPTISTE
meaning: Means "baptist" in French, originally deriving from Greek βαπτω(bapto) "to dip". This name is usually given in honour of Saint John the Baptist, and as such it is often paired with the name Jean.

name: BAQI
meaning: Means "eternal" in Arabic. This was the pen name of a 16th-century Turkish poet.

name: BAQIR
meaning: Means "to rip open" in Arabic. Muhammad al-Baqir was the fifth imam of the Shia Muslims.

name: BARAK  (1)
meaning: Means "lightning" in Hebrew. According to the Old Testament, Barak was a military commander under the guidance of the prophetess Deborah. They defeated the Canaanite army led by Sisera.

name: BARAKAT
meaning: Means "blessings" in Arabic, a plural form of BARAK(2).

name: BARBARA
meaning: Derived from Greek βαρβαρος(barbaros) meaning "foreign". According to legend, Saint Barbara was a young woman killed by her father Dioscorus, who was then killed by a bolt of lightning. She is the patron of architects, geologists, stonemasons and artillerymen. Because of her renown, the name came into general use in the Christian world in the Middle Ages. In England it became rare after the Protestant Reformation, but it was revived in the 19th century.

name: BARBORA
meaning: Czech, Slovak and Lithuanian form of BARBARA.

name: BARCLAY
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was likely derived from the English place name Berkeley, meaning "birch wood" in Old English.

name: BARLAAM
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Christian legends Barlaam (recorded as Greek Βαρλααμ) was a 3rd-century hermit who converted Josaphat, the son of an Indian king, to Christianity. The story is based on that of the Buddha. This name was also borne by two saints.

name: BARNABAS
meaning: Greek form of an Aramaic name. In Acts in the New Testament the byname Barnabas was given to a man named Joseph, a Jew from Cyprus who was a companion of Paul on his missionary journeys. The original Aramaic form is unattested, but it may be from בּר נביא(bar naviya') meaning "son of the prophet", though in Acts 4:36 it is claimed that the name means "son of encouragement". As an English name, it came into occasional use after the 12th century.

name: BARNEY
meaning: Diminutive of BARNABAS, BERNARD or BARNABY.

name: BARRET
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of BARRETT.

name: BARRETT
meaning: From a surname probably meaning "strife" in Middle English, originally given to a quarrelsome person.

name: BARRFHIONN
meaning: Means "fair hair", derived from Gaelic barr "head" and fionn "white, fair".

name: BARRY
meaning: Anglicized form of BAIRRE. It is also sometimes used as an Anglicized form of BERACH.

name: BART
meaning: Short form of BARTHOLOMEW. This name is borne by a cartoon boy on the television series 'The Simpsons'.

name: BARTEK
meaning: Polish diminutive of BARTŁOMIEJ or BARTOSZ.

name: BARTHOLOMAIOS
meaning: New Testament Greek form of BARTHOLOMEW.

name: BARTHOLOMEUS
meaning: Dutch and Latin form of BARTHOLOMEW.

name: BARTHOLOMEW
meaning: From Βαρθολομαιος(Bartholomaios), which was the Greek form of an Aramaic name meaning "son of TALMAI". In the New Testament Bartholomew is the byname of an apostle, possibly the same person as the apostle Nathanael.
