According to tradition he was a missionary to India before returning westward to Armenia, where he was martyred by flaying. Due to the popularity of this saint the name became common in England during the Middle Ages.

name: BARTOLOMEJ
meaning: Slovak and Croatian form of BARTHOLOMEW.

name: BARTOLOMEU
meaning: Portuguese and Galician form of BARTHOLOMEW.

name: BARUCH
meaning: Means "blessed" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a companion of the prophet Jeremiah, acting as his scribe and assistant. The deuterocanonical Book of Baruch was supposedly written by him. A famous bearer was Baruch Spinoza (1632-1677), a Dutch-Jewish rationalist philosopher.

name: BASAJAUN
meaning: Means "lord of the woods" from Basque baso "woods" and jaun "lord". This is the name of a character in Basque folklore, the Old Man of the Woods.

name: BASEMATH
meaning: Means "fragrance" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a wife of Esau.

name: BASEMMATH
meaning: Form of BASEMATH and BASMATH used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: BASIL  (1)
meaning: From the Greek name Βασιλειος(Basileios) which was derived from βασιλευς(basileus) meaning "king". Saint Basil the Great was a 4th-century bishop of Caesarea and one of the fathers of the early Christian church. Due to him, the name (in various spellings) has come into general use in the Christian world, being especially popular among Eastern Christians. It was also borne by two Byzantine emperors.

name: BASILIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of BASIL(1).

name: BASIR
meaning: Means "wise" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition البصير(al-Basir) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: BASMAT
meaning: Hebrew form of BASEMATH and BASMATH.

name: BASMATH
meaning: Variant of BASEMATH. This was the name of a daughter of Solomon in the Old Testament.

name: BAST
meaning: Possibly means "fire, heat" or "ointment jar" in Egyptian. In Egyptian mythology Bast was a goddess of cats, fertility and the sun who was considered a protector of Lower Egypt. She was often depicted with the head of a lioness or a house cat. As her role in the Egyptian pantheon diminished, she was called Bastet.

name: BASTET
meaning: Variant of BAST. This form of the name, a diminutive, was given to her after the similar goddess Sekhmet (protector of Upper Egypt) became more important.

name: BATHSHEBA
meaning: Means "daughter of the oath" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a woman married to Uriah the Hittite. King David seduced her and made her pregnant, so he arranged to have her husband killed in battle and then married her. She was the mother of Solomon.

name: BATRAZ
meaning: Possibly from Turkic bagatur meaning "hero, warrior, brave". This is the name of the leader of the superhuman Narts in Caucasian mythology.

name: BATUL
meaning: Means "virgin" in Arabic. This is an Arabic epithet of the Virgin Mary.

name: BAUDELIO
meaning: From Baudelius, a Latinized form of a possibly Germanic name. Saint Baudelius was a 3rd-century saint and martyr from Orleans.

name: BAUGULF
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements bauga meaning "bend, flex" or "ring" and wulf meaning "wolf".

name: BAXTER
meaning: From an occupational surname which meant "(female) baker" in Old English.

name: BAYARD
meaning: Derived from Old French baiart meaning "bay coloured". In medieval French poetry Bayard was a bay horse owned by Renaud de Montauban and his brothers. The horse could magically adjust its size to carry multiple riders.

name: BAŞAK
meaning: Means "ear of wheat" in Turkish. This is also the Turkish name for the constellation Virgo.

name: BEATA
meaning: Derived from Latin beatus meaning "blessed". This was the name of a few minor saints.

name: BEATHAN
meaning: Derived from Scottish Gaelic beatha meaning "life".

name: BEATRICE
meaning: Italian form of BEATRIX. Beatrice Portinari (1266-1290) was the woman who was loved by the Italian poet Dante Alighieri. She serves as Dante's guide through paradise in his epic poem the 'Divine Comedy' (1321). This is also the name of a character in Shakespeare's comedy 'Much Ado About Nothing' (1599), in which Beatrice and Benedick are fooled into confessing their love for one another.

name: BEATRIX
meaning: Probably from Viatrix, a feminine form of the Late Latin name Viator which meant "voyager, traveller". It was a common name amongst early Christians, and the spelling was altered by association with Latin beatus "blessed, happy". Viatrix or Beatrix was a 4th-century saint who was strangled to death during the persecutions of Diocletian....[more]

name: BEATRIZ
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of BEATRIX.

name: BEATUS
meaning: Masculine form of BEATA. According to legend, Saint Beatus was ordained a priest by Saint Peter and evangelized in Switzerland. Another saint by this name was an 8th-century Asturian theologian.

name: BEAU
meaning: Means "beautiful" in French. It has been occasionally used as an American given name since the late 19th century. It appears in Margaret Mitchell's novel 'Gone with the Wind' (1936) as the name of Ashley and Melanie's son.

name: BEAUMONT
meaning: From a French surname meaning "beautiful mountain".

name: BEAUREGARD
meaning: From a French surname meaning "beautiful outlook".

name: BEAVIS
meaning: Variant of BEVIS. This name was used in the animated television program 'Beavis and Butthead'.

name: BECKETT
meaning: From an English surname which could be derived from various sources, including from Middle English beke meaning "beak" or bekke meaning "stream, brook".

name: BEDE
meaning: Modern form of the Old English name Baeda, possibly related to Old English bed "prayer". Saint Bede, called the Venerable Bede, was an 8th-century historian, scholar and Doctor of the Church.

name: BEDIVERE
meaning: From the Welsh name Bedwyr, which is of unknown meaning. In Arthurian legends Bedivere was one of the original companions of King Arthur. He first appears in early Welsh tales, and his story was later expanded by Geoffrey of Monmouth in the 12th century. He is the one who throws the sword Excalibur into the lake at the request of the dying Arthur.

name: BEE
meaning: Short form of BEATRIX and other names beginning with B.

name: BEELZEBUB
meaning: From Hebrew בַּעַל זְבוּב(Ba'al Zevuv) meaning "lord of flies", intended as a mocking alteration of בּאל זבל(Ba'al Zevul) "Ba'al the exalted", one of the Canaanite names for their god BA'AL. In Milton's 'Paradise Lost' (1667) this is the name of Satan's chief lieutenant.

name: BEHAR
meaning: From the archaic Albanian word behar meaning "summer".

name: BELENUS
meaning: Probably from a Celtic word meaning "bright, brilliant". This was the name of a Gaulish solar god who was often equated with Apollo.

name: BELI
meaning: Probably a Welsh derivative of BELENUS. Beli Mawr was a Welsh ancestor deity who established several royal lines in Wales.

name: BELIAL
meaning: Means "worthless" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this term is used to refer to various wicked people. In the New Testament, Paul uses it as a name for Satan. In later Christian tradition Belial became an evil angel associated with lawlessness and lust.

name: BELINDA
meaning: The meaning of this name is not known for certain. The first element could be related to Italian bella "beautiful". The second element could be Germanic lind meaning "flexible, soft, tender" (and by extension "snake, serpent"). This name first arose in the 17th century, and was subsequently used by Alexander Pope in his poem 'The Rape of the Lock' (1712).

name: BELLA
meaning: Short form of ISABELLA and other names ending in bella. It is also associated with the Italian word bella meaning "beautiful".

name: BELLATRIX
meaning: Means "female warrior" in Latin. This is the name of the star that marks the left shoulder of the constellation Orion.

name: BELLE
meaning: Short form of ISABELLA or names ending in belle. It is also associated with the French word belle meaning "beautiful". A famous bearer was Belle Starr (1848-1889), an outlaw of the American west, whose real given name was Maybelle.

name: BELLONA
meaning: Derived from Latin bellare meaning "to fight". This was the name of the Roman goddess of war, a companion of Mars.

name: BELPHOEBE
meaning: Combination of belle "beautiful" and the name PHOEBE. This name was first used by Edmund Spenser in his poem 'The Faerie Queene' (1590).

name: BELSHATZZAR
meaning: Form of BELSHAZZAR found in the Hebrew Bible.

name: BELSHAZZAR
meaning: From בֵּלְשַׁאצַּר(Belshatzzar), the Hebrew form of the Akkadian name Bel-sarra-usur meaning "BA'AL protect the king". This was the name of the son of Nabonidus, the last king of the Babylonian Empire before it was conquered by the Persians in the 6th century BC. In the Old Testament Book of Daniel Belshazzar is the last king of Babylon who sees the mystical handwriting on the wall, which is interpreted by Daniel to portend the end of the empire.

name: BELÉN
meaning: Spanish form of Bethlehem, the name of the town in Judah where King David and Jesus were born. The town's name is from Hebrew בֵּית־לֶחֶם(Beit-lechem) meaning "house of bread".

name: BEN  (1)
meaning: Short form of BENJAMIN or BENEDICT. A notable bearer was Ben Jonson (1572-1637), an English poet and playwright.

name: BEN  (2)
meaning: Short form of BERNHARD and other Germanic names beginning with the element bern meaning "bear".

name: BENAIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name בְּנָיָהוּ(Benayahu) meaning "YAHWEH has built". This is the name of numerous Old Testament characters.

name: BENAS
meaning: Short form of BENEDIKTAS or BENJAMINAS.

name: BENCE
meaning: Hungarian form of VINCENT. It is also used as a short form of BENEDEK.

name: BENDEGÚZ
meaning: Hungarian variant of the Turkic name Mundzuk, possibly from mončuq meaning "jewel, bead". This was the name of Attila the Hun's father.

name: BENEDICT
meaning: From the Late Latin name Benedictus which meant "blessed". Saint Benedict was an Italian monk who founded the Benedictines in the 6th century. After his time the name was common among Christians, being used by 16 popes. In England it did not come into use until the 12th century, at which point it became very popular. This name was also borne by the American general Benedict Arnold (1741-1801), who defected to Britain during the American Revolution.

name: BENEDICTUS
meaning: Original Latin form of BENEDICT, as well as the modern Dutch form.

name: BENEDIKTE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian feminine form of BENEDICT.

name: BENIAMIN
meaning: Romanian form of BENJAMIN, as well as the form used in the Greek and Latin Bibles.

name: BENIGNO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of the Late Latin name Benignus which meant "kind, friendly" in Latin. This was the name of several saints including a 5th-century disciple of Saint Patrick who later became the chief Bishop of Ireland.

name: BENITO
meaning: Spanish form of BENEDICT. This name was borne by Mexican president Benito Juárez, and also by Benito Mussolini (who was named after Juárez), the fascist dictator of Italy during World War II.

name: BENJAMIN
meaning: From the Hebrew name בִּןְיָמִין(Binyamin) which means "son of the south" or "son of the right hand", from the roots בֵּן(ben) meaning "son" and יָמִין(yamin) meaning "right hand, south". Benjamin in the Old Testament is the twelfth and youngest son of Jacob and the founder of one of the southern tribes of the Hebrews. He was originally named בֶּן־אוֹנִי(Ben-'oni) meaning "son of my sorrow" by his mother Rachel, who died shortly after childbirth, but it was later changed by his father (see Genesis 35:18)....[more]

name: BENJAMÍN
meaning: Spanish, Czech, Slovak and Icelandic form of BENJAMIN.

name: BENNETT
meaning: Medieval form of BENEDICT. This was the more common spelling in England until the 18th century. Modern use of the name is probably also influenced by the common surname Bennett, itself a derivative of the medieval name.

name: BENNO
meaning: Short form of German names containing the element bern "bear".

name: BENSON
meaning: From a surname which originally meant "son of BENEDICT".

name: BENTLEY
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name, itself derived from Old English beonet "bent grass" and leah "woodland, clearing". Various towns in England bear this name.

name: BENTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name, composed of Old English beonet "bent grass" and tun "enclosure".

name: BENVENUTO
meaning: Means "welcome" in Italian. A famous bearer was the Italian Renaissance sculptor and writer Benvenuto Cellini (1500-1571).

name: BEORHTRIC
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements beorht "bright" and ric "power, rule".

name: BEORHTSIGE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements beorht "bright" and sige "victory".

name: BEORNRÆD
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements beorn "warrior, man" and ræd "counsel".

name: BEOWULF
meaning: Possibly means "bee wolf" (in effect equal to "bear") from Old English beo "bee" and wulf "wolf". Alternatively, the first element may be beadu "battle". This is the name of the main character in the anonymous 8th-century epic poem 'Beowulf'. Set in Denmark, the poem tells how he slays the monster Grendel and its mother at the request of King Hroðgar. After this Beowulf becomes the king of the Geats. The conclusion of the poem tells how Beawulf, in his old age, slays a dragon but is himself mortally wounded in the act.

name: BER
meaning: Means "bear" in Yiddish, a vernacular form of Dov.

name: BERACH
meaning: Derived from Gaelic biorach meaning "sharp". This was the name of a 6th-century Irish saint.

name: BERAHTHRABAN
meaning: Old Germanic form of BERTRAM, using an extended form of the second element.

name: BERARD
meaning: Variant of BERNARD using the related root bera "bear" as the first element. This was the name of a 13th-century saint who was martyred in Morocco.

name: BERAT
meaning: Possibly from Turkish berat meaning "letters patent".

name: BERENGAR
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements bern "bear" and ger "spear". This was the name of two medieval kings of Italy and a Holy Roman emperor.

name: BERENGARIA
meaning: Latinized feminine form of BERENGAR. This name was borne by a 13th-century queen of Castile.

name: BERENICE
meaning: Latinized form of Βερενικη(Berenike), the Macedonian form of the Greek name Φερενικη(Pherenike), which meant "bringing victory" from φερω(phero) "to bring" and νικη(nike) "victory". This name was common among the Ptolemy ruling family of Egypt, a dynasty which was originally from Macedon. It occurs briefly in Acts in the New Testament (in most English Bibles it is spelled Bernice) belonging to a sister of King Herod Agrippa II. As an English name, Berenice came into use after the Protestant Reformation.

name: BERGLJOT
meaning: From the Old Norse name Bergljót, which was composed of the elements berg "protection, help" and ljótr "light".

name: BERGLJÓT
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of BERGLJOT.

name: BERISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements birati "to take, to gather" (in an inflected form) and slava "glory".

name: BERLIN
meaning: From the name of the city in Germany, which is of uncertain meaning.

name: BERNADETTE
meaning: French feminine form of BERNARD. Saint Bernadette was a young woman from Lourdes in France who claimed to have seen visions of the Virgin Mary.

name: BERNARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element bern "bear" combined with hard "brave, hardy". The Normans brought it to England, where it replaced the Old English cognate Beornheard. This was the name of several saints, including Saint Bernard of Menthon who built hospices in the Swiss Alps in the 10th century, and Saint Bernard of Clairvaux, a 12th-century theologian and Doctor of the Church. Other famous bearers include the Irish playwright and essayist George Bernard Shaw (1856-1950) and the British World War II field marshal Bernard Montgomery (1887-1976).

name: BERNARDO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of BERNARD.

name: BERNHARD
meaning: German, Dutch and Scandinavian form of BERNARD.

name: BERNICE
meaning: Contracted form of BERENICE. It occurs briefly in Acts in the New Testament belonging to a sister of King Herod Agrippa II.

name: BERNIE
meaning: Diminutive of BERNARD, BERNADETTE, BERNICE, and other names beginning with Bern.

name: BERRY  (2)
meaning: From the English word referring to the small fruit. It is ultimately derived from Old English berie. This name has only been in use since the 20th century.

name: BERT
meaning: Short form of ALBERT and other names containing the element bert, often derived from the Germanic element beraht meaning "bright".

name: BERTHA
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element beraht meaning "bright, famous". It was borne by the mother of Charlemagne in the 8th century, and it was popularized in England by the Normans. It died out as an English name after the Middle Ages, but was revived in the 19th century. The name also appears in southern Germanic legends (often spelled Perchta or Berchta) belonging to a goddess of animals and weaving.

name: BERTHOLD
meaning: Means "bright ruler" from the Germanic element beraht "bright" combined with wald "rule".

name: BERTIE
meaning: Diminutive of ALBERT, HERBERT, and other names containing bert (often derived from the Germanic element beraht meaning "bright").

name: BERTIL
meaning: Scandinavian form of BERTILO or BERTHOLD.

name: BERTILO
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element beraht meaning "bright, famous".

name: BERTO
meaning: Short form of ROBERTO, ALBERTO, and other names containing bert (often derived from the Germanic element beraht meaning "bright").

name: BERTRAM
meaning: Means "bright raven", derived from the Germanic element beraht "bright" combined with hramn "raven". The Normans introduced this name to England. Shakespeare used it in his play 'All's Well That Ends Well' (1603).

name: BERTRAND
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements beraht meaning "bright" and rand meaning "rim (of a shield)". From an early date it has been confused with BERTRAM and the two names have merged to some degree. A famous bearer was English philosopher Bertrand Russell (1872-1970).

name: BERTÓK
meaning: Hungarian diminutive of BERTALAN and other names beginning with Bert.

name: BERWYN
meaning: Means "white head" from the Welsh elements barr "head" and wyn "white".

name: BERYL
meaning: From the English word for the clear or pale green precious stone, ultimately deriving from Sanskrit. As a given name, it first came into use in the 19th century.

name: BESSARION
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly from Greek βησσα(bessa) "wooded valley". This was the name of a 5th-century Egyptian hermit who was a disciple of Saint Anthony the Great. It was later adopted by the scholar Basilios Bessarion (1403-1472), a Greek born in Byzantine Anatolia who became a Roman Catholic bishop.

name: BET
meaning: Frisian and Limburgish short form of ELISABETH.

name: BETELGEUSE
meaning: The name of the star that marks the right shoulder of the constellation Orion. It is derived from Arabic يد الجوزا(yad al-Jawza) meaning "the hand of Jawza". جوزا(Jawza) meaning "central one" was the old Arabic name for the constellation Orion (also for Gemini).

name: BETH
meaning: Short form of ELIZABETH, or sometimes BETHANY.

name: BETHANY
meaning: From the name of a biblical town, Βηθανια(Bethania) in Greek, which is probably of Aramaic or Hebrew origin, possibly meaning "house of affliction" or "house of figs". In the New Testament the town of Bethany is the home of Lazarus and his sisters Mary and Martha. It has been in use as a rare given name in the English-speaking world since the 19th century, used primarily by Catholics in honour of Mary of Bethany. In America it became moderately common after the 1950s.

name: BETHEL
meaning: From an Old Testament place name meaning "house of God" in Hebrew. This was a town north of Jerusalem, where Jacob saw his vision of the stairway. It is occasionally used as a given name.

name: BETHUEL
meaning: Possibly means "God destroys" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the father of Rebecca.

name: BETJE
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish diminutive of ELISABETH.

name: BETONY
meaning: From the name of the minty medicinal herb.

name: BETTE
meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH. A famous bearer was American actress Bette Davis (1908-1989).

name: BEULAH
meaning: Means "married" in Hebrew. The name is used in the Old Testament to refer to the land of Israel (Isaiah 62:4). As an English given name, Beulah has been used since the Protestant Reformation.

name: BEVAN
meaning: From a Welsh surname which was derived from ap Evan meaning "son of EVAN".

name: BEVERLY
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from the name of an English city, itself meaning "beaver stream" in Old English. It came into use as a masculine given name in the 19th century, and it became common as an American feminine name after the publication of George Barr McCutcheon's novel 'Beverly of Graustark' (1904).

name: BEVIS
meaning: From an English surname which is possibly derived from the name of the French town Beauvais.

name: BEÁTA
meaning: Hungarian, Czech and Slovak form of BEATA.

name: BHARATA
meaning: Means "being maintained" in Sanskrit. This is one of the names of Agni, the Hindu god of fire, and is also the name of the brother of Rama in the Hindu epic the 'Ramayana'. It was also borne by a legendary king, the son of Dushyanta and Shakuntala. The official name of the country of India, Bharat, derives from him.

name: BHASKARA
meaning: Means "shining", derived from a combination of Sanskrit भास(bhasa) meaning "light" and कर(kara) meaning "maker". This is another name of the sun and the Hindu god Shiva. It was additionally borne by a 12th-century Indian astronomer, also known as Bhaskaracharya.

name: BHIMA
meaning: Means "terrible, formidable" in Sanskrit. In the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' this is the name of the second son of Pandu, and thus one of the five Pandavas. He was known for his terrific strength and skill as a warrior.

name: BHUMI
meaning: Means "earth, soil" in Sanskrit. This is the name of a Hindu earth goddess. She is the wife of Varaha, an avatar of Vishnu.

name: BIANCA
meaning: Italian cognate of BLANCHE. Shakespeare used characters named Bianca in 'Taming of the Shrew' (1593) and 'Othello' (1603).

name: BIANKA
meaning: German, Hungarian and Polish form of BIANCA.

name: BIBEK
meaning: Nepali and Bengali form of VIVEK.

name: BIBIANA
meaning: Possibly an early variant of VIVIANA. Alternatively, it may be a feminine derivative of the earlier Roman cognomen VIBIANUS.

name: BIDZINA
meaning: Possibly from Georgian ბიძა(bidza) meaning "uncle". This was the name of a 17th-century Georgian saint and martyr.

name: BIFF
meaning: From a nickname which was based on the English word biff, which means "punch, hit, strike".

name: BILAL
meaning: Means "wetting, moistening" in Arabic. This was the name of a companion of the Prophet Muhammad.

name: BILBO
meaning: This was the name of the hero of 'The Hobbit' (1937) by J. R. R. Tolkien. His real hobbit name was Bilba, which is of unknown meaning, but this was altered by Tolkien in order to use the more masculine o ending. In the novel Bilbo Baggins was recruited by the wizard Gandalf to join the quest to retake Mount Erebor from the dragon Smaug.

name: BILE
meaning: Possibly an Irish form of BELENUS, though it may derive from an Irish word meaning "hero". In Irish mythology this was the name of one of the Milesians who was drowned while invading Ireland.

name: BILHA
meaning: German, French, Spanish and Dutch form of BILHAH.

name: BILHAH
meaning: Means "bashful" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the handmaid given to Jacob by his wife Rachel. By him she was the mother of Dan and Naphtali.

name: BILJANA
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly derived from the South Slavic word биље(bilje) meaning "herb".

name: BILL
meaning: Short form of WILLIAM. This spelling was first used in the 19th century. The change in the initial consonant may have been influenced by an earlier Irish pronunciation of the name. Famous bearers include basketball player Bill Russell (1934-), comedian Bill Cosby (1937-), American president Bill Clinton (1946-), and Microsoft founder Bill Gates (1955-).

name: BILLIE
meaning: Diminutive of BILL. It is also used as a feminine form of WILLIAM.

name: BILLY
meaning: Diminutive of BILL. A notable bearer was the American outlaw Billy the Kid (1859-1881), whose real name was William H. Bonney.

name: BINYAMIN
meaning: Hebrew and Arabic form of BENJAMIN.

name: BION
meaning: Ancient Greek name derived from βιος(bios) meaning "life".

name: BIRGER
meaning: From the Old Norse name Birgir, probably derived from bjarga meaning "help, save, rescue".

name: BIRGIR
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of BIRGER.

name: BIRGITTA
meaning: Most likely a Scandinavian form of BRIDGET via the Latinized form Brigitta. Alternatively it could be a feminine derivative of BIRGER. This is the name of the patron saint of Europe, Birgitta of Sweden, the 14th-century founder of the Bridgettine nuns. Her father's name was Birger.

name: BIRUTĖ
meaning: Possibly from Lithuanian birti meaning "to scatter, to pour out" combined with a diminutive suffix. This name was borne by the mother of the 15th-century Grand Duke Vytautas of Lithuania.

name: BISERA
meaning: Derived from the South Slavic word бисер(biser) "pearl" (ultimately of Arabic origin).

name: BISERKA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of BISERA.

name: BISHAL
meaning: Nepali and Bengali form of VISHAL.

name: BISHOP
meaning: Either from the English occupational surname, or else directly from the English word. It is ultimately derived from Greek επισκοπος(episkopos) "overseer".

name: BISTRA
meaning: Means "clean, pure" in Bulgarian and Macedonian.

name: BITHIAH
meaning: Means "daughter of YAHWEH" in Hebrew, from the roots בַּת(bat) meaning "daughter" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. In the Old Testament this is the name of a daughter of Pharaoh. She is traditionally equated with the pharaoh's daughter who drew Moses from the Nile.

name: BJARNI
meaning: Old Norse diminutive of BJÖRN and other names containing the element björn meaning "bear".

name: BJARTE
meaning: From the Old Norse byname Bjartr, which meant "bright".

name: BJÖRG
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of BJØRG.

name: BJÖRN
meaning: From an Old Norse byname meaning "bear".

name: BJØRG
meaning: Derived from Old Norse björg meaning "help, save, rescue".

name: BJØRN
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of BJÖRN.

name: BLAGICA
meaning: Derived from South Slavic благ(blag) meaning "sweet, pleasant, blessed".

name: BLAGOJE
meaning: Serbian and Croatian form of BLAGOY.

name: BLAGOY
meaning: Derived from South Slavic благ(blag) meaning "sweet, pleasant, blessed".

name: BLAGUN
meaning: Derived from South Slavic благ(blag) meaning "sweet, pleasant, blessed".

name: BLAINE
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from the given name Bláán, which meant "yellow" in Gaelic. Saint Bláán was a 6th-century missionary to the Picts.

name: BLAIR
meaning: From a Scottish surname which is derived from Gaelic blár meaning "plain, field, battlefield".

name: BLAISE
meaning: From the Roman name Blasius which meant "lisping" from Latin blaesus. A famous bearer was the French mathematician and philosopher Blaise Pascal (1623-1662).

name: BLAKE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from Old English blæc "black" or blac "pale". A famous bearer of the surname was the poet and artist William Blake (1757-1827).

name: BLANCA
meaning: Spanish and Catalan cognate of BLANCHE.

name: BLANCHARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements blanc meaning "white" and hard meaning "brave, hardy".

name: BLANCHE
meaning: From a medieval French nickname meaning "white, fair". This name and its cognates in other languages are ultimately derived from the Germanic word blanc. An early bearer was the 12th-century Blanca of Navarre, the wife of Sancho III of Castile. Her granddaughter of the same name married Louis VIII of France, with the result that the name became more common in France.

name: BLANDINE
meaning: French form of the Roman name Blandina, which was the feminine form of Blandinus, which was itself a derivative of the cognomen BLANDUS. Saint Blandina was a 2nd-century slave from Lyons who was martyred by being thrown to wild beasts.

name: BLANDINUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was a derivative of BLANDUS.

name: BLANDUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which meant "charming" in Latin.

name: BLAZE
meaning: Modern variant of BLAISE influenced by the English word blaze.

name: BLAZH
meaning: Medieval Slavic name derived from the Slavic element blagu meaning "sweet, pleasant, blessed".

name: BLAZHE
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element blagu meaning "sweet, pleasant, blessed".

name: BLAŽ
meaning: Slovene and Croatian form of BLAISE. It may also be derived from the Slavic element blagu meaning "sweet, pleasant, blessed".

name: BLAŽEJ
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of BLAISE.

name: BLEDA
meaning: Possibly from a Turkic root meaning "wise". According to other theories the name was of Gothic origin, or was a Gothicized form of a Hunnic name. This was the name of the brother of Attila.

name: BLEDDYN
meaning: From Welsh blaidd "wolf" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of an 11th-century king of Gwynedd and Powys.

name: BLODEUWEDD
meaning: Means "face of flowers" in Welsh. In a story in the Mabinogion, she is created out of flowers by Gwydion to be the wife of his nephew Lleu Llaw Gyffes. She is eventually changed into an owl for her infidelity.

name: BLODWEN
meaning: Means "white flowers" from Welsh blodau "flowers" combined with gwen "white, fair, blessed".

name: BLONDIE
meaning: From a nickname for a person with blond hair. This is the name of the title character in a comic strip by Chic Young.

name: BLOSSOM
meaning: From the English word blossom, ultimately from Old English blóstm. It came into use as a rare given name in the 19th century.

name: BLYTHE
meaning: From a surname which meant "cheerful" in Old English.

name: BLÁITHÍN
meaning: Variant of BLÁTHNAT using a different diminutive suffix.

name: BLÁTHNAT
meaning: Means "little flower" from the Irish word blath "flower" combined with a diminutive suffix. In Irish legend she was a maiden abducted and married by Cú Roí. She was rescued by Cúchulainn, who killed her husband, but she was in turn murdered by one of Cú Roí's loyal servants.

name: BO  (1)
meaning: From the Old Norse byname Búi which was derived from Old Norse bua meaning "to live".

name: BO  (2)
meaning: From Chinese 波(bō) meaning "wave", as well as other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: BOAZ
meaning: Means "swiftness" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the man who marries Ruth.

name: BOB
meaning: Short form of ROBERT. It arose later than Dob, Hob and Nob, which were medieval rhyming nicknames of Robert. It was borne by the character Bob Cratchit in Charles Dickens' novel 'A Christmas Carol' (1843). Other famous bearers include American folk musician Bob Dylan (1941-) and Jamaican reggae musician Bob Marley (1945-1981).

name: BOBBIE
meaning: Variant of BOBBY. As a feminine name it can be a diminutive of ROBERTA or BARBARA.

name: BOBBY
meaning: Diminutive of BOB. Hockey greats Bobby Hull (1939-) and Bobby Orr (1948-) have borne this name.

name: BODE
meaning: From the Germanic element bodo meaning "command, order".

name: BODIL
meaning: From the Old Norse name Bóthildr, derived from bót "remedy" and hildr "battle".

name: BOELE
meaning: Possibly a Dutch form of BALDO.

name: BOGDAN
meaning: Means "given by God" from the Slavic elements bogu "god" and dan "given".

name: BOGLÁRKA
meaning: Means "buttercup" in Hungarian, derived from the archaic word boglár meaning "ornament".

name: BOGOMIL
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of BOGUMIŁ.

name: BOGUMIŁ
meaning: Means "favoured by God" from the Slavic elements bogu "god" and milu "gracious, dear".

name: BOGUSŁAW
meaning: Means "glory of God" from the Slavic elements bogu "god" and slava "glory". This name was borne by several dukes of Pomerania, beginning in the 12th century.

name: BOHDAN
meaning: Czech and Ukrainian form of BOGDAN.

name: BOHUMIL
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of BOGUMIŁ.

name: BOHUMÍR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element bogu "god" combined with meru "great, famous" or miru "peace, world".

name: BOHUSLAV
meaning: Czech, Slovak and Ukrainian form of BOGUSŁAW.

name: BOJAN
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element boji meaning "battle". This was the name of a 9th-century Bulgarian saint.

name: BOLANLE
meaning: Means "finds wealth at home" in Yoruba.

name: BOLAT
meaning: From a Turkic word meaning "steel", ultimately from Persian.

name: BOLESLAV
meaning: Czech and Russian form of BOLESŁAW.

name: BOLESLAVA
meaning: Czech and Russian feminine form of BOLESŁAW.

name: BOLESŁAW
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements bolye "more, greater" and slava "glory". This was the name of kings of Poland, starting in the 11th century with the first Polish king Bolesław the Brave.

name: BOLÍVAR
meaning: From a surname which was taken from the Basque place name Bolibar, which was derived from bolu "mill" and ibar "riverside". A famous bearer of the surname was Simón Bolívar (1783-1830), a South American revolutionary leader, after whom the country of Bolivia is named.

name: BONACCORSO
meaning: From a medieval Italian name derived from bono "good" and accorso "haste, rush, help".

name: BONAVENTURA
meaning: Means "good fortune" in Italian. Saint Bonaventura was a 13th-century Franciscan monk who is considered a Doctor of the Church.

name: BONIFACE
meaning: From the Late Latin name Bonifatius, which meant "good fate" from bonum "good" and fatum "fate". This was the name of nine popes and also several saints, including an 8th-century Anglo-Saxon missionary to Germany (originally named Winfrid) who is now regarded as the patron saint of that country. It came into use in England during the Middle Ages, but became rare after the Protestant Reformation.

name: BONIFACIO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of Bonifatius (see BONIFACE).

name: BONIFÁC
meaning: Czech and Hungarian form of Bonifatius (see BONIFACE).

name: BONITA
meaning: Means "pretty" in Spanish, ultimately from Latin bonus "good". It has been used as a name in the English-speaking world since the beginning of the 20th century.

name: BONITUS
meaning: Derived from a diminutive of Latin bonus meaning "good". This was the name of a 7th-century century saint, a bishop of Auvergne.

name: BONNIE
meaning: Means "pretty" from the Scottish word bonnie, which was itself derived from Middle French bon "good". It has been in use as an American given name since the 19th century, and it became especially popular after the movie 'Gone with the Wind' (1939), in which it was the nickname of Scarlett's daughter.

name: BOOKER
meaning: From an English occupational surname meaning "maker of books". A famous bearer was Booker T. Washington (1856-1915), an African-American leader.

name: BOOS
meaning: Form of BOAZ used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: BOOZ
meaning: Form of BOAZ used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: BOPHA
meaning: Means "flower" in Khmer, ultimately from Pali.

name: BOR
meaning: Short form of names containing bor, such as BORISLAV or BORIS. It is also a South Slavic word meaning "pine tree".

name: BORA  (1)
meaning: Means "storm, squall" in Turkish, ultimately related to Greek Βορεας(Boreas), the name of the god of the north wind.

name: BORGHILD
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements borg "fortification" and hildr "battle". In Norse mythology she was the wife of Sigmund.

name: BORIS
meaning: From the Turkic name Bogoris, perhaps meaning "short" or "wolf" or "snow leopard". It was borne by the 9th-century King Boris I of Bulgaria who converted his country to Christianity, as well as two later Bulgarian emperors. The name was popularized in the Slavic world due to the 11th-century Saint Boris, who was a Russian prince martyred with his brother Gleb. His mother may have been Bulgarian. Another famous bearer was the 16th-century Russian emperor Boris Godunov, later the subject of a play of that name by Aleksandr Pushkin.

name: BORISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element borti "battle" combined with slava "glory".

name: BORISU
meaning: Medieval Slavic form of BORIS, probably ultimately of Turkic origin.

name: BORIVOJ
meaning: Serbian and Croatian form of BOŘIVOJ.

name: BORKO
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element borti meaning "fight, battle".

name: BORNA
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element borti meaning "fight, battle".

name: BORYS
meaning: Polish and Ukrainian form of BORIS.

name: BOUDICCA
meaning: Derived from Brythonic boud meaning "victory". This was the name of a 1st-century queen of the Iceni who led the Britons in revolt against the Romans. Eventually her forces were defeated and she committed suicide.

name: BOYCE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from Old French bois "wood".

name: BOYD
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was possibly derived from the name of the island of Bute.

name: BOYKO
meaning: Originally a diminutive of names containing the Slavic element boji meaning "battle".

name: BOZHIDAR
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of BOŽIDAR.

name: BOŘIVOJ
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements borti "battle" and voji "soldier". This name was borne by a 9th-century duke of Bohemia.

name: BOŽENA
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element bozy meaning "divine".

name: BOŽICA
meaning: Diminutive of BOŽENA. It also means "goddess" in Croatian.

name: BOŽIDAR
meaning: Means "divine gift" from the Slavic elements bozy "divine" and daru "gift".

name: BOŽO
meaning: Originally a diminutive of BOŽIDAR and other names beginning with the Slavic element bozy meaning "divine".

name: BRAAM
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of ABRAHAM.

name: BRAD
meaning: Short form of BRADLEY, BRADFORD, and other names beginning with Brad. A famous bearer is American actor Brad Pitt (1963-).

name: BRADEN
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Bradáin meaning "descendant of BRADÁN".

name: BRADFORD
meaning: From a surname which originally came from a place name that meant "broad ford" in Old English.

name: BRADLEY
meaning: From a surname which originally came from a place name meaning "broad clearing" in Old English. A famous bearer of the surname was the World War II American general Omar Bradley (1893-1981).

name: BRADY
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Brádaigh meaning "descendant of BRÁDACH".

name: BRAELYN
meaning: A recently created name, formed using the popular name suffix lyn.

name: BRAHIM
meaning: North African short form of IBRAHIM.

name: BRAHMA
meaning: Means "growth, expansion, creation" in Sanskrit. The Hindu god Brahma is the creator and director of the universe, the balance between the opposing forces of Vishnu and Shiva. He is often depicted with four heads and four arms.

name: BRAITH
meaning: Meaning uncertain, perhaps from Welsh brith, braith meaning "speckled".

name: BRAM
meaning: Short form of ABRAHAM. This name was borne by Bram Stoker (1847-1912), the Irish author who wrote 'Dracula'.

name: BRAN  (1)
meaning: Means "raven" in Irish. In Irish legend Bran was a mariner who was involved in several adventures.

name: BRAN  (2)
meaning: Means "raven" in Welsh. In Welsh legend Bran the Blessed (called also Bendigeid Vran) was the son of the god Llyr. Later Welsh legends describe him as a king of Britain who was killed attacking Ireland.

name: BRANCA
meaning: Portuguese and Galician form of BLANCHE.

name: BRAND
meaning: From a surname, a variant of BRANT.

name: BRANDA
meaning: Perhaps a variant of BRANDY or a feminine form of BRAND.

name: BRANDO
meaning: Germanic name derived from the element brand meaning "sword".

name: BRANDON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "hill covered with broom" in Old English. It is sometimes also used as a variant of BRENDAN.

name: BRANDT
meaning: From a surname, a variant of BRANT.

name: BRANDY
meaning: From the English word brandy for the alcoholic drink. It is ultimately from Dutch brandewijn "burnt wine". It has been in use as a given name since the 1960s.

name: BRANIMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element borna "protection" combined with miru meaning "peace, world".

name: BRANISLAVA
meaning: Serbian, Slovak, Czech and Slovene feminine form of BRONISŁAW.

name: BRANNON
meaning: From an Irish surname derived from Mac Branain, which means "descendant of BRAN(1)".

name: BRANSON
meaning: From an English surname which meant "son of BRANDR".

name: BRANT
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the Old Norse name BRANDR.

name: BRANTLEY
meaning: From a surname, an Americanized form of the German surname Brändle, ultimately from Old High German brant "fire".

name: BRANWEN
meaning: Means "beautiful raven" from Welsh bran "raven" and gwen "fair, white, blessed". In the Mabinogion, a collection of tales from Welsh myth, she is the sister of the British king Bran and the wife of the Irish king Matholwch.

name: BRATISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements bratu "brother" and slava "glory".

name: BRATISLAVA
meaning: Feminine form of BRATISLAV. This is the name of the capital city of Slovakia, though it is unrelated.

name: BRATUMIŁ
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements bratu "brother" and milu "gracious, dear".

name: BRAXTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from an Old English place name meaning "Bracca's town".

name: BRAYLON
meaning: An invented name, using the same sounds found in names such as Braden and Jalen.

name: BRECHT
meaning: Short form of names containing brecht, often derived from the Germanic element beraht meaning "bright".

name: BREDA  (2)
meaning: Meaning unknown. It was used by the Slovene author Ivan Pregelj for the title character in his novel 'Mlada Breda' (1913).

name: BRENDA
meaning: Possibly a feminine form of the Old Norse name Brandr, meaning "sword", which was brought to Britain in the Middle Ages. This name is sometimes used as a feminine form of BRENDAN.

name: BRENDAN
meaning: From Brendanus, the Latinized form of the Irish name Bréanainn which was derived from a Welsh word meaning "prince". Saint Brendan was a 6th-century Irish abbot who, according to legend, crossed the Atlantic and reached North America with 17 other monks.

name: BRENNA
meaning: Possibly a variant of BRENDA or a feminine form of BRENNAN.

name: BRENNAN
meaning: From an Irish surname derived from Ó Braonáin meaning "descendant of Braonán". Braonán is a byname meaning "rain, moisture, drop" (with a diminutive suffix).

name: BRENNUS
meaning: Latinized form of a Celtic name (or title) that possibly meant either "king, prince" or "raven". Brennus was a Gallic leader of the 4th century BC who attacked and sacked Rome.

name: BRENT
meaning: From an English surname, originally taken from various place names, perhaps derived from a Celtic word meaning "hill".

name: BRENTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from an English place name which meant "Bryni's town". Bryni was Old English name meaning "fire".

name: BRETT
meaning: From a Middle English surname meaning "a Breton", referring to an inhabitant of Brittany. A famous bearer is the American football quarterback Brett Favre (1969-).

name: BRIALLEN
meaning: Derived from Welsh briallu meaning "primrose". This is a modern Welsh name.

name: BRIAN
meaning: The meaning of this name is not known for certain but it is possibly related to the old Celtic element bre meaning "hill", or by extension "high, noble". It was borne by the semi-legendary Irish king Brian Boru, who thwarted Viking attempts to conquer Ireland in the 11th century. He was slain in the Battle of Clontarf, though his forces were decisively victorious. The name was common in Ireland before his time, and even more so afterwards. It came into use in England in the Middle Ages, introduced by Breton settlers. It subsequently became rare, but was revived in the 20th century.

name: BRIANA
meaning: Feminine form of BRIAN. This name was used by Edmund Spenser in 'The Faerie Queene' (1590). The name was not commonly used until the 1970s, when it rapidly became popular in the United States.

name: BRIAR
meaning: From the English word for the thorny plant.

name: BRICE
meaning: From the name Bricius, which was probably a Latinized form of a Gaulish name meaning "speckled". This was the name of a 5th-century saint, a disciple of Saint Martin of Tours.

name: BRICIUS
meaning: Latin form of BRICE, probably ultimately of Gaulish origin.

name: BRIDGER
meaning: From an English surname which originally indicated a person who lived near or worked on a bridge.

name: BRIDGET
meaning: Anglicized form of the Irish name Brighid which means "exalted one". In Irish mythology this was the name of the goddess of fire, poetry and wisdom, the daughter of the god Dagda. In the 5th century it was borne by Saint Brigid, the founder of a monastery at Kildare and a patron saint of Ireland. Because of the saint, the name was considered sacred in Ireland, and it did not come into general use there until the 17th century. In the form Birgitta this name has been common in Scandinavia, made popular by the 14th-century Saint Birgitta of Sweden, patron saint of Europe.

name: BRIELLE
meaning: Short form of GABRIELLE. This is also the name of towns in the Netherlands and New Jersey, though their names derive from a different source.

name: BRIGHAM
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from place names meaning "bridge settlement" in Old English.

name: BRIGITA
meaning: Slovene, Croatian and Latvian form of BRIDGET.

name: BRIGITTA
meaning: German, Dutch and Hungarian form of BRIDGET.

name: BRIGITTE
meaning: German and French form of BRIDGET.

name: BRIJESHA
meaning: Means "ruler of Brij" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu god Krishna, Brij being a region associated with him.

name: BRISCOE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "birch wood" in Old Norse.

name: BRISEIDA
meaning: Form of BRISEIS used in medieval tales about the Trojan War.

name: BRISEIS
meaning: Patronymic derived from Βρισευς(Briseus), a Greek name of unknown meaning. In Greek mythology Briseis (real name Hippodameia) was the daughter of Briseus. She was captured during the Trojan War by Achilles. After Agamemnon took her away from him, Achilles refused to fight in the war.

name: BRISTOL
meaning: From the name of the city in southwest England which means "the site of the bridge".

name: BRITANNIA
meaning: From the Latin name of the island of Britain, in occasional use as an English given name since the 18th century. This is also the name of the Roman female personification of Britain pictured on some British coins.

name: BRITTANY
meaning: From the name of the region in the northwest of France, called in French Bretagne. It was named for the Britons who settled there after the fall of the Western Roman Empire and the invasions of the Anglo-Saxons. As a given name, it first came into common use in America in the 1970s.

name: BRITTON
meaning: Derived from a Middle English surname meaning "a Briton" (a Celt of England) or "a Breton" (an inhabitant of Brittany).

name: BROCK
meaning: From a surname which was derived from Old English brocc meaning "badger".

name: BRODY
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place in Moray, Scotland. It probably means "ditch, mire" in Gaelic.

name: BROGAN
meaning: Derived from Gaelic bróg "shoe" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of several Irish saints, including Saint Patrick's scribe.

name: BRONISLAV
meaning: Czech and Russian form of BRONISŁAW.

name: BRONISLAVA
meaning: Czech, Slovak and Russian feminine form of BRONISŁAW.

name: BRONISŁAW
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements borna "protection" and slava "glory". A famous Polish anthropologist, Bronisław Malinowski (1884-1942), has borne this name.

name: BRONTE
meaning: From a surname, an Anglicized form of Irish Ó Proinntigh meaning "descendant of Proinnteach". The given name Proinnteach meant "bestower" in Gaelic. The Brontë sisters - Charlotte, Emily, and Anne - were 19th-century English novelists. Their father changed the spelling of the family surname from Brunty to Brontë, possibly to make it coincide with Greek βροντη meaning "thunder".

name: BRONTES
meaning: Means "thunderer" in Greek. In Greek mythology (according to Hesiod), this was the name of one of the three Cyclopes, who were the sons of Uranus and Gaia.

name: BRONWEN
meaning: Derived from the Welsh elements bron "breast" and gwen "white, fair, blessed".

name: BROOK
meaning: From an English surname which denoted one who lived near a brook.

name: BROOKE
meaning: Variant of BROOK. The name came into use in the 1950s, probably influenced by American socialite Brooke Astor (1902-2007). It was further popularized by actress Brooke Shields (1965-).

name: BROOKLYN
meaning: From the name of the borough of New York City, originally derived from Dutch Breukelen meaning "broken land". It can also be viewed as a combination of BROOK and the popular name suffix lyn.

name: BROOKS
meaning: From an English surname, a variant of BROOK.

name: BROOS
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of AMBROOS.

name: BRUCE
meaning: From a Scottish surname, of Norman origin, which probably originally referred to the town of Brix in France. The surname was borne by Robert the Bruce, a Scottish hero of the 14th century who achieved independence from England and became the king of Scotland. It has been in use as a given name in the English-speaking world since the 19th century. A notable bearer is the American musician Bruce Springsteen (1949-).

name: BRUNHILDA
meaning: Variant of BRÜNHILD, referring to the Frankish queen.

name: BRUNILDA
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Portuguese form of BRÜNHILD.

name: BRUNO
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element brun "armour, protection" or brun "brown". Saint Bruno of Cologne was a German monk of the 11th century who founded the Carthusian Order. The surname has belonged Giordano Bruno, a philosopher burned at the stake by the Inquisition.

name: BRUTUS
meaning: Roman cognomen meaning "heavy" in Latin. Famous bearers include Lucius Junius Brutus, the traditional founder of the Roman Republic, and Marcus Junius Brutus, the statesman who conspired to assassinated Julius Caesar.

name: BRYANT
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name BRIAN.

name: BRYN
meaning: Means "hill, mound" in Welsh. It is now used as a feminine name as well.

name: BRYNHILDR
meaning: Old Norse cognate of BRÜNHILD. In the Norse legend the 'Volsungasaga' Brynhildr was rescued by the hero Sigurd in the guise of Gunnar. Brynhildr and Gunnar were married, but when Sigurd's wife Gudrun let slip that it was in fact Sigurd who had rescued her, Brynhildr plotted against him. She accused Sigurd of taking her virginity, spurring Gunnar to arrange Sigurd's murder.

name: BRYNJAR
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements bryn "armour" and arr "warrior".

name: BRYNLEE
meaning: Combination of BRYN and the popular name suffix lee.

name: BRYNMOR
meaning: From a Welsh place name meaning "great hill".

name: BRYONY
meaning: From the name of a type of Eurasian vine, formerly used as medicine. It ultimately derives from Greek βρυω(bryo) "to swell".

name: BRYSON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of BRICE".

name: BRÁDACH
meaning: Possibly derived from a Gaelic word meaning "large-chested".

name: BRÍGH
meaning: Derived from Irish brígh meaning "power, high".

name: BRÍGIDA
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of BRIDGET.

name: BRÓNACH
meaning: Derived from Irish Gaelic brón meaning "sorrow". Saint Brónach was a 6th-century mystic from Ireland.

name: BRÜNHILD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements brun "armour, protection" and hild "battle". It is cognate with the Old Norse name Brynhildr (from the elements bryn and hildr). In Norse legend Brynhildr was the queen of the Valkyries who was rescued by the hero Sigurd. In the Germanic saga the 'Nibelungenlied' she was a queen of Iceland and the wife of Günther. Both of these characters were probably inspired by the eventful life of the 6th-century Frankish queen Brunhilda (of Visigothic birth).

name: BUANA
meaning: Means "the world" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit भुवन(bhuvana).

name: BUCK
meaning: From an English nickname meaning simply "buck, male deer", ultimately from Old English bucc.

name: BUDDHA
meaning: Means "enlightened" in Sanskrit. This is a title applied to Siddhartha Gautama, the founder of Buddhism, as well as to a handful of other enlightened individuals.

name: BUDDY
meaning: From the English word meaning "friend". It probably originated as a nursery form of the word brother.

name: BUDI
meaning: Means "reason, mind, character" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit बुद्धि(buddhi) meaning "intellect" (related to Buddha).

name: BUFFY
meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH, from a child's pronunciation of the final syllable. It is now associated with the main character from the television series 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer' (1997-2003).

name: BUHLE
meaning: From Xhosa and Ndebele buhle "beautiful, handsome", from the root hle.

name: BURAK
meaning: From Arabic براق(Buraq), the name of the legendary creature that, according to Islamic tradition, transported the Prophet Muhammad. Its name is derived from Arabic برق(barq) "lightning".

name: BURGUNDY
meaning: This name can refer either to the region in France, the wine (which derives from the name of the region), or the colour (which derives from the name of the wine).

name: BURIM
meaning: Means "spring, well, water source" in Albanian.

name: BURKE
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Old English burg meaning "fortress".

name: BURKHARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements burg meaning "protection" and hard "brave, hardy". Saint Burkhard was a bishop who founded several monasteries in Germany in the 8th century.

name: BURTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from an Old English place name meaning "fortified town". A famous bearer of the surname was Sir Richard Burton (1821-1890), an explorer of Africa and Asia.

name: BUSTER
meaning: Originally a nickname denoting a person who broke things, from the word bust. A famous bearer was the silent movie star Buster Keaton (1895-1966).

name: BUZ
meaning: Means "contempt" in Hebrew. This is the name of a son of ABRAHAM's brother Nahor in the Old Testament.

name: BYELOBOG
meaning: Means "the white god" from Slavic byelo "white" and bogu "god". This was the name of the Slavic god of the sun, happiness and fortune.

name: BYEONG-HO
meaning: From Sino-Korean 炳(byeong) meaning "bright, luminous, glorious" combined with 浩(ho) meaning "great, numerous, vast" or 昊(ho) meaning "summer, sky, heaven". Other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: BYRNE
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Broin meaning "descendant of BRAN(1)".

name: BYRON
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "place of the cow sheds" in Old English. This was the surname of the romantic poet Lord Byron (1788-1824), the writer of 'Don Juan' and many other works.

name: BYSSHE
meaning: From an English surname, a variant of the surname Bush, which originally indicated a person who lived near a bush. This was the middle name of the romantic poet Percy Bysshe Shelley (1792-1822).

name: BÁRBARA
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of BARBARA.

name: BÅRD
meaning: Norwegian form of the Old Norse name Bárðr, which was derived from the elements baðu "battle" and friðr "peace".

name: BÉBINN
meaning: Means "fair lady" in Irish Gaelic. This name was borne by several characters in Irish mythology, including a goddess of childbirth.

name: BÉLA
meaning: The meaning of this name is not known for certain. It could be derived from Hungarian bél meaning "guts, bowel" or Slavic бѣлъ(belu) meaning "white". This was the name of four Hungarian kings.

name: BÌNH
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 平(bình) meaning "level, even, peaceful".

name: BĚLA
meaning: Derived from the old Slavic word белъ(belu) meaning "white".

name: CADE
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a nickname meaning "round" in Old English.

name: CADELL
meaning: From Welsh cad "battle" and a diminutive suffix.

name: CADEN
meaning: Sometimes explained as a derivative of the Irish surname Caden, which is a reduced form of the Gaelic surname Mac Cadáin meaning "son of Cadán". In actuality, its popularity in America beginning in the 1990s is due to its sound - it shares its fashionable aden suffix sound with other popular names like Hayden, Aidan and Braden.

name: CADENCE
meaning: From an English word meaning "rhythm, flow". It has been in use only since the 20th century.

name: CADEYRN
meaning: Means "battle king" from Welsh cad "battle" and teyrn "king, monarch". Cadeyrn (also known as Catigern) was a 5th-century king of Powys in Wales, the son of Vortigern.

name: CADFAEL
meaning: Means "battle prince" from Welsh cad "battle" and mael "prince".

name: CADFAN
meaning: Means "battle peak" from Welsh cad "battle" and ban "peak". Saint Cadfan, from Brittany, was a 6th-century missionary to Wales.

name: CADMUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Καδμος(Kadmos), of uncertain meaning. In Greek mythology Cadmus was the son of the Phoenician king Agenor. He was sent by his father to rescue his sister Europa, who had been abducted by Zeus, although he did not succeed in retrieving her. According to legend, Cadmus founded the city of Thebes and introduced the alphabet to Greece.

name: CADOC
meaning: Derived from Welsh cad "battle". This was the name of a 6th-century Welsh saint who was martyred by the Saxons.

name: CADWALADER
meaning: Means "leader of the battle" from Welsh cad "battle" and gwaladr "leader". This was the name of a Welsh saint of the 7th century.

name: CADWGAN
meaning: Means "glory in battle" from Welsh cad "battle" and gwogawn "glory, honour". In the Mabinogion, a collection of tales from Welsh myth, this name is briefly mentioned as the son of Iddon.

name: CAECILIA
meaning: German form of CECILIA, as well as the original Latin form.

name: CAEDMON
meaning: Meaning unknown, though the first element is likely connected to Brythonic caed meaning "battle". Saint Caedmon was a 7th-century Anglo-Saxon poet who supposedly received his poetic inspiration from a dream. Our only knowledge of him is through the historian Bede.

name: CAELAN
meaning: Anglicized form of CAOLÁN or CAOILFHIONN.

name: CAELESTINUS
meaning: Late Latin name, a derivative of CAELESTIS. This name was borne by five popes (usually spelled Celestine in English).

name: CAELESTIS
meaning: Late Latin name which meant "of the sky, heavenly".

name: CAELINUS
meaning: Roman family name which was itself derived from the Roman family name CAELIUS.

name: CAELIUS
meaning: Roman family name which was derived from Latin caelum meaning "heaven".

name: CAERWYN
meaning: Derived from the Welsh elements caer "fortress" and gwyn "white, fair".

name: CAESAR
meaning: From a Roman cognomen which possibly meant "hairy", from Latin caesaries "hair". Julius Caesar and his adopted son Julius Caesar Octavianus (commonly known as Augustus) were both rulers of the Roman Empire in the 1st century BC. Caesar was used as a title by the emperors that came after them.

name: CAESARIUS
meaning: Late Latin name which was derived from CAESAR. Saint Caesarius was a 6th-century bishop of Arles.

name: CAIAPHAS
meaning: Meaning unknown, probably of Aramaic origin. In the New Testament this is the name of the Jewish high priest who condemns Jesus.

name: CAILEAN
meaning: Means "whelp, young dog" in Gaelic. This name is also used as a Scottish form of COLUMBA.

name: CAILIN
meaning: Variant of KAYLYN. It also coincides with the Irish word cailín meaning "girl".

name: CAIN
meaning: Means "acquired" in Hebrew. In Genesis in the Old Testament Cain is the first son of Adam and Eve. He killed his brother Abel after God accepted Abel's offering of meat instead of his offering of plant-based foods. After this Cain was banished to be a wanderer.

name: CAIRO
meaning: From the name of the city in Egypt, called القاهرة(al-Qahirah) in Arabic, meaning "the victorious".

name: CAISIDE
meaning: Old Irish byname meaning "curly haired", from Irish Gaelic cas.

name: CAITLÍN
meaning: Irish form of Cateline, the Old French form of KATHERINE.

name: CALANTHE
meaning: From the name of a type of orchid, ultimately meaning "beautiful flower", derived from Greek καλος(kalos) "beautiful" and ανθος(anthos) "flower".

name: CALEB
meaning: Most likely related to Hebrew כֶּלֶב(kelev) meaning "dog". An alternate theory connects it to Hebrew כָּל(kal) meaning "whole, all of" and לֵב(lev) meaning "heart". In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the twelve spies sent by Moses into Canaan. Of the Israelites who left Egypt with Moses, Caleb and Joshua were the only ones who lived to see the Promised Land....[more]

name: CALIGULA
meaning: Means "little boot" in Latin. This was a nickname for the Roman emperor Gaius Caesar Germanicus given to him in his youth by his father's soldiers.

name: CALISTA
meaning: Feminine form of CALLISTUS. As an English name it might also be a variant of KALLISTO.

name: CALISTO
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of CALLISTUS.

name: CALIXTA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese feminine form of CALIXTUS.

name: CALIXTO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of CALIXTUS.

name: CALIXTUS
meaning: Variant of CALLISTUS, the spelling perhaps influenced by Latin calix "wine cup". This was the name of three popes (also known as Callistus).

name: CALLA
meaning: From the name of a type of lily. Use of the name may also be inspired by Greek καλλος(kallos) meaning "beauty".

name: CALLAHAN
meaning: From a surname, the Anglicized form of the Irish Ó Ceallacháin, which means "descendant of CEALLACHÁN".

name: CALLIE
meaning: Diminutive of CAROLINE, or sometimes of names beginning with Cal.

name: CALLISTO  (2)
meaning: Latinized form of KALLISTO. A moon of Jupiter bears this name.

name: CALLISTUS
meaning: Late Latin name which was derived from the Greek name Καλλιστος(Kallistos) "most beautiful". This was the name of three popes (also known as Callixtus), including the 3rd-century Callistus I who is regarded as a saint.

name: CALLIXTUS
meaning: Variant of CALLISTUS, the spelling perhaps influenced by Latin calix "wine cup". This was the name of three popes (also known as Callistus).

name: CALOGERO
meaning: From the Late Latin name Calogerus which meant "beautiful elder" from Greek καλος(kalos) "beautiful" and γερων(geron) "old man, elder". This was the name of a 5th-century saint, a hermit of Sicily.

name: CALVIN
meaning: Derived from the French surname Cauvin, which was derived from chauve "bald". The surname was borne by Jean Cauvin (1509-1564), a theologian from France who was one of the leaders of the Protestant Reformation. His surname was Latinized as Calvinus (based on Latin calvus "bald") and he is known as John Calvin in English. It has been used as a given name in his honour since the 19th century.

name: CALYPSO
meaning: From Greek Καλυψω(Kalypso) which probably meant "she that conceals", derived from καλυπτω(kalypto) "to cover, to conceal". In Greek myth this was the name of the nymph who fell in love with Odysseus after he was shipwrecked on her island of Ogygia. When he refused to stay with her she detained him for seven years until Zeus ordered her to release him.

name: CAMBRIA
meaning: Latin form of the Welsh Cymru, the Welsh name for the country of Wales, derived from cymry meaning "the people". It is occasionally used as a given name in modern times.

name: CAMBYSES
meaning: From Καμβυσης(Kambyses), the Greek form of the Old Persian name Kambujiya, which is of unknown meaning. Two Persian kings bore this name, including Cambyses II who conquered Egypt.

name: CAMDEN
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name perhaps meaning "enclosed valley" in Old English. A famous bearer of the surname was the English historian William Camden (1551-1623).

name: CAMELIA
meaning: From camelie, the Romanian spelling of camellia (see CAMELLIA).

name: CAMELLIA
meaning: From the name of the flowering shrub, which was named for the botanist and missionary Georg Josef Kamel.

name: CAMERON
meaning: From a Scottish surname meaning "crooked nose" from Gaelic cam "crooked" and sròn "nose".

name: CAMILA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of CAMILLA.

name: CAMILLA
meaning: Feminine form of CAMILLUS. This was the name of a legendary warrior maiden of the Volsci, as told by Virgil in the 'Aeneid'. It was popularized in the English-speaking world by Fanny Burney's novel 'Camilla' (1796).

name: CAMILLE
meaning: French feminine and masculine form of CAMILLA. It is also used in the English-speaking world, where it is generally only feminine.

name: CAMILLUS
meaning: Roman cognomen, which is probably of Etruscan origin and unknown meaning. It is probably not related to Latin camillus "a youth employed in religious services". This name was borne by the 16th-century Italian monk Saint Camillus de Lellis.

name: CAMILO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of CAMILLUS.

name: CAMPBELL
meaning: From a Scottish surname meaning "crooked mouth" from Gaelic cam "crooked" and béul "mouth".

name: CANAAN
meaning: Meaning unknown. In the Old Testament this is the name of a son of Ham. He is said to be the ancestor of the Canaanite people.

name: CANDACE
meaning: From the hereditary title of the queens of Ethiopia, as mentioned in Acts in the New Testament. It is apparently derived from Cushitic kdke meaning "queen mother". In some versions of the Bible it is spelled Kandake, reflecting the Greek spelling Κανδακη. It was used as a given name by the Puritans after the Protestant Reformation. It was popularized in the 20th century by a character in the movie 'Meet the Stewarts' (1942).

name: CANDE
meaning: Short form of CANDELARIA or CANDELARIO.

name: CANDELARIA
meaning: Means "Candlemas" in Spanish, ultimately derived from Spanish candela "candle". This name is given in honour of the church festival of Candlemas, which commemorates the presentation of Christ in the temple and the purification of the Virgin Mary.

name: CANDIDA
meaning: Late Latin name derived from candidus meaning "white". This was the name of several early saints, including a woman supposedly healed by Saint Peter. As an English name, it came into use after George Bernard Shaw's play 'Candida' (1898).

name: CANDIDE
meaning: French form of CANDIDUS or CANDIDA.

name: CANDIDUS
meaning: Masculine form of CANDIDA. This name was borne by a few early saints and martyrs.

name: CANDY
meaning: Diminutive of CANDACE. It is also influenced by the English word candy.

name: CANSU
meaning: From Turkish can meaning "soul, life" and su meaning "water".

name: CAOILFHIONN
meaning: Derived from the Gaelic elements caol "slender" and fionn "fair". This was the name of several Irish saints.

name: CAOIMHE
meaning: Derived from Gaelic caomh meaning "beautiful, gentle, kind".

name: CAOLÁN
meaning: From Gaelic caol "slender" combined with the diminutive suffix án.

name: CAOMHÁN
meaning: Diminutive of CAOMH. This was the name of a 6th-century Irish saint.

name: CAPRICE
meaning: From the English word meaning "impulse", ultimately (via French) from Italian capriccio.

name: CAPRINA
meaning: From the name of the Italian island of Capri.

name: CAPUCINE
meaning: Means "nasturtium" in French. This was the stage name of the French actress and model Capucine (1928-1990).

name: CARA
meaning: From an Italian word meaning "beloved". It has been used as a given name since the 19th century, though it did not become popular until after the 1950s.

name: CARADOG
meaning: Welsh form of CARATACOS. This is the name of several figures in Welsh history and legend, including a 6th-century king of Gwent and a Knight of the Round Table in Arthurian romance.

name: CARAMIA
meaning: From the Italian phrase cara mia meaning "my beloved".

name: CARATACOS
meaning: Derived from the Celtic element car meaning "love". This was the name of a 1st-century British chieftain who rebelled against Roman rule.

name: CARDEA
meaning: Derived from Latin cardo meaning "hinge, axis". This was the name of the Roman goddess of thresholds, door pivots, and change.

name: CAREY
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Ciardha meaning "descendant of CIARDHA".

name: CARINA  (1)
meaning: Late Latin name derived from cara meaning "dear, beloved". This was the name of a 4th-century saint and martyr. It is also the name of a constellation in the southern sky, though in this case it means "keel" in Latin, referring to a part of Jason's ship the Argo.

name: CARINE
meaning: French form of CARINA(1). It can also function as a short form of CATHERINE, via Swedish Karin.

name: CARITA
meaning: Derived from Latin caritas meaning "dearness, esteem, love".

name: CARL
meaning: German form of CHARLES. Two noteworthy bearers of the name were the German mathematician Carl Gauss (1777-1855), who made contributions to number theory and algebra as well as physics and astronomy, and the Swiss psychologist Carl Jung (1875-1961), who founded analytical psychology. It was imported to America in the 19th century by German immigrants.

name: CARLA
meaning: Feminine form of CARLO, CARLOS or CARL.

name: CARLISLE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the name of a city in northern England. The city was originally called by the Romans Luguvalium meaning "stronghold of LUGUS". Later the Brythonic element ker "fort" was appended to the name of the city.

name: CARLOMAN
meaning: From a Germanic name derived from karl (see CHARLES) and man "man". This was the name of several Frankish rulers, including the 8th-century Carloman I who ruled jointly with his brother Charlemagne for a time.

name: CARLOS
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of CHARLES.

name: CARLOTA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of CHARLOTTE.

name: CARME  (1)
meaning: Galician and Catalan form of CARMEL.

name: CARME  (2)
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Καρμη(Karme), which was derived from κειρω(keiro) "to shear". This was the name of a Cretan goddess of the harvest.

name: CARMEL
meaning: From the title of the Virgin Mary Our Lady of Carmel. כַּרְמֶל (Karmel) (meaning "garden" in Hebrew) is a mountain in Israel mentioned in the Old Testament. It was the site of several early Christian monasteries. As an English given name, it has mainly been used by Catholics.

name: CARMELA
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of CARMEL.

name: CARMELO
meaning: Spanish and Italian masculine form of CARMEL.

name: CARMEN
meaning: Medieval Spanish form of CARMEL influenced by the Latin word carmen "song". This was the name of the main character in George Bizet's opera 'Carmen' (1875).

name: CARMI
meaning: Means "vine" in Hebrew. This was the name of a son of Reuben in the Old Testament.

name: CAROL  (1)
meaning: Short form of CAROLINE. It was formerly a masculine name, derived from CAROLUS. The name can also be given in reference to the English vocabulary word, which means "song" or "hymn".

name: CAROL  (2)
meaning: Romanian form of CAROLUS. This was the name of two Romanian kings.

name: CAROLINA
meaning: Latinate feminine form of CAROLUS. This is the name of two American states: North and South Carolina. They were named for Charles I, king of England.

name: CARON
meaning: Derived from Welsh caru meaning "to love".

name: CARPUS
meaning: Latin form of the Greek name Καρπος(Karpos), which meant "fruit, profits". The name is mentioned briefly in the New Testament in the second epistle of Timothy.

name: CARRAN
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of the Gaelic surname Ó Corraidhín meaning "descendant of CORRAIDHÍN".

name: CARREEN
meaning: Used by Margaret Mitchell in her novel 'Gone with the Wind' (1936), where it is a combination of CAROLINE and IRENE.

name: CARROLL
meaning: Anglicized form of CEARBHALL. A famous bearer of the surname was Lewis Carroll (1832-1898), whose real name was Charles Lutwidge Dodgson, the author of 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland'.

name: CARSON
meaning: From a Scottish surname of uncertain meaning. A famous bearer of the surname was the American scout Kit Carson (1809-1868).

name: CARTER
meaning: From an English surname which meant "one who uses a cart".

name: CARVER
meaning: From an English surname which meant "wood carver".

name: CARWYN
meaning: Means "blessed love" from Welsh caru "love" and gwyn "white, fair, blessed".

name: CARYS
meaning: Derived from Welsh caru meaning "love". This is a relatively modern Welsh name, in common use only since the middle of the 20th century.

name: CASEY
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Cathasaigh meaning "descendant of CATHASACH". This name can be given in honour of Casey Jones (1863-1900), a train engineer who sacrificed his life to save his passengers. In his case, Casey was a nickname acquired because he was raised in the town of Cayce, Kentucky.

name: CASH
meaning: From an English occupational surname for a box maker, derived from Norman French casse meaning "case". A famous bearer of the surname was American musician Johnny Cash (1932-2003).

name: CASIMIR
meaning: English form of the Polish name Kazimierz, derived from the Slavic element kaziti "to destroy" combined with miru "peace, world". Four kings of Poland have borne this name, including Casimir III the Great, who greatly strengthened the Polish state in the 14th century. It was also borne Saint Casimir, a 15th-century Polish prince and a patron saint of Poland and Lithuania. The name was imported into Western Europe via Germany, where it was borne by some royalty.

name: CASIMIRO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of CASIMIR.

name: CASPER
meaning: Dutch and Scandinavian form of JASPER. This is the name of a friendly ghost in a series of comic books.

name: CASPIAN
meaning: Used by author C. S. Lewis for a character in his 'Chronicles of Narnia' series, first appearing in 1950. Prince Caspian first appears in the fourth book, where he is the rightful king of Narnia driven into exile by his evil uncle Miraz. Lewis probably based the name on the Caspian Sea, which was named for the city of Qazvin, which was itself named for the ancient Cas tribe.

name: CASS
meaning: Short form of CASSANDRA, CASSIDY, and other names beginning with Cass.

name: CASSANDER
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Κασσανδρος(Kassandros), the masculine form of CASSANDRA. This was the name of a 3rd-century BC king of Macedon.

name: CASSANDRA
meaning: From the Greek name Κασσανδρα(Kassandra), derived from possibly κεκασμαι(kekasmai) "to excel, to shine" and ανηρ(aner) "man" (genitive ανδρος). In Greek myth Cassandra was a Trojan princess, the daughter of Priam and Hecuba. She was given the gift of prophecy by Apollo, but when she spurned his advances he cursed her so nobody would believe her prophecies....[more]

name: CASSARAH
meaning: Recently created name intended to mean "what will be, will be". It is from the title of the 1956 song 'Que Sera, Sera', which was taken from the Italian phrase che sarà sarà. The phrase que sera, sera is not grammatically correct in any Romance language.

name: CASSIAN
meaning: From the Roman family name Cassianus, which was derived from CASSIUS. This was the name of several saints, including a 3rd-century martyr from Tangier who is the patron saint of stenographers and a 5th-century mystic who founded a monastery in Marseille.

name: CASSIANUS
meaning: Roman family name which was a derivative of CASSIUS.

name: CASSIDY
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Caiside meaning "descendant of CAISIDE".

name: CASSIE
meaning: Diminutive of CASSANDRA and other names beginning with Cass.

name: CASSIOPEIA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Κασσιοπεια(Kassiopeia) or Κασσιεπεια(Kassiepeia), possibly meaning "cassia juice". In Greek myth Cassiopeia was the wife of Cepheus and the mother of Andromeda. She was changed into a constellation and placed in the northern sky after she died.

name: CASSIUS
meaning: Roman family name which was possibly derived from Latin cassus "empty, vain". This name was borne by several early saints. In modern times, it was the original first name of boxer Muhammad Ali (1942-2016), who was named after his father Cassius Clay, who was himself named after the American abolitionist Cassius Clay (1810-1903).

name: CASTOR
meaning: From the Greek name Καστωρ(Kastor), possibly related to κεκασμαι(kekasmai) meaning "to excel, to shine" (pluperfect κεκαστο). In Greek myth Castor was a son of Zeus and the twin brother of Pollux. The constellation Gemini, which represents the two brothers, contains a star by this name.

name: CAT
meaning: Diminutive of CATHERINE. It can also be a nickname from the English word for the animal.

name: CATAHECASSA
meaning: Means "black hoof" in Shawnee. This was the name of a Shawnee warrior and chief of the 18th century.

name: CATARINA
meaning: Portuguese, Occitan and Galician form of KATHERINE.

name: CATE
meaning: Variant of KATE. A famous bearer is Australian actress Cate Blanchett (1975-).

name: CATERINA
meaning: Italian and Catalan form of KATHERINE.

name: CATHAIR
meaning: Means "battle man" from Gaelic cath "battle" and vir "man".

name: CATHAL
meaning: Derived from the Gaelic elements cath "battle" and val "rule". This was the name of a 7th-century Irish saint. It has sometimes been Anglicized as Charles.

name: CATHARINA
meaning: Dutch and Swedish form of KATHERINE.

name: CATHERINE
meaning: French form of KATHERINE, and also a common English variant.

name: CATHÁN
meaning: Derived from Gaelic cath "battle" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: CATO  (1)
meaning: Roman cognomen meaning "wise" in Latin. This name was bestowed upon Cato the Elder (Marcus Porcius Cato), a 2nd-century BC Roman statesman, author and censor, and was subsequently inherited by his descendants, including his great-grandson Cato the Younger (Marcus Porcius Cato Uticencis), a politician and philosopher who opposed Julius Caesar.

name: CATRIN
meaning: Welsh form of KATHERINE, as well as a German short form of KATHARINA.

name: CAVAN
meaning: Either from the name of the Irish county, which is derived from Irish cabhán "hollow", or else from the Irish surname CAVAN.

name: CAYETANA
meaning: Spanish feminine form of Caietanus (see GAETANO).

name: CEALLACH
meaning: Irish name of uncertain origin, traditionally said to mean "bright-headed". Alternatively it could be derived from Old Irish ceallach "war, strife" or ceall "church".

name: CEARBHALL
meaning: Probably from Gaelic cearbh "hacking with a weapon".

name: CECE
meaning: Diminutive of CECILIA or other names containing a similar sound.

name: CECIL
meaning: From the Roman name Caecilius (see CECILIA). This was the name of a 3rd-century saint, a companion of Saint Cyprian. Though it was in use during the Middle Ages in England, it did not become common until the 19th century when it was given in honour of the noble Cecil family, who had been prominent since the 16th century.
