Their surname was derived from the Welsh given name Seisyll, which was derived from the Roman name Sextilius, a derivative of SEXTUS.

name: CECILIA
meaning: Latinate feminine form of the Roman family name Caecilius, which was derived from Latin caecus "blind". Saint Cecilia was a semi-legendary 2nd- or 3rd-century martyr who was sentenced to die because she refused to worship the Roman gods. After attempts to suffocate her failed, she was beheaded. She was later regarded as the patron saint of music and musicians....[more]

name: CECILIE
meaning: Norwegian, Danish and Czech form of CECILIA.

name: CECILIJA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian form of CECILIA.

name: CECILIO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of Caecilius (see CECILIA).

name: CECILY
meaning: English form of CECILIA. This was the usual English form during the Middle Ages.

name: CECÍLIA
meaning: Portuguese, Slovak and Hungarian form of CECILIA.

name: CEDAR
meaning: From the English word for the coniferous tree, derived (via Old French and Latin) from Greek κεδρος(kedros).

name: CEDRIC
meaning: Invented by Sir Walter Scott for a character in his novel 'Ivanhoe' (1819). Apparently he based it on the actual name Cerdic, the name of the semi-legendary founder of the kingdom of Wessex in the 6th century. The meaning of Cerdic is uncertain, but it does not appear to be Old English in origin. It could be connected to the Brythonic name CARATACOS. The name was also used by Frances Hodgson Burnett for the main character in her novel 'Little Lord Fauntleroy' (1886).

name: CEINWEN
meaning: Derived from the Welsh elements cain "lovely" and gwen "white, fair, blessed".

name: CELANDINE
meaning: From the name of the flower, which derives from Greek χελιδων(chelidon) "swallow (bird)".

name: CELESTE
meaning: Italian feminine and masculine form of CAELESTIS. It is also the English feminine form.

name: CELESTINE
meaning: English form of CAELESTINUS. It is more commonly used as a feminine name, from the French feminine form Célestine.

name: CELESTINO
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Portuguese form of CAELESTINUS.

name: CELIA
meaning: Feminine form of the Roman family name CAELIUS. Shakespeare used it in his play 'As You Like It' (1599), which introduced the name to the English-speaking public at large. It is sometimes used as a short form of CECILIA.

name: CELINDA
meaning: Probably a blend of CELIA and LINDA. This is also the Spanish name for a variety of shrub with white flowers, known as sweet mock-orange in English (species Philadelphus coronarius).

name: CELINO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of CAELINUS or a short form of MARCELINO.

name: CELIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of CAELIUS.

name: CELSO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of CELSUS.

name: CELSUS
meaning: Roman family name which meant "tall" in Latin. This was the name of a 2nd-century philosopher who wrote against Christianity. It was also borne by an early saint martyred with Nazarius in Milan.

name: CENK
meaning: Means "battle, war" in Turkish, ultimately from Persian.

name: CENNÉTIG
meaning: Old Irish byname meaning "armoured head" or "misshapen head". This was the name of an Irish king, the father of Brian Boru.

name: CENRIC
meaning: Derived from Old English cene "bold" and ric "power".

name: CEOLMUND
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ceol "keel" and mund "protection".

name: CEPHALUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Κεφαλος(Kephalos), which was derived from κεφαλη(kephale) meaning "head". In Greek legend he remained faithful to his wife Procris even though he was pursued by the goddess Eos.

name: CEPHAS
meaning: Means "rock" in Aramaic. The apostle Simon was called Cephas by Jesus because he was to be the rock upon which the Christian church was to be built. In most versions of the New Testament Cephas is translated into Greek Πετρος(Petros) (in English Peter).

name: CEPHEUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Κηφευς(Kepheus), which is of unknown meaning. In Greek legend he was a king of Ethiopia, the husband of Cassiopeia. After he died he was made into a constellation and placed in the sky.

name: CERBERUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Κερβερος(Kerberos), which possibly meant "spotted". In Greek myth this was the name of the three-headed dog that guarded the entrance to Hades.

name: CERDIC
meaning: Earlier form of CEDRIC, possibly of Brythonic origin.

name: CERES
meaning: Derived from the Indo-European root *ker meaning "to grow". In Roman mythology Ceres was the goddess of agriculture, equivalent to the Greek goddess Demeter.

name: CERI  (1)
meaning: Possibly derived from Welsh caru meaning "to love".

name: CERIDWEN
meaning: Possibly from Welsh cyrrid "bent" or cerdd "poetry" combined with ven "woman" or gwen "white, fair, blessed". According to medieval Welsh legend this was the name of a sorceress or goddess who created a potion that would grant wisdom to her son Morfan. The potion was instead consumed by her servant Gwion Bach, who was subsequently reborn as the renowned bard Taliesin.

name: CERNUNNOS
meaning: Means "horned" in Celtic. This was the name of the Celtic god fertility, animals, wealth, and the underworld. He was usually depicted having antlers, and was identified with the Roman god Mercury.

name: CEZAR
meaning: Romanian form of CAESAR, as well as a Brazilian Portuguese variant of CÉSAR.

name: CHAD
meaning: From the Old English name Ceadda which is of unknown meaning, possibly based on Welsh cad "battle". This was the name of a 7th-century English saint. Borne primarily by Catholics, it was a rare name until the 1960s when it started to become more common amongst the general population. This is also the name of a country in Africa, though it originates from a different source.

name: CHADWICK
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the name of towns in England, meaning "settlement belonging to CHAD" in Old English.

name: CHAE-WON
meaning: From Sino-Korean 采(chae) meaning "collect, gather, pluck" combined with 原(won) meaning "source, origin, beginning". Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: CHALCHIUHTICUE
meaning: Means "jade skirt" in Nahuatl. She was the Aztec goddess of water and rivers, the wife of Tlaloc.

name: CHALEB
meaning: Form of CALEB used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: CHALICE
meaning: Means simply "chalice, goblet" from the English word, derived from Latin calix.

name: CHAN
meaning: Means "moon" in Khmer, ultimately from Sanskrit.

name: CHANCE
meaning: Originally a diminutive of CHAUNCEY. It is now usually given in reference to the English word chance meaning "luck, fortune" (ultimately derived from Latin cadens "falling").

name: CHANDA
meaning: Means "fierce, hot, passionate" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the masculine form चण्ड and the feminine form चण्डा (an epithet of the Hindu goddess Durga).

name: CHANDLER
meaning: From an occupational surname which meant "candle seller" in Middle English, ultimately from Old French.

name: CHANDRA
meaning: Means "moon" in Sanskrit, derived from चन्द(chand) meaning "to shine". This is a transcription of the masculine form चण्ड (a name of the moon in Hindu texts which is often personified as a deity) as well as the feminine form चण्डा.

name: CHANDRAKANT
meaning: Means "beloved by the moon", derived from Sanskrit चन्द्र(chandra) meaning "moon" and कान्त(kanta) meaning "desired, beloved". This is another name for the moonstone.

name: CHANEL
meaning: From a French surname which meant "pipe". It has been used as an American given name since 1970s, influenced by the Chanel brand name (a line of women's clothing and perfume), which was named for French fashion designer Coco Chanel (1883-1971).

name: CHANG
meaning: From Chinese 昌(chāng) meaning "flourish, prosper, good, sunlight" (which is usually only masculine), 畅(chàng) meaning "smooth, free, unrestrained" or 长(cháng) meaning "long". Other Chinese characters are also possible.

name: CHANNARY
meaning: Means "moon-faced girl" from Khmer ចន្ទ(chan) "moon" and នារី(neari) "woman, girl".

name: CHANNING
meaning: From an English surname of uncertain origin.

name: CHANTAL
meaning: From a French surname which was derived from a place name meaning "stony". It was originally given in honour of Saint Jeanne-Françoise de Chantal, the founder of the Visitation Order in the 17th century. It has become associated with French chant "song".

name: CHAO
meaning: From Chinese 超(chāo) meaning "surpass, leap over" (which is usually only masculine), 潮(cháo) meaning "tide, flow, damp", or other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: CHARALAMPOS
meaning: Means "to shine from happiness" from Greek χαρα(chara) "happiness" combined with λαμπω(lampo) "to shine".

name: CHARES
meaning: Derived from Greek χαρις(charis) meaning "grace, kindness". This was the name of a 4th-century BC Athenian general. It was also borne by the sculptor who crafted the Colossus of Rhodes.

name: CHARIS
meaning: Feminine form of CHARES. It came into use as an English given name in the 17th century.

name: CHARISMA
meaning: From the English word meaning "personal magnetism", ultimately derived from Greek χαρις(charis) "grace, kindness".

name: CHARISSA
meaning: Elaborated form of CHARIS. Edmund Spencer used it in his epic poem 'The Faerie Queene' (1590).

name: CHARISSE
meaning: From a French surname of unknown meaning. It was used as a given name in honour of American actress and dancer Cyd Charisse (1921-2008).

name: CHARITON
meaning: Derived from Greek χαρις(charis) meaning "grace, kindness". This was the name of a 1st-century Greek novelist.

name: CHARITY
meaning: From the English word charity, ultimately derived from Late Latin caritas meaning "generous love", from Latin carus "dear, beloved". Caritas was in use as a Roman Christian name. The English name Charity came into use among the Puritans after the Protestant Reformation.

name: CHARLEMAGNE
meaning: From Old French Charles le Magne meaning "CHARLES the Great". This is the name by which the Frankish king Charles the Great (742-814) is commonly known.

name: CHARLES
meaning: From the Germanic name Karl, which was derived from a Germanic word meaning "man". However, an alternative theory states that it is derived from the common Germanic name element hari meaning "army, warrior"....[more]

name: CHARLEY
meaning: Diminutive or feminine form of CHARLES.

name: CHARLIE
meaning: Diminutive or feminine form of CHARLES. A famous bearer is Charlie Brown, the main character in the comic strip 'Peanuts' by Charles Schulz.

name: CHARLIZE
meaning: Feminine form of CHARLES using the popular Afrikaans name suffix ize. This name was popularized by South African actress Charlize Theron (1975-), who was named after her father Charles.

name: CHARLOTTE
meaning: French feminine diminutive of CHARLES. It was introduced to Britain in the 17th century. A notable bearer was Charlotte Brontë (1816-1855), the eldest of the three Brontë sisters and the author of 'Jane Eyre' and 'Villette'.

name: CHARLTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "settlement of free men" in Old English.

name: CHARMAINE
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps a combination of CHARMIAN or the English word charm with the aine suffix from LORRAINE. It was (first?) used for a character in the play 'What Price Glory' (1924), which was made into a popular movie in 1926.

name: CHARMIAN
meaning: Form of CHARMION used by Shakespeare in his play 'Antony and Cleopatra' (1606).

name: CHARMION
meaning: Greek name derived from χαρμα(charma) meaning "delight". This was the name of one of Cleopatra's servants, as recorded by Plutarch.

name: CHARON
meaning: Possibly means "fierce brightness" in Greek. In Greek mythology Charon was the operator of the ferry that brought the newly dead over the River Acheron into Hades.

name: CHASE
meaning: From a surname meaning "chase, hunt" in Middle English, originally a nickname for a huntsman.

name: CHASTITY
meaning: From the English word chastity, which is ultimately from Latin castus "pure". It was borne by the daughter of Sonny Bono and Cher, which probably led to the name's increase in popularity during the 1970s.

name: CHAUNCEY
meaning: From a Norman surname of unknown meaning. It was used as a given name in American in honour of Harvard president Charles Chauncey (1592-1672).

name: CHAVDAR
meaning: Derived from a Persian word meaning "leader, dignitary".

name: CHAYYIM
meaning: Derived from the Hebrew word חַיִּים(chayyim) meaning "life". It has been used since medieval times.

name: CHE
meaning: From an Argentine expression meaning "hey!". This nickname was acquired by the Argentine revolutionary Ernesto Guevara while he was in Cuba.

name: CHELSEA
meaning: From the name of a district in London, originally derived from Old English and meaning "landing place for chalk or limestone". It has been in general use as an English given name since the 1970s.

name: CHEN  (1)
meaning: From Chinese 晨(chén) or 辰(chén) which both mean "morning". The character 辰 also refers to the fifth Earthly Branch (7 AM to 9 AM) which is itself associated with the dragon of the Chinese zodiac. This name can be formed from other characters as well.

name: CHENANIAH
meaning: Variant of KENANIAH used in several translations of the Old Testament.

name: CHENG
meaning: From Chinese 成(chéng) meaning "completed, finished, succeeded" or 诚(chéng) meaning "sincere, honest, true", as well as other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: CHER
meaning: Short form of CHERYL. In the case of the American musician Cher (1946-), it is short for her real name CHERILYN.

name: CHERIE
meaning: Derived from French chérie meaning "darling". In America, Cherie came into use shortly after the variant Sherry, and has not been as common.

name: CHERILYN
meaning: Combination of CHERYL and the popular name suffix lyn.

name: CHERISH
meaning: From the English word meaning "to treasure".

name: CHERNOBOG
meaning: Means "the black god" from Slavic cherno "black" and bogu "god". Chernobog was the Slavic god of darkness, evil and grief.

name: CHEROKEE
meaning: Probably derived from the Creek word tciloki meaning "people of a different speech". This is the name of a Native American people who live in the east of North America.

name: CHERRY
meaning: Simply means "cherry" from the name of the fruit. It can also be a diminutive of CHARITY. It has been in use since the late 19th century.

name: CHERYL
meaning: Elaboration of CHERIE, perhaps influenced by BERYL. This name was not used before the 20th century.

name: CHESLEY
meaning: From a surname that was originally from a place name meaning "camp meadow" in Old English.

name: CHESTER
meaning: From a surname which originally belonged to a person who came from Chester, an old Roman settlement in Britain. The name of the settlement came from Latin castrum "camp, fortress".

name: CHESTIRAD
meaning: Possible medieval Slavic form of CTIRAD.

name: CHEYANNE
meaning: Variant of CHEYENNE probably influenced by the name ANNE(1).

name: CHEYENNE
meaning: Derived from the Dakota word shahiyena meaning "red speakers". This is the name of a Native American people of the Great Plains. The name was supposedly given to the Cheyenne by the Dakota because their language was unrelated to their own. As a given name, it has been in use since the 1950s.

name: CHI  (2)
meaning: Means "god, spirtual being" in Igbo, referring to the personal spiritual guardian that each person is believed to have. Christian Igbo people use it as a name for the personal Christian god. This can also be a short form of the many Igbo names that begin with this element.

name: CHIARA
meaning: Italian form of CLARA. Saint Chiara (commonly called Saint Clare in English) was a follower of Saint Francis of Assisi.

name: CHIBUEZE
meaning: Means "God is the king" in Igbo.

name: CHIBUZO
meaning: Means "God leads the way" in Igbo.

name: CHICHI
meaning: Diminutive of Igbo names beginning with the element Chi meaning "God".

name: CHIDI
meaning: Means "God exists" in Igbo. It is also a short form of Igbo names beginning with Chidi.

name: CHIEMEKA
meaning: Means "God has performed great deeds" in Igbo.

name: CHIHIRO
meaning: From Japanese 千(chi) meaning "thousand" and 尋(hiro) meaning "search, seek", as well as other kanji combinations.

name: CHIJINDUM
meaning: Means "God holds my life" in Igbo.

name: CHIKA  (1)
meaning: Means "God is the greatest" in Igbo.

name: CHIKA  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 千(chi) meaning "thousand", 智(chi) meaning "wisdom, intellect" or 散(chi) meaning "scatter" combined with 佳(ka) meaning "good, beautiful" or 花(ka) meaning "flower". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: CHIKAKO
meaning: From Japanese 千(chi) meaning "thousand", 香(ka) meaning "fragrance" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations can be possible.

name: CHINA
meaning: From the name of the Asian country, ultimately derived from Qin, the name of a dynasty that ruled there in the 3rd century BC.

name: CHINATSU
meaning: From Japanese 千(chi) meaning "thousand" and 夏(natsu) meaning "summer", as well as other kanji combinations.

name: CHINWE
meaning: Means "God owns" in Igbo. It is also a short form of Igbo names beginning with Chinwe.

name: CHIP
meaning: Diminutive of CHARLES or CHRISTOPHER. It can also be from a nickname given in reference to the phrase a chip off the old block, used of a son who is similar to his father.

name: CHIYO
meaning: From Japanese 千(chi) meaning "thousand" combined with 代(yo) meaning "generation" or 世(yo) meaning "world". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: CHIYOKO
meaning: From Japanese 千(chi) meaning "thousand" and 代(yo) meaning "generation" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other combinations of kanji characters are possible.

name: CHLOE
meaning: Means "green shoot" in Greek, referring to new plant growth in the spring. This was an epithet of the Greek goddess Demeter. The name is also mentioned by Paul in one of his epistles in the New Testament. As an English name, Chloe has been in use since the Protestant Reformation.

name: CHLORIS
meaning: Derived from Greek χλωρος(chloros) meaning "pale green". Chloris, in Greek mythology, was a minor goddess of vegetation.

name: CHOUKO
meaning: From Japanese 蝶(chou) meaning "butterfly" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations can be possible.

name: CHRIS
meaning: Short form of CHRISTOPHER, CHRISTIAN, CHRISTINE, and other names that begin with Chris.

name: CHRISTABEL
meaning: Combination of CHRISTINA and the name suffix bel. This name occurs in medieval literature, and was later used by Samuel Coleridge in his poem 'Christabel' (1800).

name: CHRISTER
meaning: Swedish and Danish diminutive of CHRISTIAN.

name: CHRISTIAN
meaning: From the medieval Latin name Christianus meaning "a Christian" (see CHRISTOS). In England it has been in use since the Middle Ages, during which time it was used by both males and females, but it did not become common until the 17th century. In Denmark the name has been borne by ten kings since the 15th century. A famous bearer was Hans Christian Andersen (1805-1875), the Danish author of such fairy tales as 'The Ugly Duckling' and 'The Emperor's New Clothes'.

name: CHRISTIANE
meaning: German and French feminine form of CHRISTIAN.

name: CHRISTIE  (2)
meaning: Scottish and Irish diminutive of CHRISTOPHER.

name: CHRISTINA
meaning: From Christiana, the Latin feminine form of CHRISTIAN. This was the name of an early, possibly legendary, saint who was tormented by her pagan father. It was also borne by a 17th-century Swedish queen and patron the arts who gave up her crown in order to become a Roman Catholic.

name: CHRISTINE
meaning: French form of CHRISTINA, as well as a variant in other languages.

name: CHRISTMAS
meaning: From the name of the holiday, which means "Christ festival".

name: CHRISTOPHER
meaning: From the Late Greek name Χριστοφορος(Christophoros) meaning "bearing CHRIST", derived from Χριστος(Christos) combined with φερω(phero) "to bear, to carry". Early Christians used it as a metaphorical name, expressing that they carried Christ in their hearts. In the Middle Ages, literal interpretations of the name's etymology led to legends about a Saint Christopher who carried the young Jesus across a river. He has come to be regarded as the patron saint of travellers....[more]

name: CHRISTOS
meaning: From Greek Χριστος(Christos) meaning "anointed", derived from χριω(chrio) meaning "to anoint". This was a name applied to Jesus by early Greek-speaking Christians. It is a translation of the Hebrew word מָשִׁיחַ(mashiyach), commonly spelled in English messiah, which also means "anointed"....[more]

name: CHRISTY  (2)
meaning: Scottish and Irish diminutive of CHRISTOPHER.

name: CHRIZANNE
meaning: Combination of CHRISTINE and ANNE(1) used in South Africa.

name: CHRYSANTA
meaning: Shortened form of the word chrysanthemum, the name of a flowering plant, which means "golden flower" in Greek.

name: CHRYSANTHI
meaning: Modern Greek feminine form of CHRYSANTHOS.

name: CHRYSANTHOS
meaning: Means "golden flower" from Greek χρυσεος(chryseos) "golden" combined with ανθος(anthos) "flower". This name was borne by a semi-legendary 3rd-century Egyptian saint.

name: CHRYSEIS
meaning: Patronymic derived from CHRYSES. In Greek legend she was the daughter of Chryses, a priest of Apollo. After she was taken prisoner by the Greeks besieging Troy, Apollo sent a plague into their camp, forcing the Greeks to release her.

name: CHRYSES
meaning: Derived from Greek χρυσεος(chryseos) meaning "golden". In Greek mythology Chryses was the father of Chryseis, a woman captured by Agamemnon during the Trojan War.

name: CHUCK
meaning: Diminutive of CHARLES. It originated in America in the early 20th century. Two famous bearers of this name were pilot Chuck Yeager (1923-), the first man to travel faster than the speed of sound, and the musician Chuck Berry (1926-2017), one of the pioneers of rock music.

name: CHUKS
meaning: Diminutive of Igbo names beginning with the element Chukwu meaning "God".

name: CHUKWU
meaning: Derived from Igbo chi "god, spirtual being" and ukwu "great". In Igbo mythology Chukwu is the supreme god who created the universe. Christian Igbo people use this name for the Christian god.

name: CHUKWUDI
meaning: Variant of CHIDI, using Chukwu as the first element, which is the extended form of Chi meaning "God".

name: CHUKWUEMEKA
meaning: Means "God has done something great" in Igbo.

name: CHUKWUMA
meaning: Variant of CHIMA, using Chukwu as the first element, which is the extended form of Chi meaning "God".

name: CHUN
meaning: From Chinese 春(chūn) meaning "spring (the season)" or other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: CIAN
meaning: Means "ancient" in Gaelic. This was the name of the mythical ancestor of the Cianachta in Irish legend. Cian was also the name of a son-in-law of Brian Boru.

name: CIANÁN
meaning: Diminutive of CIAN. This was the name of a 5th-century Irish saint.

name: CIARA  (1)
meaning: Feminine form of CIAR. Saint Ciara was an Irish nun who established a monastery at Kilkeary in the 7th century.

name: CIARA  (2)
meaning: Variant of SIERRA. Use of the name has perhaps been influenced by the brand of perfume called Ciara, which was introduced by Revlon in 1973.

name: CIARÁN
meaning: Diminutive of CIAR. This was the name of two Irish saints: Saint Ciarán the Elder, the patron of the Kingdom of Munster, and Saint Ciarán of Clonmacnoise, the founder of a monastery in the 6th century.

name: CICERO
meaning: Roman cognomen which meant "chickpea" from Latin cicer. Marcus Tullius Cicero (known simply as Cicero) was a statesman, orator and author of the 1st century BC.

name: CIEL
meaning: Means "sky" in French. It is not used as a given name in France itself.

name: CILLIAN
meaning: Probably from Gaelic ceall "church" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of a 7th-century Irish saint who evangelized in Franconia. He was martyred in Würzburg.

name: CINDERELLA
meaning: From the French name Cendrillon which means "little ashes". This is best known as the main character in the fairy tale 'Cinderella'.

name: CINTA
meaning: Means "love" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit चिन्ता(chinta).

name: CINTIA
meaning: Spanish and Hungarian form of CYNTHIA.

name: CINÁED
meaning: Means "born of fire" in Gaelic. This was the name of the first king of the Scots and Picts (9th century). It is often Anglicized as Kenneth.

name: CIPRIANO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of Cyprianus (see CYPRIAN).

name: CIRCE
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Κιρκη(Kirke), which possibly meant "bird". In Greek mythology Circe was a sorceress who changed Odysseus's crew into hogs but was forced by him to change them back.

name: CIRIACO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of CYRIACUS.

name: CIRO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of CYRUS.

name: CIRÍACO
meaning: Portuguese form and Spanish variant of CYRIACUS.

name: CITRA
meaning: Means "image" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit चित्र(chitra).

name: CLANCY
meaning: From the Irish surname Mac Fhlannchaidh which means "son of Flannchadh". The Gaelic name Flannchadh means "red warrior".

name: CLARA
meaning: Feminine form of the Late Latin name Clarus which meant "clear, bright, famous". The name Clarus was borne by a few early saints. The feminine form was popularized by the 13th-century Saint Clare of Assisi (called Chiara in Italian), a friend and follower of Saint Francis, who left her wealthy family to found the order of nuns known as the Poor Clares. As an English name it has been in use since the Middle Ages, originally in the form Clare, though the Latinate spelling Clara became more popular in the 19th century.

name: CLARE
meaning: Medieval English form of CLARA. This is also the name of an Irish county, which was originally named for the Norman invader Richard de Clare (known as Strongbow), whose surname was derived from the name of an English river.

name: CLARENCE
meaning: From the Latin title Clarensis which belonged to members of the British royal family. The title ultimately derives from the name of the town of Clare in Suffolk. As a given name it has been in use since the 19th century.

name: CLARIBEL
meaning: Combination of CLARA and the popular name suffix bel. This name was used by Edmund Spenser in his poem 'The Faerie Queene' (in the form Claribell) and by Shakespeare in his play 'The Tempest' (1611). Alfred Lord Tennyson also wrote a poem entitled 'Claribel' (1830).

name: CLARICE
meaning: Medieval vernacular form of the Late Latin name Claritia, which was a derivative of CLARA.

name: CLARINDA
meaning: Combination of CLARA and the popular name suffix inda. It was first used by Edmund Spenser in his epic poem 'The Faerie Queene' (1590).

name: CLARISSA
meaning: Latinate form of CLARICE. This was the name of the title character in a 1748 novel by Samuel Richardson. In the novel Clarissa is a virtuous woman who is tragically exploited by her family and her lover.

name: CLARITY
meaning: Simply means "clarity, lucidity" from the English word, ultimately from Latin clarus "clear".

name: CLARK
meaning: From an English surname meaning "cleric" or "scribe", from Old English clerec which originally meant "priest". A famous bearer of the surname was William Clark (1770-1838), an explorer of the west of North America. It was also borne by the American actor Clark Gable (1901-1960).

name: CLARUS
meaning: Masculine Latin form of CLARA. This was the name of several early saints.

name: CLAUDE
meaning: French masculine and feminine form of CLAUDIUS. In France the masculine name has been common since the Middle Ages due to the 7th-century Saint Claude of Besançon. It was imported to Britain in the 16th century by the aristocratic Hamilton family, who had French connections. A famous bearer of this name was the French impressionist painter Claude Monet (1840-1926).

name: CLAUDIA
meaning: Feminine form of CLAUDIUS. It is mentioned briefly in the New Testament. As a Christian name it was very rare until the 16th century.

name: CLAUDIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of CLAUDIUS.

name: CLAUDIUS
meaning: From a Roman family name which was possibly derived from Latin claudus meaning "lame, crippled". This was the name of a patrician family prominent in Roman politics. The ancestor of the family was said to have been a 6th-century BC Sabine leader named Attius Clausus, who adopted the name Appius Claudius upon becoming a Roman citizen. The family produced several Roman emperors of the 1st century, including the emperor known simply as Claudius. He was poisoned by his wife Agrippina in order to bring her son Nero (Claudius's stepson) to power. The name was later borne by several early saints, including a 7th-century bishop of Besançon.

name: CLAY
meaning: From an English surname that originally referred to a person who lived near or worked with clay. This name can also be a short form of CLAYTON.

name: CLAYTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from various English place names, all meaning "clay settlement" in Old English.

name: CLEDWYN
meaning: Derived from the Welsh element caled "rough" combined with gwyn "white, fair, blessed".

name: CLEISTHENES
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Κλεισθενης(Kleisthenes), derived from κλεος(kleos) "glory" and σθενος(sthenos) "strength". This was the name of a 5th-century BC Athenian statesman and reformer. He helped establish democracy in Athens.

name: CLEMATIS
meaning: From the English word for a type of flowering vine, ultimately derived from Greek κλημα(klema) "twig, branch".

name: CLEMENCE
meaning: Feminine form of Clementius (see CLEMENT). It has been in use since the Middle Ages, though it became rare after the 17th century.

name: CLEMENCY
meaning: Medieval variant of CLEMENCE. It can also simply mean "clemency, mercy" from the English word, ultimately from Latin clemens "merciful".

name: CLEMENS
meaning: Original Latin form of CLEMENT, as well as the German, Dutch and Scandinavian form.

name: CLEMENT
meaning: English form of the Late Latin name Clemens (or sometimes of its derivative Clementius) which meant "merciful, gentle". This was the name of 14 popes, including Saint Clement I, the third pope, one of the Apostolic Fathers. Another saint by this name was Clement of Alexandria, a 3rd-century theologian and church father who attempted to reconcile Christian and Platonic philosophies. It has been in general as a given name in Christian Europe (in various spellings) since early times. In England it became rare after the Protestant Reformation, though it was revived in the 19th century.

name: CLEMENTE
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of Clemens (see CLEMENT).

name: CLEMENTIA
meaning: Feminine form of Clemens or Clementius (see CLEMENT).

name: CLEO
meaning: Short form of CLEOPATRA, CLEON or CLEOPAS.

name: CLEON
meaning: Latinized form of Κλεων(Kleon), a Greek name derived from κλεος(kleos) "glory".

name: CLEOPAS
meaning: Shortened form of the Greek name Kleopatros (see CLEOPATRA). In the New Testament Cleopas is a disciple who sees Jesus after his resurrection.

name: CLEOPATRA
meaning: From the Greek name Κλεοπατρα(Kleopatra) which meant "glory of the father", derived from κλεος(kleos) "glory" combined with πατηρ(pater) "father" (genitive πατρος), This was the name of queens of Egypt from the Ptolemaic royal family, including Cleopatra VII, the mistress of both Julius Caesar and Mark Antony. After being defeated by Augustus she committed suicide by allowing herself to be bitten by an asp. Shakespeare's tragedy 'Antony and Cleopatra' (1606) is based on her.

name: CLEOPHAS
meaning: Form of CLOPAS used in several versions of the New Testament.

name: CLETUS
meaning: Short form of ANACLETUS. This name is sometimes used to refer to the third pope, Saint Anacletus. It can also function an an Anglicized form of KLEITOS.

name: CLEVELAND
meaning: From a surname which was derived from an Old English place name meaning "hilly land". This was the surname of American president Grover Cleveland (1837-1908). It is also the name of an American city, which was founded by surveyor Moses Cleaveland (1754-1806).

name: CLIFF
meaning: Short form of CLIFFORD or CLIFTON.

name: CLIFFORD
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "ford by a cliff" in Old English.

name: CLIFTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "settlement by a cliff" in Old English.

name: CLINT
meaning: Short form of CLINTON. A notable bearer is American actor Clint Eastwood (1930-), who became famous early in his career for his western movies.

name: CLINTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally from an Old English place name meaning "settlement on the River Glyme". A famous bearer of the surname was American president Bill Clinton (1946-).

name: CLIVE
meaning: From a surname meaning "cliff" in Old English, originally belonging to a person who lived near a cliff.

name: CLODAGH
meaning: From the name of a river in Tipperary, Ireland.

name: CLOE
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of CHLOE.

name: CLOELIA
meaning: Feminine form of CLOELIUS. In Roman legend Cloelia was a maiden who was given to an Etruscan invader as a hostage. She managed to escape by swimming across the Tiber, at the same time helping some of the other captives to safety.

name: CLOELIUS
meaning: Roman family name of unknown meaning.

name: CLOPAS
meaning: Meaning unknown, probably of Aramaic origin. In the New Testament Clopas is mentioned briefly as the husband of one of the women who witnessed the crucifixion, sometimes identified with Alphaeus.

name: CLOTILDE
meaning: French form of the Germanic name Chlotichilda which was composed of the elements hlud "fame" and hild "battle". Saint Clotilde was the wife of the Frankish king Clovis, whom she converted to Christianity.

name: CLOVER
meaning: From the English word for the wild flower, ultimately deriving from Old English clafre.

name: CLOVIS
meaning: Shortened form of Clodovicus, a Latinized form of Chlodovech (see LUDWIG). Clovis was a Frankish king who united France under his rule in the 5th century.

name: CLOÉ
meaning: Portuguese form and French variant of CHLOE.

name: CLYDE
meaning: From the name of the River Clyde in Scotland, which is of unknown origin. It became a common given name in America in the middle of the 19th century, perhaps in honour of Sir Colin Campbell (1792-1863) who was given the title Baron Clyde in 1858.

name: CLYTEMNESTRA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Κλυταιμνηστρα(Klytaimnestra), from κλυτος(klytos) "famous, noble" and μνηστηρ(mnester) "courter, wooer". In Greek legend Clytemnestra was the wife of Agamemnon and the mother of Orestes and Electra. While her husband was away during the Trojan War she took a lover, and upon his return she had him murdered. She was subsequently killed by Orestes.

name: CLÉMENCE
meaning: French feminine form of Clementius (see CLEMENT).

name: CLÍMACO
meaning: Spanish form of Climacus, derived from Greek κλιμαξ(klimax) "ladder". The 7th-century monk Saint John Climacus (also known as John of the Ladder) acquired this name because he wrote a book called 'The Ladder of Divine Ascent'.

name: CLÍODHNA
meaning: Possibly means "shapely" in Irish Gaelic. In Irish legend this was the name of a beautiful goddess. She fell in love with a mortal named Ciabhan and left the Land of Promise with him, but when she arrived on the other shore she was swept to sea by a great wave.

name: COBY
meaning: Masculine or feminine diminutive of JACOB.

name: COCHISE
meaning: From Apache chis meaning "oak, wood". This was the name of a 19th-century chief of the Chiricahua Apache.

name: COCO
meaning: Diminutive of names beginning with Co, influenced by the word cocoa. However, this was not the case for French fashion designer Coco Chanel (real name Gabrielle), whose nickname came from the name of a song she performed while working as a cabaret singer.

name: CODY
meaning: From the Gaelic surname Ó Cuidighthigh, which means "descendant of CUIDIGHTHEACH". A famous bearer of the surname was the American frontiersman and showman Buffalo Bill Cody (1846-1917).

name: COHEN
meaning: From a common Jewish surname which was derived from Hebrew כֹּהֵן(kohen) meaning "priest". This surname was traditionally associated with the hereditary priests who claimed descent from the biblical Aaron.

name: COINNEACH
meaning: Derived from Gaelic caoin "handsome". It is often Anglicized as Kenneth.

name: COLA
meaning: Old English byname meaning "charcoal", originally given to a person with dark features.

name: COLBERT
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a Norman form of the Germanic name COLOBERT.

name: COLBY
meaning: From a surname, originally from various English place names, derived from the Old Norse nickname Koli (meaning "coal, dark") and býr "town".

name: COLE
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from the Old English byname COLA.

name: COLETTE
meaning: Short form of NICOLETTE. Saint Colette was a 15th-century French nun who gave her money to the poor. This was also the pen name of the French author Sidonie-Gabrielle Colette (1873-1954).

name: COLIN  (1)
meaning: Anglicized form of CAILEAN or COILEAN.

name: COLIN  (2)
meaning: Medieval diminutive of Col, a short form of NICHOLAS.

name: COLLEEN
meaning: Derived from the Irish word cailín meaning "girl". It is not commonly used in Ireland itself, but has been used in America since the early 20th century.

name: COLMÁN
meaning: Diminutive of Colm (see COLUM). This was the name of a large number of Irish saints.

name: COLOBERT
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements col, possibly meaning "helmet", and beraht meaning "bright".

name: COLOMBINA
meaning: Italian feminine diminutive of COLUMBA. In traditional Italian pantomimes this is the name of a stock character, the female counterpart of Arlecchino (also called Harlequin). This is also the Italian word for the columbine flower.

name: COLTON
meaning: From an English surname which was originally from a place name meaning "COLA's town".

name: COLUM
meaning: Irish form of COLUMBA. This is also an Old Irish word meaning "dove", derived from Latin columba.

name: COLUMBA
meaning: Late Latin name meaning "dove". The dove is a symbol of the Holy Spirit in Christianity. This was the name of several early saints both masculine and feminine, most notably the 6th-century Irish monk Saint Columba (or Colum) who established a monastery on the island of Iona off the coast of Scotland. He is credited with the conversion of Scotland to Christianity.

name: COLUMBAN
meaning: Possibly an Irish diminutive of COLUMBA. Alternatively, it may be derived from Old Irish colum "dove" and bán "white". The 7th-century Saint Columban of Leinster was the founder of several monasteries in Europe.

name: COLUMBANUS
meaning: This name can be viewed as a derivative of COLUMBA or a Latinized form of COLUMBAN, both derivations being approximately equivalent. This is the name of Saint Columban in Latin sources.

name: COLUMBINE
meaning: From the name of a variety of flower. It is also an English form of COLOMBINA, the pantomime character.

name: COLWYN
meaning: From the name of a river in northern Wales.

name: COMFORT
meaning: From the English word comfort, ultimately from Latin confortare "to strengthen greatly", a derivative of fortis "strong". It was used as a given name after the Protestant Reformation.

name: COMHGHALL
meaning: Means "joint pledge" from Irish comh "together" and gall "pledge".

name: COMHGHÁN
meaning: Means "born together" from Irish comh "together" and gan "born".

name: CONALL
meaning: Means "strong wolf" in Gaelic. This is the name of several characters in Irish legend including the hero Conall Cernach ("Conall of the victories"), a member of the Red Branch of Ulster, who avenged Cúchulainn's death by killing Lugaid.

name: CONAN
meaning: Means "little wolf" or "little hound" from Gaelic cú "wolf, hound" combined with a diminutive suffix. Sir Arthur Conan Doyle was the author who wrote the Sherlock Holmes mystery stories.

name: CONCEPCIÓN
meaning: Means "conception" in Spanish. This name is given in reference to the Immaculate Conception of the Virgin Mary. A city in Chile bears this name.

name: CONCHA
meaning: Diminutive of CONCEPCIÓN. This name can also mean "seashell" in Spanish.

name: CONCORDIA
meaning: Means "harmony" in Latin. This was the name of the Roman goddess of harmony and peace.

name: CONDOLEEZZA
meaning: In the case of American Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice it is derived from the Italian musical term con dolcezza meaning "with sweetness".

name: CONFUCIUS
meaning: Anglicized form of the Chinese name Kong Fuzi. The surname 孔(Kong) means "hole, opening" and the title 夫子(Fuzi) means "master". This was the name of a 6th-century BC Chinese philosopher. His given name was Qiu.

name: CONLAOCH
meaning: Possibly derived from Gaelic conn "chief" and flaith "lord". This was the name of several characters in Irish legend including a son of Cúchulainn who was accidentally killed by his father.

name: CONLETH
meaning: Modern form of the old Irish name Conláed, possibly meaning "chaste fire" from Gaelic connla "chaste" and aodh "fire". Saint Conláed was a 5th-century bishop of Kildare.

name: CONNELL
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Conaill meaning "descendant of CONALL".

name: CONNIE
meaning: Diminutive of CONSTANCE and other names beginning with Con. It is occasionally a masculine name, a diminutive of CORNELIUS or CONRAD.

name: CONOR
meaning: Anglicized form of the Gaelic name Conchobhar, derived from Old Irish con "hound, dog, wolf" and cobar "desiring". It has been in use in Ireland for centuries and was the name of several Irish kings. It was also borne by the legendary Ulster king Conchobar mac Nessa, known for his tragic desire for Deirdre.

name: CONRAD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements kuoni "brave" and rad "counsel". This was the name of a 10th-century saint and bishop of Konstanz, in southern Germany. It was also borne by several medieval German kings and dukes. In England it was occasionally used during the Middle Ages, but has only been common since the 19th century when it was reintroduced from Germany.

name: CONSOLATA
meaning: Means "consoled" in Italian. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary, María Consolata.

name: CONSTANCE
meaning: Medieval form of CONSTANTIA. The Normans introduced this name to England (it was the name of a daughter of William the Conqueror).

name: CONSTANS
meaning: Late Latin name meaning "constant, steadfast". This was the name of a 4th-century Roman emperor, a son of Constantine the Great.

name: CONSTANT
meaning: From the Late Latin name CONSTANS. It was also used by the Puritans as a vocabulary name, from the English word constant.

name: CONSTANTIA
meaning: Feminine form of the Late Latin name Constantius, which was itself derived from CONSTANS.

name: CONSTANTIN
meaning: Romanian and French form of Constantinus (see CONSTANTINE).

name: CONSTANTINE
meaning: From the Latin name Constantinus, a derivative of CONSTANS. Constantine the Great (272-337) was the first Roman emperor to adopt Christianity. He moved the capital of the empire from Rome to Byzantium, which he renamed Constantinople (modern Istanbul).

name: CONSTANTIUS
meaning: Late Latin name which was a derivative of CONSTANS.

name: CONSUELO
meaning: Means "consolation" in Spanish. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary, Nuestra Señora del Consuelo, meaning "Our Lady of Consolation".

name: CONSUS
meaning: Possibly derived from Latin conserere meaning "to sow, to plant". Consus was a Roman god of the harvest and grain.

name: CONWAY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the name of the River Conwy, which possibly means "holy water" in Welsh.

name: COOPER
meaning: From a surname meaning "barrel maker" in Middle English.

name: CORA
meaning: Latinized form of KORE. It was not used as a given name in the English-speaking world until after it was employed by James Fenimore Cooper for a character in his novel 'The Last of the Mohicans' (1826). In some cases it may be a short form of CORDULA, CORINNA or other names beginning with a similar sound.

name: CORAL
meaning: From the English and Spanish word coral for the underwater skeletal deposits which can form reefs. It is ultimately derived (via Old French and Latin) from Greek κοραλλιον(korallion).

name: CORALIE
meaning: Either a French form of KORALIA, or a derivative of Latin corallium "coral" (see CORAL).

name: CORBIN
meaning: From a French surname which was derived from corbeau "raven", originally denoting a person who had dark hair. The name was probably popularized in America by actor Corbin Bernsen (1954-).

name: CORDELIA
meaning: From Cordeilla, possibly a Celtic name of unknown meaning. According to Geoffrey of Monmouth, Cordeilla was the youngest of the three daughters of King Lear and the only one to remain loyal to her father. When adapting the character for his play 'King Lear' (1606), Shakespeare altered the spelling to Cordelia.

name: CORDELL
meaning: From a surname meaning "maker of cord" or "seller of cord" in Middle English.

name: CORDULA
meaning: Late Latin name meaning "heart" from Latin cor, cordis. Saint Cordula was one of the 4th-century companions of Saint Ursula.

name: CORENTIN
meaning: Possibly means "hurricane" in Breton. This was the name of a 5th-century bishop of Quimper in Brittany.

name: CORETTA
meaning: Diminutive of CORA. It was borne by Coretta Scott King (1927-2006), the wife of Martin Luther King.

name: COREY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the Old Norse given name Kóri, of unknown meaning. This name became popular in the 1960s due to the character Corey Baker on the television series 'Julia'.

name: CORIANDER
meaning: From the name of the spice, also called cilantro, which may ultimately be of Phoenician origin (via Latin and Greek).

name: CORINNA
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Κοριννα(Korinna), which was derived from κορη(kore) "maiden". This was the name of a Greek lyric poet of the 5th century BC. The Roman poet Ovid used it for the main female character in his book 'Amores'. In the modern era it has been in use since the 17th century, when Robert Herrick used it in his poem 'Corinna's going a-Maying'.

name: CORINNE
meaning: French form of CORINNA. The French-Swiss author Madame de Staël used it for her novel 'Corinne' (1807).

name: CORMAC
meaning: Possibly derived from Irish Gaelic corb "raven" or "wheel" and mac "son". This was the name of a 3rd-century king of Ireland.

name: CORNELIA
meaning: Feminine form of CORNELIUS. In the 2nd century BC it was borne by Cornelia Scipionis Africana (the daughter of the military hero Scipio Africanus), the mother of the two reformers known as the Gracchi. After her death she was regarded as an example of the ideal Roman woman. The name was revived in the 18th century.

name: CORNELIO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of CORNELIUS.

name: CORNELIUS
meaning: Roman family name which possibly derives from the Latin element cornu "horn". In Acts in the New Testament Cornelius is a centurion who is directed by an angel to seek Peter. After speaking with Peter he converts to Christianity, and he is traditionally deemed the first gentile convert. The name was also borne by a few early saints, including a 3rd-century pope. In England it came into use in the 16th century, partly due to Dutch influence.

name: CORNELL
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name CORNELIUS.

name: CORONA
meaning: Means "crown" in Latin, as well as Italian and Spanish. This was the name of a 2nd-century saint who was martyred with her companion Victor.

name: CORRADO
meaning: Italian form of CONRAD. This was a 14th-century saint from Piacenza, Italy.

name: CORRAIDHÍN
meaning: Means "little spear", derived from Irish corradh "spear" and a diminutive suffix.

name: CORRIE
meaning: Diminutive of CORINNA, CORA, CORNELIA and other names starting with Cor. Since the 1970s it has also been used as a feminine form of COREY.

name: CORWIN
meaning: From an English surname, derived from Old French cordoan "leather", ultimately from the name of the Spanish city of Cordova.

name: COSETTE
meaning: From French chosette meaning "little thing". This is the nickname of the illegitimate daughter of Fantine in Victor Hugo's novel 'Les Misérables' (1862). Her real name is Euphrasie, though it is seldom used. In the novel young Cosette is the ward of the cruel Thénardiers until she is retrieved by Jean Valjean.

name: COSIMO
meaning: Italian form of COSMAS. A famous bearer was Cosimo de' Medici, the 15th-century founder of Medici rule in Florence, who was a patron of the Renaissance and a successful merchant. Other members of the Medici family have also borne this name.

name: COSMAS
meaning: From the Greek name Κοσμας(Kosmas), which was derived from κοσμος(kosmos) meaning "order, decency". Saint Cosmas was martyred with his twin brother Damian in the 4th century. They are the patron saints of physicians.

name: COSME
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of COSMAS.

name: COSMO
meaning: Italian variant of COSIMO. It was introduced to Britain in the 18th century by the second Scottish Duke of Gordon, who named his son and successor after his friend Cosimo III de' Medici.

name: COURTNEY
meaning: From an aristocratic English surname which was derived either from the French place name Courtenay (originally a derivative of the personal name Curtenus, itself derived from Latin curtus "short") or else from a Norman nickname meaning "short nose". As a feminine name in America, it first became popular during the 1970s.

name: COWESSESS
meaning: From Ojibwe Ka-we-zauce meaning "little child". This was the name of a late 19th-century chief of the Saulteaux.

name: COY
meaning: From a surname which meant "quiet, shy, coy" from Middle English coi.

name: CRAIG
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from Gaelic creag meaning "crag" or "rocks", originally indicating a person who lived near a crag.

name: CRAWFORD
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "crow ford" in Old English.

name: CREE
meaning: From the name of a Native American tribe of central Canada. Their name derives via French from the Cree word kiristino.

name: CREIGHTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name, originally from Gaelic crioch "border" combined with Old English tun "town".

name: CRESCENS
meaning: Latin name which was derived from crescere "to grow". This name is mentioned briefly in one of Paul's epistles in the New Testament.

name: CRESCENTIUS
meaning: Latin name which was a derivative of the name CRESCENS. Saint Crescentius was a child martyred in Rome during the persecutions of Emperor Diocletian in the early 4th century.

name: CRESSIDA
meaning: Medieval form of CHRYSEIS. Various medieval tales describe her as a woman of Troy, daughter of Calchus, who leaves her Trojan lover Troilus for the Greek hero Diomedes. Shakespeare's play 'Troilus and Cressida' (1602) was based on these tales.

name: CRISPIN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Crispinus which was derived from the name CRISPUS. Saint Crispin was a 3rd-century Roman who was martyred with his twin brother Crispinian in Gaul. They are the patrons of shoemakers. They were popular saints in England during the Middle Ages, and the name has occasionally been used since that time.

name: CRISPUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which meant "curly-haired" in Latin.

name: CRISTIANA
meaning: Italian and Portuguese form of CHRISTINA.

name: CRISTIANO
meaning: Italian and Portuguese form of CHRISTIAN. A famous bearer is Portuguese soccer player Cristiano Ronaldo (1985-).

name: CRISTINA
meaning: Italian, Spanish, Portuguese and Romanian form of CHRISTINA.

name: CROFTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "town with a small enclosed field" in Old English.

name: CRONUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Κρονος(Kronos), possibly derived from the Indo-European root *ker- meaning "to cut". Cronus was the Titan who fathered the Greek gods. As his wife Rhea gave birth to the gods, Cronus swallowed them fearing the prophecy that he would be overthrown by one of his children. However Rhea hid Zeus, her last child, who eventually forced his father to disgorge his siblings. Cronus and the rest of the Titans were then defeated by the gods and exiled.

name: CRUZ
meaning: Means "cross" in Spanish or Portuguese, referring to the cross of the crucifixion.

name: CRYSTAL
meaning: From the English word crystal for the clear, colourless glass, sometimes cut into the shape of a gemstone. The English word derives ultimately from Greek κρυσταλλος(krystallos) meaning "ice". It has been in use as a given name since the 19th century.

name: CSABA
meaning: Possibly means either "shepherd" or "gift" in Hungarian. According to legend this was the name of the son of Attila the Hun.

name: CSENGE
meaning: Possibly derived from Hungarian cseng meaning "to ring, to clang".

name: CSILLA
meaning: Derived from Hungarian csillag meaning "star". This name was created by the Hungarian author András Dugonics for an 1803 novel and later used and popularized by the poet Mihály Vörösmarty.

name: CTIRAD
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements chisti meaning "honour" and rad meaning "happy, willing". In Czech legend this was the name of one of the men tricked by Šárka.

name: CUAUHTÉMOC
meaning: Means "falling eagle" in Nahuatl. This was the name of the last Aztec emperor, ruling until he was captured and executed by the Spanish conquistador Hernán Cortés in the year 1525.

name: CUIMÍN
meaning: Possibly from Celtic cam meaning "bent, crooked". This was the name of a 6th-century Irish saint.

name: CULHWCH
meaning: Means "hiding place of the pig" in Welsh. In Welsh legend he was the lover of Olwen the daughter of the giant Yspaddaden. Before the giant would allow Culhwch to marry his daughter, he insisted that Culhwch complete a series of extremely difficult tasks. Culhwch managed to complete them, and he returned to marry Olwen and kill the giant. This tale appears in the Mabinogion, a collection of tales from Welsh myth.

name: CULLEN
meaning: From a surname, either CULLEN(1) or CULLEN(2).

name: CUNOBELINUS
meaning: Possibly means "hound of Belenus" from the old Celtic element koun "hound" combined with the name of the god BELENUS. This was the name of a 1st-century king of southeast Britain.

name: CUNÉGONDE
meaning: French form of KUNIGUNDE. Voltaire used this name in his novel 'Candide' (1759).

name: CUPID
meaning: From the Latin Cupido meaning "desire". This was the name of the Roman god of love, the son of Venus and Mars. He was portrayed as a winged, blindfolded boy, armed with a bow and arrows which caused the victim to fall in love. His Greek equivalent was Eros.

name: CURT
meaning: Either a variant of KURT or short form of CURTIS.

name: CURTIS
meaning: From an English surname which originally meant "courteous" in Old French.

name: CUSTODIO
meaning: Means "guardian" in Spanish, from Latin custodia "protection, safekeeping".

name: CUTHBERT
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements cuþ "famous" and beorht "bright". Saint Cuthbert was a 6th-century hermit who became the bishop of Lindisfarne, an island off the coast of England. He was known as performer of healing miracles. Because of the saint, this name remained in use in England even after the Norman conquest. It became rare after the Protestant Reformation, but it was (briefly) revived in the 19th century.

name: CUÁN
meaning: Means "little wolf" or "little hound" from the Irish element cú meaning "wolf, hound" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: CVETKA
meaning: Derived from Slovene cvet meaning "blossom, flower".

name: CVIJETA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of CVETKA.

name: CY
meaning: Short form of CYRUS or CYRIL.

name: CYAN
meaning: From the English word meaning "greenish blue", ultimately derived from Greek κυανος(kyanos).

name: CYBELE
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly from Phrygian roots meaning either "stone" or "hair". This was the name of the Phrygian mother goddess associated with fertility and nature. She was later worshipped by the Greeks and Romans.

name: CYBILL
meaning: Variant of SIBYL. This name was borne by actress Cybill Shepherd (1950-), who was named after her grandfather Cy and her father Bill.

name: CYMBELINE
meaning: Form of CUNOBELINUS used by Shakespeare in his play 'Cymbeline' (1609).

name: CYNBEL
meaning: Derived from Welsh cyn "chief" and bel "war".

name: CYNEBALD
meaning: Derived from Old English cyne "royal" and beald "bold".

name: CYNEBURG
meaning: Means "royal fortress" from Old English cyne "royal" and burg "fortress". Saint Cyneburga, a daughter of a king of Mercia, was the founder of an abbey at Gloucester in the 7th century.

name: CYNEFRIÐ
meaning: Means "royal peace" from Old English cyne "royal" and friþ "peace".

name: CYNEHEARD
meaning: Derived from Old English cyne "royal" and heard "brave, hardy".

name: CYNEMÆR
meaning: Derived from Old English cyne "royal" and mær "famous".

name: CYNERIC
meaning: Derived from Old English cyne "royal" and ric "power".

name: CYNESIGE
meaning: Derived from Old English cyne "royal" and sige "victory".

name: CYNEWEARD
meaning: Derived from Old English cyne "royal" and weard "guard".

name: CYNTHIA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Κυνθια(Kynthia) which means "woman from Kynthos". This was an epithet of the Greek moon goddess Artemis, given because Kynthos was the mountain on Delos on which she and her twin brother Apollo were born. It was not used as a given name until the Renaissance, and it did not become common in the English-speaking world until the 19th century.

name: CYNWRIG
meaning: Derived from Welsh cyn meaning "chief" and gwr meaning "hero, man", plus the suffix ig indicating "has the quality of".

name: CYPRIAN
meaning: From the Roman family name Cyprianus which meant "from Cyprus" in Latin. Saint Cyprian was a 3rd-century bishop of Carthage and a martyr under the emperor Valerian.

name: CYRA
meaning: Meaning unknown. Saint Cyra was a 5th-century Syrian hermit who was martyred with her companion Marana.

name: CYRANO
meaning: Possibly derived from the name of the ancient Greek city of Cyrene, which was located in North Africa. Edmond Rostand used this name in his play 'Cyrano de Bergerac' (1897). He based his character upon a real person, Savinien Cyrano de Bergerac, a French satirist of the 17th century.

name: CYRIACUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Κυριακος(Kyriakos), which meant "of the lord" (derived from Greek κυριος(kyrios) "lord"). This was the name of a few early saints.

name: CYRIL
meaning: From the Greek name Κυριλλος(Kyrillos) which was derived from Greek κυριος(kyrios) meaning "lord", a word used frequently in the Greek Bible to refer to God or Jesus....[more]

name: CYRILLE
meaning: French form of CYRIL, sometimes used as a feminine form.

name: CYRUS
meaning: From Κυρος(Kyros), the Greek form of the Persian name Kūrush, which may mean "far sighted" or "young". The name is sometimes associated with Greek κυριος(kyrios) "lord". It was borne by several kings of Persia, including Cyrus the Great, who conquered Babylon. He is famous in the Old Testament for freeing the captive Jews and allowing them to return to Israel. As an English name, it first came into use among the Puritans after the Protestant Reformation.

name: CZCIBOR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements chisti "honour" and borti "battle".

name: CZESŁAW
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements chisti "honour" and slava "glory".

name: CÁEL
meaning: From Gaelic caol "slender". In Irish legend Cáel was a warrior of the Fianna and the lover of Créd.

name: CÁRTHACH
meaning: Means "loving" in Irish. This was the name of a 6th-century Irish saint.

name: CÉIBHFHIONN
meaning: Means "fair locks" in Irish Gaelic. This was the name of an Irish goddess of inspiration.

name: CÉLESTE
meaning: French feminine and masculine form of CAELESTIS.

name: CÉLINE
meaning: French feminine form of CAELINUS. This name can also function as a short form of MARCELINE.

name: CÉSAR
meaning: French, Spanish and Portuguese form of CAESAR. A famous bearer was the American labour organizer César Chávez (1927-1993).

name: CÔNG
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 公(công) meaning "fair, equitable, public".

name: CÚCHULAINN
meaning: Means "hound of Culann" in Irish. This was the usual name of the warrior hero who was named Sétanta at birth, given to him because he took the place of one of Culann's hounds after he accidentally killed it. Irish legend tells of Cúchulainn's many adventures, including his single-handed defense of Ulster against the army of Queen Medb.

name: D'ARTAGNAN
meaning: Means "from Artagnan" in French, Artagnan being a town in southwest France. This was the name of a character in the novel 'The Three Musketeers' (1884) by Alexandre Dumas. In the novel D'Artagnan is an aspiring musketeer who first duels with the three title characters and then becomes their friend.

name: DA
meaning: From Chinese 达(dá) meaning "achieve, arrive at, intelligent" (which is usually only masculine), 大(dà) meaning "big, great, vast, high", or other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: DACIANA
meaning: Derived from Dacia, the old Roman name for the region which is now Romania and Moldova.

name: DACRE
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name in Cumbria, of Brythonic origin meaning "trickling stream".

name: DADO  (2)
meaning: Croatian diminutive of DAMIR and other names containing the sound da.

name: DAE-JUNG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 大(dae) meaning "big, great, vast, large, high" combined with 中(jung) meaning "middle". Other combinations of hanja characters can form this name as well. A notable bearer was South Korean president Kim Dae-jung (1924-2009).

name: DAEDALUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Δαιδαλος(Daidalos) which was derived from δαιδαλλω(daidallo) meaning "to work cunningly". In Greek myth Daedalus was an Athenian inventor who was banished to Crete. There he designed the Labyrinth for King Minos, but he and his son Icarus were eventually imprisoned inside it because he had aided Theseus in his quest against the Minotaur. Daelalus and Icarus escaped using wings fashioned from wax, but Icarus fell from the sky to his death.

name: DAENERYS
meaning: Created by author George R. R. Martin for a character in his series 'A Song of Ice and Fire', first published 1996, and the television adaption 'Game of Thrones' (2011-). An explanation for the meaning of her name is not provided, though it is presumably intended to be of Valyrian origin. In the series Daenerys Targaryen is a queen of the Dothraki and a claimant to the throne of Westeros.

name: DAFFODIL
meaning: From the name of the flower, ultimately derived from Dutch de affodil meaning "the asphodel".

name: DAFINA
meaning: Albanian and Macedonian form of DAPHNE.

name: DAFYDD
meaning: Welsh form of DAVID. This name was borne by Dafydd ap Gruffydd, a 13th-century Welsh ruler, and Dafydd ap Gwilym, a 14th-century poet.

name: DAG
meaning: Derived from Old Norse dagr meaning "day".

name: DAGDA
meaning: Means "good god" in Celtic. In Irish myth Dagda (called also The Dagda) was the powerful god of the earth, knowledge, magic, abundance and treaties, a leader of the Tuatha De Danann. He was skilled in combat and healing and possessed a huge club, the handle of which could revive the dead.

name: DAGFINN
meaning: From the Old Norse name Dagfinnr, which was composed of the elements dagr "day" and Finnr "Sámi, person from Finland".

name: DAGMAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Dagmær, derived from the elements dagr "day" and mær "maid". This was the name adopted by the popular Bohemian wife of the Danish king Valdemar II when they married in 1205. Her birth name was Markéta.

name: DAGNY
meaning: From the Old Norse name Dagný, which was derived from the elements dagr "day" and ný "new".

name: DAGNÝ
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of DAGNY.

name: DAGON
meaning: Derived from Ugaritic dgn meaning "grain". This was the name of a Semitic god of agriculture, usually depicted with the body of a fish.

name: DAGRUN
meaning: From the Old Norse name Dagrún, which was derived from the Old Norse elements dagr "day" and rún "secret lore".

name: DAGRÚN
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of DAGRUN.

name: DAHLIA
meaning: From the name of the flower, which was named for the Swedish botanist Anders Dahl.

name: DAI
meaning: Derived from the old Celtic word dei meaning "to shine". This name is also used as a Welsh diminutive of DAVID.

name: DAICHI
meaning: From Japanese 大(dai) meaning "big, great" combined with 地(chi) meaning "earth, land" or 智(chi) meaning "wisdom, intellect". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: DAIKI
meaning: From Japanese 大(dai) meaning "big, great" combined with 輝(ki) meaning "brightness", 樹(ki) meaning "tree" or 貴(ki) meaning "valuable". Other combinations of kanji can also form this name.

name: DAISUKE
meaning: From Japanese 大(dai) meaning "big, great" and 輔(suke) meaning "help". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: DAISY
meaning: Simply from the English word for the white flower, ultimately derived from Old English dægeseage meaning "day eye". It was first used as a given name in the 19th century, at the same time many other plant and flower names were coined.

name: DAIVA
meaning: Created by the Lithuanian writer Vydūnas, who possibly derived it from a Sanskrit word meaning "destiny".

name: DAJANA
meaning: Serbian and Croatian form of DIANA.

name: DAKOTA
meaning: Means "allies, friends" in the Dakota language. This is the name of a Native American people of the northern Mississippi valley.

name: DALE
meaning: From an English surname which originally belonged to a person who lived near a dale or valley.

name: DALEY
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Dálaigh meaning "descendant of Dálach". The name Dálach means "assembly" in Gaelic.

name: DALIA  (1)
meaning: Spanish form of DAHLIA. The Dahlia is the national flower of Mexico.

name: DALIA  (2)
meaning: Means "fate, luck" in Lithuanian. This was the name of the Lithuanian goddess of weaving, fate and childbirth, often associated with Laima.

name: DALIBOR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements dali meaning "distance" and borti meaning "to fight".

name: DALIMIL
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements dali meaning "distance" and milu meaning "gracious, dear".

name: DALLAS
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from a Scottish place name meaning "meadow dwelling". A city in Texas bears this name, probably in honour of American Vice President George Mifflin Dallas (1792-1864).

name: DALTON
meaning: From an English surname which was originally from a place name meaning "valley town" in Old English. A notable bearer of the surname was John Dalton (1766-1844), the English chemist and physicist who theorized about the existence of atoms.

name: DALY
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of DALEY.

name: DAMARIS
meaning: Probably means "calf, heifer, girl" from Greek δαμαλις(damalis). In the New Testament this is the name of a woman converted to Christianity by Saint Paul.

name: DAMAYANTI
meaning: Means "subduing" in Sanskrit. In the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' this is the name of a beautiful princess, the wife of Nala.

name: DAMHNAIT
meaning: Means "fawn" from Gaelic damh "stag, ox" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: DAMHÁN
meaning: Means "fawn" from Gaelic damh "stag, ox" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: DAMIAN
meaning: From the Greek name Δαμιανος(Damianos) which was derived from Greek δαμαζω(damazo) "to tame". Saint Damian was martyred with his twin brother Cosmo in Syria early in the 4th century. They are the patron saints of physicians. Due to his renown, the name came into general use in Christian Europe. Another saint by this name was Peter Damian, an 11th-century cardinal and theologian from Italy.

name: DAMIR
meaning: Possibly derived from the Slavic elements dan "given" and miru "peace, world". Otherwise, it might be of Turkic origin.

name: DAMJAN
meaning: Slovene, Croatian, Serbian and Macedonian form of DAMIAN.

name: DAMJANA
meaning: Slovene, Serbian and Macedonian feminine form of DAMIAN.

name: DAMOCLES
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Δαμοκλης(Damokles), which was derived from δαμος(damos) "the people", a Doric Greek variant of δημος(demos), and κλεος(kleos) "glory". In Greek legend Damocles was a member of the court of Dionysius the Elder, the king of Syracuse. Damocles expressed envy of the king's station so Dionysius offered to switch roles with him for a day. To illustrate to Damocles the peril of a man in his position he suspended a sword over the throne.

name: DAMODARA
meaning: Means "rope around the belly", derived from Sanskrit दाम(dama) meaning "rope" and उदर(udara) meaning "belly". This is another name of the Hindu god Krishna, given to him because his foster-mother tied him to a large urn.

name: DAMON
meaning: Derived from Greek δαμαζω(damazo) meaning "to tame". According to Greek legend, Damon and Pythias were friends who lived on Syracuse in the 4th century BC. When Pythias was sentenced to death, he was allowed to temporarily go free on the condition that Damon take his place in prison. Pythias returned just before Damon was to be executed in his place, and the king was so impressed with their loyalty to one another that he pardoned Pythias. As an English given name, it has only been regularly used since the 20th century.

name: DAN  (1)
meaning: Means "he judged" in Hebrew. Dan in the Old Testament is one of the twelve sons of Jacob by Rachel's servant Bilhah, and the founder of one of the twelve tribes of Israel. His name is explained in Genesis 30:6.

name: DAN  (3)
meaning: From the Old Norse byname Danr meaning "a Dane". This was the name of several semi-legendary Danish kings.

name: DANA  (1)
meaning: Feminine form of DANIEL or DAN(1).

name: DANA  (2)
meaning: From a surname which originally belonged to a person who was Danish. It was originally given in honour of American lawyer Richard Henry Dana (1815-1882), the author of 'Two Years Before the Mast'.

name: DANA  (3)
meaning: Short form of BOGDANA, YORDANA or GORDANA.

name: DANAË
meaning: From Δαναοι(Danaoi), a word used by Homer to designate the Greeks. In Greek mythology Danaë was the daughter of the Argive king Acrisius. It had been prophesized to her father that he would one day be killed by Danaë's son, so he attempted to keep his daughter childless. However, Zeus came to her in the form of a shower of gold, and she became the mother of Perseus. Eventually the prophecy was fulfilled and Perseus killed Acrisius, albeit accidentally.

name: DANE
meaning: From an English surname which was either a variant of the surname DEAN or else an ethnic name referring to a person from Denmark.

name: DANI  (2)
meaning: Hungarian diminutive of DÁNIEL and Spanish diminutive of DANIEL.

name: DANICA
meaning: From a Slavic word meaning "morning star, Venus". This name occurs in Slavic folklore as a personification of the morning star. It has sometimes been used in the English-speaking world since the 1970s.

name: DANIEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name דָּנִיֵּאל(Daniyyel) meaning "God is my judge", from the roots דִּין(din) meaning "to judge" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". Daniel was a Hebrew prophet whose story is told in the Book of Daniel in the Old Testament. He lived during the Jewish captivity in Babylon, where he served in the court of the king, rising to prominence by interpreting the king's dreams. The book also presents Daniel's four visions of the end of the world....[more]

name: DANIELLE
meaning: French feminine form of DANIEL. It has been commonly used in the English-speaking world only since the 20th century.

name: DANIHEL
meaning: Form of DANIEL used in the Latin Bible.

name: DANIIL
meaning: Russian and Greek form of DANIEL.

name: DANKA
meaning: Diminutive of DANIJELA, DANIELA or DANUTA.

name: DANKO
meaning: Diminutive of GORDAN, DANILO or DANIJEL.

name: DANNA
meaning: Feminine form of DANIEL or DAN(1).

name: DANTE
meaning: Medieval short form of DURANTE. The most notable bearer of this name was Dante Alighieri, the 13th-century Italian poet who wrote the 'Divine Comedy'.

name: DANUTĖ
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly a feminine form of DANIEL. It is found in Lithuania from at least 14th century, being borne by a sister of Vytautas the Great.

name: DANYAL
meaning: Arabic, Persian, Urdu and Turkish form of DANIEL.

name: DAPHNE
meaning: Means "laurel" in Greek. In Greek mythology she was a nymph turned into a laurel tree by her father in order that she might escape the pursuit of Apollo. It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since the end of the 19th century.

name: DAQUAN
meaning: Combination of the popular name elements Da and quan.

name: DARA  (1)
meaning: From the Irish Mac Dara which means "oak tree". This was the name of a 6th-century saint from Connemara. It is also used as an Anglicized form of DÁIRE.

name: DARA  (2)
meaning: Means "star" in Khmer, ultimately from Sanskrit.

name: DARACH
meaning: Variant of DARA(1) or Anglicized form of DÁIRE.

name: DARAGH
meaning: Variant of DARA(1) or Anglicized form of DÁIRE.

name: DARBY
meaning: From an English surname, which was derived from the name of the town of Derby, meaning "deer town" in Old Norse.

name: DARCY
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Norman French d'Arcy, originally denoting one who came from Arcy in France. This was the surname of a character in Jane Austen's novel 'Pride and Prejudice' (1813).

name: DARDAN
meaning: From the name of the Dardani, an Illyrian tribe who lived on the Balkan Peninsula. Their name may derive from an Illyrian word meaning "pear". They were unrelated to the ancient people who were also called the Dardans who lived near Troy.

name: DARDANOS
meaning: Possibly from Greek δαρδαπτω(dardapto) "to devour". In Greek mythology Dardanos was a son of Zeus and Electra. He was the founder of the city of Dardania in Asia Minor.

name: DARDEN
meaning: From an English surname of unknown meaning, possibly from a place name.

name: DAREJAN
meaning: From the second part of NESTAN-DAREJAN.

name: DAREJANI
meaning: From the second part of NESTAN-DAREJAN.

name: DARIA
meaning: Feminine form of DARIUS. Saint Daria was a 3rd-century Greek woman who was martyred with her husband Chrysanthus under the Roman emperor Numerian. It has never been a particularly common English given name.

name: DARIAN
meaning: Probably an elaborated form of DARREN.

name: DARIJA
meaning: Croatian, Serbian and Slovene form of DARIA.

name: DARIN
meaning: Variant of DARREN. This was the adopted surname of the singer Bobby Darin (1936-1973), who was born Robert Cassotto and chose his stage name from a street sign.

name: DARINA  (2)
meaning: Derived from the Slavic word dar meaning "gift". It can also be used as a diminutive of DARIA.

name: DARINKA
meaning: Either a diminutive of DARIJA, or a derivative of the Slavic word dar meaning "gift".

name: DARIUS
meaning: Roman form of Δαρειος(Dareios), which was the Greek form of the Persian name Dārayavahush, which was composed of the elements dâraya "to possess" and vahu "good". Three ancient kings of Persia bore this name, including Darius the Great who expanded the Achaemenid Empire to its greatest extent. His forces invaded Greece but were defeated in the Battle of Marathon....[more]

name: DARIUSH
meaning: Modern Persian form of Dārayavahush (see DARIUS).

name: DARJA
meaning: Slovene and Czech form of DARIA.

name: DARKO
meaning: Originally a diminutive of names containing the Slavic element daru meaning "gift".

name: DARLENE
meaning: From the English word darling combined with the popular name suffix lene. This name has been in use since the beginning of the 20th century.

name: DARMA
meaning: Means "good deed" or "duty" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit धर्म(dharma).

name: DARNELL
meaning: From a surname, possibly derived from Old French darnel, a type of grass. Alternatively it may be derived from Old English derne "hidden" and halh "nook".

name: DARRAGH
meaning: Variant of DARA(1) or Anglicized form of DÁIRE.

name: DARRELL
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Norman French d'Airelle, originally denoting one who came from Airelle in France.

name: DARREN
meaning: The meaning of this name is not known for certain. It could be from a rare Irish surname or it could be an altered form of DARRELL. It was first brought to public attention in the late 1950s by the American actor Darren McGavin (1922-2006). It was further popularized in the 1960s by the character Darrin Stephens from the television show 'Bewitched'.

name: DARWIN
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the Old English given name Deorwine which meant "dear friend". The surname was borne by the English naturalist Charles Darwin (1809-1882), the man who first proposed the theory of natural selection and subsequently revolutionized biology.

name: DARYA  (1)
meaning: Russian and Belarusian form of DARIA.

name: DARYAWESH
meaning: Form of DARIUS used in the Hebrew Bible.

name: DASHIELL
meaning: In the case of American author Dashiell Hammett (1894-1961), it is an Anglicized form of his mother's surname De Chiel, which is of unknown meaning.

name: DATHAN
meaning: Possibly means "fountain" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the conspirators against Moses.

name: DAUD
meaning: Indonesian form of DAVID, and also a variant Arabic transcription of DAWUD.

name: DAUMANTAS
meaning: From Lithuanian daug "much" and mantus "intelligent". This name was borne by a 13th-century Lithuanian ruler of Pskov who is venerated as a saint in the Eastern Orthodox Church.

name: DAVID
meaning: From the Hebrew name דָּוִד(Dawid), which was derived from Hebrew דּוֹד(dod) meaning "beloved" or "uncle". David was the second and greatest of the kings of Israel, ruling in the 10th century BC. Several stories about him are told in the Old Testament, including his defeat of Goliath, a giant Philistine. According to the New Testament, Jesus was descended from him....[more]

name: DAVIN
meaning: Possibly a variant of DEVIN influenced by DAVID.

name: DAVINA
meaning: Feminine form of DAVID. It originated in Scotland.

name: DAVIS
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name DAVID. A famous bearer of the surname was Jefferson Davis (1808-1889), the only president of the Confederate States of America.

name: DAVIT
meaning: Georgian and Armenian form of DAVID.

name: DAVOR
meaning: Possibly from an old Slavic exclamation expressing joy or sorrow.

name: DAWID
meaning: Polish form of DAVID, as well as the original Hebrew form.

name: DAWN
meaning: From the English word dawn, ultimately derived from Old English dagung.

name: DAWSON
meaning: From a surname meaning "son of DAVID". This name was popularized in the late 1990s by the television drama 'Dawson's Creek'.

name: DAX
meaning: From an English surname which was derived either from the town of Dax in France or else from the Old English given name Dæcca (of unknown meaning).

name: DAYARAM
meaning: Means "compassion of Rama", from Sanskrit दया(daya) meaning "compassion" combined with the name of the god RAMA(1).

name: DAYTON
