meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a place name which possibly meant either "dairy town" or "ditch town" in Old English.

name: DAZHDBOG
meaning: Possibly means "the giving god" in Slavic. He was a Slavic god of the sun and light, a son of Svarog. In some myths he is the ancestor of the Russian people.

name: DEACON
meaning: Either from the occupational surname Deacon or directly from the vocabulary word deacon, which refer to a cleric in the Christian church (ultimately from Greek διακονος(diakonos) meaning "servant").

name: DEAN
meaning: From a surname, see DEAN(1) and DEAN(2). The actor James Dean (1931-1955) was a famous bearer of the surname.

name: DEANDRE
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix De and ANDRE.

name: DEANGELO
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix De and ANGELO.

name: DEANNA
meaning: Either a variant of DIANA or a feminine form of DEAN. This name was popularized by the Canadian actress and singer Deanna Durbin (1921-), whose birth name was Edna. Her stage name was a rearrangement of the letters of her real name.

name: DEARBHÁIL
meaning: Means "daughter of Fál", derived from the Old Irish poetic word der meaning "daughter" and Fál, a legendary name for Ireland.

name: DEBBORA
meaning: Form of DEBORAH used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: DEBDAS
meaning: Bengali form of DEVADAS. This is the name of a 1917 novel by the Bengali author Sarat Chandra Chattopadhyay.

name: DEBORA
meaning: Italian, German and Dutch form of DEBORAH.

name: DEBORAH
meaning: Means "bee" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament Book of Judges, Deborah is a heroine and prophetess who leads the Israelites when they are threatened by the Canaanites. She forms an army under the command of Barak, and together they destroy the army of the Canaanite commander Sisera. Also in the Old Testament, this is the name of the nurse of Rebecca....[more]

name: DECEBAL
meaning: Means "powerful, brave" in Dacian. This was the name adopted by Diurpaneus, a 1st-century king of Dacia. For many years he successfully resisted Roman expansion into his territory but was finally defeated by the forces of Emperor Trajan in 106.

name: DECIMUS
meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, meaning "tenth" in Latin.

name: DECLAN
meaning: Anglicized form of Irish Deaglán, which is of unknown meaning. Saint Declan was a 5th-century missionary to Ireland.

name: DEDRICK
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name DIEDERIK.

name: DEE
meaning: Short form of names beginning with D. It may also be given in reference to the Dee River in Scotland.

name: DEEMER
meaning: From an English and Scottish surname meaning "judge", from Old English demere.

name: DEFOREST
meaning: From a French surname meaning "from the forest". It was originally given in honour of American author John Deforest (1826-1906).

name: DEIMOS
meaning: Means "terror" in Greek. This was one of the sons of the Greek god Ares. Also, a moon of Mars bears this name.

name: DEION
meaning: Variant of DION. A notable bearer is retired American football player Deion Sanders (1967-).

name: DEIRBHILE
meaning: Means "daughter of a poet" from Old Irish der "daughter" and file "poet". This was the name of a 6th-century Irish saint.

name: DEIRDRE
meaning: From the older Gaelic form Derdriu, meaning unknown, possibly derived from Old Irish der meaning "daughter". This was the name of a tragic character in Irish legend who died of a broken heart after Conchobhar, the king of Ulster, forced her to be his bride and killed her lover Naoise....[more]

name: DEJA
meaning: Means "already" from the French phrase deja vu meaning "already seen".

name: DEJAN
meaning: Possibly derived from the South Slavic word dejati meaning "to act, to do". Otherwise it may be related to Latin deus "god".

name: DELAIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH has drawn up" in Hebrew. This is the name of several Old Testament characters.

name: DELANEY
meaning: From a surname: either the English surname DELANEY(1) or the Irish surname DELANEY(2).

name: DELANO
meaning: From a surname, recorded as de la Noye in French, indicating that the bearer was from a place called La Noue (ultimately Gaulish meaning "wetland, swamp"). It has been used in honour of American president Franklin Delano Roosevelt (1882-1945), whose middle name came from his mother's maiden name.

name: DELARA
meaning: Means "adorning the heart", from Persian دل(del) meaning "heart" and آرا(ara) meaning "decorate, adorn".

name: DELBERT
meaning: Short form of ADELBERT. As an American name it was first used in the New York area by people of Dutch ancestry.

name: DELFINA
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of DELPHINA.

name: DELIA  (1)
meaning: Means "of Delos" in Greek. This was an epithet of the Greek goddess Artemis, given because she and her twin brother Apollo were born on the island of Delos. The name appeared in several poems of the 16th and 17th centuries, and it has occasionally been used as a given name since that time.

name: DELIA  (2)
meaning: Short form of ADELIA or BEDELIA.

name: DELICIA
meaning: Either from Latin deliciae "delight, pleasure" or a variant of the English word delicious. It has only been used since the 20th century (rarely).

name: DELIGHT
meaning: Means simply "delight, happiness" from the English word.

name: DELILAH
meaning: Means "delicate, weak, languishing" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament she is the lover of Samson, whom she betrays to the Philistines by cutting his hair, which is the source of his power. Despite her character flaws, the name began to be used by the Puritans in the 17th century. It has been used occasionally in the English-speaking world since that time.

name: DELL
meaning: From an English surname which originally denoted a person who lived in a dell or valley.

name: DELLA
meaning: Diminutive of ADELA or ADELAIDE. A famous bearer is American actress and singer Della Reese (1931-).

name: DELMAR
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Norman French de la mare meaning "from the pond".

name: DELPHIA
meaning: Possibly from the name of the Greek city of Delphi, the site of an oracle of Apollo, which is possibly related to Greek δελφυς(delphys) "womb". It was used in the play 'The Prophetess' (1647), in which it belongs to the title prophetess.

name: DELPHINA
meaning: Feminine form of the Latin name Delphinus, which meant "of Delphi". Delphi was a city in ancient Greece, the name of which is possibly related to Greek δελφυς(delphys) "womb". The Blessed Delphina was a 14th-century Provençal nun.

name: DELPHINUS
meaning: Masculine form of DELPHINA. Saint Delphinus was a 4th-century bishop of Bordeaux.

name: DELTA
meaning: From the name of the fourth letter in the Greek alphabet, Δ. It is also the name for an island formed at the mouth of a river.

name: DELWYN
meaning: Means "pretty and white" from the Welsh element del "pretty" combined with gwyn "fair, white, blessed".

name: DELYTH
meaning: From an elaboration of the Welsh element del "pretty".

name: DEMELZA
meaning: From a Cornish place name meaning "fort of Maeldaf". It has been used as a given name since the middle of the 20th century. It was popularized in the 1970s by a character from the British television series 'Poldark', which was set in Cornwall.

name: DEMETER  (1)
meaning: Possibly means "earth mother", derived from Greek δα(da) "earth" and μητηρ(meter) "mother". In Greek mythology Demeter was the goddess of agriculture, the daughter of Cronus, the sister of Zeus, and the mother of Persephone. She was an important figure in the Eleusinian Mysteries, which were secret rites performed at Eleusis near Athens.

name: DEMETRA
meaning: Italian and Romanian form of DEMETER(1), as well as a variant transcription of Greek DIMITRA.

name: DEMETRIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of DEMETRIUS.

name: DEMETRIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Δημητριος(Demetrios), which was derived from the name of the Greek goddess DEMETER(1). Kings of Macedon and the Seleucid kingdom have had this name. This was also the name of several early saints including a Saint Demetrius who was martyred in the 4th century.

name: DEMOCRITUS
meaning: Latinized form of Δημοκριτος(Demokritos), a Greek name meaning "judge of the people" from the elements δημος(demos) "the people" and κριτης(krites) "judge, critic". This was the name of a Greek philosopher, the creator of the atomic theory.

name: DEMON
meaning: Ancient Greek name derived from δημος(demos) "the people".

name: DEMOSTHENES
meaning: Means "vigour of the people" from Greek δημος(demos) "the people" and σθενος(sthenos) "vigour, strength". This was the name of both an Athenian general of the 5th century and an Athenian orator of the 4th century.

name: DEMOSTRATE
meaning: Means "army of the people", derived from the Greek elements δημος(demos) "the people" and στρατος(stratos) "army".

name: DEMYAN
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of DAMIAN.

name: DENA
meaning: Possibly a short form of names ending with dena. It has also been used as a variant of DEANNA.

name: DENEB
meaning: Derived from Arabic ذنب(dhanab) meaning "tail". This is the name of a star in the constellation Cygnus.

name: DENHOLM
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from a place name meaning "valley island" in Old English.

name: DENICA
meaning: Bulgarian form and Macedonian variant of DANICA.

name: DENIS
meaning: From Denys or Denis, the medieval French forms of DIONYSIUS. Saint Denis was a 3rd-century missionary to Gaul and the first bishop of Paris. He was martyred by decapitation, after which legend says he picked up his own severed head and walked for a distance while preaching a sermon. He is credited with converting the Gauls to Christianity and is considered the patron saint of France....[more]

name: DENNIS
meaning: Usual English, German and Dutch form of DENIS.

name: DENTON
meaning: From a surname, originally from a place name, which meant "valley town" in Old English.

name: DENVER
meaning: From an English surname which was from a place name meaning "Dane ford" in Old English. This is the name of the capital city of Colorado, which was named for the politician James W. Denver (1817-1892).

name: DENZEL
meaning: Possibly a variant of DENZIL. This spelling of the name was popularized by American actor Denzel Washington (1954-), who was named after his father.

name: DENZIL
meaning: From a surname which originally denoted a person from the manor of Denzell in Cornwall. This given name was borne by several members of the noble Holles family starting in the 16th century, notably the statesman Denzil Holles (1599-1680). They were named for John Denzel, an ancestor whose home was Denzell.

name: DEODATUS
meaning: Variant of ADEODATUS or DEUSDEDIT. This name was borne by several saints.

name: DEORWINE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements deor "dear" and wine "friend".

name: DERBY
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of DARBY.

name: DEREK
meaning: From the older English name Dederick, which was in origin a Low German form of THEODORIC. It was imported to England from the Low Countries in the 15th century.

name: DERVAL
meaning: Anglicized form of DEARBHÁIL or DEIRBHILE.

name: DERVILA
meaning: Anglicized form of DEARBHÁIL or DEIRBHILE.

name: DERVLA
meaning: Anglicized form of DEARBHÁIL or DEIRBHILE.

name: DERVİŞ
meaning: From a Turkish word, which exists in English as dervish, for a Sufi ascetic. It is ultimately from Avestan drigu meaning "needy, poor".

name: DERYA
meaning: Means "sea, ocean" in Turkish, ultimately from Persian.

name: DESDEMONA
meaning: Derived from Greek δυσδαιμων(dysdaimon) meaning "ill-fated". This was the name of the murdered wife of Othello in Shakespeare's play 'Othello' (1603).

name: DESHAUN
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix De and SHAUN.

name: DESHAWN
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix De and SHAWN.

name: DESIDERATUS
meaning: Derived from Latin desideratum meaning "desired". This was the name of a 6th-century French saint.

name: DESIDERIA
meaning: Feminine form of DESIDERIO. This was the Latin name of a 19th-century queen of Sweden, the wife of Karl XIV. She was born in France with the name Désirée.

name: DESIDERIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of DESIDERIUS.

name: DESIDERIUS
meaning: Derived from Latin desiderium "longing, desire". It was the name of several early saints. It was also borne in the 8th century by the last king of the Lombard Kingdom.

name: DESIREE
meaning: English form of DÉSIRÉE. It was popularized in the English-speaking world by the movie 'Désirée' (1954).

name: DESISLAV
meaning: Derived from Slavic elements, possibly deseti meaning "ten", combined with slava "glory".

name: DESMOND
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Deasmhumhain meaning "South Munster", originally indicating a person who came from that region in Ireland.

name: DESPINA
meaning: Modern Greek and Macedonian form of DESPOINA.

name: DESPOINA
meaning: Means "mistress, lady" in Greek. In Greek mythology this was the name of the daughter of Demeter and Poseidon. She was worshipped in the Eleusinian Mysteries, which were secret rites practiced at Eleusis near Athens.

name: DESTINY
meaning: Means simply "destiny, fate" from the English word, ultimately from Latin destinare "to determine", a derivative of stare "to stand". It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world only since the last half of the 20th century.

name: DETLEF
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements theud "people" and leib "heritage".

name: DETTA
meaning: Short form of names that end in detta.

name: DEUSDEDIT
meaning: Latin name meaning "God has given". This was the name of two popes (who are also known by the related name Adeodatus).

name: DEVADAS
meaning: Means "servant of the gods" from Sanskrit देव(deva) meaning "god" and दास(dasa) meaning "servant".

name: DEVARAJA
meaning: Means "king of gods" from Sanskrit देव(deva) meaning "god" and राज(raja) meaning "king". This is another name of the Hindu god Indra.

name: DEVEREUX
meaning: From an English surname, of Norman French origin, meaning "from Evreux". Evreux is a town in France.

name: DEVI
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit देवी(devi) meaning "goddess". Devi is the Hindu mother goddess who manifests herself as all other goddesses.

name: DEVIKA
meaning: Means "little goddess" from Sanskrit देवी(devi) meaning "goddess" and क(ka) meaning "little".

name: DEVIN
meaning: From a surname, either the Irish surname DEVIN(1) or the English surname DEVIN(2).

name: DEVON
meaning: Variant of DEVIN. It may also be partly inspired by the name of the county of Devon in England, which got its name from the Dumnonii, a Celtic tribe.

name: DEWI  (1)
meaning: From Dewydd, an old Welsh form of DAVID. Saint Dewi, the patron saint of Wales, was a 6th-century Welsh bishop.

name: DEXTER
meaning: From an occupational surname meaning "one who dyes" in Old English. It also coincides with the Latin word dexter meaning "right-handed, skilled".

name: DEZI
meaning: Diminutive of DESMOND and other names beginning with a similar sound.

name: DHARMA
meaning: Means "that which is established, law, duty, virtue" in Sanskrit.

name: DIAMOND
meaning: From the English word diamond for the clear colourless precious stone, the birthstone of April. It is derived from Late Latin diamas, from Latin adamas, which is of Greek origin meaning "invincible, untamed".

name: DIANA
meaning: Probably derived from an old Indo-European root meaning "heavenly, divine", related to dyeus (see ZEUS). Diana was a Roman goddess of the moon, hunting, forests, and childbirth, often identified with the Greek goddess Artemis....[more]

name: DIANE
meaning: French form of DIANA, also regularly used in the English-speaking world.

name: DIANTHA
meaning: From dianthus, the name of a type of flower (ultimately from Greek meaning "heavenly flower").

name: DIARMAID
meaning: Perhaps means "without envy" in Irish. In Irish mythology this was the name of a warrior who became the lover of Gráinne. It was also the name of several ancient Irish kings.

name: DICK  (1)
meaning: Medieval diminutive of RICHARD. The change in the initial consonant is said to have been caused by the way the trilled Norman R was pronounced by the English.

name: DIDACUS
meaning: Form of DIEGO found in medieval Latin records.

name: DIDO
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly "virgin" in Phoenician. Dido, also called Elissa, was the queen of Carthage in Virgil's 'Aeneid'. She burned herself to death after Aeneas left her.

name: DIEDE
meaning: Short form of DIEDERIK and other names beginning with the same element, originally from Germanic theud meaning "people".

name: DIEGO
meaning: Possibly a shortened form of SANTIAGO. In medieval records Diego was Latinized as Didacus, and it has been suggested that it in fact derives from Greek διδαχη(didache) "teaching". Saint Didacus (or Diego) was a 15th-century Franciscan brother based in Alcalá, Spain. Other famous bearers of this name include Mexican muralist Diego Rivera (1886-1957) and Argentine soccer player Diego Maradona (1960-).

name: DIETER
meaning: Means "warrior of the people", derived from the Germanic elements theud "people" and hari "army".

name: DIETFRIED
meaning: Means "peace of the people" from the Germanic elements theud "people" and frid "peace".

name: DIETHELM
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements theud "people" and helm "helmet, protection".

name: DIETLINDE
meaning: From the Germanic name Theudelinda, derived from the elements theud "people" and lind "soft, tender, flexible". Theudelinda was a 6th-century queen of the Lombards.

name: DIETMAR
meaning: Means "famous people", derived from the Germanic elements theud "people" and mari "famous".

name: DIEUDONNÉ
meaning: Means "given by God" in French, used as a French form of DEUSDEDIT.

name: DIEUWE
meaning: Frisian short form of Germanic names beginning with the element diet, originally theud meaning "people".

name: DIEUWER
meaning: Frisian form of the Germanic name Dietwar, a later form of THEODOAR.

name: DIEUWERT
meaning: Frisian form of the Germanic name Dietwart, a later form of THEODOARD.

name: DIGBY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the name of an English town, itself derived from a combination of Old English dic "dyke, ditch" and Old Norse byr "farm, town".

name: DIGGORY
meaning: Probably an Anglicized form of Degaré. Sir Degaré was the subject of a medieval poem set in Brittany. The name may mean "lost one" from French égaré.

name: DIKE
meaning: Means "justice" in Greek. In Greek mythology Dike was the goddess of justice, one of the ‘Ωραι (Horai).

name: DIKLAH
meaning: Possibly means "palm grove" in Hebrew or Aramaic. In the Old Testament this is the name of a son of Joktan. In modern times it is also used as a feminine name.

name: DIKSHA
meaning: Means "preparation for a religious ceremony" in Sanskrit.

name: DILBERT
meaning: Meaning unknown. The second element is probably intended to be from Germanic beraht "bright". This is the title character in a comic strip by Scott Adams.

name: DILIPA
meaning: Means "protector of Delhi" from Sanskrit दिल्ली (see DELHI) combined with प(pa) meaning "protecting". This is the name of several kings in Hindu texts.

name: DILLON
meaning: Variant of DYLAN based on the spelling of the surname Dillon, which has an unrelated origin.

name: DILWYN
meaning: Means "genuine and white" from the Welsh element dilys "genuine" combined with gwyn "white, fair, blessed".

name: DIMAS
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of DISMAS.

name: DIMITAR
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of DEMETRIUS.

name: DIMITRI
meaning: Variant of DMITRIY, using the Church Slavic spelling.

name: DIMITRIJ
meaning: Slovene and Macedonian form of DEMETRIUS.

name: DINA  (1)
meaning: Variant of DINAH, and also the form used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: DINA  (2)
meaning: Short form of names ending in dina.

name: DINAH
meaning: Means "judged" in Hebrew. She is the daughter of Jacob and Leah in the Old Testament. It has been used as an English given name since after the Protestant Reformation.

name: DINESHA
meaning: Means "day lord" from Sanskrit दिन(dina) meaning "day" and ईश(isha) meaning "lord". In Hindu texts this is used as a name of the sun.

name: DINIS
meaning: Portuguese form of DENIS, used mainly in Portugal as opposed to Brazil (where Dênis is more common).

name: DINO
meaning: Short form of names ending in dino or tino.

name: DIOCLETIAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Diocletianus, a derivative of DIOKLES. This was the name of a Roman emperor of the 3rd and 4th centuries. He is remembered for persecuting Christians, but he also reformed and stabilized the crumbling Empire.

name: DIODORUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Διοδωρος(Diodoros) which meant "gift of Zeus", derived from the elements Διος(Dios) meaning "of ZEUS" and δωρον(doron) meaning "gift". This was the name of a 1st-century BC Greek historian.

name: DIODOTUS
meaning: Latinized form of Διοδοτος(Diodotos), a Greek name which meant "given by Zeus" from Διος(Dios) meaning "of ZEUS" and δοτος(dotos) meaning "given".

name: DIOGENES
meaning: Means "born of Zeus" from Greek Διος(Dios) meaning "of ZEUS" and γενης(genes) meaning "born". This was the name of a Greek Cynic philosopher.

name: DIOGO
meaning: Portuguese form of DIEGO. This name was borne by the 15th-century Portuguese explorer Diogo Cão.

name: DIOKLES
meaning: Means "glory of Zeus" from Greek Διος(Dios) meaning "of ZEUS" and κλεος(kleos) meaning "glory".

name: DIOMEDES
meaning: Derived from Greek Διος(Dios) meaning "of ZEUS" and μηδομαι(medomai) meaning "to think, to plan". In Greek legend Diomedes was one of the greatest heroes who fought against the Trojans. With Odysseus he entered Troy and stole the Palladium. After the Trojan War he founded the cities of Brindisi and Arpi in Italy.

name: DION
meaning: Short form of DIONYSIOS and other Greek names beginning with the Greek element Διος(Dios) meaning "of ZEUS". This was the name of a 4th-century BC tyrant of Syracuse. It has been used as an American given name since the middle of the 20th century.

name: DIONE  (1)
meaning: From Greek Διος(Dios) meaning "of ZEUS". By extension, it means "goddess". This was the name of an obscure Greek goddess who, according to some legends, was the mother of Aphrodite.

name: DIONISIA
meaning: Italian and Spanish feminine form of DIONYSIUS.

name: DIONISIO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of DIONYSIUS.

name: DIONYSIOS
meaning: Greek personal name derived from the name of the Greek god DIONYSOS. Famous bearers include two early tyrants of Syracuse and a 1st-century BC Greek rhetorician.

name: DIONYSIUS
meaning: Latin form of DIONYSIOS. Dionysius the Areopagite, who is mentioned in the New Testament, was a judge converted to Christianity by Saint Paul. This was also the name of many other early saints, including a 3rd-century pope.

name: DIONYSODOROS
meaning: Means "gift of Dionysos" from the name of the god DIONYSOS combined with Greek δωρον(doron) "gift".

name: DIONYSOS
meaning: From Greek Διος(Dios) meaning "of ZEUS" combined with NYSA, the name of the region where young Dionysos was said to have been raised. In Greek mythology Dionysos was the god of wine, revelry, fertility and dance. He was the son of Zeus and Semele.

name: DIPAKA
meaning: Means "inflaming, exciting" in Sanskrit. This is another name of Kama, the Hindu god of love.

name: DIRK
meaning: Short form of DIEDERIK. The name was popularized in the English-speaking world by actor Dirk Bogarde (1921-1999), who had some Dutch ancestry. This is also the Scots word for a type of dagger.

name: DISMAS
meaning: Derived from Greek δυσμη(dysme) meaning "sunset". This is the name traditionally given to the repentant thief who was crucified beside Jesus.

name: DITTE
meaning: Danish diminutive of EDITH or DOROTHEA.

name: DIVINA
meaning: From an elaboration of the English word divine meaning "divine, godlike".

name: DIVNA
meaning: From Serbian диван(divan) or Macedonian дивен(diven) meaning "wonderful".

name: DIXIE
meaning: From the term that refers to the southern United States, used by Daniel D. Emmett in his song Dixie in 1859. The term may be derived from French dix "ten", which was printed on ten-dollar bills issued from a New Orleans bank.

name: DIXON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "DICK(1)'s son".

name: DIỆU
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 妙(diệu) meaning "mysterious, subtle, exquisite".

name: DMITAR
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of DEMETRIUS.

name: DMITRIY
meaning: Russian form of DEMETRIUS. Dmitriy Mendeleev (1834-1907) was the Russian chemist who devised the periodic table.

name: DO-YUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 道(do) meaning "path, road, way" and 允(yun) meaning "allow, consent", as well as other hanja character combinations.

name: DOBROGOST
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements dobru "good" and gosti "guest".

name: DOBROMIL
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements dobru "good" and milu "gracious, dear".

name: DOBROSLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements dobru "good" and slava "glory".

name: DOIREANN
meaning: Means "sullen, tempestuous" in Irish. This was the name of several characters in Irish legend, including a daughter of Bodb Derg who poisoned Fionn mac Cumhail.

name: DOLLY
meaning: Diminutive of DOROTHY. Doll and Dolly were used from the 16th century, and the common English word doll (for the plaything) is derived from them. In modern times this name is also sometimes used as a diminutive of DOLORES.

name: DOLORES
meaning: Means "sorrows", taken from the Spanish title of the Virgin Mary María de los Dolores, meaning "Mary of Sorrows". It has been used in the English-speaking world since the 19th century, becoming especially popular in America during the 1920s and 30s.

name: DOMAGOJ
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements domu "home" and gojiti "grow, heal, foster, nurture".

name: DOMENICO
meaning: Italian form of DOMINIC. Domenico Veneziano was a Renaissance painter who lived in Florence.

name: DOMINIC
meaning: From the Late Latin name Dominicus meaning "of the Lord". This name was traditionally given to a child born on Sunday. Several saints have borne this name, including the 13th-century founder of the Dominican order of friars. It was in this saint's honour that the name was first used in England, starting around the 13th century. It is primarily used by Catholics.

name: DOMINICUS
meaning: Original Latin form of DOMINIC, as well as the modern Dutch form.

name: DOMINIQUE
meaning: French feminine and masculine form of DOMINIC.

name: DOMITIAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Domitianus, itself derived from the family name DOMITIUS. This was the name of a 1st-century Roman emperor, Titus Flavius Domitianus.

name: DOMITILA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of DOMITILLA.

name: DOMITILLA
meaning: Feminine diminutive of the Roman family name DOMITIUS. This was the name of the wife of the Roman emperor Vespasian and the mother of emperors Titus and Domitian.

name: DOMITIUS
meaning: Roman family name which was probably derived from Latin domitus meaning "having been tamed".

name: DONALD
meaning: From the Gaelic name Domhnall which means "ruler of the world", composed of the old Celtic elements dumno "world" and val "rule". This was the name of two 9th-century kings of the Scots and Picts. It has traditionally been very popular in Scotland, and during the 20th century it became common in the rest of the English-speaking world. This is the name of one of Walt Disney's most popular cartoon characters, Donald Duck. It was also borne by Australian cricket player Donald Bradman (1908-2001).

name: DONAR
meaning: Continental Germanic cognate of Þórr (see THOR).

name: DONAT
meaning: French, Occitan, Catalan and Polish form of Donatus (see DONATO).

name: DONATELLO
meaning: Diminutive of DONATO. The Renaissance sculptor Donato di Niccolo di Bette Bardi was better known as Donatello.

name: DONATIANUS
meaning: Derivative of Donatus (see DONATO). This was the name of a few early saints.

name: DONATO
meaning: From the Late Latin name Donatus meaning "given". Several early saints had this name. The name was also borne by two Renaissance masters: the sculptor Donato di Niccolo di Bette Bardi (also known as Donatello), and the architect Donato Bramante.

name: DONG
meaning: From Chinese 东(dōng) meaning "east", 栋(dòng) meaning "pillar, beam", or other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: DONG-GEUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 東(dong) meaning "east" and 根(geun) meaning "root, foundation", as well as other hanja character combinations.

name: DONNA
meaning: From Italian donna meaning "lady". It is also used as a feminine form of DONALD.

name: DONNDUBHÁN
meaning: Composed of the Gaelic element donn "brown" combined with dubh "dark" and a diminutive suffix.

name: DONOVAN
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Donndubháin meaning "descendant of DONNDUBHÁN".

name: DORA
meaning: Short form of DOROTHY, THEODORA or ISIDORA.

name: DORAN
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Deoráin meaning "descendant of Deoradhán". The name Deoradhán means "exile, wanderer" in Gaelic.

name: DORCAS
meaning: Derived from Greek δορκας(dorkas) meaning "gazelle". This is the Greek translation of the name Tabitha in the New Testament (see Acts 9:36).

name: DOREEN
meaning: Combination of DORA and the name suffix een. The name was (first?) used by novelist Edna Lyall in her novel 'Doreen' (1894).

name: DORES
meaning: Portuguese and Galician form of DOLORES.

name: DORIA
meaning: Possibly a feminine form of DORIAN or an elaboration of DORA.

name: DORIAN
meaning: The name was first used by Oscar Wilde in his novel 'The Picture of Dorian Gray' (1891), which tells the story of a man whose portrait ages while he stays young. Wilde may have taken it from the name of the ancient Greek tribe the Dorians, or from the surname DORAN.

name: DORIN
meaning: Romanian, possibly a form of DORIAN or a diminutive of TEODOR.

name: DORINDA
meaning: Combination of DORA and the name suffix inda. It was apparently coined by the English writers John Dryden and William D'Avenant for their play 'The Enchanted Island' (1667). In the play, a loose adaptation of Shakespeare's 'The Tempest', Dorinda is the sister of Miranda.

name: DORIS
meaning: From the ancient Greek name Δωρις(Doris) which meant "Dorian woman". The Dorians were a Greek tribe who occupied the Peloponnese starting in the 12th century BC. In Greek mythology Doris was a sea nymph, one of the many children of Oceanus and Tethys. It began to be used as an English name in the 19th century. A famous bearer is the American actress Doris Day (1924-).

name: DOROTA
meaning: Polish, Czech and Slovak form of DOROTHEA.

name: DOROTEJA
meaning: Slovene, Croatian, Serbian and Macedonian form of DOROTHEA.

name: DOROTHEA
meaning: Feminine form of the Late Greek name Δωροθεος(Dorotheos), which meant "gift of God" from Greek δωρον(doron) "gift" and θεος(theos) "god". The name Theodore is composed of the same elements in reverse order. Dorothea was the name of two early saints, notably the 4th-century martyr Dorothea of Caesarea. It was also borne by the 14th-century Saint Dorothea of Montau, who was the patron saint of Prussia.

name: DOROTHEOS
meaning: Original Greek masculine form of DOROTHEA.

name: DOROTHY
meaning: Usual English form of DOROTHEA. It has been in use since the 16th century. The author L. Frank Baum used it for the central character in his fantasy novel 'The Wonderful Wizard of Oz' (1900).

name: DORY
meaning: Diminutive of DOROTHY or DORIS. This is the name of a fish in the animated film 'Finding Nemo' (2003).

name: DOUGAL
meaning: Anglicized form of the Gaelic name Dubhghall, which meant "dark stranger" from dubh "dark" and gall "stranger".

name: DOUGLAS
meaning: Anglicized form of the Scottish surname Dubhghlas, meaning "dark river" from Gaelic dubh "dark" and glais "water, river" (an archaic word related to glas "grey, green"). Douglas was originally a place name (for example, a tributary of the River Clyde), which then became a Scottish clan name borne by a powerful line of earls. It has been used as a given name since the 16th century.

name: DOVE
meaning: From the English word for the variety of bird, seen as a symbol of peace.

name: DOYLE
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Dubhghaill meaning "descendant of Dubhghall" (see DOUGAL). Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (1859-1930) was the author of the Sherlock Holmes mystery stories.

name: DRACO
meaning: From the Greek name Δρακων(Drakon) which meant "dragon, serpent". This was the name of a 7th-century BC Athenian legislator. This is also the name of a constellation in the northern sky.

name: DRAGAN
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element dragu meaning "precious".

name: DRAGICA
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element dragu meaning "precious".

name: DRAGO
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element dragu meaning "precious". It is also a short form of other Slavic names beginning with that element.

name: DRAGOMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element dragu meaning "precious" combined with miru meaning "peace, world".

name: DRAGOSLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements dragu meaning "precious" and slava "glory".

name: DRAGOȘ
meaning: Originally a short form of Slavic names beginning with the element dragu "precious", such as DRAGOMIR. This was the name of a 14th-century ruler of Moldavia.

name: DRAGUTIN
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element dragu meaning "precious".

name: DRAHOMÍR
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of DRAGOMIR.

name: DRAHOMÍRA
meaning: Czech and Slovak feminine form of DRAGOMIR.

name: DRAHOSLAV
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of DRAGOSLAV.

name: DRAHOSLAVA
meaning: Czech and Slovak feminine form of DRAGOSLAV.

name: DRAKE
meaning: From an English surname derived from the Old Norse byname Draki or the Old English byname Draca both meaning "dragon", both via Latin from Greek δρακων(drakon) meaning "dragon, serpent". This name coincides with the unrelated English word drake meaning "male duck".

name: DRAUPADI
meaning: Means "daughter of DRUPADA" in Sanskrit. In the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' this is the name of the daughter of King Drupada. She married all of the Pandavas, the five sons of Pandu.

name: DRAVEN
meaning: From a surname (of unknown meaning) which was used in the movie 'The Crow' (1994).

name: DRAŠKO
meaning: Diminutive of names containing the Slavic element dragu meaning "precious".

name: DRAŽEN
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element dragu meaning "precious".

name: DRISCOLL
meaning: From an Irish surname which was an Anglicized form of Ó Eidirsceóil meaning "descendant of the messenger".

name: DROGO
meaning: Norman name, possibly derived from Gothic dragen "to carry" or Saxon drog "ghost". Alternatively, it could be from the Slavic element dragu "precious, dear". The Normans introduced this name to England.

name: DROUSILLA
meaning: Form of DRUSILLA used in the Greek New Testament.

name: DRUMMOND
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from various place names, themselves derived from Gaelic druim meaning "ridge".

name: DRUPADA
meaning: Means "wooden pillar" or "firm footed" in Sanskrit. In the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' this is the name of a king of Panchala, the father of Draupadi and Dhrishtadyumna.

name: DRUSILLA
meaning: Feminine diminutive of the Roman family name DRUSUS. In Acts in the New Testament Drusilla is the wife of Felix.

name: DRUST
meaning: Pictish name probably derived from Celtic drest meaning "riot" or "tumult". This name was borne by several kings of the Picts, including their last king Drust X, who ruled in the 9th century.

name: DRUSTAN
meaning: Older form of TRISTAN. This name was borne by a 7th-century Scottish saint.

name: DRUSUS
meaning: Roman family name, also sometimes used as a praenomen, or given name, by the Claudia family. Apparently the name was first assumed by a Roman warrior who killed a Gallic chieftain named Drausus in single combat. Drausus possibly derives from a Celtic element meaning "strong".

name: DUANE
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of the Gaelic surname Ó Dubhán meaning "descendant of DUBHÁN".

name: DUARTE
meaning: Portuguese form of EDWARD. This name was borne by a 15th-century king of Portugal, who was named after his maternal ancestor Edward III of England.

name: DUBHSHLÁINE
meaning: Old Irish name derived from dubh "dark, black" and either slán "defiance" or Sláine, the Gaelic name of the River Slaney.

name: DUBHTHACH
meaning: Old Irish name derived from dubh "dark, black" in combination with a second element of unknown meaning.

name: DUBHÁN
meaning: Irish name derived from dubh "dark, black" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: DUBRAVKO
meaning: From the old Slavic word dubrava meaning "oak grove".

name: DUDA
meaning: Portuguese diminutive of EDUARDO or EDUARDA.

name: DUDLEY
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "Dudda's clearing" in Old English. The surname was borne by a British noble family.

name: DUILIO
meaning: From the Roman name Duilius, which is possibly derived from Latin duellum "war". This was the name of a Roman consul who defeated the Carthaginians in a naval battle.

name: DUKE
meaning: From the noble title duke, which was originally derived from Latin dux "leader".

name: DUKVAKHA
meaning: Means "to live long", derived from Nakh duqa "many" and vakha "to live".

name: DULCIBELLA
meaning: From Latin dulcis "sweet" and bella "beautiful". The usual medieval spelling of this name was Dowsabel, and the Latinized form Dulcibella was revived in the 18th century.

name: DULCIE
meaning: From Latin dulcis meaning "sweet". It was used in the Middle Ages in the spellings Dowse and Duce, and was recoined in the 19th century.

name: DULCINEA
meaning: Derived from Spanish dulce meaning "sweet". This name was (first?) used by Miguel de Cervantes in his novel 'Don Quixote' (1605), where it belongs to the love interest of the main character, though she never actually appears in the story.

name: DUNCAN
meaning: Anglicized form of the Gaelic name Donnchadh, derived from Gaelic donn "brown" and cath "battle". This was the name of two kings of Scotland, including the one who was featured in Shakespeare's play 'Macbeth' (1606).

name: DUNJA
meaning: Serbian, Croatian and Slovene form of DUNYA. This also means "quince" in the South Slavic languages, a quince being a type of fruit.

name: DUNSTAN
meaning: From the Old English elements dunn "dark" and stan "stone". This name was borne by a 10th-century saint, the archbishop of Canterbury. It was occasionally used in the Middle Ages, though it died out after the 16th century. It was revived by the Tractarian movement in the 19th century.

name: DURANTE
meaning: Italian form of the Late Latin name Durans which meant "enduring".

name: DURGA
meaning: Means "unattainable" in Sanskrit. Durga is a Hindu warrior goddess, the fierce, twelve-armed, three-eyed form of the wife of Shiva. She is considered an incarnation of Parvati.

name: DURWARD
meaning: From an occupational surname which meant "door guard" in Middle English.

name: DUSHYANTA
meaning: Possibly means "destroyer of evil" in Sanskrit. In Hindu legend this is the name of a king who is the husband of Shakuntala and the father of Bharata.

name: DUSTIN
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Old Norse given name Þórsteinn (see TORSTEN). The name was popularized by the actor Dustin Hoffman (1937-), who was apparently named after the earlier silent movie star Dustin Farnum (1874-1929).

name: DUSTY
meaning: From a nickname originally given to people perceived as being dusty. It is also used a diminutive of DUSTIN. A famous bearer was British singer Dusty Springfield (1939-1999), who acquired her nickname as a child.

name: DUTCH
meaning: From a nickname given to Americans of German descent. It is derived from Deutsch, the German word for the German people.

name: DUŠAN
meaning: Derived from Slavic dusha meaning "soul, spirit".

name: DWI
meaning: Means "two, second" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit द्वि(dvi).

name: DWIGHT
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the medieval feminine name Diot, a diminutive of Dionysia, the feminine form of DIONYSIUS. In America it was sometimes given in honour of Yale president Timothy Dwight (1752-1817). A famous bearer was the American president Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969).

name: DWYN
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of the Celtic god of love.

name: DYLAN
meaning: From the Welsh elements dy meaning "great" and llanw meaning "tide, flow". In Welsh mythology Dylan was a god or hero associated with the sea. He was the son of Arianrhod and was accidentally slain by his uncle Govannon....[more]

name: DYMPHNA
meaning: Anglicized form of DAMHNAIT. This was the name of a 7th-century Irish saint who was martyred by her father. She is the patron saint of the mentally ill.

name: DYSON
meaning: From an English surname which meant "son of DYE".

name: DZHOKHAR
meaning: Possibly from Persian گوهر(gohar) "jewel, essence" or جوهر(johar) "essence, ink" (which comes from the same root, but via a loan to Arabic and retransmission to Persian).

name: DÁIRE
meaning: Means "fruitful, fertile" in Irish Gaelic. This name is borne by many figures in Irish legend, including the Ulster chief who reneged on his promise to loan the Brown Bull of Cooley to Medb, starting the war between Connacht and Ulster as told in the Irish epic 'The Cattle Raid of Cooley'.

name: DÁIRÍNE
meaning: Derived from Irish Gaelic dáire meaning "fruitful, fertile".

name: DÁITHÍ
meaning: Possibly means "swift" in Irish Gaelic. It is sometimes used as an Irish form of David.

name: DÁNIEL
meaning: Hungarian and Faroese form of DANIEL.

name: DÁVID
meaning: Hungarian and Slovak form of DAVID.

name: DÉBORA
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and French form of DEBORAH.

name: DÉLIA
meaning: Portuguese, French and Hungarian form of DELIA(1).

name: DÉSIRÉE
meaning: French form of DESIDERATA. In part it is directly from the French word meaning "desired, wished".

name: DÊNIS
meaning: Portuguese form of DENIS, used mainly in Brazil as opposed to Portugal (where Dinis is more common).

name: DÓNAL
meaning: Modern Irish form of Domhnall (see DONALD).

name: DÓRA
meaning: Short form of DOROTTYA and names that end in dóra, such as TEODÓRA or HALLDÓRA.

name: DİDEM
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly from Persian دیده(dideh) meaning "eye".

name: EA  (1)
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps from Sumerian meaning "house of water". This was the Akkadian and Babylonian name of the Sumerian water god Enki.

name: EA  (2)
meaning: Short form of names ending in ea.

name: EACHANN
meaning: Means "brown horse" from Gaelic each "horse" and donn "brown". It was sometimes Anglicized as Hector.

name: EADBERHT
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ead "wealth, fortune" and beorht "bright". This was the name of an 8th-century king of Northumbria and three kings of Kent.

name: EADBURG
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ead "wealth, fortune" and burg "fortress".

name: EADWIG
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ead "wealth, fortune" and wig "war". This was the name of a Saxon king of England in the 10th century. The name fell out of use after the Norman conquest.

name: EADWULF
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ead "wealth, fortune" and wulf "wolf". This name fell out of use after the Norman conquest.

name: EALDGYÐ
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements eald "old" and gyð "battle".

name: EALDRÆD
meaning: From the Old English elements eald "old" and ræd "counsel". This name was rarely used after the Norman conquest.

name: EALDWINE
meaning: From the Old English elements eald "old" and wine "friend". This name was rarely used after the Norman conquest.

name: EALHHERE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ealh "temple" and here "army".

name: EALHSTAN
meaning: Derived from the Old English element ealh "temple" combined with stan "stone".

name: EARDWULF
meaning: Derived from the Old English element eard "land" combined with wulf "wolf".

name: EARL
meaning: From the aristocratic title, which derives from Old English eorl "nobleman, warrior". It has been used as a given name since the 19th century.

name: EARNEST
meaning: Variant of ERNEST influenced by the spelling of the English word earnest.

name: EARTHA
meaning: Combination of the English word earth with the feminine name suffix a. It has been used in honour of African-American philanthropist Eartha M. M. White (1876-1974). Another famous bearer was American singer and actress Eartha Kitt (1927-2008).

name: EASTER
meaning: From the English name of the Christian festival celebrating the resurrection of Jesus. It was ultimately named for the Germanic spring goddess Eostre. It was traditionally given to children born on Easter, though it is rare in modern times.

name: EASTON
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from place names meaning "east town" in Old English.

name: EBBA  (2)
meaning: From the Old English name Æbbe, meaning unknown, perhaps a contracted form of a longer name. Saint Ebba was a 7th-century daughter of King Æthelfrith of Bernicia and the founder of monasteries in Scotland. Another saint named Ebba was a 9th-century abbess and martyr who mutilated her own face so that she would not be raped by the invading Danes.

name: EBBE
meaning: Diminutive of EBERHARD and other names beginning with the Germanic element ebur meaning "wild boar". In Scandinavia it is also a diminutive of ESBEN.

name: EBENEZER
meaning: Means "stone of help" in Hebrew. This was the name of a monument erected by Samuel in the Old Testament. Charles Dickens used it for the miserly character Ebenezer Scrooge in his novel 'A Christmas Carol' (1843).

name: EBERHARD
meaning: German form of EVERARD. This name was borne by a 9th-century Duke of Friuli.

name: EBONY
meaning: From the English word ebony for the black wood which comes from the ebony tree. It is ultimately from the Egyptian word hbnj. In America this name is most often used by black parents.

name: EBRAHIM
meaning: Persian form of ABRAHAM. It is also a variant transcription of Arabic IBRAHIM.

name: EBRU
meaning: Means "paper marbling" in Turkish. Paper marbling is the art of creating colourful patterns on paper.

name: ECHO
meaning: Means "echo" from the word for the repeating reflected sound, which derives from Greek ηχη(eche) "sound". In Greek mythology Echo was a nymph given a speech impediment by Hera, so that she could only repeat what others said. She fell in love with Narcissus, but her love was not returned, and she pined away until nothing remained of her except her voice.

name: ECRİN
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly from an Arabic word meaning "reward".

name: ED
meaning: Short form of EDWARD, EDMUND, and other names beginning with Ed.

name: EDANA
meaning: Latinized form of ÉTAÍN. This was the name of an early Irish saint.

name: EDDA  (2)
meaning: Possibly from Old Norse meaning "great-grandmother". This was the name of two 13th-century Icelandic literary works: the Poetic Edda and the Prose Edda. This is also the name of a character in the Poetic Edda, though it is unclear if her name is connected to the name of the collection.

name: EDDIE
meaning: Diminutive of EDWARD, EDMUND, and other names beginning with Ed.

name: EDDY
meaning: Diminutive of EDWARD, EDMUND, and other names beginning with Ed.

name: EDEN
meaning: Means "place of pleasure" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament the Garden of Eden was the place where the first people, Adam and Eve, lived before they were expelled.

name: EDER  (1)
meaning: Means "flock" in Hebrew. This was the name of a son of Beriah in the Old Testament.

name: EDGAR
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ead "wealth, fortune" and gar "spear". This was the name of a 10th-century English king, Edgar the Peaceful. The name did not survive long after the Norman conquest, but it was revived in the 18th century, in part due to a character by this name in Sir Walter Scott's novel 'The Bride of Lammermoor' (1819), which tells of the tragic love between Edgar Ravenswood and Lucy Ashton. Famous bearers include author and poet Edgar Allan Poe (1809-1849), French impressionist painter Edgar Degas (1834-1917), and author Edgar Rice Burroughs (1875-1950).

name: EDGARDO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of EDGAR.

name: EDI
meaning: Slovene diminutive of EDVARD and a Croatian diminutive of EDUARD.

name: EDINA
meaning: Possibly a Hungarian form of a Germanic name.

name: EDISON
meaning: From an English surname which meant either "son of EDA(2)" or "son of ADAM". A famous bearer of the surname was the inventor Thomas Edison (1847-1931).

name: EDIT
meaning: Hungarian and Swedish form of EDITH.

name: EDITH
meaning: From the Old English name Eadgyð, derived from the elements ead "wealth, fortune" and gyð "war". It was popular among Anglo-Saxon royalty, being borne for example by Saint Eadgyeth;, the daughter of King Edgar the Peaceful. The name remained common after the Norman conquest. It became rare after the 15th century, but was revived in the 19th century.

name: EDMAO
meaning: Limburgish form of EDMUND. Its spelling has been influenced by the French pronunciation of Edmond.

name: EDMOND
meaning: French form of EDMUND. A notable bearer was the English astronomer Edmond Halley (1656-1742), for whom Halley's comet is named.

name: EDMUND
meaning: From the Old English elements ead "wealth, fortune" and mund "protection". This was the name of two Anglo-Saxon kings of England. It was also borne by two saints, including a 9th-century king of East Anglia who, according to tradition, was shot to death with arrows after refusing to divide his Christian kingdom with an invading pagan Danish leader. This Old English name remained in use after the Norman conquest (even being used by King Henry III for one of his sons), though it became less common after the 15th century....[more]

name: EDMUNDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of EDMUND.

name: EDNA  (2)
meaning: Means "pleasure" in Hebrew. This name appears in the Old Testament Apocrypha in the Book of Tobit.

name: EDOM
meaning: Means "red" in Hebrew. According to the Old Testament, Esau was given this name because he traded his birthright for a helping of red broth. The bible goes on to tell that Esau was the founder of the ancient nation of Edom, located to the south of the kingdom of Judah.

name: EDRIC
meaning: From the Old English elements ead "wealth, fortune" and ric "rule". After the Norman conquest this Old English name was not commonly used. It has occasionally been revived in modern times.

name: EDSEL
meaning: Variant of ETZEL notably borne by Edsel Ford (1893-1943), the son of the American industrialist Henry Ford.

name: EDUARDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of EDWARD.

name: EDUR
meaning: Means "snow" in Basque. It is a Basque equivalent of Nieves.

name: EDVIN
meaning: Scandinavian, Finnish, Estonian and Hungarian form of EDWIN.

name: EDWARD
meaning: Means "rich guard", derived from the Old English elements ead "wealth, fortune" and weard "guard". This was the name of several Anglo-Saxon kings, the last being Saint Edward the Confessor shortly before the Norman conquest in the 11th century. He was known as a just ruler, and because of his popularity his name remained in use after the conquest when most other Old English names were replaced by Norman ones. The 13th-century Plantagenet king Henry III named his son and successor after the saint, and seven subsequent kings of England were also named Edward....[more]

name: EDWIN
meaning: Means "rich friend" from the Old English elements ead "wealth, fortune" and wine "friend". This was the name of a 7th-century Northumbrian king, regarded as a saint. After the Norman conquest the name was not popular, but it was eventually revived in the 19th century. A notable bearer was the astronaut Edwin Aldrin (1930-), also known as Buzz, the second man to walk on the moon.

name: EEF
meaning: Short form of names beginning with Ev, such as EVA or EVERT.

name: EERO
meaning: Finnish form of ERIC. A famous bearer was the architect Eero Saarinen (1910-1961).

name: EFE  (2)
meaning: Short form of EFEMENA or other names containing efe "wealth".

name: EFEMENA
meaning: Means "here is my wealth" in Urhobo.

name: EFISIO
meaning: From the Latin byname Ephesius, which originally belonged to a person who was from the city of Ephesus in Ionia. This was the name of a saint martyred on Sardinia in the 4th century.

name: EGBERT
meaning: Means "bright edge" from the Old English elements ecg "edge of a sword" and beorht "bright". This was the name of kings of Kent and Wessex as well as two English saints. The name was rarely used after the Norman conquest but was revived in the 19th century.

name: EGIL
meaning: From the Old Norse name Egill, a diminutive of names that began with the element agi "awe, terror". This was the name of a semi-legendary Icelandic warrior.

name: EGILHARD
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements agil "edge of a sword" and hard "brave, hardy".

name: EGILL
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of EGIL.

name: EGLANTINE
meaning: From the English word for the flower also known as sweetbrier. It was first used as a given name (in the form Eglentyne) in Geoffrey Chaucer's 14th-century story 'The Prioress's Tale'.

name: EGLĖ
meaning: Means "spruce tree" in Lithuanian. In a Lithuanian legend Eglė was a young woman who married a sea snake.

name: EGON
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element ag, which means "edge of a sword".

name: EHECATL
meaning: Means "wind" in Nahuatl. Ehecatl was the name of the Aztec wind god.

name: EHUD
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly related to Hebrew אֶחָד('echad) meaning "one". In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the biblical judges. He killed Eglon, the king of Moab, and freed the city of Jericho from Moabite rule.

name: EIFION
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was an old Welsh name that was revived in the 19th century.

name: EIJA
meaning: Possibly from the Finnish happy exclamation eijaa.

name: EIKE
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Germanic element ag "edge".

name: EILEEN
meaning: Anglicized form of EIBHLÍN. It is also sometimes considered an Irish form of HELEN. It first became popular in the English-speaking world outside of Ireland near the end of the 19th century.

name: EILERT
meaning: Frisian and Scandinavian form of EGILHARD.

name: EILIDH
meaning: Diminutive of EILIONOIR, sometimes taken to be a Gaelic form of HELEN.

name: EILWEN
meaning: Perhaps means "white brow" from Welsh ael "brow" and gwen "white, fair, blessed".

name: EILÍS
meaning: Irish Gaelic form of ELIZABETH (or sometimes of ALICE).

name: EINAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Einarr, derived from the elements ein "one, alone" and arr "warrior". This name shares the same roots as einherjar, the word for the slain warriors in Valhalla.

name: EINDRIDE
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse name Eindriði, possibly from the elements ein "one, alone" and ríða "to ride".

name: EINION
meaning: Probably from the Latin name Ennianus, a derivative of Ennius (see ENNIO). It is also a modern Welsh word meaning "anvil". This was the name of a 5th-century Welsh king who is considered a saint in some Christian traditions.

name: EINO
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly a Finnish form of a Scandinavian name.

name: EIR
meaning: Means "mercy" in Old Norse. This was the name of a Norse goddess of healing and medicine.

name: EIREANN
meaning: From Éireann, the genitive case of Gaelic Éire, meaning "Ireland". It is commonly Anglicized as Erin.

name: EIRWEN
meaning: Means "white snow" from the Welsh elements eira "snow" and gwen "white, blessed".

name: EITHNE
meaning: Means "kernel, grain" in Irish. This was the name of a 5th-century Irish saint, sister of Saint Fidelma and follower of Saint Patrick.

name: EJDER
meaning: Means "dragon" in Turkish, of Persian origin.

name: EJIRO
meaning: Short form of EJIROGHENE or other names containing ejiro "praise".

name: EKA  (1)
meaning: Means "one, first" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit एक(eka).

name: EKATERINA
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of KATHERINE, and a variant Russian transcription of YEKATERINA.

name: EKENEDILICHUKWU
meaning: Means "all praise to God" in Igbo.

name: EKKEHARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ag "edge" and hard "brave, hardy".

name: EKWUEME
meaning: Means "he says, he does" in Igbo.

name: EL
meaning: From a Semitic word meaning "god", perhaps originally derived from a root meaning "power". This was the name of the chief Semitic god, the father of the gods and mankind. In some cases it was used as a title and applied to other gods of the pantheon. It was used by the Hebrews to refer to Yahweh.

name: ELAH
meaning: Means "oak tree" or "terebinth tree" in Hebrew. This was the name of the fourth king of Israel, as told in the Old Testament. He was murdered by Zimri, who succeeded him. In modern Hebrew this is typically a feminine name.

name: ELAINE
meaning: From an Old French form of HELEN. It appears in Arthurian legend; in Thomas Malory's 15th-century compilation 'Le Morte d'Arthur' Elaine was the daughter of Pelleas, the lover of Lancelot, and the mother of Galahad. It was not commonly used as an English given name until after the appearance of Tennyson's Arthurian epic 'Idylls of the King' (1859).

name: ELAM
meaning: Possibly means either "hidden" or "eternity" in Hebrew. This was the name of several characters in the Old Testament, including a son of Shem who was the ancestor of the Elamite peoples.

name: ELANOR
meaning: Means "star sun" in Sindarin. In 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954) by J. R. R. Tolkien this is Sam's eldest daughter, named after a type of flower.

name: ELBA
meaning: Possibly a Spanish variant form of ALBA(3).

name: ELDAD
meaning: Means "God has loved" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is one of the two elders who prophesizes in the Israelite camp.

name: ELDAR
meaning: From Turkic el meaning "country, society" combined with the Persian suffix دار(dar) meaning "possessor".

name: ELDON
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name meaning "Ella's hill" in Old English.

name: ELDRED
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from EALDRÆD.

name: ELEA
meaning: Short form of ELEANOR. This was also the name of an ancient Italian town (modern Velia) which is well known for being the home of the philosopher Parmenides and his student Zeno of Elea, who was famous for his paradoxes.

name: ELEANOR
meaning: From the Old French form of the Occitan name Aliénor. Among the name's earliest bearers was the influential Eleanor of Aquitaine (12th century), who was the queen of Louis VII, the king of France, and later Henry II, the king of England. She was named Aenor after her mother, and was called by the Occitan phrase alia Aenor "the other AENOR" in order to distinguish her from her mother. However, there appear to be examples of bearers prior to Eleanor of Aquitaine. It is not clear whether they were in fact Aenors who were retroactively recorded as having the name Eleanor, or whether there is an alternative explanation for the name's origin....[more]

name: ELEAZAR
meaning: From the Hebrew name אֶלְעָזָר('El'azar) meaning "my God has helped". In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the sons of Aaron.

name: ELECTRA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Ηλεκτρα(Elektra), derived from ηλεκτρον(elektron) meaning "amber". In Greek myth she was the daughter of Agamemnon and Clytemnestra and the sister of Orestes. She helped her brother kill their mother and her lover Aegisthus in vengeance for Agamemnon's murder. Also in Greek mythology, this name was borne by one of the Pleiades, who were the daughters of Atlas and Pleione.

name: ELEFTHERIOS
meaning: Modern Greek form of Eleutherios (see ELEUTHERIUS).

name: ELEN
meaning: Welsh form of HELEN. This was the name of a 4th-century Welsh saint. It also appears in the Mabinogion, a collection of tales from Welsh myth, belonging to a woman who built the roads in Wales.

name: ELENA
meaning: Cognate of HELEN, and a variant transcription of Russian YELENA.

name: ELENE
meaning: Georgian and Sardinian form of HELEN.

name: ELERI
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Welsh legend she was the daughter of the chieftain Brychan.

name: ELEUTERIO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of ELEUTHERIUS.

name: ELEUTHERIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ελευθεριος(Eleutherios) which meant "free". This was the name of a 2nd-century pope, as well as several saints.

name: ELFLEDA
meaning: Middle English form of both the Old English names ÆÐELFLÆD and ÆLFFLÆD. These names became rare after the Norman conquest, but Elfleda was briefly revived in the 19th century.

name: ELFREDA
meaning: Middle English form of the Old English name Ælfþryð meaning "elf strength", derived from the element ælf "elf" combined with þryð "strength". Ælfþryð was common amongst Anglo-Saxon nobility, being borne for example by the mother of King Æðelræd the Unready. This name was rare after the Norman conquest, but it was revived in the 19th century.

name: ELI  (1)
meaning: Means "ascension" in Hebrew. In the Books of Samuel in the Old Testament he is a high priest of the Israelites. He took the young Samuel into his service and gave him guidance when God spoke to him. Because of the misdeeds of his sons, Eli and his descendants were cursed to die before reaching old age....[more]

name: ELI  (3)
meaning: Spanish, Norwegian and Danish short form of ELISABET or ELIN.

name: ELIA
meaning: Italian and Dutch form of ELIJAH.

name: ELIAKIM
meaning: Means "God rises" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the master of Hezekiah's household.

name: ELIAN
meaning: Dutch variant of names beginning with Eli, such as ELIJAH or ELISABETH.

name: ELIANA  (1)
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of ÉLIANE.

name: ELIANA  (2)
meaning: Means "my God has answered" in Hebrew.

name: ELIAS
meaning: Cognate of ELIJAH. This is the form used in the Greek New Testament.

name: ELIDI
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Greek or Welsh origin. It may have been inspired by the name of the Ηληδα(Ilida) Valley in western Greece.

name: ELIEZER
meaning: From Hebrew אֱלִיעֶזֶר('Eli'ezer) meaning "my God is help". In the Old Testament this is the name of both a servant of Abraham and one of the sons of Moses (see Exodus 18:4 for an explanation of the significance of the name).

name: ELIGIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of ELIGIUS.

name: ELIGIUS
meaning: Late Latin name derived from Latin eligere "to choose". The 7th-century Saint Eligius is the patron saint of metalworkers.

name: ELIHU
meaning: Means "my God is he" in Hebrew. This was the name of several characters in the Old Testament including one of the friends of Job.

name: ELIJAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name אֱלִיָּהוּ('Eliyyahu) meaning "my God is YAHWEH", derived from the elements אֵל(el) and יָה(yah), both referring to the Hebrew God. Elijah was a Hebrew prophet and miracle worker, as told in the two Books of Kings in the Old Testament. He was active in the 9th century BC during the reign of King Ahab of Israel and his Phoenician-born queen Jezebel. Elijah confronted the king and queen over their idolatry of the Canaanite god Ba'al and other wicked deeds. At the end of his life he was carried to heaven in a chariot of fire, and was succeeded by Elisha. In the New Testament, Elijah and Moses appear next to Jesus when he is transfigured....[more]

name: ELIN
meaning: Scandinavian and Welsh form of HELEN.

name: ELINA
meaning: Finnish and Swedish form of HELEN.

name: ELIO
meaning: Italian form of AELIUS or HELIOS.

name: ELIOENAI
meaning: Means "my eyes look to God" in Hebrew. This was the name of several minor characters in the Old Testament.

name: ELIOR
meaning: Means "my God is my light" in Hebrew.

name: ELIOT
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of ELLIOTT. A famous bearer of the surname was T. S. Eliot (1888-1965), an Anglo-American poet and dramatist, the writer of 'The Waste Land'. As a given name, it was borne by the American mob-buster Eliot Ness (1903-1957).

name: ELIOTT
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of ELLIOTT.

name: ELIOU
meaning: Form of ELIJAH used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: ELIPHALET
meaning: Variant of ELIPHELET used in some versions of the Old Testament to refer to the son of David.

name: ELIPHELET
meaning: Means "God is release" in Hebrew. This is the name of several people in the Old Testament including a son of David.

name: ELIS
meaning: Swedish variant of ELIAS, as well as the Medieval English form.

name: ELISABET
meaning: Scandinavian and Finnish form of ELIZABETH. It is also used in Spain alongside the traditional form Isabel.

name: ELISABETE
meaning: Portuguese form of ELIZABETH. This more recent form is used alongside the traditional Portuguese form Isabel.

name: ELISABETH
meaning: German and Dutch form of ELIZABETH. It is also a variant English form, reflecting the spelling used in the Authorized Version of the New Testament.

name: ELISAIE
meaning: Form of ELISHA used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: ELISAVETA
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of ELIZABETH.

name: ELISEDD
meaning: Derived from Welsh elus meaning "kind". This was the name of two kings of Powys in Wales.

name: ELISEO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of ELISHA.

name: ELISHA
meaning: From the Hebrew name אֱלִישַׁע('Elisha'), a contracted form of אֱלִישׁוּעַ('Elishu'a) meaning "my God is salvation". According to the Old Testament, Elisha was a prophet and miracle worker. He was the attendant of Elijah and succeeded him after his ascension to heaven.

name: ELISHEBA
meaning: Form of ELIZABETH used in many versions of the Old Testament, where it belongs to the wife of Aaron.

name: ELISHUA
meaning: From Hebrew אֱלִישׁוּעַ('Elishu'a), an extended form of אֱלִישַׁע (see ELISHA). In the Old Testament this is the name of a son of King David.

name: ELISSA  (1)
meaning: Meaning unknown (possibly Phoenician in origin). This is another name of Dido, the legendary queen of Carthage.

name: ELIUD
meaning: Greek form of a Hebrew name meaning "God is grandeur". The Gospel of Matthew lists him as an ancestor of Jesus.

name: ELIZA
meaning: Short form of ELIZABETH. It was borne by the character Eliza Doolittle in George Bernard Shaw's play 'Pygmalion' (1913) and the subsequent musical adaptation 'My Fair Lady' (1956).

name: ELIZABETA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian form of ELIZABETH.

name: ELIZABETH
meaning: From Ελισαβετ(Elisabet), the Greek form of the Hebrew name אֱלִישֶׁבַע('Elisheva') meaning "my God is an oath", derived from the roots אֵל(el) referring to the Hebrew God and שָׁבַע(shava') meaning "oath". The Hebrew form appears in the Old Testament where Elisheba is the wife of Aaron, while the Greek form appears in the New Testament where Elizabeth is the mother of John the Baptist....[more]

name: ELIÁN
meaning: In the case of Elian Gonzalez it is a combination of ELIZABETH and JUAN(1), the names of his parents.

name: ELIŠKA
meaning: Czech and Slovak diminutive of ELIZABETH.

name: ELKANAH
meaning: Means "God has purchased" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the father of Samuel.

name: ELLA  (1)
meaning: Norman form of the Germanic name Alia, which was a short form of names containing the Germanic element alja meaning "other". It was introduced to England by the Normans and used until the 14th century, and it was later revived in the 19th century. A famous bearer was the American singer Ella Fitzgerald (1917-1996).

name: ELLA  (2)
meaning: Diminutive of ELEANOR, ELLEN(1), and other names beginning with El. It can also be a short form of names ending in ella.

name: ELLANHER
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements aljan "strength, power" and hari "army, warrior".

name: ELLE
meaning: Diminutive of ELEANOR and other names beginning with El. This name can also be given in reference to the French pronoun elle meaning "she".

name: ELLEN  (1)
meaning: Medieval English form of HELEN. This was the usual spelling of the name until the 17th century, when Helen became more common.

name: ELLERY
meaning: From an English surname which was originally derived from the medieval masculine name HILARY.

name: ELLI
meaning: Diminutive of names beginning with El, such as ELIZABETH.

name: ELLIE
meaning: Diminutive of ELEANOR, ELLEN(1), and other names beginning with El.

name: ELLIOT
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of ELLIOTT.

name: ELLIOTT
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a diminutive of the medieval name ELIAS.

name: ELLIS  (1)
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the given name ELIJAH.

name: ELLY
meaning: Dutch diminutive of ELISABETH or an English variant of ELLIE.

name: ELMA
meaning: Short form of WILHELMINE or names ending in elma, such as ANSELMA. It has also been recorded as a combination of ELIZABETH and MARY, as in the case of the 19th-century daughter of the Earl of Elgin, who was named using her mother's first and middle names.

name: ELMAR
meaning: Descended from various Germanic names such as Agilmar, which was derived from the elements agil "edge (of a sword), blade" and mari "famous".

name: ELMAS
meaning: Means "diamond" in Turkish, ultimately from Persian.

name: ELMER
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the Old English name ÆÐELMÆR. In the United States it is sometimes given in honour of brothers Jonathan (1745-1817) and Ebenezer Elmer (1752-1843), who were active in early American politics.

name: ELMIRA
meaning: Shortened form of EDELMIRA. It appears in the play 'Tartuffe' (1664) by the French playwright Molière (often spelled in the French style Elmire).

name: ELMO
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names that began with the element helm meaning "helmet, protection". It is also a derivative of ERASMUS, via the old Italian diminutive Ermo. Saint Elmo, also known as Saint Erasmus, was a 4th-century martyr who is the patron of sailors. Saint Elmo's fire is said to be a sign of his protection.

name: ELNATHAN
meaning: From Hebrew אֶלְנָתָן('Elnatan) meaning "God has given". In the Old Testament this is the name of both a grandfather of King Jehoiachin and a son of Akbor.

name: ELNUR
meaning: Means "light of the people" in Azerbaijani, ultimately derived from Turkic el "country, society" and Arabic نور(nur) "light".

name: ELOF
meaning: From the Old Norse name Eileifr, which was derived from the elements ei "ever, always" and leifr "descendant, heir".

name: ELOISE
meaning: From the Old French name Héloïse, which is probably from the Germanic name Helewidis, composed of the elements heil "hale, healthy" and wid "wide". It is sometimes associated with the Greek word ‘ηλιος(helios) "sun" or the name Louise, though there is not likely an etymological connection. This name was borne in the 12th century by Saint Eloise, the wife of the French theologian Peter Abelard. She became a nun after her husband was castrated by her uncle....[more]

name: ELON
meaning: Means "oak" in Hebrew. This was the name of one of the ruling judges of the Israelites according to the Old Testament.

name: ELOUAN
meaning: Possibly from a Breton word meaning "light". This name was borne by an obscure 6th-century saint who is now venerated mainly in Brittany and Cornwall.

name: ELOWEN
meaning: Means "elm tree" in Cornish. This is a recently coined Cornish name.

name: ELPIDIO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of ELPIDIUS.

name: ELPIDIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ελπιδιος(Elpidios), which was derived from ελπις(elpis) "hope". This was the name of a 4th-century saint who spent twenty years in a cave in Cappadocia.

name: ELPIS
meaning: Means "hope" in Greek. In Greek mythology Elpis was the personification of hope. She was the last spirit to remain in the jar after Pandora unleashed the evils that were in it.

name: ELRIC
meaning: Middle English form of either of the Old English names ÆLFRIC or ÆÐELRIC. Both were rarely used after the Norman conquest.

name: ELROND
meaning: Means "star dome" in Sindarin. In 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954) by J. R. R. Tolkien, Elrond was the elven ruler of Rivendell.

name: ELROY
meaning: Altered form of LEROY, using the Spanish definite article el as opposed to the French le.

name: ELSDON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "Elli's valley" in Old English.

name: ELTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "Ella's town" in Old English. A famous bearer of this name is British musician Elton John (1947-), born Reginald Dwight, who adopted his stage name in honour of his former bandmate Elton Dean (1945-2006).

name: ELUNED
meaning: Derived from Welsh eilun "image, idol". This was the name of a 5th-century Welsh saint.

name: ELVIRA
meaning: Spanish form of a Visigothic name, possibly composed of the Germanic elements ala "all" and wer "true". This is the name of a character in Mozart's opera 'Don Giovanni' (1787).

name: ELVIS
meaning: Meaning unknown. It could possibly be a derivative of ALVIS or ELWIN. More likely, it is from the rare surname Elvis, which is ultimately derived from the given name ELOISE. The name was brought to public attention by the singer Elvis Presley (1935-1977), whose name came from his father's middle name.

name: ELWOOD
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a place name meaning "elder tree forest" in Old English.

name: ELYSE
meaning: Diminutive of ELIZABETH. It was popularized in the early 1980s by a character from the television comedy 'Family Ties'.

name: ELYSIA
meaning: From Elysium, the name of the realm of the dead in Greek and Roman mythology, which means "blissful".

name: ELÍAS
meaning: Spanish and Icelandic form of ELIJAH.

name: ELİF
meaning: Turkish form of Alif, the name of the first letter of the Arabic alphabet, ا. It also means "slender", from the Turkish phrase elif gibi, literally "shaped like elif".

name: EM
meaning: Short form of EMILY or EMMA.

name: EMANUELA
meaning: Italian and Romanian feminine form of EMMANUEL.

name: EMBLA
meaning: Meaning uncertain, perhaps related to Old Norse almr "elm". In Norse mythology Embla and her husband Ask were the first humans. They were created by three of the gods from two trees.

name: EMEKA
meaning: Means "great deeds" in Igbo. It also functions as a short form of CHUKWUEMEKA.

name: EMEL
meaning: Means "desire" in Turkish, ultimately of Arabic origin, making this name a relative of Amal.

name: EMELIE
meaning: Swedish feminine form of Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: EMER
meaning: Possibly from Gaelic eimh "swift". In Irish legend she was the wife of Cúchulainn. She was said to possess the six gifts of womanhood: beauty, voice, speech, needlework, wisdom and chastity.

name: EMERALD
meaning: From the word for the green precious stone, which is the birthstone of May. The emerald supposedly imparts love to the bearer. The word is ultimately from Greek σμαραγδος(smaragdos).

name: EMERENTIUS
meaning: Derived from Latin emereo meaning "to fully deserve".

name: EMERSON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of EMERY". The surname was borne by Ralph Waldo Emerson (1803-1882), an American writer and philosopher who wrote about transcendentalism.

name: EMERY
meaning: Norman form of EMMERICH. The Normans introduced it to England, and though it was never popular, it survived until the end of the Middle Ages. As a modern given name, it is likely inspired by the surname Emery, which was itself derived from the medieval given name. It can also be given in reference to the hard black substance called emery.

name: EMESE
meaning: Possibly derived from Finno-Ugric eme meaning "mother". In Hungarian legend this was the name of the grandmother of Árpád, founder of the Hungarian state.

name: EMI
meaning: From Japanese 恵(e) meaning "favour, benefit" or 絵(e) meaning "picture, painting" combined with 美(mi) meaning "beautiful". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: EMIDIO
meaning: From the Late Latin name Emygdius, which was possibly a Latinized form of a Gaulish name (of unknown meaning). Saint Emygdius was a 3rd-century bishop and martyr, the patron saint against earthquakes.

name: EMIGDIA
meaning: Spanish feminine form of Emygdius (see EMIDIO).

name: EMIL
meaning: From the Roman family name Aemilius, which was derived from Latin aemulus meaning "rival".

name: EMILIANO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of the Roman cognomen Aemilianus, which was itself derived from the family name Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: EMILIE
meaning: German and Scandinavian feminine form of Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: EMILIO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: EMILIYA
meaning: Bulgarian feminine form of Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: EMILY
meaning: English feminine form of Aemilius (see EMIL). In the English-speaking world it was not common until after the German House of Hanover came to the British throne in the 18th century; the princess Amelia Sophia (1711-1786) was commonly known as Emily in English, even though Amelia is an unrelated name....[more]

name: EMILÍA
meaning: Icelandic feminine form of Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: EMLYN
meaning: Probably from the name of an ancient region in Wales, its name meaning "around the valley". It has also been suggested that this name is a Welsh form of Aemilianus (see EMILIANO).

name: EMMA
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names that began with the element ermen meaning "whole" or "universal". It was introduced to England by Emma of Normandy, who was the wife both of King Ethelred II (and by him the mother of Edward the Confessor) and later of King Canute. It was also borne by an 11th-century Austrian saint, who is sometimes called Hemma....[more]

name: EMMALYN
meaning: Variant of EMMELINE, or else a combination of EMMA and the fashionable name suffix lyn.

name: EMMANOUEL
meaning: Form of IMMANUEL used in the Greek Bible.

name: EMMANUEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name עִמָּנוּאֵל('Immanu'el) meaning "God is with us", from the roots עִם('im) meaning "with" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". This was the foretold name of the Messiah in the Old Testament. It has been used in England since the 16th century in the spellings Emmanuel and Immanuel, though it has not been widespread. The name has been more common in continental Europe, especially in Spain and Portugal (in the spellings Manuel and Manoel).

name: EMMANUHEL
meaning: Form of IMMANUEL used in the Latin Bible.

name: EMMELINE
meaning: From an Old French form of the Germanic name Amelina, originally a diminutive of Germanic names beginning with the element amal meaning "work". The Normans introduced this name to England.

name: EMMERICH
meaning: Germanic name, in which the second element is ric meaning "power". The first element may be ermen "whole, universal" (making it a relative of Ermenrich), amal "work, labour" (making it a relative of Amalric) or heim "home" (making it a relative of Henry). It is likely that several forms merged into a single name.

name: EMMET
meaning: Variant of EMMETT. It is used in Ireland in honour of the nationalist and rebel Robert Emmet (1778-1803).

name: EMMETT
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a diminutive of the feminine given name EMMA.

name: EMMI
meaning: Short form of names beginning with Em.

name: EMRYS
