meaning: Welsh form of AMBROSE. Emrys Wledig (or Ambrosius Aurelianus) was a Romano-British military leader who fought against the invading Anglo-Saxons in the 5th century. Tales of his life were used by the 12th-century chronicler Geoffrey of Monmouth to create the character of Merlin, who he called Merlinus Ambrosius or Myrddin Emrys.

name: EMÍLIA
meaning: Portuguese, Slovak and Hungarian feminine form of Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: EMÍLIE
meaning: Czech feminine form of Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: EMĪLIJA
meaning: Latvian feminine form of Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: EMİRHAN
meaning: Derived from Turkish emir "amir, prince" and han "khan, ruler, leader".

name: ENCARNACIÓN
meaning: Means "incarnation" in Spanish. This is given in reference to the Incarnation of Jesus in the womb of the Virgin Mary.

name: ENDRE  (1)
meaning: Possibly a Hungarian form of ANDREW, though it may in fact originate from a pre-Christian source.

name: ENDYMION
meaning: Derived from Greek ενδυειν(endyein) meaning "to dive into, to enter". In Greek mythology he was an Aeolian mortal loved by the moon goddess Selene, who asked Zeus to grant him eternal life. Zeus complied by putting him into an eternal sleep in a cave on Mount Latmos.

name: ENEIDA
meaning: From the Portuguese and Spanish name of the 'Aeneid' (see AENEAS).

name: ENEKO
meaning: Possibly derived from Basque ene "my" and ko, a diminutive suffix. This was the name of the first king of Pamplona or Navarre (9th century), whose name is usually rendered as Íñigo.

name: ENES
meaning: Turkish and Bosnian form of ANIS.

name: ENGEL
meaning: Originally this was a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element Angil, the name of a Germanic tribe (known in English as the Angles). Since the Middle Ages it has been firmly associated with the German word engel meaning "angel".

name: ENGELBERT
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements Angil, the name of a Germanic tribe known in English as the Angles, and beraht "bright". Saint Engelbert was a 13th-century archbishop of Cologne murdered by assassins.

name: ENGUERRAND
meaning: Medieval French form of the Germanic name Engilram, which was composed of the elements Angil, the name of a Germanic tribe known in English as the Angles, and hramn "raven". This was the name of several French nobles from Picardy.

name: ENID
meaning: Derived from Welsh enaid meaning "soul" or "life". She is the wife of Geraint in Welsh legend and Arthurian romance.

name: ENIKŐ
meaning: Created by the Hungarian poet Mihály Vörösmarty in the 19th century. He based it on the name of the legendary mother of the Hungarian people, Enéh, which may mean "cow" or "deer".

name: ENITAN
meaning: Means "person with a story, storied person" in Yoruba.

name: ENKI
meaning: Derived from Sumerian en-ki "lord of the earth" (though maybe originally from en-kur "lord of the underworld"). Enki, called Ea by the Babylonians, was the Sumerian god of water and wisdom and the keeper of the Me, the divine laws.

name: ENLIL
meaning: Derived from Sumerian en-lil "lord of the wind". Enlil was the Sumerian god of the wind and storms, the son of An and Ki.

name: ENNIO
meaning: Italian form of the Roman family name Ennius which is of unknown meaning. Quintus Ennius was an early Roman poet.

name: ENNIS
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Gaelic inis meaning "island".

name: ENOBARBUS
meaning: Form of AHENOBARBUS used by Shakespeare in his play 'Antony and Cleopatra' (1606).

name: ENOCH
meaning: From the Hebrew name חֲנוֹך(Chanokh) meaning "dedicated". In Genesis in the Old Testament this is the name of both the son of Cain and the father of Methuselah, who was the supposed author of the apocryphal Books of Enoch.

name: ENOLA
meaning: Meaning unknown. This name first appeared in the late 19th century. The aircraft that dropped the atomic bomb on Hiroshima was named 'Enola Gay' after the mother of the pilot.

name: ENOS
meaning: Form of ENOSH used in many versions of the Old Testament.

name: ENOSH
meaning: Means "human being" in Hebrew. He was a son of Seth and a grandson of Adam in the genealogies in Genesis in the Old Testament.

name: ENRICO
meaning: Italian form of HENRY. Enrico Fermi (1901-1954) was an Italian physicist who did work on the development of the nuclear bomb.

name: ENVER
meaning: Turkish and Bosnian form of ANWAR.

name: ENYO
meaning: Meaning unknown. She was a blood-thirsty Greek war goddess and a companion of Ares.

name: ENYONAM
meaning: Means "it is good for me" in Ewe.

name: ENZO
meaning: The meaning of this name is uncertain. In some cases it seems to be an old Italian form of HEINZ, though in other cases it could be a variant of the Germanic name ANZO. In modern times it is also used as a short form of names ending in enzo, such as VINCENZO or LORENZO.

name: EOFORHILD
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements eofor "boar" and hild "battle". This name was rarely used after the Norman conquest.

name: EOFORWINE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements eofor "boar" and wine "friend". This name was rarely used after the Norman conquest.

name: EOGHAN
meaning: Possibly means "born from the yew tree" in Irish, though it is possibly derived from EUGENE. It was borne by several legendary or semi-legendary Irish figures, including a son of Niall of the Nine Hostages.

name: EOS
meaning: Means "dawn" in Greek. This was the name of the Greek goddess of the dawn.

name: EPAPHRAS
meaning: Derived from Greek επαφρος(epaphros) meaning "foamy". In the New Testament this is the name of one of Paul's co-workers.

name: EPAPHRODITOS
meaning: Means "lovely, charming", derived from Greek επι(epi) "on" combined with the name of the Greek love goddess APHRODITE.

name: EPHRAIM
meaning: From the Hebrew name אֶףְרָיִם('Efrayim) which meant "fruitful". In the Old Testament Ephraim is a son of Joseph and Asenath and the founder of one of the twelve tribes of Israel.

name: EPHRATH
meaning: Means "fruitful place" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this name was borne by one of the wives of Caleb. Also in the Bible, it is the name of the place where Rachel was buried.

name: EPIFANIO
meaning: From the Latin name Epiphanius, which was from the Greek name Επιφανιος(Epiphanios), itself derived from the Greek word επιφανεια(epiphaneia) meaning "appearance, manifestation". This name was borne by a few early saints. It is associated with the event known in English as the Epiphany (Spanish Epifanía, Italian Epifania, Latin Epiphania), the coming of the three Magi to visit the infant Jesus.

name: EPIKTETOS
meaning: Ancient Greek name meaning "newly acquired". This was the name of a 1st-century Greek stoic philosopher.

name: EPIMETHEUS
meaning: Derived from Greek επιμηθεια(epimetheia) meaning "hindsight, hindthought". In Greek mythology he was a Titan, the brother of the god of forethought Prometheus.

name: EPIPHANES
meaning: Means "appearing, manifesting" in Greek. This was an epithet of two 2nd-century BC Hellenistic rulers: the Seleucid king Antiochus IV and the Ptolemaic king Ptolemy V.

name: EPIPHANY
meaning: From the name of the Christian festival (January 6) which commemorates the visit of the Magi to the infant Jesus. It is also an English word meaning "sudden appearance" or "sudden perception", ultimately deriving from Greek επιφανεια(epiphaneia) "manifestation".

name: EPONA
meaning: Derived from Gaulish epos meaning "horse". This was the name of the Celtic goddess of horses.

name: EPONINE
meaning: Meaning unknown. Victor Hugo used this name in his novel 'Les Misérables' (1862) for a daughter of the Thénardiers. Her mother got her name from a romance novel.

name: ERAN
meaning: Means "watchful, vigilant" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is a grandson of Ephraim.

name: ERASMO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of ERASMUS.

name: ERASMUS
meaning: Derived from Greek ερασμιος(erasmios) meaning "beloved". Saint Erasmus, also known as Saint Elmo, was a 4th-century martyr who is the patron saint of sailors. Erasmus was also the name of a Dutch scholar of the Renaissance period.

name: ERASTUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Εραστος(Erastos) meaning "beloved". This was the name of an assistant of Paul mentioned in Acts and two epistles in the New Testament.

name: ERATO
meaning: Means "lovely" in Greek. In Greek mythology she was one of the nine Muses, the muse of lyric poetry.

name: ERCAN
meaning: From Turkish er "brave man" and can "soul, life".

name: ERDMANN
meaning: Variant of HARTMANN. It can also be interpreted as meaning "earth man" from German Erde "earth", and thus was sometimes used as a translation of Adam.

name: ERDOĞAN
meaning: From Turkish er "brave man" and doğan "falcon".

name: EREBUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Ερεβος(Erebos) which means "nether darkness". Erebus was the personification of the primordial darkness in Greek mythology.

name: EREKLE
meaning: Georgian form of Herakleios (see HERACLIUS). This name was borne by two Georgian kings of the Bagrationi dynasty.

name: ERESHKIGAL
meaning: Means "lady of the great earth" in Sumerian. In Sumerian and Babylonian mythology she was the violent goddess of death and the underworld.

name: ERHAN
meaning: From Turkish er "brave man" and han, which is from the title khan meaning "leader".

name: ERHARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element era "honour, respect" or hari "army" combined with hard "brave, hardy". In some cases it may be a variant of EBERHARD.

name: ERIC
meaning: From the Old Norse name Eiríkr, derived from the elements ei "ever, always" and ríkr "ruler". A notable bearer was Eiríkr inn Rauda (Eric the Red in English), a 10th-century navigator and explorer who discovered Greenland. This was also the name of several early kings of Sweden, Denmark and Norway....[more]

name: ERICA
meaning: Feminine form of ERIC. It was first used in the 18th century. It also coincides with the Latin word for "heather".

name: ERICH
meaning: German form of ERIC. The German novelist Erich Maria Remarque (1898-1970) was the author of 'All Quiet on the Western Front'.

name: ERIK
meaning: Scandinavian form of ERIC. This was the name of kings of Sweden, Denmark and Norway. King Erik IX of Sweden (12th century) is the patron saint of that country.

name: ERIKA
meaning: Feminine form of ERIK. It also coincides with the word for "heather" in some languages.

name: ERIN
meaning: Anglicized form of EIREANN. It has been used as a given name since the middle of the 20th century.

name: ERIS
meaning: Means "strife" in Greek. In Greek mythology Eris was the goddess of discord. She was the sister and companion of Ares.

name: ERKAN
meaning: From Turkish er "brave man" and kan "blood".

name: ERLAND
meaning: From the Old Norse byname Erlendr, which was derived from örlendr meaning "foreigner".

name: ERLING
meaning: Means "descendant of the jarl", a derivative of the Old Norse word jarl meaning "chieftain, nobleman, earl".

name: ERMA
meaning: Variant of IRMA. It began to be used in the English-speaking world in the 19th century, along with Irma.

name: ERMELINDA
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ermen "whole, universal" and lind "soft, tender, flexible".

name: ERMENDRUD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ermen "whole, universal" and thrud "strength".

name: ERMENRICH
meaning: From the Germanic elements ermen "whole, universal" and ric "power". Ermenrich (also often called Ermanaric) was a 4th-century Gothic king.

name: ERMETE
meaning: Derived from Hermetis, the Latin genitive form of HERMES, the name of the Greek messenger god.

name: ERMINTRUDE
meaning: English form of ERMENDRUD. It was occasionally used until the 19th century.

name: ERNA  (2)
meaning: Means "brisk, vigourous, hale" in Old Norse. This was the name of the wife of Jarl in Norse legend.

name: ERNEST
meaning: Derived from Germanic eornost meaning "serious". It was introduced to England by the German House of Hanover when they inherited the British throne in the 18th century, though it did not become common until the following century. The American author and adventurer Ernest Hemingway (1899-1961) was a famous bearer of the name. It was also used by Oscar Wilde for a character in his comedy 'The Importance of Being Earnest' (1895).

name: ERNESTO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of ERNEST.

name: ERNST
meaning: German, Dutch and Scandinavian form of ERNEST.

name: EROS
meaning: Means "love" in Greek. In Greek mythology he was a young god, the son of Aphrodite, who was armed with arrows that caused the victim to fall in love.

name: ERROL
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a Scottish place name. It was popularized as a given name by the Australian actor Errol Flynn (1909-1959).

name: ERSKINE
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from the name of a Scottish town meaning "projecting height" in Gaelic. A famous bearer of the name was the Irish novelist and nationalist Erskine Childers (1870-1922).

name: ERVIN
meaning: Hungarian and Croatian form of ERWIN.

name: ERWAN
meaning: Breton form of IVO(1) or YVES.

name: ERWIN
meaning: Derived from the Germanic name Hariwini, composed of the elements hari "army" and win "friend". It may have merged somewhat with the Germanic name EBURWIN. A notable bearer was Erwin Schrodinger (1887-1961), an Austrian physicist who made contributions to quantum theory.

name: ERZSÉBET
meaning: Hungarian form of ELIZABETH. This is the native name of Saint Elizabeth of Hungary. It was also borne by the infamous Erzsébet Báthory, a 16th-century countess and murderer.

name: ESAIAS
meaning: Form of ISAIAH used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: ESAU
meaning: From the Hebrew name עֵשָׂו('Esaw) which possibly meant "hairy". In the Old Testament Esau is the elder of the twin sons of Isaac and Rebecca. Once when he was very hungry he sold his birthright to his twin Jacob for a bowl of stew. Later Jacob disguised himself as Esau and received the elder son's blessing from the blind Isaac. Esau was the ancestor of the Edomites.

name: ESDRAS
meaning: Greek form of EZRA. This spelling is used in parts of the Old Testament Apocrypha.

name: ESE
meaning: Possibly a Frisian form of ANSO.

name: ESKARNE
meaning: Means "mercy" in Basque. It is a Basque equivalent of Mercedes.

name: ESMA
meaning: Turkish and Bosnian form of ASMA.

name: ESMAIL
meaning: Persian form of ISHMAEL. It is also a variant transcription of Arabic ISMA'IL.

name: ESMERALDA
meaning: Means "emerald" in Spanish and Portuguese. Victor Hugo used this name in his novel 'The Hunchback of Notre Dame' (1831), in which Esmeralda is the Gypsy girl who is loved by Quasimodo. It has occasionally been used in the English-speaking world since that time.

name: ESMOND
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements east "grace" and mund "protection". This Old English name was rarely used after the Norman conquest. It was occasionally revived in the 19th century.

name: ESMÉ
meaning: Means "esteemed" or "loved" in Old French. It was first recorded in Scotland, being borne by the first Duke of Lennox in the 16th century.

name: ESPERANZA
meaning: Spanish form of the Late Latin name Sperantia which was derived from sperare "to hope".

name: ESRA
meaning: Possibly a Turkish form of ASRA.

name: ESSENCE
meaning: From the English word essence which means either "odour, scent" or else "fundamental quality". Ultimately it derives from Latin esse "to be".

name: ESTEE
meaning: Diminutive of ESTHER. A famous bearer was the American businesswoman Estée Lauder (1908-2004), founder of the cosmetics company that bears her name. Her birth name was Josephine Esther Mentzer. Apparently she added the accent to her name Estee in order to make it appear French.

name: ESTELA
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of ESTELLE.

name: ESTELLA
meaning: Latinate form of ESTELLE. This was the name of the heroine, Estella Havisham, in Charles Dickens' novel 'Great Expectations' (1860).

name: ESTELLE
meaning: From an Old French name which was derived from Latin stella, meaning "star". It was rare in the English-speaking world in the Middle Ages, but it was revived in the 19th century, perhaps due to the character Estella Havisham in Charles Dickens' novel 'Great Expectations' (1860).

name: ESTERA
meaning: Polish, Slovak and Lithuanian form of ESTHER.

name: ESTHER
meaning: Possibly means "star" in Persian. Alternatively it could be a derivative of the name of the Near Eastern goddess ISHTAR. The Book of Esther in the Old Testament tells the story of Queen Esther, the Jewish wife of the king of Persia. The king's advisor Haman persuaded the king to exterminate all the Jews in the realm. Warned of this plot by her cousin Mordecai, Esther revealed her Jewish ancestry and convinced the king to execute Haman instead. Her original Hebrew name was Hadassah....[more]

name: ESTRELLA
meaning: Spanish form of STELLA(1), coinciding with the Spanish word meaning "star".

name: ETELE
meaning: Probably a Hungarian form of ETZEL.

name: ETELKA
meaning: Feminine form of ETELE created by the Hungarian writer András Dugonics for the main character in his novel 'Etelka' (1788).

name: ETERI
meaning: Means "ether, air" in Georgian. This name features in the Georgian opera 'Abesalom and Eteri' (1918).

name: ETHAN
meaning: From the Hebrew name אֵיתָן('Eitan) meaning "solid, enduring, firm". In the Old Testament this name is borne by a few minor characters, including the wise man Ethan the Ezrahite, supposedly the author of Psalm 89....[more]

name: ETHEL
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Old English element æðel meaning "noble". It was coined in the 19th century, when many Old English names were revived. It was popularized by the novels 'The Newcomes' (1855) by William Makepeace Thackeray and 'The Daisy Chain' (1856) by C. M. Yonge. A famous bearer was American actress and singer Ethel Merman (1908-1984).

name: ETHELBERT
meaning: Middle English form of ÆÐELBERHT. The name was very rare after the Norman conquest, but it was revived briefly in the 19th century.

name: ETHELINDA
meaning: English form of the Germanic name ADALLINDIS. The name was very rare in medieval times, but it was revived in the early 19th century.

name: ETHELRED
meaning: Middle English form of ÆÐELRÆD. The name was very rare after the Norman conquest, but it was revived briefly in the 19th century.

name: ETSUKO
meaning: From Japanese 悦(etsu) meaning "joy, pleased" and 子(ko) meaning "child", as well as other kanji combinations.

name: ETTA
meaning: Short form of HENRIETTA and other names that end with etta. A famous bearer was the American singer Etta James (1938-2012), who took her stage name from her real given name Jamesetta.

name: ETTIE
meaning: Diminutive of HENRIETTA and other names ending with etta or ette.

name: ETZEL
meaning: Form of ATTILA used in the medieval German saga the 'Nibelungenlied'. In the story Etzel is a fictional version of Attila the Hun.

name: EUA
meaning: Form of Chawwah (see EVE) used in the Greek translation of Old Testament. Chawwah is also translated as Zoe in the Greek Old Testament.

name: EUANTHE
meaning: Derived from Greek ευανθης(euanthes) meaning "blooming, flowery", a derivative of ευ(eu) "good" and ανθος(anthos) "flower". According to some sources, this was the name of the mother of the three Graces or Χαριτες (Charites) in Greek mythology.

name: EUCLID
meaning: From the Greek name Ευκλειδης(Eukleides), derived from Greek ευ(eu) "good" and κλεος(kleos) "glory" with the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides). This was the name of a 3rd-century BC Greek mathematician from Alexandria who made numerous contributions to geometry.

name: EUDES
meaning: Old French form of Audo (see OTTO). This was the name of an 8th-century French saint. It was also borne by a 9th-century French king.

name: EUDOCIA
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ευδοκια(Eudokia), derived from the word ευδοκεω(eudokeo) meaning "to be well pleased, to be satisfied", itself derived from ευ(eu) "good" and δοκεω(dokeo) "to think, to imagine, to suppose".

name: EUDORA
meaning: Means "good gift" in Greek, from the elements ευ(eu) "good" and δωρον(doron) "gift". This was the name of a nymph, one of the Hyades, in Greek mythology.

name: EUDOXIA
meaning: Means "good repute, good judgement" from Greek ευδοξος(eudoxos), itself derived from ευ(eu) "good" and δοξα(doxa) "notion, reputation, honour, glory".

name: EUFEMIA
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of EUPHEMIA.

name: EUGENE
meaning: English form of Eugenius, the Latin form of the Greek name Ευγενιος(Eugenios) which was derived from the Greek word ευγενης(eugenes) meaning "well born". It is composed of the elements ευ(eu) "good" and γενης(genes) "born". This was the name of several saints and four popes....[more]

name: EUGENEIA
meaning: Ancient Greek feminine form of EUGENE.

name: EUGENIA
meaning: Feminine form of Eugenius (see EUGENE). It was borne by a semi-legendary 3rd-century saint who escaped persecution by disguising herself as a man. The name was occasionally found in England during the Middle Ages, but it was not regularly used until the 19th century.

name: EUGENIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of Eugenius (see EUGENE).

name: EUGÉNIE
meaning: French form of EUGENIA. This was the name of the wife of Napoleon III.

name: EULALIA
meaning: Derived from Greek ευλαλος(eulalos) meaning "sweetly-speaking", itself from ευ(eu) "good" and λαλεω(laleo) "to talk". This was the name of an early 4th-century saint and martyr from Merida in Spain. She is a patron saint of Barcelona.

name: EULÁLIA
meaning: Portuguese, Hungarian and Slovak form of EULALIA.

name: EUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 恩(eun) meaning "kindness, mercy, charity" or 銀(eun) meaning "silver, money", as well as other hanja characters which are pronounced in the same way. It usually occurs in combination with another character, though it is sometimes used as a stand-alone name.

name: EUN-JEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 恩(eun) meaning "kindness, mercy, charity" or 慇(eun) meaning "careful, anxious, attentive" combined with 廷(jeong) meaning "court" or 婷(jeong) meaning "pretty, graceful". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: EUN-JI
meaning: From Sino-Korean 恩(eun) meaning "kindness, mercy, charity" combined with 智(ji) meaning "wisdom, intellect" or 地(ji) meaning "earth, soil, ground". Other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: EUN-YEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 恩(eun) meaning "kindness, mercy, charity" and 英(yeong) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: EUNICE
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ευνικη(Eunike) which meant "good victory" from ευ(eu) "good" and νικη(nike) "victory". The New Testament mentions her as the mother of Timothy. As an English name, it was first used after the Protestant Reformation.

name: EUNOMIA
meaning: Means "good order" in Greek, ultimately from ευ(eu) "good" and νομος(nomos) "law, custom". Eunomia was a Greek goddess, one of the ‘Ωραι (Horai), presiding over law.

name: EUPHEMIA
meaning: Means "to use words of good omen" from Greek () "good" and φημι(phemi) "to speak, to declare". Saint Euphemia was an early martyr from Chalcedon.

name: EUPHRANOR
meaning: Derived from Greek ευφραινω(euphraino) meaning "to delight". This was the name of a 4th-century BC Athenian artist.

name: EUPHROSYNE
meaning: Means "mirth, merriment" in Greek. She was one of the three Graces or Χαριτες (Charites) in Greek mythology.

name: EUPRAXIA
meaning: From a Greek word meaning "good conduct", derived from ευ(eu) "good" and πραξις(praxis) "action, exercise".

name: EURIPIDES
meaning: Derived from Greek Ευριπος(Euripos), referring to the strait between Euboea and Boeotia, combined with the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides). This was the name of a 5th-century BC Greek tragic poet.

name: EUROPA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Ευρωπη(Europe), which meant "wide face" from ευρυς(eurys) "wide" and ωψ(ops) "face, eye". In Greek mythology Europa was a Phoenician princess who was abducted and taken to Crete by Zeus in the guise of a bull. She became the first queen of Crete, and later fathered Minos by Zeus. The continent of Europe is named for her. This is also the name of a moon of Jupiter.

name: EURWEN
meaning: Derived from Welsh aur "gold" and gwen "white, fair, blessed".

name: EURYDICE
meaning: From the Greek Ευρυδικη(Eurydike) which meant "wide justice", derived from ευρυς(eurys) "wide" and δικη(dike) "justice". In Greek myth she was the wife of Orpheus. Her husband tried to rescue her from Hades, but he failed when he disobeyed the condition that he not look back upon her on their way out.

name: EUSEBIO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of EUSEBIUS.

name: EUSEBIOS
meaning: Derived from Greek ευσεβης(eusebes) meaning "pious", itself derived from ευ(eu) "good" and σεβω(sebo) "to worship, to honour". This was the name of several saints.

name: EUSEBIUS
meaning: Latinized form of EUSEBIOS. This was the name of a 4th-century historian of the Christian church.

name: EUSTACE
meaning: English form of EUSTACHIUS or EUSTATHIUS, two names of Greek origin which have been conflated in the post-classical period. Saint Eustace, whose is known under both spellings, was a 2nd-century Roman general who became a Christian after seeing a vision of a cross between the antlers of a stag he was hunting. He was burned to death for refusing to worship the Roman gods and is now regarded as the patron saint of hunters. Due to him, this name was common in England during the Middle Ages, though it is presently rare.

name: EUSTACHE
meaning: French form of Eustachius or Eustathius (see EUSTACE).

name: EUSTACHIUS
meaning: Possibly from the Greek name EUSTACHYS or from the same source. This (or Eustathius) is the Latin name of Saint Eustace.

name: EUSTACHYS
meaning: Means "fruitful" in Greek. It is ultimately from ευ(eu) "good" and σταχυς(stachus) "ear of corn".

name: EUSTATHIUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Ευσταθιος(Eustathios), derived from the Greek word ευσταθης(eustathes) meaning "well-built, stable". It is ultimately from ευ(eu) "good" and ‘ιστημι(histemi) "to stand, to set up". This was the name of a few early saints, including the 2nd-century martyr also known as Eustachius (see Eustace).

name: EUSTORGIO
meaning: From Eustorgius, the Latin form of the Greek name Ευστοργιος(Eustorgios), which was from the word ευστοργος(eustorgos) meaning "content", a derivative of ευ(eu) "good" and στεργω(stergo) "to love, to be content". Saint Eustorgius was a 6th-century bishop of Milan.

name: EUTERPE
meaning: Means "delight" in Greek, ultimately from ευ(eu) "good" and τερπω(terpo) "to satisfy, to cheer". In Greek mythology she was one of the nine Muses, the muse of music and joy. She was said to have invented the double flute.

name: EUTHALIA
meaning: Means "flower, bloom" from the Greek word ευθαλεια(euthaleia), itself derived from ευ(eu) "good" and θαλλω(thallo) "to blossom".

name: EUTHYMIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ευθυμιος(Euthymios) which meant "in good spirits", derived from the word ευθυμος(euthymos), which was composed of the elements ευ(eu) "good" and θυμος(thymos) "soul, spirit". This was the name of several early saints.

name: EUTIMIO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of EUTHYMIUS.

name: EUTROPIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ευτροπιος(Eutropios), which was derived from the word ευτροπος(eutropos) "versatile", formed of the elements ευ(eu) "good" and τροπος(tropos) "direction, manner, fashion".

name: EUTYCHIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ευτυχιος(Eutychios), a variant of Eutychos (see EUTYCHUS). This was the name of several early saints and martyrs.

name: EUTYCHUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ευτυχος(Eutychos), which was derived from Greek ευτυχης(eutyches) "fortunate". The word was formed of the elements ευ(eu) "good" and τυχη(tyche) "chance, luck, fortune". In the New Testament this is the name of a young man who went to sleep while Paul was preaching and fell from the third story of the building. He was believed to be dead, but later turned out to be alive.

name: EVA
meaning: Latinate form of EVE. This form is used in the Latin translation of the New Testament, while Hava is used in the Latin Old Testament. It is also a variant transcription of Russian YEVA. This name appears in Harriet Beecher Stowe's novel 'Uncle Tom's Cabin' (1852) belonging to the character Little Eva, whose real name is in fact Evangeline.

name: EVADNE
meaning: From Greek Ευαδνη(Euadne), from ευ(eu) meaning "good" possibly combined with Cretan Greek αδνος(adnos) meaning "holy". In Greek legend Evadne was the wife of Capaneus. After Capaneus was killed by a lightning bolt sent from Zeus she committed suicide by throwing herself onto his burning body.

name: EVAN
meaning: Anglicized form of Iefan, a Welsh form of JOHN.

name: EVANDER  (1)
meaning: Variant of Evandrus, the Latin form of the Greek name Ευανδρος(Euandros), derived from Greek ευ(eu) meaning "good" and ανηρ(aner) meaning "man" (genitive ανδρος). In Roman mythology Evander was an Arcadian hero of the Trojan War who founded the city of Pallantium near the spot where Rome was later built.

name: EVANGELINE
meaning: Means "good news" from Greek ευ(eu) "good" and αγγελμα(angelma) "news, message". It was (first?) used by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow in his epic poem 'Evangeline' (1847). It also appears in Harriet Beecher Stowe's novel 'Uncle Tom's Cabin' (1852) as the full name of the character Eva.

name: EVANGELOS
meaning: Means "bringing good news" from the Greek word ευαγγελος(euangelos), a derivative of ευ(eu) "good" and αγγελος(angelos) "messenger".

name: EVARISTO
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Portuguese form of EVARISTUS.

name: EVARISTUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ευαριστος(Euaristos) meaning "well pleasing" from the Greek word ευαρεστος(euarestos), derived from ευ(eu) "good, well" and αρεστος(arestos) "pleasing". This was the name of the fifth pope, supposedly martyred under Emperor Hadrian.

name: EVDOKIYA
meaning: Bulgarian form of EUDOCIA, and a variant Russian transcription of YEVDOKIYA.

name: EVE
meaning: From the Hebrew name חַוָּה(Chawwah), which was derived from the Hebrew word חָוָה(chawah) meaning "to breathe" or the related word חָיָה(chayah) meaning "to live". According to the Old Testament Book of Genesis, Eve and Adam were the first humans. God created her from one of Adam's ribs to be his companion. At the urging of a serpent she ate the forbidden fruit and shared some with Adam, causing their expulsion from the Garden of Eden....[more]

name: EVELEEN
meaning: Either a diminutive of EVE or a variant of EVELYN.

name: EVELIN
meaning: German, Estonian and Hungarian form of EVELINA.

name: EVELINA
meaning: Latinate form of AVELINE. It was revived by the author Fanny Burney for the heroine of her first novel 'Evelina' (1778). It is often regarded as a variant of the related name EVELYN or an elaboration of EVE.

name: EVELYN
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the given name AVELINE. In the 17th century when it was first used as a given name it was more common for boys, but it is now regarded as mainly feminine due to association with the related name Evelina.

name: EVERARD
meaning: Means "brave boar", derived from the Germanic elements ebur "wild boar" and hard "brave, hardy". The Normans introduced it to England, where it joined the Old English cognate Eoforheard. It has only been rarely used since the Middle Ages. Modern use of the name may be inspired by the surname Everard, itself derived from the medieval name.

name: EVERETT
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name EVERARD.

name: EVERILD
meaning: Latinized form of EOFORHILD. This was the name of a 7th-century English saint.

name: EVERLY
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name, itself derived from Old English eofor "boar" and leah "woodland, clearing".

name: EVGENI
meaning: Bulgarian form of EUGENE and a variant Russian transcription of YEVGENIY.

name: EVGENIA
meaning: Modern Greek form of EUGENIA. It is also a variant transcription of Russian YEVGENIYA and Bulgarian EVGENIYA.

name: EVGENIYA
meaning: Bulgarian form of EUGENIA and a variant Russian transcription of YEVGENIYA.

name: EVI
meaning: Modern Greek form of EVE, as well as a Dutch and German variant.

name: EVREN
meaning: Means "cosmos, the universe" in Turkish. In Turkic mythology the Evren is a gigantic snake-like dragon.

name: EWALD
meaning: From a Germanic name which was composed of the elements ewa "law, custom" and wald "rule".

name: EWART
meaning: From an English and Scottish surname which was either based on a Norman form of EDWARD, or else derived from a place name of unknown meaning.

name: EYDÍS
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements ey "good fortune" or "island" and dís "goddess".

name: EYSTEINN
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements ey meaning "island" or "good fortune" and steinn meaning "stone".

name: EZECHIAS
meaning: Form of HEZEKIAH used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: EZECHIEL
meaning: Latin form of EZEKIEL used in some versions of the Vulgate.

name: EZEKIAS
meaning: Form of HEZEKIAH used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: EZEKIEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְחֶזְקֵאל(Yechezqel) meaning "God will strengthen", from the roots חָזַק(chazaq) meaning "to strengthen" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". Ezekiel is a major prophet of the Old Testament, the author of the Book of Ezekiel. He lived in Jerusalem until the Babylonian conquest and captivity of Israel, at which time he was taken to Babylon. The Book of Ezekiel describes his vivid symbolic visions that predict the restoration of the kingdom of Israel. As an English given name, Ezekiel has been used since the Protestant Reformation.

name: EZEQUIEL
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of EZEKIEL.

name: EZER
meaning: Means "help" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a son of Seir, as well as several other minor characters.

name: EZRA
meaning: Means "help" in Hebrew. Ezra is a prophet of the Old Testament and the author of the Book of Ezra. It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since the Protestant Reformation. The American poet Ezra Pound (1885-1972) was a famous bearer.

name: FAAS
meaning: Dutch short form of BONIFAAS or SERVAAS.

name: FABIAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Fabianus, which was derived from FABIUS. Saint Fabian was a 3rd-century pope.

name: FABIANO
meaning: Italian and Portuguese form of Fabianus (see FABIAN).

name: FABIENNE
meaning: French feminine form of Fabianus (see FABIAN).

name: FABIJAN
meaning: Croatian and Slovene form of Fabianus (see FABIAN).

name: FABIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of FABIUS.

name: FABIOLA
meaning: Diminutive of FABIA. This was the name of a 4th-century saint from Rome.

name: FABIUS
meaning: Roman family name which was derived from Latin faba "bean". Quintus Fabius Maximus was the Roman general who used delaying tactics to halt the invasion of Hannibal in the 3rd century BC.

name: FABRICE
meaning: French form of the Roman family name Fabricius, which was derived from Latin faber "craftsman". Gaius Fabricius Luscinus was a 3rd-century BC Roman general and statesman.

name: FABRICIO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of Fabricius (see FABRICE).

name: FABRIZIA
meaning: Italian feminine form of Fabricius (see FABRICE).

name: FACHTNA
meaning: Perhaps means "hostile" in Irish Gaelic. He was the husband of Neasa in Irish legend. Some versions of the legends also have him as the father of Conchobhar.

name: FADI
meaning: Means "saviour" in Arabic. This is an Arabic name of Jesus.

name: FADL
meaning: Means "grace, generosity" in Arabic. This was a name of both a cousin of Muhammad and a son of Abbas (the son of the fourth caliph Ali).

name: FAINA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly derived from PHAENNA.

name: FAITH
meaning: Simply from the English word faith, ultimately from Latin fidere "to trust". This was one of the virtue names adopted by the Puritans in the 17th century.

name: FALLON
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Fallamhain meaning "descendant of Fallamhan". The given name Fallamhan meant "leader". It was popularized in the 1980s by a character on the soap opera 'Dynasty'.

name: FANCY
meaning: From the English word fancy which means either "like, love, inclination" or "ornamental". It is derived from Middle English fantasie, which comes (via Norman French and Latin) from Greek φαινω(phaino) "to show, to appear".

name: FANG
meaning: From Chinese 芳(fāng) meaning "fragrant, virtuous, beautiful" or other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: FANNAR
meaning: Possibly derived from Old Norse fönn meaning "snow drift".

name: FANNI
meaning: Finnish diminutive of FRANCISCA and a Hungarian diminutive of FRANCISKA or STEFÁNIA.

name: FANNY
meaning: Diminutive of FRANCES, FRANÇOISE or STÉPHANIE. In the English-speaking world this has been a vulgar slang word since the late 19th century, and the name has subsequently dropped out of common use.

name: FANTINE
meaning: This name was used by Victor Hugo for the mother of Cosette in his novel 'Les Misérables' (1862). The name was given to her by a passerby who found the young orphan on the street. Hugo may have intended it to be a derivative of the French word enfant "child".

name: FAOLÁN
meaning: Means "little wolf", derived from Gaelic fáel "wolf" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of an Irish saint who did missionary work in Scotland.

name: FARAMUND
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements fara "journey" and mund "protection". This was the name of a semi-legendary 5th-century king of the Franks.

name: FARID
meaning: Means "unique, precious", derived from Arabic فرد(farada) meaning "to be unique". This was the name of a 13th-century Persian poet.

name: FARLEY
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "fern clearing" in Old English. A notable bearer of this name is Canadian author Farley Mowat (1921-).

name: FARON
meaning: From a French surname which was derived from the Germanic given name Faro.

name: FARRAN
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Old French ferrant meaning "iron grey".

name: FARRELL
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Fearghail meaning "descendant of FEARGHAL".

name: FARRUKH
meaning: Urdu, Uzbek and Tajik form of FARUQ.

name: FARUK
meaning: Turkish form of FARUQ, as well as a variant transcription of the Arabic name.

name: FARUQ
meaning: Means "person who can tell right from wrong" in Arabic. This was the name of the last king of Egypt (1920-1965).

name: FARVALD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements fara "journey" and wald "power, leader, ruler".

name: FATIMAH
meaning: Means "to abstain" in Arabic. Fatimah was a daughter of the Prophet Muhammad and the wife of Ali, the fourth caliph.

name: FATIMATOU
meaning: Form of FATIMAH used in parts of western Africa.

name: FATMA
meaning: Turkish and Azerbaijani form of FATIMAH, as well as an Arabic variant.

name: FAUNA
meaning: Feminine form of FAUNUS. Fauna was a Roman goddess of fertility, women and healing, a daughter and companion of Faunus.

name: FAUNUS
meaning: Possibly means "to befriend" from Latin. Faunus was a Roman god of fertility, forests, and agriculture.

name: FAUST
meaning: From a German surname which was derived from the Latin name FAUSTUS. This is the name of a character in German legends about a man who makes a deal with the devil. He is believed to be based on the character of Dr. Johann Faust (1480-1540). His story was adapted by writers such as Christopher Marlowe and Goethe.

name: FAUSTINE
meaning: French feminine form of Faustinus (see FAUSTINO).

name: FAUSTINO
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Portuguese form of the Roman cognomen Faustinus, which was itself derived from the Roman name FAUSTUS. Faustinus was the name of several early saints.

name: FAUSTO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of FAUSTUS.

name: FAUSTUS
meaning: Roman cognomen meaning "auspicious, lucky" in Latin. It was also occasionally used as a praenomen, or given name. This was the name of several early Christian saints.

name: FAWN
meaning: From the English word fawn for a young deer.

name: FAY
meaning: Derived from Middle English faie meaning "fairy", ultimately (via Old French) from Latin fata meaning "the Fates". It appears in Geoffrey of Monmouth's Arthurian legends in the name of Morgan le Fay. It has been used as a given name since the 19th century. In some cases it may be used as a short form of FAITH.

name: FAYRUZ
meaning: Means "turquoise (the gemstone)" in Arabic, ultimately of Persian origin.

name: FEARCHAR
meaning: Means "dear man" from Gaelic fear "man" and char "dear".

name: FEARDORCHA
meaning: Means "dark man" from Gaelic fear "man" and dorcha "dark".

name: FEARGHAL
meaning: Means "man of valour", derived from the Gaelic elements fear "man" and gal "valour". This was the name of an 8th-century king of Ireland.

name: FEARGHAS
meaning: Means "man of vigour", derived from the Gaelic elements fear "man" and gus "vigour". This was the name of several characters in Irish legend including the Ulster hero Fearghas mac Róich.

name: FEBE
meaning: Dutch, Spanish and Italian form of PHOEBE.

name: FECHÍN
meaning: Means "little raven" from Irish fiach "raven" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of an Irish saint of the 7th century who died of the yellow plague.

name: FEDDE
meaning: Short form of Frisian names beginning with the Germanic element frid "peace".

name: FEDERICO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of FREDERICK. Spanish poet Federico García Lorca (1898-1936) and Italian filmmaker Federico Fellini (1920-1993) are famous bearers of this name.

name: FEIBUSH
meaning: Yiddish form of PHOEBUS, apparently used as a translation of Shimshon (see Samson).

name: FEIDELM
meaning: Possibly a feminine form of FEIDLIMID. This name is borne by several women in Irish legend including Feidelm Noíchrothach, a daughter of Conchobhar the king of Ulster.

name: FEIDLIMID
meaning: Possibly means "beauty" or "ever good" in Irish Gaelic. This was the name of three early kings of Munster.

name: FELICIA
meaning: Feminine form of the Latin name Felicius, a derivative of FELIX. In England, it has occasionally been used since the Middle Ages.

name: FELICIANO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of the Roman name Felicianus, which was itself derived from the Roman name FELIX.

name: FELICIDAD
meaning: Spanish form of FELICITAS. It also means "happiness" in Spanish.

name: FELICIDADE
meaning: Portuguese form of FELICITAS. It also means "happiness" in Portuguese.

name: FELICITA
meaning: Italian form of FELICITAS. It also coincides closely with Italian felicità "happiness".

name: FELICITAS
meaning: Latin name which meant "good luck, fortune". In Roman mythology the goddess Felicitas was the personification of good luck. It was borne by a 3rd-century saint, a slave martyred with her master Perpetua in Carthage.

name: FELICITY
meaning: From the English word felicity meaning "happiness", which ultimately derives from Latin felicitas "good luck". This was one of the virtue names adopted by the Puritans around the 17th century. It can sometimes be used as an English form of the Latin name FELICITAS. This name was revived in the late 1990s after the appearance of the television series 'Felicity'.

name: FELICIUS
meaning: Masculine form of FELICIA. This was the name of a 4th-century saint, a companion of Saint Castor of Karden.

name: FELIKS
meaning: Russian, Slovene and Polish form of FELIX.

name: FELINUS
meaning: Late Latin name meaning "cat-like". This was the name of a possibly legendary saint who was martyred with Gratian in the 3rd century.

name: FELIPE
meaning: Spanish and Brazilian Portuguese form of PHILIP.

name: FELIX
meaning: From a Roman cognomen meaning "lucky, successful" in Latin. It was acquired as an agnomen, or nickname, by the 1st-century BC Roman general Sulla. It also appears in the New Testament belonging to the governor of Judea who imprisoned Saint Paul....[more]

name: FELÍCIA
meaning: Hungarian and Portuguese form of FELICIA.

name: FEMKE
meaning: Diminutive of Germanic names beginning with the element frid "peace". It also coincides with a Frisian word meaning "little girl".

name: FEMME
meaning: Diminutive of Germanic names beginning with the element frid "peace".

name: FEN  (1)
meaning: From Chinese 芬(fēn) meaning "fragrance, aroma, perfume" (which is usually only feminine) or 奋(fèn) meaning "strive, exert" (usually only masculine). Other Chinese characters are also possible.

name: FEN  (2)
meaning: Diminutive of Germanic names beginning with the element frid "peace".

name: FENTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from a place name meaning "marsh town" in Old English.

name: FERAY
meaning: Means "radiance of the moon" in Turkish.

name: FERDINAND
meaning: From Ferdinando, the old Spanish form of a Germanic name composed of the elements fardi "journey" and nand "daring, brave". The Visigoths brought the name to the Iberian Peninsula, where it entered into the royal families of Spain and Portugal. From there it became common among the Habsburg royal family of the Holy Roman Empire and Austria, starting with the Spanish-born Ferdinand I in the 16th century. A notable bearer was Portuguese explorer Ferdinand Magellan (1480-1521), called Fernão de Magalhães in Portuguese, who was the leader of the first expedition to sail around the earth.

name: FEREYDOUN
meaning: Means "the third" in Persian. In the 11th-century Persian epic the 'Shahnameh' this is the name of a virtuous king who ruled for 500 years.

name: FERGIE
meaning: Diminutive and feminine form of FERGUS.

name: FERN
meaning: From the English word for the plant, ultimately from Old English fearn. It has been used as a given name since the late 19th century.

name: FERNANDA
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian feminine form of FERDINAND.

name: FERNANDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of FERDINAND.

name: FERNÃO
meaning: Portuguese form of FERDINAND. This name was borne by the Portuguese explorer Fernão de Magalhães (1480-1521), better known in English as Ferdinand Magellan.

name: FERRER
meaning: From a surname which meant "blacksmith" in Catalan. This name is often given in honour of Saint Vicente Ferrer, a 14th-century missionary who is the patron saint of builders.

name: FERRUCCIO
meaning: Derived from the Late Latin name Ferrutius, a derivative of ferrum meaning "iron, sword". Saint Ferrutius was a 3rd-century martyr with his brother Ferreolus.

name: FESTER
meaning: Possibly a short form of SILVESTER.

name: FESTUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which possibly meant "festival, holiday" in Latin. This was the name of a Roman official in the New Testament.

name: FIACHNA
meaning: Derived from Gaelic fiach meaning "raven". This was the name of a king in Irish legend.

name: FIACHRA
meaning: Derived from Gaelic fiach meaning "raven". In Irish legend Fiachra was one of the four children of Lir transformed into swans for a period of 900 years. This is also the name of the patron saint of gardeners, a 7th-century Irish abbot who settled in France.

name: FIAMMETTA
meaning: Derived from Italian fiamma "fire" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: FIDEL
meaning: From the Late Latin name Fidelis which meant "faithful". A famous bearer was revolutionary leader Fidel Castro (1926-2016), the former president of Cuba.

name: FIDELMA
meaning: Latinized form of FEIDELM. Saint Fidelma and her sister Saint Eithne were 5th-century followers of Saint Patrick.

name: FIDO
meaning: Means "I am faithful" in Latin. This name is commonly given to dogs.

name: FIFE
meaning: From a Scottish place name which was formerly the name of a kingdom in Scotland. It is said to be named for the legendary Pictish hero Fib.

name: FIGARO
meaning: Created by playwright Pierre-Augustin Caron de Beaumarchais for the central character in his plays 'The Barber of Seville' (1775), 'The Marriage of Figaro' (1784) and 'The Guilty Mother' (1792). Beaumarchais may have based the character's name on the French phrase fils Caron meaning "son of Caron", which was his own nickname and would have been pronounced in a similar way. In modern French the word figaro has acquired the meaning "barber", reflecting the character's profession.

name: FIHR
meaning: Means "stone pestle" in Arabic. This was the name of an ancestor of Muhammad.

name: FILBERT
meaning: Variant of FILIBERT. It is particularly used in Tanzania due to track star Filbert Bayi (1953-), who set a world record running the 1500 meter in 1974.

name: FILIBERT
meaning: Means "much brightness" from the Germanic elements filu "much" and beraht "bright".

name: FILIPPA
meaning: Greek, Swedish and Italian feminine form of PHILIP.

name: FILIPPUS
meaning: Official Dutch form of PHILIP, used on birth certificates but not commonly in daily life.

name: FILOMENA
meaning: Italian, Spanish, Portuguese and Dutch form of PHILOMENA.

name: FINA
meaning: Short form of SERAFINA. Saint Fina, also known as Saint Serafina, was a 13th-century girl from the town of San Gimignano in Italy.

name: FINDLAY
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from the given name FIONNLAGH.

name: FINEES
meaning: Form of PHINEHAS used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: FINGAL
meaning: From Scottish Gaelic Fionnghall meaning "white stranger", derived from fionn "white, fair" and gall "stranger". This was the name of the hero in James Macpherson's epic poem 'Fingal' (1762), which he claimed to have based on early Gaelic legends about Fionn mac Cumhail.

name: FINN  (1)
meaning: Older Irish form of FIONN. This is also the usual Anglicized spelling of the name. As a surname it is borne by Huckleberry Finn, a character in Mark Twain's novels.

name: FINN  (2)
meaning: From the Old Norse name Finnr which meant "Sámi, person from Finland".

name: FINNEGAN
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Fionnagáin meaning "descendant of Fionnagán". The name Fionnagán is a diminutive of FIONN. This was the name of a character in James Joyce's novel 'Finnegans Wake' (1939), the title of which was based on a 19th-century Irish ballad called 'Finnegan's Wake'.

name: FINNIAN
meaning: Derived from Old Irish finn "white". This was the name of several Irish saints.

name: FINTAN
meaning: Possibly means either "white fire" or "white bull" in Irish. According to legend this was the name of the only Irish person to survive the great flood. This name was also borne by many Irish saints.

name: FIONA
meaning: Feminine form of FIONN. This name was (first?) used by Scottish poet James Macpherson in his poem 'Fingal' (1762).

name: FIONN
meaning: From Irish fionn (older Irish finn) meaning "fair" or "white". Fionn mac Cumhail was a legendary Irish hero who became all-wise by eating an enchanted salmon. He fought against the giant Fomors with his son Oisín and grandson Oscar.

name: FIONNBHARR
meaning: Means "fair hair", derived from Irish fionn "white, fair" and barr "head". Saint Fionnbharr of Cork was a 6th-century bishop who supposedly performed miraculous cures. The Barry Islands off Wales were named for him.

name: FIONNLAGH
meaning: Means "white warrior" from Gaelic fionn "white, fair" and laogh "warrior".

name: FIONNUALA
meaning: Means "white shoulder" from Irish fionn "white, fair" and guala "shoulder". In Irish legend Fionnuala was one of the four children of Lir who were transformed into swans for a period of 900 years.

name: FIONNÁN
meaning: Diminutive of FIONN. This was the name of an early Irish saint.

name: FIORALBA
meaning: Combination of Italian fiore "flower" and alba "dawn".

name: FIORE
meaning: Means "flower" in Italian. It can also be considered an Italian form of the Latin names FLORA and FLORUS.

name: FIORELLA
meaning: From Italian fiore "flower" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: FIORENZA
meaning: Italian feminine form of Florentius (see FLORENCE).

name: FIRAT
meaning: From the Turkish name of the Euphrates River, which was derived from Old Persian Ufratu, itself derived from Elamite or Sumerian.

name: FIRDAUS
meaning: Derived from the Arabic word فردوس(firdaws) meaning "paradise", ultimately derived from Avestan pairidaeza meaning "garden, enclosure". This name belonged to the 11th-century Persian poet and historian Firdausi, the author of the 'Shahnameh'.

name: FIRENZE
meaning: From the name of an Italian city, commonly called Florence in English.

name: FIRMIN
meaning: From the Late Latin name Firminus which meant "firm". This was the name of several early saints, notably the 3rd-century bishop Saint Firmin (or Fermin) of Amiens who is especially venerated in Navarre, Spain.

name: FIRMINO
meaning: Portuguese and Italian form of FIRMIN.

name: FIRUZ
meaning: From Persian پیروز(piruz) or فیروز(firuz) meaning "victorious". This name was borne by Firuz Shah Tughlaq, a 14th-century sultan of Delhi who did much to build the city's infrastructure.

name: FIRUZA
meaning: Azerbaijani, Tajik, Uzbek and Azerbaijani form of FIRUZEH.

name: FIRUZEH
meaning: Means "turquoise (the gemstone)" in Persian. Alternatively, it may be a feminine form of FIRUZ.

name: FITZ
meaning: Short form of various given names which are derived from surnames beginning with Norman French fitz meaning "son of" (for example FITZROY).

name: FITZROY
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of the king" in Old French, originally given to illegitimate sons of monarchs.

name: FLAITHRÍ
meaning: Means "king of princes" from Gaelic flaith "prince" and rí "king".

name: FLANAGAN
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Flannagáin meaning "descendant of Flannagán". The given name Flannagán is derived from Irish flann "red" and a diminutive suffix.

name: FLANN
meaning: Means "red" in Irish Gaelic. This was the name of a 9th-century king of Tara in Ireland.

name: FLANNERY
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Flannghaile meaning "descendant of Flannghal". The given name Flannghal means "red valour". A famous bearer was American author Flannery O'Connor (1925-1964).

name: FLAVIAN
meaning: From the Roman family name Flavianus, which was derived from FLAVIUS. This was the name of several early saints including a 5th-century patriarch of Constantinople who was beaten to death.

name: FLAVIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of FLAVIUS.

name: FLAVIUS
meaning: Roman family name which meant "golden" or "yellow-haired" from Latin flavus "yellow, golden". Flavius was the family name of the 1st-century Roman emperors Vespasian, Titus and Domitian. It was used as a personal name by several later emperors, notably by Constantine.

name: FLEMMING
meaning: From a medieval Norse nickname meaning "from Flanders".

name: FLETCHER
meaning: From a surname meaning "maker of arrows" in Middle English, ultimately from Old French flechier.

name: FLEUR
meaning: Means "flower" in French. This was the name of a character in John Galsworthy's novels 'The Forsyte Saga' (1922).

name: FLO
meaning: Short form of FLORENCE or FLORA.

name: FLOOR
meaning: Dutch form of Florentius (see FLORENCE) or FLORA.

name: FLORA
meaning: Derived from Latin flos meaning "flower". Flora was the Roman goddess of flowers and spring, the wife of Zephyr the west wind. It has been used as a given name since the Renaissance, starting in France. In Scotland it was sometimes used as an Anglicized form of Fionnghuala.

name: FLORENCE
meaning: From the Latin name Florentius or the feminine form Florentia, which were derived from florens "prosperous, flourishing". Florentius was borne by many early Christian saints, and it was occasionally used in their honour through the Middle Ages. In modern times it is mostly feminine....[more]

name: FLORENCIA
meaning: Spanish feminine form of Florentius (see FLORENCE).

name: FLORENCIO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of Florentius (see FLORENCE).

name: FLORENT
meaning: French masculine form of Florentius (see FLORENCE).

name: FLORENTINUS
meaning: Latin name which was a derivative of Florentius (see FLORENCE).

name: FLORIAN
meaning: From the Roman name Florianus, a derivative of FLORUS. Saint Florian, a martyr of the 3rd century, is the patron saint of Poland and Upper Austria.

name: FLORINDA
meaning: Elaborated form of Spanish or Portuguese flor meaning "flower".

name: FLORINUS
meaning: Latin name which was a derivative of FLORUS. This was the name of a 9th-century Swiss saint.

name: FLORO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of FLORUS.

name: FLORUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was derived from Latin flos meaning "flower".

name: FLOWER
meaning: Simply from the English word flower for the blossoming plant. It is derived (via Old French) from Latin flos.

name: FLYNN
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Floinn meaning "descendant of FLANN".

name: FOLAMI
meaning: Means "respect and honour me" in Yoruba.

name: FOLKE
meaning: Short form of various Old Norse names that contain the element folk meaning "people", and thus a cognate of FULK.

name: FORBES
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from a Scottish place name meaning "field" in Gaelic.

name: FORD
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "ford" in Old English. A famous bearer of the surname was the American industrialist Henry Ford (1863-1947).

name: FOREST
meaning: Variant of FORREST, or else directly from the English word forest.

name: FORREST
meaning: From an English surname meaning "forest", originally belonging to a person who lived near a forest. In America it has sometimes been used in honour of the Confederate Civil War general Nathan Bedford Forrest (1821-1877). This name was borne by the title character in the movie 'Forrest Gump' (1994) about a loveable simpleton. Use of the name increased when the movie was released, but has since faded away.

name: FORTUNATO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of the Late Latin name Fortunatus meaning "fortunate, blessed, happy". This was the name of several early saints and martyrs.

name: FORTUNE
meaning: Simply from the English word fortune, ultimately from Latin fortuna, a derivative of fors "luck".

name: FOSTER  (1)
meaning: From an English surname which has several different origins: see FOSTER(1), FOSTER(2), FOSTER(3) and FOSTER(4).

name: FOSTER  (2)
meaning: English form of VAAST, referring to Saint Vedastus.

name: FOX
meaning: Either from the English word fox or the surname Fox, which originally given as a nickname. The surname was borne by George Fox (1624-1691), the founder of the Quakers.

name: FRAN
meaning: Short form of FRANCIS, FRANCES or related names.

name: FRANCE
meaning: From the name of the country, sometimes considered a feminine form of FRANK(1) or short form of FRANÇOISE, both of which are ultimately related to the name of the country.

name: FRANCES
meaning: Feminine form of FRANCIS. The distinction between Francis as a masculine name and Frances as a feminine name did not arise until the 17th century. A notable bearer was Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini (1850-1917), a social worker and the first American to be canonized.

name: FRANCESCA
meaning: Italian and Catalan feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRANCESCO
meaning: Italian form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS). Francesco Laurana was an Italian Renaissance sculptor.

name: FRANCIS
meaning: English form of the Late Latin name Franciscus which meant "Frenchman", ultimately from the Germanic tribe of the Franks, who were named for a type of spear that they used. This name was borne by the 13th-century Saint Francis of Assisi, who was originally named Giovanni but was given the nickname Francesco by his father, an admirer of the French. Francis went on to renounce his father's wealth and devote his life to the poor, founding the Franciscan order of friars. Later in his life he apparently received the stigmata....[more]

name: FRANCISCA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRANCISCO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS). A notable bearer was Francisco de Goya, a Spanish painter and engraver. The name was also borne by Spanish dictator Francisco Franco.

name: FRANCISKA
meaning: Hungarian feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRANCISQUE
meaning: French variant of Franciscus (see FRANCIS), now somewhat archaic.

name: FRANCISZKA
meaning: Polish feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRANCO  (1)
meaning: Italian form of FRANK(1), as well as an older Germanic form.

name: FRANJO
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of FRANCIS.

name: FRANK  (1)
meaning: From a Germanic name which referred to a member of the Germanic tribe, the Franks. The Franks settled in the regions now called France and the Netherlands in the 3rd and 4th century. They derived their tribal name from the name of a type of spear that they used. From medieval times, the various forms of this name have been commonly conflated with the various forms of Francis....[more]

name: FRANK  (2)
meaning: Short form of FRANCIS. The singer Frank Sinatra (1915-1998) was a famous bearer.

name: FRANKA  (1)
meaning: German and Dutch feminine form of FRANK(1).

name: FRANKLIN
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Middle English frankelin "freeman". A famous bearer of the surname was Benjamin Franklin (1706-1790), an American statesman, inventor, scientist and philosopher. The name has commonly been given in his honour in the United States. It also received a boost during the term of American president Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945).

name: FRANS
meaning: Dutch, Scandinavian and Finnish form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRANTIŠKA
meaning: Czech feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRANTZISCA
meaning: Sardinian feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRANTZISKA
meaning: Basque feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRANZ
meaning: German form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS). This name was borne by the influential author Franz Kafka (1883-1924), writer of 'The Trial' and 'The Castle' among other works. Also, rulers of Austria and the Holy Roman Empire have had this name.

name: FRANZISKA
meaning: German feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRANÇOIS
meaning: French form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS). François Villon was a French lyric poet of the 15th century. This was also the name of two kings of France.

name: FRANČIŠKA
meaning: Slovene feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRASER
meaning: From a Scottish surname which is of unknown meaning. A famous bearer of the surname was Simon Fraser (1776-1862), a Canadian explorer.

name: FRAUKE
meaning: Means "little lady", derived from German frau combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: FRAÑSEZA
meaning: Breton feminine form of Franciscus (see FRANCIS).

name: FRED
meaning: Short form of FREDERICK or other names containing the same element. A famous bearer was the American actor and dancer Fred Astaire (1899-1987).

name: FREDA
meaning: Short form of names ending in freda or fred, such as WINIFRED or ALFREDA.

name: FREDENAND
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements frid "peace" and nand "daring, brave".

name: FREDERICA
meaning: Feminine form of FREDERICO or FREDERICK.

name: FREDERICK
meaning: English form of a Germanic name meaning "peaceful ruler", derived from frid "peace" and ric "ruler, power". This name has long been common in continental Germanic-speaking regions, being borne by rulers of the Holy Roman Empire, Germany, Austria, Scandinavia, and Prussia. Notables among these rulers include the 12th-century Holy Roman emperor and crusader Frederick I Barbarossa, the 13th-century emperor and patron of the arts Frederick II, and the 18th-century Frederick II of Prussia, known as Frederick the Great....[more]

name: FREDERIK
meaning: Danish and Dutch form of FREDERICK. This was the name of nine kings of Denmark over the past 500 years, alternating each generation with the name Christian.

name: FREDIANO
meaning: Italian form of the Roman name Frigidianus, which was derived from Latin frigidus "cold". This was the name of a 6th-century Irish bishop who made a pilgrimage to Rome and settled as a hermit on Mount Pisano.

name: FREDO
meaning: Short form of FEDERICO, ALFREDO or GOFFREDO.

name: FREDRIK
meaning: Swedish and Norwegian form of FREDERICK. This was the name of a 18th-century king of Sweden.

name: FREDRIKA
meaning: Swedish and Finnish feminine form of FREDERICK.

name: FREEMAN
meaning: From an English surname meaning "free man". It originally denoted a person who was not a serf.

name: FREJ
meaning: Danish and Swedish form of FREYR.

name: FREJA
meaning: Danish and Swedish form of FREYA.

name: FREYA
meaning: From Old Norse Freyja meaning "lady". This was the name of the goddess of love, beauty, war and death in Norse mythology. She claimed half of the heroes who were slain in battle and brought them to her realm of Fólkvangr. Along with her brother Freyr and father Njord, she was one of the Vanir (as opposed to the Æsir). Some scholars connect her with the goddess Frigg....[more]

name: FREYJA
meaning: Icelandic and Old Norse form of FREYA.

name: FREYR
meaning: Means "lord" in Old Norse. This was the name of a Norse god. He may have originally been called Yngvi, with the name Freyr being his title. Freyr presided over fertility, sunlight and rain, and was the husband of the frost giantess Gerd. With his twin sister Freya and father Njord he was one of the group of deities called the Vanir.

name: FRIDA
meaning: Germanic name, originally a short form of other feminine names containing the Germanic element frid meaning "peace". This is also the Scandinavian equivalent, from the Old Norse cognate Fríða. A famous bearer was Mexican painter Frida Kahlo (1907-1954).

name: FRIDENOT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements frid "peace" and not "need".

name: FRIDESWIDE
meaning: Modern form of the Old English name Friðuswiþ, formed of the elements friþ "peace" and swiþ "strong". Saint Frideswide was an 8th-century English princess who became a nun. She is credited with establishing Christ Church in Oxford.

name: FRIDUMAR
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements frid "peace" and mari "famous".

name: FRIEDE
meaning: Short form of names containing the element fried, derived from the Germanic element frid meaning "peace".

name: FRIEDEMANN
meaning: Means "man of peace" from the Germanic elements frid "peace" and man "man".

name: FRIEDHELM
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements frid "peace" and helm "helmet, protection".

name: FRIEDHOLD
meaning: Means "peaceful ruler", derived from the Germanic elements frid "peace" and wald "rule".

name: FRIEDRICH
meaning: German form of FREDERICK. This was the name of kings of Germany. The socialist Friedrich Engels (1820-1895) and the philosopher Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche (1844-1900) are two famous bearers of this name.

name: FRIGG
meaning: Means "beloved" in Old Norse, ultimately derived from Indo-European *pri "to love". In Norse mythology she was the goddess of the earth, air and fertility, and the wife of Odin. Some scholars believe that she and the goddess Freya share a common origin.

name: FRISO
meaning: Refers to a member of the ethnic group, the Frisians, a Germanic tribe of northwest Europe. Friesland in the Netherlands is named for them.

name: FRITJOF
meaning: From the Old Norse name Friðþjófr meaning "thief of peace", derived from the elements friðr "peace" and þjófr "thief".

name: FRODE
meaning: From the Old Norse name Fróði, which was derived from fróðr meaning "learned, wise".

name: FRODO
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element frod "wise". This was the name of the hobbit hero in 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954) by J. R. R. Tolkien, who used Old English to translate some hobbit names (Frodo's real name was Maura). In the novel Frodo Baggins was the bearer of the One Ring on the quest to destroy it in Mount Doom.

name: FRUZSINA
meaning: Diminutive of Eufrozina, the Hungarian form of EUPHROSYNE.

name: FRÍÐA
meaning: Old Norse cognate of FRIDA, also in part derived from Old Norse fríðr meaning "beautiful, beloved".

name: FU
meaning: From Chinese 富(fù) meaning "abundant, rich, wealthy", 芙(fú) meaning "hibiscus, lotus" or 甫(fǔ) meaning "begin, man, father", in addition to other characters with a similar pronunciation. A famous bearer was the 8th-century Tang dynasty poet Du Fu, whose given was 甫.

name: FULBERT
meaning: From the Germanic elements fulc "people" and beraht "bright". Saint Fulbert was an 11th-century bishop of Chartres.

name: FULGENCIO
meaning: Spanish form of the Late Latin name Fulgentius, which meant "shining" from Latin fulgens. Saint Fulgentius was a 6th-century bishop from Tunisia who was a friend of Saint Augustine.

name: FULK
meaning: From the Germanic name Fulco, a short form of various names beginning with the element fulc "people". The Normans brought this name to England, though it is now very rare.

name: FULTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the name of the town of Foulden in Norfolk, itself meaning "bird hill" in Old English.

name: FULVIO
meaning: Italian form of the Roman family name Fulvius, which was derived from Latin fulvus "yellow, tawny".

name: FUYUKO
meaning: From Japanese 冬(fuyu) meaning "winter" and 子(ko) meaning "child", as well as other combinations of kanji.

name: FYODOR
meaning: Russian form of THEODORE. It was borne by three tsars of Russia. Another notable bearer was Fyodor Dostoyevsky (1821-1881), the Russian author of such works as 'Crime and Punishment' and 'The Brothers Karamazov'.

name: FÁTIMA
meaning: From the name of a town in Portugal, which is derived from the Arabic feminine name FATIMAH, apparently after a Moorish princess who converted to Christianity during the Reconquista. The town became an important Christian pilgrimage center after 1917 when three local children reported witnessing repeated apparitions of the Virgin Mary.

name: FÉLICIENNE
meaning: French feminine form of Felicianus (see FELICIANO).

name: FÉLIX
meaning: French, Spanish and Portuguese form of FELIX.

name: GABI
meaning: German diminutive of GABRIELE(2) (feminine), Romanian diminutive of GABRIEL (masculine) or GABRIELA (feminine), and Hungarian diminutive of GÁBOR (masculine) or GABRIELLA (feminine).

name: GABIJA
meaning: Probably from Lithuanian gaubti meaning "to cover". In Lithuanian mythology this was the name of the goddess of fire and the home.

name: GABRIEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name גַבְרִיאֵל(Gavri'el) meaning "God is my strong man", derived from גֶּבֶר(gever) meaning "strong man, hero" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". Gabriel is an archangel in Hebrew tradition, often appearing as a messenger of God. In the Old Testament he is sent to interpret the visions of the prophet Daniel, while in the New Testament he serves as the announcer of the births of John to Zechariah and Jesus to Mary. According to Islamic tradition he was the angel who dictated the Qur'an to Muhammad....[more]

name: GABRIELLE
meaning: French feminine form of GABRIEL. This was the real name of French fashion designer Coco Chanel (1883-1971).

name: GABRIJEL
meaning: Croatian and Slovene form of GABRIEL.

name: GAD
meaning: Means "fortune, luck" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament, Gad is the first son of Jacob by Leah's slave-girl Zilpah, and the ancestor of one of the twelve tribes of the Israelites. His name is explained in Genesis 30:11. Another Gad in the Old Testament is a prophet of King David.

name: GAETANO
meaning: Italian form of the Latin name Caietanus, which meant "from Caieta". Caieta (now called Gaeta) was a town in ancient Italy, its name deriving either from Kaiadas, the name a Greek location where prisoners were executed, or else from Caieta, the name of the nurse of Aeneas. Saint Gaetano was a 16th-century Italian priest who founded the Theatines.

name: GAGE
meaning: From an English surname of Old French origin meaning either "measure", originally denoting one who was an assayer, or "pledge", referring to a moneylender. It was popularized as a given name by a character from the book 'Pet Sematary' (1983) and the subsequent movie adaptation (1989).

name: GAIA
meaning: From the Greek word γαια(gaia), a parallel form of γη(ge) meaning "earth". In Greek mythology Gaia was the mother goddess who presided over the earth. She was the mate of Uranus and the mother of the Titans and the Cyclopes.

name: GAIANA
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Γαιανη(Gaiane), a derivative of GAIA. This was the name of a (perhaps fictional) martyr who was killed in Armenia during the persecutions of Emperor Diocletian in the late 3rd century.

name: GAIUS
meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, of uncertain meaning. It is possibly derived from Latin gaudere "to rejoice", though it may be of unknown Etruscan origin. This was a very common Roman praenomen, the most famous bearers being Gaius Julius Caesar, the great leader of the Roman Republic, and his adopted son Gaius Octavius (later known as Augustus), the first Roman emperor. This name also appears in the New Testament belonging to a bishop of Ephesus who is regarded as a saint.

name: GAJA  (1)
meaning: Either a form of GAIA or a feminine form of GAIUS.

name: GALADRIEL
meaning: Means "maiden crowned with a radiant garland" in Sindarin. Galadriel was a Noldorin elf princess renowned for her beauty and wisdom in J. R. R. Tolkien's novels. The elements are galad "radiant" and riel "garlanded maiden". Alatáriel is the Quenya form of her name.

name: GALAHAD
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Arthurian legend Sir Galahad was the son of Lancelot and Elaine. He was the most pure of the Knights of the Round Table, and he was the only one to succeed in finding the Holy Grail. He first appears in the medieval French 'Lancelot-Grail' cycle.

name: GALE  (2)
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Middle English gaile "jovial".

name: GALEN
meaning: Modern form of the Greek name Γαληνος(Galenos), which meant "calm" from Greek γαληνη(galene). It was borne by a 2nd-century BC Greco-Roman physician who contributed to anatomy and medicine. In modern times the name is occasionally given in his honour.

name: GALENA
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian feminine form of Galenos (see GALEN).

name: GALINA
meaning: Russian and Bulgarian feminine form of Galenos (see GALEN).

name: GALLAGHER
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Gallchobhair meaning "descendant of GALLCHOBHAR".

name: GALLCHOBHAR
meaning: Irish name derived from gall "stranger" and cabhair "help".

name: GALLUS
meaning: Roman family name which meant "rooster" in Latin. This was the name of a 7th-century Irish saint, a companion of Saint Columbanus, who later became a hermit in Switzerland.

name: GAMALIEL
meaning: Means "my reward is God" in Hebrew. In Acts in the New Testament he is a teacher of Saint Paul.

name: GANDALF
meaning: Means "wand elf" in Old Norse, from the elements gandr "wand, staff, cane" and álfr "elf". This name belongs to a dwarf in the 'Völuspá', a 13th-century Scandinavian manuscript which forms part of the Poetic Edda. The author J. R. R. Tolkien borrowed the name for a wizard in his novels 'The Hobbit' (1937) and 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954).

name: GANESHA
meaning: Means "lord of hordes" from Sanskrit गण(gana) meaning "horde, multitude" and ईश(isha) meaning "lord, ruler". This is the name of the Hindu god of wisdom and good luck, the son of Shiva and Parvati. He is often depicted as a stout man with the head of an elephant.

name: GANG
meaning: From Chinese 刚(gāng) meaning "hard, rigid, strong", as well as other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: GANYMEDE
meaning: From Greek Γανυμηδης(Ganymedes), which was possibly derived from γανυμαι(ganymai) "to be glad" and μηδομαι(medomai) "to think, to plan". In Greek mythology this was the name of a beautiful boy who was abducted by Zeus to become the cupbearer to the gods, the successor of Hebe. A moon of Jupiter is named after him.

name: GARBHÁN
meaning: Means "little rough one" from Irish garbh "rough" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of a 7th-century Irish saint.

name: GARDENIA
meaning: From the name of the tropical flower, which was named for the Scottish naturalist Alexander Garden (1730-1791).

name: GAREGIN
meaning: Old Armenian name of unknown meaning.

name: GARETH
meaning: Meaning unknown. It first appears in this form in Thomas Malory's 15th-century compilation of Arthurian legends 'Le Morte d'Arthur', in which Gareth was a Knight of the Round Table, the brother of Sir Gawain. Malory based the name on Gahariet, which was the name of a similar Arthurian character in French sources. It may ultimately have a Welsh origin, possibly related to gwaredd meaning "gentleness".

name: GARFIELD
meaning: From a surname meaning "triangle field" in Old English. A famous bearer was American president James A. Garfield (1831-1881). It is now associated with the cat in Jim Davis's cartoon strip 'Garfield'.

name: GARGI
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of a 7th-century BC Indian philosopher who appears in the Upanishads, which are parts of Hindu scripture.

name: GARLAND
meaning: From a surname meaning "triangle land" from Old English gara and land. The surname originally belonged to a person who owned a triangle-shaped piece of land.

name: GARNET  (1)
meaning: From the English word garnet for the precious stone, the birthstone of January. The word is derived from Middle English gernet meaning "dark red".

name: GARNET  (2)
meaning: From an English surname which either referred to a person who made hinges (Old French carne) or was derived from the Norman name GUARIN.

name: GARRET
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of GARRETT.

name: GARRETT
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the given name GERALD or GERARD. A famous bearer of the surname was Pat Garrett (1850-1908), the sheriff who shot Billy the Kid.

name: GARRICK
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from Occitan garric meaning "oak tree grove".

name: GARSEA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly related to the Basque word hartz meaning "bear". This was the name of several medieval kings of Navarre and Leon.

name: GARTH
meaning: From a surname meaning "garden" in Old Norse, originally denoting one who lived near or worked in a garden.

name: GARY
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a Norman given name, which was itself originally a short form of names beginning with the Germanic element ger meaning "spear". This name was popularized in the late 1920s the American actor Gary Cooper (1901-1961), who took his stage name from the city of Gary in Indiana where his agent was born.

name: GASPAR
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of JASPER, as well as the Latin form.

name: GASTON
meaning: Possibly from a Germanic name derived from the element gast meaning "stranger, guest". This is the usual French name for Saint Vedastus, called Vaast in Flemish, and alternatively the name may be connected to it. The name was also borne by several counts of Foix-Béarn, beginning in the 13th century.

name: GAUBERT
meaning: French form of the Germanic name Waldobert, composed of the elements wald "rule" and beraht "bright". This was the name of a 7th-century French saint.

name: GAUFRID
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements gawia "territory" and frid "peace".

name: GAURI
