meaning: Means "white" in Sanskrit. This is a Hindu goddess, another name of Parvati the wife of Shiva, so named because of her fair complexion.

name: GAUTAMA
meaning: In the case of Siddhartha Gautama, a patronymic form of GOTAMA. Siddhartha Gautama, also known as Buddha, the founder of Buddhism, was a 6th-century BC nobleman who left his family in order to lead a life of meditation and poverty.

name: GAUTSTAFR
meaning: Old Norse form (possibly) of GUSTAV. This form is only attested in the Old Norse period belonging to a horse.

name: GAVIN
meaning: Medieval form of GAWAIN. Though it died out in England, it was reintroduced from Scotland in the 20th century.

name: GAVINO
meaning: From the Late Latin name Gabinus, which possibly referred to the ancient city of Gabii in central Italy. Saint Gavino was martyred in Sardinia in the 3rd century.

name: GAVRIIL
meaning: Greek and Russian form of GABRIEL.

name: GAVRIL
meaning: Bulgarian, Macedonian and Romanian form of GABRIEL.

name: GAWAIN
meaning: Meaning uncertain, from the Latin form Walganus used by the 12th-century chronicler Geoffrey of Monmouth. This was the name of a nephew of King Arthur and one of the Knights of the Round Table in Arthurian legend. He can be identified with the earlier Welsh hero Gwalchmei, and it is likely that the name derives from GWALCHMEI. Alternatively it may have a different Celtic or even a Germanic origin. Gawain was a popular hero in medieval stories such as the 14th-century romantic poem 'Sir Gawain and the Green Knight'.

name: GAY
meaning: From the English word gay meaning "gay, happy". By the mid-20th century the word had acquired the additional meaning of "homosexual", and the name has subsequently dropped out of use.

name: GAYATRI
meaning: From Sanskrit गायत्र(gayatra) which refers to a type of song or hymn with a particular meter. It is also the name of a Hindu goddess who is a personification of this song.

name: GAYLORD
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Old French gaillard "high-spirited, boistrous". This name was rarely used after the mid-20th century, when the word gay acquired the slang meaning "homosexual".

name: GAÉTANE
meaning: French feminine form of Caietanus (see GAETANO).

name: GAËL
meaning: Meaning uncertain. It possibly derives from the ethno-linguistic term Gael, which refers to speakers of Gaelic languages. Alternatively it may be a variant of GWENAËL.

name: GAËTANE
meaning: French feminine form of Caietanus (see GAETANO).

name: GBEMISOLA
meaning: Means "carry me into wealth" in Yoruba.

name: GEARÓID
meaning: Irish form of GERARD or GERALD.

name: GEBHARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element geb "gift" combined with hard "brave, hardy". Saint Gebhard was a 10th-century bishop of Constance.

name: GEDALIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH is great" in Hebrew. This was the name of several characters in the Old Testament, including the governor of Judah appointed by Nebuchadnezzar.

name: GEDEON
meaning: Form of GIDEON used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: GEEVARGHESE
meaning: Malayalam form of GEORGE, used by Saint Thomas Christians in the Indian state of Kerala.

name: GEIR
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse element geirr meaning "spear".

name: GELLÉRT
meaning: Hungarian form of GERARD. Saint Gellért was an 11th-century missionary to Hungary who was martyred by being thrown into the Danube.

name: GEMARIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH has completed" in Hebrew. This is the name of a friend of Jeremiah in the Old Testament.

name: GEMINI
meaning: Means "twins" in Latin. This is the name of the third sign of the zodiac. The two brightest stars in the constellation, Castor and Pollux, are named for the mythological twin sons of Leda.

name: GEMMA
meaning: Medieval Italian nickname meaning "gem, precious stone". It was borne by the wife of the 13th-century Italian poet Dante Alighieri.

name: GENADI
meaning: Bulgarian and Georgian form of GENNADIUS.

name: GENESIS
meaning: Means "birth, origin" in Greek. This is the name of the first book of the Old Testament in the Bible. It tells of the creation of the world, the expulsion of Adam and Eve, Noah and the great flood, and the three patriarchs.

name: GENEVA
meaning: Possibly a shortened form of GENEVIEVE. It could also be inspired by the name of the city in Switzerland. It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since the 19th century.

name: GENEVIÈVE
meaning: From the medieval name Genovefa, which is of uncertain origin. It could be derived from the Germanic elements kuni "kin, family" and wefa "wife, woman". Alternatively it could be of Gaulish origin, from the related Celtic element genos "kin, family" combined with a second element of unknown meaning. This name was borne by Saint Geneviève, the patron saint of Paris, who inspired the city to resist the Huns in the 5th century.

name: GENGHIS
meaning: From the title Genghis (or Chinggis) Khan, meaning "universal ruler", which was adopted by the Mongol Empire founder Temujin in the late 12th century. Remembered both for his military brilliance and his brutality towards civilians, he went on to conquer huge areas of Asia and Eastern Europe.

name: GENISTA
meaning: From the Latin name of the broom plant.

name: GENNADIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Γενναδιος(Gennadios), which was derived from Greek γενναδας(gennadas) "noble, generous". Saint Gennadius was an early martyr from North Africa.

name: GENOVEVA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of GENEVIÈVE.

name: GENTIAN
meaning: From the name of the flowering plant called the gentian, the roots of which are used to create a tonic. It is derived from the name of the Illyrian king GENTIUS, who supposedly discovered its medicinal properties.

name: GENTIUS
meaning: Possibly means "to beget" in Illyrian. This was the name of a 2nd-century BC Illyrian king who went to war with Rome.

name: GEOFFREY
meaning: From a Norman French form of a Germanic name. The second element is Germanic frid "peace", but the first element may be either gawia "territory", walha "foreign" or gisil "hostage". It is possible that two or more names merged into a single form. In the later Middle Ages Geoffrey was further confused with the distinct name Godfrey....[more]

name: GEORG
meaning: Form of GEORGE. This name was borne by the German idealist philosopher Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831).

name: GEORGE
meaning: From the Greek name Γεωργιος(Georgios) which was derived from the Greek word γεωργος(georgos) meaning "farmer, earthworker", itself derived from the elements γη(ge) "earth" and εργον(ergon) "work". Saint George was a 3rd-century Roman soldier from Palestine who was martyred during the persecutions of Emperor Diocletian. Later legends describe his defeat of a dragon, with which he was often depicted in medieval art....[more]

name: GEORGES
meaning: French form of GEORGE. This name was borne by the French artists Georges Seurat (1859-1891) and Georges Braque (1882-1963).

name: GEORGIA
meaning: Latinate feminine form of GEORGE. This is the name of an American state, which was named after the British king George II. A famous bearer was the American painter Georgia O'Keeffe (1887-1986).

name: GEORGIANA
meaning: Feminine form of GEORGE. This form of the name has been in use in the English-speaking world since the 18th century.

name: GERA
meaning: Possibly means "a grain" in Hebrew. This was the name of several members of the tribe of Benjamin in the Old Testament.

name: GERAINT
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly a Welsh form of GERONTIUS. This was the name of a figure various Welsh legends. He was also incorporated into later Arthurian tales as one of the Knights of the Round Table and the husband of Enid.

name: GERALD
meaning: From a Germanic name meaning "rule of the spear", from the elements ger meaning "spear" and wald meaning "rule". The Normans brought this name to Britain. Though it died out in England during the Middle Ages, it remained common in Ireland. It was revived in the English-speaking world in 19th century.

name: GERALDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of GERALD.

name: GERARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element ger meaning "spear" combined with hard meaning "brave, hardy". The Normans introduced this name to Britain. It was initially much more common than the similar name Gerald, with which it was often confused, but it is now less common.

name: GERARDO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of GERARD.

name: GERASIM
meaning: Russian and Macedonian form of GERASIMOS.

name: GERASIMOS
meaning: Derived from Greek γερας(geras) meaning either "old" or "honour". Saint Gerasimus was a 5th-century hermit.

name: GERBEN
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ger meaning "spear" and bern meaning "bear".

name: GERBOLD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ger meaning "spear" and bald meaning "bold".

name: GERD  (2)
meaning: Derived from Old Norse garðr meaning "enclosure". In Norse myth Gerd was a fertility goddess, a frost giantess who was the wife of Freyr.

name: GEREON
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek γερων(geron) meaning "old man, elder". This was the name of a saint martyred in Cologne in the 4th century.

name: GERFRIED
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ger "spear" and frid "peace".

name: GERHARD
meaning: German, Dutch and Scandinavian form of GERARD.

name: GERHILD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ger "spear" and hild "battle".

name: GERLACH
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element ger "spear" combined with laic "play". Saint Gerlach was a 12th-century Dutch soldier who became a hermit.

name: GERLINDE
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element ger meaning "spear" combined with lind meaning "soft, tender, flexible".

name: GERMAINE
meaning: French feminine form of GERMAIN. Saint Germaine was a 16th-century peasant girl from France.

name: GERMANO
meaning: Italian and Portuguese form of GERMANUS.

name: GERMANUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which meant "brother" in Latin. This was the name of several early saints.

name: GERMUND
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ger "spear" and mund "protection".

name: GERNOT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ger "spear" and hnod "crush".

name: GERO
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Germanic element ger meaning "spear".

name: GERONIMO
meaning: From Gerónimo, a Spanish form of JEROME. This is the better-known name of the Apache leader Goyathlay (1829-1909). It was given to him by the Mexicans, his enemies.

name: GERONTIUS
meaning: From a Late Latin name which was derived from Greek γερων(geron) "old man".

name: GERRIT
meaning: Dutch and Frisian form of GERARD.

name: GERRY
meaning: Diminutive of GERALD, GERARD or GERALDINE.

name: GERSHOM
meaning: Probably means "exile" in Hebrew, though the Bible explains that it derives from גֵּר שָׁם(ger sham) meaning "a stranger there" (see Exodus 18:3). This is the name of a son of Moses in the Old Testament.

name: GERSHON
meaning: Variant of GERSHOM. This is the name of a son of Levi in the Old Testament.

name: GERT
meaning: German and Dutch short form of GERHARD.

name: GERTRUDA
meaning: Polish and Czech form of GERTRUDE.

name: GERTRUDE
meaning: Means "spear of strength", derived from the Germanic elements ger "spear" and thrud "strength". Saint Gertrude the Great was a 13th-century nun and mystic writer. It was probably introduced to England by settlers from the Low Countries in the 15th century. Shakespeare used the name in his play 'Hamlet' (1600) for the mother of the title character. A famous bearer was the American writer Gertrude Stein (1874-1946).

name: GERULF
meaning: Derived from Germanic ger "spear" and wulf "wolf".

name: GERVASE
meaning: English form of GERVASIUS. The Normans introduced this name to England in the Middle Ages, though it has since become rare.

name: GERVASIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of GERVASIUS.

name: GERVASIUS
meaning: Probably a Latinized form of a Germanic name with a first element deriving from ger "spear". Saint Gervasius was an early martyr from Milan whose remains were discovered in the 4th century.

name: GETHSEMANE
meaning: From a biblical place name, the garden where Jesus was arrested, located on the Mount of Olives near Jerusalem. It is derived from Γεθσημανι(Gethsemani), the Greek form of an Aramaic name meaning "oil vat". It is very rarely used as a given name.

name: GEZABELE
meaning: Form of JEZEBEL used in some versions of the Italian Bible.

name: GHASSAN
meaning: Means "youth" in Arabic. This was the name of an Arabian tribe that existed until the 6th century.

name: GHISLAIN
meaning: French form of Gislenus, a Latinized form of the Germanic name Gislin, derived from the element gisil meaning "hostage" or "pledge". This was the name of a 7th-century Belgian saint.

name: GHULAM
meaning: Means "servant, boy" in Arabic. It is often used as the first part of compound names.

name: GIAMBATTISTA
meaning: Combination of GIANNI and BATTISTA, given in honour of Saint John the Baptist.

name: GIANNA
meaning: Italian short form of GIOVANNA and a modern Greek variant of IOANNA.

name: GIANNI
meaning: Italian short form of GIOVANNI and a modern Greek variant of IOANNIS.

name: GIANNIS
meaning: Modern Greek variant of Ioannes (see JOHN).

name: GIDEON
meaning: Means "feller, hewer" in Hebrew. Gideon is a hero and judge of the Old Testament. He led the vastly outnumbered Israelites against the Midianites, defeated them, and killed their two kings. In the English-speaking world, Gideon has been used as a given name since the Protestant Reformation, and it was popular among the Puritans.

name: GIDIE
meaning: Medieval French form of Aegidius (see GILES).

name: GIEDRIUS
meaning: Derived from Lithuanian giedras meaning "serene, clear".

name: GIFFARD
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Germanic given name GEBHARD.

name: GIGI
meaning: French diminutive of GEORGINE or VIRGINIE.

name: GIIWEDINOKWE
meaning: Means "woman of the north" in Ojibwe.

name: GIL  (1)
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of GILES.

name: GIL  (2)
meaning: Short form of GILBERT and other names beginning with Gil.

name: GILBERT
meaning: Means "bright pledge", derived from the Germanic elements gisil "pledge, hostage" and beraht "bright". The Normans introduced this name to England, where it was common during the Middle Ages. It was borne by a 12th-century British saint, the founder of the religious order known as the Gilbertines.

name: GILBERTA
meaning: Feminine form of GILBERT or GILBERTO.

name: GILBERTO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of GILBERT.

name: GILCHRIST
meaning: Derived from the Gaelic phrase giolla Chríost meaning "servant of Christ".

name: GILDA
meaning: Originally an Italian short form of names containing the Germanic element gild meaning "sacrifice, value".

name: GILEAD
meaning: From an Old Testament place name meaning "heap of witness" in Hebrew. This was a mountainous region east of the Jordan River. Besides being a place name, it is also borne by people in the Bible.

name: GILES
meaning: From the Late Latin name Aegidius, which is derived from Greek αιγιδιον(aigidion) meaning "young goat". Saint Giles was an 8th-century miracle worker who came to southern France from Greece. He is regarded as the patron saint of the crippled. In Old French the name Aegidius became Gidie and then Gilles, at which point it was imported to England.

name: GILGAMESH
meaning: Possibly means "the ancestor is a young man" in Sumerian. This was the name of a Sumerian hero, later appearing in the Akkadian poem the 'Epic of Gilgamesh'. Gigamesh, with his friend Enkidu, battled the giant Humbaba and stopped the rampage of the Bull of Heaven, besides other adventures. Gilgamesh was probably based on a real person: a king of Erech who ruled around the 27th century BC.

name: GILLESPIE
meaning: Anglicized form of Scottish Gille Easbaig or Irish Giolla Easpuig both meaning "servant of the bishop".

name: GILLIAN
meaning: Medieval English feminine form of JULIAN. This spelling has been in use since the 13th century, though it was not declared a distinct name from Julian until the 17th century.

name: GILLIS
meaning: Dutch and Swedish form of GILES.

name: GILROY
meaning: From an Irish surname, either Mac Giolla Ruaidh, which means "son of the red-haired servant", or Mac Giolla Rí, which means "son of the king's servant".

name: GILTBERT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements gild "sacrifice, value" and beraht "bright".

name: GINA
meaning: Short form of GEORGINA, REGINA, LUIGINA, and other names ending in gina. It can also be used as a diminutive of VIRGINIA or EUGENIA. It was popularized in the 1950s by Italian actress Gina Lollobrigida (1927-), whose birth name was Luigina.

name: GINEVRA
meaning: Italian form of GUINEVERE. This is also the Italian name for the city of Geneva, Switzerland. It is also sometimes associated with the Italian word ginepro meaning "juniper".

name: GINGER
meaning: From the English word ginger for the spice or the reddish-brown colour. It can also be a diminutive of VIRGINIA, as in the case of actress and dancer Ginger Rogers (1911-1995), by whom the name was popularized.

name: GINO
meaning: Italian short form of names ending in gino.

name: GIOACHINO
meaning: Italian form of JOACHIM. A famous bearer was the Italian composer Gioachino Rossini (1792-1868).

name: GIOCONDA
meaning: From the Late Latin name Iucunda which meant "pleasant, delightful, happy". Leonardo da Vinci's painting the 'Mona Lisa' is also known as 'La Gioconda' because its subject is Lisa del Giocondo.

name: GIORGI
meaning: Georgian form of GEORGE. This was the name of several kings of Georgia.

name: GIORGOS
meaning: Modern Greek variant of Georgios (see GEORGE).

name: GIOTTO
meaning: Possibly from Ambrogiotto, a diminutive of AMBROGIO. This name was borne by Giotto di Bondone (1267-1337), an Italian painter and architect.

name: GIOVANNA
meaning: Italian form of Iohanna (see JOANNA), making it the feminine form of GIOVANNI.

name: GIOVANNI
meaning: Italian form of Iohannes (see JOHN). The Renaissance painter Giovanni Bellini (1430-1516) and the painter and sculptor Giovanni Lorenzo Bernini (1598-1680) were two famous bearers of this name.

name: GIRISHA
meaning: Means "lord of the mountain" in Sanskrit. This is a name of the Hindu god Shiva, given because of his abode in the Himalayan Mountains.

name: GISBERT
meaning: From a Germanic name in which the second element is beraht "bright". The first element is probably a shortened form of gisil "pledge, hostage" (making it a variant of GILBERT), though it could be related to Gallo-Celtic gaiso "spear".

name: GISELA
meaning: German, Dutch, Spanish and Portuguese form of GISELLE.

name: GISELLE
meaning: Derived from the Germanic word gisil meaning "hostage, pledge". This name may have originally been a descriptive nickname for a child given as a pledge to a foreign court. It was borne by a daughter of the French king Charles III who married the Norman leader Rollo in the 10th century. The name was popular in France during the Middle Ages (the more common French form is Gisèle). Though it became known in the English-speaking world due to Adolphe Adam's ballet 'Giselle' (1841), it was not regularly used until the 20th century.

name: GISELMUND
meaning: From the Germanic elements gisil meaning "hostage, pledge" and mund meaning "protection".

name: GISILFRID
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements gisil "hostage" and frid "peace".

name: GISMUND
meaning: Germanic name, possibly a variant of GISELMUND or SIGISMUND using shortened forms of the initial element.

name: GITA
meaning: Means "song" in Sanskrit. The word appears in the name of the 'Bhagavad Gita', a sacred text of Hinduism (meaning "divine song").

name: GITTA
meaning: German short form of BRIGITTA and a Hungarian short form of MARGIT.

name: GIUSEPPE
meaning: Italian form of JOSEPH. Giuseppe Garibaldi (1807-1882) was a military leader who united Italy in the 19th century.

name: GIVI
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Persian origin.

name: GLADWIN
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the Old English given name GLÆDWINE.

name: GLADYS
meaning: From the old Welsh name Gwladus, possibly derived from gwlad "country". It has historically been used as a Welsh form of CLAUDIA. This name became popular outside of Wales after it was used in Ouida's novel 'Puck' (1870).

name: GLANVILLE
meaning: From an English surname which was taken from a Norman place name which possibly meant "domain of (a person named) Gland" in Old French.

name: GLAUCO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of GLAUCUS.

name: GLAUCUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Γλαυκος(Glaukos), a name meaning "bluish grey". This was the name of a Greek sea god, as well as other characters in Greek legend.

name: GLAW
meaning: Means "rain" in Welsh. This is a modern Welsh name.

name: GLEB
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of the Old Norse name Guðleifr, which was derived from the elements guð "god" and leifr "heir".

name: GLENDA
meaning: A name created in the 20th century from the Welsh elements glân "pure, clean" and da "good".

name: GLENN
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from Gaelic gleann "valley". A famous bearer of the surname was American astronaut John Glenn (1921-2016).

name: GLENYS
meaning: Elaboration of the Welsh word glân meaning "pure, clean, holy". This name was created in the late 19th century.

name: GLOOSCAP
meaning: Derived from an Eastern Algonquian phrase meaning "man from nothing". Glooscap (or Gluskabe) was a hero involved in the creation myths of the Wabanaki people of eastern North America.

name: GLORIA
meaning: Means "glory", from the Portuguese and Spanish titles of the Virgin Mary Maria da Glória and María de Gloria. Maria da Glória (1819-1853) was the daughter of the Brazilian emperor Pedro I, eventually becoming queen of Portugal as Maria II....[more]

name: GLORIANA
meaning: Elaborated form of Latin gloria meaning "glory". In Edmund Spenser's poem 'The Faerie Queene' (1590) this was the name of the title character, a representation of Queen Elizabeth I.

name: GLORY
meaning: Simply from the English word glory, ultimately from Latin gloria.

name: GLYNDWR
meaning: From a Welsh surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "valley water". This name is often given in honour of Owain Glyndwr, a 14th-century Welsh patriot who led a revolt against England.

name: GLYNIS
meaning: Either a variant of GLENYS or an elaboration of the Welsh word glyn meaning "valley".

name: GLÁUCIO
meaning: Portuguese form of the Roman cognomen Glaucia, which was derived from Latin glaucus "bluish grey", ultimately from Greek.

name: GLÆDWINE
meaning: Old English name derived from the elements glæd "bright" and wine "friend". This name was not actually recorded in the Old English era, though it is attested starting in the 11th century.

name: GNAEUS
meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, which is of unknown Etruscan meaning, though it may be related to Latin naevus "birthmark". A famous bearer was Gnaeus Pompeius Magnus, also known as Pompey the Great, a Roman general of the 1st century BC.

name: GOBIND
meaning: Variant of GOVINDA used in northern India. This was the name of the last Sikh guru, Gobind Singh (1666-1708).

name: GOBNAIT
meaning: Feminine form of GOBÁN. This was the name of a 6th-century Irish abbess, the patron saint of Ballyvourney.

name: GOBÁN
meaning: Either means "little smith" from Irish gobha "smith" combined with a diminutive suffix, or else derived from the name of the Irish god GOIBNIU (which is also a derivative of gobha).

name: GOCHA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly from a Georgian dialectal word meaning "old man".

name: GODA
meaning: Germanic name derived from the element god meaning "good".

name: GODABERT
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements god "god" and beraht "bright".

name: GODDARD
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the Germanic given name GODEHARD.

name: GODEHARD
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements god "god" and hard "hardy, brave". This was the name of an 11th-century saint who was a bishop of Hildesheim.

name: GODELIVA
meaning: Feminine form of GOTELEIB. This was the name of an 11th-century Flemish saint who was murdered on her husband's orders.

name: GODFREY
meaning: From the Germanic name Godafrid, which meant "peace of god" from the Germanic elements god "god" and frid "peace". The Normans brought this name to England, where it became common during the Middle Ages. A notable bearer was Godfrey of Bouillon, an 11th-century leader of the First Crusade and the first ruler of the Latin Kingdom of Jerusalem.

name: GODIVA
meaning: Latinized form of the Old English name Godgifu meaning "gift of god", from the elements god and giefu "gift". Lady Godiva was an 11th-century English noblewoman who, according to legend, rode naked through the streets of Coventry to protest the high taxes imposed by her husband upon the townspeople.

name: GODOFREDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of GODFREY.

name: GODRIC
meaning: Means "power of god", derived from Old English god combined with ric "power, rule". This name died out a few centuries after the Norman conquest.

name: GODWINE
meaning: Means "friend of god", derived from Old English god combined with wine "friend". This was the name of the powerful 11th-century Earl of Wessex, the father of King Harold II of England.

name: GOHAR
meaning: Means "jewel" in Armenian, ultimately of Persian origin.

name: GOIBNIU
meaning: Derived from Irish gobha meaning "smith". This was the name of the Irish smith god, a provider of weapons for the Tuatha De Danann. He was also skilled at brewing beer.

name: GOIZARGI
meaning: Derived from Basque goiz "morning" and argi "light".

name: GOIZEDER
meaning: Derived from Basque goiz "morning" and eder "beautiful".

name: GOLDIE  (1)
meaning: From a nickname for a person with blond hair, from the English word gold.

name: GOLIATH
meaning: From Hebrew גָּלְיָת(Golyat), possibly derived from גָּלָה(galah) meaning "uncover, reveal". This is the name of the giant Philistine who is slain by David in the Old Testament.

name: GOLNAR
meaning: Derived from Persian گل(gol) "flower, rose" and انار(anar) "pomegranate".

name: GOLNAZ
meaning: Derived from Persian گل(gol) "flower, rose" and ناز(naz) "pride".

name: GOMER
meaning: Means "complete" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of both a grandson of Noah and the unfaithful wife of the prophet Hosea.

name: GOMES
meaning: Medieval Portuguese form of the Visigothic name Goma, derived from the Germanic element guma meaning "man".

name: GONZALO
meaning: From the medieval name Gundisalvus, which was the Latin form of a Germanic name composed of the elements gund "war" and salv which is of unknown meaning.

name: GOODWIN
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name GODWINE.

name: GOPALA
meaning: Means "cow protector" from Sanskrit गो(go) meaning "cow" and पाल(pala) meaning "guard, protector". This is another name of the Hindu god Krishna. This name was also borne by the 8th-century founder of the Pala Empire in Bengal.

name: GOPINATH
meaning: Tamil and Malayalam form of GOPINATHA.

name: GOPINATHA
meaning: Means "leader of the gopis" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu god Krishna, acquired because of his association with the gopis, who are cow-herding girls.

name: GORAN
meaning: Means "mountain man", derived from South Slavic gora "mountain". It was popularized by the Croatian poet Ivan Goran Kovačić (1913-1943), who got his middle name because of the mountain town where he was born.

name: GORDAN
meaning: Derived from South Slavic gord meaning "dignified". This name and the feminine form Gordana were popularized by the publication of Croatian author Marija Jurić Zagorka's novel 'Gordana' (1935).

name: GORDIAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Gordianus which meant "from Gordium", Gordium being the capital of Phrygia in Asia Minor. This is the name by which three Roman emperors are known.

name: GORDIE
meaning: Diminutive of GORDON. A famous bearer was Canadian hockey star Gordie Howe (1928-2016).

name: GORDON
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was originally derived from a place name in Berwickshire meaning "spacious fort". It was originally used in honour of Charles George Gordon (1833-1885), a British general who died defending the city of Khartoum in Sudan.

name: GORE
meaning: From an English surname meaning "triangular" (from Old English gara), originally referring to someone who lived on a triangular piece of land. A famous bearer is American writer Gore Vidal (1925-).

name: GORETTI
meaning: From the surname of Maria Goretti, a 20th-century Italian saint who forgave her murderer on her deathbed. Her surname was derived from the given name GREGORIO.

name: GORMLAITH
meaning: Derived from Irish gorm "blue" or "illustrious" and flaith "princess, lady". This was the name of a wife of the 11th-century Irish ruler Brian Boru.

name: GORONWY
meaning: Meaning unknown. In the Mabinogion, a collection of tales from Welsh myth, he was the lover of Blodeuwedd. He attempted to murder her husband Lleu Llaw Gyffes but was himself killed.

name: GOROU
meaning: From Japanese 五(go) meaning "five" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". This was traditionally a name for the fifth son. Different combinations of kanji are also possible.

name: GOSTISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements gosti "guest" and slava "glory".

name: GOSWIN
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements Gaut "Goth" and win "friend".

name: GOTAMA
meaning: Means "the best ox" from Sanskrit गो(go) meaning "ox, cow" and तम(tama) meaning "best". In Hindu texts this is the name of one of the Saptarshis, or seven sages. This name was also born by an early Indian philosopher who wrote the Nyaya Sutras.

name: GOTELEIB
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements god "god" and leub "dear, beloved".

name: GOTTFRIED
meaning: German form of GODFREY. This name was borne by the 13th-century German poet Gottfried von Strassburg and the German philosopher and mathematician Gottfried Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), one of the inventors of calculus.

name: GOTTHILF
meaning: Derived from German Gott "God" and hilf "help". This name was created in the 17th century.

name: GOTTHOLD
meaning: Derived from German Gott "God" and hold "lovely". This name was created in the 17th century.

name: GOTTLOB
meaning: Derived from German Gott "God" and lob "praise". This name was created in the 17th century.

name: GOTTSCHALK
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements god "god" and scalc "servant". Saint Gottschalk was a (perhaps spurious) 11th-century prince of the Wends who was martyred by his brother-in-law.

name: GOUYEN
meaning: Means "wise" in Apache. This was the name of a 19th-century Apache warrior woman.

name: GOVAD
meaning: Means "wind" in Persian. This was the name of a Yazata (or angel) associated with the wind in Zoroastrianism.

name: GOVINDA
meaning: Means "cow finder", derived from Sanskrit गो(go) meaning "cow" combined with विन्द(vinda) meaning "finding". This is another name of the Hindu god Krishna.

name: GOYATHLAY
meaning: Means "one who yawns" in Apache. This was the real name of the Apache leader Geronimo (1829-1909), who fought against Mexican and American expansion into his territory.

name: GOZZO
meaning: Originally a diminutive of Germanic names beginning with the element Gaut meaning "Goth".

name: GRACE
meaning: From the English word grace, which ultimately derives from Latin gratia. This was one of the virtue names created in the 17th century by the Puritans. The actress Grace Kelly (1929-1982) was a famous bearer.

name: GRACELYN
meaning: Elaboration of GRACE using the popular name suffix lyn.

name: GRACIA
meaning: Means "grace" in Spanish, making it a cognate of GRACE.

name: GRACIANO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of Gratianus (see GRATIAN).

name: GRADY
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Grádaigh meaning "descendant of Grádaigh". The name Grádaigh means "noble" in Gaelic.

name: GRAEME
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of GRAHAM.

name: GRAHAM
meaning: From a Scottish surname, originally derived from the English place name Grantham, which probably meant "gravelly homestead" in Old English. The surname was first taken to Scotland in the 12th century by the Norman baron William de Graham. A famous bearer was Alexander Graham Bell (1847-1922), the Scottish-Canadian-American inventor who devised the telephone.

name: GRAHAME
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of GRAHAM.

name: GRANT
meaning: From an English and Scottish surname which was derived from Norman French grand meaning "great, large". A famous bearer of the surname was Ulysses Grant (1822-1885), the commander of the Union forces during the American Civil War who later served as president. In America the name has often been given in his honour.

name: GRANVILLE
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a Norman place name GRAINVILLE.

name: GRATIAN
meaning: From the Roman name Gratianus, which meant "grace" from Latin gratus. Saint Gratian was the first bishop of Tours (4th century). This was also the name of a Roman emperor.

name: GRAY
meaning: From an English surname meaning "grey", originally given to a person who had grey hair or clothing.

name: GRAYSON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of the steward", derived from Middle English greyve "steward".

name: GRAZIA
meaning: Means "grace" in Italian, making it a cognate of GRACE.

name: GRAZIANA
meaning: Italian feminine form of Gratianus (see GRATIAN).

name: GRAÇA
meaning: Means "grace" in Portuguese, making it a cognate of GRACE.

name: GRAŻYNA
meaning: Means "beautiful" in Lithuanian. This name was created by Polish poet Adam Mickiewicz for his poem 'Grażyna' (1823).

name: GREER
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from the given name GREGOR.

name: GREET
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of MARGARET.

name: GREGERS
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of GREGORY.

name: GREGOR
meaning: German, Scottish, Slovak and Slovene form of GREGORY. A famous bearer was Gregor Mendel (1822-1884), a Czech monk and scientist who did experiments in genetics.

name: GREGORIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of GREGORY.

name: GREGORY
meaning: English form of Latin Gregorius, which was from the Late Greek name Γρηγοριος(Gregorios), derived from γρηγορος(gregoros) meaning "watchful, alert". This name was popular among early Christians, being borne by a number of important saints including Saint Gregory Thaumaturgus (3rd century), Saint Gregory the Illuminator (4th century), Saint Gregory of Nyssa (4th century), Saint Gregory of Nazianzus (4th century), and Saint Gregory of Tours (6th century). It was also borne by the 6th-century pope Saint Gregory I the Great, a reformer and Doctor of the Church, as well as 15 subsequent popes....[more]

name: GRENVILLE
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of GRANVILLE.

name: GRESHAM
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "grazing homestead" in Old English.

name: GRETA
meaning: Short form of MARGARETA. A famous bearer of this name was the Swedish actress Greta Garbo (1905-1990).

name: GRETE
meaning: German, Danish and Norwegian short form of MARGARET.

name: GRETEL
meaning: Diminutive of GRETE. This name is well-known as the character in Grimm's fairy tale who is captured, with her brother Hansel, by a witch.

name: GRID
meaning: Means "peace" in Old Norse. In Norse myth she was a frost giantess, the mother of Víðarr by Odin. She also aided Thor in his fight against the giant Geirrod.

name: GRIER
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of GREER.

name: GRIFFIN
meaning: Latinized form of GRUFFUDD. This name can also be inspired by the English word griffin, a creature with the body of a lion and the head and wings of an eagle, ultimately from Greek γρυψ(gryps).

name: GRIGOR
meaning: Welsh, Bulgarian, Macedonian and Armenian form of GREGORY. This is the name of the patron saint of Armenia (known as Saint Gregory the Illuminator in English).

name: GRIGORII
meaning: Variant transcription of GRIGORIY, as well as the usual transcription of the Old Slavic form.

name: GRIGORIY
meaning: Russian form of GREGORY. This name was borne by the Russian mystic Grigoriy Rasputin (1869-1916), more commonly known by only his surname.

name: GRIMALDO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of GRIMWALD.

name: GRIMWALD
meaning: From the Germanic elements grim "mask" and wald "power, leader, ruler".

name: GRISELDA
meaning: Possibly derived from the Germanic elements gris "grey" and hild "battle". It is not attested as a Germanic name. This was the name of a patient wife in medieval tales by Boccaccio and Chaucer.

name: GROSVENOR
meaning: From an English surname which meant "great hunter" in Norman French.

name: GROVER
meaning: From a surname meaning "grove of trees" from Old English graf. A famous bearer was the American president Grover Cleveland (1837-1908), who popularized the name in the United States at the end of the 19th century. The name is now associated with a muppet character from the children's television program 'Sesame Street'.

name: GROZDAN
meaning: Derived from Bulgarian or Macedonian грозде(grozde) meaning "grapes".

name: GRUFFUDD
meaning: From the Old Welsh name Griphiud, the second element deriving from Welsh udd "lord, prince" but the first element being of uncertain meaning (possibly cryf "strong"). This was a common name among medieval Welsh royalty. Gruffudd (or Gruffydd) ap Llywelyn was an 11th-century Welsh ruler who fought against England.

name: GRWN
meaning: Means "ridge" in Welsh. This is a Welsh name of recent origin.

name: GRÁINNE
meaning: Possibly derived from Gaelic grán meaning "grain". This was the name of an ancient Irish grain goddess. The name also belonged to the fiancée of Fionn mac Cumhail and the lover of Diarmaid in later Irish legend, and it is often associated with gráidh "love".

name: GRÉTA
meaning: Short form of MARGARÉTA (Hungarian) or MARGRÉT (Icelandic).

name: GRÍMHILDR
meaning: Old Norse cognate of KRIEMHILD. In the Norse 'Volsungasaga' Grímhildr is the mother of Gunnar and Gudrun, while in the later Germanic counterpart the 'Nibelungenlied' Kriemhild is the sister of Günther and she herself has a role equivalent to Gudrun.

name: GRÓA
meaning: Derived from Old Norse gróa "to grow". This is the name of a seeress in Norse mythology.

name: GUADALUPE
meaning: From a Spanish title of the Virgin Mary, Nuestra Señora de Guadalupe, meaning "Our Lady of Guadalupe". Guadalupe is a Spanish place name, the site of a famous convent, derived from Arabic وادي(wadi) meaning "valley, river" possibly combined with Latin lupus meaning "wolf". In the 16th century Our Lady of Guadalupe supposedly appeared in a vision to a native Mexican man, and she is now regarded as a patron saint of the Americas.

name: GUANTING
meaning: From Chinese 冠(guān) meaning "cap, crown, headgear" combined with 廷(tíng) meaning "court". This name can also be formed from other character combinations.

name: GUANYU
meaning: From Chinese 冠(guān) meaning "cap, crown, headgear" combined with 宇(yǔ) meaning "house, eaves, universe". Other character combinations are possible.

name: GUDBRAND
meaning: From the Old Norse name Guðbrandr meaning "god's sword", derived from the elements guð "god" and brandr "sword".

name: GUDMUND
meaning: From the Old Norse name Guðmundr which was derived from the elements guð "god" and mundr "protection".

name: GUDRUN
meaning: From the Old Norse name Guðrún meaning "god's secret lore", derived from the elements guð "god" and rún "secret lore". In Norse legend Gudrun was the wife of Sigurd. After his death she married Atli, but when he murdered her brothers, she killed her sons by him, fed him their hearts, and then slew him.

name: GUGULETHU
meaning: From Xhosa, Zulu and Ndebele igugu "treasure, pride" and lethu "our".

name: GUIDO
meaning: Latinized form of WIDO. This was the name of two 11th-century saints. Other notable bearers include 11th-century music theorist Guido d'Arezzo, 13th-century poet Guido Cavalcanti, and 17th-century painter Guido Reni.

name: GUIFRÉ
meaning: Catalan form of WILFRED. This was the name of a 9th-century count of Barcelona.

name: GUINEVERE
meaning: From the Norman French form of the Welsh name Gwenhwyfar, derived from the elements gwen meaning "fair, white" and sebara meaning "phantom, magical being". In Arthurian legend she was the beautiful wife of King Arthur. According to the 12th-century chronicler Geoffrey of Monmouth, she was seduced by Mordred before the battle of Camlann, which led to the deaths of both Mordred and Arthur. According to the 12th-century French poet Chrétien de Troyes, she engaged in an adulterous affair with Sir Lancelot....[more]

name: GUIOMAR
meaning: Possibly derived from the Germanic name Wigmar, which is formed of the elements wig "war, battle" and mari "famous". In the medieval 'Lancelot-Grail' cycle he plays a minor role as a cousin of Guinevere, who banishes him after he becomes a lover of Morgan le Fey. In modern Portugal and Spain it is a feminine name.

name: GUISCARD
meaning: Norman French form of the Norman name Wischard, formed of the Old Norse elements viskr "wise" and hórðr "brave, hardy".

name: GUIYING
meaning: From Chinese 桂(guì) meaning "laurel, cassia, cinnamon" combined with 英(yīng) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero". This name can be formed from other character combinations as well.

name: GUL
meaning: Means "flower, rose" in Urdu and Pashto, ultimately from Persian.

name: GULBADAN
meaning: Means "having a body like a rose" in Persian. This was the name of a daughter of the Mughal emperor Babur.

name: GULBRAND
meaning: From the Old Norse name Gulbrandr, a variant of Guðbrandr (see GUDBRAND).

name: GULISA
meaning: Means "little heart" in Georgian, derived from გული(guli) "heart" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: GULL
meaning: Short form of various Scandinavian names beginning with the Old Norse element guð meaning "god".

name: GULNARA
meaning: Kazakh, Kyrgyz and Azerbaijani form of GOLNAR.

name: GULNAZ
meaning: Kazakh, Georgian and Urdu form of GOLNAZ.

name: GULRUKH
meaning: Means "rose faced" in Persian. This was the name of a wife of the Mughal emperor Babur.

name: GULSHAN
meaning: Hindi and Urdu form of GOLSHAN.

name: GUMARICH
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements guma meaning "man" and ric meaning "power, rule".

name: GUNBORG
meaning: From the Old Norse name Gunnbjörg, derived from the elements gunnr "war" and björg "help, save, rescue".

name: GUNDA
meaning: Short form of names containing the Germanic element gund which means "war".

name: GUNHILD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Gunnhildr, derived from the elements gunnr "war" and hildr "battle".

name: GUNNAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Gunnarr which was derived from the elements gunnr "war" and arr "warrior" (making it a cognate of GÜNTHER). In Norse legend Gunnar was the husband of Brynhildr. He had his brother-in-law Sigurd murdered based on his wife's false accusations that Sigurd had taken her virginity.

name: GUNNE
meaning: Short form of Old Norse names beginning with the element gunnr "war".

name: GUNNR
meaning: Derived from Old Norse gunnr meaning "war". This was the name of a valkyrie in Norse legend.

name: GUNTRAM
meaning: Means "war raven" from the Germanic elements gund "war" and hramn "raven". This was the name of a 6th-century Frankish king.

name: GUNVALD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Gunnvaldr, derived from gunnr "war" and valdr "power, leader, ruler".

name: GUNVOR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Gunnvör meaning "cautious in war" from gunnr "war" combined with vor "vigilant, cautious".

name: GUO
meaning: From Chinese 国(guó) meaning "country" or other Chinese characters pronounced in a similar way.

name: GURDEEP
meaning: From Sanskrit गुरु(guru) meaning "teacher, guru" and दीप(dipa) meaning "lamp, light".

name: GURGEN
meaning: Derived from Middle Persian gurg "wolf" combined with a diminutive suffix. This name was borne by several Georgian kings and princes.

name: GURMEET
meaning: From Sanskrit गुरु(guru) meaning "teacher, guru" and मित्र(mitra) meaning "friend".

name: GUS  (1)
meaning: Short form of AUGUSTUS or ANGUS.

name: GUS  (2)
meaning: Diminutive of CONSTANTINE, used primarily by Greek expatriates.

name: GUSTAF
meaning: Swedish and German variant of GUSTAV.

name: GUSTAV
meaning: Possibly means "staff of the Goths", derived from the Old Norse elements Gautr "Goth" and stafr "staff". However, the root name Gautstafr is not well attested in the Old Norse period. Alternatively, it might be derived from the Slavic name GOSTISLAV. This name has been borne by six kings of Sweden, including the 16th-century Gustav I Vasa.

name: GUSTAVE
meaning: French form of GUSTAV. This name was borne by the French artist Gustave Doré (1832-1883).

name: GUSTAVO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of GUSTAV.

name: GUSTI
meaning: From a title meaning "leader" in Balinese.

name: GUUS
meaning: Short form of AUGUSTUS or GUSTAAF.

name: GUY
meaning: Norman French form of WIDO. The Normans introduced it to England, where it was common until the time of Guy Fawkes (1570-1606), a revolutionary who attempted to blow up the British parliament. The name was revived in the 19th century, due in part to characters in the novels 'Guy Mannering' (1815) by Sir Walter Scott and 'The Heir of Redclyffe' (1854) by C. M. Yonge.

name: GUÐLAUG
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements guð meaning "god" and laug possibly meaning "betrothed woman".

name: GUÐRÍÐR
meaning: Old Norse name derived from the elements guð "god" and fríðr "beautiful".

name: GUÐRÚN
meaning: Old Norse form of GUDRUN, as well as the modern Icelandic form.

name: GWALCHMEI
meaning: Derived from Welsh gwalch "hawk", possibly combined with mei "May (the month)". This is the name of a character in Welsh legend. He is probably the antecedent of Gawain from Arthurian romance.

name: GWEN
meaning: From Welsh gwen, the feminine form of gwyn meaning "white, fair, blessed". It can also be a short form of GWENDOLEN, GWENLLIAN, and other names beginning with Gwen.

name: GWENAËL
meaning: Means "blessed and generous" from Breton gwenn meaning "white, fair, blessed" and hael meaning "generous". Saint Gwenhael was a 6th-century abbot of Brittany.

name: GWENDA
meaning: Derived from the Welsh elements gwen meaning "white, fair, blessed" and da meaning "good". This name was created in the 20th century.

name: GWENDOLEN
meaning: Means "white ring", derived from the Welsh elements gwen meaning "white, fair, blessed" and dolen meaning "ring, loop". This was the name of a mythical queen of the Britons who defeated her husband in battle, as told by Geoffrey of Monmouth.

name: GWENFREWI
meaning: Derived from the Welsh elements gwen meaning "white, fair, blessed" and frewi meaning "reconciliation, peace". This was the name of a 7th-century Welsh saint and martyr.

name: GWENITH
meaning: Variant of GWYNETH, perhaps influenced by the Welsh word gwenith meaning "wheat".

name: GWENLLIAN
meaning: Derived from the Welsh elements gwen meaning "white, fair, blessed" and llian meaning "flaxen". This name was popular among medieval Welsh royalty. It was borne by the 14th-century daughter of Llywelyn ap Gruffudd.

name: GWENNEG
meaning: Derived from Breton gwenn meaning "white, fair, blessed" combined with a diminutive suffix. Saint Gwenneg was an 8th-century monk of Brittany.

name: GWRTHEYRN
meaning: Means "supreme king" from Welsh gor meaning "over" and teyrn meaning "king, monarch". It is possible that this is not a name, but a title. Gwrtheyrn (also known as Vortigern) was a 5th-century king of the Britons. It was he who invited Horsa and Hengist to Britain, which eventually led to the Anglo-Saxon conquest of England.

name: GWYDION
meaning: Means "born of trees" in Welsh. In the Mabinogion, Gwydion was the nephew of Math, and like him a powerful magician. He was the uncle of Lleu Llaw Gyffes, for whom he fashioned a wife, Blodeuwedd, out of flowers.

name: GWYNEDD
meaning: From the name of a region in Wales, named after an ancient kingdom, which may be derived from the old Welsh given name Cunedda.

name: GWYNEIRA
meaning: Means "white snow" from the Welsh element gwyn meaning "white, fair, blessed" combined with eira meaning "snow".

name: GWYNETH
meaning: Possibly a variant of GWYNEDD or a form of Welsh gwyn meaning "white, fair, blessed". It has been common in Wales since the 19th century.

name: GWYNFOR
meaning: Derived from the Welsh element gwyn meaning "white, fair, blessed" combined with mawr meaning "great, large".

name: GYATSO
meaning: From Tibetan རྒྱ་མཚོ(rgya-mtsho) meaning "ocean". This is one of the given names of the current Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso (1935-).

name: GYEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 京(gyeong) meaning "capital city", 景(gyeong) meaning "scenery, view", 敬(gyeong) meaning "respect, honour", or other hanja characters with the same pronunciation. It usually occurs in combination with another character, though it is sometimes used as a stand-alone name.

name: GYEONG-HUI
meaning: From Sino-Korean 敬(gyeong) meaning "respect, honour" and 姬(hui) meaning "beauty". Other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: GYEONG-JA
meaning: From Sino-Korean 慶(gyeong) meaning "congratulate, celebrate" or 敬(gyeong) meaning "respect, honour" combined with 子(ja) meaning "child". This name can be formed of other hanja character combinations as well. Korean feminine names ending with the character 子 (a fashionable name suffix in Japan, read as -ko in Japanese) became less popular after Japanese rule of Korea ended in 1945.

name: GYEONG-SUK
meaning: From Sino-Korean 京(gyeong) meaning "capital city" and 淑(suk) meaning "good, pure, virtuous, charming". Other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: GYNETH
meaning: Perhaps a variant of GWYNETH. Sir Walter Scott used this name for the daughter of King Arthur in his work 'The Bridal of Triermain' (1813).

name: GYPSY
meaning: Simply from the English word Gypsy for the nomadic people who originated in northern India. The word was originally a corruption of Egyptian. It is sometimes considered pejorative.

name: GYTHA
meaning: From Gyða, an Old Norse diminutive of GUÐRÍÐR. It was borne by a Danish noblewoman who married the English lord Godwin of Wessex in the 11th century. The name was used in England for a short time after that, and was revived in the 19th century.

name: GYULA
meaning: From a Hungarian royal title, which was probably of Turkic origin. This name is also used as a Hungarian form of JULIUS.

name: GYÐA
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of GYTHA.

name: GYÖNGYI
meaning: From Hungarian gyöngy meaning "pearl", of Turkic origin.

name: GÉZA
meaning: From Gyeücsa, possibly derived from a diminutive form of the Hungarian noble title gyevü or gyeü, itself from Turkic jabgu. This was the name of a 10th-century leader of the Hungarians, the father of the first king István.

name: GÖKER
meaning: From Turkish gök meaning "sky" and er meaning "brave man".

name: GÖKHAN
meaning: From Turkish gök meaning "sky" and han, which is from the title khan meaning "leader".

name: GÖKSU
meaning: From Turkish gök meaning "sky" and su meaning "water".

name: GÜL
meaning: Means "rose" in Turkish, ultimately from Persian.

name: GÜLNUR
meaning: Means "rose light" in Turkish, ultimately from Persian گل(gol) meaning "flower, rose" and Arabic نور(nur) meaning "light".

name: GÜLİSTAN
meaning: Means "rose garden" in Turkish, ultimately from Persian.

name: GÜNAY
meaning: Derived from the Turkic elements gün "sun" and ay "moon".

name: GÜNEL
meaning: Derived from the Turkic elements gün "sun" and el "country, society".

name: GÜNTHER
meaning: From the Germanic name Gundahar, derived from the elements gund "war" and hari "army, warrior". This was the name of a semi-legendary 5th-century Burgundian king. He appears in the Germanic saga the 'Nibelungenlied', which has him wooing the Icelandic queen Brünhild. He wins her hand in marriage with the help of the hero Siegfried. He ultimately betrays Siegfried, but Siegfried's widow Kriemhild (Günther's sister) takes her revenge upon him.

name: HA-JUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 夏(ha) meaning "summer, great, grand" combined with 准(jun) meaning "approve, permit". This name can be formed by other hanja characters as well.

name: HA-YUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 昰(ha) meaning "summer, name" combined with 昀(yun) meaning "sunlight". Other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: HABACUC
meaning: Latin form of HABAKKUK used in some versions of the Vulgate.

name: HABAKKUK
meaning: From the Hebrew name חֲבַקּוּק(Chavaqquq) meaning "embrace", from the root חָבַק(chavaq). In the Old Testament this is one of the twelve minor prophets, the author of the Book of Habakkuk.

name: HABIBULLAH
meaning: Means "friend of ALLAH", from Arabic حبيب(habib) meaning "friend" combined with الله(Allah).

name: HACHIROU
meaning: From Japanese 八(hachi) meaning "eight" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". This was traditionally a name for the eighth son. Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: HADAD
meaning: Possibly derived from a Semitic root meaning "thunder". Hadad was the Semitic god of thunder and storms, often called Ba'al.

name: HADASSAH
meaning: From Hebrew הֲדַס(hadas) meaning "myrtle tree". In the Old Testament this is the Hebrew name of Queen Esther.

name: HADES
meaning: From Greek ‘Αιδης(Haides), derived from αιδης(aides) meaning "unseen". In Greek mythology Hades was the dark god of the underworld, which was also called Hades. His brother was Zeus and his wife was Persephone.

name: HADLEY
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a place name meaning "heather field" in Old English.

name: HADRIAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Hadrianus, which meant "from Hadria" in Latin. Hadria was the name of two Roman settlements. The first (modern Adria) is in northern Italy and was an important Etruscan port town. The second (modern Atri) is in central Italy and was named after the northern town. The Adriatic Sea is also named after the northern town....[more]

name: HADUBERT
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements hadu "battle" and beraht "bright".

name: HADUFUNS
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hadu "battle, combat" and funs "ready".

name: HAFIZ
meaning: Means "custodian, guardian" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الحفيظ(al-Hafiz) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: HAFSA
meaning: Means "gathering" in Arabic. This was the name of the daughter of Umar, the second caliph, and a wife of Muhammad.

name: HAGAR
meaning: Possibly means "flight" in Hebrew, though it could also be of unknown Egyptian origin. In the Old Testament she is the concubine of Abraham and the mother of Ishmael, the founder of the Arab people. After Abraham's wife Sarah finally gave birth to a child, she had Hagar and Ishmael expelled into the desert. However, God heard their crying and saved them.

name: HAGEN  (1)
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element hagan meaning "enclosure". In the Germanic saga the 'Nibelungenlied' he is the half-brother of Günther. He killed the hero Siegfried by luring him onto a hunting expedition and then stabbing him with a javelin in his one vulnerable spot.

name: HAGGAI
meaning: Means "festive" in Hebrew, from the root חָגַג(chagag). This is one of the twelve minor prophets of the Old Testament. He was the author of the Book of Haggai, which urges the exiles returning from Babylonia to rebuild the temple in Jerusalem.

name: HAGGITH
meaning: Means "festive" in Hebrew, derived from the root חָגַג(chagag). In the Old Testament this is the name of one of King David's wives.

name: HAI
meaning: From Chinese 海(hǎi) meaning "sea, ocean" or other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: HAIDAR
meaning: Means "lion" in Arabic. This was another name of Ali, the husband of Fatimah the daughter of the Prophet Muhammad.

name: HAIDEE
meaning: Perhaps intended to derive from Greek αιδοιος(aidoios) "modest, reverent". This name was created by Byron for a character in his poem 'Don Juan' (1819).

name: HAIMO
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Germanic element heim meaning "home".

name: HAJNA
meaning: Shortened form of HAJNAL. The Hungarian poet Mihály Vörösmarty used it in his epic poem 'Zalán Futása' (1825).

name: HAKEEM
meaning: Variant transcription of HAKIM. A famous bearer is Nigerian-born former basketball player Hakeem Olajuwon (1963-).

name: HALA
meaning: Means "halo around the moon" in Arabic. This was the name of a sister-in-law of the Prophet Muhammad.

name: HALCYON
meaning: From the name of a genus of kingfisher birds, derived from Greek αλκυων (from the same source as Alcyone).

name: HALCYONE
meaning: Latinized form of Greek ‘Αλκυονη(Halkyone), a variant of Αλκυονη (see ALCYONE).

name: HALDOR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Hallþórr, which meant "Thor's rock" from hallr "rock" combined with the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR).

name: HALE  (2)
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "nook, retreat" from Old English healh.

name: HALFDAN
meaning: From the Old Norse name Hálfdan, composed of the elements hálfr "half" and Danr "Dane", originally a nickname for a person who was half Danish.

name: HALIM
meaning: Means "patient, tolerant, mild" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الحليم(al-Halim) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: HALIMA
meaning: Feminine form of HALIM. Halima was the name of the foster mother of the Prophet Muhammad.

name: HALL
meaning: From a surname which was derived from Old English heall "manor, hall", originally belonging to a person who lived or worked in a manor.

name: HALLAM
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning either "at the rocks" or "at the nook" in Old English.

name: HALLBJÖRN
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements hallr "rock" and björn "bear".

name: HALLE  (1)
meaning: From the Old Norse name Halli, a diminutive of names containing the element hallr meaning "rock".

name: HALLE  (2)
meaning: In the case of American actress Halle Berry (1966-), it is from the name of a department store in Cleveland where she was born (the store was founded by brothers bearing the German surname Halle, a cognate of HALL).

name: HALLR
meaning: Derived from Old Norse hallr meaning "rock".

name: HALSTEIN
meaning: From the Old Norse name Hallsteinn, derived from the elements hallr "rock" and steinn "stone".

name: HALSTEN
meaning: Old Swedish form of Hallsteinn (see HALSTEIN).

name: HALVARD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Hallvarðr, which meant "rock guardian" from hallr "rock" combined with varðr "guardian".

name: HAM
meaning: Means "hot, warm" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament, Ham is one of Noah's three sons, along with Shem and Japheth. He was the ancestor of the Egyptians and Canaanites.

name: HAMA
meaning: From Old English ham meaning "home". This is the name of a Gothic warrior, who appears with his companion of Wudga in some Anglo-Saxon tales (briefly in 'Beowulf').

name: HAMAN
meaning: Meaning uncertain, of Persian origin. In the Book of Esther in the Old Testament Haman, called the Agagite, is an adviser to the Persian king. He plots to have all the Jews in the realm executed, but is foiled by Queen Esther.

name: HAMID  (1)
meaning: Means "praiseworthy, praised" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الحميد(al-Hamid) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: HAMILCAR
meaning: Means "brother of Melqart" from Phoenician ha "brother" combined with the name of the god MELQART. Hamilcar was a 3rd-century BC Carthaginian general, the father of Hannibal.

name: HAMILTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from Old English hamel "crooked, mutilated" and dun "hill". The surname was originally taken from the name of a town in Leicestershire, England (which no longer exists). A famous bearer of the surname was Alexander Hamilton (1755-1804), a founding father of the United States who was killed in a duel with Aaron Burr.

name: HAMISH
meaning: Anglicized form of a Sheumais, the vocative case of SEUMAS.

name: HAMLET
meaning: Anglicized form of the Danish name Amleth. Shakespeare used this name for the Prince of Denmark in his play 'Hamlet' (1600), which he based upon earlier Danish tales.

name: HAMMOND
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from either the Germanic given name Haimund which meant "home protection" or else from the Old Norse given name Hámundr which meant "high protection".

name: HAMMURABI
meaning: From the Akkadian name Hammu-rapi, possibly derived from Amorite meaning "uncle is a healer". This was the name of an 18th-century BC king of Babylon who conquered Sumer and Akkad. He is also known for devising a written code of laws.

name: HAMNET
meaning: Diminutive of HAMO. This was the name of a son of Shakespeare who died in childhood. His death may have provided the inspiration for his father's play 'Hamlet'.

name: HAMO
meaning: Norman form of HAIMO. The Normans brought this name to Britain.

name: HAMZA
meaning: Possibly derived from Arabic hamuza meaning "strong, steadfast". This was the name of the uncle of the Prophet Muhammad who was killed in battle.

name: HANA  (2)
meaning: Czech, Slovak and Croatian form of HANNAH.

name: HANA  (3)
meaning: From Japanese 花(hana) or 華(hana) which both mean "flower". Other kanji or kanji combinations can form this name as well.

name: HANAE
meaning: From Japanese 花(hana) or 華(hana), which both mean "flower", combined with 絵(e) meaning "picture" or 恵(e) meaning "favour, benefit". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: HANAKO
meaning: From Japanese 花(hana) meaning "flower" and 子(ko) meaning "child", as well as other kanji combinations.

name: HANAN  (1)
meaning: Means "gracious" in Hebrew. This is the name of several minor characters in the Old Testament.

name: HANANIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH is gracious" in Hebrew. This name appears frequently in the Old Testament. It is the Hebrew name of Shadrach.

name: HANK
meaning: Originally a short form of Hankin which was a medieval diminutive of JOHN. Since the 17th century in the United States this name has also been used as a diminutive of HENRY, probably under the influence of the Dutch diminutive HENK. A famous bearer is the American former baseball player Hank Aaron (1934-).

name: HANN
meaning: Medieval English form of Iohannes (see JOHN).

name: HANNAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name חַנָּה(Channah) meaning "favour, grace", derived from the root חָנַן(chanan). In the Old Testament this is the name of the wife of Elkanah. Her rival was Elkanah's other wife Peninnah, who had children while Hannah remained barren. After a blessing from Eli she finally became pregnant with Samuel....[more]

name: HANNE  (1)
meaning: Danish and Norwegian short form of JOHANNE, or a German and Dutch short form of JOHANNA. This can also be a Dutch short form of JOHANNES (masculine).

name: HANNELE
meaning: Finnish diminutive of JOHANNA or HANNAH.

name: HANNIBAL
meaning: Means "grace of Ba'al" from Phoenician hann "grace" combined with the name of the god BA'AL. Hannibal was the Carthaginian general who threatened Rome during the Second Punic War in the 3rd century BC.

name: HANS
meaning: German, Dutch and Scandinavian short form of JOHANNES. Two famous bearers were Hans Holbein (1497-1543), a Renaissance portrait painter from Germany, and Hans Christian Andersen (1805-1875), a Danish writer of fairy tales.

name: HARALD
meaning: Scandinavian and German cognate of HAROLD. This was the name of several kings of Norway and Denmark.

name: HARAN
meaning: Possibly means "hill, mountain" in Hebrew. This is the name of the brother of Abraham and father of Lot in the Old Testament.

name: HARDEEP
meaning: From the name of the Hindu god HARI and Sanskrit दीप(dipa) meaning "lamp, light".

name: HARDING
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Old English given name HEARD. A famous bearer of the surname was American president Warren G. Harding (1865-1923).

name: HARDY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from Middle English hardi "brave, hardy".

name: HAREL
meaning: Means "altar, mountain of God" in Hebrew. In the Hebrew Old Testament this word is applied to the altar in the temple in Jerusalem (Ezekiel 43:15).

name: HARENDRA
meaning: Combination of the names of the Hindu gods HARI (referring to Vishnu) and INDRA.

name: HARI
meaning: Means "brown, yellow, tawny" in Sanskrit, and by extension "monkey, horse, lion". This is another name of the Hindu god Vishnu, and sometimes of Krishna. It is also borne by the son of the Garuda, the bird-like mount of Vishnu.

name: HARINDER
meaning: Variant of HARENDRA used by Sikhs.

name: HARIS  (1)
meaning: Bosnian and Urdu form of HARITH, as well as a variant transcription of the Arabic name.

name: HARIS  (2)
meaning: Modern Greek form of CHARES or CHARIS.

name: HARISHA
meaning: Means "lord of monkeys" from Sanskrit हरि(hari) meaning "monkey" and ईश(isha) meaning "lord". This is another name of the Hindu god Vishnu.

name: HARLAN
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name meaning "hare land" in Old English. In America it has sometimes been given in honour of Supreme Court justice John Marshall Harlan (1833-1911).

name: HARLAND
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of HARLAN.

name: HARLEY
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name, itself derived from Old English hara "hare" and leah "woodland, clearing".

name: HARLOW
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name which was derived from Old English hær "rock" or here "army", combined with hlaw "hill".

name: HARMON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name HERMAN.

name: HARMONIA
meaning: Means "harmony, agreement" in Greek. She was the daughter of Ares and Aphrodite, given by Zeus to Cadmus to be his wife.

name: HARMONY
meaning: From the English word harmony, ultimately deriving from Greek ‘αρμονια(harmonia).

name: HAROLD
meaning: From the Old English name Hereweald, derived from the elements here "army" and weald "power, leader, ruler". The Old Norse cognate Haraldr was also common among Scandinavian settlers in England. This was the name of five kings of Norway and three kings of Denmark. It was also borne by two kings of England, both of whom were from mixed Scandinavian and Anglo-Saxon backgrounds, including Harold II who lost the Battle of Hastings (and was killed in it), which led to the Norman conquest. After the conquest the name died out, but it was eventually revived in the 19th century.

name: HAROLDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of HAROLD.

name: HARPER
meaning: From an Old English surname which originally belonged to a person who played the harp or who made harps. A notable bearer was the American author Harper Lee (1926-2016), who wrote 'To Kill a Mockingbird'.

name: HARRI
meaning: Finnish and Welsh form of HARRY.

name: HARRIET
meaning: English form of HENRIETTE, and thus a feminine form of HARRY. It was first used in the 17th century, becoming very common in the English-speaking world by the 18th century. A famous bearer was Harriet Beecher Stowe (1811-1896), the American author who wrote 'Uncle Tom's Cabin'.

name: HARRIS
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name HARRY.

name: HARRISON
meaning: From an English surname which meant "son of HARRY". This was the surname of two American presidents, William Henry Harrison (1773-1841) and his grandson Benjamin Harrison (1833-1901). The actor Harrison Ford (1942-), who starred in such movies as 'Star Wars' and 'Indiana Jones', is a famous bearer.

name: HARRY
meaning: Medieval English form of HENRY. In modern times it is used as a diminutive of both Henry and HAROLD. A famous bearer was American president Harry S. Truman (1884-1972). It is also the name of the boy wizard in J. K. Rowling's 'Harry Potter' series of books, first released in 1997.

name: HARSHA
meaning: Means "happiness" in Sanskrit. This was the name of a 7th-century emperor of northern India. He was also noted as an author.

name: HARTA
meaning: Means "wealth, treasure, property" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit अर्थ(artha).

name: HARTLEY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "hart clearing" in Old English.

name: HARTMANN
meaning: Means "brave man", derived from the Germanic element hard "brave, hardy" combined with man.

name: HARTMUT
meaning: Means "brave mind", derived from the Germanic elements hard "brave, hardy" and muot "mind, spirit".

name: HARTWIG
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hard "brave, hardy" and wig "battle".

name: HARTWIN
meaning: Means "brave friend" from the Germanic elements hard "brave, hardy" and win "friend".

name: HARU
meaning: From Japanese 陽(haru) meaning "light, sun, male", 春(haru) meaning "spring" or 晴(haru) meaning "clear weather". Other kanji or kanji combinations can form this name as well.

name: HARUKA
meaning: From Japanese 遥(haruka) meaning "distant, remote". It can also come from 春(haru) meaning "spring" or 晴(haru) meaning "clear weather" combined with 花(ka) meaning "flower, blossom" or 香(ka) meaning "fragrance". Additionally, other kanji combinations can form this name.

name: HARUKI
meaning: From Japanese 晴(haru) meaning "clear weather" or 陽(haru) meaning "light, sun, male" combined with 輝(ki) meaning "brightness" or 生(ki) meaning "living". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: HARUKO
meaning: From Japanese 春(haru) meaning "spring" or 陽(haru) meaning "light, sun, male" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child", as well as other kanji combinations.

name: HARUN
meaning: Arabic form of AARON. Harun al-Rashid was a 9th-century Abbasid caliph featured in the stories of 'The 1001 Nights'.

name: HARUNA
meaning: From Japanese 晴(haru) meaning "clear weather", 遥(haru) meaning "distant, remote" or 春(haru) meaning "spring" combined with 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: HARUTO
meaning: From Japanese 陽(haru) meaning "light, sun, male", 遥(haru) meaning "distant, remote" or 晴(haru) meaning "clear weather" combined with 斗(to), which refers to a Chinese constellation, or 翔(to) meaning "soar, fly". Other kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: HARVEY
meaning: From the Breton given name Haerviu, which meant "battle worthy", from haer "battle" and viu "worthy". This was the name of a 6th-century Breton hermit who is the patron saint of the blind. Settlers from Brittany introduced it to England after the Norman conquest. During the later Middle Ages it became rare, but it was revived in the 19th century.

name: HASAN
meaning: Means "handsome", derived from Arabic حسن(hasuna) meaning "to be beautiful, to be good". Hasan was the son of Ali and the grandson of the Prophet Muhammad. He was poisoned by one of his wives and is regarded as a martyr by Shia Muslims. This was also the name of two kings of Morocco. It is sometimes transcribed as Hassan, though this is a distinct name in Arabic.

name: HASDRUBAL
meaning: Means "Ba'al helps" from Phoenician azru "help" combined with the name of the god BA'AL. Hasdrubal was a Carthaginian general, the brother of Hannibal.

name: HASHIM
meaning: Means "crusher, breaker" in Arabic. This was the nickname of a great-grandfather of the Prophet Muhammad. He acquired this nickname because of his practice of crumbling bread and giving it to pilgrims.

name: HASIM
meaning: Means "decisive" in Arabic, derived from حسم(hasama) meaning "to sever, to finish, to decide".

name: HASSAN
meaning: Means "beautifier, improver" in Arabic. Hassan ibn Thabit was a 7th-century poet who was a companion of the Prophet Muhammad. This name is sometimes transcribed as Hasan, though the two names are spelled distinctly in Arabic.

name: HATHOR
meaning: Greek form of Egyptian Het-Heru which means "the house of Horus", derived from Egyptian hwt "house" combined with Hr the god HORUS. In Egyptian mythology she was the goddess of love, often depicted with the head of a cow.

name: HATSHEPSUT
meaning: Means "foremost of noble women" in Egyptian. This was the name of a pharaoh of the 18th dynasty. She may have been the first woman to take the title of Pharaoh.

name: HAUKEA
meaning: Means "white snow" from Hawaiian hau "snow" and kea "white".

name: HAUL
meaning: Means "sun" in Welsh. This is a modern Welsh name.

name: HAUNANI
meaning: Means "beautiful snow" from Hawaiian hau "snow" and nani "beauty, glory".

name: HAURVATAT
meaning: Means "health, perfection, wholeness" in Avestan. This was the name of a Zoroastrian goddess (one of the Amesha Spenta) of health and water.

name: HAVEL
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of GALLUS.

name: HAVEN
meaning: From the English word for a safe place, derived ultimately from Old English hæfen.

name: HAVILAH
meaning: Probably means "to dance, to circle, to twist" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is both a place name and a masculine personal name.

name: HAYATE
meaning: From Japanese 颯(hayate) meaning "sudden, sound of the wind". Other kanji with the same pronunciation can also form this name.

name: HAYATO
meaning: From Japanese 隼(haya) meaning "falcon" and 人(to) meaning "person". Other kanji combinations can also make up this name.

name: HAYDEN
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from place names meaning either "hay valley" or "hay hill", derived from Old English heg "hay" and denu "valley" or dun "hill".

name: HAYDN
meaning: From a German surname meaning "heathen". It is used in honour of the Austrian composer Franz Joseph Haydn (1732-1809).

name: HAYDÉE
meaning: Spanish and French form of HAIDEE, from Byron's 'Don Juan' (1819). It was later used by Alexander Dumas for a character in 'The Count of Monte Cristo' (1844).

name: HAYK
meaning: Probably from the Armenian word հայ(hay) meaning "Armenian", although some hold that the ethnic name is in fact derived from the given name. This was the name of the legendary forefather of the Armenian people, supposedly a great-great-grandson of Noah.

name: HAYLEY
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from the name of an English town (meaning "hay clearing" from Old English heg "hay" and leah "clearing"). It was popularized by the British child actress Hayley Mills (1946-), though the name did not become common until over a decade after she first became famous.

name: HAYWOOD
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "fenced wood" in Old English.

name: HAZAEL
meaning: Means "God sees" in Hebrew. This is the name of a king of Aram in the Old Testament.

name: HAZEL
meaning: From the English word hazel for the tree or the light brown colour, derived ultimately from Old English hæsel. It was coined as a given name in the 19th century.

name: HE
meaning: From Chinese 河(hé) meaning "river, stream", 和(hé) meaning "harmony, peace", or 荷(hé) meaning "lotus, water lily" (which is usually only feminine). Other characters can form this name as well. A famous bearer was the 15th-century explorer Zheng He.

name: HEARD
meaning: Short form of various Old English names containing the element heard meaning "brave, hardy".

name: HEATH
meaning: From an English surname which denoted one who lived on a heath. It was popularized as a given name by the character Heath Barkley from the 1960s television series 'The Big Valley'.

name: HEATHER
meaning: From the English word heather for the variety of small shrubs with pink or white flowers which commonly grow in rocky areas. It is derived from Middle English hather. It was first used as a given name in the late 19th century, though it did not become popular until the last half of the 20th century.

name: HEAVEN
meaning: From the English vocabulary word meaning "paradise".

name: HEBE
meaning: Derived from Greek ‘ηβη(hebe) meaning "youth". In Greek mythology Hebe was the daughter of Zeus and Hera. She was a goddess of youth who acted as the cupbearer to the gods.

name: HEBER  (2)
meaning: Means "enclave" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this name is borne by a great-grandson of Jacob and also by the husband of Jael.

name: HECATE
meaning: From the Greek ‘Εκατη(Hekate), possibly derived from ‘εκας(hekas) meaning "far off". In Greek mythology Hecate was a goddess associated with witchcraft, crossroads, tombs, demons and the underworld.

name: HECTOR
meaning: Latinized form of Greek ‘Εκτωρ(Hektor), which was derived from ‘εκτωρ(hektor) "holding fast", ultimately from εχω(echo) meaning "to hold, to possess". In Greek legend Hector was one of the Trojan champions who fought against the Greeks. After he killed Achilles' friend Patroclus in battle, he was himself brutally slain by Achilles, who proceeded to tie his dead body to a chariot and drag it about. This name also appears in Arthurian legends belonging to King Arthur's foster father....[more]

name: HECUBA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek ‘Εκαβη(Hekabe), which is of uncertain meaning. In Greek mythology this is the name of the wife of Priam of Troy.

name: HEDDA
meaning: Diminutive of HEDVIG. This is the name of the heroine of the play 'Hedda Gabler' (1890) by the Norwegian dramatist Henrik Ibsen.

name: HEDDWYN
meaning: Derived from the Welsh elements hedd "peace" and gwyn "white, fair, blessed".

name: HEDLEY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "heather clearing" in Old English.

name: HEDVIG
meaning: Scandinavian and Hungarian form of HEDWIG.

name: HEDVIKA
meaning: Czech and Slovene form of HEDWIG.

name: HEDWIG
meaning: From the Germanic name Hadewig, derived from the Germanic elements hadu "battle, combat" and wig "war". This was the name of a 13th-century German saint, the wife of the Polish duke Henry the Bearded. It was subsequently borne by a 14th-century Polish queen (usually known by her Polish name Jadwiga) who is now also regarded as a saint.

name: HEDY
meaning: Diminutive of HEDWIG and other Germanic names beginning with the element hadu meaning "battle, combat".

name: HEIDI
meaning: German diminutive of ADELHEID. This is the name of the title character in the children's novel 'Heidi' (1880) by Johanna Spyri. The name began to be used in the English-speaking world shortly after the 1937 release of the movie adaptation, which starred Shirley Temple.

name: HEIDRICH
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements heid "kind, sort, type" and ric "power, ruler".

name: HEIDRUN
meaning: Derived from Old Norse heiðr meaning "bright, clear" and rún meaning "secret". In Norse mythology this was the name of a goat that would eat the leaves from the tree of life and produce mead in her udder.

name: HEIKE
meaning: Low German diminutive of HENRIKE or HEINRICH.

name: HEILWIG
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements heil "happy, hearty, healthy" and wig "war".

name: HEIMIR
meaning: Norse cognate of HAMA. In the 'Volsungasaga' he is a king of Hlymdalir.

name: HEINRICH
meaning: German form of HENRY. This was the name of several German kings.

name: HEIRANI
meaning: From Tahitian hei "crown, garland" and rani "heaven, sky".

name: HEITIARE
meaning: From Tahitian hei "crown, garland" and tiare "flower".

name: HEIÐRÚN
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of HEIDRUN.

name: HEL
meaning: In Norse mythology this was the name of the daughter of Loki. She got her name from the underworld, also called Hel, where she ruled, which meant "to conceal, to cover" in Old Norse (related to the English word hell).

name: HELAH
