meaning: Means "rust" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this name is mentioned as one of the wives of Asher.

name: HELEDD
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of a semi-legendary 7th-century Welsh princess.

name: HELEN
meaning: English form of the Greek ‘Ελενη(Helene), probably from Greek ‘ελενη(helene) "torch" or "corposant", or possibly related to σεληνη(selene) "moon". In Greek mythology Helen was the daughter of Zeus and Leda, whose kidnapping by Paris was the cause of the Trojan War. The name was also borne by the 4th-century Saint Helena, mother of the Roman emperor Constantine, who supposedly found the True Cross during a trip to Jerusalem....[more]

name: HELENE
meaning: Ancient Greek form of HELEN, as well as the modern Scandinavian and German form.

name: HELGE
meaning: From the Old Norse name Helgi, derived from heilagr meaning "holy, blessed".

name: HELI  (1)
meaning: Latin form of ELI(1) used in the Old and New Testament. This form of the name is used in most English versions of the New Testament to refer to the father of Joseph (husband of Mary) in the genealogy in the Gospel of Luke.

name: HELIAS
meaning: Latin form of ELIJAH used in some versions of the Vulgate.

name: HELIODORO
meaning: From the Greek name ‘Ηλιοδωρος(Heliodoros), derived from the elements ‘ηλιος(helios) "sun" and δωρον(doron) "gift". Saint Heliodoro was a 4th-century bishop of Altino.

name: HELIOS
meaning: Means "sun" in Greek. This was the name of the young Greek sun god, who rode across the sky each day in a chariot pulled by four horses.

name: HELLADIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Late Greek name ‘Ελλαδιος(Helladios), which was derived from ‘Ελλαδος(Hellados) meaning "of Greece". Saint Helladius was a 7th-century archbishop of Toledo.

name: HELLE  (2)
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Greek mythology Helle was the daughter of Athamus and Nephele. She and her brother Phrixus escaped sacrifice by fleeing on the back of a golden ram, but during their flight she fell off and drowned in the strait that connects the Aegean Sea with the Sea of Marmara, which was thereafter called the Hellespont ("the sea of Helle").

name: HELMFRIED
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements helm "helmet" and frid "peace".

name: HELMI
meaning: Diminutive of VILHELMIINA or VILHELMINA. It also means "pearl" in Finnish.

name: HELMOLD
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements helm "helmet" and wald "rule".

name: HELMUT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element helm "helmet" or heil "healthy" combined with muot "spirit, mind".

name: HEMERA
meaning: Means "day" in Greek. This was the name of the Greek goddess who personified the daytime. According to Hesiod she was the daughter of Nyx, the personification of the night.

name: HEMMING
meaning: Perhaps derived from Old Norse hamr "shape", and possibly originally a nickname for a person believed to be a shape changer.

name: HENDERSON
meaning: From a Scottish surname meaning "son of HENRY".

name: HENDRIK
meaning: Dutch and Estonian cognate of HENRY.

name: HENG
meaning: From Chinese 恒(héng) meaning "constant, persistent", as well as other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: HENGIST
meaning: Of Germanic origin, meaning "stallion". Hengist and his brother Horsa were the leaders of the first Germanic settlers in Britain. Hengist established a kingdom in Kent in the 5th century.

name: HENNIE
meaning: Dutch diminutive and feminine form of HENDRIK.

name: HENNY
meaning: Dutch diminutive and feminine form of HENDRIK.

name: HENRIETTA
meaning: Latinate form of HENRIETTE. It was introduced to England by Henriette Marie, the wife of the 17th-century English king Charles I. The name Henriette was also Anglicized as Harriet, a form which was initially more popular.

name: HENRIKE
meaning: German and Scandinavian feminine form of HENRY.

name: HENRIQUE
meaning: Portuguese form of HENRY. This was the name of a 15th-century Portuguese naval explorer (known as Henry the Navigator in English).

name: HENRY
meaning: From the Germanic name Heimirich which meant "home ruler", composed of the elements heim "home" and ric "power, ruler". It was later commonly spelled Heinrich, with the spelling altered due to the influence of other Germanic names like Haganrich, in which the first element is hagan "enclosure"....[more]

name: HEPHAESTUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek ‘Ηφαιστος(Hephaistos), meaning unknown. It probably shares its origin with the Minoan city of Φαιστος(Phaistos), which is of Pre-Greek origin. In Greek mythology Hephaestus was the god of fire and forging, the husband of the unfaithful Aphrodite. It was said that when he was born Hera, his mother, was so displeased with his physical deformities that she hurled him off the top of Mount Olympus.

name: HEPHZIBAH
meaning: Means "my delight is in her" in Hebrew. She is a queen and the mother of Manasseh in the Old Testament.

name: HERA
meaning: Uncertain meaning, possibly from either Greek ‘ηρως(heros) "hero, warrior"; ‘ωρα(hora) "period of time"; or ‘αιρεω(haireo) "to be chosen". In Greek mythology Hera was the queen of the gods, the sister and wife of Zeus. She presided over marriage and childbirth.

name: HERACLEITUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name ‘Ηρακλειτος(Herakleitos) which meant "glory of Hera", derived from the name of the goddess HERA combined with κλειτος(kleitos) "glory". This was the name of a 6th-century BC Greek philosopher from Ephesus.

name: HERACLES
meaning: Latinized form of HERAKLES. However, the spelling used by the Romans was Hercules.

name: HERACLIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek personal name ‘Ηρακλειος(Herakleios) which was derived from the name of the Greek hero HERAKLES. This was the name of a 7th-century Byzantine emperor, known for his victories over the Sassanid Persian Empire. This name was also borne by two early saints.

name: HERAIS
meaning: Ancient Greek personal name which was probably derived from the name of the Greek goddess HERA.

name: HERAKLEIDES
meaning: Means "son of Herakles" in Greek, derived from the name of the mythic hero HERAKLES combined with the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides).

name: HERAKLES
meaning: Means "glory of Hera" from the name of the goddess HERA combined with Greek κλεος(kleos) "glory". This was the name of a hero in Greek and Roman mythology, the son of Zeus and the mortal woman Alcmene. After being driven insane by Hera and killing his own children, Herakles completed twelve labours in order to atone for his crime and become immortal.

name: HERBERT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hari "army" and beraht "bright". The Normans introduced this name to England, where it replaced an Old English cognate Herebeorht. In the course of the Middle Ages it became rare, but it was revived in the 19th century.

name: HERBERTO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of HERBERT.

name: HEREMOANA
meaning: From Tahitian here "loved, dear" and moana "ocean".

name: HERENUI
meaning: From Tahitian here "loved, dear" and nui "big".

name: HEREWARD
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements here "army" and weard "guard". This was the name of an 11th-century Anglo-Saxon leader who rebelled against Norman rule.

name: HERIBERTO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of HERBERT.

name: HERLEIFR
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements herr "army" and leifr "son, descendant".

name: HERLEVA
meaning: Germanic name, possibly a derivative of hari "army", era "honour", or erla "noble" (or their Old Norse cognates). This was the name of the mother of William the Conqueror, who, according to tradition, was a commoner.

name: HERMAGORAS
meaning: From the name of the messenger god HERMES combined with Greek αγορα(agora) meaning "assembly, marketplace". Saint Hermagoras (3rd century) was the first bishop of Aquileia in Italy.

name: HERMAN
meaning: Means "army man", derived from the Germanic elements hari "army" and man "man". It was introduced to England by the Normans, died out, and was revived in the English-speaking world in the 19th century. It was borne by a 18th-century Russian missionary to Alaska who is venerated as a saint in the Orthodox Church. Another famous bearer was Herman Melville (1819-1891), the author of 'Moby-Dick'.

name: HERMENEGILDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of a Visigothic name which meant "complete sacrifice" from the Germanic elements ermen "whole, entire" and gild "sacrifice, value". It was borne by a 6th-century saint, the son of Liuvigild the Visigothic king of Hispania.

name: HERMES
meaning: Probably from Greek ‘ερμα(herma) meaning "cairn, pile of stones, boundary marker". Hermes was a Greek god associated with speed and good luck, who served as a messenger to Zeus and the other gods. He was also the patron of travellers, writers, athletes, merchants, thieves and orators....[more]

name: HERMIA
meaning: Feminine form of HERMES. Shakespeare used this name in his comedy 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' (1595).

name: HERMINIUS
meaning: Roman name which was possibly of unknown Etruscan origin, but could also be derived from the name of the god HERMES. In Roman legend this was the name of a companion of Aeneas.

name: HERMIONE
meaning: Derived from the name of the Greek messenger god HERMES. In Greek myth Hermione was the daughter of Menelaus and Helen. This is also the name of the wife of Leontes in Shakespeare's play 'The Winter's Tale' (1610). It is now closely associated with the character Hermione Granger from the Harry Potter series of books, first released in 1997.

name: HERMOGENES
meaning: Means "born of Hermes" from the name of the messenger god HERMES combined with Greek γενης(genes) "born".

name: HERMOKRATES
meaning: Means "power of Hermes" from the name of the messenger god HERMES combined with Greek κρατος(kratos) "power".

name: HERMOLAOS
meaning: Means "the people of Hermes" from the name of the messenger god HERMES combined with Greek λαος(laos) "people".

name: HERNANDO
meaning: Medieval Spanish form of FERDINAND. A famous bearer of this name was Hernando Cortés (1485-1547), a Spanish conquistador.

name: HERO  (1)
meaning: Derived from Greek ‘ηρως(heros) meaning "hero". In Greek legend she was the lover of Leander, who would swim across the Hellespont each night to meet her. He was killed on one such occasion when he got caught in a storm while in the water, and when Hero saw his dead body she drowned herself. This is also the name of a character in Shakespeare's play 'Much Ado About Nothing' (1599).

name: HEROD
meaning: From the Greek name ‘Ηρωιδης(Heroides), which probably means "song of the hero" from ‘ηρως(heros) "hero, warrior" combined with ωιδη(oide) "song, ode". This was the name of several rulers of Judea during the period when it was part of the Roman Empire. This includes two who appear in the New Testament: Herod the Great, the king who ordered the slaughter of the children, and his son Herod Antipas, who had John the Baptist beheaded.

name: HERODES
meaning: Latin form of HEROD, as well as the usual biblical Greek transcription of ‘Ηρωιδης: after the Classical period, the ι in the sequence ωι (often written as a subscript) was not pronounced.

name: HERODIAS
meaning: Feminine form of HEROD. This was the name of a member of the Herodian ruling family of Judea, a sister of Herod Agrippa and the wife of Herod Antipas. She appears in the New Testament, where she contrives to have her husband Antipas imprison and execute John the Baptist.

name: HERODION
meaning: Diminutive of the Greek name Heroides (see HEROD). This name is mentioned briefly in Paul's epistle to the Romans in the New Testament.

name: HERODOTUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name ‘Ηροδοτος(Herodotos), derived from the name of the goddess HERA combined with δοτος(dotos) meaning "given, granted". Herodotus was a Greek historian of the 5th century BC who wrote about Persian and the Persian Wars. He is known as the Father of History.

name: HERON
meaning: Derived from Greek ‘ηρως(heros) meaning "hero". This was the name of a 1st-century Greek inventor (also known as Hero) from Alexandria.

name: HERRY
meaning: Medieval English form of HENRY. Unlike Harry, this form is no longer used.

name: HERSHEL
meaning: Yiddish diminutive of HIRSH. As a non-Jewish American name (somewhat common around the end of the 19th century), it was likely inspired by the German surname HERSCHEL, borne for instance by the British-German astronomer William Herschel (1738-1822).

name: HERSILIA
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Roman legend this was the name of a Sabine woman who became the wife of Romulus.

name: HERTHA
meaning: Form of NERTHUS. The spelling change from N to H resulted from a misreading of Tacitus's text.

name: HESIOD
meaning: From the Greek name ‘Ησιοδος(Hesiodos), which probably means "to throw song" from ‘ιημι(hiemi) "to throw, to speak" and ωιδη(oide) "song, ode". This was the name of an 8th-century BC Greek poet.

name: HESPEROS
meaning: Means "evening" in Greek. This was the name of the personification of the Evening Star (the planet Venus) in Greek mythology.

name: HESTER
meaning: Latin form of ESTHER. Like Esther, it has been used in England since the Protestant Reformation. Nathaniel Hawthorne used it for the heroine of his novel 'The Scarlet Letter' (1850), Hester Prynne.

name: HESTIA
meaning: Derived from Greek ‘εστια(hestia) "hearth, fireside". In Greek mythology Hestia was the goddess of the hearth and domestic activity.

name: HEZEKIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name חִזְקִיָהוּ(Chizqiyahu), which means "YAHWEH strengthens", from the roots חָזַק(chazaq) meaning "to strength" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. This name was borne by a powerful king of Judah who reigned in the 8th and 7th centuries BC. Also in the Old Testament, this was the name of an ancestor of the prophet Zephaniah.

name: HIAWATHA
meaning: From the Iroquoian name Haio-went-ha meaning "he who combs". This was the name of a Mohawk or Onondaga leader who founded the Iroquois Confederacy, possibly in the 15th century. He was later the subject of a fictionalized 1855 poem by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow.

name: HIDDE
meaning: Frisian short form of names containing the Germanic element hild meaning "battle".

name: HIDEAKI
meaning: From Japanese 英(hide) meaning "excellent, fine" and 明(aki) meaning "bright", as well as other combinations of kanji.

name: HIDEKI
meaning: From Japanese 秀(hide) meaning "excellent, outstanding" or 英(hide) meaning "excellent, fine" combined with 樹(ki) meaning "tree". Other kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: HIDEYOSHI
meaning: From Japanese 秀(hide) meaning "excellent, outstanding" combined with 良(yoshi) meaning "good, virtuous, respectable" or 吉(yoshi) meaning "good luck". Other kanji combinations are possible. Toyotomi Hideyoshi (Hideyoshi 秀吉 being his given name) was a 16th-century daimyo who unified Japan and attempted to conquer Korea. He also banned the ownership of weapons by the peasantry, and banished Christian missionaries.

name: HIERONYMUS
meaning: Latin form of JEROME used in Germany and the Netherlands. Hieronymus Bosch was a 15th-century Dutch painter known for his depictions of the torments of hell.

name: HIKARI
meaning: From Japanese 光(hikari) meaning "light". Other kanji can also form this name. It is often written with the hiragana writing system.

name: HIKARU
meaning: From Japanese 光(hikaru) meaning "light" or 輝(hikaru) meaning "brightness". Other kanji can also form this name.

name: HILARION
meaning: Derived from Greek ‘ιλαρος(hilaros) meaning "cheerful". This was the name of a 4th-century saint, a disciple of Saint Anthony.

name: HILARIUS
meaning: Roman name which was derived from Latin hilaris meaning "cheerful". Alternatively, it could be derived from the Greek name ‘Ιλαρος(Hilaros) also meaning "cheerful" (the Greek word ‘ιλαρος was the source of the Latin word hilaris). Saint Hilarius was a 4th-century theologian and bishop of Poitiers. This was also the name of a 5th-century pope.

name: HILARY
meaning: Medieval English form of HILARIUS or HILARIA. During the Middle Ages it was primarily a masculine name. It was revived in Britain at the beginning of the 20th century as a predominantly feminine name. In America, this name and the variant Hillary seemed to drop in popularity after Hillary Clinton (1947-) became the first lady.

name: HILDA
meaning: Originally a short form of names containing the Germanic element hild "battle". The short form was used for both Old English and continental Germanic names. Saint Hilda of Whitby was a 7th-century English saint and abbess. The name became rare in England during the later Middle Ages, but was revived in the 19th century.

name: HILDE
meaning: German, Dutch and Norwegian variant of HILDA.

name: HILDEBERT
meaning: Means "bright battle" from the Germanic elements hild "battle" and beraht "bright".

name: HILDEBRAND
meaning: Means "battle sword", derived from the Germanic element hild "battle" combined with brand "sword". This was the name of the hero of an 8th-century poem written in Old High German.

name: HILDEGARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hild "battle" and gard "enclosure". Saint Hildegard was a 12th-century mystic from Bingen in Germany who was famous for her writings and poetry and also for her prophetic visions.

name: HILDR
meaning: Old Norse cognate of HILDA. In Norse legend this was the name of a valkyrie.

name: HILDRED
meaning: Possibly from the Old English masculine name Hildræd, which was composed of the elements hild "battle" and ræd "counsel". This name was revived in the late 19th century, probably because of its similarity to the popular names Hilda and Mildred.

name: HILLARY
meaning: Variant of HILARY. A famous bearer of the surname was Sir Edmund Hillary (1919-2008), the first man to climb Mount Everest.

name: HILLEL
meaning: Derived from Hebrew הלל(halal) meaning "praise". This name is mentioned briefly in the Old Testament as the father of the judge Abdon.

name: HILLEVI
meaning: Swedish and Finnish form of HEILWIG.

name: HILMAR
meaning: From the Germanic name Hildimar, derived from the Germanic elements hild "battle" and mari "famous".

name: HILTRUD
meaning: Means "strength in battle", derived from the Germanic elements hild "battle" and thrud "strength".

name: HINA
meaning: From Japanese 陽(hi) meaning "light, sun, male" or 日(hi) meaning "sun, day" combined with 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: HINATA
meaning: From Japanese 日向(hinata) meaning "sunny place", 陽向(hinata) meaning "toward the sun", or a non-standard reading of 向日葵(himawari) meaning "sunflower". Other kanji compounds are also possible. Because of the irregular readings, this name is often written using the hiragana writing system.

name: HIND
meaning: Possibly means "group of camels" in Arabic. Hind bint Abi Umayyah, also known as Umm Salama, was one of the wives of the Prophet Muhammad. This is also the Arabic name for the country of India.

name: HIPPOCRATES
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name ‘Ιπποκρατης(Hippokrates) which meant "horse power", derived from the elements ‘ιππος(hippos) "horse" and κρατος(kratos) "power". This was the name of a 5th-century BC Greek doctor who is known as the Father of Medicine.

name: HIPPOLYTA
meaning: Latinized form of HIPPOLYTE(1). Shakespeare used this name in his comedy 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' (1595).

name: HIPPOLYTE  (1)
meaning: Feminine form of HIPPOLYTOS. In Greek legend Hippolyte was the daughter of Ares, and the queen of the Amazons. She was killed by Herakles in order to obtain her magic girdle.

name: HIPPOLYTOS
meaning: Means "freer of horses" from Greek ‘ιππος(hippos) "horse" and λυω(luo) "to loosen". In Greek legend he was the son of Theseus who was tragically loved by his stepmother Phaedra. This was also the name of a 3rd-century theologian, saint and martyr.

name: HIPÓLITO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of HIPPOLYTOS.

name: HIRAH
meaning: Means "splendour" in Hebrew. This was the name of the father-in-law of Judah in the Old Testament.

name: HIRAKU
meaning: From Japanese 拓(hiraku) meaning "expand, open, support". Other kanji can also form this name.

name: HIRAM
meaning: Probably of Phoenician origin, though it could be from Hebrew meaning "exalted brother". This was the name of a king of Tyre in the Old Testament. As an English given name, Hiram came into use after the Protestant Reformation. In the 17th century the Puritans brought it to America, where it gained some currency.

name: HIROKI
meaning: From Japanese 大(hiro) meaning "big, great" and 輝(ki) meaning "brightness" or 樹(ki) meaning "tree". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: HIROKO
meaning: From Japanese 寛(hiro) meaning "tolerant, generous", 裕(hiro) meaning "abundant" or 浩(hiro) meaning "prosperous" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: HIROSHI
meaning: From Japanese 寛(hiroshi) meaning "tolerant, generous", 浩(hiroshi) meaning "prosperous", or other kanji and kanji combinations which are read the same way.

name: HIROTO
meaning: From Japanese 大(hiro) meaning "big, great" or 博(hiro) meaning "command, esteem" combined with 翔(to) meaning "soar, glide" or 斗(to), which refers to a Chinese constellation. Other kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: HIRSH
meaning: Means "deer" in Yiddish. The deer is particularly associated with the tribe of Naphtali (see Genesis 49:21).

name: HIRUNE
meaning: Means "trinity" in Basque, derived from hiru meaning "three".

name: HISHAM
meaning: Means "generous" in Arabic, ultimately from hashama "to crush". The meaning derives from the traditional Arab act of crushing bread into crumbs in order to share it. This was the name of an 8th-century caliph of the Umayyad dynasty in Spain.

name: HITOMI
meaning: From Japanese 瞳(hitomi) meaning "pupil of the eye". It can also come from 史(hito) meaning "history" and 美(mi) meaning "beautiful", as well as other kanji combinations. This name is often written with the hiragana writing system.

name: HIZKIAH
meaning: Alternate form of the Hebrew name Chizqiyahu (see HEZEKIAH).

name: HJALMAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Hjálmarr meaning "helmeted warrior" from the element hjalmr "helmet" combined with arr "warrior".

name: HJÖRDÍS
meaning: Means "sword goddess", derived from Old Norse hjörr "sword" and dís "goddess".

name: HJØRDIS
meaning: Modern Danish and Norwegian form of HJÖRDÍS.

name: HLENGIWE
meaning: Means "helped, rescued, redeemed" in Zulu, Xhosa, Ndebele and Swazi.

name: HLÍF
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of LIV(1).

name: HODIAH
meaning: Means "majesty of YAHWEH" in Hebrew. This is the name of a wife of Ezra in the Old Testament.

name: HOEBAER
meaning: Limburgish form of HUBERT. Its spelling has been influenced by the French pronunciation of Hubert.

name: HOKOLESQUA
meaning: Means "cornstalk" in Shawnee. This was the name of an 18th-century Shawnee chief.

name: HOKULANI
meaning: Means "heavenly star" from Hawaiian hōkū "star" and lani "heaven, sky, royal, majesty".

name: HOLDEN
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "deep valley" in Old English. This is the name of the main character in J. D. Salinger's novel 'The Catcher in the Rye' (1951), Holden Caufield.

name: HOLGER
meaning: From the Old Norse name Hólmgeirr, derived from the elements holmr "island" and geirr "spear". This was the name of one of Charlemagne's generals, a nobleman from Denmark.

name: HOLLIS
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Middle English holis "holly trees". It was originally given to a person who lived near a group of those trees.

name: HOLLY
meaning: From the English word for the holly tree, ultimately derived from Old English holen.

name: HOMER
meaning: From the Greek name ‘Ομηρος(Homeros), derived from ‘ομηρος(homeros) meaning "hostage, pledge". Homer was the Greek epic poet who wrote the 'Iliad', about the Trojan War, and the 'Odyssey', about Odysseus's journey home after the war. There is some debate about when he lived, or if he was even a real person, though most scholars place him in the 8th century BC. In the modern era, Homer has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world (chiefly in America) since the 18th century. This name is borne by the cartoon father on the television series 'The Simpsons'.

name: HONEY
meaning: Simply from the English word honey, ultimately from Old English hunig. This was originally a nickname for a sweet person.

name: HONG
meaning: From Chinese 虹(hóng) meaning "rainbow", 弘(hóng) meaning "enlarge, expand, great" (which is usually only masculine) or 鸿(hóng) meaning "wild swan, great, vast" (also usually only masculine). Other characters can also form this name.

name: HONOKA
meaning: From Japanese 和(hono) meaning "harmony" (using an obscure nanori reading) and 花(ka) meaning "flower", as well as other combinations of kanji which have the same pronunciation. Very often it is written using the hiragana writing system.

name: HONOR
meaning: Variant of HONOUR, using the American spelling.

name: HONORA
meaning: Variant of HONORIA. It was brought to England and Ireland by the Normans.

name: HONORATUS
meaning: Late Latin name which meant "esteemed, distinguished". This was the name of at least seven saints, including a 5th-century archbishop of Arles and a 6th-century bishop of Amiens who is the patron saint of bakers.

name: HONORINE
meaning: French form of Honorina, a feminine form of the Roman name Honorinus, a derivative of HONORIUS. Saint Honorina was a 4th-century martyr from the Normandy region in France.

name: HONORINUS
meaning: Late Latin name which was a derivative of HONORIUS.

name: HONORIUS
meaning: Late Latin name which meant "honour". This was the name of an emperor of the Western Roman Empire. It was also borne by a few early saints and four popes.

name: HONORÉ
meaning: French form of HONORATUS. It is also sometimes used as a French form of HONORIUS.

name: HONOUR
meaning: From the English word honour, which is of Latin origin. This was one of the virtue names adopted by the Puritans in the 17th century. It can also be viewed as a form of HONORIA or HONORATA, which are ultimately derived from the same source.

name: HOPE
meaning: From the English word hope, ultimately from Old English hopian. This name was first used by the Puritans in the 17th century.

name: HORACE
meaning: English and French form of HORATIUS, and the name by which the Roman poet Quintus Horatius Flaccus is commonly known those languages. In the modern era it has been used as a given name since the Renaissance, in honour of the poet.

name: HORATIO
meaning: Variant of HORATIUS. It was borne by the British admiral Horatio Nelson (1758-1805), famous for his defeat of Napoleon's forces in the Battle of Trafalgar, in which he was himself killed. Since his time the name has been occasionally used in his honour.

name: HORATIUS
meaning: Roman family name which was possibly derived from Latin hora "hour, time, season", though the name may actually be of Etruscan origin. A famous bearer was Quintus Horatius Flaccus, a Roman lyric poet of the 1st century BC who is better known as Horace in the English-speaking world.

name: HOREA
meaning: From Romanian horă, a type of circle dance. This was the nickname of Vasile Ursu Nicola (1731-1785), a leader of a peasant rebellion in Romania. He was eventually captured, tortured and executed.

name: HORSA
meaning: From the Germanic element hros or hors meaning "horse". Horsa and his brother Hengist were the leaders of the first Germanic settlers to arrive in Britain.

name: HORST
meaning: Means "wood, thicket" in German. Alternatively, it may derive from the Germanic element hros or hors meaning "horse".

name: HORTENSIA
meaning: Feminine form of the Roman family name Hortensius, possibly derived from Latin hortus "garden".

name: HORUS
meaning: Latinized form of ‘Ωρος(Horos), the Greek form of Egyptian Hrw (reconstructed as Heru) possibly meaning "falcon" or "high". In Egyptian mythology Horus was the god of light, often depicted as a man with the head of a falcon. The son Osiris and Isis, he avenged his father's murder by killing Seth.

name: HORYMÍR
meaning: Possibly from the Slavic elements gora meaning "mountain" and miru meaning "peace, world".

name: HOSANNA
meaning: From the Aramaic religious expression הושע נא(Hosha' na') meaning "deliver us" in Hebrew. In the New Testament this is exclaimed by those around Jesus when he first enters Jerusalem.

name: HOSEA
meaning: Variant transcription of Hoshe'a (see HOSHEA). Hosea is one of the twelve minor prophets of the Old Testament, the author of the Book of Hosea. Written in the northern kingdom, it draws parallels between his relationship with his unfaithful wife and the relationship between God and his people.

name: HOSHEA
meaning: From the Hebrew name הוֹשֵׁעַ(Hoshe'a) meaning "salvation", from the root יָשַׁע(yasha'). In the Old Testament at Numbers 13:16, Moses gives the spy Hoshea the new name Yehoshu'a (see JOSHUA), which has a related origin. This name was also borne by an 8th-century BC king of Israel, who was the last ruler of that state before it was conquered by Assyria.

name: HOSHI
meaning: From Japanese 星(hoshi) meaning "star" or other kanji with the same pronunciation.

name: HOSHIKO
meaning: From Japanese 星(hoshi) meaning "star" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: HOWARD
meaning: From an English surname which can derive from several different sources: the Anglo-Norman given name Huard, which was from the Germanic name HUGHARD; the Anglo-Scandinavian given name Haward, from the Old Norse name HÁVARÐR; or the Middle English term ewehirde meaning "ewe herder". This is the surname of a British noble family, members of which have held the title Duke of Norfolk from the 15th century to the present. A famous bearer of the given name was the American industrialist Howard Hughes (1905-1976).

name: HOYT
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Middle English hoit "stick", originally a nickname for a thin person.

name: HRISTINA
meaning: Bulgarian, Macedonian and Serbian form of CHRISTINA.

name: HRISTO
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian short form of CHRISTOPHER.

name: HRISTOFOR
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of CHRISTOPHER.

name: HRODOHAIDIS
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hrod "fame" and heid "kind, sort, type" (see ROSE).

name: HROÐGAR
meaning: Old English cognate of Hrodger (see ROGER). The name became unused after the Normans introduced Hrodger after their invasion. In the Old English poem 'Beowulf' this is the name of the Danish king.

name: HROÐULF
meaning: Old English cognate of Hrodulf (see RUDOLF). This name appears in 'Beowulf' belonging to the nephew of Hroðgar.

name: HRÓARR
meaning: Old Norse name, derived from the element hróðr "fame" combined with either geirr "spear" (making it a relation of HRÓÐGEIRR), arr "warrior" or varr "vigilant, cautious". This is the name of a legendary Danish king, the same one who is featured in the Anglo-Saxon poem 'Beowulf' with the name Hroðgar.

name: HRÓÐGEIRR
meaning: Old Norse cognate of Hrodger (see ROGER).

name: HRÓÐÓLFR
meaning: Old Norse cognate of Hrodulf (see RUDOLF).

name: HRŒREKR
meaning: Old Norse cognate of Hroderich (see RODERICK).

name: HUA
meaning: From Chinese 华(huá) meaning "splendid, illustrious, Chinese" or 花(huā) meaning "flower, blossom" (which is usually only feminine). Other Chinese characters can form this name as well.

name: HUAN
meaning: From Chinese 欢(huān) meaning "happy, pleased", as well as other characters pronounced in a similar way.

name: HUANG
meaning: From Chinese 煌(huáng) meaning "bright, shining, luminous" (which is usually only masculine) or 凰(huáng) meaning "phoenix" (usually only feminine). Other Chinese characters are also possible.

name: HUBERT
meaning: Means "bright heart", derived from the Germanic elements hug "heart, mind" and beraht "bright". Saint Hubert was an 8th-century bishop of Maastricht who is considered the patron saint of hunters. The Normans brought the name to England, where it replaced an Old English cognate Hygebeorht. It died out during the Middle Ages but was revived in the 19th century.

name: HUDDE
meaning: Medieval diminutive of HUGH or possibly RICHARD.

name: HUDSON
meaning: From an English surname which meant "son of HUDDE". A famous bearer of the surname was the English explorer Henry Hudson (1570-1611).

name: HUGH
meaning: From the Germanic element hug, meaning "heart, mind, spirit". It was common among Frankish and French nobility, being borne by Hugh Capet, a 10th-century king of France who founded the Capetian dynasty. The Normans brought the name to England and it became common there, even more so after the time of the 12th-century bishop Saint Hugh of Lincoln, who was known for his charity. This was also the name of kings of Cyprus and the crusader kingdom of Jerusalem. The name is used in Ireland and Scotland as the Anglicized form of Aodh and Ùisdean.

name: HUGHARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hug "heart, mind" and hard "brave, hardy".

name: HUGLEIKR
meaning: Old Norse name derived from hugr "heart, mind, spirit" and leikr "play".

name: HUGO
meaning: Latinized form of HUGH. As a surname it has belonged to the French author Victor Hugo (1802-1885), the writer of 'The Hunchback of Notre Dame' and 'Les Misérables'.

name: HUI
meaning: From Chinese 慧(huì) meaning "intelligent, wise" (which is usually only feminine), 辉(huī) meaning "brightness", besides other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: HUITZILOPOCHTLI
meaning: Means "southern hummingbird" or "left-handed hummingbird" in Nahuatl. In Aztec mythology he was the god of the sun and war. He was a patron deity of the city of Tenochtitlan (at the site of modern Mexico City).

name: HULDA  (1)
meaning: Derived from Old Norse hulda meaning "hiding, secrecy". This was the name of a sorceress in Norse mythology. As a modern name, it can also derive from archaic Swedish huld meaning "sweet, lovable".

name: HULDAH
meaning: Means "weasel, mole" in Hebrew. This name appears in the Old Testament belonging to a prophetess.

name: HULDERIC
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hulda "merciful, graceful" and ric "power, rule". It has long been confused with the Germanic name Ulrich.

name: HUMAYRA
meaning: Means "red" in Arabic. This was a name given by the Prophet Muhammad to his wife Aisha.

name: HUMBERT
meaning: Means "bright warrior", derived from the Germanic elements hun "warrior, bear cub" and beraht "bright". The Normans introduced this name to England, though it has always been uncommon there. It was borne by two kings of Italy (called Umberto in Italian), who ruled in the 19th and 20th centuries.

name: HUMPHREY
meaning: Means "peaceful warrior" from the Germanic elements hun "warrior, bear cub" and frid "peace". The Normans introduced this name to England, where it replaced the Old English cognate Hunfrith, and it was regularly used through the Middle Ages. A famous bearer was the American actor Humphrey Bogart (1899-1957), who starred in 'The Maltese Falcon' and 'Casablanca'.

name: HUNOR
meaning: Derived from the ethnic term Hun, which refers to the nomadic people from Central Asia who expanded into Europe in the 4th century. The word Hun is from Latin Hunnus, which is possibly of Turkic origin.

name: HUNTER
meaning: From an occupational English surname for a hunter, derived from Old English hunta. A famous bearer was the eccentric American journalist Hunter S. Thompson (1937-2005).

name: HURI
meaning: Means "linen weaver" in Hebrew. This was the name of the father of Abihail in the Old Testament.

name: HUSAM
meaning: Means "sword" in Arabic, a derivative of the verb حسم(hasama) meaning "to sever, to finish, to decide".

name: HUSAYN
meaning: Diminutive of HASAN. Husayn ibn Ali (also commonly transliterated Hussein) was the son of Ali and the grandson of the Prophet Muhammad. His older brother was named Hasan. The massacre of Husayn and his family was a major event in the split between Shia and Sunni Muslims, which continues to this day. In more recent times this was the name of a king of Jordan (1935-1999).

name: HUSNI
meaning: Derived from Arabic حسن(husn) meaning "beauty, excellence, goodness".

name: HUỆ
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 慧(huệ) meaning "bright, intelligent" or 蕙(huệ) meaning "orchid".

name: HWAN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 煥(hwan) meaning "shining, brilliant, lustrous" or other characters which are pronounced similarly. It usually occurs in combination with another character.

name: HYACINTH  (2)
meaning: From the name of the flower (or the precious stone which also bears this name), ultimately from Greek ‘υακινθος(hyakinthos).

name: HYACINTHA
meaning: Latinate feminine form of HYACINTHUS, used to refer to the 17th-century Italian saint Hyacintha Mariscotti (real name Giacinta).

name: HYACINTHE
meaning: French masculine and feminine form of HYACINTHUS.

name: HYACINTHUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name ‘Υακινθος(Hyakinthos), which was derived from the name of the hyacinth flower. In Greek legend Hyakinthos was accidentally killed by Apollo, who caused a lily to arise from his blood. The name was also borne by several early saints, notably a 3rd-century martyr who was killed with his brother Protus.

name: HYE
meaning: From Sino-Korean 慧(hye) meaning "bright, intelligent" or other characters which are pronounced in the same way. Although it does appear rarely as a single-character name, it is more often used in combination with another character. A notable bearer was a 6th-century king of Baekje.

name: HYE-JIN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 慧(hye) meaning "bright, intelligent" or 惠(hye) meaning "favour, benefit" combined with 珍(jin) meaning "precious, rare". This name can be formed by a variety of other hanja character combinations as well.

name: HYEON
meaning: From Sino-Korean 賢(hyeon) meaning "virtuous, worthy, able" or other characters which are pronounced similarly. It usually occurs in combination with another character, though it is sometimes used as a stand-alone name.

name: HYEON-JEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 賢(hyeon) meaning "virtuous, worthy, able" or 炫(hyeon) meaning "shine, glitter" combined with 廷(jeong) meaning "court" or 貞(jeong) meaning "virtuous, chaste, loyal". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: HYEON-JU
meaning: From Sino-Korean 賢(hyeon) meaning "virtuous, worthy, able" and 珠(ju) meaning "jewel, pearl". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: HYEON-U
meaning: From Sino-Korean 賢(hyeon) meaning "virtuous, worthy, able" or 顯(hyeon) meaning "manifest, clear" combined with 祐(u) meaning "divine intervention, protection" or 雨(u) meaning "rain". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: HYGINUS
meaning: Latinized form of ‘Υγινος(Hyginos), a Greek name derived from ‘υγιεινος(hygieinos) meaning "healthy". This was the name of the ninth pope.

name: HYMAN
meaning: Alteration of HYAM influenced by Yiddish man "man".

name: HYPATIA
meaning: Derived from Greek ‘υπατος(hypatos) meaning "highest, supreme". Hypatia of Alexandria was a 5th-century philosopher and mathematician, daughter of the mathematician Theon.

name: HYPERION
meaning: Derived from Greek ‘υπερ(hyper) "over". In Greek myth this was the name of a Titan who presided over the sun and light. By Theia he was the father of the sun god Helios, the moon goddess Selene, and the dawn goddess Eos.

name: HYRUM
meaning: Variant of HIRAM. This name was borne by Hyrum Smith (1800-1844), an early leader within the Mormon church.

name: HYWEL
meaning: Means "eminent" in Welsh. This was the name of a 10th-century king of Wales.

name: HÁKON
meaning: Old Norse form of HÅKON, as well as the modern Icelandic form.

name: HÁLFDAN
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of HALFDAN.

name: HÁVARÐR
meaning: From the Old Norse elements há "high" and varðr "guardian, defender".

name: HÅKON
meaning: Modern Norwegian form of the Old Norse name Hákon, which meant "high son" from há "high" and konr "son, descendant". This was the name of seven kings of Norway.

name: HÉLDER
meaning: Meaning uncertain. It was borne by the Brazilian archbishop Dom Hélder Câmara (1909-1999) who was noted for his charity. It could be from the name of the Dutch town of Den Helder (possibly meaning "hell's door" in Dutch). Alternatively, it might be derived from the Germanic given name HULDERIC.

name: IACCHUS
meaning: From Greek Ιακχος(Iakchos), derived from ιαχω(iacho) meaning "to shout". This was the solemn name of the Greek god Dionysos as used in the Eleusinian mysteries.

name: IACHIN
meaning: Form of JACHIN used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: IAEL
meaning: Form of JAEL used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: IAFETH
meaning: Form of JAPHETH used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: IAGAN
meaning: Variant of Aodhagán, a diminutive of AODH.

name: IAGO
meaning: Welsh and Galician form of JACOB. This was the name of two early Welsh kings of Gwynedd. It is also the name of the villain in Shakespeare's tragedy 'Othello' (1603).

name: IAH
meaning: Means "moon" in Egyptian. In Egyptian mythology this was the name of a god of the moon, later identified with Thoth.

name: IAHEL
meaning: Form of JAEL used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: IAIR
meaning: Form of JAIR used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: IAIROS
meaning: New Testament Greek form of JAIRUS.

name: IAKOBOS
meaning: Form of JACOB used in the Greek Bible.

name: IAKOVOS
meaning: Modern Greek form of JACOB (or JAMES).

name: IANTHE
meaning: Means "violet flower", derived from Greek ιον(ion) "violet" and ανθος(anthos) "flower". This was the name of an ocean nymph in Greek mythology.

name: IAPETOS
meaning: Derived from Greek ιαπτω(iapto) "to wound, to pierce". In Greek mythology this was the name of a Titan, the father of Atlas, Prometheus and Epimetheus.

name: IAPETUS
meaning: Latinized form of IAPETOS. This is the name of one of Saturn's moons.

name: IAPHETH
meaning: Form of JAPHETH used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: IARA
meaning: From Tupi y "water" and îara "lady, mistress". In Brazilian legend this is the name of a beautiful river nymph who would lure men into the water. She may have been based upon earlier Tupi legends.

name: IARED
meaning: Form of JARED used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: IARFHLAITH
meaning: Composed of the Irish elements ior, of unknown meaning, and flaith "lord". Saint Iarfhlaith was a 6th-century bishop from Galway, Ireland.

name: IBOLYA
meaning: Means "violet" in Hungarian, ultimately from Latin viola.

name: IBRAGIM
meaning: Chechen and Ossetian form of ABRAHAM.

name: IBRAHIM
meaning: Arabic, Malay and Indonesian form of ABRAHAM.

name: IBRAHIMA
meaning: Form of IBRAHIM used in parts of western Africa.

name: ICARUS
meaning: From the Greek Ικαρος(Ikaros), of unknown meaning. In Greek myth Icarus was the son of Daedalus, locked with his father inside the Labyrinth by Minos. They escaped from the maze using wings devised from wax, but Icarus flew too close to the sun and the wax melted, plunging him to his death.

name: ICHABOD
meaning: Means "no glory" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is the grandson of Eli and the son of Phinehas. This name was also used by Washington Irving for Ichabod Crane, the main character in his short story 'The Legend of Sleepy Hollow' (1820).

name: ICHIROU
meaning: From Japanese 一(ichi) meaning "one" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". This was traditionally a name given to the first son. Other combinations of kanji characters are also possible.

name: IDA
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element id meaning "work, labour". The Normans brought this name to England, though it eventually died out there in the Middle Ages. It was strongly revived in the 19th century, in part due to the heroine in Alfred Lord Tennyson's poem 'The Princess' (1847), which was later adapted into the play 'Princess Ida' (1884) by Gilbert and Sullivan....[more]

name: IDIDA
meaning: Form of JEDIDAH used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: IDONEA
meaning: Medieval English name, probably a Latinized form of IÐUNN. The spelling may have been influenced by Latin idonea "suitable". It was common in England from the 12th century.

name: IDONY
meaning: Medieval English vernacular form of IDONEA.

name: IDOYA
meaning: From the Spanish place name Idoia, possibly meaning "pond" in Basque, an important place of worship of the Virgin Mary.

name: IDRIL
meaning: Means "sparkle brilliance" in Sindarin. In the 'Silmarillion' (1977) by J. R. R. Tolkien, Idril was the daughter of Turgon, the king of Gondolin. She escaped the destruction of that place with her husband Tuor and sailed with him into the west.

name: IDRIS  (1)
meaning: Possibly means "interpreter" in Arabic. In the Qur'an this is the name of an ancient prophet. He is traditionally equated with the Hebrew prophet Enoch.

name: IDRIS  (2)
meaning: Means "ardent lord" from Welsh udd "lord, prince" combined with ris "ardent, enthusiastic, impulsive".

name: IDWAL
meaning: Means "lord of the wall", derived from Welsh udd "lord, prince" combined with gwal "wall, rampart".

name: IEDIDA
meaning: Form of JEDIDAH used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: IEPHTHAE
meaning: Form of JEPHTHAH used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: IEPTHAE
meaning: Form of JEPHTHAH used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: IESHA
meaning: Variant of AISHA. It was popularized by the song 'Iesha' (1991) by Another Bad Creation.

name: IESOUS
meaning: Greek form of JOSHUA and JESUS.

name: IEVA
meaning: Lithuanian and Latvian form of EVE. This is also the Lithuanian and Latvian word for a type of cherry tree (species Prunus padus).

name: IGNAT
meaning: Romanian, Russian and Bulgarian form of IGNATIUS.

name: IGNATIUS
meaning: From the Roman family name Egnatius, meaning unknown, of Etruscan origin. The spelling was later altered to resemble Latin ignis "fire". This was the name of several saints, including the third bishop of Antioch who was thrown to wild beasts by Emperor Trajan, and by Saint Ignatius of Loyola (1491-1556), founder of the Jesuits, whose real birth name was in fact Íñigo.

name: IGNÁC
meaning: Hungarian, Czech and Slovak form of IGNATIUS.

name: IGONE
meaning: Feminine form of IGON. It is a Basque equivalent of Ascensión.

name: IGOR
meaning: Russian form of Yngvarr (see INGVAR). The Varangians brought it to Russia in the 10th century. It was borne by two grand princes of Kiev. Famous bearers include Igor Stravinsky (1882-1971), a Russian composer whose most famous work is 'The Rite of Spring', and Igor Sikorsky (1889-1972), the Russian-American designer of the first successful helicopter.

name: IGRAINE
meaning: Meaning unknown, from Igerna, the Latinized form of Welsh Eigyr. In Arthurian legend she is the mother of King Arthur by Uther Pendragon and the mother of Morgan le Fay by Gorlois. The Welsh form Eigyr or Eigr was rendered into Latin as Igerna by the 12th-century chronicler Geoffrey of Monmouth.

name: IHINTZA
meaning: Means "dew" in Basque. It is a Basque equivalent of Rocío.

name: IINA
meaning: Short form of names ending with iina.

name: IJSBRAND
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements is "ice, iron" and brand "sword".

name: IKE
meaning: Diminutive of ISAAC. This was the nickname of the American president Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), based on the initial sound of his surname.

name: IKER
meaning: Means "visitation" in Basque. It is a Basque equivalent of Visitación.

name: IL-SEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 日(il) meaning "sun, day" and 成(seong) meaning "completed, finished, succeeded". Other hanja character combinations are possible. A notable bearer was Kim Il-sung (1912-1994), the first leader of North Korea.

name: ILARI
meaning: Russian and Finnish form of HILARIUS.

name: ILARION
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of HILARION.

name: ILBERT
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Germanic given name HILDEBERT.

name: ILDEFONSO
meaning: Spanish form of the Visigothic name Hildefons, which meant "battle ready", derived from the Germanic elements hild "battle" and funs "ready". This was the name of a 7th-century saint, an archbishop of Toledo.

name: ILDIKÓ
meaning: Possibly a form of HILDA. This name was borne by the last wife of Attila the Hun.

name: ILEANA
meaning: Possibly a Romanian variant of ELENA. In Romanian folklore this is the name of a princess kidnapped by monsters and rescued by a heroic knight.

name: ILENE
meaning: Variant of EILEEN, probably inspired by the spelling of Irene.

name: ILIA
meaning: Georgian form of ELIJAH. It is also a variant transcription of Russian ILYA or Bulgarian ILIYA.

name: ILIANA
meaning: Feminine form of ILIAS (Greek) or ILIYA (Bulgarian).

name: ILIJA
meaning: Macedonian, Serbian and Croatian form of ELIJAH, and a Bulgarian variant transcription of ILIYA.

name: ILITHYIA
meaning: From the Greek Ειλειθυια(Eileithyia), which was derived from ειληλυθυια(eilelythyia) "the readycomer". This was the name of the Greek goddess of childbirth and midwifery.

name: ILLTYD
meaning: Means "multitude of land" from Welsh il "multitude" and tud "land, people". This was the name of a 6th-century Welsh saint who founded the abbey of Llanilltud in Glamorgan.

name: ILMARINEN
meaning: Derived from Finnish ilma "air". Ilmarinen is an immortal smith in Finnish mythology, the creator of the sky and the magic mill known as the Sampo. He is one of the main characters in the Finnish epic the 'Kalevala'.

name: ILMATAR
meaning: Derived from Finnish ilma "air". In Finnish mythology Ilmatar was a semi-androgynous goddess of the heavens. She was the mother of Ilmarinen, Väinämöinen and Lemminkäinen.

name: ILONA
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly a Hungarian form of HELEN.

name: ILONKA
meaning: Hungarian and Czech diminutive of ILONA.

name: ILSE
meaning: German and Dutch diminutive of ELISABETH.

name: IMAMU
meaning: Means "spiritual leader" in Swahili, ultimately from Arabic إمام(Imam).

name: IMAN
meaning: Means "faith", derived from Arabic امن(amuna) meaning "to be faithful".

name: IMANI
meaning: Means "faith" in Swahili, ultimately of Arabic origin.

name: IME  (2)
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Germanic element ermen meaning "whole, universal".

name: IMELDA
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of IRMHILD. The Blessed Imelda was a young 14th-century nun from Bologna.

name: IMHOTEP
meaning: Means "he comes in peace" in Egyptian. This was the name of the architect, priest, physician and chief minister to the pharaoh Djoser. Imhotep apparently designed the step pyramid at Saqqara, near Memphis.

name: IMMA
meaning: Short form of IMMACOLATA or IMMACULADA.

name: IMMANUEL
meaning: Form of EMMANUEL used in most translations of the Old Testament. Immanuel Kant (1724-1804) was a German philosopher who held that duty was of highest importance.

name: IMOGEN
meaning: The name of a princess in the play 'Cymbeline' (1609) by Shakespeare. He based her on a legendary character named Innogen, but the name was printed incorrectly and never corrected. The name Innogen is probably derived from Gaelic inghean meaning "maiden".

name: IMRAN
meaning: Arabic form of AMRAM. This is the name Muslims traditionally assign to the father of the Virgin Mary (analogous to the Christian Joachim).

name: IMRE
meaning: Hungarian form of EMMERICH. This was the name of an 11th-century Hungarian saint, the son of Saint Istvan. He is also known as Emeric.

name: INA
meaning: Short form of names ending with ina.

name: INANNA
meaning: Possibly derived from Sumerian (n)in-an-na "lady of the heavens". Inanna was the Sumerian goddess of the earth, love, fertility and war. She descended into the underworld where the ruler of that place, her sister Ereshkigal, had her killed. The god Enki interceded, and Inanna was allowed to leave the underworld as long as her husband Dumuzi took her place.

name: INBAL
meaning: Means "tongue of a bell" in Hebrew.

name: INDERJIT
meaning: Variant of INDRAJIT used by Sikhs.

name: INDERPAL
meaning: Means "protector of Indra" from the name of the god INDRA combined with Sanskrit पाल(pala) meaning "protector".

name: INDIA
meaning: From the name of the country, which is itself derived from the name of the Indus River. The river's name is ultimately from Sanskrit सिन्धु(Sindhu) meaning "body of trembling water, river".

name: INDIANA
meaning: From the name of the American state, which means "land of the Indians". This is the name of the hero in the 'Indiana Jones' series of movies, starring Harrison Ford.

name: INDIGO
meaning: From the English word indigo for the purplish-blue dye or the colour. It is ultimately derived from Greek Ινδικον(Indikon) "Indic, from India".

name: INDIRA
meaning: Means "beauty" in Sanskrit. This is another name of Lakshmi, the wife of the Hindu god Vishnu. A notable bearer was India's first female prime minister, Indira Gandhi (1917-1984).

name: INDRA
meaning: Means "possessing drops of rain" from Sanskrit इन्दु(indu) meaning "a drop" and र(ra) meaning "acquiring, possessing". Indra is the name of the ancient Hindu warrior god of the sky and rain. He is the chief god in the Hindu text the Rigveda.

name: INDRAJIT
meaning: Means "conqueror of Indra" from the name of the god INDRA combined with Sanskrit जिति(jiti) meaning "victory, conquering". In Hindu legend this is another name of Meghanada, the son of Ravana, the king of Sri Lanka. He was given this name by Brahma after he defeated Indra.

name: INDRANI
meaning: Means "queen of INDRA" in Sanskrit. This is a Hindu goddess of jealousy and beauty, a wife of Indra.

name: INDU
meaning: Means "bright drop" in Sanskrit. This is a name for the moon.

name: INDY
meaning: Diminutive of INDIANA. This is the nickname of the hero of the 'Indiana Jones' movies, starring Harrison Ford.

name: INES
meaning: Italian, Slovene and Croatian form of INÉS.

name: ING
meaning: From the Germanic *Ingwaz, possibly meaning "ancestor". This was the name of an obscure old Germanic fertility god who was considered the ancestor of the tribe the Ingaevones. It is possible he was an earlier incarnation of the god Freyr.

name: INGE
meaning: Short form of Scandinavian and German names beginning with the element ing, which refers to the Germanic god ING. In Sweden and Norway this is primarily a masculine name, elsewhere it is usually feminine.

name: INGEBJØRG
meaning: Norwegian and Danish variant of INGEBORG.

name: INGEBORG
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ingibjörg, which was derived from the name of the Germanic god ING combined with björg meaning "help, save, rescue".

name: INGEGERD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ingigerðr, which was derived from the name of the Germanic god ING combined with garðr meaning "enclosure".

name: INGEMAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ingimárr, derived from the name of the Germanic god ING combined with mærr "famous".

name: INGIBJÖRG
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of INGEBORG.

name: INGMAR
meaning: Variant of INGEMAR. This name was borne by the Swedish film director Ingmar Bergman (1918-2007).

name: INGOLF
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ingólfr, which was derived from the name of the Germanic god ING combined with úlfr meaning "wolf".

name: INGRAM
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Norman French given name ENGUERRAND.

name: INGRID
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ingríðr meaning "Ing is beautiful", derived from the name of the Germanic god ING combined with fríðr "beautiful". A famous bearer was the Swedish actress Ingrid Bergman (1915-1982).

name: INGVAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Yngvarr, which was derived from the name of the Germanic god YNGVI combined with arr meaning "warrior".

name: INGVILD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Yngvildr, derived from the name of the Norse god YNGVI combined with hildr "battle".

name: INIGO
meaning: English form of ÍÑIGO. It became well-known in Britain due to the 17th-century English architect Inigo Jones. He was named after his father, a Catholic who was named for Saint Ignatius of Loyola.

name: INKA
meaning: Frisian and Finnish feminine form of INGE, and a German variant.

name: INMACULADA
meaning: Means "immaculate" in Spanish. This name is given to commemorate the Immaculate Conception of the Virgin Mary.

name: INNA
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of an early Scythian saint and martyr, a male, supposedly a disiciple of Saint Andrew.

name: INNES
meaning: Anglicized form of AONGHUS, also used as a feminine name.

name: INNOCENT
meaning: From the Late Latin name Innocentius which was derived from innocens "innocent". This was the name of several early saints. It was also borne by 13 popes including Innocent III, a politically powerful ruler and organizer of the Fourth Crusade.

name: INTI
meaning: Means "sun" in Quechua. This was the name of the Inca god of the sun.

name: IO
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Greek mythology Io was a princess loved by Zeus, who changed her into a heifer in order to hide her from Hera. A moon of Jupiter bears this name in her honour.

name: IOAB
meaning: Greek and Latin form of JOAB.

name: IOAKEIM
meaning: Greek form of JOACHIM, found in the apocryphal Gospel of James.

name: IOAN
meaning: Romanian and Welsh form of JOHN. This is also a variant transcription of the Bulgarian name YOAN(2).

name: IOANA
meaning: Romanian feminine form of JOHN. This is also a variant transcription of the Bulgarian name YOANA.

name: IOANNES
meaning: Biblical Greek form of Yochanan (see JOHN).

name: IOANNIS
meaning: Modern Greek transcription of Ioannes (see JOHN).

name: IOANNU
meaning: Old Slavic form of Ioannes (see JOHN).

name: IOB
meaning: Form of JOB used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: IOEL
meaning: Form of JOEL used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: IOHEL
meaning: Form of JOEL used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: IOLANDA
meaning: Italian, Portuguese and Romanian form of YOLANDA.

name: IOLANTHE
meaning: Probably a variant of YOLANDA influenced by the Greek words ιολη(iole) "violet" and ανθος(anthos) "flower". This name was (first?) used by Gilbert and Sullivan in their comic opera 'Iolanthe' (1882).

name: IOLE
meaning: Means "violet" in Greek. In Greek mythology she was a woman beloved by Herakles.

name: ION  (1)
meaning: Basque and Romanian form of JOHN.

name: ION  (2)
meaning: Of unknown etymology, possibly pre-Greek. According to Greek mythology he was a son of Creusa and Xuthus (or alternatively the god Apollo). He was said to be the ancestor of the Greek tribe of the Ionians.

name: IONA  (1)
meaning: From the name of the island off Scotland where Saint Columba founded a monastery. The name of the island is Old Norse in origin, and apparently derives simply from ey meaning "island".

name: IONA  (2)
meaning: Form of JONAH used in the Latin Old Testament, as well as the Russian and Georgian form.

name: IONAS
meaning: Form of JONAH used in the Greek Bible. It is also the form used in the Latin New Testament.

name: IONATHAN
meaning: Form of JONATHAN and JEHONATHAN used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: IONE
meaning: From Greek ιον(ion) meaning "violet flower". This was the name of a sea nymph in Greek mythology. It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since the 19th century, though perhaps based on the Greek place name Ionia, a region on the west coast of Asia Minor.

name: IORAM
meaning: Form of JORAM used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: IORWERTH
meaning: Means "handsome lord" from Welsh ior "lord" and berth "handsome". This name is used in the Mabinogion, a collection of tales from Welsh myth, where it belongs to a son of Maredudd. This name is sometimes used as a Welsh form of EDWARD.

name: IOSAPHAT
meaning: Form of JEHOSHAPHAT used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: IOSEPH
meaning: Form of JOSEPH used in the Greek and Latin Bible.

name: IOSIAS
meaning: Form of JOSIAH used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: IOSIF
meaning: Russian, Romanian and Greek form of JOSEPH.

name: IOSIFU
meaning: Old Slavic form of Ioseph (see JOSEPH).

name: IOUBAL
meaning: Form of JUBAL used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: IOUNIA
meaning: Form of JUNIA used in the Greek New Testament.

name: IOVITA
meaning: Latin masculine and feminine form of JOVITA.

name: IPATIY
meaning: Russian form of the Greek name ‘Υπατος(Hypatos), the masculine form of HYPATIA.

name: IPHIGENEIA
meaning: Derived from Greek ιφιος(iphios) "strong, stout" and γενης(genes) "born". In Greek myth Iphigenia was the daughter of King Agamemnon. When her father offended Artemis it was divined that the only way to appease the goddess was to sacrifice Iphigenia. Just as Agamemnon was about to sacrifice his daughter she was magically transported to the city of Taurus....[more]

name: IQBAL
meaning: Means "fortunate" in Arabic. Allama Muhammad Iqbal (1877-1938) was a poet, philosopher, and scholar from Pakistan.

name: IRA  (1)
meaning: Means "watchful" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of King David's priest. As an English Christian given name, Ira began to be used after the Protestant Reformation. In the 17th century the Puritans brought it to America, where remained moderately common into the 20th century.

name: IRACEMA
meaning: Means "honey lips" in Tupi. This is the name of an 1865 novel by José de Alencar, about the relationship between a Tupi woman and a Portuguese man during the early colonial period. Alencar may have constructed the name so that it would be an anagram of America.

name: IRELAND
meaning: From the name of the European island country, derived from Irish Gaelic Éire, which may mean something like "abundant land" in Old Irish.

name: IRENAEUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ειρηναιος(Eirenaios) which meant "peaceful". Saint Irenaeus was an early bishop of Lyons for whom the Greek island of Santorini is named.

name: IRENE
meaning: From Greek Ειρηνη(Eirene), derived from a word meaning "peace". This was the name of the Greek goddess who personified peace, one of the ‘Ωραι (Horai). It was also borne by several early Christian saints. The name was common in the Byzantine Empire, notably being borne by an 8th-century empress, who was the first woman to lead the empire. She originally served as regent for her son, but later had him killed and ruled alone....[more]

name: IRENKA
meaning: Polish and Czech diminutive of IRENA.

name: IRIA
meaning: Possibly a Portuguese and Galician form of IRENE. This was the name of a 7th-century saint (also known as Irene) from Tomar in Portugal. This is also the name of an ancient town in Galicia (now a district of Padrón).

name: IRIDA
meaning: Greek variant of IRIS, from the genitive form Ιριδος(Iridos).

name: IRIS
meaning: Means "rainbow" in Greek. Iris was the name of the Greek goddess of the rainbow, also serving as a messenger to the gods. This name can also be given in reference to the word (which derives from the same Greek source) for the iris flower or the coloured part of the eye.

name: IRIT
meaning: Means "asphodel" in Hebrew (an asphodel is a type of flower).

name: IRJA
meaning: Possibly a Finnish diminutive of IRINA.

name: IRMA
meaning: German short form of names beginning with the Germanic element ermen, which meant "whole, universal". It is thus related to EMMA. It began to be regularly used in the English-speaking world in the 19th century.

name: IRMHILD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ermen "whole, universal" and hild "battle".

name: IRMINGARD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ermen meaning "whole, universal" and gard meaning "enclosure".

name: IRNERIUS
meaning: Possibly from Wernerius, a Latinized form of the Germanic name WERNER. This was the name of a 12th-century Italian scholar and jurist.

name: IRVIN
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of either IRVING or IRWIN.

name: IRVING
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was in turn derived from a Scottish place name meaning "green water". Historically this name has been relatively common among Jews, who have used it as an American-sounding form of Hebrew names beginning with I such as Isaac, Israel and Isaiah. A famous bearer was the Russian-American songwriter and lyricist Irving Berlin (1888-1989), whose birth name was Israel Beilin.

name: IRWIN
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Old English given name EOFORWINE.

name: ISA  (3)
meaning: Short form of Germanic names beginning with the element is "ice, iron".

name: ISAAC
meaning: From the Hebrew name יִץְחָק(Yitzchaq) meaning "he will laugh, he will rejoice", derived from צָחַק(tzachaq) meaning "to laugh". The Old Testament explains this meaning, by recounting that Abraham laughed when God told him that his aged wife Sarah would become pregnant with Isaac (see Genesis 17:17), and later Sarah laughed when overhearing the same prophecy (see Genesis 18:12). When Isaac was a boy, God tested Abraham's faith by ordering him to sacrifice his son, though an angel prevented the act at the last moment. Isaac went on to become the father of Esau and Jacob with his wife Rebecca....[more]

name: ISAAK
meaning: Russian and German form of ISAAC, as well as the form used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: ISABEL
meaning: Medieval Occitan form of ELIZABETH. It spread throughout Spain, Portugal and France, becoming common among the royalty by the 12th century. It grew popular in England in the 13th century after Isabella of Angoulême married the English king John, and it was subsequently bolstered when Isabella of France married Edward II the following century....[more]

name: ISABELLA
meaning: Latinate form of ISABEL. This name was borne by many medieval royals, including queen consorts of England, France, Portugal, the Holy Roman Empire and Hungary, as well as the powerful ruling queen Isabella of Castile (properly called Isabel).

name: ISADORA
meaning: Variant of ISIDORA. A famous bearer was the American dancer Isadora Duncan (1877-1927).

name: ISAGANI
meaning: Meaning unknown. This is the name of a character in the novel 'El Filibusterismo' (1891) by José Rizal.

name: ISAIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְשַׁעְיָהוּ(Yesha'yahu) meaning "YAHWEH is salvation", from the roots יָשַׁע(yasha') meaning "to save" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. Isaiah is one of the four major prophets of the Old Testament, supposedly the author of the Book of Isaiah. He was from Jerusalem and probably lived in the 8th century BC, at a time when Assyria threatened the Kingdom of Judah. As an English Christian name, Isaiah was first used after the Protestant Reformation.

name: ISAIAS
meaning: Late Latin form of ISAIAH used in some versions of the Bible.

name: ISAIJA
meaning: Serbian and Macedonian form of ISAIAH.

name: ISAMU
meaning: From Japanese 勇(isamu) meaning "brave" or other kanji having the same pronunciation.

name: ISAURA
meaning: Late Latin name which meant "from Isauria". Isauria was the name of a region in Asia Minor.

name: ISAURUS
meaning: Masculine form of ISAURA. This was the name of an early saint who was martyred in Macedon.

name: ISAÍAS
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of ISAIAH.

name: ISCAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יִסְכָּה(Yiskah) which meant "to behold". In the Old Testament this is the name of Abraham's niece, mentioned only briefly. This is the basis of the English name Jessica.

name: ISHA
meaning: Means "master, lord" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the feminine form ईशा and the masculine form ईश (an epithet of the Hindu god Shiva). It is also the name of one of the Upanishads, which are parts of Hindu scripture.

name: ISHILD
meaning: Germanic name, a hypothetical early form of ISOLDE.

name: ISHMAEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name יִשְׁמָעֵאל(Yishma'el) meaning "God will hear", from the roots שָׁמַע(shama') meaning "to hear" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". In the Old Testament this is the name of a son of Abraham. He is the traditional ancestor of the Arab people. Also in the Old Testament, it is borne by a man who assassinates Gedaliah the governor of Judah. The author Herman Melville later used this name for the narrator in his novel 'Moby-Dick' (1851).

name: ISHMERAI
meaning: Means "he guards" in Hebrew. This name is mentioned briefly in the Old Testament.

name: ISHTAR
meaning: Meaning unknown. Ishtar was the Babylonian and Assyrian mother goddess who presided over love, war and fertility. She was called Ashtoreth by the Phoenicians, and she was also identified with the Sumerian goddess Inanna.

name: ISHVI
meaning: Means "he resembles me" in Hebrew. This is the name of a son of Asher in the Old Testament.

name: ISIDOR
meaning: German, Russian and Macedonian form of ISIDORE.

name: ISIDORA
meaning: Feminine form of ISIDORE. This was the name of a 4th-century Egyptian saint and hermitess.

name: ISIDORE
meaning: From the Greek name Ισιδωρος(Isidoros) which meant "gift of Isis", derived from the name of the Egyptian goddess ISIS combined with Greek δωρον(doron) "gift". Saint Isidore of Seville was a 6th-century archbishop, historian and theologian....[more]

name: ISIDORO
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of ISIDORE.

name: ISIS
meaning: Greek form of Egyptian Ist (reconstructed as Iset or Ueset), which possibly meant "the throne". In Egyptian mythology Isis was the goddess of the sky and nature, the wife of Osiris and the mother of Horus. She was originally depicted wearing a throne-shaped headdress, but in later times she was conflated with the goddess Hathor and depicted having the horns of a cow on her head. She was also worshipped by people outside of Egypt, such as the Greeks and Romans.

name: ISKANDAR
meaning: Arabic, Indonesian and Malay form of ALEXANDER.

name: ISKRA
meaning: From a South Slavic word meaning "spark".

name: ISLA
meaning: Variant of ISLAY, typically used as a feminine name.

name: ISLAM
meaning: From the name of the religion, derived from Arabic إسلام(Islam) which means "submission (to God)".

name: ISLAMBEK
meaning: Derived from Islam, the name of the religion (ultimately from Arabic إسلام), combined with the Turkish military title beg meaning "chieftain, master".

name: ISLAY
meaning: From the name of the island of Islay, which lies off of the west coast of Scotland.

name: ISLWYN
meaning: From the name of a mountain in Wales which means "below the grove" from Welsh is "below" and llwyn "grove".

name: ISMAEL
meaning: Spanish form of ISHMAEL. This is also the form used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: ISMAHEL
meaning: Form of ISHMAEL used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: ISMAIL
meaning: Uyghur form of ISHMAEL. It is also a variant transcription of Arabic ISMA'IL.

name: ISMENE
meaning: Possibly from Greek ισμη(isme) "knowledge". This was the name of the daughter of Oedipus and Jocasta in Greek legend.

name: ISOCRATES
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ισοκρατης(Isokrates) which meant "equal power", derived from ισος(isos) "equal" and κρατος(kratos) "power". This was the name of a 4th-century BC Athenian orator.

name: ISOLDE
meaning: The origins of this name are uncertain, though some Celtic roots have been suggested. It is possible that the name is ultimately Germanic, perhaps from a hypothetic name like Ishild, composed of the elements is "ice, iron" and hild "battle"....[more]

name: ISRA
meaning: Means "nocturnal journey", derived from Arabic سرى(sara) "to travel at night".

name: ISRAEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name יִשְׂרָאֵל(Yisra'el) meaning "God contends", from the roots שָׂרָה(sarah) meaning "to contend, to fight" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". In the Old Testament Israel (who was formerly named Jacob; see Genesis 32:28) wrestles with an angel. The ancient and modern states of Israel took their names from him.

name: ISRAFIL
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Islamic tradition this is the name of the angel who will blow the trumpet that signals the coming of Judgement Day. He is sometimes equated with the angels Raphael or Uriel from Judeo-Christian tradition.

name: ISRAHEL
meaning: Form of ISRAEL used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: ISSACHAR
meaning: Possibly means "man of hire" or "there is reward", from Hebrew שָׁכַר(shakhar) meaning "hire, wage, reward". In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the twelve sons of Jacob and Leah and the founder of one of the twelve tribes of Israel. A justification for the name's meaning is given in Genesis 30:18.

name: ISSY
meaning: Diminutive of ISIDORE, ISABELLA and other names beginning with Is.

name: ISTVÁN
meaning: Hungarian form of STEPHEN. This was the name of the first king of Hungary. Ruling in the 11th century, he encouraged the spread of Christianity among his subjects and is considered the patron saint of Hungary.

name: ITALIA
meaning: From the Italian name of the country of Italy, Italia (see ITALUS).

name: ITALUS
meaning: Means "of Italy" in Latin. In Roman legend Italus was the father of Romulus and Remus, the founders of Rome. He supposedly gave his name to the region known as Italia or Italy (in fact the region may have gotten its name from Oscan Víteliú meaning "land of bulls").

name: ITHAI
meaning: From a Hebrew name spelled variously אִתַּי('Ittai) or אִיתַי('Itai) meaning "with me". In the Old Testament this is the name of one of King David's mighty men.

name: ITHAMAR
meaning: From the Hebrew name אִיתָמָר('Itamar) meaning "date palm island". This is the name of a son of Aaron in the Old Testament.

name: ITHEL
meaning: Means "generous lord" from the Welsh elements udd "lord, prince" and hael "generous".

name: ITHIEL
meaning: Possibly means "God is with me" in Hebrew. This is the name of a minor character in the Old Testament.

name: ITSUKI
meaning: From Japanese 樹(itsuki) meaning "tree", using the kanji's nanori reading. Other kanji or kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: ITZEL
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly from Mayan itz meaning "dew, nectar, fluid". Otherwise, it might be a variant of IXCHEL.

name: ITZIAR
meaning: From the name of a Basque village which contains an important shrine to the Virgin Mary, possibly meaning "old stone".

name: IULIA
meaning: Ancient Roman and Romanian form of JULIA.

name: IULIANA
meaning: Ancient Roman and Romanian form of JULIANA.

name: IVAH
meaning: From the name of a district of Babylon, mentioned in the Old Testament.

name: IVAN
meaning: Newer form of the old Slavic name Іѡаннъ(Ioannu), which was derived from Greek Ioannes (see JOHN). This was the name of six Russian rulers, including the 15th-century Ivan III the Great and 16th-century Ivan IV the Terrible, the first tsar of Russia. It was also borne by nine emperors of Bulgaria. Other notable bearers include the Russian author Ivan Turgenev (1818-1883), who wrote 'Fathers and Sons', and the Russian physiologist Ivan Pavlov (1849-1936), who is best known for his discovery of the conditioned reflex.

name: IVAYLO
meaning: Perhaps derived from an old Bulgar name meaning "wolf". This was the name of a 13th-century emperor of Bulgaria. It is possible that this spelling was the result of a 15th-century misreading of his real name Vulo from historical documents.

name: IVES
meaning: English form of YVES, used to refer to Saint Ives (also called Ivo) of Huntingdonshire, a semi-legendary English bishop.

name: IVETA
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of YVETTE.

name: IVKA
meaning: Diminutive of IVA(1), IVA(2) or IVA(3).

name: IVO  (1)
meaning: Germanic name, originally a short form of names beginning with the Germanic element iv meaning "yew". Alternative theories suggest that it may in fact be derived from a cognate Celtic element. This was the name of several saints (who are also commonly known as Saint Yves or Ives).

name: IVONNE
meaning: Spanish, German and Dutch variant of YVONNE.

name: IVOR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ívarr, which was derived from the elements yr "yew, bow" and arr "warrior". During the Middle Ages it was brought to Britain by Scandinavian settlers and invaders, and it was adopted in Ireland, Scotland and Wales.

name: IVORY
meaning: From the English word for the hard, creamy-white substance which comes from elephant tusks and was formerly used to produce piano keys.

name: IVY
meaning: From the English word for the climbing plant that has small yellow flowers. It is ultimately derived from Old English ifig.

name: IVÁN
meaning: Spanish and Hungarian form of IVAN.

name: IWAN
meaning: Welsh form of JOHN and a Polish form of IVAN.

name: IXCHEL
meaning: Means "rainbow lady" in Mayan. Ixchel was the Maya goddess of the earth, the moon, and medicine. She was often depicted with a snake in her hair and crossbones embroidered on her skirt.

name: IZABELLA
meaning: Hungarian and Polish form of ISABELLA.

name: IZANAGI
meaning: Means "male who invites" in Japanese. In Japanese mythology the god Izanagi was the husband of Izanami. When she died he unsuccessfully journeyed to the underworld to retrieve her. In the purifying rites that followed his return the gods of the sun, moon and wind were created.

name: IZANAMI
meaning: Means "female who invites" in Japanese. In Japanese mythology she was a creator goddess, the wife of Izanagi. She died giving birth to Kagututi, the god of fire.

name: IZARO
meaning: Meaning unknown, from the name of a small island off the Spanish coast in the Bay of Biscay.

name: IZEBEL
meaning: Form of JEZEBEL used in some versions of the Italian Bible.

name: IZOLDA
meaning: Georgian and Polish form of ISOLDE.

name: IZUMI
meaning: From Japanese 泉(izumi) meaning "fountain, spring". This name can also be constructed from other combinations of kanji.

name: IZZ AL-DIN
meaning: Means "glory of religion", derived from Arabic عزّ('izz) meaning "glory, power" and دين(din) meaning "religion". In the 13th century Izz al-Din Aybak became the first Mamluk ruler of Egypt. The Mamluks were a warrior caste who were originally slaves.

name: IZZY
meaning: Diminutive of ISIDORE, ISABEL, ISRAEL, and other names beginning with a similar sound.

name: IÐUNN
meaning: Probably derived from Old Norse ið "again" and unna "to love". In Norse mythology Iðunn was the goddess of spring and immortality whose responsibility it was to guard the gods' apples of youth.

name: JAAK
meaning: Estonian form of JACOB or JAMES, and a Flemish short form of JACOB.

name: JAAKOB
meaning: Finnish and Estonian form of JACOB (or JAMES).

name: JAALA
meaning: Means "wild goat" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a servant of Solomon.

name: JAANA
meaning: Short form of MARJAANA and other names ending in jaana.

name: JAASAU
meaning: Means "they will do" in Hebrew. This was the name of a descendant of Bani in the Old Testament.

name: JABBAR
meaning: Means "powerful" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الجبّار(al-Jabbar) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: JABEZ
meaning: Means "sorrow" in Hebrew. This is the name of a character in the Old Testament who is blessed by God.

name: JABIN
meaning: Means "perceptive" in Hebrew. This name was borne by two kings of Hazor in the Old Testament.

name: JACENTY
meaning: Polish form of HYACINTHUS. Saint Jacenty was a 13th-century Dominican monk from Krakow who was said to have taken missionary journeys throughout northern Europe and Asia.

name: JACHIN
meaning: Means "he establishes" in Hebrew. This was the name of a son of Simeon in the Old Testament.

name: JACINTA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese feminine form of HYACINTHUS.

name: JACINTH
meaning: From the English word for the orange precious stone, originating from the same source as Hyacinth.

name: JACINTO
