meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of HYACINTHUS.

name: JACK
meaning: Derived from Jackin (earlier Jankin), a medieval diminutive of JOHN. It is often regarded as an independent name. During the Middle Ages it was very common, and it became a slang word meaning "man". It was frequently used in fairy tales and nursery rhymes, such as 'Jack and the Beanstalk', 'Little Jack Horner', and 'Jack Sprat'. American writers Jack London (1876-1916) and Jack Kerouac (1922-1969) were two famous bearers of this name. It is also borne by American actor Jack Nicholson (1937-).

name: JACKIE
meaning: Diminutive of JACK or JACQUELINE. A notable bearer was baseball player Jackie Robinson (1919-1972), the first African-American to play in Major League Baseball.

name: JACKSON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of JACK". A famous bearer of the surname was American president Andrew Jackson (1767-1845).

name: JACOB
meaning: From the Latin Iacobus, which was from the Greek Ιακωβος(Iakobos), which was from the Hebrew name יַעֲקֹב(Ya'aqov). In the Old Testament Jacob (later called Israel) is the son of Isaac and Rebecca and the father of the twelve founders of the twelve tribes of Israel. He was born holding his twin brother Esau's heel, and his name is explained as meaning "holder of the heel" or "supplanter", because he twice deprived his brother of his rights as the firstborn son (see Genesis 27:36). Other theories claim that it is in fact derived from a hypothetical name like יַעֲקֹבְאֵל(Ya'aqov'el) meaning "may God protect"....[more]

name: JACOBINE
meaning: Norwegian, Danish and Dutch feminine form of JACOB (or JAMES).

name: JACOBUS
meaning: Latin form of JACOB, also used in Dutch.

name: JACOMINA
meaning: Dutch feminine form of Iacomus (see JAMES).

name: JACQUELINE
meaning: French feminine form of JACQUES, also commonly used in the English-speaking world.

name: JADA  (1)
meaning: Possibly an elaborated form of JADE. This name came into general use in the 1960s, and was popularized in the 1990s by actress Jada Pinkett Smith (1971-).

name: JADA  (2)
meaning: Means "he knows" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament, Jada is a son of Onam.

name: JADE
meaning: From the name of the precious stone that is often used in carvings. It is derived from Spanish (piedra de la) ijada meaning "(stone of the) flank", relating to the belief that jade could cure renal colic. As a given name, it came into general use during the 1970s. It was initially unisex, though it is now mostly feminine.

name: JADEN
meaning: An invented name, using the popular aden suffix sound found in such names as Braden, Hayden and Aidan. This name first became common in American in the 1990s when similar-sounding names were increasing in popularity. It is sometimes considered a variant of JADON.

name: JADON
meaning: Possibly means either "thankful" or "he will judge" in Hebrew. This name is borne by a minor character in the Old Testament.

name: JADRAN
meaning: Croatian, Serbian and Slovene form of ADRIAN.

name: JADRANKA
meaning: Croatian, Serbian and Slovene feminine form of ADRIAN.

name: JADRANKO
meaning: Croatian, Serbian and Slovene form of ADRIAN.

name: JADWIGA
meaning: Polish form of HEDWIG. This was the name of a 14th-century ruling queen of Poland who has recently been canonized as a saint.

name: JAE  (1)
meaning: From Sino-Korean 才(jae) meaning "talent, ability" or 財(jae) meaning "wealth, riches", as well as other hanja characters with the same pronunciation. It usually occurs in combination with another character, though it is sometimes used as a stand-alone name.

name: JAE-SEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 在(jae) meaning "located at, exist" or 宰(jae) meaning "kill, rule" combined with 成(seong) meaning "completed, finished, succeeded" or 誠(seong) meaning "sincere, honest, true". Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: JAEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name יָעֵל(Ya'el) meaning "ibex, mountain goat". This name appears in the Old Testament belonging to the wife of Heber the Kenite. After Sisera, the captain of the Canaanite army, was defeated in battle by Deborah and Barak he took refuge in Heber's tent. When he fell asleep Jael killed him by hammering a tent peg into his head.

name: JAFAR
meaning: Means "stream" in Arabic. Jafar ibn Abi Talib was a cousin of the Prophet Muhammad who was killed fighting against Byzantium in the 7th century. Another notable bearer was Jafar al-Sadiq, the sixth Shia imam.

name: JAGA
meaning: Croatian, Serbian and Macedonian diminutive of AGATHA or JAGODA.

name: JAGADISHA
meaning: Means "ruler of the world" from Sanskrit जगत्(jagat) meaning "world" and ईश(isha) meaning "ruler". This is another name of the Hindu god Vishnu.

name: JAGANNATHA
meaning: Means "master of the world" from Sanskrit जगत्(jagat) meaning "world" and नाथ(natha) meaning "master". This is a title of the Hindu gods Vishnu and Krishna.

name: JAGJIT
meaning: From Sanskrit जगत्(jagat) meaning "world, universe" and जिति(jiti) meaning "victory, conquering".

name: JAGODA
meaning: Means "strawberry" in South Slavic, and "berry" in Polish.

name: JAHAN
meaning: Means "world" in Persian. This name was borne by Shah Jahan, a 17th-century Mughal emperor who is best known as the builder of the Taj Mahal.

name: JAHANGIR
meaning: Means "world conqueror" in Persian. This was the name of a 17th-century Mughal emperor.

name: JAHLEEL
meaning: Means "God waits" in Hebrew. This name is mentioned briefly in the Old Testament.

name: JAHZEEL
meaning: Means "God will divide" in Hebrew. This is the son of Naphtali in the Old Testament.

name: JAI
meaning: Variant transcription of JAY(2) and a Tamil masculine form of JAYA.

name: JAIME  (1)
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of JAMES.

name: JAIME  (2)
meaning: Variant of JAMIE. The character Jaime Sommers from the television series 'The Bionic Woman' (1976-1978) helped to popularize the name. It can sometimes be given in reference to the French phrase j'aime meaning "I love", though it is pronounced differently.

name: JAIR
meaning: Means "he shines" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of both a son of Manasseh and one of the ruling judges of the Israelites.

name: JAIRUS
meaning: From Ιαιρος(Iairos), the Greek form of JAIR used in the New Testament, where it belongs to the father of a young girl brought back to life by Jesus.

name: JAKE
meaning: Medieval variant of JACK. It is also sometimes used as a short form of JACOB.

name: JAKOV
meaning: Serbian, Croatian and Macedonian form of JACOB (or JAMES).

name: JAKUB
meaning: Polish, Czech and Slovak form of JACOB (or JAMES).

name: JALEN
meaning: An invented name. In America it was popularized in the 1990s by basketball player Jalen Rose (1973-), whose name was a combination of those of his father James and maternal uncle Leonard.

name: JAM
meaning: Persian form of Avestan Yima meaning "twin" (related to Sanskrit Yama). This was the name of a mythological king, more commonly called Jamshid.

name: JAMAL
meaning: Means "beauty" in Arabic. Jamal al-Din al-Afghani was a political activist who promoted pan-Islamism in the 19th century.

name: JAMAR
meaning: Recently created name, possibly a blend of JAMAL and LAMAR. It has been in general use in America since the 1970s.

name: JAMES
meaning: English form of the Late Latin name Iacomus which was derived from Ιακωβος(Iakobos), the New Testament Greek form of the Hebrew name Ya'aqov (see JACOB). This was the name of two apostles in the New Testament. The first was Saint James the Greater, the apostle John's brother, who was beheaded under Herod Agrippa in the Book of Acts. The second was James the Lesser, son of Alphaeus. Another James (known as James the Just) is also mentioned in the Bible as being the brother of Jesus....[more]

name: JAMESON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of JAMES".

name: JAMIE
meaning: Originally a Lowland Scots diminutive of JAMES. Since the late 19th century it has also been used as a feminine form.

name: JAMIN
meaning: Means "right hand" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a son of Simeon.

name: JAMISON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of JAMES".

name: JAMSHED
meaning: Variant transcription of JAMSHID, as well as the regular Tajik form.

name: JAMSHID
meaning: Modern Persian form of Avestan Yima Kshaeta, which meant "shining JAM". This was the name of a mythological king of Persia. He is known as either Jamshid or Jam, where Jamshid is a combination of his original name and an honourific.

name: JAMYANG
meaning: Means "gentle song" in Tibetan, from འཇམ('jam) meaning "gentle, soft" and དབྱངས(dbyangs) meaning "song, voice".

name: JAN  (1)
meaning: Form of JOHANNES. This name was borne by the 15th-century Flemish painter Jan van Eyck and the 17th-century Dutch painter Jan Vermeer.

name: JAN  (2)
meaning: Short form of JANET, JANICE, and other names beginning with Jan.

name: JAN  (3)
meaning: Medieval English form of JOHN, derived from the Old French form Jehan.

name: JANA  (2)
meaning: Croatian and Serbian variant of ANA.

name: JANE
meaning: Medieval English form of Jehanne, an Old French feminine form of Iohannes (see JOHN). This became the most common feminine form of John in the 17th century, surpassing Joan....[more]

name: JANEK
meaning: Polish and Czech diminutive of JAN(1).

name: JANELLE
meaning: Diminutive of JANE. It has been in use only since the 20th century.

name: JANESSA
meaning: Elaborated form of JANE, influenced by VANESSA.

name: JANI
meaning: Finnish form and Hungarian diminutive of JOHN.

name: JANICE
meaning: Elaborated form of JANE, created by Paul Leicester Ford for his novel 'Janice Meredith' (1899).

name: JANINE
meaning: Variant of JEANNINE. It has only been in use since the 20th century.

name: JANJA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of AGNES. It also may be inspired by Serbo-Croatian janje meaning "lamb".

name: JANNA
meaning: Feminine form of JAN(1). As an English name, it is an elaboration of JAN(2).

name: JANNAH
meaning: Variant of JANNA, influenced by HANNAH.

name: JANNE  (1)
meaning: Finnish form of JOHN, as well as a Swedish diminutive of JAN(1).

name: JANNE  (2)
meaning: Danish and Norwegian diminutive of JOHANNA.

name: JANNICKE
meaning: Scandinavian feminine diminutive of JAN(1), from Low German.

name: JANNIKE
meaning: Scandinavian feminine diminutive of JAN(1), from Low German.

name: JANUARIUS
meaning: Roman cognomen meaning "January" in Latin. The name of the month derives from the name of the Roman god Janus. Saint Januarius, the patron saint of Naples, was a bishop who was beheaded during the persecutions of Emperor Diocletian in the early 4th century.

name: JANUS
meaning: Means "archway" in Latin. Janus was the Roman god of gateways and beginnings, often depicted as having two faces looking in opposite directions. The month of January is named for him.

name: JAPHETH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יֶפֶת(Yefet) meaning "enlarged". In the Old Testament he is one of the three sons of Noah, along with Shem and Ham. He was the ancestor of the peoples of Europe and Northern Asia.

name: JAQUAN
meaning: Combination of the popular name elements Ja and quan.

name: JARAH
meaning: Means "honeycomb" and "honeysuckle" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a descendant of Saul.

name: JARED
meaning: From the Hebrew name יָרֶד(Yared) or יֶרֶד(Yered) meaning "descent". This is the name of a close descendant of Adam in the Old Testament. It has been used as an English name since the Protestant Reformation, and it was popularized in the 1960s by the character Jarrod Barkley on the television series 'The Big Valley'.

name: JAREK
meaning: Diminutive of Slavic names beginning with the element yaru meaning "fierce, strong", such as JAROSŁAW or JAROSLAV.

name: JARETH
meaning: Probably a blend of JARED and GARETH. This was the name of the Goblin King, played by David Bowie, in the movie 'Labyrinth' (1986).

name: JARL
meaning: Means "chieftain, nobleman, earl" in Old Norse. In Norse legend Jarl was the son of the god Ríg and the founder of the race of warriors.

name: JARMIL
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements yaru meaning "fierce, energetic" and milu meaning "gracious, dear".

name: JAROGNIEW
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements yaru meaning "fierce, energetic" and gnyevu meaning "anger".

name: JAROMÍR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements yaru meaning "fierce, energetic" and miru meaning "peace, world".

name: JARON  (2)
meaning: Invented name, probably based on JARED and DARREN.

name: JAROPEŁK
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements yaru meaning "fierce, energetic" and pulku meaning "people, host".

name: JAROSLAV
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of JAROSŁAW.

name: JAROSLAVA
meaning: Czech and Slovak feminine form of JAROSŁAW.

name: JAROSŁAW
meaning: Means "fierce and glorious", derived from the Slavic elements yaru meaning "fierce, energetic" and slava meaning "glory".

name: JARRETT
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of GARRETT.

name: JARVIS
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name GERVAIS.

name: JASMIN  (1)
meaning: German and Finnish form of JASMINE, as well as an English variant.

name: JASMINA
meaning: Croatian, Serbian, Slovene and Macedonian form of JASMINE.

name: JASMINE
meaning: From the English word for the climbing plant with fragrant flowers which is used for making perfumes. It is derived from Persian یاسمن(yasamen) (which is also a Persian name).

name: JASNA
meaning: Derived from South Slavic jasno meaning "clear, sharp".

name: JASON
meaning: From the Greek name Ιασων(Iason), which was derived from Greek ιασθαι(iasthai) "to heal". In Greek mythology Jason was the leader of the Argonauts. After his uncle Pelias overthrew his father Aeson as king of Iolcos, Jason went in search of the Golden Fleece in order to win back the throne. During his journeys he married the sorceress Medea, who helped him gain the fleece and kill his uncle, but who later turned against him when he fell in love with another woman....[more]

name: JASPER
meaning: Means "treasurer" in Persian. This name was traditionally assigned to one of the wise men (also known as the Magi, or three kings) who were said to have visited the newborn Jesus. It has occasionally been used in the English-speaking world since the Middle Ages. The name can also be given in reference to the English word for the gemstone.

name: JASWINDER
meaning: From Sanskrit यशस्(yashas) meaning "fame, praise, glory" combined with the name of the Hindu god INDRA.

name: JAVAN
meaning: Means "Greece" in Hebrew, possibly related to ION(2). In the Old Testament this is the name of a grandson of Noah and the ancestor of the Greek peoples.

name: JAWAHIR
meaning: Means "jewels" in Arabic, ultimately from Persian گوهر(gohar) meaning "jewel, essence".

name: JAWDAT
meaning: Means "goodness, excellence", derived from Arabic جاد(jada) meaning "to be excellent".

name: JAY  (1)
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the sound J, such as JAMES or JASON. It was originally used in America in honour of founding father John Jay (1749-1825), whose surname was derived from the jaybird.

name: JAY  (2)
meaning: Modern (northern Indian) masculine form of JAYA.

name: JAYA
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit जय(jaya) meaning "victory". This is a transcription of both the feminine form जया (an epithet of the Hindu goddess Durga) and the masculine form जय (borne by several characters in Hindu texts). As a modern personal name, this transcription is both feminine and masculine in southern India, but typically only feminine in the north.

name: JAYADEVA
meaning: Means "divine victory" from Sanskrit जय(jaya) meaning "victory" and देव(deva) meaning "god". This was the name of a 13th-century Indian poet.

name: JAYANTA
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit जयन्त(jayanta) meaning "victorious". This is the name of a son of the Hindu god Indra, as well as other figures in Hindu mythology.

name: JAYANTI
meaning: Feminine form of JAYANTA. This is another name of the Hindu goddess Durga.

name: JAYENDRA
meaning: Means "lord of victory" from Sanskrit जय(jaya) meaning "victory" combined with the name of the god INDRA, used here to mean "lord".

name: JAYESH
meaning: Means "lord of victory" from Sanskrit जय(jaya) meaning "victory, conquest" and ईश(isha) meaning "lord, ruler".

name: JAYLA
meaning: Combination of JAY(1) and the popular name suffix la.

name: JAYLEN
meaning: Variant of JALEN. It can also be a feminine elaboration of JAY(1).

name: JAYLENE
meaning: Feminine elaboration of JAY(1) using the popular suffix lene.

name: JAYLIN
meaning: Variant of JALEN. It can also be a feminine elaboration of JAY(1).

name: JAYLYN
meaning: Feminine elaboration of JAY(1) using the popular suffix lyn.

name: JAZLYN
meaning: Modern name, a combination of the popular name elements Jaz and lyn.

name: JEAN  (1)
meaning: French form of Jehan, the Old French form of Iohannes (see JOHN). The French philosophers Jean-Jacques Rousseau (1712-1778) and Jean Paul Sartre (1905-1980) were two well-known bearers of this name. It was also borne by the German-French Dadaist artist Jean Arp (1886-1966).

name: JEAN  (2)
meaning: Medieval English variant of Jehanne (see JANE). It was common in England and Scotland during the Middle Ages, but eventually became rare in England. It was reintroduced to the English-speaking world from Scotland in the 19th century.

name: JEAN-BAPTISTE
meaning: Combination of JEAN(1) and BAPTISTE, referring to Saint John the Baptist.

name: JEANNE
meaning: Modern French form of Jehanne, an Old French feminine form of Iohannes (see JOHN). Joan of Arc is known as Jeanne d'Arc in France.

name: JEB
meaning: Sometimes a diminutive of JACOB. This name may have also resulted from a nickname of James Ewell Brown Stuart (1833-1864), a Confederate general in the American Civil War, which was formed from the initial letters of his three given names.

name: JECONIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH will establish" in Hebrew. This is another name (with the same meaning) of the Judean king Jehoiachin.

name: JEDIDAH
meaning: Means "beloved" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the wife of King Amon of Judah and the mother of Josiah.

name: JEDIDIAH
meaning: Means "beloved of YAHWEH" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is a name given to Solomon by Nathan.

name: JEFFERSON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of JEFFREY". It is usually given in honour of Thomas Jefferson (1743-1826), the third president of the United States and the primary author of the Declaration of Independence.

name: JEFFREY
meaning: Medieval variant of GEOFFREY. In America, Jeffrey has been more common than Geoffrey, though this is not true in Britain.

name: JEFIMIJA
meaning: Serbian form of EUPHEMIA. This name was adopted by a 14th-century Serbian poet (born Jelena Mrnjavčević).

name: JEHAN
meaning: Old French form of Iohannes (see JOHN).

name: JEHANNE
meaning: Old French feminine form of Iohannes (see JOHN).

name: JEHIEL
meaning: Means "God will live" in Hebrew. This is the name of several people in the Old Testament, including one of King David's lute players.

name: JEHOASH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְהוֹאָשׁ(Yeho'ash), an extended form of יוֹאָשׁ (see JOASH). According to the Old Testament, this was the name of a king of Israel. He probably reigned in the 8th century BC.

name: JEHOHANAN
meaning: From the Hebrew name Yehochanan, an extended form of Yochanan (see JOHN). It is borne by a few minor characters in the English Old Testament.

name: JEHOIACHIN
meaning: Means "YAHWEH establishes" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a king of Judah. Also known as Jeconiah, he was imprisoned in Babylon by Nebuchadnezzar after a brief reign in the early 6th century BC.

name: JEHOIAKIM
meaning: Means "raised by YAHWEH" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a king of Judah. He lived in the 7th century BC, and was the son of Josiah and the father of Jehoiachin.

name: JEHONATHAN
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְהוֹנָתָן(Yehonatan), the full form of JONATHAN. This is the name of a few minor characters in the Old Testament.

name: JEHORAM
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְהוֹרָם(Yehoram) which meant "exalted by YAHWEH". In the Old Testament this is the name of a king of Judah and a king of Israel, both of whom ruled at about the same time in the 9th century BC.

name: JEHOSHAPHAT
meaning: Means "YAHWEH has judged" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is the fourth king of Judah, noted for having a generally peaceful and prosperous reign.

name: JEHOSHEBA
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְהוֹשֶׁבַע(Yehosheva') which meant "YAHWEH is an oath". In the Old Testament she is the daughter of King Jehoram of Judah. With her husband Jehoiada she rescued the future king Joash, her nephew, from a purge.

name: JEHOVAH
meaning: Form of YAHWEH used in older translations of the Bible, produced by blending the letters of the tetragrammaton with the vowels from ADONAI.

name: JEHU
meaning: Means "YAHWEH is he" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a king of Israel. He ruled in the 9th century BC, coming to power by overthrowing Jehoram. This was also the name of a prophet during the reign of the king Baasha.

name: JEHUDI
meaning: Means "Jew" in Hebrew, ultimately referring to a person from the tribe of Judah. In the Old Testament this is the name of a servant of King Jehoiakim.

name: JELA
meaning: Short form of JELENA or JELISAVETA. It also means "fir tree" in Serbian and Croatian.

name: JELENA
meaning: Form of YELENA. In Serbia, Croatia and Slovenia it is also associated with the South Slavic words jelen meaning "deer, stag" and jela meaning "fir tree".

name: JELKA
meaning: Diminutive of JELENA. It also means "fir tree" in Slovene.

name: JELLE
meaning: Originally a Frisian short form of Germanic names beginning with the element gild "sacrifice, value". It can also be a Dutch diminutive of WILLEM.

name: JEM
meaning: Diminutive of JEREMY (and formerly of JAMES).

name: JEMIMA
meaning: Means "dove" in Hebrew. This was the oldest of the three daughters of Job in the Old Testament. As an English name, Jemima first became common during the Puritan era.

name: JEMMY
meaning: Diminutive of JEREMY (and formerly of JAMES).

name: JENELLE
meaning: Combination of JEN and the popular name suffix elle.

name: JENESSA
meaning: Combination of JEN and the popular name suffix essa.

name: JENNA
meaning: Variant of JENNY. Use of the name was popularized in the 1980s by the character Jenna Wade on the television series 'Dallas'.

name: JENNIE
meaning: Variant of JENNY. Before the 20th century this spelling was more common.

name: JENNIFER
meaning: From a Cornish form of the Welsh name Gwenhwyfar (see GUINEVERE). This name has only been common outside of Cornwall since the beginning of the 20th century, after it was featured in George Bernard Shaw's play 'The Doctor's Dilemma' (1906).

name: JENNY
meaning: Originally a medieval English diminutive of JANE. Since the middle of the 20th century it has been primarily considered a diminutive of JENNIFER.

name: JENŐ
meaning: From the name of an ancient Hungarian tribe. Since the 19th century it has been used as a Hungarian form of EUGENE.

name: JEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 靜(jeong) meaning "quiet, still, gentle" or 貞(jeong) meaning "virtuous, chaste, loyal", as well as other characters which are pronounced similarly. It usually occurs in combination with another character, though it is sometimes used as a stand-alone name.

name: JEONG-HO
meaning: From Sino-Korean 正(jeong) meaning "right, proper, correct" combined with 好(ho) meaning "good, excellent" or 浩(ho) meaning "great, numerous, vast". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: JEONG-HUI
meaning: From Sino-Korean 正(jeong) meaning "right, proper, correct" or 靜(jeong) meaning "quiet, still, gentle" combined with 姬(hui) meaning "beauty" or 熙(hui) meaning "bright, splendid, glorious". Other combinations of hanja characters can form this name as well.

name: JEONG-HUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 正(jeong) meaning "right, proper, correct" and 勛(hun) meaning "meritorious deed, rank", as well as other hanja character combinations.

name: JEONG-SUK
meaning: From Sino-Korean 貞(jeong) meaning "virtuous, chaste, loyal" or 正(jeong) meaning "right, proper, correct" combined with 淑(suk) meaning "good, pure, virtuous, charming". Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: JEPHTHAH
meaning: Means "he opens" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this name belongs to a ruling judge. He successfully defended Israel from the Ammonites, but was then obliged to sacrifice his daughter because of a vow he had made.

name: JEPSON
meaning: From an English surname which meant "son of JEP".

name: JERE
meaning: Finnish diminutive of JEREMIAS (usually used independently), as well as a Croatian diminutive of JERONIM and an English diminutive of JERALD or JEREMIAH.

name: JEREMIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יִרְםְיָהוּ(Yirmiyahu) meaning "YAHWEH will exalt", from the roots רוּם(rum) meaning "to exalt" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. This is the name of one of the major prophets of the Old Testament, the author of the Book of Jeremiah and the Book of Lamentations (supposedly). He lived to see the Babylonian destruction of Jerusalem in the 6th century BC....[more]

name: JEREMIAS
meaning: German, Portuguese and Finnish form of JEREMIAH.

name: JEREMIEL
meaning: Means "God will exalt" in Hebrew. Jeremiel (also called Remiel) is named as an archangel in the apocryphal books of Esdras and Enoch in the Old Testament.

name: JEREMY
meaning: Medieval English form of JEREMIAH, and the form used in some English versions of the New Testament.

name: JERIAH
meaning: Means "taught by YAHWEH" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament, Jeriah is a descendant of Hebron.

name: JERICHO
meaning: From the name of a city in Israel which is mentioned several times in the Old Testament. The meaning of the city's name is uncertain, but it may be related to the Hebrew word יָרֵחַ(yareach) meaning "moon", or otherwise to the Hebrew word רֵיחַ(reyach) meaning "fragrant".

name: JERMAINE
meaning: Variant of GERMAIN. The name was popularized in the 1970s by Jermaine Jackson (1954-), a member of the singing group The Jackson 5.

name: JEROBOAM
meaning: From the Hebrew name יָרָבְעָם(Yarav'am) meaning "the people contend". According to the Old Testament, this was the name of the leader of the revolt against King Rehoboam of Israel. The kingdom was split into Judah in the south and Israel in the north, with Jeroboam becoming the first king of the latter.

name: JEROME
meaning: From the Greek name ‘Ιερωνυμος(Hieronymos) meaning "sacred name", derived from ‘ιερος(hieros) "sacred" and ονομα(onoma) "name". Saint Jerome was responsible for the creation of the Vulgate, the Latin translation of the Bible, in the 5th century. He is regarded as a Doctor of the Church. The name was used in his honour in the Middle Ages, especially in Italy and France, and has been used in England since the 12th century.

name: JERRY
meaning: Diminutive of JEREMY, JEROME, GERALD, GERALDINE, and other names beginning with the same sound. A notable bearer was American comedian Jerry Lewis (1926-2017).

name: JERUSHA
meaning: From Hebrew יָרַשׁ(yarash) meaning "possession". In the Old Testament she is the wife of King Uzziah of Judah and the mother of Jotham.

name: JERVIS
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of JARVIS.

name: JERÓNIMO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of JEROME.

name: JESCHA
meaning: Form of ISCAH found in the medieval Wycliffe Bible. This name was probably the basis for Shakespeare's created name Jessica.

name: JESS
meaning: Short form of JESSE or JESSICA.

name: JESSALYN
meaning: Combination of JESSIE(1) and the popular name suffix lyn.

name: JESSAMINE
meaning: From a variant spelling of the English word jasmine (see JASMINE), used also to refer to flowering plants in the cestrum family.

name: JESSE
meaning: From the Hebrew name יִשַׁי(Yishai) which possibly means "gift". In the Old Testament Jesse is the father of King David. It began to be used as an English given name after the Protestant Reformation. A famous bearer was Jesse James (1847-1882), an American outlaw who held up banks and stagecoaches. He was eventually shot by a fellow gang member for a reward. Another famous bearer was the American athlete Jesse Owens (1913-1980), whose real name was James Cleveland (or J. C.) Owens.

name: JESSICA
meaning: This name was first used in this form by Shakespeare in his play 'The Merchant of Venice' (1596), where it belongs to the daughter of Shylock. Shakespeare probably based it on the biblical name ISCAH, which would have been spelled Jescha in his time. It was not commonly used as a given name until the middle of the 20th century. Notable bearers include actresses Jessica Tandy (1909-1994) and Jessica Lange (1949-).

name: JESSIE  (1)
meaning: Originally a Scottish diminutive of JEAN(2). In modern times it is also used as a diminutive of JESSICA.

name: JESSIKA
meaning: German and English variant of JESSICA.

name: JESUS
meaning: English form of Ιησους(Iesous), which was the Greek form of the Aramaic name יֵשׁוּעַ(Yeshu'a). Yeshu'a is itself a contracted form of Yehoshu'a (see JOSHUA). Yeshua ben Yoseph, better known as Jesus Christ, was the central figure of the New Testament and the source of the Christian religion. The four gospels state that he was the son of God and the Virgin Mary who fulfilled the Old Testament prophecies of the Messiah. He preached for three years before being crucified in Jerusalem.

name: JESÚS
meaning: Spanish form of JESUS, used as a personal name.

name: JET
meaning: Short form of HENRIËTTE or MARIËTTE.

name: JETHRO
meaning: From the Hebrew name יִתְרוֹ(Yitro), which was derived from the Hebrew word יֶתֶר(yeter) meaning "abundance". According to the Old Testament, Jethro was a Midianite priest who sheltered Moses when he fled Egypt. He was the father of Zipporah, who became Moses's wife. A famous bearer of the name was Jethro Tull (1674-1741), an English inventor and agriculturist.

name: JETT
meaning: From the English word jet, which denotes either a jet aircraft or an intense black colour (the words derive from different sources).

name: JEUNESSE
meaning: Means "youth" in French. It is not used as a given name in France itself.

name: JEWEL
meaning: In part from the English word jewel, a precious stone, derived from Old French jouel, which was possibly related to jeu "game". It is also in part from the surname Jewel or Jewell (a derivative of the Breton name JUDICAËL), which was sometimes used in honour of the 16th-century bishop of Salisbury John Jewel. It has been in use as a given name since the 19th century.

name: JEZEBEL
meaning: From the Hebrew אִיזֶבֶל('Izevel) which probably means "where is the prince?", a ritual question spoken in ceremonies honouring Baal. Alternatively, it may mean "not exalted". In the Old Testament Jezebel is the evil wife of Ahab, king of Israel. After she was thrown from a window to her death her body was eaten by dogs, fulfilling Elijah's prophecy.

name: JI
meaning: From Sino-Korean 智(ji) meaning "wisdom, intellect" or other hanja characters with the same pronunciation. Although it does appear rarely as a single-character name, it is more often used in combination with another character.

name: JI-EUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 枝(ji) meaning "branch, limb", 知(ji) meaning "know, perceive, comprehend" or 志(ji) meaning "will, purpose, ambition" combined with 恩(eun) meaning "kindness, mercy, charity". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: JI-HU
meaning: From Sino-Korean 智(ji) meaning "wisdom, intellect" combined with 厚(hu) meaning "thick". Other combinations of hanja characters can form this name as well.

name: JI-HUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 智(ji) meaning "wisdom, intellect" or 志(ji) meaning "will, purpose, ambition" combined with 勛(hun) meaning "meritorious deed, rank". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: JI-HYE
meaning: From a Sino-Korean compound meaning "wisdom", formed of the hanja characters 智(ji) meaning "wisdom, intellect" and 慧(hye) meaning "bright, intelligent". This name can also be formed from other character combinations.

name: JI-MIN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 志(ji) meaning "will, purpose, ambition" or 智(ji) meaning "wisdom, intellect" combined with 旼(min) meaning "gentle, affable", 敏(min) meaning "quick, clever, sharp" or 珉(min) meaning "jade, stone resembling jade". Other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: JI-U
meaning: From Sino-Korean 芝(ji) meaning "sesame" or 志(ji) meaning "will, purpose, ambition" combined with 雨(u) meaning "rain" or 宇(u) meaning "house, eaves, universe". Other combinations of hanja characters can form this name as well.

name: JI-YEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 智(ji) meaning "wisdom, intellect" or 知(ji) meaning "know, perceive, comprehend" combined with 英(yeong) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero" or 榮(yeong) meaning "glory, honour, flourish, prosper". Many other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: JI-YU
meaning: From Sino-Korean 智(ji) meaning "wisdom, intellect" and 裕(yu) meaning "abundant, rich, plentiful". Other combinations of hanja characters can form this name as well.

name: JIA
meaning: From Chinese 佳(jiā) meaning "good, auspicious, beautiful", 家(jiā) meaning "home, family", or other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: JIAHAO
meaning: From Chinese 家(jiā) meaning "home, family" combined with 豪(háo) meaning "brave, heroic, chivalrous". This name can be formed from other character combinations as well.

name: JIAN
meaning: From Chinese 建(jiàn) meaning "build, establish", 健(jiàn) meaning "strong, healthy", or other characters which are pronounced in a similar fashion.

name: JIANG
meaning: From Chinese 江(jiāng) meaning "river, Yangtze", as well as other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: JIANHONG
meaning: From Chinese 健(jiàn) meaning "build, establish" combined with 宏(hóng) meaning "wide, spacious, great, vast". This name can also be formed from other character combinations.

name: JIE
meaning: From Chinese 杰(jié) meaning "heroic, outstanding" or other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: JIEMBA
meaning: Means "star" or perhaps "laughing star" in Wiradjuri.

name: JIMI
meaning: Diminutive of JAMES. A famous bearer was the rock musician Jimi Hendrix (1942-1970).

name: JIMMIE
meaning: Diminutive or feminine form of JAMES.

name: JIMMU
meaning: Means "divine warrior", from Japanese 神(jin) meaning "god" and 武(mu) meaning "military, martial". In Japanese legend this was the name of the founder of Japan and the first emperor, supposedly ruling in the 7th century BC.

name: JIN
meaning: From Chinese 金(jīn) meaning "gold, metal, money", 锦(jǐn) meaning "tapestry, brocade, embroidered" or 津(jīn) meaning "ferry". Other Chinese characters can form this name as well.

name: JING
meaning: From Chinese 静(jìng) meaning "quiet, still, gentle", 精(jīng) meaning "essence, spirit", 晶(jīng) meaning "clear, crystal" or 京(jīng) meaning "capital city". Other characters can also form this name.

name: JINGYI
meaning: From Chinese 静(jìng) meaning "quiet, still, gentle" combined with 怡(yí) meaning "joy, harmony". Other character combinations are possible as well.

name: JIROU
meaning: From Japanese 二(ji) meaning "two" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". This was traditionally a name given to the second son. Other combinations of kanji characters can also be possible.

name: JITENDER
meaning: Variant of JITENDRA used by Sikhs.

name: JITENDRA
meaning: Means "conqueror of Indra" from Sanskrit जिति(jiti) meaning "victory, conquering" combined with the name of the god INDRA.

name: JO
meaning: Short form of JOAN(1), JOANNA, JOSEPHINE, or other names that begin with Jo. It is primarily masculine in German and Dutch, short for JOHANNES or JOSEF.

name: JOAB
meaning: Means "YAHWEH is father" in Hebrew. According to the Old Testament, he was the commander of King David's army. In separate incidents he killed both Abner and Absalom. When Solomon came to power he was executed.

name: JOACHIM
meaning: Contracted form of JEHOIACHIN or JEHOIAKIM. According to the apocryphal Gospel of James, Saint Joachim was the husband of Saint Anne and the father of the Virgin Mary. Due to his popularity in the Middle Ages, the name came into general use in Christian Europe (though it was never common in England).

name: JOAKIM
meaning: Scandinavian, Macedonian and Serbian form of JOACHIM.

name: JOAN  (1)
meaning: Medieval English form of Johanne, an Old French form of Iohanna (see JOANNA). This was the usual English feminine form of John in the Middle Ages, but it was surpassed in popularity by Jane in the 17th century....[more]

name: JOAN  (2)
meaning: Catalan and Occitan form of Iohannes (see JOHN).

name: JOANA
meaning: Portuguese and Catalan form of Iohanna (see JOANNA).

name: JOANNA
meaning: English and Polish form of Latin Iohanna, which was derived from Greek Ιωαννα(Ioanna), the feminine form of Ioannes (see JOHN). This is the spelling used in the English New Testament, where it belongs to a follower of Jesus who is regarded as a saint. In the Middle Ages in England it was used as a Latinized form of Joan (the usual feminine form of John) and it became common as a given name in the 19th century.

name: JOAQUIM
meaning: Portuguese and Catalan form of JOACHIM.

name: JOASH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יוֹאָשׁ(Yo'ash), possibly meaning "fire of YAHWEH". In the Old Testament this name was borne by several characters including the father of Gideon, a king of Judah, and a son of King Ahab of Israel.

name: JOB
meaning: From the Hebrew name אִיּוֹב('Iyyov) which means "persecuted, hated". In the Book of Job in the Old Testament he is a righteous man who is tested by God, enduring many tragedies and hardships while struggling to remain faithful.

name: JOCASTA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Ιοκαστη(Iokaste), which is of unknown meaning. In Greek mythology she was the mother Oedipus by the Theban king Laius. In a case of tragic mistaken identity, she married her own son.

name: JOCELINE
meaning: French feminine form of Joscelin (see JOCELYN).

name: JOCELYN
meaning: From a Germanic masculine name, variously written as Gaudelenus, Gautselin, Gauzlin, along with many other spellings. It was derived from the Germanic element Gaut, which was from the name of the Germanic tribe the Goths, combined with a Latin diminutive suffix. The Normans brought this name to England in the form Goscelin or Joscelin, and it was common until the 14th century. It was revived in the 20th century primarily as a feminine name, perhaps an adaptation of the surname Jocelyn (a medieval derivative of the given name). In France this is a masculine name only.

name: JOCELYNE
meaning: French feminine form of Joscelin (see JOCELYN).

name: JOCHEBED
meaning: From the Hebrew name יוֹכֶבֶד(Yokheved) which meant "YAHWEH is glory". In the Old Testament this is the name of the mother of Miriam, Aaron and Moses.

name: JOCKEL
meaning: Diminutive of JAKOB, JÖRG or JOACHIM.

name: JOCOSA
meaning: Medieval variant of JOYCE, influenced by the Latin word iocosus or jocosus "merry, playful".

name: JODY
meaning: Probably either a variant of JUDY or a diminutive of JOSEPH. It was popularized by the young hero in Marjorie Kinnan Rawlings' novel 'The Yearling' (1938) and the subsequent film adaptation (1946).

name: JOE
meaning: Short form of JOSEPH. Five famous sports figures who have had this name are boxers Joe Louis (1914-1981) and Joe Frazier (1944-), baseball player Joe DiMaggio (1914-1999), and football quarterbacks Joe Namath (1943-) and Joe Montana (1956-).

name: JOEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name יוֹאֵל(Yo'el) meaning "YAHWEH is God", from the elements יוֹ(yo) and אֵל(el), both referring to the Hebrew God. Joel is one of the twelve minor prophets of the Old Testament, the author of the Book of Joel, which describes a plague of locusts. In England, it was first used as a Christian name after the Protestant Reformation.

name: JOEY
meaning: Diminutive of JOSEPH. It is occasionally used as a feminine diminutive of JOSEPHINE or JOHANNA.

name: JOHAN
meaning: Scandinavian and Dutch form of Iohannes (see JOHN).

name: JOHANAN
meaning: Form of Yochanan (see JOHN) used in the English Old Testament. It was the name of a military leader in the time of the prophet Jeremiah.

name: JOHANN
meaning: German form of Iohannes (see JOHN). Famous bearers include German composer Johann Sebastian Bach (1685-1750), German novelist and poet Johann Goethe (1749-1832), and Austrian composers Johann Strauss the Elder (1804-1849) and his son Johann Strauss the Younger (1825-1899).

name: JOHANNE
meaning: French, Danish and Norwegian form of Iohanna (see JOANNA).

name: JOHANNES
meaning: Latin form of Ioannes (see JOHN). Notable bearers include the inventor of the printing press Johannes Gutenberg (1398-1468), astronomer Johannes Kepler (1571-1630) and composer Johannes Brahms (1833-1897).

name: JOHN
meaning: English form of Iohannes, the Latin form of the Greek name Ιωαννης(Ioannes), itself derived from the Hebrew name יוֹחָנָן(Yochanan) meaning "YAHWEH is gracious", from the roots יוֹ(yo) referring to the Hebrew God and חָנַן(chanan) meaning "to be gracious". The Hebrew form occurs in the Old Testament (spelled Johanan or Jehohanan in the English version), but this name owes its popularity to two New Testament characters, both highly revered saints. The first is John the Baptist, a Jewish ascetic who is considered the forerunner of Jesus. He baptized Jesus and was later executed by Herod Antipas. The second is the apostle John, who is traditionally regarded as the author of the fourth gospel and Revelation. With the apostles Peter and James (his brother), he was part of the inner circle of Jesus....[more]

name: JOHNIE
meaning: Diminutive of JOHN, sometimes used as a feminine form.

name: JOHNNIE
meaning: Diminutive of JOHN, sometimes used as a feminine form.

name: JOHNNY
meaning: Diminutive of JOHN. A famous bearer is American actor Johnny Depp (1963-).

name: JOJO
meaning: Diminutive of JOSEPH, JOLENE, and other names that begin with Jo.

name: JOKTAN
meaning: Means "small" in Hebrew. This is the name of a son of Eber in the Old Testament.

name: JOLANA
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of YOLANDA.

name: JOLANDA
meaning: Dutch, Slovene and Croatian form of YOLANDA, as well as an Italian variant of IOLANDA.

name: JOLANTA
meaning: Polish and Lithuanian form of YOLANDA.

name: JOLENE
meaning: Formed from JO and the popular name suffix lene. This name was created in the 20th century.

name: JOLIE
meaning: Means "pretty" in French. This name was popularized by American actress Angelina Jolie (1975-), whose surname was originally her middle name. It is not used as a given name in France.

name: JOLYON
meaning: Medieval form of JULIAN. The author John Galsworthy used it for a character in his 'Forsyte Saga' novels (published between 1906 and 1922).

name: JOLÁNKA
meaning: Created by the Hungarian writer András Dugonics for the main character in his novel 'Jólánka, Etelkának Leánya' (1803). He may have based it on Hungarian jóleán meaning "good girl" or possibly on the name YOLANDA.

name: JON  (1)
meaning: Scandinavian and Basque form of JOHN.

name: JON  (2)
meaning: Short form of JONATHAN, or sometimes a variant of JOHN.

name: JONAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יוֹנָה(Yonah) meaning "dove". This was the name of a prophet swallowed by a fish, as told in the Old Testament Book of Jonah. Jonah was commanded by God to preach in Nineveh, but instead fled by boat. After being caught in a storm, the other sailors threw Jonah overboard, at which point he was swallowed. He emerged from the fish alive and repentant three days later....[more]

name: JONAS  (2)
meaning: From Ιωνας(Ionas), the Greek form of JONAH. This spelling is used in some English translations of the New Testament.

name: JONATAN
meaning: Spanish form of JONATHAN, as well as a Scandinavian and German variant form.

name: JONATHAN
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְהוֹנָתָן(Yehonatan), contracted to יוֹנָתָן(Yonatan), meaning "YAHWEH has given", derived from the roots יְהוֹ(yeho) referring to the Hebrew God and נָתַן(natan) meaning "to give". According to the Old Testament, Jonathan was the eldest son of Saul. His relationship with his father was strained due to his close friendship with his father's rival David. Along with Saul he was killed in battle with the Philistines....[more]

name: JONG-SU
meaning: From Sino-Korean 宗(jong) meaning "lineage, ancestry" and 秀(su) meaning "luxuriant, beautiful, elegant, outstanding", as well as other combinations of hanja characters with the same pronunciations.

name: JONQUIL
meaning: From the English word for the type of flower, derived ultimately from Latin iuncus "reed".

name: JONÁŠ
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of JONAH.

name: JOONAS
meaning: Finnish and Estonian form of JONAS(2).

name: JOOP
meaning: Dutch diminutive of JOHANNES or JOZEF.

name: JOOS
meaning: Dutch short form of JODOCUS, JUSTUS or JOZEF.

name: JOOST
meaning: Dutch form of Iudocus (see JOYCE), sometimes used as a diminutive of JUSTUS or JOZEF.

name: JORAM
meaning: Contracted form of Yehoram (see JEHORAM). This name belongs to several minor characters in the Old Testament, as well as being another name for the kings Jehoram of Israel and Jehoram of Judah.

name: JORDAN
meaning: From the name of the river which flows between the countries of Jordan and Israel. The river's name in Hebrew is יַרְדֵן(Yarden), and it is derived from יָרַד(yarad) meaning "descend" or "flow down". In the New Testament John the Baptist baptizes Jesus Christ in its waters, and it was adopted as a personal name in Europe after crusaders brought water back from the river to baptize their children. There may have been some influence from the Germanic name JORDANES, notably borne by a 6th-century Gothic historian....[more]

name: JORDANES
meaning: Germanic name, probably related to the Norse element jord meaning "land". This name was borne by a 6th-century Roman author of Gothic background, who wrote a history of the Goths. It is possible that the spelling of his name was influenced by that of the Jordan River.

name: JORGE
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of GEORGE.

name: JORIS
meaning: Dutch and Frisian form of GEORGE.

name: JORUNN
meaning: From the Old Norse name Jórunnr, derived from the elements jór "horse" and unna "love".

name: JOSAPHAT
meaning: Contracted form of JEHOSHAPHAT used in some English versions of the New Testament.

name: JOSEF
meaning: German, Scandinavian and Czech form of JOSEPH.

name: JOSEFA
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Czech feminine form of JOSEPH.

name: JOSEFINA
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Swedish feminine form of JOSEPH.

name: JOSEFINE
meaning: Scandinavian and German form of JOSÉPHINE.

name: JOSEPH
meaning: From Ioseph, the Latin form of Greek Ιωσηφ(Ioseph), which was from the Hebrew name יוֹסֵף(Yosef) meaning "he will add", from the root יָסַף(yasaf). In the Old Testament Joseph is the eleventh son of Jacob and the first with his wife Rachel. Because he was the favourite of his father, his older brothers sent him to Egypt and told their father that he had died. In Egypt, Joseph became an advisor to the pharaoh, and was eventually reconciled with his brothers when they came to Egypt during a famine. This name also occurs in the New Testament, belonging to Saint Joseph the husband of Mary, and to Joseph of Arimathea....[more]

name: JOSEPHINE
meaning: English, German and Dutch form of JOSÉPHINE.

name: JOSEPHUS
meaning: Latin form of JOSEPH. This form is used by Dutch Catholics. In English, it is used primarily to refer to the 1st-century Jewish historian Titus Flavius Josephus.

name: JOSES
meaning: From Ιωσης(Ioses), a Greek variant of JOSEPH used in the New Testament to distinguish Joseph the brother of James from the many other characters of that name.

name: JOSHUA
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְהוֹשֻׁעַ(Yehoshu'a) meaning "YAHWEH is salvation", from the roots יְהוֹ(yeho) referring to the Hebrew God and יָשַׁע(yasha') meaning "to save". As told in the Old Testament, Joshua was a companion of Moses. He went up Mount Sinai with Moses when he received the Ten Commandments from God, and later he was one of the twelve spies sent into Canaan. After Moses died Joshua succeeded him as leader of the Israelites and he led the conquest of Canaan. His original name was Hoshea....[more]

name: JOSIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יֹאשִׁיָהוּ(Yoshiyahu) meaning "YAHWEH supports". In the Old Testament this is the name of a king of Judah famous for his religious reforms. He was killed fighting the Egyptians at Megiddo in the 7th century BC. In England this name came into use after the Protestant Reformation.

name: JOSIAS
meaning: Latinized form of JOSIAH used in some English versions of the Old Testament.

name: JOSIF
meaning: Serbian and Macedonian form of JOSEPH.

name: JOSIP
meaning: Croatian and Slovene form of JOSEPH.

name: JOSUÉ
meaning: French, Spanish and Portuguese form of JOSHUA.

name: JOSÉ
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of JOSEPH.

name: JOSÉPHINE
meaning: French feminine form of JOSEPH. A notable bearer of this name was the first wife of Napoleon Bonaparte, Joséphine de Beauharnais (1763-1814).

name: JOTHAM
meaning: Means "YAHWEH is perfect" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of both a son of Gideon and a king of Judah.

name: JOUKAHAINEN
meaning: Meaning unknown. In the Finnish epic the 'Kalevala' this is the name of a youth who challenges Väinämöinen to a chanting (or spellcasting) duel. Joukahainen loses, and must promise his sister Aino to Väinämöinen.

name: JOURNEY
meaning: From the English word, derived via Old French from Latin diurnus "of the day".

name: JOVAN
meaning: Serbian and Macedonian form of JOHN.

name: JOVANA
meaning: Serbian and Macedonian feminine form of JOHN.

name: JOVE
meaning: From Latin Iovis, derived from the stem of Iuppiter (see JUPITER). This was another name of the Roman god Jupiter.

name: JOVIAN
meaning: From Latin Iovianus, a Roman cognomen which was a derivative of Iovis (see JOVE). This was the name of a 4th-century Roman emperor.

name: JOVITA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese feminine form of the Roman name Iovita (masculine), which was derived from the name of the god JOVE. This was the name of an early saint and martyr, the brother of Faustinus.

name: JOY
meaning: Simply from the English word joy, ultimately derived from Norman French joie, Latin gaudia. It has been regularly used as a given name since the late 19th century.

name: JOYCE
meaning: From the medieval masculine name Josse, which was derived from the earlier Iudocus, which was a Latinized form of the Breton name Judoc meaning "lord". The name belonged to a 7th-century Breton saint, and Breton settlers introduced it to England after the Norman conquest. It became rare after the 14th century, but was later revived as a feminine name, perhaps because of similarity to the Middle English word joise "to rejoice". This given name also formed the basis for a surname, as in the case of the Irish novelist James Joyce (1882-1941).

name: JOZAFAT
meaning: Polish form of JOSAPHAT. This was the name of a 17th-century Polish saint and martyr who attempted to reconcile the Catholic and Eastern Churches.

name: JOZEF
meaning: Slovak and Dutch form of JOSEPH.

name: JOZEFA
meaning: Hungarian and Slovene feminine form of JOSEPH.

name: JOËL
meaning: French and Dutch form of JOEL.

name: JOĈJO
meaning: Esperanto diminutive of JOHN or JOSEPH.

name: JOŽICA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian feminine form of JOSEPH.

name: JU
meaning: From Chinese 菊(jú) meaning "chrysanthemum" (which is usually only feminine) or 巨(jù) meaning "big, enormous" (usually only masculine), besides other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: JU-WON
meaning: From Sino-Korean 周(ju) meaning "circumference" combined with 元(won) meaning "first, origin" or 媛(won) meaning "beautiful woman". Other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: JUAN  (1)
meaning: Spanish and Manx form of Iohannes (see JOHN). This name is borne by Don Juan, a character from Spanish legend who, after killing his lover's father, is dragged to hell by the father's ghost.

name: JUAN  (2)
meaning: From Chinese 娟(juān) meaning "beautiful, graceful" or other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: JUANA
meaning: Spanish form of Iohanna (see JOANNA), making it the feminine form of JUAN(1). This name was borne by Juana the Mad, a 16th-century queen of Castile.

name: JUBAL
meaning: Means "stream" in Hebrew. This name is mentioned in Genesis in the Old Testament as belonging to the first person to be a musician.

name: JUDA
meaning: Means "goodness, excellence", derived from Arabic جاد(jada) "to be excellent".

name: JUDAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְהוּדָה(Yehudah), probably derived from יָדָה(yadah) meaning "praise". In the Old Testament Judah is the fourth of the twelve sons of Jacob by Leah, and the ancestor of the tribe of Judah. An explanation for his name is given in Genesis 29:35. His tribe eventually formed the Kingdom of Judah in the south of Israel. King David and Jesus were among the descendants of him and his wife Tamar. This name was also borne by Judah Maccabee, the Jewish priest who revolted against Seleucid rule in the 2nd century BC, as told in the Books of Maccabees....[more]

name: JUDAS
meaning: From Ιουδας(Ioudas), the Greek form of JUDAH. This is the name of several characters in the New Testament including the infamous Judas Iscariot, the apostle who betrayed Jesus to the Jewish authorities in exchange for money.

name: JUDD
meaning: Medieval diminutive of JORDAN. Modern use of this name is inspired by the surname that was derived from the medieval name.

name: JUDDA
meaning: Probably derived from the name of the Germanic tribe the Jutes, who originated in Denmark and later invaded and settled in England. The name of the tribe, recorded in Latin as Iutae and Old English as Eotas, is of uncertain origin.

name: JUDE  (1)
meaning: Variant of JUDAS. It is used in many English versions of the New Testament to denote the second apostle named Judas, in order to distinguish him from Judas Iscariot. He was supposedly the author of the Epistle of Jude. In the English-speaking world, Jude has occasionally been used as a given name since the time of the Protestant Reformation.

name: JUDICAËL
meaning: French form of the Old Breton name Iudicael, derived from the elements iud "lord, prince" and cael "generous". This was the name of a 7th-century Breton king, also regarded as a saint.

name: JUDITA
meaning: Lithuanian, Czech and Slovak form of JUDITH.

name: JUDITH
meaning: From the Hebrew name יְהוּדִית(Yehudit) meaning "Jewish woman", feminine of יְהוּדִי(yehudi), ultimately referring to a person from the tribe of Judah. In the Old Testament Judith is one of the Hittite wives of Esau. This is also the name of the main character of the apocryphal Book of Judith. She killed Holofernes, an invading Assyrian commander, by beheading him in his sleep....[more]

name: JUDY
meaning: Diminutive of JUDITH. A well-known bearer of this name was singer and actress Judy Garland (1922-1969).

name: JULES  (1)
meaning: French form of JULIUS. A notable bearer of this name was the French novelist Jules Verne (1828-1905), author of 'Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea' and other works of science fiction.

name: JULIA
meaning: Feminine form of the Roman family name JULIUS. Among the notable women from this family were Julia Augusta (also known as Livia Drusilla), the wife of Emperor Augustus, and Julia the Elder, the daughter of Augustus and the wife of Tiberius. A person by this name has a brief mention in the New Testament. It was also borne by a few early saints and martyrs, including the patron saint of Corsica. Additionally, Shakespeare used it in his comedy 'The Two Gentlemen of Verona' (1594)....[more]

name: JULIAN
meaning: From the Roman name Iulianus, which was derived from JULIUS. This was the name of the last pagan Roman emperor, Julian the Apostate (4th century). It was also borne by several early saints, including the legendary Saint Julian the Hospitaller. This name has been used in England since the Middle Ages, at which time it was also a feminine name (from Juliana, eventually becoming Gillian).

name: JULIANA
meaning: Feminine form of Iulianus (see JULIAN). This was the name of a 4th-century saint and martyr from Nicomedia, and also of the Blessed Juliana of Norwich, also called Julian, a 14th-century mystic and author. The name was also borne by a 20th-century queen of the Netherlands. In England, this form has been in use since the 18th century, alongside the older form Gillian.

name: JULIANE
meaning: German and French feminine form of JULIAN.

name: JULIE
meaning: French, Danish, Norwegian and Czech form of JULIA. It has spread to many other regions as well. It has been common in the English-speaking world since the early 20th century.

name: JULIENNE
meaning: French feminine form of Iulianus (see JULIAN).

name: JULIET
meaning: Anglicized form of JULIETTE or GIULIETTA. This spelling was first used by Shakespeare for the lover of Romeo in his play 'Romeo and Juliet' (1596).

name: JULIJA
meaning: Slovene, Croatian and Lithuanian form of JULIA.

name: JULIJANA
meaning: Slovene, Croatian, Serbian and Macedonian form of JULIANA.

name: JULITTA
meaning: Diminutive of JULIA. This was the name of a 4th-century saint who was martyred in Tarsus with her young son Quiricus.

name: JULIUS
meaning: From a Roman family name which was possibly derived from Greek ιουλος(ioulos) meaning "downy-bearded". Alternatively, it could be related to the name of the Roman god JUPITER. This was a prominent patrician family of Rome, who claimed descent from the mythological Julus, son of Aeneas. Its most notable member was Gaius Julius Caesar, who gained renown as a military leader for his clever conquest of Gaul. After a civil war he became the dictator of the Roman Republic, but was eventually stabbed to death in the senate....[more]

name: JULY
meaning: From the name of the month, which was originally named for Julius Caesar.

name: JUN  (1)
meaning: From Chinese 君(jūn) meaning "king, ruler", 俊(jùn) meaning "talented, handsome" (which is usually only masculine) or 军(jūn) meaning "army" (also usually only masculine). This is also a single-character Korean name, often from the hanja 俊 meaning "talented, handsome". This name can be formed by other characters besides those shown here.

name: JUN  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 淳(jun) meaning "pure", 潤(jun) meaning "moisture", 純(jun) meaning "pure, clean, simple", or other kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: JUN'ICHI
meaning: From Japanese 順(jun) meaning "obey, submit" or 淳(jun) meaning "pure" combined with 一(ichi) meaning "one". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: JUN-HO
meaning: From Sino-Korean 俊(jun) meaning "talented, handsome" combined with 鎬(ho) meaning "stove, bright" or 昊(ho) meaning "summer, sky, heaven". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: JUN-SEO
meaning: From Sino-Korean 俊(jun) meaning "talented, handsome" combined with 舒(seo) meaning "open up, unfold, comfortable, easy" or 瑞(seo) meaning "felicitous omen, auspicious". This name can be formed by other hanja character combinations as well.

name: JUNAYD
meaning: Means "small army", derived from Arabic جند(jund) "army, soldiers".

name: JUNE
meaning: From the name of the month, which was originally derived from the name of the Roman goddess Juno. It has been used as a given name since the 19th century.

name: JUNIA
meaning: Feminine form of JUNIUS. This was the name of an early Christian mentioned in the New Testament (there is some debate about whether the name belongs to a man or a woman).

name: JUNIOR
meaning: From a nickname which was originally used for a boy who had the same name as his father.

name: JUNIPER
meaning: From the English word for the type of tree, derived ultimately from Latin iuniperus.

name: JUNIUS
meaning: Roman family name which was possibly derived from the name of the Roman goddess JUNO. It was borne by Lucius Junius Brutus, the founder of the Roman Republic in the 6th century BC. It was also borne by the 1st-century BC Roman politician Marcus Junius Brutus, commonly known as Brutus, who was one of the assassins of Julius Caesar.

name: JUNKO
meaning: From Japanese 順(jun) meaning "obedience" or 純(jun) meaning "pure" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other combinations of kanji characters are also possible.

name: JUNO
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly related to an Indo-European root meaning "youth", or possibly of Etruscan origin. In Roman mythology Juno was the wife of Jupiter and the queen of the heavens. She was the protectress of marriage and women, and was also the goddess of finance.

name: JUNÍPERO
meaning: This was the name assumed by the 18th-century Spanish Franciscan monk Miguel José Serra, a missionary to California. He named himself after one of Saint Francis's companions, who was named from Latin iuniperus "juniper".

name: JUPITER
meaning: From Latin Iuppiter, which was ultimately derived from the Indo-European *Dyeu-pater, composed of the elements Dyeus (see ZEUS) and pater "father". Jupiter was the supreme god in Roman mythology. He presided over the heavens and light, and was responsible for the protection and laws of the Roman state. This is also the name of the fifth and largest planet in the solar system.

name: JURAJ
meaning: Croatian and Slovak form of GEORGE.

name: JURE
meaning: Slovene and Croatian form of GEORGE.

name: JURIAN
meaning: Medieval Low German form of GEORGE.

name: JURIJ
meaning: Slovene and Sorbian form of GEORGE.

name: JUSTICE
meaning: From an occupational surname which meant "judge, officer of justice" in Old French. This name can also be given in direct reference to the English word justice.

name: JUSTIN
meaning: From the Latin name Iustinus, which was derived from JUSTUS. This was the name of several early saints including Justin Martyr, a Christian philosopher of the 2nd century who was beheaded in Rome. It was also borne by two Byzantine emperors. As an English name, it has occasionally been used since the late Middle Ages, though it did not become common until the 20th century. Famous modern bearers include pop stars Justin Timberlake (1981-) and Justin Bieber (1994-).

name: JUSTINE
meaning: French feminine form of Iustinus (see JUSTIN). This is the name of the heroine in the novel 'Justine' (1791) by the Marquis de Sade.

name: JUSTINIAN
meaning: From the Latin name Iustinianus, which was derived from Iustinus (see JUSTIN). This was the name of a 6th-century Byzantine emperor who attempted to restore the borders of the Roman Empire.

name: JUSTUS
meaning: Latin name which meant "just". This name was borne by at least eight saints.

name: JUSTYNA
meaning: Polish feminine form of Iustinus (see JUSTIN).

name: JUSTÍNA
meaning: Slovak feminine form of Iustinus (see JUSTIN).

name: JUSTÝNA
meaning: Czech feminine form of Iustinus (see JUSTIN).

name: JUSUF
meaning: Bosnian and Indonesian form of YUSUF.

name: JUTTA
meaning: Probably a medieval Low German form of JUDITH. It might also derive from a Germanic name such as JUDDA.

name: JUTURNA
meaning: Meaning unknown. Juturna was the Roman goddess of fountains and springs. According to Virgil she was the sister of Turnus.

name: JUUROU
meaning: From Japanese 十(juu) meaning "ten" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". Traditionally this name was given to the tenth son. Other combinations of kanji characters are possible as well.

name: JUVENAL
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Iuvenalis which meant "youthful" in Latin. Juvenal was a Roman satirist of the 1st century.

name: JUVENTAS
meaning: Means "youth" in Latin. Juventas was the Roman goddess of youth, equivalent to the Greek goddess Hebe.

name: JYOTHI
meaning: Telugu and Malayalam form of JYOTI.

name: JYOTI
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit ज्योतिस्(jyotis) meaning "light". This is a transcription of both the feminine form ज्योती and the masculine form ज्योति.

name: JÁKOB
meaning: Hungarian variant form of JACOB (or JAMES).

name: JÓHANNES
meaning: Icelandic and Faroese form of JOHN.

name: JÓN
meaning: Icelandic and Faroese form of JOHN.

name: JØRG
meaning: Danish and Norwegian short form of JØRGEN.

name: JØRGEN
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of JÜRGEN.

name: JÚLIA
meaning: Portuguese, Catalan, Hungarian and Slovak form of JULIA.

name: JĘDRZEJ
meaning: An old Polish form of ANDREW.

name: K'AWIIL
meaning: Means "powerful" in Mayan. This is the name of the Maya god of lightning. He was sometimes depicted with one of his legs taking the form of a serpent.

name: KADEK
meaning: Possibly from Balinese adik meaning "younger sibling". This name is traditionally given to the second-born child.

name: KAEDE
meaning: From Japanese 楓(kaede) meaning "maple" or other kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: KAHINA
meaning: Derived from Arabic الكاهِنة(al-Kahinah) meaning "the diviner, the fortuneteller". This was a title applied to the 7th-century Berber queen Dihya, who resisted the Arab expansion into North Africa.

name: KAHURANGI
meaning: From the name of a type of green gemstone found in New Zealand, meaning "sky blue" in Maori.

name: KAI  (1)
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly a Frisian diminutive of GERHARD, NICOLAAS, CORNELIS or GAIUS.

name: KAI  (2)
meaning: Variant of KAJA(1). Note, this is primarily a masculine name in Sweden (see KAI(1)).

name: KAI  (4)
meaning: From Chinese 凯(kǎi) meaning "triumph, victory, music of triumph", as well as other characters pronounced in a similar way.

name: KAILASH
meaning: From the name of a mountain in the Himalayas which is believed to be the paradise of the Hindu god Shiva. It possibly means "crystal" in Sanskrit.

name: KAIMANA
meaning: From Hawaiian kai "ocean, sea" and mana "power". It is also Hawaiian meaning "diamond", derived from the English word diamond.

name: KAIN
meaning: Form of CAIN used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: KAINAN
meaning: Form of CAINAN used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: KAIPO
meaning: Means "the sweetheart" from Hawaiian ka, a definite article, and ipo "sweetheart".

name: KAISA
meaning: Finnish and Estonian diminutive of KATHERINE.

name: KAISER
meaning: German form of the Roman title Caesar (see CAESAR). It is not used as a given name in Germany itself.

name: KAITO
meaning: From Japanese 海(kai) meaning "sea, ocean" combined with 斗(to), which refers to a Chinese constellation, or 翔(to) meaning "soar, fly". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: KAJ  (2)
meaning: Variant of KAJA(1). Note, this is primarily a masculine name in Sweden (see KAJ(1)).

name: KAJAL
meaning: Means "kohl, collyrium, lotion for the eyes" in Sanskrit.

name: KAJETÁN
meaning: Czech, Slovak and Hungarian form of Caietanus (see GAETANO).

name: KALANI
meaning: Means "the heavens" from Hawaiian ka "the" and lani "heaven, sky, royal, majesty".

name: KALEO
meaning: Means "sound, voice" from Hawaiian ka "the" and leo "sound, voice".

name: KALEV  (1)
meaning: Estonian form of KALEVA. This was the name of a hero in Estonian mythology.

name: KALEVA
meaning: From the name of the mythological ancestor of the Finns, which is of unknown meaning. The name of the Finnish epic the 'Kalevala' means "the land of Kalevi".

name: KALI
meaning: Means "the black one" in Sanskrit. The Hindu goddess Kali is the fierce destructive form of the wife of Shiva. She is usually depicted with black skin and four arms, holding a severed head and brandishing a sword. As a personal name, it is generally masculine in India.

name: KALIDASA
meaning: Means "servant of Kali" from the name of the Hindu goddess KALI combined with Sanskrit दास(dasa) meaning "servant". This was the name of a 4th-century Indian poet and dramatist, the author of the 'Abhijnanashakuntalam'.

name: KALINA
meaning: Means "viburnum tree" in Bulgarian, Macedonian and Polish.

name: KALISHA
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix Ka and LISHA.

name: KALLE
meaning: Swedish and Finnish diminutive of KARL.

name: KALLIAS
meaning: Derived from Greek καλλος(kallos) meaning "beauty". This was the name of an Athenian who fought at Marathon who later became an ambassador to the Persians.

name: KALLIKRATES
meaning: Means "beautiful power", derived from the Greek elements καλλος(kallos) "beauty" and κρατος(kratos) "power".

name: KALLIOPE
meaning: Means "beautiful voice" from Greek καλλος(kallos) "beauty" and οψ(ops) "voice". In Greek mythology she was a goddess of epic poetry and eloquence, one of the nine Muses.

name: KALLISTO
meaning: Derived from Greek καλλιστος(kallistos) meaning "most beautiful", a derivative of καλος(kalos) "beautiful". In Greek mythology Kallisto was a nymph who was loved by Zeus. She was changed into a she-bear by Hera, and subsequently became the Great Bear constellation. This was also an ancient Greek personal name.

name: KALLISTRATE
meaning: Means "beautiful army" from the Greek elements καλλος(kallos) "beauty" and στρατος(stratos) "army".

name: KALOYAN
meaning: From Greek καλος Ιωαννης(kalos Ioannes) meaning "handsome JOHN", the nickname of a 13th-century emperor of Bulgaria. He successfully defended the empire from the Fourth Crusade.

name: KALYANI
meaning: Means "beautiful, lovely, auspicious" in Sanskrit. In the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' this is the name of one of the Krittikas, or Pleiades. It is also another name of the Hindu goddess Parvati.

name: KALYNA
meaning: From the Ukrainian word for a type of shrub, also called the guelder rose.

name: KAMA
meaning: Means "love, desire" in Sanskrit. Kama is the winged Hindu god of love, the son of Lakshmi.

name: KAMAKSHI
meaning: From Sanskrit काम(kama) meaning "love, desire" and अक्षि(akshi) meaning "eye". This is the name of a Hindu fertility goddess. She is considered to be an incarnation of Parvati.

name: KAMALA
meaning: Means "lotus" or "pale red" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the feminine form कमला and the masculine form कमल. This is the name of one of the Krittikas, or Pleiades, in Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata'. It is also another name of the Hindu goddess Lakshmi.

name: KAMALANI
meaning: Means "heavenly child" or "royal child" from Hawaiian kama "child" and lani "heaven, sky, royal, majesty".

name: KAMARIA
meaning: Swahili name, likely related to QAMAR.

name: KAMEN
meaning: Means "stone" in Bulgarian. This is a translation of the Greek name Petros.

name: KAMIL  (2)
meaning: Czech, Slovak and Polish form of CAMILLUS.

name: KAMILA
meaning: Czech, Slovak and Polish form of CAMILLA.

name: KAMILLA
meaning: Hungarian form of CAMILLA, as well as a Scandinavian variant. This is also the Hungarian word for the chamomile flower (species Matricaria chamomilla).

name: KANEONUSKATEW
meaning: Means "one that walks on four claws" in Cree. This was the name of a 19th-century Cree chief.

name: KANON
meaning: From Japanese 花(ka) meaning "flower, blossom" and 音(non) meaning "sound". Other kanji combinations are possible as well.

name: KANTA
meaning: Means "desired, beautiful" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the feminine form कान्ता and the masculine form कान्त.

name: KANTI
meaning: Means "beauty" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the feminine form कान्ती (another name of the Hindu goddess Lakshmi) and the masculine form कान्ति.

name: KANTUTA
meaning: Means "cantua flower" in Aymara (species Cantua buxifolia).

name: KAOLIN
meaning: Anglicized form of CAOLÁN. This is also the name of a type of clay.

name: KAORI
meaning: From Japanese 香(kaori) meaning "fragrance". It can also come from an alternate reading of 香(ka) combined with 織(ori) meaning "weaving". Other kanji combinations are possible. It is often written using the hiragana writing system.

name: KAORU
meaning: From Japanese 薫(kaoru), 香(kaoru), 馨(kaoru) all meaning "fragrance, fragrant", as well as other kanji having the same reading.

name: KAPILA
meaning: Means "reddish brown" in Sanskrit, derived from कपि(kapi) "monkey". In the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' this is the name of a sage who founded Samkhya philosophy and is identified with the god Vishnu.

name: KAPONO
meaning: Means "the good one" from Hawaiian ka, a definite article, and pono "good, moral".

name: KAPUA
meaning: Means "the flower" or "the child" from Hawaiian ka, a definite article, and pua "flower, offspring".

name: KAREEM
meaning: Variant transcription of KARIM. A famous bearer of this name is basketball player Kareem Abdul-Jabbar (1947-).

name: KAREL
meaning: Dutch, Czech and Slovene form of CHARLES.

name: KAREN  (1)
meaning: Danish short form of KATHERINE. It became common in the English-speaking world after the 1930s.

name: KAREN  (3)
meaning: From Japanese 華(ka) meaning "flower" and 蓮(ren) meaning "lotus, water lily". Other combinations of kanji can also form this name.

name: KARENA
meaning: Elaboration of KAREN(1), possibly influenced by CARINA(1).

name: KARESINDA
meaning: Means "worthy of a caress" in Esperanto.

name: KARIM
meaning: Means "generous, noble" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الكريم(al-Karim) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: KARINE  (1)
meaning: French form of CARINA(1). It can also function as a short form of CATHERINE, via Swedish Karin.

name: KARL
meaning: German and Scandinavian form of CHARLES. This was the name of seven emperors of the Holy Roman Empire and an emperor of Austria, as well as kings of Sweden and Norway. Other famous bearers include Karl Marx (1818-1883), the German philosopher and revolutionary who laid the foundations for communism, and Karl Jaspers (1883-1969), a German existentialist philosopher.

name: KARLA
meaning: German, Scandinavian and Croatian feminine form of CHARLES.

name: KARMA
meaning: From the Sanskrit word कर्म(karma) meaning "action, deed, fate".

name: KARMEN
meaning: Slovene and Croatian form of CARMEN.

name: KARNA
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit कर्ण(karna) meaning "ear". This is the name of the son of the Hindu sun god Surya and the goddess Kunti, who gave birth to him through her ear. He was a great warrior who joined the Kauravas to fight against his half-brothers the Pandavas, eventually becoming the king of Anga.

name: KAROL
meaning: Polish, Slovak and Slovene form of KARL.

name: KAROLA
meaning: Hungarian and German feminine form of CAROLUS.

name: KARTHIKA
meaning: Southern Indian feminine form of KARTIK.

name: KARTIK
meaning: From Sanskrit कृत्तिका(krittika), the name for the constellation of the Pleiades.

name: KARTIKEYA
meaning: From Sanskrit कृत्तिका(krittika), the name for the constellation of the Pleiades, ultimately from कृत्(krit) meaning "to cut, to divide". This is another name for the Hindu god Skanda.

name: KASANDRA
meaning: English variant and Polish form of CASSANDRA.

name: KASHI
meaning: From the name of a holy city in India, famous for its many temples dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva. Its name is derived from Sanskrit काशि(kashi) meaning "shining".

name: KASPER
meaning: Dutch and Scandinavian form of JASPER.

name: KASSANDRA
meaning: Greek form of CASSANDRA, as well as a modern English variant.

name: KASUMI
meaning: From Japanese 霞(kasumi) meaning "mist". It can also come from 花(ka) meaning "flower, blossom" combined with 澄(sumi) meaning "clear, pure". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: KATA
meaning: Hungarian short form of KATALIN, Finnish short form of KATARIINA and Croatian short form of KATARINA.

name: KATALIN
meaning: Hungarian and Basque form of KATHERINE.

name: KATARIINA
meaning: Finnish and Estonian form of KATHERINE.

name: KATASHI
meaning: From Japanese 堅(katashi) meaning "hard, firm" or other kanji and kanji combinations which are pronounced the same way.

name: KATAYUN
meaning: Possibly from the Persian elements kata "house, city" (but also "king, lord") and bânu "wife".

name: KATE
meaning: Diminutive of KATHERINE, often used independently. It has been used in England since the Middle Ages. This was the name of the woman who Petruchio marries and tries to tame in Shakespeare's comedy 'Taming of the Shrew' (1593). A famous bearer is the British actress Kate Winslet (1975-).

name: KATELIJN
meaning: Dutch form of KATHERINE, used especially in Flanders.

name: KATELIJNE
meaning: Dutch form of KATHERINE, used especially in Flanders.

name: KATERI
meaning: From the Mohawk pronunciation of KATHERINE. This was the name adopted by the 17th-century Mohawk woman Tekakwitha upon her baptism. She has been beatified by the Catholic Church.

name: KATERINA
meaning: Macedonian form of KATHERINE, a Russian short form of YEKATERINA, a Bulgarian short form of EKATERINA, and a Greek variant of AIKATERINE.

name: KATHARINE
meaning: English variant of KATHERINE and German variant of KATHARINA. A famous bearer was American actress Katharine Hepburn (1907-2003).

name: KATHERINA
meaning: Latinate form of KATHERINE. Shakespeare used this name in his play 'Taming of the Shrew' (1593).

name: KATHERINE
meaning: From the Greek name Αικατερινη(Aikaterine). The etymology is debated: it could derive from the earlier Greek name ‘Εκατερινη(Hekaterine), which came from ‘εκατερος(hekateros) "each of the two"; it could derive from the name of the goddess HECATE; it could be related to Greek αικια(aikia) "torture"; or it could be from a Coptic name meaning "my consecration of your name". In the early Christian era it became associated with Greek καθαρος(katharos) "pure", and the Latin spelling was changed from Katerina to Katharina to reflect this....[more]

name: KATHRINE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of KATHERINE.

name: KATI
meaning: Finnish and Estonian diminutive of KATARIINA and a Hungarian diminutive of KATALIN.

name: KATIA
meaning: Italian diminutive of CATERINA, as well as a variant transcription of KATYA.

name: KATICA
meaning: Croatian, Slovene and Hungarian diminutive of KATHERINE.

name: KATINA
meaning: Greek and Macedonian contracted form of KATERINA. This name had a spike in popularity in America in 1972 when it was used for a newborn baby on the soap opera 'Where the Heart Is'.

name: KATINKA
meaning: German diminutive of KATHARINA, a Hungarian diminutive of KATALIN and a Dutch diminutive of CATHARINA.

name: KATRIN
meaning: German, Swedish and Estonian short form of KATHERINE.

name: KATRINA
meaning: Variant of CATRIONA. It is also a German, Swedish and Dutch contracted form of KATHERINE.

name: KATRINE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of KATHERINE.

name: KATSU
meaning: From Japanese 勝(katsu) meaning "victory", as well as other kanji having the same pronunciation.

name: KATSUO
meaning: From Japanese 勝(katsu) meaning "victory" and 雄(o) meaning "hero, manly". Other combinations of kanji are also possible.

name: KATSUROU
meaning: From Japanese 勝(katsu) meaning "victory" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". Different kanji characters can combine to form this name as well.

name: KAUI
meaning: Means "the youthful one" from Hawaiian ka, a definite article, and u'i "youth, beauty".

name: KAUR
meaning: Means "princess", ultimately from Sanskrit कुमारी(kumari) meaning "girl". This surname was assigned to all female Sikhs in 1699 by Guru Gobind Singh. It is now used as a surname or a middle name by most female Sikhs. The male equivalent is Singh.

name: KAURI
meaning: From the name of a type of tree found in New Zealand (species Agathis australis).

name: KAUSALYA
