meaning: Means "of the Kosala people" in Sanskrit. Kosala was an ancient Indian kingdom that was at its most powerful in the 6th century BC. In Hindu legend Kausalya is the name of the mother of the hero Rama.

name: KAVEH
meaning: Possibly means "royal" in Avestan. In Persian mythology Kaveh is a blacksmith who leads a rebellion against the evil ruler Zahhak.

name: KAVERI
meaning: From the name of the Kaveri River in southern India.

name: KAVI
meaning: From a title for a a poet, meaning "wise man, sage, poet" in Sanskrit.

name: KAWACATOOSE
meaning: Means "poor man" or "lean man" in Cree. This was the name of a 19th-century Cree chief.

name: KAWEHI
meaning: Means "the adornment" from Hawaiian ka, a definite article, and wehi "adornment".

name: KAWISENHAWE
meaning: Means "she holds the ice" in Mohawk.

name: KAY  (1)
meaning: Short form of KATHERINE and other names beginning with K.

name: KAY  (2)
meaning: From the Welsh name Cai or Cei, possibly a form of the Roman name GAIUS. Sir Kay was one of the Knights of the Round Table in Arthurian legend. He first appears in Welsh tales as a brave companion of Arthur. In later medieval tales, notably those by the 12th-century French poet Chrétien de Troyes, he is portrayed as an unrefined boor.

name: KAYLA
meaning: Combination of KAY(1) and the popular name suffix la. Use of the name was greatly increased in the 1980s after the character Kayla Brady began appearing on the American soap opera 'Days of Our Lives'.

name: KAYLEE
meaning: Combination of KAY(1) and the popular name suffix lee.

name: KAYLEEN
meaning: Combination of KAY(1) and the popular name suffix leen.

name: KAYLEIGH
meaning: Variant of KAYLEE. This is also a common Anglicized form of the Gaelic word ceilidh, a traditional social gathering and dance.

name: KAYLYN
meaning: Combination of KAY(1) and the popular name suffix lyn.

name: KAZIMÍR
meaning: Czech, Slovak and Hungarian form of CASIMIR.

name: KAZUE
meaning: From Japanese 和(kazu) meaning "harmony, peace" or 一(kazu) meaning "one" combined with 枝(e) meaning "branch" or 恵(e) meaning "favour, benefit". Other combinations of kanji characters can potentially form this name.

name: KAZUKI
meaning: From Japanese 一(kazu) meaning "one" or 和(kazu) meaning "harmony, peace" combined with 輝(ki) meaning "brightness", 希(ki) meaning "hope" or 樹(ki) meaning "tree", as well as other combinations of kanji characters.

name: KAZUKO
meaning: From Japanese 一(kazu) meaning "one" or 和(kazu) meaning "harmony, peace" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". This name can also be formed from other kanji combinations.

name: KAZUO
meaning: From Japanese 一(kazu) meaning "one" or 和(kazu) meaning "harmony, peace" combined with 男(o) meaning "male, man" or 夫(o) meaning "husband, man". Other kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: KAĞAN
meaning: From a Turkish title meaning "king, ruler", ultimately of Mongolian origin. The title is usually translated into English as Khan.

name: KEAHI
meaning: Means "the fire" from Hawaiian ke, a definite article, and ahi "fire".

name: KEALA
meaning: Means "the path" from Hawaiian ke, a definite article, and ala "path".

name: KEALOHA
meaning: Means "the loved one" from Hawaiian ke, a definite article, and aloha "love".

name: KEANNA
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix Ke and ANNA.

name: KEANU
meaning: Means "the cool breeze" from Hawaiian ke, a definite article, and anu "coolness". This name is now associated with Canadian actor Keanu Reeves (1964-).

name: KEATON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "shed town" in Old English.

name: KEEFE
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Caoimh meaning "descendant of CAOMH".

name: KEEGAN
meaning: From an Irish surname, the Anglicized form of the Gaelic Mac Aodhagáin, which means "descendant of Aodhagán". The given name Aodhagán is a double diminutive of AODH.

name: KEELAN
meaning: Anglicized form of CAOILFHIONN, sometimes used as a masculine name.

name: KEELY
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Caolaidhe meaning "descendant of Caoladhe". The given name Caoladhe is derived from the Gaelic word caol "slender".

name: KEES
meaning: Dutch diminutive of CORNELIS. A notable bearer was the Dutch painter Kees van Dongen (1877-1968).

name: KEIGHLEY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from an English place name, ultimately meaning "clearing belonging to Cyhha". The Old English given name Cyhha is of unknown meaning. This name also serves as a variant of KAYLEE.

name: KEIKO
meaning: From Japanese 慶(kei) meaning "celebrate", 敬(kei) meaning "respect", 啓(kei) meaning "open, begin" or 恵(kei) meaning "favour, benefit" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: KEIR
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of KERR.

name: KEIRA
meaning: Variant of CIARA(1). This spelling was popularized by British actress Keira Knightley (1985-).

name: KEISHA
meaning: Recent coinage, possibly invented, possibly based on KEZIAH.

name: KEITH
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was originally derived from a place name, itself probably derived from the Brythonic element cet meaning "wood". This was the surname of a long line of Scottish nobles. It has been used as a given name since the 19th century.

name: KEKOA
meaning: Means "the warrior" from Hawaiian ke, a definite article, and koa "warrior, koa tree".

name: KELDA
meaning: Possibly derived from Old Norse kildr meaning "a spring".

name: KELIA
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps an invented name.

name: KELLY
meaning: Anglicized form of the Irish given name CEALLACH or the surname derived from it Ó Ceallaigh. As a surname, it has been borne by actor and dancer Gene Kelly (1912-1996) and actress and princess Grace Kelly (1929-1982).

name: KELSEY
meaning: From an English surname which is derived from town names in Lincolnshire. It may mean "Cenel's island", from the Old English name Cenel "fierce" in combination with eg "island".

name: KELVIN
meaning: From the name of a Scottish river, perhaps meaning "narrow water". As a title it was borne by the Irish-Scottish physicist William Thomson, Lord Kelvin (1824-1907), who acquired his title from the river.

name: KEMAL
meaning: Turkish form of KAMAL(1). This was the second name, acquired in his youth, of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk (1881-1938), the founder of modern Turkey.

name: KEMP
meaning: From a surname derived from Middle English kempe meaning "champion, athlete, warrior".

name: KEMUEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name קְמוּאֵל(Qemu'el) meaning "raised by God". This is the name of a nephew of Abraham in the Old Testament.

name: KEN  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 健(ken) meaning "healthy, strong" or other kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: KEN'ICHI
meaning: From Japanese 健(ken) meaning "healthy, strong" or 研(ken) meaning "study, sharpen" combined with 一(ichi) meaning "one". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: KENAN
meaning: Possibly means "possession" in Hebrew. He is a son of Enosh and a great-grandson of Adam in the Old Testament.

name: KENANIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH establishes" in Hebrew. This was the name of two minor Old Testament characters.

name: KENDAL
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of KENDALL.

name: KENDALL
meaning: From a surname which comes from the name of the city of Kendale in northwest England meaning "valley on the river Kent".

name: KENDRA
meaning: Feminine form of KEN(1) or KENDRICK.

name: KENDRICK
meaning: From a surname which has several different origins. It could be from the Old English given names Cyneric "royal power" or Cenric "bold power", or from the Welsh name Cynwrig "chief hero". It can also be an Anglicized form of the Gaelic surname Mac Eanraig meaning "son of HENRY".

name: KENELM
meaning: From the Old English name Cenhelm, which was composed of the elements cene "bold, keen" and helm "helmet". Saint Kenelm was a 9th-century martyr from Mercia, where he was a member of the royal family. The name was occasionally used during the Middle Ages, but has since become rare.

name: KENJI
meaning: From Japanese 研(ken) meaning "study, sharpen" and 二(ji) meaning "two", as well as other combinations of kanji characters.

name: KENNARD
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the Old English given names CYNEWEARD or CYNEHEARD.

name: KENNEDY
meaning: From an irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Cinnéidigh meaning "descendant of CENNÉTIG". The name is often given in honour of assassinated American president John F. Kennedy (1917-1963).

name: KENNETH
meaning: Anglicized form of both COINNEACH and CINÁED. This name was borne by the Scottish king Kenneth (Cináed) mac Alpin, who united the Scots and Picts in the 9th century. It was popularized outside of Scotland by Sir Walter Scott, who used it for the hero in his novel 'The Talisman' (1825). A famous bearer was the British novelist Kenneth Grahame (1859-1932), who wrote 'The Wind in the Willows'.

name: KENSHIN
meaning: From Japanese 謙(ken) meaning "humble, modest" and 信(shin) meaning "trust, believe". Other kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: KENT
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from Kent, the name of a county in England, which may be derived from a Brythonic word meaning "coastal district".

name: KENTA
meaning: From Japanese 健(ken) meaning "healthy, strong" and 太(ta) meaning "thick, big", as well as other kanji combinations having the same pronunciation.

name: KENTIGERN
meaning: Possibly means "chief lord" in Gaelic. This was the name of a 6th-century saint from Glasgow.

name: KENTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from an English place name meaning either "town on the River Kenn" or "royal town" in Old English.

name: KENYA
meaning: From the name of the African country. The country is named for Mount Kenya, which in the Kikuyu language is called Kĩrĩnyaga meaning "the one having stripes". It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since the 1960s.

name: KENYON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from an English place name, of uncertain meaning.

name: KEONE
meaning: Means "the homeland" from Hawaiian ke, a definite article, and one "sand, homeland".

name: KEREN
meaning: Means "horn" or "ray of light" in Hebrew.

name: KEREN-HAPPUCH
meaning: Means "horn of antimony" in Hebrew. Antimony is a substance that was formerly used as an eye cosmetic (eyeshadow). A hollowed animal horn could have been used to store this material. Keren-Happuch is the name of the third daughter of Job in the Old Testament.

name: KERMIT
meaning: From a Manx surname, a variant of the Irish surname MacDermott meaning "son of DIARMAID". Theodore Roosevelt used it for one of his sons. The name is now associated with Kermit the Frog, one of the Muppets created by puppeteer Jim Henson.

name: KERR
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from a place name meaning "rough wet ground" in Old Norse.

name: KERRY
meaning: From the name of the Irish county, called Ciarraí in Irish Gaelic, which means "CIAR's people".

name: KESHAUN
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix Ke and SHAUN.

name: KESHAWN
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix Ke and SHAWN.

name: KESTREL
meaning: From the name of the bird of prey, ultimately derived from Old French crecelle "rattle", which refers to the sound of its cry.

name: KETEVAN
meaning: Georgian form of KATAYUN. It is sometimes used as a Georgian form of KATHERINE.

name: KETIL
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ketill meaning "kettle, cauldron" (later also acquiring the meaning "helmet"). In old Scandinavian rituals the ketill was used to catch the blood of sacrificed animals.

name: KETURAH
meaning: Means "incense" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament she is Abraham's wife after Sarah dies.

name: KETUT
meaning: Possibly from a Balinese word meaning "small banana". This name is traditionally given to the fourth child.

name: KEVIN
meaning: Anglicized form of the Irish name Caoimhín, derived from the older Irish Cóemgein, composed of the Old Irish elements cóem "kind, gentle, handsome" and gein "birth". Saint Caoimhín established a monastery in Glendalough, Ireland in the 6th century and is the patron saint of Dublin. It became popular in the English-speaking world outside of Ireland in the 20th century.

name: KEVYN
meaning: Variant or feminine form of KEVIN.

name: KEZIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name קְצִיעָה(Qetzi'ah) meaning "cassia, cinnamon", from the name of the spice tree. In the Old Testament she is a daughter of Job.

name: KHACHATUR
meaning: Means "given by the cross" in Armenian.

name: KHADIGA
meaning: Variant transcription of KHADIJA. This corresponds more closely with the Egyptian Arabic pronunciation of the name.

name: KHADIJA
meaning: Means "premature child" in Arabic. This was the name of the Prophet Muhammad's first wife and the mother of all of his children. She was a wealthy merchant and a widow when they married in the year 595. Muhammad received his first revelation 15 years after their marriage, and she was the first person to convert to Islam.

name: KHADIJAH
meaning: Variant transcription of KHADIJA, as well as the usual Malay form.

name: KHALEESI
meaning: From a title used in the George R. R. Martin book series 'A Song of Ice and Fire' (first published 1996) and the television adaption 'Game of Thrones' (2011-). It is a feminine form of the Dothraki title khal meaning "warlord". In the series Daenerys Targaryen gains this title after she marries Khal Drogo.

name: KHALID
meaning: Means "eternal", derived from Arabic خلد(khalada) meaning "to last forever". This name was borne by a 7th-century Islamic military leader, Khalid ibn al-Walid.

name: KHALIFA
meaning: Means "successor, caliph" in Arabic. The title caliph was given to the successors of the Prophet Muhammad, originally elected by the Islamic populace.

name: KHALIQ
meaning: Means "creator" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الخليق(al-Khaliq) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: KHAN
meaning: From a title meaning "king, ruler". Its origin is probably Mongolian, though the word has been transmitted into many other languages.

name: KHANPASHA
meaning: Derived from the Turkic title Khan which means "ruler, leader" combined with the high Ottoman military rank pasha.

name: KHAVA
meaning: Chechen and Ingush form of EVE.

name: KHAYRAT
meaning: Means "good deeds" in Arabic, plural of خيرة(khayrah).

name: KHAYYAM
meaning: Means "tent maker" in Arabic. This was the surname of the 12th-century Persian poet Omar Khayyam.

name: KHODADAD
meaning: Means "God given" from Persian خدا(khoda) "god, lord" and داد(dad) "gave".

name: KHORDAD
meaning: Modern Persian form of HAURVATAT. This is the name of the third month in the Iranian calendar.

name: KHULAN
meaning: Means "onager, wild donkey" in Mongolian. This was the name of a wife of Genghis Khan.

name: KHURSHID
meaning: Modern Persian form of Avestan Hvare Khshaeta meaning "shining sun". In Zoroastrianism this was the name of a Yazata (or angel) who was associated with the sun.

name: KHUSHI
meaning: Means "happiness" in Hindi, ultimately from Persian خوشی(khushi).

name: KHWAJA
meaning: From a title meaning "master, owner" in Persian. It is not generally used as a name itself.

name: KIAN  (1)
meaning: Means "king, foundation, symbol of pride" in Persian.

name: KIARA
meaning: Variant of CIARA(1) or CHIARA. This name first became used in 1988 after the singing duo Kiara released their song 'This Time'. It was further popularized by a character in the animated movie 'The Lion King II' (1998).

name: KICHIROU
meaning: From Japanese 吉(kichi) meaning "good luck" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: KIEFER
meaning: From a German surname meaning either "pine tree" or "barrel maker".

name: KIELO
meaning: Means "lily of the valley" in Finnish.

name: KIERRA
meaning: Variant of KIARA influenced by the spelling of SIERRA.

name: KIKI
meaning: Diminutive of names beginning with or containing the sound K.

name: KIKU
meaning: From Japanese 菊(kiku) meaning "chrysanthemum", as well as other kanji characters which are pronounced the same way.

name: KILIAN
meaning: German form and Irish and French variant of CILLIAN.

name: KILLIAN
meaning: Anglicized variant of CILLIAN, also used in France.

name: KIM  (1)
meaning: At the present it is usually considered a short form of KIMBERLY, but it in fact predates it as a given name. The author Rudyard Kipling used it for the title hero of his novel 'Kim' (1901), though in this case it was short for KIMBALL. In her novel 'Show Boat' (1926) Edna Ferber used it for a female character who was born on the Mississippi River and was named from the initials of the states Kentucky, Illinois and Mississippi. The name was popularized in America by the actresses Kim Hunter (1922-2002) and Kim Novak (1933-), both of whom assumed it as a stage name.

name: KIMBALL
meaning: From a surname which was derived from either the Welsh given name CYNBEL or the Old English given name CYNEBALD.

name: KIMBERLY
meaning: From the name of the city of Kimberley in South Africa, which was named after Lord KIMBERLEY (1826-1902). The city came to prominence in the late 19th century during the Boer War. Kimberly has been used as a given name since the mid-20th century, eventually becoming very popular as a feminine name.

name: KIMIKO
meaning: From Japanese 貴(ki) meaning "valuable" with 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" or 君(kimi) meaning "lord, noble" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: KINCSŐ
meaning: Derived from Hungarian kincs "treasure". This name was created by Hungarian author Mór Jókai in 'The Novel of the Next Century' (1872).

name: KING
meaning: From a nickname which derives from the English word king, ultimately from Old English cyning.

name: KINGA
meaning: Polish and Hungarian diminutive of KUNIGUNDE.

name: KINGSLEY
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "king's wood" in Old English.

name: KINGSTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "king's town" in Old English.

name: KINLEY
meaning: From a surname which was an Anglicized form of Mac Fhionnlaigh meaning "son of FIONNLAGH".

name: KINNERET
meaning: From the name of the large lake in northern Israel, usually called the Sea of Galilee in English. Its name is derived from Hebrew כִּנּוֹר(kinnor) meaning "harp" because of its shape.

name: KINSLEY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name CYNESIGE.

name: KIP
meaning: From a nickname, probably from the English word kipper meaning "male salmon".

name: KIPLING
meaning: From an English surname which was from a place name meaning "Cybbel's cottage". The surname was borne by Rudyard Kipling (1865-1936), a British novelist born in India who wrote 'The Jungle Book' and other works.

name: KIRAN
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit किरण(kirana) which can mean "dust" or "thread" or "sunbeam".

name: KIRBY
meaning: From an English surname which was originally from a place name meaning "church settlement" in Old Norse.

name: KIRI
meaning: Means "skin of a tree or fruit" in Maori. This name has been brought to public attention by New Zealand opera singer Kiri Te Kanawa (1944-).

name: KIRIL
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of CYRIL.

name: KIRK
meaning: From an English and Scottish surname meaning "church" from Old Norse kirkja, ultimately from Greek. A famous bearer was American actor Kirk Douglas (1916-), whose birth name was Issur Danielovitch.

name: KIRSI
meaning: Finnish form of CHRISTINA, or a short form of KIRSIKKA. It also means "frost" in Finnish.

name: KIRSTEN
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of CHRISTINA.

name: KIRTIDA
meaning: Means "one who bestows fame" in Sanskrit.

name: KISECAWCHUCK
meaning: Means "daystar" in Cree. This was the name of a 19th-century Cree chief.

name: KISMET
meaning: Means "fate" in Turkish, ultimately from Arabic.

name: KIT
meaning: Diminutive of CHRISTOPHER or KATHERINE. A notable bearer was Kit Carson (1809-1868), an American frontiersman and explorer.

name: KIYOKO
meaning: From Japanese 清(kiyo) meaning "clear, pure, clean" or 聖(kiyo) meaning "holy" and 子(ko) meaning "child". This name can also be formed from other combinations of kanji characters.

name: KIYOSHI
meaning: From Japanese 清(kiyoshi) or 淳(kiyoshi) both meaning "pure". Other kanji or kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: KIZZY
meaning: Diminutive of KEZIAH. This particular spelling was repopularized in the late 1970s by a character in the book and miniseries 'Roots'.

name: KJELLFRID
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ketilriðr, derived from the elements ketill meaning "kettle" and fríðr meaning "beautiful".

name: KJERSTIN
meaning: Swedish and Norwegian and Swedish form of CHRISTINA.

name: KLAAS
meaning: Dutch and Low German short form of NICHOLAS.

name: KLAUDIA
meaning: Polish and Slovak feminine form of CLAUDIUS.

name: KLAVDIYA
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian and Bulgarian feminine form of CLAUDIUS.

name: KLEIO
meaning: Derived from Greek κλεος(kleos) meaning "glory". In Greek mythology she was the goddess of history and heroic poetry, one of the nine Muses. She was said to have introduced the alphabet to Greece.

name: KLEITOS
meaning: Means "splendid, famous" in Greek. This was the name of one of the generals of Alexander the Great.

name: KLEMENS
meaning: German, Danish, Swedish and Polish form of Clemens (see CLEMENT). Prince Klemens Metternich was a 19th-century Austrian chancellor who guided the Austrian Empire to victory in the Napoleonic Wars.

name: KLEMENT
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of Clemens (see CLEMENT).

name: KLEMENTINA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian form of CLEMENTINA.

name: KLIMENT
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian, Bulgarian and Macedonian form of Clemens (see CLEMENT).

name: KLOPAS
meaning: Form of CLOPAS used in the Greek New Testament.

name: KLOTHO
meaning: Means "spinner" in Greek. In Greek mythology Klotho was one of the three Fates or Μοιραι (Moirai). She was responsible for spinning the thread of life.

name: KLYTIË
meaning: Derived from Greek κλυτος(klytos) meaning "famous, noble". In Greek myth Klytië was an ocean nymph who loved the sun god Helios. Her love was not returned, and she pined away staring at him until she was transformed into a heliotrope flower, whose head moves to follow the sun.

name: KLÁRA
meaning: Hungarian, Czech and Slovak form of CLARA.

name: KNOX
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from Old English cnocc "round hill".

name: KNUT
meaning: Derived from Old Norse knútr meaning "knot". Knut was a Danish prince who defeated Æðelræd II, king of England, in the early 11th century and became the ruler of Denmark, Norway and England.

name: KOBE  (2)
meaning: From the name of the city in Japan. The parents of basketball player Kobe Bryant (1978-) chose this name after seeing Kobe beef (which is from the Japanese city) on a menu.

name: KOHARU
meaning: From Japanese 小(ko) meaning "small" or 心(ko) meaning "heart" combined with 春(haru) meaning "spring". The compound word 小春 means "late summer". Other combinations of kanji characters can form this name as well.

name: KOHINOOR
meaning: From Koh-i-noor, the name of a famous gemstone, meaning "mountain of light" in Persian.

name: KOIOS
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek κοιος(koios), also spelled ποιος(poios), a questioning word meaning approximately "of what kind?". This was the name of a Titan god of intelligence in Greek mythology.

name: KOKORO
meaning: From Japanese 心(kokoro) meaning "heart, mind, soul" or other kanji and kanji combinations having the same pronunciation. It is often written using the hiragana writing system.

name: KOLOMAN
meaning: German and Slovak form of COLMÁN. Saint Koloman (also called Coloman or Colman) was an Irish monk who was martyred in Stockerau in Austria.

name: KOMANG
meaning: Meaning unknown. This name is traditionally given to the third-born child in Balinese families.

name: KONDWANI
meaning: Means "be happy, rejoice" in Chewa and Tumbuka.

name: KONRAD
meaning: German, Scandinavian, Polish and Slovene form of CONRAD.

name: KONRÁD
meaning: Hungarian, Czech and Slovak form of CONRAD.

name: KONSTANTINA
meaning: Greek feminine form of Constantinus (see CONSTANTINE).

name: KOPPÁNY
meaning: Possibly of Turkic origin meaning "great, tall".

name: KORALIA
meaning: Derived from Ancient Greek κοραλλιον(korallion) meaning "coral" (in Modern Greek κοραλλι). This was the name of an obscure 4th-century saint and martyr from Thrace.

name: KORALJKA
meaning: From Croatian koralj meaning "coral", ultimately from Latin.

name: KORBINIAN
meaning: Derived from Latin corvus meaning "raven". This was the name of an 8th-century Frankish saint who was sent by Pope Gregory II to evangelize in Bavaria. His real name may have been Hraban (see Raban).

name: KORE
meaning: Means "maiden" in Greek. This was another name for the Greek goddess Persephone.

name: KORESH
meaning: Form of CYRUS used in the Hebrew Bible.

name: KORNEL
meaning: Polish, Czech and Slovak form of CORNELIUS.

name: KORNELIA
meaning: German and Polish form of CORNELIA.

name: KORNELIJA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of CORNELIA.

name: KORNÉLIA
meaning: Hungarian and Slovak form of CORNELIA.

name: KOSTADIN
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian variant of KONSTANTIN.

name: KOTONE
meaning: From Japanese 琴(koto), which refers to a type of musical instrument similar to a harp, combined with 音(ne) meaning "sound". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: KOUKI
meaning: From Japanese 光(kou) meaning "light" or 幸(kou) meaning "happiness, good luck" combined with 希(ki) meaning "hope" or 輝(ki) meaning "brightness". This name can be formed from other combinations of kanji characters as well.

name: KOUTA
meaning: From Japanese 康(kou) meaning "peace" and 太(ta) meaning "thick, big". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: KRASIMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements krasa "beauty, adornment" and miru "peace, world".

name: KRASTYO
meaning: Derived from Bulgarian кръст(krast) meaning "cross". This is a translation of the Greek name Stavros.

name: KREIOS
meaning: Possibly derived from either Greek κρειων(kreion) "lord, master" or κριος(krios) "ram, male sheep". This was the name of a Titan in Greek mythology.

name: KREKA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Turkic or Germanic origin. This name was borne by the most powerful of Attila's wives.

name: KRESKES
meaning: Form of CRESCENS used in the Greek New Testament.

name: KREŠIMIR
meaning: From the Slavic elements kresu "spark, light, rouse" and miru "peace, world". This was the name of four kings of Croatia.

name: KRIEMHILD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements grim "mask" and hild "battle". Kriemhild was a beautiful heroine in the Germanic saga the 'Nibelungenlied', where she is the sister of Günther and the wife of Siegfried. After her husband is killed by Hagen with the consent of Günther, Kriemhild tragically exacts her revenge.

name: KRIS
meaning: Short form of KRISTIAN, KRISTOFFER, and other names beginning with Kris.

name: KRISHNA
meaning: Means "black, dark" in Sanskrit. This is the name of a Hindu god believed to be an incarnation of the god Vishnu. He was the youngest of King Vasudeva's eight children, six of whom were killed by King Kamsa because of a prophecy that a child of Vasudeva would kill Kamsa. Krishna however was saved and he eventually killed the king as well as performing many other great feats. In some Hindu traditions, Krishna is regarded as the supreme deity. He is usually depicted with blue skin.

name: KRISTEN  (1)
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of CHRISTIAN.

name: KRISTIAN
meaning: Scandinavian and Finnish form of CHRISTIAN, as well as a Bulgarian variant form.

name: KRISTIINA
meaning: Finnish and Estonian form of CHRISTINA.

name: KRISTIJAN
meaning: Serbian, Croatian, Slovene and Macedonian form of CHRISTIAN.

name: KRISTIN
meaning: Scandinavian and German form of CHRISTINA.

name: KRISTINA
meaning: Form of CHRISTINA, and a Bulgarian variant of HRISTINA.

name: KRISTINE
meaning: Scandinavian form of CHRISTINE, as well as an English and German variant.

name: KRISTJAN
meaning: Estonian and Slovene form of CHRISTIAN.

name: KRIŠTOF
meaning: Slovene and Slovak form of CHRISTOPHER.

name: KRSTO
meaning: Croatian short form of KRISTOFOR or KRISTIJAN.

name: KRUNOSLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements kruna "crown" (a derivative of Latin corona) and slava "glory".

name: KSENIA
meaning: Polish form of XENIA, as well as a variant transcription of KSENIYA.

name: KSENIJA
meaning: Serbian, Croatian, Macedonian and Slovene form of XENIA.

name: KSENIYA
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian and Belarusian form of XENIA.

name: KSHITIJ
meaning: Means "born of the earth" or "horizon" in Sanskrit.

name: KUDRET
meaning: Means "power, might" in Turkish, ultimately from Persian.

name: KUKULKAN
meaning: Means "feathered serpent" in Mayan. This is the name of snake god in Maya legend, roughly equivalent to Quetzalcoatl in Aztec mythology.

name: KULDEEP
meaning: From Sanskrit कुल(kula) meaning "family" and दीप(dipa) meaning "lamp, light".

name: KUMARA
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit कुमार(kumara) meaning "boy, son". In Hindu texts this is an epithet of both the fire god Agni and the war god Skanda.

name: KUMARAN
meaning: Tamil and Malayam variant of KUMARA.

name: KUMARI
meaning: Feminine form of KUMARA. In the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' Kumari is the wife of the warrior Bhima. This is also another name of the Hindu goddess Durga.

name: KUMIKO
meaning: From Japanese 久(ku) meaning "long time", 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: KUN
meaning: From Chinese 坤(kūn) meaning "earth, female", as well as other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: KUNALA
meaning: Means "lotus" in Sanskrit. This was the name of a son of the 3rd-century BC Indian emperor Ashoka.

name: KUNEGUNDA
meaning: Polish form of KUNIGUNDE. The 13th-century Saint Kunegunda was the daughter of Bela IV, king of Hungary. She married Boleslaus V of Poland, but after his death refused to assume power and instead became a nun.

name: KUNIBERT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements kuni "clan, family" and beraht "bright".

name: KUNIGUNDE
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element kuni "clan, family" combined with gund "war". Saint Kunigunde was the wife of the Holy Roman emperor Henry II.

name: KUNO
meaning: Derived from Germanic kuni meaning "clan, family".

name: KUNTI
meaning: Means "spear" in Sanskrit. In the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' this is the name of the mother of the Pandavas.

name: KUNZANG
meaning: Means "all good, ever excellent" in Tibetan.

name: KUROU
meaning: From Japanese 九(ku) meaning "nine" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". This name was traditionally given to the ninth son. Other combinations of kanji characters are also possible.

name: KURT
meaning: German contracted form of CONRAD. A famous bearer was the American musician Kurt Cobain (1967-1994).

name: KUSTI
meaning: Finnish diminutive of KUSTAA or AUKUSTI.

name: KUZMAN
meaning: Bulgarian, Serbian and Macedonian form of COSMAS.

name: KVETA
meaning: Derived from Czech kvet meaning "flower, blossom".

name: KYLE
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from Gaelic caol meaning "narrows, channel, strait".

name: KYLER
meaning: Probably a variant of KYLE, blending it with TYLER. It also coincides with the rare surname Kyler, an Anglicized form of Dutch Cuyler, which is of uncertain meaning.

name: KYLIE
meaning: This name arose in Australia, where it is said to mean "boomerang" in an Australian Aboriginal language. It is more likely a feminine form of KYLE, and it is in this capacity that it began to be used in America in the 1970s. A famous bearer is the Australian singer Kylie Minogue (1968-).

name: KYLLIKKI
meaning: Derived from Finnish kyllä "abundance" or kyllin "enough". This is the name of a character in the Finnish epic the 'Kalevala'.

name: KYNASTON
meaning: From an English surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "CYNEFRIÐ's town" in Old English.

name: KYOU
meaning: From Japanese 協(kyou) meaning "unite, cooperate", 京(kyou) meaning "capital city", 郷(kyou) meaning "village", 杏(kyou) meaning "apricot", or other kanji with the same pronunciation.

name: KYRA
meaning: Variant of KIRA(2), sometimes considered a feminine form of CYRUS.

name: KYRIE
meaning: From the name of a Christian prayer, also called the Kyrie eleison meaning "Lord, have mercy". It is ultimately from Greek κυριος(kyrios) meaning "lord". In America it was popularized as a masculine name by basketball player Kyrie Irving (1992-), whose name is pronounced differently than the prayer.

name: KÁLMÁN
meaning: Probably of Turkic origin, meaning "remainder". This was the name of a 12th-century king of Hungary. It was also borne in the 13th-century by the first king of Galicia-Volhynia, who was also a member of the Hungarian Árpád royal family. This name has been frequently confused with Koloman.

name: KÁRA
meaning: Probably from Old Norse kárr meaning "curly, curved". In Norse legend this is the name of a valkyrie.

name: KÅRE
meaning: From the Old Norse name Kári meaning "curly, curved".

name: KÓRI
meaning: Old Norse name of unknown meaning.

name: KĘSTUTIS
meaning: From Lithuanian kęsti meaning "to cope, to endure" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of a 14th-century ruler of Lithuania.

name: LABAN
meaning: Derived from Hebrew לָבָן(lavan) meaning "white". In the Old Testament this is the name of the father of Rachel and Leah.

name: LABONI
meaning: From Sanskrit लावण्य(lavanya) meaning "beauty, loveliness, charm".

name: LACEY
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of LACY.

name: LACHESIS
meaning: Means "apportioner" in Greek. She was one of the three Fates or Μοιραι (Moirai) in Greek mythology. She was responsible for deciding how long each person had to live.

name: LACHLAN
meaning: Originally a Scottish nickname for a person who was from Norway. In Scotland, Norway was known as the "land of the lochs", or Lochlann.

name: LACHTNA
meaning: Means "milk-coloured" in Irish Gaelic. According to legend this was the name of an ancestor of the Irish king Brian Boru.

name: LACY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from Lassy, the name of a town in Normandy. The name of the town was Gaulish in origin, perhaps deriving from a personal name which was Latinized as Lascius.

name: LADISLAV
meaning: Czech, Slovak, Slovene and Croatian form of VLADISLAV.

name: LADISLAVA
meaning: Czech and Slovak feminine form of VLADISLAV.

name: LADONNA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name DONNA.

name: LAEL
meaning: Means "of God" in Hebrew. This is the name of the father of Eliasaph in the Old Testament.

name: LAELIA
meaning: Feminine form of Laelius, a Roman family name of unknown meaning. This is also the name of a type of flower, an orchid found in Mexico and Central America.

name: LAETITIA
meaning: Original form of LETITIA, as well as the French form.

name: LAGINA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name GINA.

name: LAILA  (2)
meaning: Scandinavian and Finnish form of LÁILÁ.

name: LAIMA
meaning: From Latvian laime and Lithuanian laima which mean "luck, fate". This was the name of the Latvian and Lithuanian goddess of fate, luck, pregnancy and childbirth. She was the sister of the goddesses Dekla and Karta, who were also associated with fate.

name: LAIUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Λαιος(Laios), which is of unknown meaning. This was the name of a king of Thebes in Greek mythology, the husband of Jocasta. Due to a prophecy that he would be killed by his son, Laius left his infant Oedipus for dead. The boy survived but was ignorant of his true parentage. Years later he unwittingly killed Laius in a quarrel on the road.

name: LAKE
meaning: From the English word lake, for the inland body of water. It is ultimately derived from Latin lacus.

name: LAKEISHA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name KEISHA.

name: LAKESHIA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name KESHIA.

name: LAKISHA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name KISHA.

name: LAKSHMANA
meaning: Means "having lucky marks" in Sanskrit. In the Hindu epic the 'Ramayana' he is the trusted companion of the hero Rama, accompanying him into exile.

name: LAKSHMI
meaning: Means "sign, mark" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the Hindu goddess of prosperity, good luck, and beauty. She is the wife of Vishnu and her symbol is the lotus flower, with which she is often depicted.

name: LAL
meaning: Means "boy" in Hindi, derived from Sanskrit लल(lala) meaning "playing, caressing".

name: LALA
meaning: From a South Slavic word meaning "tulip". It is derived via Turkish from Persian لاله(laleh).

name: LALAGE
meaning: Derived from Greek λαλαγεω(lalageo) meaning "to babble, to prattle". The Roman poet Horace used this name in one of his odes.

name: LALAWETHIKA
meaning: Means "he makes noise" in Shawnee. This was another name of the Shawnee leader Tenskwatawa (1775-1836).

name: LALE
meaning: Means "tulip" in Turkish, of Persian origin.

name: LALI
meaning: Means "ruby" in Georgian, of Sanskrit origin.

name: LALITA
meaning: Means "playful, charming, desirable" in Sanskrit. In Hindu belief this is the name of one of the playmates of the young Krishna. It is also another name of the goddess Parvati.

name: LALLA
meaning: Derived from Persian لاله(laleh) meaning "tulip". This was the name of the heroine of Thomas Moore's poem 'Lalla Rookh' (1817). In the poem, Lalla, the daughter of the emperor of Delhi, listens to a poet sing four tales.

name: LAMAR
meaning: From a French and English surname, originally from a place name in Normandy, which was derived from Old French la mare meaning "the pool".

name: LAMBAER
meaning: Limburgish form of LAMBERT. Its spelling has been influenced by the French pronunciation of Lambert.

name: LAMBERT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements landa "land" and beraht "bright". Saint Lambert of Maastricht was a 7th-century bishop who was martyred after denouncing Pepin II for adultery.

name: LAMECH
meaning: Possibly means "to make low" in Hebrew. This is the name of two characters in Genesis in the Old Testament: a descendant of Cain and the father of Noah.

name: LAMIA  (2)
meaning: Possibly from Greek λαιμος(laimos) "throat". In Greek mythology this is the name of a queen of Libya who was a mistress of Zeus. Hera, being jealous, kills Lamia's children, causing her to go mad and transform into a monster that hunts the children of others.

name: LAMONT
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from the Old Norse given name Logmaðr meaning "law man".

name: LAMYA
meaning: Means "having beautiful dark lips" in Arabic.

name: LAN
meaning: From Chinese 兰(lán) meaning "orchid, elegant" (which is usually only feminine) or 岚(lán) meaning "mountain mist". Other Chinese characters can form this name as well. As a Vietnamese name, it is derived from Sino-Vietnamese 蘭 meaning "orchid".

name: LANA
meaning: Short form of ALANA (English) or SVETLANA (Russian). In the English-speaking world, it was popularized by actress Lana Turner (1921-1995).

name: LANCE
meaning: From the Germanic name Lanzo, originally a short form of names that began with the element landa meaning "land". During the Middle Ages it became associated with Old French lance "spear, lance". A famous bearer is American cyclist Lance Armstrong (1971-).

name: LANCELOT
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly an Old French diminutive of Lanzo (see LANCE). In Arthurian legend Lancelot was the bravest of the Knights of the Round Table. He became the lover of Arthur's wife Guinevere. His earliest appearance is in the works of the 12th-century French poet Chrétien de Troyes.

name: LANDON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from an Old English place name meaning "long hill" (effectively meaning "ridge"). Use of the name may have been inspired in part by the actor Michael Landon (1936-1991).

name: LANE
meaning: From a surname meaning "lane, path" which originally belonged to a person who lived near a lane.

name: LANFORD
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "long ford" in Old English.

name: LANGDON
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of the surname LANDON.

name: LANI
meaning: Means "sky, heaven, royal, majesty" in Hawaiian.

name: LANNY
meaning: Diminutive of LANCE, LANDON, and other names beginning with Lan.

name: LAOISE
meaning: Possibly a newer form of LUIGSECH. It is also used as an Irish form of Louise.

name: LARA  (1)
meaning: Russian short form of LARISA. It was introduced to the English-speaking world by a character from Boris Pasternak's novel 'Doctor Zhivago' (1957) and the subsequent movie adaptation (1965).

name: LARI
meaning: Finnish diminutive of LAURENCE(1) or HILARIUS.

name: LARISA
meaning: Possibly derived from the name of the ancient city of Larisa in Thessaly, which meant "citadel". In Greek legends, the nymph Larisa was either a daughter or mother of Pelasgus, the ancestor of the mythical Pelasgians. This name was later borne by a 4th-century Greek martyr who is venerated as a saint in the Eastern Church. The name (of the city, nymph and saint) is commonly Latinized as Larissa, with a double s.

name: LARISSA
meaning: Variant of LARISA. It has been commonly used as an English given name only since the 20th century. In 1991 this name was given to one of the moons of Neptune, in honour of the mythological character.

name: LARK
meaning: From the English word for the type of songbird.

name: LARRY
meaning: Diminutive of LAURENCE(1). A notable bearer is former basketball player Larry Bird (1956-).

name: LARUNDA
meaning: Possibly connected to Greek λαλεω(laleo) "to talk, to chatter", or the Latin term Lares referring to minor guardian gods. In Roman mythology Larunda or Lara was a water nymph who was overly talkative. She revealed to Juno that her husband Jupiter was having an affair with Juturna, so Jupiter had Larunda's tongue removed. By the god Mercury she had two children, who were Lares.

name: LASHAWN
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name SHAWN.

name: LASHAY
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix La and SHAY(1).

name: LASHONDA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name SHONDA.

name: LASSE
meaning: Scandinavian and Finnish form of LAURENCE(1).

name: LATANYA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name TANYA.

name: LATASHA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name TASHA.

name: LATIF
meaning: Means "gentle, kind" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition اللطيف(al-Latif) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: LATONYA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name TONYA.

name: LATOYA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name TOYA.

name: LAU
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of LAURENS.

name: LAUMA
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Latvian mythology this is the name of a forest spirit sometimes associated with childbirth and weaving.

name: LAUNCE
meaning: Short form of Launcelot, a variant of LANCELOT. This was the name of a clownish character in Shakespeare's play 'The Two Gentlemen of Verona' (1594).

name: LAUNO
meaning: Possibly a Finnish diminutive of KLAUS.

name: LAURA
meaning: Feminine form of the Late Latin name Laurus, which meant "laurel". This meaning was favourable, since in ancient Rome the leaves of laurel trees were used to create victors' garlands. The name was borne by the 9th-century Spanish martyr Saint Laura, who was a nun thrown into a vat of molten lead by the Moors. It was also the name of the subject of poems by the 14th-century Italian poet Petrarch....[more]

name: LAURAINE
meaning: Variant of LORRAINE influenced by the spelling of LAURA.

name: LAUREL
meaning: From the name of the laurel tree, ultimately from Latin laurus.

name: LAUREN
meaning: Variant or feminine form of LAURENCE(1). Originally a masculine name, it was first popularized as a feminine name by actress Betty Jean Perske (1924-), who used Lauren Bacall as her stage name.

name: LAURENCE  (1)
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Laurentius, which meant "from Laurentum". Laurentum was a city in ancient Italy, its name probably deriving from Latin laurus "laurel". Saint Laurence was a 3rd-century deacon and martyr from Rome. According to tradition he was roasted alive on a gridiron because, when ordered to hand over the church's treasures, he presented the sick and poor. Due to the saint's popularity, the name came into general use in the Christian world (in various spellings)....[more]

name: LAURENCE  (2)
meaning: French feminine form of Laurentius (see LAURENCE(1)).

name: LAURENTINUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was a derivative of Laurentius (see LAURENCE(1)). Saint Laurentinus was a 3rd-century martyr from Carthage.

name: LAURITS
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of Laurentius (see LAURENCE(1)).

name: LAURITZ
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of Laurentius (see LAURENCE(1)).

name: LAVENDER
meaning: From the English word for the aromatic flower or the pale purple colour.

name: LAVERNA
meaning: Meaning unknown. Laverna was the Roman goddess of thieves and thievery.

name: LAVERNE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a French place name, ultimately derived from the Gaulish word vern meaning "alder". It is sometimes associated with the Roman goddess Laverna or the Latin word vernus "of spring".

name: LAVINIA
meaning: Meaning unknown, probably of Etruscan origin. In Roman legend Lavinia was the daughter of King Latinus, the wife of Aeneas, and the ancestor of the Roman people. According to the legend Aeneas named the town of Lavinium in honour of his wife.

name: LAVONNE
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name YVONNE.

name: LAWANDA
meaning: Combination of the popular prefix La with the name WANDA.

name: LAWRENCE
meaning: Variant of LAURENCE(1). This spelling of the name is now more common than Laurence in the English-speaking world, probably because Lawrence is the usual spelling of the surname. The surname was borne by the author and poet D. H. Lawrence (1885-1930), as well as the revolutionary T. E. Lawrence (1888-1935), who was known as Lawrence of Arabia.

name: LAWSON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of LAURENCE(1)".

name: LAYLA
meaning: Means "night" in Arabic. This was the name of the object of romantic poems written by the 7th-century poet known as Qays. The story of Qays and Layla became a popular romance in medieval Arabia and Persia. The name became used in the English-speaking world after the 1970 release of the song 'Layla' by Derek and the Dominos, the title of which was inspired by the medieval story.

name: LAYTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "settlement with a leek garden" in Old English.

name: LAZAR
meaning: Russian, Bulgarian, Serbian and Macedonian form of LAZARUS.

name: LAZARUS
meaning: Latinized form of Λαζαρος(Lazaros), a Greek form of ELEAZAR used in the New Testament. Lazarus was a man from Bethany, the brother of Mary and Martha, who was restored to life by Jesus.

name: LEAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name לֵאָה(Le'ah) which was probably derived from the Hebrew word לְאָה(le'ah) meaning "weary". Alternatively it might derive from a Chaldean name meaning "mistress" or "ruler" in Akkadian. In the Old Testament Leah is the first wife of Jacob and the mother of seven of his children. Jacob's other wife was Leah's sister Rachel. Although this name was used by Jews in the Middle Ages, it was not typical as an English Christian name until after the Protestant Reformation, being common among the Puritans.

name: LEANDER
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Λεανδρος(Leandros), derived from λεων(leon) meaning "lion" and ανηρ(aner) meaning "man" (genitive ανδρος). In Greek legend Leander was the lover of Hero. Every night he swam across the Hellespont to meet her, but on one occasion he was drowned when a storm arose. When Hero saw his dead body she threw herself into the waters and perished.

name: LEANDRO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of LEANDER.

name: LEANNA
meaning: Probably this was originally a variant of LIANA. It is now often considered a combination of LEE and ANNA.

name: LEATRICE
meaning: Possibly a combination of LEAH and BEATRICE. This name was first brought to public attention by the American actress Leatrice Joy (1893-1985).

name: LEBERECHT
meaning: Means "live rightly" from German lebe "live" and recht "right". This name was created in the 17th century.

name: LEBRON
meaning: Meaning unknown, probably an invented name. This is the name of basketball player LeBron James (1984-).

name: LECH
meaning: From the name of the Slavic tribe the Lendians, called the Lędzianie in Polish. According to Slavic legend this was the name of the founder of the Polish people. A famous bearer was the Polish president Lech Wałęsa (1943-).

name: LECHOSŁAW
meaning: Derived from the Polish name LECH combined with the Slavic element slava meaning "glory".

name: LECIA
meaning: Short form of ALICIA, FELICIA or LETITIA.

name: LEDA
meaning: Possibly means "woman" from Greek. In Greek myth she was the mother of Castor, Pollux, Helen and Clytemnestra by the god Zeus, who came upon her in the form of a swan.

name: LEE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from Old English leah meaning "clearing". The surname belonged to Robert E. Lee (1807-1870), commander of the Confederate forces during the American Civil War. In his honour, it has been commonly used as a given name in the American South.

name: LEENA
meaning: Finnish and Estonian short form of HELENA or MATLEENA.

name: LEGEND
meaning: From the English word, referring to a story about the past (or by extension, a heroic character in such a story), ultimately from Latin legere "to read".

name: LEGOLAS
meaning: Means "green leaves" in Sindarin, from laeg "green" combined with go-lass "collection of leaves". In 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954) by J. R. R. Tolkien, Legolas is the son of the elf lord Thranduil and a member of the Fellowship of the Ring.

name: LEHI
meaning: From an Old Testament place name meaning "jawbone" in Hebrew, so called because it was the site where the hero Samson defeated 1,000 warriors using only the jawbone of a donkey as a weapon. It is also used in the Book of Mormon as the name of a prophet.

name: LEI  (2)
meaning: From Chinese 磊(lěi) meaning "pile of stones" (which is typically masculine) or 蕾(lěi) meaning "bud" (typically feminine). Other characters can also form this name.

name: LEIA
meaning: Form of LEAH used in the Greek Old Testament. This is the name of a princess in the 'Star Wars' movies by George Lucas, who probably based it on Leah.

name: LEIF
meaning: From the Old Norse name Leifr meaning "descendant, heir". Leif Eriksson was a Norse explorer who reached North America in the early 11th century. He was the son of Erik the Red.

name: LEIGH
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of LEE.

name: LEIGHTON
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of LAYTON.

name: LEILA
meaning: Variant of LAYLA. This spelling was used by Lord Byron for characters in 'The Giaour' (1813) and 'Don Juan' (1819), and it is through him that the name was introduced to the English-speaking world.

name: LEILANI
meaning: Means "heavenly flowers" or "royal child" from Hawaiian lei "flowers, lei, child" and lani "heaven, sky, royal, majesty".

name: LEIMOMI
meaning: Means "pearl lei" or "pearl child" from Hawaiian lei "flowers, lei, child" and momi "pearl".

name: LEITH
meaning: From a surname, originally from the name of a Scottish town (now a district of Edinburgh), which is derived from Gaelic lìte "wet, damp". It is also the name of the river that flows though Edinburgh.

name: LELA  (1)
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly from the name of a type of plant.

name: LELAND
meaning: From a surname, originally from an English place name, which meant "fallow land" in Old English. A famous bearer was the politician, businessman and Stanford University founder Leland Stanford (1824-1893).

name: LEMMINKÄINEN
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly related to Finnish lempi "love". In the Finnish epic the 'Kalevala' this is the name of an arrogant hero. After he was killed his mother fetched his body from the River of Death and restored him to life. He is sometimes identified with the god Ahti.

name: LEMOINE
meaning: From a French surname meaning "the monk" in French.

name: LEMUEL
meaning: Means "for God" in Hebrew. This was the name of a king briefly mentioned in Proverbs in the Old Testament. In the Book of Mormon it is the name of a son of Lehi and Sariah. It is also borne by the hero of Jonathan Swift's novel 'Gulliver's Travels' (1726).

name: LENA
meaning: Short form of names ending in lena, such as HELENA, MAGDALENA or YELENA.

name: LENE
meaning: German, Danish and Norwegian short form of HELENE or MAGDALENE.

name: LENI
meaning: German diminutive of HELENE or MAGDALENA.

name: LENKA
meaning: Originally a diminutive of MAGDALÉNA or HELENA. It is now used as an independent name.

name: LENNART
meaning: Swedish and Low German form of LEONARD.

name: LENNON
meaning: Anglicized form of the Irish surname Ó Leannáin, which means "descendant of Leannán". The name Leannán means "lover" in Gaelic. This surname was borne by musician John Lennon (1940-1980), a member of the Beatles.

name: LENNOX
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from the name of a district in Scotland. The district, called Leamhnachd in Gaelic, possibly means "place of elms".

name: LENORE
meaning: Short form of ELEANOR. This was the name of the departed love of the narrator in Edgar Allan Poe's poem 'The Raven' (1845).

name: LENOX
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of LENNOX.

name: LENZ
meaning: Short form of LORENZ. This is also a German poetic word referring to the springtime.

name: LEO
meaning: Derived from Latin leo meaning "lion", a cognate of LEON. It was popular among early Christians and was the name of 13 popes, including Saint Leo the Great who asserted the dominance of the Roman bishops (the popes) over all others in the 5th century. It was also borne by six Byzantine emperors and five Armenian kings. Another famous bearer was Leo Tolstoy (1828-1910), a Russian novelist whose works include 'War and Peace' and 'Anna Karenina'. Leo is also the name of a constellation and the fifth sign of the zodiac.

name: LEOBWIN
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements leub "dear, beloved" and win "friend", making it a cognate of LEOFWINE.

name: LEOCADIA
meaning: Late Latin name which might be derived from the name of the Greek island of Leucadia or from Greek λευκος(leukos) meaning "bright, clear, white" (which is also the root of the island's name). Saint Leocadia was a 3rd-century martyr from Spain.

name: LEOFDÆG
meaning: Derived from the Old English element leof "dear, agreeable, beloved" combined with dæg "day".

name: LEOFFLÆD
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements leof "dear, agreeable, beloved" and flæd "beauty".

name: LEOFRIC
meaning: Derived from the Old English element leof "dear, agreeable, beloved" combined with ric "power".

name: LEOFSIGE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements leof "dear, agreeable, beloved" and sige "victory".

name: LEOFSTAN
meaning: Derived from the Old English element leof "dear, agreeable, beloved" combined with stan "stone".

name: LEOFWINE
meaning: Means "dear friend", derived from the Old English elements leof "dear, agreeable, beloved" and wine "friend". This was the name of an 8th-century English saint, also known as Lebuin, who did missionary work in Frisia.

name: LEOLIN
meaning: Variant of LLYWELYN influenced by Latin leo "lion".

name: LEON
meaning: Derived from Greek λεων(leon) meaning "lion". During the Christian era this Greek name was merged with the Latin cognate Leo, with the result that the two forms are used somewhat interchangeably across European languages. In England during the Middle Ages this was a common name among Jews. A famous bearer was Leon Trotsky (1879-1940), a Russian Communist revolutionary.

name: LEONARD
meaning: Means "brave lion", derived from the Germanic elements lewo "lion" (of Latin origin) and hard "brave, hardy". This was the name of a 5th-century Frankish saint from Noblac who is the patron of prisoners and horses. The Normans brought this name to England, though it did not become common there until the 19th century.

name: LEONARDO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of LEONARD. A notable bearer was Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519), an Italian artist and scientist of the Renaissance. He is also known as the inventor of several contraptions, including flying machines, as well as the painter of the 'Mona Lisa'. Another famous bearer was Leonardo Fibonacci, a 13th-century Italian mathematician. A more recent bearer is American actor Leonardo DiCaprio (1974-).

name: LEONHARD
meaning: German form of LEONARD. Leonhard Euler was a Swiss mathematician who made many important contributions to calculus, number theory, geometry and theoretical physics.

name: LEONID
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of LEONIDAS.

name: LEONIDAS
meaning: Derived from Greek λεων(leon) meaning "lion" combined with the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides). Leonidas was a Spartan king of the 5th century BC who sacrificed his life and his army defending the pass of Thermopylae from the Persians. This was also the name of a 3rd-century saint and martyr, the father of Origen, from Alexandria.

name: LEONIE
meaning: German and Dutch feminine form of LEONIUS.

name: LEONIUS
meaning: Late Latin name which was derived from LEO.

name: LEONOR
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of ELEANOR. It was brought to Spain in the 12th-century by Eleanor of England, who married King Alfonso VIII of Castile.

name: LEONTIOS
meaning: Derived from Greek λεων(leon) meaning "lion". This was the name of various early saints and martyrs. It was also borne by a 7th-century Byzantine emperor.

name: LEONTYNE
meaning: Variant of LÉONTINE. This name was borne by opera singer Leontyne Price (1927-).

name: LEOPOLD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements leud "people" and bald "bold". The spelling was altered due to association with Latin leo "lion". This name was common among German royalty, first with the Babenbergs and then the Habsburgs. Saint Leopold was a 12th-century Babenberg margrave of Austria, who is now considered the patron of that country. It was also borne by two Habsburg Holy Roman emperors, as well as three kings of Belgium. Since the 19th century this name has been occasionally used in England, originally in honour of Queen Victoria's uncle, a king of Belgium, after whom she named one of her sons. It was later used by James Joyce for the main character, Leopold Bloom, in his novel 'Ulysses' (1920).

name: LEOPOLDO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of LEOPOLD.

name: LER
meaning: Irish cognate of LLYR. Ler was an Irish god of the sea, the father of Manannan mac Lir.

name: LEROY
meaning: From the French nickname le roi meaning "the king". It has been common as an English given name since the 19th century.

name: LES
meaning: Short form of LESLIE or LESTER.

name: LESLIE
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from a Scottish place name, probably derived from Gaelic leas celyn meaning "garden of holly". It has been used as a given name since the 19th century. In America it was more common as a feminine name after the 1940s.

name: LESSIE
meaning: Diminutive of names containing the sound les, such as LESLIE.

name: LESTAT
meaning: Name used by author Anne Rice for a character in her 'Vampire Chronicles' series of novels, first released in 1976, where it belongs to the French vampire Lestat de Lioncourt. Rice possibly intended the name to appear derived from Old French or Occitan l'estat "state, status", though apparently her husband's name Stan was inspiration.

name: LESTER
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the name of the city of Leicester, originally denoting a person who was from that place. The city's name is derived from the river name Ligore combined with Latin castra "camp".

name: LETA
meaning: Possibly derived from Latin laetus meaning "glad". Otherwise, it could be a short form of names ending in leta.

name: LETHA
meaning: Possibly a short form of ALETHA.

name: LETITIA
meaning: From the Late Latin name Laetitia which meant "joy, happiness". This was the name of an obscure saint, who is revered mainly in Spain. It was in use in England during the Middle Ages, usually in the spelling Lettice, and it was revived in the 18th century.

name: LETIZIA
meaning: Italian form of LETITIA. It was borne by Napoleon Bonaparte's mother.

name: LETO
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek ληθω(letho) "hidden, forgotten". In Greek mythology she was the mother of Apollo and Artemis by Zeus.

name: LETÍCIA
meaning: Portuguese and Hungarian form of LETITIA.

name: LEUI
meaning: Form of LEVI used in the Greek Bible.

name: LEUTHAR
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements leud "people" and hari "army".

name: LEUTWIN
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements leud "people" and win "friend". Saint Leutwin was an 8th-century bishop of Trier.

name: LEV  (1)
meaning: Means "lion" in Russian, functioning as a vernacular form of Leo. This was the real Russian name of both author Leo Tolstoy (1828-1910) and revolutionary Leon Trotsky (1879-1940).

name: LEVENT
meaning: From the Ottoman Turkish term levend, referring to a member of the navy, which is possibly ultimately derived from Italian levante "person from the eastern Mediterranean". The Turkish word has now come to mean "tall, handsome, roguish".

name: LEVENTE
meaning: Old Hungarian name, possibly of Slavic origin, or possibly from Hungarian lesz "will be". This name was used by the Árpád royal family since at least the 10th century.

name: LEVI
meaning: Possibly means "joined, attached" in Hebrew. As told in the Old Testament, Levi was the third son of Jacob and Leah, and the ancestor of one of the twelve tribes of the Israelites, known as the Levites. This was the tribe that formed the priestly class of the Israelites. The brothers Moses and Aaron were members. In the New Testament this is another name for the apostle Matthew. As an English Christian name, Levi came into use after the Protestant Reformation.

name: LEVON
meaning: Armenian form of LEON. This was the name of several kings of Cilician Armenia, including the first king Levon I the Magnificent.

name: LEWIN
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the given name LEOFWINE.

name: LEWIS
meaning: Medieval English form of LOUIS. A famous bearer was Lewis Carroll (1832-1898), the author of 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland'. This was also the surname of C. S. Lewis (1898-1963), the author of the 'Chronicles of Narnia'.

name: LEXA
meaning: Short form of ALEXANDRA or ALEXA.

name: LEXUS
meaning: Short form of ALEXUS. Its use has been influenced by the Lexus brand name (a line of luxury automobiles made by Toyota).

name: LEYTON
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of LAYTON.

name: LEÓN
meaning: Spanish form of LEON. León is also the name of a province in Spain, though the etymology is unrelated.

name: LI  (1)
meaning: From Chinese 理(lǐ) meaning "reason, logic", 立(lì) meaning "stand, establish", 黎(lí) meaning "black, dawn", 力(lì) meaning "power, capability, influence" (which is usually only masculine) or 丽(lì) meaning "beautiful" (usually only feminine). Other Chinese characters are also possible.

name: LIA  (1)
meaning: Italian, Portuguese, Georgian and Greek form of LEAH.

name: LIA  (2)
meaning: Short form of ROSALIA, JULIA, and other names ending in lia.

name: LIANA
meaning: Short form of JULIANA, LILIANA, and other names that end in liana. This is also the word for a type of vine that grows in jungles.

name: LIBA
meaning: From Yiddish לִיבֵע(libe) meaning "love", of German origin.

name: LIBBY
meaning: Originally a medieval diminutive of Ibb, itself a diminutive of ISABEL. It is also used as a diminutive of ELIZABETH.

name: LIBENA
meaning: Derived from the Czech element lib meaning "love".

name: LIBER
meaning: Derived from Latin liber meaning "free". This was the name of a Roman fertility god, often identified with Dionysus.

name: LIBERIUS
meaning: Late Latin name which was derived from Latin liber "free". This name was borne by a 2nd-century saint and a 4th-century pope.

name: LIBERTY
meaning: Simply from the English word liberty, derived from Latin libertas, a derivative of liber "free". Interestingly, since 1880 this name has charted on the American popularity lists in three different periods: in 1918 (at the end of World War I), in 1976 (the American bicentennial), and after 2001 (during the War on Terrorism).

name: LIBITINA
meaning: Meaning unknown. Libitina was the Roman goddess of funerals, corpses and death.

name: LIBORIUS
meaning: Possibly a variant of LIBERIUS, or possibly a Latinized form of a Gaulish name. Saint Liborius was a 4th-century bishop of Le Mans.

name: LIBUŠE
meaning: Derived from the Czech element lib meaning "love". In Czech legend Lubuše was the founder of Prague.

name: LIDIA
meaning: Polish, Italian, Spanish and Romanian form of LYDIA.

name: LIDIJA
meaning: Slovene, Croatian, Serbian and Macedonian form of LYDIA.

name: LIDIYA
meaning: Russian and Bulgarian form of LYDIA.

name: LIEBER
meaning: From Yiddish לִיבֵע(libe) meaning "love", of German origin.

name: LIEKE
meaning: Dutch diminutive of ANGELIQUE or names ending in lia.

name: LIEN
meaning: Short form of CAROLIEN and other names ending in lien.

name: LIES
meaning: German and Dutch diminutive of ELISABETH.

name: LIESE
meaning: German and Dutch diminutive of ELISABETH.

name: LIGEIA
meaning: Derived from Greek λιγυς(ligys) meaning "clear-voiced, shrill, whistling". This was the name of one of the Sirens in Greek legend. It was also used by Edgar Allan Poe in his story 'Ligeia' (1838).

name: LIISA
meaning: Finnish and Estonian short form of ELISABET or ELIISABET.

name: LIISI
meaning: Finnish and Estonian diminutive of ELISABET or ELIISABET.

name: LILAC
meaning: From the name of the shrub with purple or white flowers. It is derived via Arabic from Persian.

name: LILAVATI
meaning: Means "amusing, charming, graceful" in Sanskrit. The 12th-century mathematician Bhaskara named one of his systems of mathematics after his daughter Lilavati. This was also the name of a 13th-century queen of Sri Lanka.

name: LILI
meaning: German, French and Hungarian diminutive of ELISABETH, also sometimes connected to the German word lilie meaning "lily". In Hungarian, it can also be diminutive of KAROLINA or JÚLIA.

name: LILIA
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of LILY, as well as a Russian and Ukrainian variant transcription of LILIYA.

name: LILIAN
meaning: English variant of LILLIAN, as well as a French masculine form.

name: LILIJA
meaning: Lithuanian and Latvian cognate of LILY.

name: LILITH
meaning: Derived from Akkadian lilitu meaning "of the night". This was the name of a demon in ancient Assyrian myths. In Jewish tradition she was Adam's first wife, sent out of Eden and replaced by Eve because she would not submit to him. The offspring of Adam (or Samael) and Lilith were the evil spirits of the world.

name: LILIYA
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian and Bulgarian cognate of LILY.

name: LILJA
meaning: Icelandic and Finnish cognate of LILY.

name: LILLA
meaning: Hungarian diminutive of LÍVIA or LÍDIA.

name: LILLI
meaning: German variant of LILI and a Finnish variant of LILJA.

name: LILLIA
meaning: Short form of LILLIAN or an elaborated form of LILY.

name: LILLIAN
meaning: Probably originally a diminutive of ELIZABETH. It may also be considered an elaborated form of LILY, from the Latin word for "lily" lilium. This name has been used in England since the 16th century.

name: LILLY
meaning: English variant of LILY. It is also used in Scandinavia, as a form of LILY or a diminutive of ELISABETH.

name: LILOU
meaning: Either a diminutive of French names containing the sound lee or a combination of LILI and LOUISE.

name: LILY
meaning: From the name of the flower, a symbol of purity. The word is ultimately derived from Latin lilium.

name: LIN
meaning: From Chinese 林(lín) meaning "forest" or 琳(lín) meaning "fine jade, gem". Other characters can also form this name.

name: LINA  (1)
meaning: Means either "palm tree" or "tender" in Arabic.

name: LINA  (2)
meaning: Short form of names ending in lina.

name: LINAS
meaning: Lithuanian form of LINUS. This is also the Lithuanian word for "flax" (a cognate of the name's root).

name: LINCOLN
meaning: From a surname which was originally from the name of a city in England, called Lindum Colonia by the Romans, derived from Brythonic lindo "lake, pool" and Latin colonia "colony". This name is usually given in honour of Abraham Lincoln (1809-1865), president of the United States during the American Civil War.

name: LINDA
meaning: Originally a medieval short form of Germanic names containing the element lind meaning "flexible, soft, mild". It also coincides with the Spanish and Portuguese word linda meaning "beautiful".

name: LINDEN
meaning: From a German surname which was derived from Old High German linta meaning "linden tree".

name: LINDITA
meaning: Means "the day is born" in Albanian, from lind "to give birth" and ditë "day".

name: LINDIWE
meaning: Means "waited for, awaited" in Zulu, Xhosa, Ndebele and Swazi.

name: LINDON
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of LYNDON.

name: LINDSAY
meaning: From an English and Scottish surname which was originally derived from the name of the region Lindsey, which means "LINCOLN island" in Old English. As a given name it was typically masculine until the 1960s (in Britain) and 1970s (in America) when it became popular for girls, probably due to its similarity to Linda and because of American actress Lindsay Wagner (1949-).

name: LINDY
meaning: Originally this was a masculine name, coming into use in America in 1927 when the dance called the Lindy Hop became popular. The dance was probably named for aviator Charles Lindbergh. Later this name was used as a diminutive of LINDA.

name: LINE
meaning: Short form of CAROLINE and other names ending in line.

name: LINFORD
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from place names meaning either "flax ford" or "linden tree ford" in Old English.

name: LING
meaning: From Chinese 灵(líng) meaning "spirit, soul", 铃(líng) meaning "bell, chime", or other Chinese characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: LINN
meaning: Short form of LINNÉA and other names containing the same sound.

name: LINNAEA
meaning: From the word for the type of flower, also called the twinflower (see LINNÉA).

name: LINNET
meaning: Either a variant of LYNETTE or else from the name of the small bird, a type of finch.

name: LINNIE
meaning: Diminutive of LINDA and other names beginning with Lin.

name: LINNÉA
meaning: From the name of a flower, also known as the twinflower. The Swedish botanist Carolus Linnaeus named it after himself, it being his favourite flower.

name: LINO
meaning: Italian, Spanish, Portuguese and Galician form of LINUS.

name: LINTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally from place names meaning either "flax town" or "linden tree town" in Old English.

name: LINUS
meaning: From the Greek name Λινος(Linos) meaning "flax". In Greek legend he was the son of the god Apollo, who accidentally killed him in a contest. Another son of Apollo by this name was the music teacher of Herakles. The name was also borne by the second pope, serving after Saint Peter in the 1st century. In modern times this was the name of a character in Charles Schulz's comic strip 'Peanuts'.

name: LINWOOD
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "stream forest" in Old English.

name: LIONEL
meaning: French diminutive of LÉON. A notable bearer is Argentine soccer star Lionel Messi (1987-).

name: LIR
meaning: Variant of LER based on the genitive case of the name.

name: LIRON
meaning: Means "song for me" or "joy for me" in Hebrew.

name: LISA
meaning: Short form of ELIZABETH, ELISABETH, ELISABET or ELISABETTA. This is the name of the subject of one of the world's most famous paintings, the 'Mona Lisa', the portrait of Lisa del Giocondo by Leonardo da Vinci.

name: LISE
meaning: Short form of ELISABETH or ELIZABETH.

name: LISHA
meaning: Short form of ALICIA, FELICIA, and other names ending with the same sound.

name: LITA
meaning: Short form of names ending in lita. This name was brought to the public eye in the 1920s due to Lita Grey (1908-1995), who was the second wife of Charlie Chaplin. Her birth name was Lillita Louise MacMurray.

name: LIV  (1)
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse name Hlíf meaning "protection". Its use has been influenced by the modern Scandinavian word liv meaning "life".

name: LIVIA  (1)
meaning: Feminine form of LIVIUS. This was the name of the wife of the Roman emperor Augustus.

name: LIVIANA
meaning: Feminine form of the Roman family name Livianus, which was itself derived from the family name LIVIUS.

name: LIVIE
meaning: French and Czech feminine form of LIVIUS.

name: LIVIUS
meaning: Roman family name which may be related to either Latin liveo "to envy" or lividus "blue, envious". Titus Livius, also known as Livy, was a Roman historian who wrote a history of the city of Rome.

name: LIVY
meaning: Form of LIVIUS used to refer to the Roman historian Titus Livius.

name: LIZ
meaning: Short form of ELIZABETH. This is the familiar name of actress Elizabeth Taylor (1932-).

name: LIZA
meaning: Short form of ELIZABETH or YELIZAVETA.

name: LIÊM
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 廉(liêm) meaning "clean, honest, upright".

name: LIÊN
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 蓮(liên) meaning "lotus, water lily".

name: LJERKA
meaning: Derived from South Slavic lijer meaning "lily".

name: LJILJANA
meaning: Derived from South Slavic ljiljan meaning "lily".

name: LJUBA
meaning: From the Slavic element lyuby meaning "love".

name: LJUBAN
meaning: Serbian and Croatian form of LYUBEN.

name: LJUBICA
meaning: From the Slavic element lyuby meaning "love" combined with a diminutive suffix. It can also come from Serbo-Croatian ljubicica meaning "violet".

name: LJUBOMIR
meaning: Croatian, Serbian and Macedonian form of LUBOMÍR.

name: LLEU
meaning: Probably a Welsh form of LUGUS. In the Mabinogion, Lleu Llaw Gyffes is the son of Arianrhod. He was raised by his uncle Gwydion, who helped him overcome the curses that his mother placed upon him.

name: LLEW
meaning: Variant of LLEU. It can also be a short form of LLEWELYN. It coincides with the Welsh word llew meaning "lion".

name: LLEWELYN
meaning: Variant of LLYWELYN influenced by the Welsh word llew "lion".

name: LLINOS
meaning: Means "linnet, finch" in Welsh. The linnet (species Linaria cannabina) is a small European bird in the finch family.

name: LLOYD
meaning: From a surname which was derived from Welsh llwyd meaning "grey". The composer Andrew Lloyd Webber (1948-) is a famous bearer of this name.

name: LLYR
meaning: Means "the sea" in Welsh. This was the name of the Welsh god of the sea. He possibly forms the basis for the legendary King Lear of the Britons.

name: LLYWELYN
meaning: Possibly a Welsh form of the old Celtic name Lugubelenus, a combination of the names of the gods LUGUS and BELENUS. Alternatively it may be derived from Welsh llyw "leader". This was the name of several Welsh rulers, notably the 13th-century Llywelyn the Great who fought against England.

name: LOGAN
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a Scottish place name meaning "little hollow" in Scottish Gaelic.

name: LOIS  (1)
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek λωιων(loion) meaning "more desirable" or "better". Lois is mentioned in the New Testament as the mother of Eunice and the grandmother of Timothy. As an English name, it came into use after the Protestant Reformation. In fiction, this is the name of the girlfriend of the comic book hero Superman.

name: LOKI
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly derived from the Indo-European root *leug meaning "to break". In Norse legend Loki was a trickster god associated with magic and fire. Over time he became more and more evil, and he was eventually chained to a rock by the other gods.

name: LOMMÁN
meaning: Means "little bare one", derived from Irish Gaelic lomm "bare" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of a 5th-century saint, a nephew of Saint Patrick.

name: LON
meaning: Short form of ALONZO and other names containing the same sound. Famous bearers were American actors Lon Chaney Sr. (1883-1930) and Lon Chaney Jr. (1906-1973). The elder's birth name was Leonidas.

name: LONDON
meaning: From the name of the capital city of the United Kingdom, the meaning of which is uncertain. As a surname it was borne by the American author Jack London (1876-1916).

name: LONGINUS
meaning: Roman cognomen derived from Latin longus "long". According to Christian legend Saint Longinus was the name of the Roman soldier who pierced Jesus' side with a spear, then converted to Christianity and was martyred. The name was also borne by the 3rd-century Greek philosopher Cassius Longinus.

name: LONNIE
meaning: Short form of ALONZO and other names containing the same sound.

name: LONNY
meaning: Short form of ALONZO and other names containing the same sound.

name: LONÁN
meaning: Means "little blackbird", derived from Irish Gaelic lon "blackbird" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: LORA
meaning: Variant of LAURA. It is also used as an Italian diminutive of ELEONORA or LOREDANA.

name: LORCÁN
meaning: Means "little fierce one", derived from Irish Gaelic lorcc "fierce" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of a 12th-century archbishop of Dublin.

name: LOREDANA
meaning: Used by the French author George Sand for a character in her novel 'Mattea' (1833) and later by the Italian author Luciano Zuccoli in his novel 'L'amore de Loredana' (1908). It was possibly based on the Venetian surname Loredan, which was derived from the place name Loreo.

name: LORELEI
meaning: From a Germanic name meaning "luring rock". This is the name of a rock headland on the Rhine River. Legends say that a maiden named the Lorelei lives on the rock and lures fishermen to their death with her song.

name: LOREN
meaning: Either a short form of LAURENCE(1) (masculine) or a variant of LAUREN (feminine).

name: LORENA  (1)
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of LORRAINE.

name: LORENA  (2)
meaning: Latinized form of LAUREN. This name was first brought to public attention in America by the song 'Lorena' (1856), written by Joseph Webster, who was said to have created the name as an anagram of LENORE (from the character in Poe's poem 'The Raven').

name: LORENCIO
meaning: Archaic Spanish form of Laurentius (see LAURENCE(1)).

name: LORENZA
meaning: Italian and Spanish feminine form of Laurentius (see LAURENCE(1)).

name: LORENZO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of Laurentius (see LAURENCE(1)). Lorenzo de' Medici (1449-1492), known as the Magnificent, was a ruler of Florence during the Renaissance. He was also a great patron of the arts who employed Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, Botticelli and other famous artists.

name: LORETO
