meaning: From the Latin Mercurius, probably derived from Latin mercari "to trade" or merces "wages". This was the name of the Roman god of trade, merchants, and travellers, later equated with the Greek god Hermes. This is also the name of the first planet in the solar system.

name: MERCY
meaning: From the English word mercy, ultimately from Latin merces "wages, reward", a derivative of merx "goods, wares". This was one of the virtue names adopted by the Puritans in the 17th century.

name: MEREDITH
meaning: From the Welsh name Maredudd or Meredydd, possibly meaning "great lord" or "sea lord". Since the mid-1920s it has been used more often for girls than for boys in English-speaking countries, though it is still a masculine name in Wales. A famous bearer of this name as surname was the English novelist and poet George Meredith (1828-1909).

name: MERIT  (1)
meaning: Either a variant of MERRITT or else simply from the English word merit, ultimately from Latin meritus "deserving".

name: MERITXELL
meaning: From the name of a village in Andorra where there is a sanctuary dedicated to the Virgin Mary. The name of the village may derive from Latin meridies meaning "midday".

name: MERIWETHER
meaning: From a surname meaning "happy weather" in Middle English, originally belonging to a cheery person. A notable bearer of the name was Meriwether Lewis (1774-1809), who, with William Clark, explored the west of North America.

name: MERJA
meaning: Possibly from the name of an ancient Finnish tribe.

name: MERLE
meaning: Variant of MERRILL or MURIEL. The spelling has been influenced by the word merle meaning "blackbird" (via French, from Latin merula).

name: MERLIN
meaning: Form of the Welsh name Myrddin (meaning "sea fortress") used by Geoffrey of Monmouth in his 12th-century Arthurian tales. Writing in Latin, he likely chose the form Merlinus over Merdinus in order to prevent associations with French merde "excrement"....[more]

name: MERLYN
meaning: Variant of MERLIN, sometimes used as a feminine form. It has perhaps been influenced by the Welsh word merlyn meaning "pony".

name: MEROB
meaning: Form of MERAB(1) used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: MERRICK
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from the Welsh given name MEURIG.

name: MERRILL
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the given name MURIEL.

name: MERRITT
meaning: From an English surname, originally from a place name, which meant "boundary gate" in Old English.

name: MERRY  (1)
meaning: From the English word merry, ultimately from Old English myrge. This name appears in Charles Dickens' novel 'Martin Chuzzlewit' (1844), where it is a diminutive of MERCY.

name: MERRY  (2)
meaning: The name of a hobbit in J. R. R. Tolkien's novel 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954). His full given name was Meriadoc, a semi-translation into English of his true hobbit name Kalimac meaning "jolly, merry".

name: MERRYN
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of an early Cornish (male) saint.

name: MERT
meaning: Means "manly, brave" in Turkish, from Persian مرد(mard) meaning "man".

name: MERTEN
meaning: Medieval Low German variant of MARTIN.

name: MERTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "town on a lake" in Old English.

name: MERVI
meaning: From the name of a Finnish village (now a part of the municipality of Hattula).

name: MERVYN
meaning: From the Welsh name Merfyn, which possibly meant "marrow famous". This was the name of a 9th-century Welsh king, Merfyn Frych.

name: MERYEM
meaning: Turkish and Uyghur form of Miriam (see MARY).

name: MERYL
meaning: Variant of MURIEL, influenced by the spelling of the name CHERYL. A famous bearer is American actress Meryl Streep (1949-), whose real name is Mary Louise Streep.

name: MESHACH
meaning: Possibly means "who is what Aku is?" in Akkadian, Aku being the name of the Babylonian god of the moon. In the Book of Daniel in the Old Testament this is the Babylonian name of Mishael, one of the three men cast into a blazing furnace but saved from harm by God.

name: MESHULLAM
meaning: Means either "paid for" or "friend" in Hebrew. This was the name of many characters in the Old Testament.

name: MESSIAH
meaning: From the English word meaning "saviour", ultimately from Hebrew מָשִׁיחַ(mashiyach) meaning "anointed". The word appears in the Old Testement referring to a future king of the Jewish people. In the New Testament it is translated as Christ and is used as a title of Jesus.

name: MESUD
meaning: Older Turkish form of MAS'UD. This was the name of several Seljuq sultans of Rûm.

name: META
meaning: German and Scandinavian short form of MARGARET.

name: METHOATASKE
meaning: Means "turtle laying its eggs" in Shawnee.

name: METHODIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Μεθοδιος(Methodios), derived from Greek μεθοδος(methodos) meaning "pursuit" or "method", ultimately from μετα(meta) "with" and ‘οδος(hodos) "road". Saint Methodius was a Greek missionary to the Slavs who developed the Cyrillic alphabet (with his brother Cyril) in order to translate the Bible into Slavic.

name: METHUSELAH
meaning: Means "man of the dart" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is the father of Lamech and the grandfather of Noah. He lived to age 969, making him the longest-lived person in the Bible.

name: METOD
meaning: Slovene and Slovak form of METHODIUS.

name: METRODORA
meaning: Derived from Greek μητηρ(meter) "mother" (genitive μητρος) and δωρον(doron) "gift". This was the name of a 4th-century saint and martyr who was killed with her sisters Menodora and Nymphodora.

name: METROPHANES
meaning: Derived from Greek μητηρ(meter) "mother" (genitive μητρος) and φανης(phanes) "appearing". Saint Metrophanes was the first bishop of Byzantium (4th century).

name: MEURIG
meaning: Welsh form of MAURICE. This was the name of a few early Welsh kings.

name: MEYER
meaning: Variant transcription of MEIR. It also coincides with a German surname meaning "mayor, leader".

name: MEZTLI
meaning: Means "moon" in Nahuatl. This was the name of the Aztec god (or goddess) of the moon.

name: MI-GYEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" combined with 京(gyeong) meaning "capitol city" or 景(gyeong) meaning "scenery, view". Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: MI-SUK
meaning: From Sino-Korean 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" and 淑(suk) meaning "good, pure, virtuous, charming", as well as other combinations of hanja characters with the same pronunciations.

name: MIA
meaning: Scandinavian, Dutch and German diminutive of MARIA. It coincides with the Italian word mia meaning "mine".

name: MICAELA
meaning: Italian, Spanish, Catalan and Portuguese feminine form of MICHAEL.

name: MICAH
meaning: Contracted form of MICAIAH. Micah is one of the twelve minor prophets of the Old Testament. He authored the Book of Micah, which alternates between prophesies of doom and prophesies of restoration. It was occasionally used as an English given name by the Puritans after the Protestant Reformation, but it did not become common until the end of the 20th century.

name: MICAIAH
meaning: Means "who is like YAHWEH?" in Hebrew. This name occurs in the Old Testament belonging to both males and females.

name: MICHA  (1)
meaning: Form of MICAH used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament. It is also the German and Dutch form.

name: MICHA  (2)
meaning: Short form of MICHAEL or MICHAELA.

name: MICHAEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name מִיכָאֵל(Mikha'el) meaning "who is like God?". This is a rhetorical question, implying no person is like God. Michael is one of the archangels in Hebrew tradition and the only one identified as an archangel in the Bible. In the Book of Daniel in the Old Testament he is named as a protector of Israel. In the Book of Revelation in the New Testament he is portrayed as the leader of heaven's armies in the war against Satan, and is thus considered the patron saint of soldiers in Christianity....[more]

name: MICHAIL
meaning: Modern Greek form of MICHAEL. It is also a variant transcription of Russian MIKHAIL.

name: MICHAL  (1)
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of MICHAEL.

name: MICHAL  (2)
meaning: Possibly means "brook" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament she is a daughter of Saul. She was married to David, but after David fled from Saul he remarried her to someone else. Later, when David became king, he ordered her returned to him.

name: MICHAËL
meaning: Dutch and French form of MICHAEL.

name: MICHEL
meaning: French form of MICHAEL. Michel de Notredame, also known as Nostradamus, was the 16th-century French astrologer who made predictions about future world events. This is also the German diminutive form of MICHAEL.

name: MICHELANGELO
meaning: From Italian, meaning "MICHAEL angel", referring to the archangel Michael. The Renaissance painter and sculptor Michelangelo Buonarroti, from Florence, was the man who created such great works of art as the statue of David and the mural on the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel. This name was also borne by the Baroque artist Michelangelo Merisi, better known as Caravaggio.

name: MICHELLE
meaning: French feminine form of MICHEL. It has been common in the English-speaking world since the middle of the 20th century.

name: MICHI  (1)
meaning: From Japanese 道(michi) meaning "path". Other kanji can also form this name.

name: MICHI  (2)
meaning: German diminutive of MICHAEL or MICHAELA.

name: MICHIKO
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful", 智(chi) meaning "wisdom, intellect" and 子(ko) meaning "child". This name can also be comprised of other combinations of kanji.

name: MICKEY
meaning: Diminutive or feminine form of MICHAEL. This was the name that Walt Disney gave to Ub Iwerks' cartoon character Mickey Mouse, who was originally named Mortimer Mouse. Another famous bearer was the American baseball player Mickey Mantle (1931-1995).

name: MICTLANTECUHTLI
meaning: Means "lord of Mictlan" in Nahuatl. In Aztec mythology he was the skeletal ruler of Mictlan, the realm of the dead, with his wife Mictecacihuatl.

name: MIDAS
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Greek myth Midas was a king of Phrygia in Asia Minor. He was granted a wish by the god Dionysos - that everything he touch be turned to gold.

name: MIDORI
meaning: From Japanese 緑(midori) meaning "green", as well as other kanji or kanji combinations which have the same pronunciation.

name: MIECZYSŁAW
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element mechi "sword" combined with slava "glory".

name: MIELIKKI
meaning: Derived from Finnish mieli "mind, mood". This was the name of a Finnish goddess of forests and hunting. By some accounts she is the wife of the god Tapio.

name: MIEN
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of WILHELMINA.

name: MIERVALDIS
meaning: Latvian name derived from the Baltic elements mier "peace" and vald "rule".

name: MIES
meaning: Dutch diminutive of MARIA or BARTHOLOMEUS.

name: MIESZKO
meaning: Diminutive of MIECZYSŁAW. This was the name of two rulers of Poland, including Mieszko I who converted the country to Christianity.

name: MIGNON
meaning: Means "cute, darling" in French. This is the name of a character in Ambroise Thomas's opera 'Mignon' (1866), which was based on a novel by Goethe.

name: MIGUEL
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of MICHAEL. A notable bearer of this name was Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra (1547-1616), the Spanish novelist and poet who wrote 'Don Quixote'.

name: MIHAEL
meaning: Slovene and Croatian form of MICHAEL.

name: MIHAELA
meaning: Feminine form of MIHAIL or MIHAEL.

name: MIHAI
meaning: Romanian form of MICHAEL. Mihai the Brave was a prince of Wallachia who united Romania in the early 17th century.

name: MIHAIL
meaning: Romanian, Bulgarian and Macedonian form of MICHAEL. This is also a variant transcription of the Greek name MICHAIL.

name: MIHANGEL
meaning: Welsh name of the archangel Michael, formed from a contraction of MICHAEL and "angel".

name: MIHO  (1)
meaning: Short form of MIHAEL or MIHOVIL.

name: MIHO  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" and 穂(ho) meaning "grain". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: MIKA  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" combined with 香(ka) meaning "fragrance" or 加(ka) meaning "increase". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: MIKAEL
meaning: Scandinavian and Finnish form of MICHAEL.

name: MIKHAIL
meaning: Russian form of MICHAEL, and a variant transcription of Bulgarian MIHAIL. This was the name of two Russian tsars. Other notable bearers include the poet Mikhail Lermontov (1814-1841) and the Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev (1931-).

name: MIKHAILA
meaning: Variant of MICHAELA, possibly influenced by the spelling of Mikhail.

name: MIKI
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" and 紀(ki) meaning "chronicle". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: MIKKEL
meaning: Danish form of MICHAEL. It can also derive from the Scandinavian root mikill meaning "enormous".

name: MIKSA
meaning: Originally a diminutive of MIKLÓS or MIHÁLY. It is now used independently, or as a Hungarian form of MAXIMILIAN.

name: MIKU
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" combined with 空(ku) meaning "sky" or 久(ku) meaning "long time". It can also come from a nanori reading of 未来(mirai) meaning "future". Other kanji combinations are possible as well.

name: MIKULÁŠ
meaning: Slovak and Czech form of NICHOLAS.

name: MILA
meaning: Originally a diminutive of Slavic names containing the element milu "gracious, dear".

name: MILADA
meaning: Originally a diminutive of Slavic names containing the element milu "gracious, dear". It has become associated with Czech mladý "young".

name: MILAGROS
meaning: Means "miracles" in Spanish. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary, Nuestra Señora de los Milagros, which means "Our Lady of Miracles".

name: MILAN
meaning: From the Slavic element milu meaning "gracious, dear", originally a short form of names that began with that element. A city in Italy bears this name, though it originates from a different source.

name: MILBURGA
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements milde "gentle" and burg "fortress". Saint Milburga, the sister of Saint Mildred, was a daughter of a 7th-century Mercian king. She was supposedly in possession of magical powers.

name: MILBURN
meaning: From an English surname which was from a place name meaning "mill stream" in Old English.

name: MILDA
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of the Lithuanian goddess of love.

name: MILDGYÐ
meaning: Old English name derived from the elements milde "gentle" and gyð "battle". This was the name of a 7th-century saint, the sister of Saint Mildred.

name: MILDRED
meaning: From the Old English name Mildþryð meaning "gentle strength", derived from the elements milde "gentle" and þryð "strength". Saint Mildred was a 7th-century abbess, the daughter of the Kentish princess Saint Ermenburga. After the Norman conquest this name became rare, but it was revived in the 19th century.

name: MILE
meaning: Originally a diminutive of Slavic names containing the element milu "gracious, dear".

name: MILENA
meaning: Feminine form of MILAN. It began to be used in Italy in honour of Milena Vukotić (1847-1923), mother of Helen of Montenegro, the wife of the Italian king Victor Emmanuel III. In Italy it can also be considered a combination of MARIA and ELENA.

name: MILENKO
meaning: Serbian and Croatian diminutive of MILAN.

name: MILES
meaning: From the Germanic name Milo, introduced by the Normans to England in the form Miles. The meaning is not known for certain. It is possibly connected to the Slavic name element milu meaning "gracious". From an early date it was associated with Latin miles "soldier".

name: MILEY
meaning: In the case of actress and singer Miley Cyrus (1992-), it is a shortened form of the nickname Smiley, given to her by her father because she often smiled. Although it was not at all common before she brought it to public attention, there are some examples of its use before her time, most likely as a diminutive of MILES.

name: MILFORD
meaning: From an English surname which was originally derived from various place names all meaning "ford by a mill" in Old English.

name: MILICA
meaning: From the Slavic element milu meaning "gracious". It was originally a diminutive of names that began with that element.

name: MILIVOJ
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements milu "gracious" and voji "soldier".

name: MILKA  (1)
meaning: Diminutive of Slavic names containing the element milu "gracious, dear".

name: MILKA  (2)
meaning: Means "queen" in Hebrew. This name appears in the Old Testament belonging to both the wife of Nahor and the daughter of Zelophehad.

name: MILKO
meaning: Diminutive of Slavic names containing the element milu "gracious, dear".

name: MILLA
meaning: Short form of CAMILLA and other names that end in milla.

name: MILLARD
meaning: From an occupational English surname which meant "guardian of the mill" in Old English.

name: MILLICENT
meaning: From the Germanic name Amalasuintha, composed of the elements amal "work, labour" and swinth "strong". Amalasuintha was a 6th-century queen of the Ostrogoths. The Normans introduced this name to England in the form Melisent or Melisende. Melisende was a 12th-century queen of Jerusalem, the daughter of Baldwin II.

name: MILLIE
meaning: Diminutive of MILDRED, MILLICENT and other names containing the same sound.

name: MILLY
meaning: Diminutive of EMILIE, MILDRED and other names containing the same sound.

name: MILO
meaning: Old Germanic form of MILES, as well as the Latinized form. This form of the name was used in official documents during the Middle Ages, and it has been used independently since the 19th century.

name: MILODRAG
meaning: Possible medieval Slavic form of MIODRAG.

name: MILOJE
meaning: From the Slavic element milu meaning "gracious, dear", originally a diminutive of names that began with that element.

name: MILORAD
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements milu "gracious, dear" and rad "happy, willing".

name: MILOSLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements milu "gracious, dear" and slava "glory".

name: MILOŠ
meaning: Originally a diminutive of names beginning with the Slavic element milu "gracious, dear". This was the name of a 14th-century Serbian hero who apparently killed the Ottoman sultan Murad I at the Battle of Kosovo.

name: MILTIADES
meaning: Derived from Greek μιλτος(miltos) meaning "red earth" and the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides). This was the name of the general who led the Greek forces to victory against the Persians in the Battle of Marathon.

name: MILTON
meaning: From an English surname which was from a place name meaning "mill town" in Old English. A famous bearer of the surname was John Milton (1608-1674), the poet who wrote 'Paradise Lost'.

name: MIMI
meaning: Diminutive of MARIA and other names beginning with M.

name: MIN
meaning: From 敏(mǐn) meaning "quick, clever, sharp", 民(mín) meaning "people, citizens", or other Chinese/Sino-Korean characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: MIN-JI
meaning: From Sino-Korean 敏(min) meaning "quick, clever, sharp" combined with 智(ji) meaning "wisdom, intellect" or 知(ji) meaning "know, perceive, comprehend". Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: MIN-JUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 敏(min) meaning "quick, clever, sharp" or 旼(min) meaning "gentle, affable" combined with 俊(jun) meaning "talented, handsome". Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: MIN-SEO
meaning: From Sino-Korean 民(min) meaning "people, citizens" or 敏(min) meaning "quick, clever, sharp" combined with 徐(seo) meaning "slowly, calmly, composed, dignified" or 序(seo) meaning "series, sequence". This name can also be formed from other character combinations.

name: MIN-SU
meaning: From Sino-Korean 民(min) meaning "people, citizens" or 旼(min) meaning "gentle, affable" combined with 秀(su) meaning "luxuriant, beautiful, elegant, outstanding" or 洙(su), which refers to a river in China. Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: MINA  (1)
meaning: Short form of WILHELMINA and other names ending in mina. This was the name of a character in the novel 'Dracula' (1897) by Bram Stoker.

name: MINA  (2)
meaning: Means "fish" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the daughter of the Hindu goddess Ushas as well as the daughter of the god Kubera.

name: MINAKO
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful", 奈(na), a phonetic character, and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: MINAKSHI
meaning: From Sanskrit मीन(mina) meaning "fish" and अक्षि(akshi) meaning "eye". This is another name of the Hindu goddess Parvati.

name: MINATO
meaning: From Japanese 港(minato) meaning "harbour", as well as other combinations of kanji having the same pronunciation.

name: MINDAUGAS
meaning: Possibly from Lithuanian mintis "thought" or minti "remember" combined with daug "much". This was the name of a 13th-century ruler of Lithuania.

name: MINERVA
meaning: Possibly derived from Latin mens meaning "intellect", but more likely of Etruscan origin. Minerva was the Roman goddess of wisdom and war, approximately equivalent to the Greek goddess Athena. It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since after the Renaissance.

name: MING
meaning: From Chinese 明(míng) meaning "bright, light, clear" or 铭(míng) meaning "inscribe, engrave", as well as other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: MINH
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 明(minh) meaning "bright". A famous bearer was the communist revolutionary Ho Chi Minh (1890-1969).

name: MINKE
meaning: Diminutive and feminine form of MEINE.

name: MINORU
meaning: From Japanese 実(minoru) meaning "to bear fruit", as well as other kanji or kanji combinations with the same pronunciation.

name: MINOS
meaning: Possibly from a Cretan word or title meaning "king". This was the name of a king of Crete in Greek mythology. He was the son of Zeus and Europa. Because Minos had refused to sacrifice a certain bull to Poseidon, the god had caused his wife Pasiphaë to mate with the bull, which produced the half-bull creature called the Minotaur. Minos had Daedalus construct the Labyrinth to house the beast, but it was eventually slain by Theseus.

name: MIO
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" combined with 桜(o) meaning "cherry blossom" or 緒(o) meaning "thread". Other kanji or kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: MIODRAG
meaning: Derived from the element mio, a Serbo-Croatian form of the Slavic element milu meaning "dear", combined with dragu meaning "precious".

name: MIRA  (1)
meaning: Means "sea, ocean" in Sanskrit. This was the name of a 16th-century Indian princess who devoted her life to the god Krishna.

name: MIRA  (2)
meaning: Short form of names containing the Slavic element miru meaning "peace" or "world".

name: MIRABELLE
meaning: Derived from Latin mirabilis "wonderful". This name was coined during the Middle Ages, though it eventually died out. It was briefly revived in the 19th century.

name: MIRACLE
meaning: From the English word miracle for an extraordinary event, ultimately deriving from Latin miraculum "wonder, marvel".

name: MIRAN
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element miru meaning "peace" or "world".

name: MIRANDA
meaning: Derived from Latin mirandus meaning "admirable, wonderful". The name was created by Shakespeare for the heroine in his play 'The Tempest' (1611), about a father and daughter stranded on an island. It did not become a common English given name until the 20th century. This is also the name of one of the moons of Uranus, named after the Shakespearian character.

name: MIRCEA
meaning: Romanian form of MIRČE. This name was borne by a 14th-century ruler of Wallachia.

name: MIREILLE
meaning: From the Occitan name Mirèio, which was first used by the poet Frédéric Mistral for the main character in his poem 'Mirèio' (1859). He probably derived it from the Occitan word mirar meaning "to admire".

name: MIREK
meaning: Diminutive of MIROSLAV and other names beginning with the Slavic element miru meaning "peace" or "world".

name: MIRELA
meaning: Romanian, Croatian and Albanian form of MIREILLE.

name: MIRIAM
meaning: Original Hebrew form of MARY. It is used in the Old Testament, where it belongs to the elder sister of Moses and Aaron. She watched over the infant Moses as the pharaoh's daughter drew him from the Nile. The name has long been popular among Jews, and it has been used as an English Christian name since the Protestant Reformation.

name: MIRICA
meaning: Diminutive of MIRELA or names containing the Slavic element miru meaning "peace, world".

name: MIRKO
meaning: Originally a diminutive of MIROSLAV and other names containing the element miru "peace, world".

name: MIRON  (1)
meaning: Romanian, Russian, Ukrainian and Polish form of MYRON.

name: MIRON  (2)
meaning: From the name of the highest mountain in Israel, Mount Meron. It is also the name of a village on its slopes, thought to be on the same site as the ancient Canaanite city of Merom.

name: MIROSLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements miru "peace, world" and slava "glory". This was the name of a 10th-century king of Croatia who was deposed by one of his nobles after ruling for four years.

name: MIRSAD
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly derived from Arabic meaning "watchtower" or Persian meaning "ambush".

name: MIRTA
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Croatian cognate of MYRTLE.

name: MIRUNA
meaning: Possibly derived from the Slavic word mir meaning "peace".

name: MIRZA
meaning: Means "prince" from Persian میرزا(mirza), earlier امیرزاده(amirzadeh), which is ultimately from Arabic أمير(amir) meaning "commander" combined with Persian زاده(zadeh) meaning "offspring".

name: MIRČE
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element miru meaning "peace, world".

name: MISAKI
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" and 咲(saki) meaning "blossom". This name can be formed from other combinations of kanji as well.

name: MISHO
meaning: Georgian diminutive of MIKHEIL and a Bulgarian diminutive of MIHAIL.

name: MISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element mysli "thought" or moji "my" combined with slava "glory". This was the name of a 9th-century duke of Croatia, also called Mojslav.

name: MISSY
meaning: Diminutive of MELISSA. This is also a slang term meaning "young woman".

name: MISTY
meaning: From the English word misty, ultimately derived from Old English. The jazz song 'Misty' (1954) by Erroll Garner may have helped popularize the name.

name: MITCHELL
meaning: From a surname, itself derived from the given name MICHAEL or in some cases from Middle English michel meaning "big, large".

name: MITHRA
meaning: Derived from an Indo-Iranian root *mitra meaning "oath, alliance, friend". In Persian mythology he was a god of light and friendship, the son of the supreme god Ahura Mazda. Worship of him eventually spread outside of Persia, where it was known as Mithraism.

name: MITHRIDATES
meaning: Greek form of the Old Persian name Mithradatha meaning "gift of MITHRA". This was the name (in Greek) of several Parthian kings.

name: MITICĂ
meaning: Diminutive of DUMITRU. This is the name of a character in early 20th-century stories by the Romanian author Ion Luca Caragiale.

name: MITRA  (1)
meaning: Means "friend" in Sanskrit, a cognate of MITHRA. This is a transcription of both the feminine form मित्रा and the masculine form मित्र, which is the name of a Hindu god of friendship and contracts who appears in the Rigveda.

name: MITRA  (2)
meaning: Modern variant of MITHRA used as a feminine name. The true Modern Persian form of Mithra is in fact Mehr.

name: MITSUKO
meaning: From Japanese 光(mitsu) meaning "light" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: MIU
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" and 羽(u) meaning "feather". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: MIYAKO
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful", 夜(ya) meaning "night" and 子(ko) meaning "child". This name can be formed from other combinations of kanji as well.

name: MIYU
meaning: From Japanese 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" or 実(mi) meaning "fruit, good result, truth" combined with 優(yu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness" or 結(yu) meaning "tie, bind" or 夕(yu) meaning "evening". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: MIZUKI
meaning: From Japanese 瑞(mizu) meaning "felicitous omen, auspicious" and 希(ki) meaning "hope", besides other kanji combinations.

name: MIŁOGOST
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements milu "gracious, dear" and gosti "guest".

name: MIŠA
meaning: Serbian diminutive of MIHAILO, MIROSLAV and other names beginning with a similar sound. In Slovenia it is typically feminine.

name: MIŠKO
meaning: Serbian and Croatian diminutive of MIHAILO, MIHAEL, MIROSLAV and other names beginning with a similar sound.

name: MLADEN
meaning: Derived from the Slavic word младъ(mladu) meaning "young".

name: MNASON
meaning: Possibly means "reminding" in Greek. In Acts in the New Testament Paul stays in Jerusalem with a man named Mnason, a Jew who was originally from Cyprus.

name: MNEME
meaning: Means "memory" in Greek. In Greek mythology she was one of the original three muses, the muse of memory.

name: MNEMOSYNE
meaning: Means "remembrance" in Greek. In Greek mythology Mnemosyne was a Titan goddess of memory. She was the mother by Zeus of the nine Muses.

name: MO
meaning: Short form of MAUREEN, MAURICE, MORRIS, and other names beginning with a similar sound.

name: MOA
meaning: Possibly derived from Swedish moder meaning "mother". This was the pen name of the Swedish author Moa Martinson (real name Helga Maria Martinson).

name: MOAB
meaning: Means "of his father" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a son of Lot. He was the ancestor of the Moabites, a people who lived in the region called Moab to the east of Israel.

name: MOACIR
meaning: Possibly means "son of pain" in Tupi. This is the name of the son of Iracema and Martim in the novel 'Iracema' (1865) by José de Alencar.

name: MOANA
meaning: Means "ocean, wide expanse of water, deep sea" in Maori and Hawaiian (as well as in other Polynesian languages).

name: MOCHÁN
meaning: Derived from Irish moch "early" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: MODESTE
meaning: French masculine and feminine form of MODESTUS.

name: MODESTO
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Portuguese form of MODESTUS.

name: MODESTUS
meaning: Means "moderate, restrained" in Late Latin. This was the name of several saints.

name: MODESTY
meaning: From the English word modesty, ultimately from Latin modestus "moderate", a derivative of modus "measure".

name: MOE  (1)
meaning: Short form of MAURICE or MORRIS, or sometimes of other names beginning with a similar sound.

name: MOE  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 萌(moe) meaning "bud, sprout". Other kanji with the same reading can also form this name.

name: MOEMA
meaning: Means "lies" in Tupí. This name appears in the poem 'Caramuru' (1781) by the Brazilian poet Santa Rita Durão.

name: MOERANI
meaning: From Tahitian moe "sleep" and rani "heaven, sky".

name: MOHAMED
meaning: Variant transcription of MUHAMMAD (chiefly Egyptian and Algerian).

name: MOHAMMAD
meaning: Persian and Tatar form of MUHAMMAD. It is also a variant transcription of the Arabic, Urdu, Punjabi, Pashto and Bengali name.

name: MOHAMMAT
meaning: Tatar variant of MOHAMMAD. This form is also usually transcribed Mohammad.

name: MOHANA
meaning: Means "bewitching, infatuating, charming" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the masculine form मोहन (an epithet of the Hindu gods Shiva, Krishna and Kama) and the feminine form मोहना.

name: MOHANDAS
meaning: Means "servant of Mohana" from the name of the Hindu god MOHANA combined with Sanskrit दास(dasa) meaning "servant". A famous bearer of this name was Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi (1869-1948), also known as Mahatma Gandhi, an Indian leader who struggled peacefully for independence from Britain.

name: MOHINDER
meaning: Variant of MAHENDRA used by Sikhs.

name: MOHINI
meaning: Means "infatuating" in Sanskrit. This was the name adopted by the Hindu god Vishnu when he took the form of a woman.

name: MOIRA
meaning: Anglicized form of MÁIRE. It also coincides with Greek Μοιρα(Moira) meaning "fate, destiny", the singular of Μοιραι, the Greek name for the Fates. They were the three female personifications of destiny in Greek mythology.

name: MOISÉS
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of MOSES.

name: MOJCA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian diminutive of MARIJA.

name: MOJISOLA
meaning: Means "wake up to wealth" in Yoruba.

name: MOKOSH
meaning: Derived from Slavic mok meaning "wet, moist". Mokosh was a Slavic goddess of weaving, women, water and fertility. She was often depicted as a woman with a large head and long arms.

name: MOLLY
meaning: Diminutive of MARY. It developed from Malle and Molle, other medieval diminutives. James Joyce used this name in his novel 'Ulysses' (1920), where it belongs to Molly Bloom, the wife of the main character.

name: MOMOKA
meaning: From Japanese 百(momo) meaning "hundred" or 桃(momo) meaning "peach" combined with 花(ka) meaning "flower" or 香(ka) meaning "fragrance". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: MOMOKO
meaning: From Japanese 百(momo) meaning "hundred" or 桃(momo) meaning "peach" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". This name can be constructed from other kanji combinations as well.

name: MONA  (1)
meaning: Anglicized form of MUADHNAIT. It is also associated with Greek monos "one" and Leonardo da Vinci's painting the 'Mona Lisa' (in which case it is a contraction of Italian ma donna meaning "my lady").

name: MONDAY
meaning: From the English word for the day of the week, which was derived from Old English mona "moon" and dæg "day". This was formerly given to girls born on Monday.

name: MONET
meaning: From a French surname which was derived from either HAMON or EDMOND. This was the surname of the French impressionist painter Claude Monet (1840-1926).

name: MONICA
meaning: Meaning unknown, most likely of North African or Phoenician origin. In the 4th century this name was borne by the North African saint Monica of Hippo, the mother of Saint Augustine, whom she converted to Christianity. Since the Middle Ages it has been associated with Latin moneo "advisor" and Greek monos "one". As an English name, Monica has been in general use since the 18th century.

name: MONROE
meaning: From a Scottish surname meaning "from the mouth of the Roe". The Roe is a river in Ireland. Two famous bearers of the surname were American president James Monroe (1758-1831) and American actress Marilyn Monroe (1926-1962).

name: MONTA
meaning: Modern Latvian name, possibly from Latin mons "mountain".

name: MONTAGUE
meaning: From a surname meaning "pointed mountain" in French.

name: MONTANA
meaning: From the name of the American state, which is derived from Latin montanus "mountainous".

name: MONTE
meaning: Either a diminutive of MONTGOMERY or from the Spanish or Italian vocabulary word meaning "mountain".

name: MONTGOMERY
meaning: From an English surname meaning "GUMARICH's mountain" in Norman French. A notable bearer of this surname was Bernard Montgomery (1887-1976), a British army commander during World War II.

name: MONTSERRAT
meaning: From the name of a mountain near Barcelona, the site of a monastery founded in the 10th century. The mountain gets its name from Latin mons serratus meaning "jagged mountain".

name: MORANA
meaning: From a Slavic root meaning "death, plague". In Slavic mythology this was the name of the goddess of winter and death.

name: MORDAD
meaning: Modern Persian form of AMORDAD. This is the name of the fifth month in the Iranian calendar.

name: MORDECAI
meaning: Means "servant of MARDUK" in Persian. In the Old Testament Mordecai is the cousin and foster father of Esther. He thwarted a plot to kill the Persian king, though he made an enemy of the king's chief advisor Haman.

name: MORDRED
meaning: From Welsh Medraut, possibly from Latin moderatus meaning "controlled, moderated". In Arthurian legend Mordred was the illegitimate son (in some versions nephew) of King Arthur. Mordred first appears briefly (as Medraut) in the 10th-century 'Annales Cambriae', but he was not portrayed as a traitor until the chronicles of the 12th-century Geoffrey of Monmouth. While Arthur is away he seduces his wife Guinevere and declares himself king. This prompts the battle of Camlann, which leads to the deaths of both Mordred and Arthur.

name: MOREEN
meaning: Anglicized form of MÓIRÍN. It is sometimes used as a variant of MAUREEN.

name: MORGAINE
meaning: Variant of MORGAN(2), from a French form.

name: MORGAN  (1)
meaning: From the Old Welsh masculine name Morcant, which was possibly derived from Welsh mor "sea" and cant "circle". Since the 1980s in America Morgan has been more common for girls than boys, perhaps due to stories of Morgan le Fay or the fame of actress Morgan Fairchild (1950-).

name: MORGAN  (2)
meaning: Modern form of Morgen, which was used by Geoffrey of Monmouth in the 12th century for the Arthurian sorceress Morgan le Fay, who was unnamed in earlier stories. Geoffrey probably did not derive it from the Welsh masculine name Morgan, which would have been spelled Morcant in his time. He may have based it on the Irish name MUIRGEN.

name: MORGANE
meaning: French, either a form of MORGAN(2) or a feminine form of MORGAN(1).

name: MORIAH
meaning: From Hebrew מֹרִיָה(Moriyah) possibly meaning "seen by YAHWEH". This is a place name in the Old Testament, both the land where Abraham is to sacrifice Isaac and the mountain upon which Solomon builds the temple. They may be the same place. Since the 1980s it has occasionally been used as a feminine given name in America.

name: MORIKO
meaning: From Japanese 森(mori) meaning "forest" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: MORLEY
meaning: From a surname which was originally from an Old English place name meaning "marsh clearing".

name: MORPHEUS
meaning: Derived from Greek μορφη(morphe) meaning "shape", referring to the shapes seen in dreams. In Greek mythology Morpheus was the god of dreams.

name: MORRIGAN
meaning: Derived from Irish Mór Ríoghain meaning "great queen". In Irish myth she was a goddess of war and death who often took the form of a crow.

name: MORT
meaning: Short form of MORTON or MORTIMER.

name: MORTEN
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of MARTIN.

name: MORTIMER
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a place name meaning "still water" in Old French.

name: MORTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "moor town" in Old English.

name: MORVEN
meaning: From a Scottish place name meaning "big gap". This was the name of Fingal's kingdom in James Macpherson's poems.

name: MORWENNA
meaning: Means "maiden" in Cornish (related to the Welsh word morwyn). This was the name of a 6th-century Cornish saint.

name: MOSES
meaning: From the Hebrew name מֹשֶׁה(Mosheh) which is most likely derived from Egyptian mes meaning "son", but could also possibly mean "deliver" in Hebrew. The meaning suggested in the Old Testament of "drew out" from Hebrew משה(mashah) is probably an invented etymology (see Exodus 2:10). The biblical Moses was drawn out of the Nile by the pharaoh's daughter and adopted into the royal family, at a time when the Israelites were slaves in Egypt. With his brother Aaron he demanded the pharaoh release the Israelites, which was only done after God sent ten plagues upon Egypt. Moses led the people across the Red Sea and to Mount Sinai, where he received the Ten Commandments from God. After 40 years of wandering in the desert the people reached Canaan, the Promised Land, but Moses died just before entering it....[more]

name: MOSTYN
meaning: From a Welsh place name which means "moss town" in Old English.

name: MOT
meaning: Means "death" in Ugaritic. This was the name of the Ugaritic god of death and the lord of the netherworld. He was a son of the supreme god El.

name: MOYSES
meaning: Variant Latin form of MOSES. This spelling is used in some versions of the Vulgate.

name: MPHO
meaning: Means "gift" in Tswana and Sotho, a derivative of fa "to offer".

name: MRIDULA
meaning: From Sanskrit मृदु(mridu) meaning "soft, delicate, gentle".

name: MSTISLAV
meaning: Means "vengeance and glory" from the Slavic elements misti "vengeance" and slava "glory".

name: MU
meaning: From Chinese 慕(mù) meaning "admire, desire", 木(mù) meaning "tree, wood", or other characters with similar pronunciations.

name: MU'TAMID
meaning: Means "relying on, leaning on" in Arabic. Al-Mu'tamid was a 9th-century Abbasid caliph. This was also the name of an 11th-century Abbadid ruler of Seville, who was a patron of the arts and a poet.

name: MUADHNAIT
meaning: Means "little noble one", derived from Irish muadh "noble, good" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: MUBIRU
meaning: Meaning unknown. This is the name of a figure in Ganda mythology associated with forests and hunting.

name: MUHAMAD
meaning: Indonesian, Malay and Avar variant of MUHAMMAD.

name: MUHAMADKHAN
meaning: Combination of MUHAMAD and the Turkic title khan meaning "ruler, leader".

name: MUHAMMAD
meaning: Means "praiseworthy", derived from Arabic حمد(hamid) meaning "to praise". This was the name of the prophet who founded the Islamic religion in the 7th century. According to Muslim belief, at age 40 Muhammad was visited by the angel Gabriel, who provided him with the first verses of the Qur'an. Approximately 20 years later he conquered Mecca, the city of his birth, and his followers controlled most of the Arabian Peninsula at the time of his death in 632....[more]

name: MUHAMMADU
meaning: Hausa and Fula form of MUHAMMAD.

name: MUHAMMED
meaning: Turkish form of MUHAMMAD, as well as a variant transcription of the Arabic name.

name: MUIR
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from a Scottish place name meaning "moor, fen". It also means "sea" in Scottish Gaelic.

name: MUIRCHERTACH
meaning: Means "mariner" in Gaelic. This was the name of a 6th-century Irish high king.

name: MUIREDACH
meaning: Means "lord" in Irish. This was the name of several legendary and historical kings of Ireland.

name: MUIRENN
meaning: Either derived from Gaelic muir "sea" and fionn "fair, white", or else a variant of MUIRNE.

name: MUIRGEL
meaning: Means "bright sea", derived from Gaelic muir "sea" and geal "bright".

name: MUIRGEN
meaning: Means "born of the sea" in Gaelic. In Irish legend this was the name of a woman (originally named Líban) who was transformed into a mermaid. After 300 years she was brought to shore, baptized, and transformed back into a woman.

name: MUIRNE
meaning: Means "festive" in Irish Gaelic. In Irish legend this was the name of the mother of Fionn mac Cumhail.

name: MUKAMI
meaning: Possibly means "the one who milks the cows" in Kikuyu.

name: MUKESHA
meaning: Means "ruler of Muka" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu god Shiva, given to him because he killed Muka, a demon in the form of a wild boar.

name: MUMBI
meaning: Means "she who shapes" in Kikuyu. In Kikuyu mythology Mumbi was the wife of Gikuyu and the mother of his nine daughters.

name: MUNA
meaning: Means "wishes, desires", from the plural of Arabic منية(munyah).

name: MUNGO
meaning: Possibly derived from Welsh mwyn "gentle, kind". This was a nickname of the 6th-century Saint Kentigern.

name: MURAD
meaning: Means "wish, desire" in Arabic. This name was borne by several Ottoman sultans.

name: MURALI
meaning: Means "flute" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu god Krishna, given to him because he played the flute.

name: MURAT
meaning: Turkish and Bosnian form of MURAD.

name: MURCHADH
meaning: Derived from Gaelic muir "sea" and cadh "warrior".

name: MURDO
meaning: Anglicized form of MUIREADHACH or MURCHADH.

name: MURIEL
meaning: Medieval English form of a Celtic name which was probably related to the Irish name MUIRGEL. The Normans brought it to England from Brittany. In the modern era it was popularized by a character from Dinah Craik's novel 'John Halifax, Gentleman' (1856).

name: MURPHY
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Murchadha meaning "descendant of MURCHADH".

name: MURRAY
meaning: From a surname, which is either Scottish or Irish in origin (see MURRAY(1) and MURRAY(2)).

name: MURTAGH
meaning: Anglicized form of MUIRCHERTACH or MUIREDACH.

name: MURUGAN
meaning: Possibly from a Dravidian word meaning "youth". This is the name of a Tamil war god identified with Skanda.

name: MUSA
meaning: Arabic, Turkish and Persian form of MOSES.

name: MUSCOWEQUAN
meaning: Means "hard quill" in Cree. This was the name of a 19th-century Cree chief.

name: MUSTAFA
meaning: Means "the chosen one" in Arabic, an epithet of Muhammad. This was the name of four Ottoman sultans. Another famous bearer was Mustafa Kemal (1881-1938), also known as Atatürk, the founder of modern Turkey.

name: MWANGI
meaning: Means "rapid expansion" in Kikuyu. Kikuyu males were traditionally organized into age sets or generations. The Mwangi generation started around the beginning of the 20th century and lasted for about 30 years.

name: MYEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 明(myeong) meaning "bright, light, clear" or other hanja characters with the same pronunciation. Although it does appear rarely as a single-character name, it is more often used in combination with another character.

name: MYEONG-SUK
meaning: From Sino-Korean 明(myeong) meaning "bright, light, clear" combined with 淑(suk) meaning "good, pure, virtuous, charming". Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: MYFANWY
meaning: Means "my woman" from the Welsh prefix my "my" combined with banw "woman".

name: MYLES  (2)
meaning: Probably from Greek μυλη(myle) meaning "mill". This was the name of a king of Laconia in Greek mythology.

name: MYLÈNE
meaning: Contraction of MARIE and HÉLÈNE. It can also be used as a French form of MILENA.

name: MYRA
meaning: Created by the 17th-century poet Fulke Greville. He possibly based it on Latin myrra meaning "myrrh" (a fragrant resin obtained from a tree). Otherwise, he may have simply rearranged the letters from the name MARY. Although unrelated etymologically, this is also the name of an ancient city of Anatolia.

name: MYRON
meaning: Derived from Greek μυρον(myron) meaning "sweet oil, perfume". Myron was the name of a 5th-century BC Greek sculptor. Saints bearing this name include a 3rd-century bishop of Crete and a 4th-century martyr from Cyzicus who was killed by a mob. These saints are more widely revered in the Eastern Church, and the name has generally been more common among Eastern Christians. As an English name, it has been used since the 19th century.

name: MYRTLE
meaning: Simply from the English word myrtle for the evergreen shrub, ultimately from Greek μυρτος(myrtos). It was first used as a given name in the 19th century, at the same time many other plant and flower names were coined.

name: MÁEDÓC
meaning: Meaning unknown. Saint Máedóc (also known as Áedán) of Ferns was a 7th-century Irish bishop.

name: MÁEL MÁEDÓC
meaning: Means "disciple of Saint MÁEDÓC" in Irish. Saint Máel Máedóc (also known as Malachy) was a 12th-century archbishop of Armagh.

name: MÁEL SECHNAILL
meaning: Means "disciple of Saint SEACHNALL" in Irish. This was the name of two Irish high kings: Máel Sechnaill mac Máele Ruanaid who ruled all of Ireland in the 9th century; and Máel Sechnaill mac Domnaill (called Malachy) who defeated the Norse of Dublin in the 10th century.

name: MÁRIA
meaning: Hungarian and Slovak form of MARIA.

name: MÁTYÁS
meaning: Hungarian form of MATTHIAS. This was the name of two Hungarian kings.

name: MÄDCHEN
meaning: Means "girl" in German. It is not used as a name in Germany itself.

name: MÉLISANDE
meaning: French form of MILLICENT used by Maurice Maeterlinck in his play 'Pelléas et Mélisande' (1893). The play was later adapted by Claude Debussy into an opera (1902).

name: MÓR
meaning: Means "great" in Gaelic. It is sometimes translated into English as SARAH.

name: MÜGE
meaning: Means "lily of the valley" in Turkish (species Convallaria majalis).

name: NA
meaning: From Chinese 娜(nà) meaning "elegant, graceful, delicate" or other characters pronounced similarly.

name: NA'IM
meaning: Means "tranquil, happy, at ease" in Arabic.

name: NAAMAH
meaning: Means "pleasant" in Hebrew. This name is borne in the Old Testament by both a daughter of Lamech and a wife of Solomon. Some later Jewish texts give Naamah as the name of Noah's wife, even though she is not named in the Old Testament.

name: NABU
meaning: Possibly from a Semitic root meaning "to announce". This was the name of an Assyrian and Babylonian god of wisdom, letters and writing.

name: NADAB
meaning: Means "generous" in Hebrew. This is the name of a son of Aaron in the Old Testament. He was consumed by flames and killed when he offered unauthorized fire to God. It was also the name of the second king of Israel.

name: NADEŽDA
meaning: Slovak, Serbian and Latvian form of NADEZHDA.

name: NADIA  (1)
meaning: Variant of NADYA(1) used in the Western world, as well as a variant transcription of the Slavic name. It began to be used in France in the 19th century. The name received a boost in popularity from the Romanian gymnast Nadia Comaneci (1961-).

name: NADIM
meaning: Means "drinking companion", derived from Arabic ندم(nadima) meaning "to drink together".

name: NADIYA
meaning: Diminutive of NADEZHDA, as well as being the modern Ukrainian word meaning "hope".

name: NADJA
meaning: German and Slovene form of NADYA(1).

name: NADZIEJA
meaning: Polish cognate of NADEZHDA, being the modern Polish word meaning "hope".

name: NAENIA
meaning: Means "incantation, dirge" in Latin. This was the name of the Roman goddess of funerals.

name: NAGENDRA
meaning: Means "lord of snakes" from Sanskrit नाग(naga) meaning "snake" (also "elephant") combined with the name of the Hindu god INDRA, used here to mean "lord". This is another name for Vasuki, the king of snakes, in Hindu mythology.

name: NAGORE
meaning: From the name of a Basque village where there is a sanctuary dedicated to the Virgin Mary.

name: NAHID
meaning: Modern Persian form of ANAHITA. This is also the Persian name for the planet Venus.

name: NAHOR
meaning: Means "snorting" in Hebrew. Nahor is the name of both the grandfather and a brother of Abraham in the Old Testament.

name: NAHUM
meaning: Means "comforter" in Hebrew, from the root נָחַם(nacham). Nahum is one of the twelve minor prophets of the Old Testament. He authored the Book of Nahum in which the downfall of Nineveh is foretold.

name: NAIARA
meaning: From the Basque name of the Spanish city of Nájera, which is Arabic in origin. In the 12th century there was a reported apparition of the Virgin Mary in a nearby cave.

name: NAICHE
meaning: Means "mischief maker" in Apache. This name was borne by a 19th-century Chiricahua Apache chief, the son of Cochise.

name: NAIDA
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly derived from Greek Ναιαδ(Naiad), a type of water nymph in Greek mythology.

name: NAILA
meaning: Feminine form of NAIL. This was the name of the wife of Uthman, the third caliph of the Muslims. She tried in vain to prevent a mob from murdering her husband, and had several fingers cut off in the process.

name: NAIRYOSANGHA
meaning: Derived from Avestan nairyo "male" and sangha "word". Nairyosangha was a Zoroastrian Yazata (or angel) who served as a messenger for Ahura Mazda.

name: NAJI
meaning: Means "intimate friend" in Arabic. It can also be a variant transcription of NAAJI.

name: NALA
meaning: Means "stem" in Sanskrit. This is the name of a king of the Nishadha people in the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata'.

name: NALANI
meaning: Means "the heavens" or "the chiefs" from Hawaiian nā, a definite article, and lani "heaven, sky, chief".

name: NALDO
meaning: Short form of names ending in naldo.

name: NALIAKA
meaning: Means "born during the weeding season", from Luhya liliaka meaning "weeding".

name: NAN
meaning: Originally a diminutive of ANN. It may have originated with the affectionate phrase mine Ann, which was later reinterpreted as my Nan. It is now also used as a short form of NANCY.

name: NANA  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens" and/or 奈(na), a phonetic character. The characters can be in either order or the same character can be duplicated, as indicated by the symbol 々. Other kanji with the same pronunciations can also be used to form this name.

name: NANA  (3)
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of a 4th-century queen consort of Georgia who is regarded as a saint in the Orthodox Church.

name: NANABOZHO
meaning: Means "my rabbit" in Ojibwe. In Anishinaabe mythology Nanabozho (also called Wenabozho) is the name of a trickster spirit.

name: NANAKO
meaning: From Japanese 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens" duplicated and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible as well.

name: NANAMI
meaning: From Japanese 七(nana) meaning "seven" and 海(mi) meaning "sea". It can also come from 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens" duplicated and 美(mi) meaning "beautiful". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: NANAYA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly related to INANNA. This was the name of a goddess worshipped by the Sumerians and Akkadians. She was later conflated with the goddesses Anahita and Aphrodite.

name: NANCY
meaning: Previously a medieval diminutive of ANNIS, though since the 18th century it has been a diminutive of ANN. It is now usually regarded as an independent name. During the 20th century it became very popular in the United States. A city in the Lorraine region of France bears this name, though it derives from a different source.

name: NAND
meaning: Modern northern Indian form of NANDA.

name: NANDA
meaning: Means "joy" in Sanskrit. In Hindu texts this is a name of both Vishnu and the foster-father of Krishna, as well as various other characters. In Buddhist texts this is the name of a god and a disciple of Buddha. Nanda was also the name of a 4th-century BC king who founded a dynasty in Magadha in India.

name: NANNA  (1)
meaning: Possibly derived from Old Norse nanþ meaning "daring, brave". In Norse legend she was a goddess who died of grief when her husband Balder was killed.

name: NANNA  (2)
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of the Sumerian god of the moon. He was the son of Enlil and the husband of Ningal.

name: NANOOK
meaning: Variant of NANUQ. This was the (fictional) name of the subject of Robert Flaherty's documentary film 'Nanook of the North' (1922).

name: NAOISE
meaning: Meaning unknown, presumably of Gaelic origin. In Irish legend he was the young man who eloped with Deirdre, the beloved of Conchobhar the king of Ulster. Conchobhar eventually succeeded in having Naoise murdered, which caused Deirdre to die of grief.

name: NAOKI
meaning: From Japanese 直(nao) meaning "straight" and 樹(ki) meaning "tree", as well as other combinations of different kanji with the same pronunciations.

name: NAOKO
meaning: From Japanese 直(nao) meaning "straight" and 子(ko) meaning "child", as well as other kanji combinations.

name: NAOMHÁN
meaning: Means "little saint", derived from Irish naomh "saint" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: NAOMI  (1)
meaning: From the Hebrew name נָעֳמִי(Na'omi) meaning "pleasantness". In the Old Testament this is the name of the mother-in-law of Ruth. After the death of her husband and sons, she returned to Bethlehem with Ruth. There she declared that her name should be Mara (see Ruth 1:20)....[more]

name: NAOMI  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 直(nao) meaning "straight" and 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" (usually feminine) or 己(mi) meaning "self" (usually masculine). Other kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: NAOUM
meaning: Form of NAHUM used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: NAPHTALI
meaning: Means "my struggle, my strife" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is a son of Jacob by Rachel's servant Bilhah, and the ancestor of one of the twelve tribes of Israel.

name: NAPIER
meaning: From an English and Scots surname which meant "linen keeper" in Middle English, from Old French nappe "table cloth".

name: NAPOLEON
meaning: From the old Italian name Napoleone, used most notably by the French emperor Napoléon Bonaparte (1769-1821), who was born on Corsica. The etymology is uncertain, but it is possibly derived from the Germanic Nibelungen meaning "sons of mist", a name used in Germanic mythology to refer to the keepers of a hoard of treasure (often identified with the Burgundians). Alternatively, it could be connected to the name of the Italian city of Napoli (Naples).

name: NAPOLEONE
meaning: Original Italian form of NAPOLEON. Besides the French emperor, it was borne by the 14th-century cardinal Napoleone Orsini and the Italian writer and politician Napoleone Colajanni (1847-1921).

name: NARAYAN
meaning: Modern northern Indian form of NARAYANA.

name: NARAYANA
meaning: Means "path of man" in Sanskrit. In Hindu belief this is the name of the god of creation, later synonymous with the god Brahma, and even later with Vishnu.

name: NARAYANAN
meaning: Malayalam and Tamil variant of NARAYANA.

name: NARCISO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of NARCISSUS. This is also the word for the narcissus flower in those languages.

name: NARCISSE
meaning: French masculine and feminine form of NARCISSUS. This is also the French word for the narcissus flower.

name: NARCISSUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Ναρκισσος(Narkissos), possibly derived from ναρκη(narke) meaning "sleep, numbness". Narkissos was a beautiful youth in Greek mythology who stared at his own reflection for so long that he eventually died and was turned into the narcissus flower....[more]

name: NARCYZ
meaning: Polish form of NARCISSUS. This is also the Polish word for the narcissus flower.

name: NARCÍS
meaning: Catalan form of NARCISSUS. This is also the Catalan word for the narcissus flower.

name: NAREK
meaning: From the name of a 10th-century Armenian saint, Grigor of Narek, who came from the town of Narek (formerly in Armenia, now in eastern Turkey).

name: NARELLE
meaning: Meaning unknown. It was borne by the wife of Umbarra, who was a 19th-century leader of the Yuin, an Aboriginal people.

name: NARENDRA
meaning: Means "lord of men" from Sanskrit नर(nara) meaning "man" combined with the name of the Hindu god INDRA, used here to mean "lord".

name: NARGES
meaning: Means "daffodil, narcissus flower" in Persian, ultimately derived from Greek (see NARCISSUS).

name: NARINDER
meaning: Variant of NARENDRA used by Sikhs.

name: NARSES
meaning: Hellenized form of the Persian name Narseh, which was derived from Avestan NAIRYOSANGHA. This name was borne by a Byzantine general of Armenian descent who helped restore Italy to the Roman Empire during the reign of Justinian I in the 6th century.

name: NASH
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the Middle English phrase atten ash "at the ash tree". A famous bearer of the surname was the mathematician John Nash (1928-2015). The name was popularized in the 1990s by the television series 'Nash Bridges'.

name: NASIR
meaning: Means "helper" in Arabic. This transcription represents two different Arabic names.

name: NAT
meaning: Short form of NATHAN, NATHANIEL, NATALIE, or other names beginning with Nat.

name: NATACHA
meaning: French and Portuguese form of NATASHA.

name: NATALI
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of NATALIE.

name: NATALIE
meaning: From the Late Latin name Natalia, which meant "Christmas Day" from Latin natale domini. This was the name of the wife of the 4th-century martyr Saint Adrian of Nicomedia. She is venerated as a saint in the Orthodox Church, and the name has traditionally been more common among Eastern Christians than those in the West. It was popularized in America by actress Natalie Wood (1938-1981), who was born to Russian immigrants.

name: NATALIJA
meaning: Serbian, Croatian, Slovene and Macedonian form of Natalia (see NATALIE).

name: NATALIYA
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of Natalia (see NATALIE).

name: NATALKA
meaning: Ukrainian and Polish diminutive of Natalia (see NATALIE).

name: NATANAEL
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of NATHANAEL.

name: NATANAIL
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of NATHANAEL.

name: NATASHA
meaning: Russian diminutive of NATALYA. This is the name of a character in Leo Tolstoy's novel 'War and Peace' (1865). It has been used in the English-speaking world only since the 20th century.

name: NATAŠA
meaning: Serbian, Croatian, Slovene and Macedonian form of NATASHA.

name: NATE
meaning: Short form of NATHAN or NATHANIEL.

name: NATELA
meaning: Derived from Georgian ნათელი(nateli) meaning "light, bright".

name: NATHALIE
meaning: French form of NATALIE, as well as a Dutch, German and Scandinavian variant.

name: NATHAN
meaning: From the Hebrew name נָתָן(Natan) meaning "he gave". In the Old Testament this is the name of a prophet during the reign of King David. He chastised David for his adultery with Bathsheba and for the death of Uriah the Hittite. Later he championed Solomon as David's successor. This was also the name of a son of David and Bathsheba....[more]

name: NATHANAEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name ןְתַןְאֵל(Netan'el) meaning "God has given", from the elements נָתַן(natan) meaning "to give" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". It is borne by several minor characters in the Old Testament, typically spelled Nethanel or Nethaneel. In the New Testament this is the name of an apostle, probably another name of the apostle called Bartholomew.

name: NATHANAHEL
meaning: Form of NATHANAEL used in the Latin Bible.

name: NATHANIEL
meaning: Variant of NATHANAEL. It has been regularly used in the English-speaking world since the Protestant Reformation. This has been the most popular spelling, even though the spelling Nathanael is found in most versions of the New Testament. The American writer Nathaniel Hawthorne (1804-1864), author of 'The Scarlet Letter', was a famous bearer of this name.

name: NATISHA
meaning: Variant of NATASHA, probably modeled on LATISHA.

name: NATSUKI
meaning: From Japanese 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens" and 月(tsuki) meaning "moon". Alternatively, it can come from 夏(natsu) meaning "summer" and 希(ki) meaning "hope". Other kanji combinations can form this name as well.

name: NATSUKO
meaning: From Japanese 夏(natsu) meaning "summer" and 子(ko) meaning "child", as well as other kanji combinations.

name: NATSUMI
meaning: From Japanese 夏(natsu) meaning "summer" and 美(mi) meaning "beautiful". It can also come from 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens" and 摘(tsumi) meaning "pick, pluck". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: NATÁLIA
meaning: Portuguese, Slovak and Hungarian form of Natalia (see NATALIE).

name: NAUM
meaning: Russian and Bulgarian form of NAHUM.

name: NAUSICAA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Ναυσικαα(Nausikaa) meaning "burner of ships". In Homer's epic the 'Odyssey' this is the name of a daughter of Alcinous who helps Odysseus on his journey home.

name: NAVDEEP
meaning: From Sanskrit नव(nava) meaning "new, fresh" and दीप(dipa) meaning "lamp, light".

name: NAVNEET
meaning: From Sanskrit नव(nava) meaning "new, fresh" and नित्य(nitya) meaning "eternal".

name: NAZAR
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian, Turkmen and Armenian form of NAZARIUS.

name: NAZARET
meaning: From Nazareth, the town in Galilee where Jesus lived. This name is feminine in Spanish and masculine in Armenian.

name: NAZARIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of NAZARIUS.

name: NAZARIUS
meaning: Latin name meaning "from Nazareth". Nazareth was the town in Galilee where Jesus lived. This name was borne by several early saints, including a man martyred with Celsus in Milan.

name: NAZARIY
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of NAZARIUS.

name: NAZLI
meaning: Turkish form of NAZLI. This name is spelled with a Turkish dotless i, as Nazlı.

name: NAZZARENO
meaning: Italian form of the Late Latin Nazarenus, which meant "from Nazareth, Nazarene". Nazareth was the town in Galilee where Jesus lived. According to the New Testament, the phrase Iesus Nazarenus, Rex Iudaeorum meaning "Jesus the Nazarene, king of the Jews", was inscribed on the cross upon which Jesus was crucified.

name: NEASA
meaning: Meaning uncertain. In Irish legend she was the mother of Conchobhar, king of Ulster. According to some versions of the legend she was originally named Assa meaning "gentle", but was renamed Ni-assa "not gentle" after she sought to avenge the murders of her foster fathers.

name: NEBO
meaning: Form of NABU used in the Old Testament.

name: NEBUCHADNEZZAR
meaning: From the Akkadian name Nabu-kudurri-usur meaning "NABU preserve my firstborn son". This name was borne by a 12th-century BC king of the Babylonian Empire. It was also borne by a 6th-century BC king of the Neo-Babylonian Empire. He captured Jerusalem, and ultimately destroyed the city's temple and deported many of its citizens, as told in the Old Testament.

name: NECHTAN
meaning: Celtic name of uncertain meaning, possibly meaning "damp" (cognate with NEPTUNE). In Irish mythology Nechtan was the husband of Boand, the goddess of the River Boyne. This name was also borne by the 5th-century Saint Nectan of Hartland in Devon, who was supposedly born in Ireland. It was also the name of several kings of the Picts.

name: NED
meaning: Diminutive of EDWARD or EDMUND. It has been used since the 14th century, and may have had root in the medieval affectionate phrase mine Ed, which was later reinterpreted as my Ned.

name: NEDELJKO
meaning: Derived from Croatian nedjelja and Serbian недеља(nedelja) meaning "Sunday".

name: NEELY
meaning: From a Scottish surname, an Anglicized form of Mac an Fhilidh meaning "son of the poet" in Gaelic.

name: NEEMIAS
meaning: Form of NEHEMIAH used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: NEFERTARI
meaning: From Egyptian Nfrt-jrj meaning "the most beautiful". This was the name of an Egyptian queen of the New Kingdom, the favourite wife of Rameses II.

name: NEFERTITI
meaning: From Egyptian Nfrt-jytj meaning "the beautiful one has come". Nefertiti was a powerful Egyptian queen of the New Kingdom, the principal wife of Akhenaton, the pharaoh that briefly imposed a monotheistic religion centered around the sun god Aton.

name: NEHA
meaning: Possibly from Sanskrit स्नेह(sneha) meaning "love, tenderness".

name: NEHEMIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH comforts" in Hebrew, derived from נָחַם(nacham) meaning "to comfort" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. According to the Book of Nehemiah in the Old Testament he was a leader of the Jews who was responsible for the rebuilding of Jerusalem after the return from the Babylonian captivity.

name: NEIL
meaning: From the Gaelic name Niall, which is of disputed origin, possibly meaning "champion" or "cloud". This was the name of a semi-legendary 4th-century Irish king, Niall of the Nine Hostages....[more]

name: NEITH
meaning: Greek form of Egyptian Nit, possibly meaning "water". This was the name of an early Egyptian goddess of weaving, hunting and war. Her character may have some correspondences with the goddesses Tanith, Anat or Athena.

name: NEKANE
meaning: Means "sorrows" in Basque. It is a Basque equivalent of Dolores.

name: NEKODA
meaning: Means "marked" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the head of a family of temple servants.

name: NELA
meaning: Short form of names ending in nela, such as ANTONELA.

name: NELDA
meaning: Possibly an elaboration of NELL using the popular name suffix da.

name: NELL
meaning: Medieval diminutive of names beginning with El, such as ELEANOR, ELLEN(1) or HELEN. It may have arisen from the medieval affectionate phrase mine El, which was later reinterpreted as my Nel.

name: NELSON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of NEIL". It was originally given in honour of the British admiral Horatio Nelson (1758-1805). His most famous battle was the Battle of Trafalgar, in which he destroyed a combined French and Spanish fleet, but was himself killed. Another notable bearer was the South African statesman Nelson Mandela (1918-2013). Mandela's birth name was Rolihlahla; as a child he was given the English name Nelson by a teacher.

name: NEMANJA
meaning: Possibly from Slavic ne maniti meaning "not deceiving, not luring, not attracting". Another theory states that it means "without possessions", derived from Serbo-Croatian nemati meaning "have not". This was the name of a 12th-century Serbian king, and the name of the dynasty he began.

name: NEMESIS
meaning: Means "distribution of what is due, righteous anger" in Greek. In Greek mythology Nemesis was personification of vengeance and justice.

name: NEMO
meaning: Means "nobody" in Latin. This was the name used by author Jules Verne for the captain of the Nautilus in his novel 'Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea' (1870). It was later used for the title character (a fish) in the 2003 animated movie 'Finding Nemo'.

name: NENAD
meaning: Means "unexpected" in Serbian and Croatian. In the Serbian folk song 'Predrag and Nenad' this is the name of Predrag's brother.

name: NEO  (1)
meaning: Means "gift" in Tswana, a derivative of naya "to give".

name: NEO  (2)
meaning: From the prefix meaning "new", ultimately derived from Greek νεος(neos).

name: NEOFIT
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of NEOPHYTOS.

name: NEOPHYTOS
meaning: Greek name meaning "newly planted", from a word which was derived from νεος(neos) "new" and φυτον(phyton) "plant".

name: NEOPTOLEMUS
meaning: From the Greek name Νεοπτολεμος(Neoptolemos) meaning "new war", derived from νεος(neos) "new" and πολεμος(polemos) "war". In Greek legend this was the name of the son of Achilles, brought into the Trojan War because it was prophesied the Greeks could not win it unless he was present. After the war he was slain by Orestes fighting over Hermione.

name: NEPHELE
meaning: From Greek νεφος(nephos) meaning "cloud". In Greek legend Nephele was created from a cloud by Zeus, who shaped the cloud to look like Hera in order to trick Ixion, a mortal who desired her. Nephele was the mother of the centaurs by Ixion, and was also the mother of Phrixus and Helle by Athamus.

name: NEPHTHYS
meaning: Greek form of Egyptian Nebt-Het meaning "lady of the house", derived from Egyptian nbt "lady" and hwt "house". This was the name of an Egyptian goddess associated with the air, death and mourning. She was wife of the desert god Seth.

name: NEPTUNE
meaning: From the Latin Neptunus, which is of unknown meaning, possibly related to the Indo-European root *nebh "wet, damp, clouds". Neptune was the god of the sea in Roman mythology, approximately equivalent to the Greek god Poseidon. This is also the name of the eighth planet in the solar system.

name: NEREIDA
meaning: Derived from Greek Νηρειδες(Nereides) meaning "nymphs, sea sprites", ultimately derived from the name of the Greek sea god NEREUS, who supposedly fathered them.

name: NEREUS
meaning: Derived from Greek νηρος(neros) meaning "water". In Greek myth this was the name of a god of the sea, the father of the Nereids. It is mentioned briefly in the New Testament, belonging to a Christian in Rome. This was also the name of a Roman saint of the 1st century, a member of the army, who was martyred with his companion Achilleus because they refused to execute Christians.

name: NERGÜI
meaning: Means "no name" in Mongolian. This name was traditionally given in order to mislead bad spirits.

name: NERGİS
meaning: Means "daffodil, narcissus flower" in Turkish, ultimately derived from Greek (see NARCISSUS).

name: NERIAH
meaning: Means "lamp of YAHWEH" in Hebrew, from נִיר(nir) meaning "lamp, light" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. This is the name of the father of Baruch in the Old Testament.

name: NERIDA
meaning: Possibly means "water lily" in an Australian Aboriginal language.

name: NERISSA
meaning: Created by Shakespeare for a character in his play 'The Merchant of Venice' (1596). He possibly took it from Greek Νηρεις(Nereis) meaning "nymph, sea sprite", ultimately derived from the name of the Greek sea god NEREUS, who supposedly fathered them.

name: NERO  (1)
meaning: Roman cognomen, which was probably of Sabine origin meaning "strong, vigourous". It was borne most infamously by a tyrannical Roman emperor of the 1st century.

name: NERSES
meaning: Armenian form of Narseh (see NARSES). Saint Nerses was a 4th-century patriarch of the Armenian Church.

name: NERTHUS
meaning: Latinized form of Nerþuz, the Germanic (feminine) equivalent of Njörðr (see NJORD). Nerthus was a Germanic goddess of fertility as described by the Roman historian Tacitus in the 1st century.

name: NERVA
meaning: Roman cognomen derived from Latin nervus "strength". This is the name by which the 1st-century Roman emperor Marcus Cocceius Nerva is commonly known.

name: NERYS
meaning: Perhaps an elaboration of Welsh ner "lord", with the intended meaning of "lady".

name: NES
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of AGNES.

name: NESKE
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish diminutive of AGNES.

name: NESSA  (1)
meaning: Short form of VANESSA and other names ending in nessa.

name: NESTAN
meaning: From the first part of NESTAN-DAREJAN.

name: NESTAN-DAREJAN
meaning: Created by the Georgian poet Shota Rustaveli for a character in his 12th-century epic 'The Knight in the Panther's Skin'. Rustaveli derived it from the Middle Persian phrase نیست اندر جهان(nist andar jahan) meaning "unlike any other in the world" or "unique". In the poem Nestan-Darejan is a princess loved by Tariel.

name: NESTANI
meaning: From the second part of NESTAN-DAREJAN.

name: NESTOR
meaning: Means "homecoming" in Greek. In Homer's 'Iliad' this was the name of the king of Pylos, famous for his great wisdom and longevity, who acted as a counselor to the Greek allies.

name: NETHANEEL
meaning: Form of NATHANAEL used in some versions of the Old Testament.

name: NETHANEL
meaning: Hebrew form of NATHANAEL, also used in some versions of the English-language Old Testament.

name: NETHANIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH has given" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the father of Ishmael (the assassin of Gedaliah), as well as other minor characters.

name: NETTA  (1)
meaning: Short form of names ending in netta.

name: NETTIE
meaning: Diminutive of names ending in nette, such as ANNETTE or JEANETTE.

name: NEVADA
meaning: From the name of the American state, which means "snow-capped" in Spanish.

name: NEVAEH
meaning: The word heaven spelled backwards. It became popular after the musician Sonny Sandoval from the rock group P.O.D. gave it to his daughter in 2000.

name: NEVENA
meaning: Derived from South Slavic neven meaning "marigold".

name: NEVILLE
meaning: From an English surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "new town" in Norman French. As a given name it is chiefly British and Australian.

name: NEVIO
meaning: Italian form of the Roman family name Naevius, which was derived from Latin naevus "mole (on the body)". A famous bearer was the 3rd-century BC Roman poet Gnaeus Naevius.

name: NEWTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "new town" in Old English. A famous bearer of the surname was the English physicist Isaac Newton (1643-1727).

name: NGAIO
meaning: Maori name which is derived from the name of a type of tree, also called the mousehole tree. This name was borne by New Zealand crime writer Dame Ngaio Marsh (1895-1982).

name: NGAWANG
meaning: Means "powerful speech" in Tibetan, from ངག(ngag) meaning "speech" and དབང(dbang) meaning "power, force".

name: NGỌC
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 玉(ngọc) meaning "jade, precious stone, gem".

name: NIA  (3)
meaning: Short form of ANTONIA, SIDONIA and other names ending in nia.

name: NIAMH
meaning: Means "bright" in Irish. She was the daughter of the sea god in Irish legends. She fell in love with the poet Oisín, son of Fionn.

name: NIC
meaning: Short form of NICHOLAS, or sometimes DOMINIC.

name: NICANOR
meaning: From the Greek name Νικανωρ(Nikanor), which was derived from νικη(nike) "victory". This name was borne by several notable officers from ancient Macedon.

name: NICCOLÒ
meaning: Italian form of NICHOLAS. A famous bearer was Niccolò Machiavelli, a 16th-century political philosopher from Florence.

name: NICHOLAS
meaning: From the Greek name Νικολαος(Nikolaos) which meant "victory of the people" from Greek νικη(nike) "victory" and λαος(laos) "people". Saint Nicholas was a 4th-century bishop from Anatolia who, according to legend, saved the daughters of a poor man from lives of prostitution. He is the patron saint of children, sailors and merchants, as well as Greece and Russia. He formed the basis for the figure known as Santa Claus (created in the 19th century from Dutch Sinterklaas), the bringer of Christmas presents....[more]

name: NICO
meaning: Short form of NICHOLAS (or sometimes NICODEMUS).

name: NICODEMO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of NICODEMUS.

name: NICODEMUS
meaning: From the Greek name Νικοδημος(Nikodemos) which meant "victory of the people" from Greek νικη(nike) "victory" and δημος(demos) "the people". This is the name of a character in the New Testament who helps Joseph of Arimathea entomb Jesus.

name: NICOL  (1)
meaning: Medieval English and Scottish form of NICHOLAS. This was the middle name of character in the novel 'Rob Roy' (1817) by Sir Walter Scott.

name: NICOL  (2)
meaning: Dutch, German and Czech variant of NICOLE.

name: NICOLA  (1)
meaning: Italian form of NICHOLAS. A notable bearer was the 13th-century sculptor Nicola Pisano.

name: NICOLA  (2)
meaning: Latinate feminine form of NICHOLAS. In the English-speaking world this name is more common outside of America, where Nicole is more usual.

name: NICOLAU
meaning: Portuguese, Galician and Catalan form of NICHOLAS.

name: NICOLAUS
meaning: Latinized form of Nikolaos (see NICHOLAS). This form is also used in Germany as a variant of NIKOLAUS.

name: NICOLE
meaning: French feminine form of NICHOLAS, commonly used in the English-speaking world since the middle of the 20th century. A famous bearer is American-Australian actress Nicole Kidman (1967-).

name: NIELS  (1)
meaning: Danish form of NICHOLAS. A famous bearer was Niels Bohr (1885-1962), a Danish physicist who investigated the structure of atoms.

name: NIEVES
meaning: Means "snows" in Spanish, derived from the title of the Virgin Mary Nuestra Señora de las Nieves meaning "Our Lady of the Snows".

name: NIGEL
meaning: From Nigellus, a medieval Latinized form of NEIL. It was commonly associated with Latin niger "black". It was revived in the 19th century, perhaps in part due to Sir Walter Scott's novel 'The Fortunes of Nigel' (1822).

name: NIK
meaning: Short form of NIKOLAS, NIKOLAOS, NIKOLAJ or NIKOLA(1).

name: NIKA  (1)
meaning: Russian short form of VERONIKA and other names ending in nika. It can also be a short form of NIKITA(1) (masculine).

name: NIKANDROS
meaning: Means "victory of a man" from the Greek elements νικη(nike) "victory" and ανηρ(aner) "man" (genitive ανδρος). This was the name of a 2nd-century BC Greek poet and grammarian.

name: NIKAU
meaning: From the name of a type of palm tree found in New Zealand (species Rhopalostylis sapida).

name: NIKE
meaning: Means "victory" in Greek. Nike was the Greek goddess of victory.

name: NIKEISHA
meaning: Combination of the name prefix Ni and the name KEISHA.

name: NIKEPHOROS
