meaning: Means "carrying victory" from Greek νικη(nike) "victory" and φερω(phero) "to carry, to bear". This name was borne by several Byzantine emperors, including the 10th-century Nikephoros II Phokas. Besides being a masculine personal name, it was also a title borne by the goddess Athena.

name: NIKETAS
meaning: Derived from Greek νικητης(niketes) meaning "winner, victor". Saint Niketas was a 4th-century bishop of Remesiana in Serbia. He is a patron saint of Romania.

name: NIKIAS
meaning: Derived from Greek νικη(nike) meaning "victory". This was the name of an Athenian general who fought in the Peloponnesian war.

name: NIKICA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian diminutive of NIKOLA(1).

name: NIKIFOR
meaning: Russian, Bulgarian and Macedonian form of NIKEPHOROS.

name: NIKITA  (1)
meaning: Russian form of NIKETAS. This form is also used in Ukrainian and Belarusian alongside the more traditional forms Mykyta and Mikita.

name: NIKITA  (2)
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit निकेत(niketa) meaning "house, habitation".

name: NIKO
meaning: Finnish form of NICHOLAS, as well as a Croatian, Slovene, Georgian and German short form.

name: NIKOL
meaning: Czech and Bulgarian form of NICOLE.

name: NIKOLA  (2)
meaning: German, Polish, Czech and Slovak feminine form of NICHOLAS.

name: NIKOLAJ
meaning: Danish and Slovene form of NICHOLAS.

name: NIKOLAY
meaning: Russian and Bulgarian form of NICHOLAS. A notable bearer was the Russian novelist Nikolay Gogol (1809-1852).

name: NIKOLE
meaning: Basque form of NICOLE, as well as an English variant.

name: NIKOLETTA
meaning: Hungarian and Greek form of NICOLETTA.

name: NIKOLINA
meaning: Bulgarian, Croatian, Serbian and Macedonian feminine form of NICHOLAS.

name: NIKOMACHOS
meaning: Means "battle of victory" from Greek νικη(nike) "victory" and μαχη(mache) "battle".

name: NIKOMEDES
meaning: Derived from Greek νικη(nike) "victory" and μηδομαι(medomai) "to think, to plan". This was the name of a 1st-century saint, a priest beaten to death for refusing to worship the Roman gods.

name: NIKORA
meaning: Maori form of NICHOLAS or NICOLE.

name: NIKOSTRATOS
meaning: Means "army of victory" from Greek νικη(nike) "victory" and στρατος(stratos) "army". This was the name of a Roman saint martyred during the persecutions of Emperor Diocletian.

name: NILES
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name NEIL.

name: NILI
meaning: Acronym of the phrase נצח ישׂראל לא ישׁקר(Netzach Yisrael Lo Yishaker) meaning "the eternity of Israel will not lie". This phrase appears in the Old Testament in Samuel 15:29. It was used as the name of a Jewish spy network in Palestine during World War I.

name: NIMAT
meaning: Means "blessings" in Arabic, a plural form of NIMA(1).

name: NIMROD
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Akkadian origin or possibly meaning "rebel" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament Nimrod is a renowned hunter, the great-grandson of Noah. He was the founder of Babylon....[more]

name: NIMUE
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Arthurian legends this is the name of a sorceress, also known as the Lady of the Lake, Vivien, or Niniane. Various versions of the tales have Merlin falling in love with her and becoming imprisoned by her magic. She first appears in the medieval French 'Lancelot-Grail' cycle.

name: NINA  (1)
meaning: Short form of names that end in nina, such as ANTONINA or GIANNINA. It was imported to Western Europe from Russia and Italy in the 19th century. This name also nearly coincides with the Spanish word niña meaning "little girl".

name: NINA  (2)
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of a Babylonian and Assyrian fertility goddess who was identified with Ishtar. She was the patron goddess of the city of Nineveh. Her name was written using a character representing a fish surrounded by a character representing a house.

name: NINEL
meaning: Reversal of the name Lenin. Lenin was the founder of the former Soviet state. This name was created by Communist parents who were eager to reject traditional names.

name: NING
meaning: From Chinese 宁(níng) meaning "peaceful, calm, serene", as well as other characters pronounced in a similar way.

name: NINGAL
meaning: Means "great lady" in Sumerian. This was the name of a goddess of reeds in Sumerian mythology. She was the daughter of Enki and the wife of Nanna.

name: NINIAN
meaning: Meaning unknown. It appears in a Latinized form Niniavus, which could be from the Welsh name NYNNIAW. This was the name of a 5th-century British saint who was apparently responsible for many miracles and cures. He is known as the Apostle to the Picts.

name: NINO  (1)
meaning: Short form of GIANNINO, ANTONINO, and other names ending in nino.

name: NINO  (2)
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly related to the masculine name NINOS. Saint Nino (sometimes called Nina) was a woman from Asia Minor who introduced Christianity to Georgia in the 4th century.

name: NINOS
meaning: Possibly related to the name of the goddess NINA(2). According to Greek historians this was the name of the founder of the ancient city of Nineveh in Assyria.

name: NINOSLAV
meaning: From a Slavic element, possibly nyni "now", combined with slava "glory".

name: NIOBE
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Greek mythology Niobe was the daughter of Tantalos, a king of Asia Minor. Because she boasted that she was superior to Leto, Leto's children Apollo and Artemis killed her 14 children with poison arrows. In grief, Niobe was turned to stone by Zeus.

name: NITA  (1)
meaning: Short form of ANITA(1) and other names ending in nita.

name: NITIKA
meaning: From Sanskrit नीति(niti) meaning "guidance, moral conduct".

name: NITIN
meaning: From Sanskrit नीति(niti) meaning "guidance, moral conduct".

name: NITYA
meaning: Means "always, eternal" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the feminine form नित्या (an epithet of the Hindu goddess Durga) and the masculine form नित्य.

name: NIV
meaning: Means either "speech, expression" or "fang, tusk" in Hebrew.

name: NIVIARSIAQ
meaning: Means "girl" in Greenlandic. This is the name of a variety of flower that grows on Greenland.

name: NJERI
meaning: Means "travelling one" in Kikuyu. Njeri (or Wanjeri) is the name of one of the nine daughters of Mumbi in the Kikuyu origin legend.

name: NJORD
meaning: From Old Norse Njörðr, which was possibly derived from the Indo-European root *ner meaning "strong, vigourous". Njord was the Norse god of the sea, sailing, fishing and fertility. With his children Freyr and Freya he was a member of the Vanir.

name: NJÁLL
meaning: Old Norse form of Niall (see NEIL). This is the name of the hero of a 13th century Icelandic saga, based on the life of a 10th-century Icelandic chieftain.

name: NKECHINYERE
meaning: Means "what God has given" or "gift of God" in Igbo.

name: NKEMDILIM
meaning: Means "let mine be mine" in Igbo.

name: NKIRUKA
meaning: Means "the best is still to come" in Igbo.

name: NNAMDI
meaning: Means "my father is alive" in Igbo. This name is given to a child when it is believed that he is a reincarnation of his grandfather.

name: NNEKA
meaning: Means "my mother is supreme" in Igbo.

name: NNENNA
meaning: Means "father's mother" in Igbo. This name is sometimes given to a child when it is believed that she is a reincarnation of her paternal grandmother.

name: NNENNE
meaning: Means "mother's mother" in Igbo. This name is sometimes given to a child when it is believed that she is a reincarnation of her maternal grandmother.

name: NOA  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 乃(no), a possessive particle, and 愛(a) meaning "love, affection". This name can also be constructed from other kanji or kanji combinations.

name: NOACH
meaning: Hebrew and Dutch form of NOAH(1).

name: NOAH  (1)
meaning: From the Hebrew name נֹחַ(Noach) meaning "rest, repose", derived from the root נוּחַ(nuach). According to the Old Testament, Noah was the builder of the Ark that allowed him, his family, and animals of each species to survive the great Flood. After the Flood he received the sign of the rainbow as a covenant from God. He was the father of Shem, Ham and Japheth....[more]

name: NOAH  (2)
meaning: From the Hebrew name נֹעָה(No'ah) meaning "motion". In the Old Testament this is the name of a daughter of Zelophehad.

name: NOAM
meaning: Means "pleasantness" in Hebrew. A famous bearer is Noam Chomsky (1928-), an American linguist and philosopher.

name: NOBLE
meaning: From an English surname meaning "noble, notable". The name can also be given in direct reference to the English word noble.

name: NOBORU
meaning: From Japanese 登(noboru) meaning "rise, ascend" or other kanji pronounced in the same way.

name: NOBU
meaning: From Japanese 信(nobu) meaning "trust", 延(nobu) meaning "prolong, stretch", or other kanji and kanji combinations. It is sometimes a short form of longer names beginning with this sound.

name: NOBURU
meaning: From Japanese 伸(noburu) meaning "extend, stretch" or other kanji having the same pronunciation.

name: NOBUYUKI
meaning: From Japanese 信(nobu) meaning "trust" or 伸(nobu) meaning "extend, stretch, open" combined with 行(yuki) meaning "row, line" or 幸(yuki) meaning "happiness". Other kanji combinations are possible as well.

name: NOE
meaning: Form of NOAH(1) used in the Greek and Latin Bible.

name: NOELANI
meaning: Means "heavenly mist" from Hawaiian noe "mist" and lani "heaven, sky, royal, majesty".

name: NOEMI
meaning: Italian, German and Czech form of NAOMI(1).

name: NOEMIN
meaning: Form of NAOMI(1) used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: NOGAH
meaning: Means "brightness" in Hebrew. This is the name of a son of King David in the Old Testament. In modern times it is sometimes used as a feminine name.

name: NOKOMIS
meaning: Means "my grandmother" in Ojibwe. In Anishinaabe mythology this is the name of Nanabozho's grandmother. It was used by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow for the grandmother of Hiawatha in his poem 'The Song of Hiawatha' (1855).

name: NOLA
meaning: Diminutive of MAGNOLIA, FINOLA or other names containing a similar sound.

name: NOLAN
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Nualláin meaning "descendant of NUALLÁN". The baseball player Nolan Ryan (1947-) is a famous bearer of this name.

name: NOLWENN
meaning: From the Breton phrase Noyal Gwenn meaning "holy one from Noyal". This was the epithet of a 6th-century saint and martyr from Brittany.

name: NOMIKI
meaning: Derived from Greek νομικος(nomikos) "relating to the law".

name: NON
meaning: Possibly derived from Latin nonna meaning "nun". This was the name of the mother of Saint David.

name: NONA  (1)
meaning: Derived from Latin nonus meaning "ninth", referring to the nine months of pregnancy. This was the name of a Roman goddess of pregnancy. She was also one of the three Fates (or Parcae).

name: NONA  (2)
meaning: Feminine form of NONUS. It was also used in 19th-century England, derived directly from Latin nonus "ninth" and traditionally given to the ninth-born child.

name: NONHELEMA
meaning: Possibly means "not a man" in Shawnee. This was the name of an 18th-century Shawnee chief, the sister of Hokolesqua.

name: NONHLE
meaning: From the Xhosa feminine prefix no- combined with hle "beautiful".

name: NONUS
meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, meaning "ninth" in Latin. This was a very rare praenomen.

name: NOOR  (2)
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of ELEONORA.

name: NORA
meaning: Short form of HONORA or ELEANOR. Henrik Ibsen used it for a character in his play 'A Doll's House' (1879).

name: NORBAER
meaning: Limburgish form of NORBERT. Its spelling has been influenced by the French pronunciation of Norbert.

name: NORBERT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements nord "north" and beraht "bright". This was the name of an 11th-century German saint who made many reforms within the church.

name: NORBERTO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of NORBERT.

name: NORI
meaning: From Japanese 儀(nori) meaning "ceremony, rites" or other kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: NORIKO
meaning: From Japanese 法(nori) meaning "law, rule" or 典(nori) meaning "rule, ceremony" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: NORMA
meaning: Created by Felice Romani for the main character in the opera 'Norma' (1831). He may have based it on Latin norma "rule". This name is also frequently used as a feminine form of NORMAN.

name: NORMAN
meaning: From an old Germanic byname meaning "northman", referring to a Viking. The Normans were Vikings who settled on the coast of France, in the region that became known as Normandy. In England the name Norman or Normant was used before the Norman conquest, first as a nickname for Scandinavian settlers and later as a given name. After the Conquest it became more common, but died out around the 14th century. It was revived in the 19th century, perhaps in part due to a character by this name in C. M. Yonge's novel 'The Daisy Chain' (1856).

name: NORMAND
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the same source as the name NORMAN.

name: NORRIS
meaning: From an English surname, either NORRIS(1) or NORRIS(2).

name: NORTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "north town" in Old English.

name: NORWOOD
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from a place name meaning "north wood" in Old English.

name: NOSIPHO
meaning: From the Zulu and Xhosa feminine prefix no- combined with isipho "gift".

name: NOSIZWE
meaning: From the Xhosa feminine prefix no- combined with isizwe "nation".

name: NOUREDDINE
meaning: Variant transcription of NUR AD-DIN (chiefly Maghrebi).

name: NOVA
meaning: Derived from Latin novus meaning "new". It was first used as a name in the 19th century.

name: NOWELL
meaning: From the surname Nowell (a variant of NOEL).

name: NOXOLO
meaning: From the Xhosa and Ndebele feminine prefix no- combined with uxolo "peace".

name: NOÉ
meaning: French, Spanish and Portuguese form of NOAH(1).

name: NOÉMI
meaning: Hungarian and French form of NAOMI(1).

name: NOËL
meaning: Means "Christmas" in French. In the Middle Ages it was used for children born on the holiday. A famous bearer was the English playwright and composer Noël Coward (1899-1973).

name: NTOMBIZODWA
meaning: Means "only girls", from Zulu, Xhosa and Ndebele intombi "girl" and zodwa "only".

name: NUADA
meaning: Possibly means "protector" in Celtic. In Irish myth he was an Irish god and a leader of the Tuatha De Danann. He was killed in battle against the Fomorii.

name: NUALLÁN
meaning: Derived from Irish nuall "noble, famous" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: NUAN
meaning: From Chinese 暖(nuǎn) meaning "warm, genial" or other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: NUBIA
meaning: From the name of the ancient region and kingdom in Africa, south of Egypt. It possibly derives from the Egyptian word nbw meaning "gold".

name: NUH
meaning: Arabic and Turkish form of NOAH(1).

name: NUMITOR
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Roman mythology Numitor was the king of Alba Longa and the father of Rhea Silvia. He was overthrown by his brother Amulius, but reinstated by his grandsons Romulus and Remus.

name: NUNO
meaning: Medieval Portuguese and Spanish name, possibly from Latin nonus "ninth" or nunnus "grandfather". Saint Nuno was a 14th-century Portuguese general who defeated a Castilian invasion.

name: NUNZIO
meaning: Masculine short form of ANNUNZIATA. It also coincides with the related Italian word nunzio "messenger" (ultimately from Latin nuntius).

name: NUR
meaning: Means "light" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition النور(al-Nur) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: NUR AD-DIN
meaning: Means "light of religion", from Arabic نور(nur) meaning "light" combined with دين(din) "religion, faith".

name: NURASYL
meaning: From Kazakh нұр(nur) meaning "light" (of Arabic origin) and асыл(asyl) meaning "precious, noble".

name: NURAY
meaning: Means "bright moon" in Turkish, ultimately from Arabic نور(nur) meaning "light" and Turkic ay meaning "moon".

name: NURGÜL
meaning: Means "radiant rose" in Turkish, ultimately from Arabic نور(nur) meaning "light" and Persian گل(gol) meaning "flower, rose".

name: NURISLAM
meaning: From Kazakh нұр(nur) meaning "light" (of Arabic origin) combined with Islam, the name of the religion (ultimately from Arabic إسلام).

name: NURLAN
meaning: From Kazakh нұр(nur) meaning "light" (of Arabic origin) and ұлан(ulan) meaning "soldier".

name: NURMUHAMAD
meaning: Combination of Arabic نور(nur) meaning "light" and the name MUHAMAD.

name: NURSULTAN
meaning: From Kazakh нұр(nur) meaning "light" and сұлтан(sultan) meaning "sultan, king" (both words of Arabic origin).

name: NURTEN
meaning: Means "radiant skin" in Turkish, ultimately from Arabic نور(nur) meaning "light" and Persian تن(tan) meaning "body".

name: NURU
meaning: Means "light" in Swahili, ultimately from Arabic نور(nur).

name: NURUL
meaning: First part of compound Arabic names beginning with نور ال(Nur al) meaning "light of the" (such as نور الدين(Nur al-Din) "light of religion").

name: NURULLAH
meaning: Means "light of ALLAH", from Arabic نور(nur) meaning "light" combined with الله(Allah).

name: NURZHAN
meaning: From Kazakh нұр(nur) meaning "light" (of Arabic origin) and жан(zhan) meaning "soul" (of Persian origin).

name: NWANNEKA
meaning: Means "my siblings are supreme" in Igbo.

name: NYALA
meaning: From the name of a type of African antelope, ultimately derived from the Bantu word nyálà.

name: NYAMBURA
meaning: From Kikuyu mbura meaning "rain". This is the name of one of the nine daughters of Mumbi in the Kikuyu origin legend.

name: NYDIA
meaning: Used by British author Edward Bulwer-Lytton for a blind flower-seller in his novel 'The Last Days of Pompeii' (1834). He perhaps based it on Latin nidus "nest".

name: NYMPHODORA
meaning: Derived from Greek νυμφη(nymphe) "bride, nymph" and δωρον(doron) "gift". This was the name of a 4th-century saint who was martyred with her sisters Menodora and Metrodora.

name: NYNNIAW
meaning: Meaning unknown, presumably of Welsh origin. According to the 12th-century chronicler Geoffrey of Monmouth, this was the name of a Welsh prince who fought against the invading forces of Julius Caesar. It was also borne by an 8th-century Welsh historian, usually known by the Latinized form Nennius.

name: NYOMAN
meaning: Possibly from a Balinese word meaning "end, remainder". This name is traditionally bestowed upon the third-born child.

name: NYREE
meaning: Anglicized form of NGAIRE. It was borne by New Zealand actress Nyree Dawn Porter (1936-2001).

name: NYSSA
meaning: From the name of an ancient town of Asia Minor where Saint Gregory was bishop. Nyssa is also the genus name of a type of tree, also called the Tupelo.

name: NYX
meaning: Means "night" in Greek. This was the name of the Greek goddess of the night, the daughter of Khaos and the wife of Erebos.

name: NYYRIKKI
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of a Finnish god of the hunt, the son of Tapio.

name: NÁNDOR
meaning: Originally this was a Hungarian word referring to a Bulgarian people that lived along the Danube. Since the 19th century it has been used as a Hungarian short form of FERDINAND.

name: NÉLIDA
meaning: Created by French author Marie d'Agoult for her semi-autobiographical novel 'Nélida' (1846), written under the name Daniel Stern. It was probably an anagram of her pen name DANIEL.

name: NÓRA
meaning: Hungarian and Irish Gaelic form of NORA.

name: NÚRIA
meaning: From a Catalan title of the Virgin Mary, Nostra Senyora de Núria, meaning "Our Lady of Nuria". Nuria is a sanctuary in Spain in which there is a shrine containing a famous statue of Mary.

name: OANEZ
meaning: Derived from Breton oan "lamb" (ultimately from Latin agnus) and used as a Breton form of AGNES.

name: OBADIAH
meaning: Means "serving YAHWEH" in Hebrew, derived from עָבַד('avad) meaning "to serve" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the twelve minor prophets, the author of the Book of Obadiah, which predicts the downfall of the nation of Edom.

name: OBDULIA
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of a saint from Toledo, Spain. The details of her life are unknown.

name: OBED
meaning: Means "serving, worshipping" in Hebrew. This is the name of several Old Testament characters including the grandfather of David.

name: OBERON
meaning: Variant of AUBERON. Oberon was the king of the fairies in Shakespeare's comedy 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' (1595). A moon of Uranus bears this name in his honour.

name: OBRAD
meaning: Possibly derived from Serbian obradovati "to make happy".

name: OCEAN
meaning: Simply from the English word ocean for a large body of water. It is ultimately derived from Greek Ωκεανος(Okeanos), the name of the body of water thought to surround the Earth.

name: OCHIENG
meaning: Means "born when the sun shines", derived from Luo chieng meaning "sun".

name: OCTAVIA
meaning: Feminine form of OCTAVIUS. Octavia was the wife of Mark Antony and the sister of the Roman emperor Augustus. In 19th-century England it was sometimes given to the eighth-born child.

name: OCTAVIAN
meaning: From the Roman name Octavianus, which was derived from the name OCTAVIUS. After Gaius Octavius (later the Roman emperor Augustus) was adopted by Julius Caesar he took the name Gaius Julius Caesar Octavianus.

name: OCTAVIUS
meaning: Roman family name meaning "eighth" from Latin octavus. This was the original family name of the emperor Augustus (born Gaius Octavius). It was also rarely used as a Roman praenomen, or given name.

name: ODD
meaning: Derived from Old Norse oddr meaning "point of a sword".

name: ODDMUND
meaning: Possibly a modern coinage based on the Old Norse elements oddr "point of a sword" and mundr "protection".

name: ODE
meaning: Medieval English form of Odo (see OTTO).

name: ODED
meaning: Means "to restore" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a prophet from Samaria.

name: ODELIA  (2)
meaning: Means "I will thank YAHWEH" in Hebrew. This is a modern Hebrew name probably inspired by ODELIA(1).

name: ODELL
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "woad hill" in Old English. A woad is a herb used for dyeing.

name: ODESERUNDIYE
meaning: Means "lightning has struck" in Mohawk. This was the name of an 18th-century Mohawk chief, also called John Deseronto.

name: ODESSA
meaning: From the name of a Ukrainian city that sits on the north coast of the Black Sea. This name can also be used as a feminine form of ODYSSEUS.

name: ODETTE
meaning: French diminutive of ODA or ODILIA. This is the name of a princess who has been transformed into a swan in the ballet 'Swan Lake' (1877) by Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky.

name: ODHARNAIT
meaning: Means "little pale green one", derived from Irish odhra "pale green, sallow" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: ODHIAMBO
meaning: Means "born in the evening" in Luo.

name: ODHRÁN
meaning: Means "little pale green one", derived from Irish odhra "pale green, sallow" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of a saint who travelled with Saint Columba through Scotland.

name: ODILIA
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element odal meaning "fatherland" or aud meaning "wealth, fortune". Saint Odilia (or Odila) was an 8th-century nun who is considered the patron saint of Alsace. She was apparently born blind but gained sight when she was baptized.

name: ODIN
meaning: Anglicized form of Old Norse Óðinn, which was derived from óðr "inspiration, rage, frenzy". It ultimately developed from the early Germanic *Woðanaz. The name appears as Woden in Anglo-Saxon sources (for example, as the founder of several royal lineages in the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle) and in forms such as Wotan, Wuotan or Wodan in continental Europe. However Odin is most known from Norse mythology, as the highest of the gods, presiding over art, war, wisdom and death. He resided in Valhalla, where warriors went after they were slain.

name: ODOACER
meaning: Variant of ODOVACAR. The Gothic leader Odovacar is frequently called by this name.

name: ODOVACAR
meaning: From the Germanic name Audovacar meaning "wealthy and vigilant", derived from the elements aud "wealth" and wacar "vigilant". Odovacar, also called Odoacer, was a 5th-century Gothic leader who overthrew the last Western Roman emperor and became the first barbarian king of Italy.

name: ODYSSEUS
meaning: Perhaps derived from Greek οδυσσομαι(odyssomai) "to hate". In Greek legend Odysseus was one of the Greek heroes who fought in the Trojan War. In the 'Odyssey' Homer relates Odysseus's misadventures on his way back to his kingdom and his wife Penelope.

name: OEDIPUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Οιδιπους(Oidipous), meaning "swollen foot" from οιδεω(oideo) "to swell" and πους(pous) "foot". In Greek mythology Oedipus was the son of the Theban king Laius and his wife Jocasta. Laius received a prophesy that he would be killed by his son, so he left the newborn to die of exposure. Oedipus was however rescued and raised in the home of the Corinthian king Polybus. After he had grown and learned of the same prophesy, Oedipus left Corinth so that he would not be a danger to Polybus, who he assumed was his father. On the road to Delphi he chanced upon his real father Laius and slew him in a petty disagreement, thus fulfilling the prophecy. He then correctly answered the Sphinx's riddle, winning the now vacant throne of Thebes and marrying the widowed Queen Jocasta, his own mother. Years later they learned the truth of their relationship, prompting Jocasta to commit suicide and Oedipus to blind himself.

name: OENONE
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Οινωνε(Oinone), derived from οινος(oinos) meaning "wine". In Greek mythology Oenone was a mountain nymph who was married to Paris before he went after Helen.

name: OFELIA
meaning: Spanish and Italian form of OPHELIA.

name: OFER
meaning: Means "fawn" in Hebrew. This makes it a modern variant of the Classical Hebrew name Ophrah.

name: OFIR
meaning: Hebrew form of OPHIR. In modern times it is also used as a feminine name.

name: OFRA
meaning: Hebrew form of OPHRAH. Originally it was a masculine name, but it is now used for females too.

name: OGDEN
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "oak valley" in Old English. A famous bearer was the humourous American poet Ogden Nash (1902-1971).

name: OGECHUKWUKAMA
meaning: Means "God's time is the best" in Igbo.

name: OGHENEKEVWE
meaning: Means "God provided for me" in Urhobo.

name: OGNJAN
meaning: Croatian and Serbian variant form of OGNYAN.

name: OGNJEN
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of OGNYAN.

name: OHAD
meaning: Means "united" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is the third son of Simeon.

name: OIGHRIG
meaning: Means "new speckled one" in Scottish Gaelic.

name: OISÍN
meaning: Means "little deer", derived from Irish os "deer" combined with a diminutive suffix. In Irish legend Oisín was a warrior hero and a poet, the son of Fionn mac Cumhail.

name: OKAFOR
meaning: Means "born on Afor" in Igbo, Afor being one of the days of the Igbo week.

name: OKEANOS
meaning: From the name of the river or body of water thought by the ancient Greeks to surround the Earth. In Greek mythology Okeanos was the Titan who personified this body of water.

name: OKEKE
meaning: Means "born on Eke" in Igbo, Eke being one of the days of the Igbo week.

name: OKONKWO
meaning: Means "born on Nkwo" in Igbo, Nkwo being one of the days of the Igbo week.

name: OKORIE
meaning: Means "born on Orie" in Igbo, Orie being one of the days of the Igbo week.

name: OLA  (1)
meaning: Norwegian and Swedish short form of OLAF.

name: OLAF
meaning: From the Old Norse name Áleifr meaning "ancestor's descendant", derived from the elements anu "ancestor" and leifr "descendant". This was the name of five kings of Norway, including Saint Olaf (Olaf II).

name: OLALLA
meaning: Spanish variant of EULALIA. This was the name of two 4th-century saints from Spain.

name: OLAMIDE
meaning: Means "my wealth has arrived" in Yoruba.

name: OLAMILEKAN
meaning: Means "my wealth is increased" in Yoruba.

name: OLANREWAJU
meaning: Means "my wealth is the future" or "my wealth is moving forward" in Yoruba.

name: OLAVI
meaning: Finnish and Estonian form of OLAF.

name: OLE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of OLAF.

name: OLEG
meaning: Russian form of HELGE. The Varangians brought this name from Scandinavia to Russia. It was borne by an important 10th-century grand prince of Kiev.

name: OLEGARIO
meaning: Spanish form of a Germanic name, possibly Aldegar, derived from the elements ald "old" and ger "spear". This was the name of a 12th-century saint, a bishop of Barcelona.

name: OLES
meaning: Short form of OLEKSANDR or OLEKSIY.

name: OLGA
meaning: Russian form of HELGA. The Varangians brought it from Scandinavia to Russia. The 10th-century Saint Olga was the wife of Igor I, grand prince of Kievan Rus (a state based around the city of Kiev). Following his death she ruled as regent for her son for 18 years. After she was baptized in Constantinople she attempted to convert her subjects to Christianity.

name: OLGICA
meaning: Macedonian and Serbian diminutive of OLGA.

name: OLIVA
meaning: Late Latin name meaning "olive". This was the name of a 2nd-century saint from Brescia.

name: OLIVE
meaning: From the English and French word for the type of tree, ultimately derived from Latin oliva.

name: OLIVER
meaning: From Olivier, a Norman French form of a Germanic name such as ALFHER or an Old Norse name such as Áleifr (see OLAF). The spelling was altered by association with Latin oliva "olive tree". In the Middle Ages the name became well-known in Western Europe because of the French epic 'La Chanson de Roland', in which Olivier was a friend and advisor of the hero Roland....[more]

name: OLIVETTE
meaning: Feminine form of OLIVER. This was the name of the title character in the French opera 'Les noces d'Olivette' (1879) by Edmond Audran.

name: OLIVIA
meaning: This name was first used in this spelling by William Shakespeare for a character in his comedy 'Twelfth Night' (1602). Shakespeare may have based it on OLIVER or OLIVA, or perhaps directly on the Latin word oliva meaning "olive". In the play Olivia is a noblewoman who is wooed by Duke Orsino but instead falls in love with his messenger Cesario....[more]

name: OLIVIE
meaning: French and Czech form of OLIVIA.

name: OLIVIER
meaning: French and Dutch form of OLIVER.

name: OLLIE
meaning: Diminutive of OLIVER, OLIVIA or OLIVE.

name: OLUFUNKE
meaning: Means "God has cared for" in Yoruba.

name: OLUFUNMILAYO
meaning: Means "God gave me joy" in Yoruba.

name: OLUFUNMILOLA
meaning: Means "God gives me wealth" in Yoruba.

name: OLUWAKANYINSOLA
meaning: Means "God has added sweetness to my wealth" in Yoruba.

name: OLUWASEGUN
meaning: Means "God has been victorious" in Yoruba.

name: OLUWATOYIN
meaning: Means "God is worthy to be praised" in Yoruba.

name: OLWEN
meaning: Means "white footprint" from Welsh ol "footprint, track" and gwen "white, fair, blessed". In Welsh legend Olwen was a beautiful maiden, the lover of Culhwch and the daughter of the giant Yspaddaden. Her father insisted that Culhwch complete several seemingly impossible tasks before he would allow them to marry, and Culhwch was successful with all of them.

name: OLYMPIAS
meaning: Feminine form of OLYMPOS. This was the name of the mother of Alexander the Great. It was also borne by a 4th-century saint.

name: OLYMPIODOROS
meaning: From OLYMPOS, the name of the mountain home of the Greek gods, combined with Greek δωρον(doron) "gift".

name: OLYMPOS
meaning: From a Greek personal name which was derived from the place name OLYMPOS, the name of the mountain home of the Greek gods.

name: OLÍVIA
meaning: Portuguese, Slovak and Hungarian form of OLIVIA.

name: OM
meaning: From the Sanskrit ओम्(om), considered to be a sacred syllable because it represents the range of sounds that can be made by the human voice.

name: OMAR  (1)
meaning: Variant transcription of UMAR. This is the usual English spelling of the 12th-century poet Umar Khayyam's name. In his honour it has sometimes been used in the English-speaking world, notably for the American general Omar Bradley (1893-1981).

name: OMAR  (2)
meaning: Means "speaker" in Hebrew. This was the name of a son of Eliphaz in the Old Testament.

name: OMEGA
meaning: From the name of the last letter in the Greek alphabet, Ω. It is often seen as a symbol of completion.

name: OMOBOLANLE
meaning: Means "a child who met wealth at home" in Yoruba.

name: OMOLARA
meaning: Means "a child is family" in Yoruba.

name: OMONDI
meaning: Means "born early in the morning" in Luo.

name: OMRI
meaning: Possibly means "life" or "servant" in Hebrew (or a related Semitic language). This was the name of a 9th-century BC military commander who became king of Israel. He appears in the Old Testament, where he is denounced as being wicked.

name: ONA  (2)
meaning: Short form of MARIONA. It also coincides with a Catalan word meaning "wave".

name: ONANGWATGO
meaning: Means "big medicine" in Oneida. This was the name of a chief of the Oneida people, also named Cornelius Hill (1834-1907).

name: ONDINA
meaning: Portuguese and Italian form of UNDINE.

name: ONEIDA
meaning: From the name of a Native American tribe, perhaps meaning "standing rock".

name: ONESIMUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ονησιμος(Onesimos), which meant "beneficial, profitable". Saint Onesimus was an escaped slave of Philemon who met Saint Paul while in prison and was converted by him. Paul sent him back to Philemon carrying the epistle that appears in the New Testament.

name: ONESIPHORUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ονησιφορος(Onesiphoros), which meant "bringing advantage, beneficial". This name is mentioned briefly in Paul's second epistle to Timothy in the New Testament. According to tradition he was martyred by being tied to horses and then torn apart.

name: ONI
meaning: Possibly means "born in sacred abode" in Yoruba.

name: ONOFRE
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of ONUPHRIUS.

name: ONUPHRIUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Οννωφρις(Onnophris), derived from Egyptian Unn-nfr meaning "he who is good, he who is happy". This was an epithet of the god Osiris. It was later used by an Egyptian saint and hermit from the 4th or 5th century.

name: ONYEKACHI
meaning: Means "who is greater than God?" in Igbo.

name: ONYEKACHUKWU
meaning: Variant of ONYEKACHI, using Chukwu as the last element, which is the extended form of Chi meaning "God".

name: OONA
meaning: Irish variant and Finnish form of ÚNA.

name: OPAL
meaning: From the English word opal for the iridescent gemstone, the birthstone of October. The word ultimately derives from Sanskrit उपल(upala) meaning "jewel".

name: OPEYEMI
meaning: Means "I should give praise" in Yoruba.

name: OPHELIA
meaning: Derived from Greek οφελος(ophelos) meaning "help". This name was probably created by the 15th-century poet Jacopo Sannazaro for a character in his poem 'Arcadia'. It was borrowed by Shakespeare for his play 'Hamlet' (1600), in which it belongs to Hamlet's lover who eventually goes insane and drowns herself. In spite of this, the name has been used since the 19th century.

name: OPHIR
meaning: Meaning unknown. This is the name of a son of Joktan in the Old Testament (where it is also used as a place name).

name: OPHIUCHUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Οφιουχος(Ophiouchos) meaning "serpent bearer". This is the name of an equatorial constellation that depicts the god Asklepios holding a snake.

name: OPHRAH
meaning: Means "fawn" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of both a man mentioned in genealogies and a city in Manasseh.

name: OPRAH
meaning: In the case of television personality Oprah Winfrey, it was a childhood mispronunciation of her real name ORPAH that became permanent.

name: ORA  (1)
meaning: Perhaps based on Latin oro "to pray". It was first used in America in the 19th century.

name: ORAL
meaning: Meaning uncertain. This name was borne by the influential American evangelist Oral Roberts (1918-2009), who was apparently named by his cousin.

name: ORESTES
meaning: Derived from Greek ορεστιας(orestias) meaning "of the mountains". In Greek myth he was the son of Agamemnon and Clytemnestra. He killed his mother and her lover Aegisthus after they killed his father.

name: ORFEO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of ORPHEUS.

name: ORHAN
meaning: Derived from Turkish or "great" and the title khan meaning "leader". This was the name of a 14th-century sultan of the Ottoman Empire.

name: ORIANA
meaning: Possibly derived from Latin aurum "gold" or from its derivatives, Spanish oro or French or. In medieval legend Oriana was the daughter of a king of England who married the knight Amadis.

name: ORIGEN
meaning: From the Greek name Ωριγενης(Origenes), which was possibly derived from the name of the Egyptian god HORUS combined with γενης(genes) "born". Origen was a 3rd-century theologian from Alexandria. Long after his death some of his writings were declared heretical, hence he is not regarded as a saint.

name: ORINDA
meaning: Probably an elaboration of Spanish oro "gold". This was the pseudonym of the English poet Katherine Philips (1631-1664).

name: ORINTHIA
meaning: Possibly related to Greek ορινω(orino) meaning "to excite, to agitate". George Bernard Shaw used this name in his play 'The Apple Cart' (1929).

name: ORIOL
meaning: From a Catalan surname meaning "golden". It has been used in honour of Joseph Oriol, a 17th-century saint.

name: ORION
meaning: Meaning unknown, but possibly related to Greek ‘οριον(horion) "boundary, limit". Alternatively it may be derived from Akkadian Uru-anna meaning "light of the heavens". This is the name of a constellation, which gets its name from a legendary Greek hunter killed by a scorpion sent by Gaia.

name: ORLANDO
meaning: Italian form of ROLAND. A city in Florida bears this name, as does a character in Shakespeare's play 'As You like It' (1599).

name: ORMAZD
meaning: Modern Persian form of AHURA MAZDA.

name: ORMOND
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Ruaidh meaning "descendant of RUADH".

name: ORNELLA
meaning: Created by the Italian author Gabriele d'Annunzio for his novel 'La Figlia di Jorio' (1904). It is derived from Tuscan Italian ornello meaning "flowering ash tree".

name: ORPAH
meaning: Means "back of the neck" in Hebrew. Orpah was Naomi's second daughter-in-law in the Book of Ruth in the Old Testament.

name: ORPHA
meaning: Variant of ORPAH used in some translations of the Bible.

name: ORPHEUS
meaning: Perhaps related to Greek ορφνη(orphne) meaning "the darkness of night". In Greek mythology Orpheus was a poet and musician who went to the underworld to retrieve his dead wife Eurydice. He succeeded in charming Hades with his lyre, and he was allowed to lead his wife out of the underworld on the condition that he not look back at her until they reached the surface. Unfortunately, just before they arrived his love for her overcame his will and he glanced back at her, causing her to be drawn back to Hades.

name: ORRELL
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "ore hill" in Old English.

name: ORSINO
meaning: Italian form of the Roman name Ursinus, itself derived from Ursus (see URS). This is the name of a character in Shakespeare's play 'Twelfth Night' (1602).

name: ORSON
meaning: From an English surname which was originally a nickname meaning "bear cub", from a diminutive of Norman French ors "bear", ultimately from Latin ursus. American actor and director Orson Welles (1915-1985) was a famous bearer of this name.

name: ORTRUN
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ort "point" and run "secret".

name: ORTWIN
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements ort "point" and win "friend".

name: ORVAR
meaning: Means "arrow" in Old Norse. Orvar Odd is a legendary Norse hero who is the subject of a 13th-century Icelandic saga.

name: ORVILLE
meaning: This name was invented by the 18th-century writer Fanny Burney, who perhaps intended it to mean "golden city" in French. Orville Wright (1871-1948), together with his brother Wilbur, invented the first successful airplane.

name: OSAMU
meaning: From Japanese 修(osamu) meaning "discipline, study", as well as other kanji which have the same pronunciation.

name: OSANE
meaning: Means "cure, remedy" in Basque. It is a Basque equivalent of Remedios.

name: OSANNA
meaning: Italian form of HOSANNA. This was the name of a 15th-century Italian saint and mystic.

name: OSBERT
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements os "god" and beorht "bright". After the Norman conquest, this Old English name was merged with its Norman cognate. It was rare in the Middle Ages, and eventually died out. It was briefly revived in the 19th century.

name: OSBORN
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements os "god" and beorn "bear". During the Anglo-Saxon period there was also a Norse cognate Ásbjörn used in England, and after the Norman conquest the Norman cognate Osbern was introduced. It was occasionally revived in the 19th century, in part from a surname that was derived from the given name.

name: OSBORNE
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of OSBORN.

name: OSBOURNE
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of OSBORN.

name: OSCAR
meaning: Possibly means "deer friend", derived from Gaelic os "deer" and cara "friend". Alternatively, it may derive from the Old English name OSGAR or its Old Norse cognate ÁSGEIRR, which may have been brought to Ireland by Viking invaders and settlers. In Irish legend Oscar was the son of the poet Oisín and the grandson of the hero Fionn mac Cumhail....[more]

name: OSEE
meaning: Form of HOSHEA (and HOSEA) used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: OSGAR
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements os "god" and gar "spear".

name: OSHEA
meaning: Variant of HOSHEA used in some versions of the Bible.

name: OSIRIS
meaning: Greek form of the Egyptian Asar which is of unknown meaning. In Egyptian mythology Osiris was the god of the dead and the judge of the underworld. He was slain by his brother Seth, but revived by his wife Isis.

name: OSKAR
meaning: Scandinavian, German, Polish and Slovene form of OSCAR. A famous bearer was Oskar Schindler (1908-1974), who saved over 1,000 Polish Jews during World War II.

name: OSMAN
meaning: Turkish form of UTHMAN. This was the name of the founder of the Ottoman Empire (14th century).

name: OSMOND
meaning: From the Old English elements os "god" and mund "protection". During the Anglo-Saxon period a Norse cognate Ásmundr was also used in England, and another version was imported by the Normans. Saint Osmund was an 11th-century Norman nobleman who became an English bishop. Though it eventually became rare, it was revived in the 19th century, in part from a surname that was derived from the given name.

name: OSSIAN
meaning: Variant of OISÍN used by James Macpherson in his epic poems, which he claimed to have based on early Irish legends.

name: OSVALDO
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Portuguese form of OSWALD.

name: OSWALD
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements os "god" and weald "power, ruler". Saint Oswald was a king of Northumbria who introduced Christianity to northeast England in the 7th century before being killed in battle. There was also an Old Norse cognate Ásvaldr in use in England, being borne by the 10th-century Saint Oswald of Worcester, who was of Danish ancestry. Though the name had died out by the end of the Middle Ages, it was revived in the 19th century.

name: OSWIN
meaning: From the Old English elements os "god" and wine "friend". Saint Oswin was a 7th-century king of Northumbria. After the Norman conquest this name was used less, and it died out after the 14th century. It was briefly revived in the 19th century.

name: OTAKAR
meaning: Czech form of ODOVACAR. This was the name of two kings of Bohemia.

name: OTAR
meaning: Derived from Turkic otar meaning "pasture, meadow".

name: OTHELLO
meaning: Perhaps an Italian diminutive of OTHO. Shakespeare used this name in his tragedy 'Othello' (1603), where it belongs to a Moor who is manipulated by Iago into killing his wife Desdemona.

name: OTHNIEL
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly "lion of God" or "strength of God" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is a nephew of Caleb who becomes the first of the ruling judges of the Israelites.

name: OTHO
meaning: Roman cognomen of unknown meaning. This was the name of a short-lived 1st-century Roman emperor.

name: OTIS
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the medieval given name Ode, a cognate of OTTO. In America it has been used in honour of the revolutionary James Otis (1725-1783).

name: OTMAR
meaning: From the Germanic name Audamar, which was derived from the elements aud "wealth, fortune" and mari "famous". This was the name of an 8th-century Swiss saint, an abbot of Saint Gall.

name: OTTO
meaning: Later German form of Audo or Odo, originally a short form of various names beginning with the Germanic element aud meaning "wealth, fortune". This was the name of four kings of Germany, starting in the 10th century with Otto I, the first Holy Roman emperor, who was known as Otto the Great. This name was also borne by a 19th-century king of Greece who was originally from Bavaria. Another notable bearer was the German chancellor Otto von Bismarck (1815-1898).

name: OTTOLINE
meaning: Diminutive of OTTILIE. A famous bearer was the British socialite Lady Ottoline Morrell (1873-1938).

name: OTTÓ
meaning: Hungarian and Icelandic form of OTTO.

name: OUIDA
meaning: Used by the English author Ouida (1839-1908), born Marie Louise Ramé to a French father. Ouida was a pseudonym that arose from her own childhood pronunciation of her middle name LOUISE.

name: OURANIA
meaning: Derived from Greek ουρανιος(ouranios) meaning "heavenly". In Greek mythology she was the goddess of astronomy and astrology, one of the nine Muses.

name: OURBANOS
meaning: Form of URBAN used in the Greek New Testament.

name: OURI
meaning: Form of URI used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: OVE
meaning: Probably a modern form of the Old Danish name Aghi, originally a short form of names that contain the Old Norse element egg "edge of a sword" or agi "terror".

name: OVID
meaning: From the Roman family name Ovidius, which was possibly derived from Latin ovis "a sheep". Alternatively, it could have a Sabellic origin. Publius Ovidius Naso, better known as Ovid, was a 1st-century BC Roman poet who often wrote on the subjects of love and mythology. He was sent into exile by Emperor Augustus for no apparent reason.

name: OVIDIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of Ovidius (see OVID).

name: OWAIN
meaning: Probably a Welsh form of EUGENE, though it might be derived from Welsh eoghunn meaning "youth". This was the name of several figures from Welsh history and mythology. In Arthurian legend Owain (also called Yvain in French sources) was one of the Knights of the Round Table, the son of King Urien and husband of the Lady of the Fountain. His character was based on that of Owain ap Urien, a 6th-century Welsh prince who fought against the Angles. This name was also borne by Owain Glyndwr, a 14th-century leader of Welsh resistance against English rule.

name: OZ  (1)
meaning: Short form of OSWALD, OSBORN, and other names beginning with a similar sound.

name: OZAZIAS
meaning: Form of AZAZIAH used in the Greek Bible.

name: OZI
meaning: Form of UZZI used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: OZIAS
meaning: Form of UZZIAH used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: OZIEL
meaning: Form of UZZIEL used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: OZIHEL
meaning: Form of UZZIEL used in the Latin Old Testament.

name: OZZIE
meaning: Diminutive of OSWALD, OSBORN, and other names beginning with a similar sound.

name: PAAVALI
meaning: Finnish form of PAUL used in the Bible.

name: PAAVO
meaning: Finnish and Estonian form of PAUL.

name: PABLO
meaning: Spanish form of Paulus (see PAUL). Spanish painter and sculptor Pablo Picasso (1881-1973) was a famous bearer of this name.

name: PACE
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Middle English word pace meaning "peace".

name: PACEY
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the French place name Pacy, itself derived from Gaulish given name of unknown meaning.

name: PACÍFICA
meaning: Spanish feminine form of the Late Latin name Pacificus meaning "peacemaker".

name: PADEN
meaning: An invented name, using the popular aden suffix sound found in such names as Braden, Hayden and Aidan. It is sometimes considered a derivative of the surname PADDON.

name: PADERAU
meaning: Means "beads" or "rosary" in Welsh. This is a modern Welsh name.

name: PADMA
meaning: Means "lotus" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the feminine form पद्मा and the masculine form पद्म. According to Hindu tradition a lotus holding the god Brahma arose from the navel of the god Vishnu. The name Padma is used in Hindu texts to refer to several characters, including the goddess Lakshmi and the hero Rama.

name: PADMAVATI
meaning: Means "resembling lotuses", derived from the Sanskrit word पद्म(padma) meaning "lotus" combined with वती(vati) meaning "resemblance". This is the name of the foster-mother of the god Hindu Skanda.

name: PADMINI
meaning: Means "a multitude of lotuses", a derivative of Sanskrit पद्म(padma) meaning "lotus".

name: PADRIG
meaning: Welsh and Breton form of PATRICK.

name: PAGE
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of PAIGE.

name: PAGET
meaning: From a surname which meant "little page" (see PAIGE).

name: PAIGE
meaning: From an English surname meaning "servant, page" in Middle English. It is ultimately derived (via Old French and Italian) from Greek παιδιον(paidion) meaning "little boy".

name: PAISLEY
meaning: From a Scottish surname, originally from the name of a town, which may ultimately be derived from Latin basilica "church". This is also a word (derived from the name of that same town) for a type of pattern commonly found on fabrics.

name: PALLAS  (1)
meaning: Probably derived from a Greek word meaning "maiden". In Greek mythology this was the name of a friend of the goddess Athena. Athena accidentally killed her, and subsequently took the name Pallas in honour of her friend.

name: PALLAS  (2)
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek παλλω(pallo) "to brandish". In Greek mythology this was the name of a Titan and several other characters. It was also the name of a female character, though her name is probably from a different source (see Pallas).

name: PALLU
meaning: Means "distinguished" in Hebrew. This was the name of a son of Reuben in the Old Testament.

name: PALMER
meaning: From an English surname meaning "pilgrim". It is ultimately from Latin palma "palm tree", since pilgrims to the Holy Land often brought back palm fronds as proof of their journey.

name: PALMIRO
meaning: Means "pilgrim" in Italian. In medieval times it denoted one who had been a pilgrim to Palestine. It is ultimately from the word palma meaning "palm tree", because of the custom of pilgrims to bring palm fronds home with them. The name is sometimes given to a child born on Palm Sunday.

name: PAMELA
meaning: This name was invented in the late 16th century by the poet Sir Philip Sidney for use in his poem 'Arcadia'. He possibly intended it to mean "all sweetness" from Greek παν(pan) "all" and μελι(meli) "honey". It was later employed by author Samuel Richardson for the heroine in his novel 'Pamela, or Virtue Rewarded' (1740), after which time it became used as a given name. It did not become popular until the 20th century.

name: PAMPHILOS
meaning: Means "friend of all" from Greek παν(pan) "all" and φιλος(philos) "friend".

name: PAN
meaning: Derived from a Greek word meaning "shepherd". In Greek mythology Pan was a half-man, half-goat god associated with shepherds, flocks and pastures.

name: PANAGIOTIS
meaning: From the Greek title of the Virgin Mary Παναγια(Panagia) meaning "all holy", derived from παν(pan) "all" combined with ‘αγιος(hagios) "devoted to the gods, sacred".

name: PANCHO
meaning: Spanish diminutive of FRANCISCO. This name was borne by Pancho Villa (1878-1923), a Mexican bandit and revolutionary.

name: PANCRAS
meaning: Medieval English form of PANCRATIUS. The relics of the 4th-century saint Pancratius were sent to England by Pope Gregory the Great, leading to the saint's veneration there.

name: PANCRATIUS
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Πανκρατιος(Pankratios), derived from παν(pan) "all" and κρατος(kratos) "power". Early Byzantine Christians used this as a title of Christ. It was borne by two saints, a 1st-century Sicilian martyr and a semi-legendary 4th-century Roman martyr.

name: PANDORA
meaning: Means "all gifts", derived from a combination of Greek παν(pan) "all" and δωρον(doron) "gift". In Greek mythology Pandora was the first mortal woman. Zeus gave her a jar containing all of the troubles and ills that mankind now knows, and told her not to open it. Unfortunately her curiosity got the best of her and she opened it, unleashing the evil spirits into the world.

name: PANFILO
meaning: Italian form of PAMPHILOS. The Italian novelist Boccaccio used this name in his work 'The Decameron' (1350).

name: PANKAJA
meaning: Means "born of mud", referring to the lotus flower, derived from Sanskrit पङ्क(panka) meaning "mud" and ज(ja) meaning "born". This is another name of the Hindu god Brahma.

name: PANSY
meaning: From the English word for a type of flower, ultimately deriving from Old French pensee "thought".

name: PANTALEON
meaning: Derived from the Greek elements παν(pan) meaning "all" (genitive παντος) and λεων(leon) meaning "lion". This was the name of a 2nd-century BC king of Bactria. It was also borne by Saint Pantaleon (also called Panteleimon), a doctor from Asia Minor who was martyred during the persecutions of the Roman emperor Diocletian in the early 4th century. He is a patron saint of doctors and midwives.

name: PANTELEIMON
meaning: From Greek παν(pan) meaning "all" (genitive παντος) and ελεημων(eleemon) meaning "compassionate". This was a name given to Saint Pantaleon.

name: PANTHERAS
meaning: Derived from Greek πανθηρ(panther) meaning "panther", ultimately of Sanskrit origin, though folk etymology connects it to Greek παν(pan) "all" and θηραω(therao) "to hunt". According to some legends a Roman soldier named Panthera was the father of Jesus.

name: PAOLINA
meaning: Italian feminine form of Paulinus (see PAULINO).

name: PAOLO
meaning: Italian form of Paulus (see PAUL). Paolo Uccello and Paolo Veronese were both Italian Renaissance painters.

name: PAPA
meaning: Means "earth" in Maori. In Maori and other Polynesian mythology Papa or Papatuanuku was the goddess of the earth and the mother of many of the other gods. She and her husband Rangi, the god of the sky, were locked in a tight embrace. Their children decided to separate them, a feat of strength accomplished by the god Tane.

name: PARAMONOS
meaning: Derived from Greek παραμονη(paramone) meaning "endurance, constancy".

name: PARASKEVA
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of PARASKEVE.

name: PARASKEVE
meaning: Derived from Greek παρασκευη(paraskeue) meaning "preparation" or "Friday" (being the day of preparation). This was the name of a 2nd-century saint who was martyred in Rome.

name: PARIS  (1)
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Greek mythology he was the Trojan prince who kidnapped Helen and began the Trojan War. Though presented as a somewhat of a coward in the 'Iliad', he did manage to slay the great hero Achilles. He was himself eventually slain in battle by Philoctetes.

name: PARIS  (2)
meaning: From the name of the capital city of France, which got its name from the ancient Celtic tribe known as the Parisii.

name: PARKER
meaning: From an English occupational surname which meant "keeper of the park".

name: PARMINDER
meaning: From Sanskrit परम(parama) meaning "highest, best" combined with the name of the Hindu god INDRA.

name: PARNEL
meaning: Contracted form of PETRONEL. In the later Middle Ages it became a slang term for a promiscuous woman, and the name subsequently fell out of use.

name: PARRIS
meaning: From an English surname which originally denoted a person who came from the French city of Paris (see PARIS(2)).

name: PARRY
meaning: From a Welsh surname which was derived from ap Harry meaning "son of HARRY".

name: PARTHA
meaning: Means "son of PRITHA" in Sanskrit. In Hindu belief this is another name for the Pandavas, who were sons of Pritha (another name of Kunti) and Pandu.

name: PARTHALÁN
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly from BARTHOLOMEW. In Irish legend he was the first man on Ireland after the biblical flood.

name: PARTHENIA
meaning: Derived from Greek παρθενος(parthenos) meaning "maiden, virgin". This was an epithet of the Greek goddess Athena.

name: PARTHENOPE
meaning: Means "maiden's voice", derived from Greek παρθενος(parthenos) "maiden, virgin" and οψ(ops) "voice". In Greek legend this is the name of one of the Sirens who enticed Odysseus.

name: PARVANA
meaning: Variant transcription of PƏRVANƏ (Azerbaijani) or PARVANEH (Persian).

name: PARVATI
meaning: Means "of the mountains" in Sanskrit. Parvati is a Hindu goddess of love and power, the wife of Shiva and the mother of Ganesha.

name: PARVEEN
meaning: Hindi form of PARVIN, also used as a masculine name.

name: PARVIN
meaning: Means "the Pleiades" in Persian. The Pleiades are a group of seven stars in the constellation Taurus.

name: PARVIZ
meaning: Means "fortunate, happy" in Persian. This name was borne by a son of the Mughal emperor Jahangir.

name: PASCAL
meaning: From the Late Latin name Paschalis, which meant "relating to Easter" from Latin Pascha "Easter", which was in turn from Hebrew פֶּסַח(pesach) meaning "Passover". Passover is the ancient Hebrew holiday celebrating the liberation from Egypt. Because it coincided closely with the later Christian holiday of Easter, the same Latin word was used for both. The name Pascal can also function as a surname, as in the case of Blaise Pascal, the French philosopher, mathematician and inventor.

name: PASCHAL
meaning: Variant of Paschalis (see PASCAL). Paschal or Paschalis was the name of two popes.

name: PASCHALIS
meaning: Latin and Greek form of PASCAL.

name: PASKAL
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian form of PASCAL.

name: PASTOR
meaning: From a Late Latin name meaning "shepherd". This was the name of at least three saints.

name: PAT
meaning: Short form of PATRICK or PATRICIA. A famous bearer of this name was Pat Garrett (1850-1908), the sheriff who shot Billy the Kid.

name: PATIENCE
meaning: From the English word patience, ultimately from Latin patientia, a derivative of pati "to suffer". This was one of the virtue names coined by the Puritans in the 17th century.

name: PATIGUL
meaning: Uyghur elaboration of PATIME using the suffix گۇل(gul) meaning "flower, rose".

name: PATRICIA
meaning: Feminine form of Patricius (see PATRICK). In medieval England this spelling appears in Latin documents, but this form was probably not used as the actual name until the 18th century, in Scotland.

name: PATRICIE
meaning: Czech feminine form of Patricius (see PATRICK).

name: PATRICIJA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian feminine form of Patricius (see PATRICK).

name: PATRICK
meaning: From the Latin name Patricius, which meant "nobleman". This name was adopted in the 5th-century by Saint Patrick, whose birth name was Sucat. He was a Romanized Briton who was captured and enslaved in his youth by Irish raiders. After six years of servitude he escaped home, but he eventually became a bishop and went back to Ireland as a missionary. He is traditionally credited with Christianizing the island, and is regarded as Ireland's patron saint....[more]

name: PATRIZIA
meaning: Italian feminine form of Patricius (see PATRICK).

name: PATROCLUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek Πατροκλος(Patroklos) which meant "glory of the father", derived from πατηρ(pater) "father" (genitive πατρος) and κλεος(kleos) "glory". In Greek legend he was one of the heroes who fought against the Trojans. His death at the hands of Hector drew his friend Achilles back into the war.

name: PATRYCJA
meaning: Polish feminine form of Patricius (see PATRICK).

name: PATRÍCIA
meaning: Slovak, Portuguese and Hungarian feminine form of Patricius (see PATRICK).

name: PATSY
meaning: Variant of PATTY, also used as a diminutive of PATRICK.

name: PATTON
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from a diminutive of PATRICK. A notable bearer of the surname was the American World War II general George S. Patton (1885-1945), who played an important part in the allied offensive in France.

name: PATTY
meaning: Originally a variant of Matty, a 17th-century diminutive of MARTHA. It is now commonly used as a diminutive of PATRICIA.

name: PAU
meaning: Catalan and Occitan form of PAUL. It also coincides with the Catalan word for "peace".

name: PAUL
meaning: From the Roman family name Paulus, which meant "small" or "humble" in Latin. Paul was an important leader of the early Christian church. According to Acts in the New Testament, he was a Jewish Roman citizen who converted to Christianity after the resurrected Jesus appeared to him. After this he travelled the eastern Mediterranean as a missionary. His original Hebrew name was Saul. Many of the epistles in the New Testament were authored by him....[more]

name: PAULA
meaning: Feminine form of Paulus (see PAUL). This was the name of a 4th-century Roman saint who was a companion of Saint Jerome.

name: PAULE
meaning: French feminine form of Paulus (see PAUL).

name: PAULIEN
meaning: Dutch feminine form of Paulinus (see PAULINO).

name: PAULINE
meaning: French feminine form of Paulinus (see PAULINO).

name: PAULINO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of the Roman family name Paulinus, which was itself derived from Paulus (see PAUL). Saint Paulinus of Nola was a 5th-century nobleman from Gaul who gave up his wealthy lifestyle and became bishop of Nola. He was also noted for his poetry. Another saint by this name was a 7th-century missionary to England who became the first bishop of York.

name: PAULO
meaning: Portuguese and Galician form of Paulus (see PAUL).

name: PAVEL
meaning: Russian, Czech, Bulgarian, Slovene and Macedonian form of PAUL.

name: PAVLE
meaning: Serbian, Macedonian, Croatian and Georgian form of PAUL.

name: PAVLINA
meaning: Bulgarian, Macedonian and Greek form of PAULINA.

name: PAX
meaning: Means "peace" in Latin. In Roman mythology this was the name of the goddess of peace.

name: PAXTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from an English place name meaning "Pœcc's town". Pœcc is an Old English name of unknown meaning.

name: PAZ  (1)
meaning: Means "peace" in Spanish. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary, Nuestra Señora de la Paz, meaning "Our Lady of Peace".

name: PAĈJO
meaning: Esperanto diminutive of PAUL. This name also means "papa" in Esperanto.

name: PEACE
meaning: From the English word peace, ultimately derived from Latin pax.

name: PEADAR
meaning: Irish and Scottish form of PETER.

name: PEARL
meaning: From the English word pearl for the concretions formed in the shells of some mollusks, ultimately from Late Latin perla. Like other gemstone names, it has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since the 19th century. The pearl is the birthstone for June, and it supposedly imparts health and wealth.

name: PEDRO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of PETER. This was the name of the only two emperors of Brazil.

name: PEER
meaning: Variant of PER. The Norwegian playwright Henrik Ibsen used this name for the main character in his play 'Peer Gynt' (1867).

name: PEGASUS
meaning: From the Greek Πηγασος(Pegasos), possibly either from πηγος(pegos) "strong" or πηγαιος(pegaios) "from a water spring". In Greek mythology Pegasus was the winged horse that sprang from the blood of Medusa after she was killed by Perseus. There is a constellation in the northern sky named after the horse.

name: PEGGY
meaning: Medieval variant of Meggy, a diminutive of MARGARET. The reason for the change in the initial consonant is unknown.

name: PEJO
meaning: Croatian and Serbian diminutive of PETAR.

name: PEKKO
meaning: Meaning unknown. This is the name of the Finnish god of fields and crops.

name: PELAGIA
meaning: Feminine form of PELAGIUS. This was the name of a few early saints, including a young 4th-century martyr who threw herself from a rooftop in Antioch rather than lose her virginity.

name: PELAGIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Πελαγιος(Pelagios), which was derived from πελαγος(pelagos) "the sea". This was the name of several saints and two popes.

name: PELE
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of the Hawaiian goddess of volcanoes and fire who is said to live in Kilauea.

name: PELEG
meaning: Means "division, channel" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is the son of Eber.

name: PENELOPE
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek πηνελοψ(penelops), a type of duck. Alternatively it could be from πηνη(pene) "threads, weft" and ωψ(ops) "face, eye". In Homer's epic the 'Odyssey' this is the name of the wife of Odysseus, forced to fend off suitors while her husband is away fighting at Troy. It has occasionally been used as an English given name since the 16th century.

name: PENINNAH
meaning: Means "precious stone, pearl" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of one of the wives of Elkanah, the other being Hannah.

name: PENJANI
meaning: Means "seek for, look for" in Tumbuka.

name: PENUEL
meaning: Means "facing God" in Hebrew. This is the name of two minor characters in the Old Testament.

name: PEONY
meaning: From the English word for the type of flower. It was originally believed to have healing qualities, so it was named after the Greek medical god Pæon.

name: PER
meaning: Scandinavian and Breton form of PETER.

name: PERCIVAL
meaning: Created by the 12th-century French poet Chrétien de Troyes for his poem 'Perceval, the Story of the Grail'. In the poem Perceval was one of King Arthur's Knights of the Round Table who was given a glimpse of the Holy Grail. The character (and probably the name) of Perceval was based on that of the Welsh hero PEREDUR. The spelling was perhaps altered under the influence of Old French percer val "to pierce the valley".

name: PERCY
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the name of a Norman town Perci, which was itself perhaps derived from a Gaulish given name which was Latinized as Persius. The surname was borne by a noble English family, and it first used as a given name in their honour. A famous bearer was Percy Bysshe Shelley (1792-1822), an English romantic poet whose works include 'Adonais' and 'Ozymandias'. This name can also be used as a short form of PERCIVAL.

name: PERDITA
meaning: Derived from Latin perditus meaning "lost". Shakespeare created this name for the daughter of Hermione in his play 'The Winter's Tale' (1610).

name: PEREDUR
meaning: Possibly means "hard spears" in Welsh. This was the name of several figures from Welsh mythology. It was later used by the 12th-century chronicler Geoffrey of Monmouth in his Arthurian tales. The character of Percival was probably based on him.

name: PEREGRINE
meaning: From the Late Latin name Peregrinus, which meant "traveller". This was the name of several early saints.

name: PEREZ
meaning: Means "breach, burst forth" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the twin brother of Zerah.

name: PERICLES
meaning: From the Greek name Περικλης(Perikles), which was derived from the Greek elements περι(peri) "around, exceedingly" and κλεος(kleos) "glory". This was the name of a 5th-century BC Athenian statesman and general.

name: PERLA
meaning: Italian and Spanish cognate of PEARL.

name: PERLE
meaning: French and Yiddish cognate of PEARL. It is also used as a Yiddish vernacular form of Margaret.

name: PERMELIA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly an early American alteration of PAMELA.

name: PERNILLE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian short form of PETRONILLA.

name: PERPETUA
meaning: Derived from Latin perpetuus meaning "continuous". This was the name of a 3rd-century saint martyred with another woman named Felicity.

name: PERRINE
meaning: French feminine form of Perrin, a diminutive of PIERRE.

name: PERRY
meaning: From a surname which is either English or Welsh in origin. It can be derived from Middle English perrie meaning "pear tree", or else from Welsh ap Herry, meaning "son of HERRY". A famous bearer of the surname was Matthew Perry (1794-1858), the American naval officer who opened Japan to the West.

name: PERSEPHONE
meaning: Meaning unknown, probably of Pre-Greek origin, but perhaps related to Greek περθω(pertho) "to destroy" and φονη(phone) "murder". In Greek myth she was the daughter of Demeter and Zeus. She was abducted to the underworld by Hades, but was eventually allowed to return to the surface for part of the year. The result of her comings and goings is the changing of the seasons. With her mother she was worshipped in the Eleusinian Mysteries, which were secret rites practiced at the city of Eleusis near Athens.

name: PERSEUS
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek περθω(pertho) meaning "to destroy". In Greek mythology Perseus was a hero who was said to have founded the ancient city of Mycenae. He was the son of Zeus and Danaë. Mother and child were exiled by Danaë's father Acrisius, and Perseus was raised on the island of Seriphos. The king of the island compelled Perseus to kill the Gorgon Medusa, who was so ugly that anyone who gazed upon her was turned to stone. After obtaining winged sandals and other tools from the gods, he succeeded in his task by looking at Medusa in the reflection of his shield and slaying her in her sleep. On his return he defeated a sea monster in order to save Andromeda, who became his wife.

name: PERSIS
meaning: Greek name meaning "Persian woman". This was the name of a woman mentioned in Paul's epistle to the Romans in the New Testament.

name: PERTTI
meaning: Short form of ROOPERTTI or ALPERTTI.

name: PERUN
meaning: Means "thunder" in Slavic. In Slavic mythology Perun was the god of lightning, sometimes worshipped as the primary god. The oak was his sacred tree.

name: PETAR
meaning: Serbian, Croatian, Bulgarian and Macedonian form of PETER.

name: PETER
meaning: Derived from the Greek Πετρος(Petros) meaning "stone". This is a translation used in most versions of the New Testament of the name Cephas, meaning "stone" in Aramaic, which was given to the apostle Simon by Jesus (compare Matthew 16:18 and John 1:42). Simon Peter was the most prominent of the apostles during Jesus' ministry and is often considered the first pope....[more]

name: PETKO
meaning: Derived from Bulgarian Петък(Petak) or Macedonian Петок(Petok) meaning "Friday". This is a vernacular form of Paraskeve.

name: PETRA
meaning: Feminine form of PETER. This was also the name of an ancient city in the region that is now Jordan.

name: PETRE
meaning: Romanian, Macedonian and Georgian form of PETER.

name: PETRI
meaning: Finnish and Basque form of PETER.

name: PETRO
meaning: Ukrainian and Esperanto form of PETER.

name: PETRONA
meaning: Possibly a feminine form of PETRONIUS.

name: PETRONELA
meaning: Romanian, Slovak and Polish form of PETRONILLA.

name: PETRONELLA
meaning: Dutch and Swedish form of PETRONILLA.

name: PETRONILLA
meaning: From a Latin name, a diminutive of Petronia, the feminine form of PETRONIUS. This was the name of an obscure 1st-century Roman saint, later believed to be a daughter of Saint Peter.

name: PETRONIUS
meaning: Roman family name which is possibly derived from Latin petro, petronis "yokel".

name: PETROS
meaning: Greek and Armenian form of PETER.

name: PETRU
meaning: Romanian and Corsican form of PETER. It is also the form used in the Church Slavic New Testament.

name: PETRUS
meaning: Latin form of PETER used occasionally in Dutch and German.

name: PETTER
meaning: Swedish and Norwegian form of PETER.

name: PETULA
meaning: Meaning unknown, created in the 20th century. The name is borne by the British singer Petula Clark (1932-), whose name was invented by her father.

name: PETUNIA
meaning: From the name of the flower, derived ultimately from a Tupi (South American) word.

name: PETYA
meaning: Russian masculine diminutive of PYOTR or Bulgarian feminine diminutive of PETAR.

name: PEYTON
meaning: From an English surname, originally a place name meaning "PÆGA's town". A famous bearer was Peyton Randolph (1721-1775), the first president of the Continental Congress. It is also borne by American football quarterback Peyton Manning (1976-).

name: PHAEDRA
meaning: From the Greek Φαιδρα(Phaidra), derived from φαιδρος(phaidros) meaning "bright". Phaedra was the daughter of Minos and the wife of Theseus in Greek mythology. Aphrodite caused her to fall in love with her stepson Hippolytos, and after she was rejected by him she killed herself.

name: PHAEDRUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Φαιδρος(Phaidros), which meant "bright". This was the name of a 5th-century BC Greek philosopher, and also of a 1st-century Roman fabulist who was originally a slave from Thrace.

name: PHAENNA
meaning: Derived from Greek φαεινος(phaeinos) "shining". According to some Greek myths this was the name of one of the three Graces or Χαριτες (Charites).

name: PHANUEL
meaning: Form of PENUEL used in the New Testament, where it is borne by the father of Anna the prophetess. It also appears in the apocryphal Book of Enoch belonging to an angel.

name: PHANUHEL
meaning: Form of PENUEL in the Latin New Testament.

name: PHARAMOND
meaning: French form of FARAMUND used by Shakespeare in 'Henry V' (1599).

name: PHARES
meaning: Form of PEREZ in the Greek and Latin Bible.

name: PHAREZ
meaning: Form of PEREZ used in some translations of the Bible.

name: PHEBE
meaning: Variant of PHOEBE used in some translations of the New Testament.

name: PHELIX
meaning: Form of FELIX used in the Greek New Testament.

name: PHERENIKE
meaning: Ancient Attic Greek form of BERENICE.

name: PHESTOS
meaning: Form of FESTUS used in the Greek New Testament.

name: PHIL
meaning: Short form of PHILIP and various other names beginning with Phil, often a Greek element meaning "friend, dear, beloved".

name: PHILADELPHIA
meaning: From the name of a city in Asia Minor mentioned in Revelation in the New Testament. The name of the city meant "brotherly love" from Greek φιλεω(phileo) "to love" and αδελφος(adelphos) "brother". It is also the name of a city in the United States.

name: PHILANDER
meaning: From the Greek name Φιλανδρος(Philandros) meaning "friend of man" from Greek φιλος(philos) "friend" and ανηρ(aner) "man" (genitive ανδρος). It was the name of a son of Apollo with the nymph Acalle. In the 18th century this was coined as a word meaning "to womanize", and the name subsequently dropped out of use.

name: PHILEMON
meaning: Means "affectionate" in Greek, a derivative of φιλημα(philema) "kiss". Philemon was the recipient of one of Paul's epistles in the New Testament.

name: PHILETUS
meaning: From the Greek name Φιλητος(Philetos) meaning "beloved". In the New Testament, Philetus is a heretic in the church at Ephesus.

name: PHILIBERT
meaning: Early variant of FILIBERT altered by association with Greek φιλος(philos) "friend, lover". This was the name of a 7th-century Frankish saint. Another famous bearer was Philibert de l'Orme (1510-1570), a French Renaissance architect.

name: PHILIP
meaning: From the Greek name Φιλιππος(Philippos) which means "friend of horses", composed of the elements φιλος(philos) "friend, lover" and ‘ιππος(hippos) "horse". This was the name of five kings of Macedon, including Philip II the father of Alexander the Great. The name appears in the New Testament belonging to two people who are regarded as saints. First, one of the twelve apostles, and second, an early figure in the Christian church known as Philip the Deacon....[more]

name: PHILLIP
meaning: Variant of PHILIP, inspired by the usual spelling of the surname.

name: PHILO
meaning: From the Greek name Φιλων(Philon), which was derived from φιλος(philos) meaning "lover, friend". This was the name of a 1st-century Hellenistic Jewish philosopher and theologian from Alexandria.

name: PHILOKRATES
meaning: Means "friend of power" from Greek φιλος(philos) "lover, friend" and κρατος(kratos) "power".

name: PHILOMEL
meaning: From an English word meaning "nightingale" (ultimately from PHILOMELA). It has been used frequently in poetry to denote the bird.

name: PHILOMELA
meaning: Derived from Greek φιλος(philos) "lover, friend" and μηλον(melon) "fruit". The second element has also been interpreted as Greek μελος(melos) "song". In Greek myth Philomela was the sister-in-law of Tereus, who raped her and cut out her tongue. Prokne avenged her sister by killing her son by Tereus, after which Tereus attempted to kill Philomela. However, the gods intervened and transformed her into a nightingale.

name: PHILOMENA
meaning: From Greek φιλος(philos) "friend, lover" and μενος(menos) "mind, strength, force". This was the name of an obscure early saint and martyr. The name came to public attention in the 19th century after a tomb seemingly marked with the name Filumena was found in Rome, supposedly belonging to another martyr named Philomena. This may have in fact been a representation of the Greek word φιλομηνη(philomene) meaning "loved".

name: PHILOTHEOS
meaning: Means "friend of god" from Greek φιλος(philos) "lover, friend" and θεος(theos) "god".

name: PHINEAS
meaning: Variant of PHINEHAS used in some versions of the Bible.

name: PHINEES
meaning: Form of PHINEHAS used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: PHINEHAS
meaning: Probably means "Nubian" from the Egyptian name Panhsj, though some believe it means "serpent's mouth" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament Phinehas is a grandson of Aaron who kills an Israelite because he is intimate with a Midianite woman, thus stopping a plague sent by God. Also in the Bible this is the son of Eli, killed in battle with the Philistines.

name: PHIRUN
meaning: Means "rain" in Khmer, from the name of a rain god in the mythologies of southeast Asia. The god's name is possibly derived from VARUNA.

name: PHOBOS
meaning: Means "fear, panic" in Greek. This was one of the sons of Ares in Greek mythology. Also, one of the moons of Mars bears this name.

name: PHOCAS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Φωκας(Phokas), which meant "a seal" from Greek φωκη(phoke). This was the name of an early saint and martyr from Asia Minor. Sentenced to death for being a Christian, he is said to have given his killers lodging and then dug his own grave before he was executed.

name: PHOEBE
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Φοιβη(Phoibe), which meant "bright, pure" from Greek φοιβος(phoibos). In Greek mythology Phoibe was a Titan associated with the moon. This was also an epithet of her granddaughter, the moon goddess Artemis. The name appears in Paul's epistle to the Romans in the New Testament, where it belongs to a female minister in the church at Cenchreae. In England, it began to be used as a given name after the Protestant Reformation. A moon of Saturn bears this name (in honour of the Titan).

name: PHOEBUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Φοιβος(Phoibos), which meant "bright, pure". This was an epithet of the Greek god Apollo.

name: PHOENIX
meaning: From the name of a beautiful immortal bird which appears in Egyptian and Greek mythology.
