After living for several centuries in the Arabian Desert, it would be consumed by fire and rise from its own ashes, with this cycle repeating every 500 years. The name of the bird was derived from Greek φοινιξ(phoinix) meaning "dark red".

name: PHOTINE
meaning: Derived from Greek φως(phos) meaning "light" (genitive φωτος(photos)). This is the name traditionally given to the Samaritan woman Jesus met at the well (see John 4:7). She is venerated as a saint by the Eastern Church.

name: PHOTIOS
meaning: Derived from Greek φως(phos) meaning "light" (genitive φωτος(photos)).

name: PHRIXUS
meaning: From the Greek Φριξος(Phrixos) which meant "thrilling, causing shivers", derived from φριξ(phrix) "ripple, shiver". In Greek myth Phrixus was the son of Athamus and Nephele. He was to be sacrificed to Zeus, but he escaped with his sister Helle on the back of the ram with the Golden Fleece.

name: PHUNIHEL
meaning: Form of PENUEL in the Latin Old Testament.

name: PHYLLIDA
meaning: From Φυλλιδος(Phyllidos), the genitive form of PHYLLIS. This form was used in 17th-century pastoral poetry.

name: PHYLLIS
meaning: Means "foliage" in Greek. In Greek mythology this was the name of a woman who killed herself out of love for Demophon and was subsequently transformed into an almond tree. It began to be used as a given name in England in the 16th century, though it was often confused with Felicia.

name: PHÚC
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 福(phúc) meaning "happiness, good fortune, blessing".

name: PHƯỢNG
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 鳳(phượng) meaning "phoenix". This refers to the mythological creature known as the Chinese phoenix or the Fenghuang.

name: PIEDAD
meaning: Means "mercy, piety" in Spanish, ultimately from Latin pietas.

name: PIER
meaning: Italian and Dutch variant form of PETER. In Italian, this form is often used in combination with another name.

name: PIERCE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name PIERS.

name: PIERO
meaning: Italian form of PETER. Piero della Francesca was an Italian Renaissance painter.

name: PIERRE
meaning: French form of PETER. This name was borne by Pierre-Auguste Renoir (1841-1919), a French impressionist painter, and by Pierre Curie (1859-1906), a physicist who discovered radioactivity with his wife Marie.

name: PIERS
meaning: Medieval form of PETER. This was the name of the main character in the 14th-century poem 'Piers Plowman' by William Langland.

name: PIETARI
meaning: Finnish form of PETER used in the Bible.

name: PIETER
meaning: Dutch form of PETER. This name was borne by the 16th-century Flemish painter Pieter Brueghel the Elder.

name: PIETRO
meaning: Italian form of PETER. Pietro was the given name of the Renaissance painter known as Perugino.

name: PIETY
meaning: From the English word meaning "piety, devoutness". This was a rare virtue name used by the Puritans in the 17th century.

name: PIHLA
meaning: Derived from Finnish pihlaja meaning "rowan tree".

name: PIIA
meaning: Finnish and Estonian form of PIA.

name: PILAR
meaning: Means "pillar" in Spanish. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary, María del Pilar, meaning "Mary of the Pillar". According to legend, when Saint James the Greater was in Saragossa in Spain, the Virgin Mary appeared on a pillar.

name: PINA
meaning: Short form of names ending in pina.

name: PING
meaning: From Chinese 平(píng) meaning "level, even, peaceful". Other characters can also form this name.

name: PINO
meaning: Short form of names ending in pino.

name: PIO
meaning: Italian and Portuguese form of PIUS.

name: PIP
meaning: Diminutive of PHILIP or PHILIPPA. This was the name of the main character in 'Great Expectations' (1860) by Charles Dickens.

name: PIPER
meaning: From a surname which was originally given to a person who played on a pipe (a flute). It was popularized as a given name by a character from the television series 'Charmed', which debuted in 1998.

name: PIPPIN  (2)
meaning: The name of a hobbit in 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954) by J. R. R. Tolkien. His full given name was Peregrin, a semi-translation into English of his true hobbit name Razanur meaning "traveller".

name: PIRAN
meaning: Possibly derived from CIARÁN. This was the name of a 5th-century Irish monk who founded a monastery in Cornwall. He is the patron saint of Cornwall.

name: PIROSKA
meaning: Hungarian form of PRISCA, influenced by the Hungarian word piros meaning "red".

name: PISTIS
meaning: Means "trust, faith" in Greek. In Greek mythology Pistis was the personification of trust.

name: PITAMBARA
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit पीत(pita) meaning "yellow" and अम्बर(ambara) meaning "garment". This is another name of the Hindu gods Vishnu or Krishna, given to them because yellow clothing is traditionally worn at religious events.

name: PITTER
meaning: Frisian and Limburgish form of PETER.

name: PIUS
meaning: Late Latin name meaning "pious, dutiful". This was the name of twelve popes.

name: PLACIDE
meaning: French masculine and feminine form of Placidus (see PLACIDO).

name: PLACIDO
meaning: Italian form of the Late Latin name Placidus which meant "quiet, calm".

name: PLAMEN
meaning: Derived from South Slavic plamen meaning "flame, fire".

name: PLATO
meaning: From the Greek name Πλατων(Platon) which was derived from Greek πλατυς(platys) meaning "broad-shouldered". Plato was one of the most important of the Greek philosophers. He was a pupil of Socrates and a teacher of Aristotle. He constructed the theory of Forms and wrote several works, including the 'Republic'.

name: PLEASANCE
meaning: From the medieval name Plaisance which meant "pleasant" in Old French.

name: PLINIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of Plinius (see PLINY).

name: PLINY
meaning: From the Roman family name Plinius, which is of unknown meaning. Two 1st-century Romans are known by this name: Gaius Plinius Secundus (called Pliny the Elder), a scientist and historian who died during the eruption of Mount Vesuvius; and Caius Plinius Caecilius Secundus (called Pliny the Younger), an author and statesman.

name: PLUTARCH
meaning: From the Greek name Πλουταρχος(Ploutarchos), which was derived from πλουτος(ploutos) "riches, wealth" and αρχος(archos) "master". Plutarch was a 1st-century Greek historian.

name: PLUTO
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Πλουτων(Plouton), derived from πλουτος(ploutos) meaning "wealth". This was an alternate name of Hades, the god of the underworld. This is also the name of a dwarf planet (formerly designated the ninth planet) in the solar system.

name: PLÁCIDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of Placidus (see PLACIDO).

name: POCAHONTAS
meaning: Means "playful one" in Powhatan, an Algonquian language. This was the name of a 17th-century Powhatan woman, a daughter of the powerful chief Wahunsenacawh. She married the white colonist John Rolfe and travelled with him to England, but died of illness before returning.

name: POLINA
meaning: Either a Russian, Ukrainian, Bulgarian and Greek form of PAULINA or a short form of APOLLINARIYA.

name: POLLUX
meaning: Roman form of Greek Πολυδευκης(Polydeukes) meaning "very sweet", from Greek πολυς(polys) "much" and δευκης(deukes) "sweet". In mythology he was the twin brother of Castor and a son of Zeus. The constellation Gemini, which represents the two brothers, contains a star by this name.

name: POLLY
meaning: Medieval variant of MOLLY. The reason for the change in the initial consonant is unknown.

name: POLLYANNA
meaning: Combination of POLLY and ANNA. This was the name of the main character in Eleanor H. Porter's novel 'Pollyanna' (1913).

name: POLYCARP
meaning: From the Greek name Πολυκαρπος(Polykarpos) meaning "fruitful, rich in fruit", ultimately from Greek πολυς(polys) "much" and καρπος(karpos) "fruit". Saint Polycarp was a 2nd-century bishop of Smyrna who was martyred by being burned at the stake and then stabbed.

name: POLYMNIA
meaning: Means "abounding in song", derived from Greek πολυς(polys) "much" and ‘υμνος(hymnos) "song, hymn". In Greek mythology she was the goddess of dance and sacred songs, one of the nine Muses.

name: POLYXENA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek Πολυξενη(Polyxene) which was from the word πολυξενος(polyxenos) meaning "entertaining many guests, very hospitable", itself derived from πολυς(polys) "many" and ξενος(xenos) "foreigner, guest". In Greek legend she was a daughter of Priam and Hecuba, beloved by Achilles. After the Trojan War, Achilles' son Neoptolemus sacrificed her.

name: POMARE
meaning: From Tahitian po "night" and mare "cough". This name was borne by four kings and a queen of Tahiti. The first king adopted the name after his child died of a cough in the night.

name: POMONA
meaning: From Latin pomus "fruit tree". This was the name of the Roman goddess of fruit trees.

name: POMPEY
meaning: Modern form of the Roman family name Pompeius, which was probably derived from a Sabellic word meaning "five". A notable bearer was the 1st-century BC Roman general Gnaeus Pompeius Magnus, also known as Pompey the Great.

name: POMPILIU
meaning: Romanian form of the Roman name Pompilius which is of unknown meaning, possibly a derivative of Pompeius (see POMPEY). Numa Pompilius was the legendary second king of Rome (after Romulus).

name: POMPONIUS
meaning: Roman family name which is of unknown meaning, possibly a derivative of Pompeius (see POMPEY).

name: PONTIUS
meaning: Roman family name. The family had Samnite roots so the name probably originated from the Oscan language, likely meaning "fifth" (a cognate of Latin Quintus). Alternatively, it could be derived from the name of the ancient province of Pontus in Asia Minor, itself probably from Greek ποντος(pontos) "sea". A notable bearer of this name was Pontius Pilate, the Roman governor of Judea who appears in the New Testament.

name: POPPY
meaning: From the word for the red flower, derived from Old English popæg.

name: PORCIUS
meaning: Roman family name meaning "pig", derived from Latin porcus. Famous members of the family include the Roman statesmen Cato the Elder (Marcus Porcius Cato) and his great-grandson Cato the Younger (Marcus Porcius Cato Uticencis).

name: PORFIRIO
meaning: Derived from the Greek name Πορφυριος(Porphyrios), which was derived from the word πορφυρα(porphyra) meaning "purple dye". This was the name of several early saints.

name: PORNTIP
meaning: Derived from Thai พร(phon) "blessing" and ทิพย์(thip) "divine".

name: PORSCHE
meaning: From the name of the German car company, which was founded by Ferdinand Porsche (1875-1951). His surname is derived from the given name BORIS.

name: PORTER
meaning: From an occupational English surname meaning "doorkeeper", ultimately from Old French porte "door", from Latin porta.

name: PORTIA
meaning: Variant of Porcia, the feminine form of the Roman family name PORCIUS, used by William Shakespeare for the heroine of his play 'The Merchant of Venice' (1596). In the play Portia is a woman who disguises herself as a man in order to defend Antonio in court. It is also the name of a moon of Uranus, after the Shakespearian character.

name: POSEIDON
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek ποσις(posis) "husband, lord" and δα(da) "earth". In Greek mythology Poseidon was the unruly god of the sea and earthquakes, the brother of Zeus. He was often depicted carrying a trident and riding in a chariot drawn by white horses.

name: POSY
meaning: Diminutive of JOSEPHINE. It can also be inspired by the English word posy for a bunch of flowers.

name: POTSɄNAKWAHIPɄ
meaning: Means "buffalo hump" in Comanche. This name was borne by a 19th-century war chief of the Penateka Comanche.

name: PRABHAKARA
meaning: Means "light maker", derived from Sanskrit प्रभा(prabha) meaning "light" and कर(kara) meaning "maker". This is a name given to the sun in Hindu texts. It was also borne by a medieval Hindu scholar.

name: PRABHU
meaning: Means "mighty, powerful, master" in Sanskrit. This is an epithet of both the Hindu gods Surya and Agni.

name: PRADIP
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit प्रदीप(pradipa) meaning "light, lantern".

name: PRAISE
meaning: From the English word praise, which is ultimately derived (via Old French) from Late Latin preciare, a derivative of Latin pretium "price, worth".

name: PRAKASH
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit प्रकाश(prakasha) meaning "light, bright, shining".

name: PRAMODA
meaning: Means "joy" in Sanskrit. This is the name of an attendant of the Hindu god Skanda.

name: PRANAV
meaning: This is the Sanskrit word referring to ओम्(om), the Hindu sacred syllable.

name: PRANVERA
meaning: Derived from Albanian pranverë meaning "spring", itself from pranë "nearby, close" and verë "summer".

name: PRASAD
meaning: Means "brightness, clearness, graciousness, offering" in Sanskrit. This is a word referring to an offering of food made to a deity.

name: PRASENJIT
meaning: Means "conqueror of an expert army" in Sanskrit.

name: PRAXIS
meaning: Means "practical" in Greek. This was another name for the Greek goddess Aphrodite.

name: PRAXITELES
meaning: Derived from the Greek elements πραξις(praxis) "action, exercise" and τελος(telos) "aim, goal". This was the name of a 4th-century BC sculptor from Athens.

name: PREBEN
meaning: Modern Danish form of the name Pridbjørn, which was a medieval Scandinavian form of the Slavic (Wendish) name Pridbor, which was derived from Slavic prid "first" and borti "battle". It was imported into Danish via the medieval Putbus family, who were Slavic nobles from Rügen in Pomerania.

name: PRECIOUS
meaning: From the English word precious, ultimately derived from Latin pretiosus, a derivative of Latin pretium "price, worth".

name: PREDRAG
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element dragu meaning "precious" combined with a superlative prefix.

name: PREMISLAV
meaning: Possible medieval Slavic form of PRZEMYSŁAW.

name: PREMYSL
meaning: Possible medieval Slavic form of PŘEMYSL.

name: PRESLEY
meaning: From an English surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "priest clearing" (Old English preost and leah). This surname was borne by musician Elvis Presley (1935-1977).

name: PRESTON
meaning: From an English surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "priest town" (Old English preost and tun).

name: PRIAM
meaning: From the Greek Πριαμος(Priamos), possibly meaning "redeemed". In Greek legend Priam was the king of Troy during the Trojan War and the father of many children including Hector and Paris.

name: PRIAPUS
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of a Greek god of fertility, gardens, and the phallus.

name: PRICE
meaning: From a Welsh surname which was derived from ap Rhys meaning "son of RHYS".

name: PRIMITIVA
meaning: Feminine form of PRIMITIVUS. Saint Primitiva was an early martyr from Rome.

name: PRIMITIVUS
meaning: Late Latin name which meant "first formed". Saint Primitivus was a 3rd-century Spanish martyr.

name: PRIMO
meaning: Italian form of the Late Latin name Primus, which meant "first". This was the name of three early saints, each of whom were martyred.

name: PRIMROSE
meaning: From the English word for the flower, ultimately deriving from Latin prima rosa "first rose".

name: PRIMULA
meaning: From the name of a genus of several species of flowers, including the primrose. It is derived from the Latin word primulus meaning "very first".

name: PRINCE
meaning: From the English word prince, a royal title, which comes ultimately from Latin princeps. This name was borne by the American musician Prince Rogers Nelson (1958-2016), who is known simply as Prince.

name: PRISCA
meaning: Feminine form of Priscus, a Roman family name which meant "ancient" in Latin. This name appears in the epistles in the New Testament, referring to Priscilla the wife of Aquila.

name: PRISCILA
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of PRISCILLA.

name: PRISCILLA
meaning: Roman name, a diminutive of PRISCA. In Acts in the New Testament Paul lived with Priscilla (also known as Prisca) and her husband Aquila in Corinth for a while. It has been used as an English given name since the Protestant Reformation, being popular with the Puritans. Henry Wadsworth Longfellow used it in his poem 'The Courtship of Miles Standish' (1858).

name: PRISKA
meaning: German form of PRISCA, as well as the form used in the Greek New Testament.

name: PRISKILLA
meaning: Form of PRISCILLA used in the Greek New Testament.

name: PRITHA
meaning: Means "the palm of the hand" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the legendary Hindu figure Kunti.

name: PRIYA
meaning: Means "beloved" in Sanskrit. In Hindu legend this is the name of a daughter of King Daksha.

name: PROCHORUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Προχορος(Prochoros) which meant "leader of the dance". Saint Prochorus was one of the original seven deacons, as told in Acts in the New Testament.

name: PROKOPIOS
meaning: Derived from Greek προκοπη(prokope) "progress, advance". Saint Prokopios was an early Christian martyr who was beheaded in Palestine during the persecutions of the Roman emperor Diocletian.

name: PROMETHEUS
meaning: Derived from Greek προμηθεια(prometheia) meaning "foresight, forethought". In Greek myth he was the Titan who gave the knowledge of fire to mankind. For doing this he was punished by Zeus, who had him chained to a rock and caused an eagle to feast daily on his liver, which regenerated itself each night. Herakles eventually freed him.

name: PROSERPINA
meaning: Means "to emerge" in Latin. She was the Roman equivalent of the Greek goddess Persephone.

name: PROSPER
meaning: From the Latin name Prosperus, which meant "fortunate, successful". This was the name of a 5th-century saint, a supporter of Saint Augustine. It has never been common as an English name, though the Puritans used it, partly because it is identical to the English word prosper.

name: PROSPERO
meaning: Italian form of PROSPER. This was the name of the shipwrecked magician in 'The Tempest' (1611) by Shakespeare.

name: PROTEUS
meaning: Derived from Greek πρωτος(protos) meaning "first". In Greek mythology this was the name of a prophetic god of the sea.

name: PRUDENCE
meaning: Medieval English form of Prudentia, the feminine form of PRUDENTIUS. In France it is both the feminine form and a rare masculine form. In England it was used during the Middle Ages and was revived in the 17th century by the Puritans, in part from the English word prudence, ultimately of the same source.

name: PRUDENTIUS
meaning: Late Latin name derived from prudens "prudence, good judgement". This was the name of a 9th-century bishop of Troyes. He is considered a local saint there.

name: PRUNELLA
meaning: From the English word for the type of flower, also called self-heal, ultimately a derivative of the Latin word pruna "plum".

name: PRYDERI
meaning: Means "care" in Welsh. According to Welsh legend this was the name of the son of Pwyll and Rhiannon. A central character in the Mabinogion, he succeeds his father as king of Dyfed, but is ultimately killed in single combat with Gwydion.

name: PRZEMYSŁ
meaning: Polish form of PŘEMYSL. This was the name of a 13th-century king of Poland.

name: PRZEMYSŁAW
meaning: Medieval variant of PRZEMYSŁ, with the addition of the Slavic element slava.

name: PSYCHE
meaning: Means "the soul", derived from Greek ψυχω(psycho) "to breathe". The Greeks thought that the breath was the soul. In Greek mythology Psyche was a beautiful maiden who was beloved by Eros (or Cupid in Roman mythology). She is the subject of Keats's poem 'Ode to Psyche' (1819).

name: PTAH
meaning: Possibly means "opener" in Egyptian. Ptah was an Egyptian god associated with creation and the arts.

name: PTOLEMY
meaning: From the Greek name Πτολεμαιος(Ptolemaios), derived from Greek πολεμηιος(polemeios) meaning "aggressive, warlike". Ptolemy was the name of several Greco-Egyptian rulers of Egypt, all descendants of Ptolemy I, one of the generals of Alexander the Great. This was also the name of a Greek astronomer.

name: PUALANI
meaning: Means "heavenly flower" or "royal offsring" from Hawaiian pua "flower, offsring" and lani "heaven, sky, royal, majesty".

name: PUANANI
meaning: Means "beautiful flower" or "beautiful offsring" from Hawaiian pua "flower, offsring" and nani "beauty, glory".

name: PUBLIUS
meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, meaning "public" in Latin. This was among the more common of the Roman praenomina, being borne by (among others) the emperor Hadrian and the poet Virgil.

name: PUCK
meaning: Meaning unknown, from Old English puca. It could ultimately be of either Germanic or Celtic origin. In English legend this was the name of a mischievous spirit, also known as Robin Goodfellow. He appears in Shakespeare's play 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' (1600).

name: PUJA
meaning: Means "honour, worship" in Sanskrit. This is the name of a Hindu ritual of reverence.

name: PURDIE
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Norman French expression pur die "by God". It was perhaps originally a nickname for a person who used the oath frequently.

name: PURNAMA
meaning: Means "full moon" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit पूर्णिमा(purnima).

name: PURUSHOTTAMA
meaning: Means "the best man" from Sanskrit पुरुष(purusha) meaning "man" and उत्तम(uttama) meaning "highest". This is another name of either of the Hindu gods Vishnu or Krishna.

name: PUTERA
meaning: Means "son, prince" in Malay, ultimately from Sanskrit पुत्र(putra).

name: PUTERI
meaning: Means "daughter, princess" in Malay, ultimately from Sanskrit पुत्री(putri).

name: PUTRA
meaning: Means "son" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit पुत्र(putra).

name: PUTRI
meaning: Means "daughter" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit पुत्री(putri).

name: PUTU
meaning: Means "grandchild" in Balinese. Traditionally, this name is given to the first-born child.

name: PWYLL
meaning: Meaning unknown. In the Mabinogion, a collection of tales from Welsh mythology, Pwyll is a king of Dyfed who pursues and finally marries Rhiannon.

name: PYOTR
meaning: Russian form of PETER. A famous bearer was the Russian composer Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky (1840-1893).

name: PYRRHUS
meaning: From the Greek name Πυρρος(Pyrros) which meant "flame-coloured, red", related to πυρ(pyr) "fire". This was another name of Neoptolemus the son of Achilles. This was also the name of a 3rd-century BC king of Epirus.

name: PYTHAGORAS
meaning: Derived from PYTHIOS, a name of Apollo, combined with Greek αγορα(agora) meaning "assembly, marketplace". This was the name of a 6th-century BC Greek philosopher and mathematician from Samos. He was the founder of a school of philosophy whose members believed that numbers described the universe.

name: PYTHIOS
meaning: From the Greek place name Πυθω(Pytho), an older name of the city of Delphi, which was probably derived from Greek πυθω(pytho) meaning "to rot". This was an epithet of Apollo.

name: PÀULA
meaning: Sardinian feminine form of Paulus (see PAUL).

name: PÁLL
meaning: Icelandic and Faroese form of PAUL.

name: PÅL
meaning: Swedish and Norwegian form of PAUL.

name: PÆGA
meaning: Old English name of unknown meaning.

name: PÉPIN
meaning: Frankish name of unknown meaning. It possibly means "awe-inspiring" from Frankish bib- "to tremble". This was the name of three majordomos of Austrasia including Pépin III the Short, who became the first Carolingian king of the Franks. He was the father of Charlemagne.

name: PËRPARIM
meaning: Derived from Albanian përparim meaning "progress, advancement".

name: PŘEMYSL
meaning: From an old Slavic name which meant "trick, stratagem", from pre "over" and mysli "thought, idea". This was the name of the founder of the Přemyslid dynasty, which ruled Bohemia from the 9th to the 14th century.

name: QADIR
meaning: Means "capable, powerful" in Arabic. This transcription represents two different ways of spelling the name in Arabic. In Islamic tradition القادر(al-Qadir) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: QASIM
meaning: Means "one who divides goods among his people", derived from Arabic قسم(qasama) "to share" or "to divide". This was the name of a son of Muhammad who died while young.

name: QIANA
meaning: From the word for the silk-like material, introduced by DuPont in 1968 and popular in the fashions of the 1970s.

name: QIANG
meaning: From Chinese 强(qiáng) meaning "strong, powerful, energetic", as well as other characters pronounced in a similar way.

name: QING
meaning: From Chinese 青(qīng) meaning "blue, green, young", as well as other characters pronounced in a similar way.

name: QIU
meaning: From Chinese 秋(qiū) meaning "autumn", 丘(qiū) meaning "hill, mound", or other characters with a similar pronunciation. The given name of the philosopher Confucius was 丘.

name: QUANAH
meaning: Means "fragrant" in Comanche. This was the name of a 19th-century chief of the Comanche.

name: QUANNA
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix Qua and ANNA.

name: QUEEN
meaning: From an old nickname which was derived from the English word, ultimately from Old English cwen meaning "woman, wife".

name: QUENTIN
meaning: French form of the Roman name QUINTINUS. It was borne by a 3rd-century saint, a missionary who was martyred in Gaul. The Normans introduced this name to England. In America it was brought to public attention by president Theodore Roosevelt's son Quentin Roosevelt (1897-1918), who was killed in World War I.

name: QUERALT
meaning: From the name of a Spanish sanctuary (in Catalonia) which is devoted to the Virgin Mary.

name: QUETZALCOATL
meaning: Means "feathered snake" in Nahuatl, derived from quetzalli "feather" and coatl "snake". In Aztec and other Mesoamerican mythology he was the god of the sky, wind, and knowledge, also associated with the morning star. According to one legend he created the humans of this age using the bones of humans from the previous age and adding his own blood.

name: QUINCY
meaning: From a surname which was derived (via the place name CUINCHY) from the personal name QUINTIUS. A famous bearer was John Quincy Adams (1767-1848), sixth president of the United States, who was born in the town of Quincy, Massachusetts.

name: QUINLAN
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Caoinlean meaning "descendant of Caoinlean". The name Caoinlean means "slender" in Gaelic.

name: QUINN
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Cuinn meaning "descendant of CONN".

name: QUINTEN
meaning: Variant and Dutch form of QUENTIN.

name: QUINTILIAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Quintilianus, which was itself derived from the Roman name QUINTILLUS. A notable bearer was the 1st-century rhetorician Marcus Fabius Quintilianus, simply known as Quintilian in English.

name: QUINTILLUS
meaning: Roman cognomen derived from the given name QUINTUS.

name: QUINTINO
meaning: Italian and Portuguese form of QUINTINUS.

name: QUINTINUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was originally derived from QUINTUS.

name: QUINTIUS
meaning: Roman cognomen derived from the given name QUINTUS.

name: QUINTON
meaning: Variant of QUENTIN, also coinciding with an English surname meaning "queen's town" in Old English.

name: QUINTUS
meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, meaning "fifth" in Latin. It was traditionally given to the fifth child, or possibly a child born in the fifth month. This was a common praenomen, being more popular than the other numeric Roman names. A notable bearer was the poet Horace (Quintus Horatius Flaccus).

name: QUIRINO
meaning: Italian, Portuguese and Spanish form of QUIRINUS.

name: QUIRINUS
meaning: Possibly derived from the Sabine word quiris meaning "spear". Quirinus was a Sabine and Roman god who was later identified with Mars. The name was also borne by several early saints.

name: QUSAY
meaning: Possibly derived from Arabic قصي(qasi) meaning "distant". This was the name of an ancestor of the Prophet Muhammad who was in charge of a temple in Mecca.

name: QUYỀN
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 權(quyền) meaning "power, right, authority".

name: RA
meaning: Possibly means "sun" in Egyptian. Ra was an important Egyptian sun god originally worshipped in Heliopolis in Lower Egypt. He was usually depicted as a man with the head of a falcon crowned with a solar disc. In later times his attributes were often merged with those of other deities, such as Amon, Atum and Horus.

name: RA'D
meaning: Means "thunder" in Arabic. This is the name of the 13th chapter of the Qur'an (surah ar-Rad).

name: RAABI'A
meaning: Means "fourth" in Arabic. This name was borne by an 8th-century Sufi mystic from Basra in Iraq.

name: RABAN
meaning: From a Germanic byname derived from hraban meaning "raven".

name: RABI'A
meaning: Feminine form of RABI(1). It is also a variant transcription of RAABI'A.

name: RABİA
meaning: Turkish form of RAABI'A or RABI'A.

name: RACHAEL
meaning: Variant of RACHEL, the spelling probably influenced by that of Michael.

name: RACHEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name רָחֵל(Rachel) meaning "ewe". In the Old Testament this is the name of the favourite wife of Jacob and the mother of Joseph and Benjamin. She was the younger sister of Jacob's first wife Leah....[more]

name: RACHELLE
meaning: Variant of RACHEL influenced by the spelling of ROCHELLE.

name: RADA
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element rad meaning "happy, willing".

name: RADANA
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element rad meaning "happy, willing".

name: RADBOUD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements rad meaning "counsel" and bodo meaning "command, order".

name: RADCLIFF
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "red cliff" in Old English.

name: RADCLYFFE
meaning: From a surname, a variant of RADCLIFF.

name: RADE
meaning: Originally a diminutive of MILORAD and other Slavic names containing the element rad meaning "happy, willing".

name: RADEK
meaning: Diminutive of Slavic names beginning with rad meaning "happy, willing".

name: RADHA
meaning: Means "success" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the favourite consort of the Hindu god Krishna.

name: RADKO
meaning: Diminutive of Slavic names beginning with the element rad "happy, willing".

name: RADMILA
meaning: Serbian, Croatian and Czech feminine form of RADOMIL.

name: RADOMIL
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements rad "happy, willing" and milu "gracious, dear".

name: RADOMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element rad "happy, willing" combined with meru "great, famous" or miru "peace, world".

name: RADOSŁAW
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements rad "happy, willing" and slava "glory".

name: RADOVAN
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element rad "happy, willing" combined with another element of unknown meaning.

name: RADOŠ
meaning: Short form of RADOSLAV, RADOMIR, and other names beginning with the Slavic element rad meaning "happy, willing".

name: RADU
meaning: Old Romanian diminutive of Slavic names beginning with the element rad "happy, willing". This was the name of a 13th-century ruler of Wallachia.

name: RADÚZ
meaning: Derived from the Czech word rád "happy, glad". The Czech author Julius Zeyer probably created it for a character in his play 'Radúz and Mahulena' (1898).

name: RAE
meaning: Short form of RACHEL. It can also be used as a feminine form of RAY.

name: RAEBURN
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a Scottish place name meaning "stream where does drink" in Middle English. A famous bearer of the surname was Scottish portrait painter Sir Henry Raeburn (1756-1823).

name: RAELENE
meaning: Combination of RAE and the popular name suffix lene.

name: RAELYN
meaning: Combination of RAE and the popular name suffix lyn.

name: RAELYNN
meaning: Combination of RAE and the popular name suffix lynn.

name: RAFA'EL
meaning: Hebrew form of RAPHAEL. This name does not appear in any surviving Hebrew text of the Old Testament Apocrypha.

name: RAFAELA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese feminine form of RAPHAEL.

name: RAFAIL
meaning: Greek and Russian form of RAPHAEL.

name: RAFE
meaning: Variant of RALPH. This form became common during the 17th century, reflecting the usual pronunciation.

name: RAFFERTY
meaning: From an Irish surname which was an Anglicized form of Ó Rabhartaigh meaning "descendant of Rabhartach". The given name Rabhartach means "flood tide".

name: RAGHU
meaning: Means "swift" in Sanskrit. This is the name of a heroic king in Hindu epics, the great-grandfather of Rama. It is also mentioned as the name of a son of Buddha in Buddhist texts.

name: RAGNA
meaning: Short form of Old Norse names beginning with the element regin "advice, counsel".

name: RAGNBJÖRG
meaning: Old Norse name derived from the elements regin "advice, counsel" and björg "help, save, rescue".

name: RAGNHEIÐR
meaning: Old Norse name meaning "bright advice", derived from the elements regin "advice, counsel" and heiðr "brightness".

name: RAGNHILD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ragnhildr, composed of the elements regin "advice, counsel" and hildr "battle".

name: RAGNVALDR
meaning: Old Norse name composed of the elements regin "advice, counsel" and valdr "power, ruler" (making it a cognate of REYNOLD).

name: RAGUEL
meaning: Means "friend of God" in Hebrew. The Book of Enoch names him as one of the seven archangels.

name: RAHAB
meaning: Means "spacious" in Hebrew. This was the name of a prostitute of Jericho who aided the Israelites in the Old Testament.

name: RAHELA
meaning: Romanian, Croatian and Serbian form of RACHEL.

name: RAHIM
meaning: Means "kind, compassionate" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الرحيم(al-Rahim) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: RAHMAN
meaning: Means "merciful" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الرحمان(al-Rahman) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: RAHMİ
meaning: Means "merciful" in Turkish, ultimatey from Arabic.

name: RAHUL
meaning: Possibly means "able, efficient" in Sanskrit. This was the name of a son of Gautama Buddha.

name: RAIDEN
meaning: Variant transcription of RAIJIN. This is the usual spelling of the god's name in English.

name: RAIJIN
meaning: From Japanese 雷(rai) meaning "thunder" and 神(jin) meaning "god, spirit". This is the name of the god of thunder and storms in the mythology of Japan.

name: RAIMUNDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of RAYMOND.

name: RAIN  (1)
meaning: Simply from the English word rain, derived from Old English regn.

name: RAIN  (2)
meaning: Estonian short form of RAYNER and other Germanic names beginning with the element ragin "advice, counsel".

name: RAINBOW
meaning: From the English word for the arc of multicoloured light that can appear in a misty sky.

name: RAINE
meaning: Possibly based on the French word reine meaning "queen". A famous bearer is the British socialite Raine Spencer (1929-), the stepmother of Princess Diana. In modern times it can also be used as a variant of RAIN(1) or a short form of LORRAINE.

name: RAISA  (1)
meaning: Possibly from the Greek name HERAIS. This was the name of a saint and martyr killed in Alexandria during the early 4th-century persecutions of the Roman emperor Diocletian.

name: RAJAB
meaning: Means "respect" in Arabic. This is the name of the seventh month in the Islamic calendar.

name: RAJANI
meaning: Means "the dark one" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu goddess Kali or Durga.

name: RAJENDRA
meaning: Means "lord of kings", derived from Sanskrit राज(raja) meaning "king" combined with the name of the Hindu god INDRA, used here to mean "lord". This was the name of two 11th-century rulers of the Chola empire in southern India.

name: RAJESH
meaning: Means "ruler of kings" from Sanskrit राज(raja) meaning "king" and ईश(isha) meaning "lord, ruler".

name: RAJINDER
meaning: Variant of RAJENDRA used by Sikhs.

name: RAJIV
meaning: Means "striped" in Sanskrit. This is used to refer to the blue lotus in Hindu texts.

name: RAJMUND
meaning: Polish, Hungarian and Slovene form of RAYMOND.

name: RAJNISH
meaning: Means "lord of the night" from Sanskrit रजनि(rajani) meaning "night" and ईश(isha) meaning "lord, ruler". This is another name for the moon in Hindu texts.

name: RAKESH
meaning: Means "lord of the full moon" from Sanskrit राका(raka) meaning "full moon" and ईश(isha) meaning "lord, ruler".

name: RAKHI
meaning: From a word for a type of ritual wristband, ultimately from Sanskrit रक्षा(raksha).

name: RALEIGH
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name meaning either "red clearing" or "roe deer clearing" in Old English.

name: RALPH
meaning: Contracted form of the Old Norse name RÁÐÚLFR (or its Norman form Radulf). Scandinavian settlers introduced it to England before the Norman conquest, though afterwards it was bolstered by Norman influence. In the Middle Ages it was usually spelled Ralf, but by the 17th century it was most commonly Rafe, reflecting the normal pronunciation. The Ralph spelling appeared in the 18th century. A famous bearer of the name was Ralph Waldo Emerson (1803-1882), an American poet and author who wrote on transcendentalism.

name: RALUCA
meaning: Romanian diminutive of the Greek name Rallou, of uncertain meaning. It was popularized by the actress Rallou Karatza (1778-1870), a daughter of the prince of Wallachia Ioannis Karatzas, who was of Greek background.

name: RAM  (1)
meaning: Means "exalted" in Hebrew. This was a son of Hezron in the Old Testament.

name: RAMA  (1)
meaning: Means "pleasing, beautiful" in Sanskrit. In Hindu belief this is the name of an incarnation of the god Vishnu. He is the hero of the 'Ramayana', a Hindu epic, which tells of the abduction of his wife Sita by the demon king Ravana, and his efforts to recapture her.

name: RAMA  (2)
meaning: Means "wife" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the goddess Lakshmi.

name: RAMACHANDRA
meaning: Derived from the name of the Hindu god RAMA(1) combined with Sanskrit चन्द्र(chandra) meaning "moon". This is another name of Rama.

name: RAMADAN
meaning: From the name of the ninth month of the Islamic calendar. It is derived from Arabic رمض(ramad) meaning "parchedness, scorchedness". Muslims traditionally fast during this month.

name: RAMAKRISHNA
meaning: Combination of the names of the Hindu gods RAMA(1) and KRISHNA. This name was borne by the Hindu religious teacher Sri Ramakrishna Paramahamsa (1836-1886).

name: RAMAZ
meaning: Possibly a Georgian form of RAMADAN.

name: RAMAZAN
meaning: Turkish, Azerbaijani, Avar and Kazakh form of RAMADAN.

name: RAMBERT
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hramn "raven" and beraht "bright".

name: RAMESES
meaning: From Egyptian Ra-msj-sw meaning "born of Ra", composed of the name of the supreme god RA combined with the Egyptian root mesu "be born". Rameses was the name of eleven Egyptian kings of the New Kingdom. The most important of these were Rameses II the Great who campaigned against the Hittites and also built several great monuments, and Rameses III who defended Egypt from the Libyans and Sea Peoples.

name: RAMESHA
meaning: Means "husband of Lakshmi", derived from RAMA(2), a name of Lakshmi, combined with ईश(isha) meaning "ruler, husband". This is one of the names of the Hindu god Vishnu.

name: RAMESHVARA
meaning: Means "lord of Rama", derived from the name of the Hindu god RAMA(1) combined with Sanskrit ईश्वर(ishvara) meaning "lord, god". This is another name for the Hindu god Shiva.

name: RAMIRO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of Ramirus, a Latinized form of a Visigothic name derived from the Germanic elements ragin "advice" and mari "famous". Saint Ramirus was a 6th-century prior of the Saint Claudius Monastery in Leon. He and several others were executed by the Arian Visigoths, who opposed orthodox Christianity. This name was subsequently borne by kings of León, Asturias and Aragon.

name: RAMLAH
meaning: Means "sand" in Arabic. This was the name of one of the wives of Muhammad.

name: RAMONA
meaning: Feminine form of RAMÓN. It was popularized in the English-speaking world by Helen Hunt Jackson's novel 'Ramona' (1884), as well as several subsequent movies based on the book.

name: RAMSEY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "wild-garlic island" in Old English.

name: RAMŪNAS
meaning: Derived from Lithuanian ramus meaning "calm" combined with the patronymic suffix ūnas.

name: RAN
meaning: From Japanese 蘭(ran) meaning "orchid" or other kanji pronounced in the same way.

name: RANA  (1)
meaning: Means "an eye-catching object" from Arabic رنا(rana) meaning "to gaze".

name: RANA  (2)
meaning: From the Sanskrit title राणा(rana) meaning "king".

name: RANDALL
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the medieval given name RANDEL.

name: RANDEL
meaning: Medieval diminutive of RANDOLF and other names beginning with the Germanic element rand meaning "rim (of a shield)".

name: RANDI  (2)
meaning: Modern form of the Old Norse name Ragnfríðr, which was derived from regin "advice, counsel" and fríðr "beautiful".

name: RANDOLF
meaning: From the Germanic elements rand meaning "rim (of a shield)" and wulf meaning "wolf". The Normans brought this name to England, where there existed already an Old Norse cognate Randúlfr, which had been introduced by Scandinavian settlers. Randolf became rare after the Middle Ages, though it was revived in the 18th century (usually in the spelling Randolph).

name: RANDOLPH
meaning: Variant of RANDOLF. This spelling was adopted in the 18th century.

name: RANDY
meaning: Diminutive of RANDALL, RANDOLF or MIRANDA.

name: RANGI
meaning: Means "sky" in Maori. In Maori and other Polynesian mythology Rangi or Ranginui was a god of the sky, husband of the earth goddess Papa. They were locked in a crushing embrace but were eventually separated by their children, the other gods.

name: RANI  (2)
meaning: Means "my joy" or "my song" in Hebrew.

name: RANIYA
meaning: Means "looking at", derived from Arabic رنا(rana) meaning "to gaze".

name: RANJIT
meaning: Means "coloured, pleased, delighted" in Sanskrit. A famous bearer was Ranjit Singh (1780-1839), the founder of a Sikh kingdom that covered most of the Punjab and Kashmir.

name: RANKO
meaning: Derived from the Slavic word ранъ(ranu) meaning "early".

name: RANULF
meaning: Scottish form of the Old Norse name Randúlfr, a cognate of RANDOLF. Scandinavian settlers and invaders introduced this name to Scotland in the Middle Ages.

name: RAPHAEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name רָפָאֵל(Rafa'el) which meant "God heals", from the roots רָפָא(rafa') meaning "to heal" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". In Hebrew tradition Raphael is the name of an archangel. He appears in the Book of Tobit, in which he disguises himself as a man named Azarias and accompanies Tobias on his journey to Media, aiding him along the way. In the end he cures Tobias's father Tobit of his blindness. He is not mentioned in the New Testament, though tradition identifies him with the angel troubling the water in John 5:4....[more]

name: RAQUEL
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of RACHEL.

name: RASHAD
meaning: Means "good sense, good guidance" in Arabic.

name: RASHAUN
meaning: Combination of the prefix Ra with the name SHAUN.

name: RASHAWN
meaning: Combination of the prefix Ra with the name SHAWN.

name: RASHID
meaning: Means "rightly guided" in Arabic. This transcription represents two different ways of spelling the name in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الرشيد(al-Rashid) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: RASHMI
meaning: Means "ray of sunlight" or "rope" in Sanskrit.

name: RASHN
meaning: Modern Persian form of Avestan Rashnu meaning "justice". In Zoroastrianism this was the name of a Yazata who judged the souls of the dead.

name: RASMUS
meaning: Scandinavian, Finnish and Estonian form of ERASMUS.

name: RASİM
meaning: Turkish and Azerbaijani form of RASIM.

name: RATHNAIT
meaning: Derived from Irish rath "grace, prosperity" combined with a diminutive suffix.

name: RATI
meaning: Means "rest, pleasure" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the wife of the Hindu god of love Kama.

name: RATIMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements rati meaning "war, battle" and miru meaning "peace, world".

name: RATKO
meaning: Diminutive of names beginning with the Slavic element rati meaning "war, battle".

name: RATNA
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit रत्न(ratna) meaning "jewel, treasure". This is a transcription of both the feminine form रत्ना and the masculine form रत्न.

name: RATREE
meaning: From the name of a variety of jasmine flower, the night jasmine, ultimately from a poetic word meaning "night".

name: RAUL
meaning: Portuguese and Italian form of Radulf (see RALPH).

name: RAVEN
meaning: From the name of the bird, ultimately from Old English hræfn. The raven is revered by several Native American groups of the west coast. It is also associated with the Norse god Odin.

name: RAVENNA
meaning: Either an elaboration of RAVEN, or else from the name of the city of Ravenna in Italy.

name: RAVI
meaning: Means "sun" in Sanskrit. Ravi is a Hindu god of the sun, sometimes equated with Surya. A famous bearer was the musician Ravi Shankar (1920-2012).

name: RAVIL
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Arabic origin.

name: RAVINDER
meaning: Variant of RAVINDRA used by Sikhs.

name: RAVINDRA
meaning: Means "lord of the sun" from Sanskrit रवि(ravi) meaning "sun" combined with the name of the Hindu god INDRA, used here to mean "lord". This is another name for the Hindu god Surya.

name: RAWIYA
meaning: Means "storyteller", derived from Arabic روى(rawa) meaning "to relate".

name: RAY
meaning: Short form of RAYMOND, often used as an independent name. It coincides with an English word meaning "beam of light". Science-fiction author Ray Bradbury (1920-2012) and musician Ray Charles (1930-2004) are two notable bearers of the name.

name: RAYHANA
meaning: Means "basil" in Arabic. This was the name of a wife of the Prophet Muhammad.

name: RAYLENE
meaning: Combination of RAY and the popular name suffix lene.

name: RAYMOND
meaning: From the Germanic name Raginmund, composed of the elements ragin "advice" and mund "protector". The Normans introduced this name to England in the form Reimund. It was borne by several medieval (mostly Spanish) saints, including Saint Raymond Nonnatus, the patron of midwives and expectant mothers, and Saint Raymond of Peñafort, the patron of canonists.

name: RAYMUNDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of RAYMOND.

name: RAYNA  (1)
meaning: Either a Bulgarian form of REGINA or a feminine form of RAYNO.

name: RAYNER
meaning: From the Germanic name Raganhar, composed of the elements ragin "advice" and hari "army". The Normans brought this name to England where it came into general use, though it was rare by the end of the Middle Ages.

name: RAYYAN
meaning: Means "watered, luxuriant" in Arabic. According to Islamic tradition this is the name of one of the gates of paradise.

name: RAZIELA
meaning: Means "my secret is God" in Hebrew.

name: READ
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of REED.

name: REAGAN
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Ríagáin meaning "descendant of RIAGÁN". This surname was borne by American president Ronald Reagan (1911-2004).

name: REBECA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of REBECCA.

name: REBECCA
meaning: From the Hebrew name רִבְקָה(Rivqah) from an unattested root probably meaning "join, tie, snare". This is the name of the wife of Isaac and the mother of Esau and Jacob in the Old Testament. It came into use as a Christian name after the Protestant Reformation, and it was popular with the Puritans in the 17th century.

name: REBEKAH
meaning: Form of REBECCA used in some versions of the Bible.

name: REBEKKA
meaning: Cognate of REBECCA. It is also the form used in the Greek Old Testament.

name: RED
meaning: From the English word, ultimately derived from Old English read. It was originally a nickname given to a person with red hair or a ruddy complexion.

name: REED
meaning: From an English surname which comes from multiple sources, including Old English read meaning "red" (originally a nickname given to a person with red hair or a ruddy complexion) and Old English ried meaning "clearing" (given to a person who lived in a clearing in the woods).

name: REENIE
meaning: Either a variant of RENÉE or a diminutive of names ending in reen.

name: REGAN
meaning: Meaning unknown, probably of Celtic origin. Shakespeare took the name from earlier British legends and used it in his tragedy 'King Lear' (1606) for a treacherous daughter of the king. In the modern era it has appeared in the horror movie 'The Exorcist' (1973) belonging to a girl possessed by the devil. This name can also be used as a variant of REAGAN.

name: REGANA
meaning: Elaboration of REGAN, influenced by REGINA.

name: REGINA
meaning: Means "queen" in Latin (or Italian). It was in use as a Christian name from early times, and was borne by a 2nd-century saint. In England it was used during the Middle Ages in honour of the Virgin Mary, and it was later revived in the 19th century. A city in Canada bears this name, in honour of Queen Victoria.

name: REGINALD
meaning: From Reginaldus, a Latinized form of REYNOLD.

name: REGINE
meaning: German and Norwegian form of REGINA.

name: REGULA
meaning: Means "rule" in Latin. This was the name of a 3rd-century Swiss martyr, the patron saint of Zurich.

name: REGULUS
meaning: Roman cognomen meaning "prince, little king", a diminutive of Latin rex "king". This was the cognomen of several 3rd-century BC consuls from the gens Atilia. It was also the name of several early saints. A star in the constellation Leo bears this name as well.

name: REHOBOAM
meaning: From the Hebrew name רֵחַבְעָם(Rechav'am) meaning "he enlarges the people". In the Old Testament this is the name of a son of Solomon. He succeeded his father as king of Israel, but his subjects eventually revolted because of high taxes. This resulted in the division of the kingdom into Israel and Judah, with Rehoboam ruling Judah.

name: REI
meaning: From Japanese 鈴(rei) meaning "bell", 麗(rei) meaning "beautiful, lovely" or 玲(rei) meaning "the tinkling of jade". This name can also be formed by other kanji with the same pronunciation.

name: REID
meaning: From a surname, a Scots variant of REED.

name: REIDAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Hreiðarr which was derived from the elements hreiðr "nest, home" and arr "warrior".

name: REIDUN
meaning: From the Old Norse name Hreiðunn which was derived from the elements hreiðr "nest, home" and unnr "to wave, to billow".

name: REILLY
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from the given name Raghailleach, meaning unknown.

name: REIN
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element ragin "advice, counsel".

name: REINA  (2)
meaning: Derived from Yiddish רֵײן(rein) meaning "clean, pure". It is sometimes used as a Yiddish form of KATHERINE.

name: REINA  (3)
meaning: From Japanese 怜(rei) meaning "wise" and 奈(na), a phonetic character. This name can also be formed by other combinations of kanji.

name: REINALDO
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of REYNOLD.

name: REINHILD
meaning: From a Germanic name which was composed of the elements ragin "advice" and hild "battle".

name: REMAO
meaning: Limburgish form of RAYMOND. Its spelling has been influenced by the French pronunciation of Raymond.

name: REMBRANDT
meaning: From a Germanic name which was composed of the elements ragin "advice" and brand "sword". This name belonged to the 17th-century Dutch painter Rembrandt van Rijn.

name: REMEDIOS
meaning: Means "remedies" in Spanish. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary, Nuestra Señora de los Remedios, meaning "Our Lady of the Remedies".

name: REMEI
meaning: Means "remedy" in Catalan, a Catalan equivalent of REMEDIOS.

name: REMIEL
meaning: Possibly means "God exalts" in Hebrew. The Book of Enoch names him as one of the seven archangels. He is also named Jeremiel.

name: REMIGIO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of Remigius (see RÉMY).

name: REMUS
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Roman legend Romulus and Remus were the founders of Rome. Remus was later slain by Romulus.

name: REN
meaning: From Japanese 蓮(ren) meaning "lotus", 恋(ren) meaning "love", or other kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: RENARD
meaning: French form of REYNARD. Because of the medieval character Reynard the Fox, renard became a French word meaning "fox".

name: RENAT
meaning: Russian form of RENATUS. In some cases Communist parents may have bestowed it as an acronym of революсия наука техника(revolyusiya nauka tekhnika) meaning "revolution, science, technics" or революсия наука труд(revolyusiya nauka trud) meaning "revolution, science, labour".

name: RENATE
meaning: German, Dutch and Norwegian feminine form of RENATUS.

name: RENATO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of RENATUS.

name: RENAUD
meaning: French form of REYNOLD. This name was used in medieval French literature for the hero Renaud de Montauban, a young man who flees with his three brothers from the court of Charlemagne after killing the king's nephew. Charlemagne pardons the brothers on the condition that they enter the Crusades.

name: RENE
meaning: English form of RENÉ or RENÉE.

name: RENITA
meaning: Probably a feminine form of RENATUS. It came into use during the 1950s.

name: RENS
meaning: Short form of LAURENS or EMERENS.

name: RENÁTA
meaning: Hungarian, Czech and Slovak feminine form of RENATUS.

name: RENÉ
meaning: French form of RENATUS. A famous bearer was the French mathematician and rationalist philosopher René Descartes (1596-1650).

name: RESHMI
meaning: Means "silk", from Hindi रेशम(Resham) and Bengali রেশম(Resham), ultimately of Persian origin.

name: RETO
meaning: Means "of Rhaetia". Rhaetia is a region in eastern Switzerland that got its name from the Rhaeti, a Celtic tribe who originally inhabited the area.

name: REUBEN
meaning: Means "behold, a son" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament he is the eldest son of Jacob and Leah and the ancestor of one of the twelve tribes of Israel. Reuben was cursed by his father because he slept with Jacob's concubine Bilhah. It has been used as a Christian name in Britain since the Protestant Reformation.

name: REUEL
meaning: Means "friend of God" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is another name for Jethro. The fantasy author John Ronald Reuel Tolkien (1892-1973) was a famous bearer.

name: REUT
meaning: Means "friend" in Hebrew, making it a variant of the Biblical name Ruth.

name: REVA
meaning: Means "one that moves" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu goddess Rati.

name: REVAZ
meaning: Possibly of Persian origin meaning "wealthy, successful".

name: REX
meaning: From Latin rex "king". It has been used as a given name since the 19th century.

name: REXANNE
meaning: Variant of ROXANE influenced by REX.

name: REYES
meaning: Means "kings" in Spanish. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary, La Virgen de los Reyes, meaning "The Virgin of the Kings". According to legend, the Virgin Mary appeared to King Ferdinand III of Castile and told him his armies would defeat those of the Moors in Seville.

name: REYHAN
meaning: Turkish and Uyghur form of RAYHANA.

name: REYHANGUL
meaning: Uyghur elaboration of REYHAN using the suffix گۇل(gul) meaning "flower, rose".

name: REYNALDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of REYNOLD.

name: REYNARD
meaning: From the Germanic name Raginhard, composed of the elements ragin "advice" and hard "brave, hardy". The Normans brought it to England in the form Reinard, though it never became very common there. In medieval fables the name was borne by the sly hero Reynard the Fox (with the result that renard has become a French word meaning "fox").

name: REYNOLD
meaning: From the Germanic name Raginald, composed of the elements ragin "advice" and wald "rule". The Normans (who used forms like Reinald or Reinold) brought the name to Britain, where it reinforced rare Old English and Norse cognates already in existence. It was common during the Middle Ages, but became more rare after the 15th century.

name: RHEA
meaning: Latinized form of Greek ‘Ρεια(Rheia), meaning unknown, perhaps related to ‘ρεω(rheo) "to flow" or ερα(era) "ground". In Greek mythology Rhea was a Titan, the wife of Cronus, and the mother of Zeus, Poseidon, Hades, Hera, Demeter and Hestia. Also, in Roman mythology a woman named Rhea Silvia was the mother of Romulus and Remus, the legendary founders of Rome.

name: RHETT
meaning: From a surname, an Anglicized form of the Dutch de Raedt, derived from raet "advice, counsel". Margaret Mitchell used this name for the character Rhett Butler in her novel 'Gone with the Wind' (1936).

name: RHIANNON
meaning: Probably derived from the old Celtic name Rigantona meaning "great queen". It is speculated that this was the name of an otherwise unattested Celtic goddess of fertility and the moon. The name Rhiannon appears later in Welsh legend in the Mabinogion, borne by the wife of Pwyll and the mother of Pryderi....[more]

name: RHODA
meaning: Derived from Greek ‘ροδον(rhodon) meaning "rose". In the New Testament this name was borne by a maid in the house of Mary the mother of John Mark. As an English given name, Rhoda came into use in the 17th century.

name: RHODRI
meaning: Derived from the Welsh elements rhod "wheel" and rhi "king". This name was borne by a 9th-century Welsh king.

name: RHONA
meaning: Possibly derived from the name of the Hebridean island Rona, which means "rough island" in Gaelic.

name: RHONDA
meaning: Probably intended to mean "good spear" from Welsh rhon "spear" and da "good", but possibly influenced by the name of the Rhondda Valley in South Wales, which means "noisy". It has been in use only since the 20th century. Its use may have been partially inspired by Margaret Mackworth, Viscountess Rhondda (1883-1956), a British feminist.

name: RHONWEN
meaning: Means either "fair spear" or "fair hair" in Welsh. The first element is either rhon "spear" or rhawn "(coarse) hair", and the second element is gwen "fair, white, blessed".

name: RHOSYN
meaning: Means "rose" in Welsh. This is a modern Welsh name.

name: RHYDDERCH
meaning: Means "reddish brown" in Welsh. It is sometimes used as a Welsh form of RODERICK.

name: RHYS
meaning: Means "enthusiasm" in Welsh. Several Welsh rulers have borne this name.

name: RIAD
meaning: Means "meadows, gardens", from the plural of Arabic روضة(rawdah).

name: RICA
meaning: Short form of FREDERICA and other names ending in rica.

name: RICARDA
meaning: Spanish and German feminine form of RICHARD.

name: RICARDO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of RICHARD.

name: RICHA
meaning: Means "praise, verse, sacred text" in Sanskrit.

name: RICHARD
meaning: Means "brave power", derived from the Germanic elements ric "power, rule" and hard "brave, hardy". The Normans introduced this name to Britain, and it has been very common there since that time. It was borne by three kings of England including Richard I the Lionheart, one of the leaders of the Third Crusade in the 12th century....[more]

name: RICHELLE
meaning: Feminine form of RICHARD using the popular suffix elle, probably influenced by the sound of MICHELLE.

name: RICHMAL
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly a combination of RICHARD and MARY. This name has been used since at least the late 18th century, mainly confined to the town of Bury in Lancashire.

name: RICK
meaning: Short form of RICHARD or names ending in rick.

name: RICKI
meaning: Masculine and feminine diminutive of RICHARD.

name: RIDHA
meaning: Means "satisfaction, contentment" in Arabic. This name was borne by Ali Musi al-Ridha, a 9th-century Shia imam.

name: RIDLEY
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "reed clearing" or "cleared wood" in Old English.

name: RIGANTONA
meaning: Reconstructed old Celtic form of RHIANNON.

name: RIGBY
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "ridge farm" in Old Norse.

name: RIGEL
meaning: Derived from Arabic الرجل(al-Rijl) meaning "foot". This is the name of the star that forms the left foot of the constellation Orion.

name: RIIKKA
meaning: Finnish short form of FREDRIKA, HENRIIKKA and other names ending in rika.

name: RIK
meaning: Short form of HENDRIK, FREDERIK, and other names containing rik.

name: RIKA
meaning: Short form of FREDRIKA, HENRIKA, and other names ending in rika.

name: RIKE
meaning: German short form of FRIEDERIKE, HENRIKE, and other names ending in rike.

name: RIKO
meaning: From Japanese 莉(ri) meaning "white jasmine" or 理(ri) meaning "reason, logic" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: RIKU  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 陸(riku) meaning "land" or different kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: RIKUTO
meaning: From Japanese 陸(riku) meaning "land" combined with 斗(to), which refers to a Chinese constellation, or 人(to) meaning "person", as well as other combinations of kanji which have the same pronunciations.

name: RILEY
meaning: From a surname which comes from two distinct sources. As an Irish surname it is a variant of REILLY. As an English surname it is derived from a place name meaning "rye clearing" in Old English.

name: RILLA
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps a short form of names ending in rilla.

name: RIN
meaning: From Japanese 凛(rin) meaning "dignified, severe, cold" or other kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: RINA  (1)
meaning: Short form of CATERINA or CATHARINA as well as other names ending in rina.

name: RINA  (4)
meaning: From Japanese 莉(ri) meaning "white jasmine" or 里(ri) meaning "village" combined with 奈(na), a phonetic character, or 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: RINALDO
meaning: Italian form of REYNOLD. This is the Italian name of the hero Renaud, a character in several Renaissance epics.

name: RINAT  (1)
meaning: Tatar and Bashkir form of RENAT.

name: RINI
meaning: Diminutive of MARINUS, MARINA or CATHARINA.

name: RINO
meaning: Short form of names ending in rino.

name: RINY
meaning: Diminutive of MARINUS, MARINA or CATHARINA.

name: RIO  (1)
meaning: Means "river" in Spanish or Portuguese. A city in Brazil bears this name. Its full name is Rio de Janeiro, which means "river of January", so named because the first explorers came to the harbour in January and mistakenly thought it was a river mouth.

name: RIO  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 莉(ri) meaning "white jasmine" or 里(ri) meaning "village" combined with 央(o) meaning "center", 緒(o) meaning "thread" or 桜(o) meaning "cherry blossom". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: RIPLEY
meaning: From a surname which originally came from a place name that meant "strip clearing" in Old English.

name: RISHI
meaning: Means "sage, poet" in Sanskrit, perhaps ultimately deriving from a root meaning "to see".

name: RISTO
meaning: Finnish and Macedonian short form of CHRISTOPHER.

name: RITA
meaning: Short form of MARGHERITA and other names ending in rita. A famous bearer was American actress Rita Hayworth (1918-1987).

name: RITIKA
meaning: Means either "movement, stream" or "brass" in Sanskrit.

name: RIVER
meaning: From the English word that denotes a flowing body of water. The word is ultimately derived (via Old French) from Latin ripa "riverbank".

name: RIZWAN
meaning: Urdu form and variant Arabic transcription of RIDWAN.

name: RIZWANA
meaning: Urdu form and variant Arabic transcription of RIDWANA.

name: ROALD
meaning: Modern form of the Old Norse name Hróðvaldr or Hróaldr, composed of the elements hróðr "fame" and valdr "ruler". This name was borne by the children's author Roald Dahl (1916-1990).

name: ROBERT
meaning: From the Germanic name Hrodebert meaning "bright fame", derived from the Germanic elements hrod "fame" and beraht "bright". The Normans introduced this name to Britain, where it replaced the Old English cognate Hreodbeorht. It has been a very common English name since that time....[more]

name: ROBERTO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of ROBERT. Saint Roberto Bellarmine was a 16th-century cardinal who is regarded as a Doctor of the Church. Another famous bearer was Roberto de Nobili, a Jesuit missionary to India in the 17th century.

name: ROBIN
meaning: Medieval diminutive of ROBERT. Robin Hood was a legendary hero and archer of medieval England who stole from the rich to give to the poor. In modern times it has also been used as a feminine name, and it may sometimes be given in reference to the red-breasted bird.

name: ROBINA
meaning: Feminine form of ROBIN. It originated in Scotland in the 17th century.

name: ROCCO
meaning: Germanic name derived from the element hrok meaning "rest". This was the name of a 14th-century French saint who nursed victims of the plague but eventually contracted the disease himself. He is the patron saint of the sick.

name: ROCH
meaning: French and Polish form of ROCCO.

name: ROCHELLE
meaning: From the name of the French city La Rochelle, meaning "little rock". It first became commonly used as a given name in America in the 1930s, probably due to the fame of actress Rochelle Hudson (1914-1972) and because of the similarity to the name Rachel.

name: ROCHUS
meaning: Latinized form of ROCCO, used in occasionally German and Dutch.

name: ROCKY
meaning: Diminutive of ROCCO or other names beginning with a similar sound, or else a nickname referring to a tough person. This is the name of a boxer played by Sylvester Stallone in the movie 'Rocky' (1976) and its five sequels.

name: ROCÍO
meaning: Means "dew" in Spanish. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary María del Rocío meaning "Mary of the Dew".

name: ROD
meaning: Short form of RODERICK or RODNEY.

name: RODERICK
meaning: Means "famous power" from the Germanic elements hrod "fame" and ric "power". This name was in use among the Visigoths; it was borne by their last king (also known as Rodrigo), who died fighting the Muslim invaders of Spain in the 8th century. It also had cognates in Old Norse and West Germanic, and Scandinavian settlers and Normans introduced it to England, though it died out after the Middle Ages. It was revived in the English-speaking world by Sir Walter Scott's poem 'The Vision of Don Roderick' (1811).

name: RODNEY
meaning: From a surname, originally derived from a place name, which meant "Hroda's island" in Old English (where Hroda is a Germanic given name meaning "fame"). It was first used as a given name in honour of the British admiral Lord Rodney (1719-1792).

name: RODOLFO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of RUDOLF. This is the name of the hero in Puccini's opera 'La Bohème' (1896).

name: RODRIGO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of RODERICK. A notable bearer was Rodrigo Díaz de Vivar, also known as El Cid, an 11th-century Spanish military commander.

name: ROEL
meaning: Short form of ROELAND or ROELOF.

name: ROGELIO
meaning: Spanish form of the Late Latin name Rogelius, which was possibly derived from the name Rogatus, which was itself derived from Latin rogatus "request".

name: ROGER
meaning: Means "famous spear" from the Germanic elements hrod "fame" and ger "spear". The Normans brought this name to England, where it replaced the Old English cognate Hroðgar (the name of the Danish king in the Anglo-Saxon epic 'Beowulf'). It was a common name in England during the Middle Ages. By the 18th century it was rare, but it was revived in following years. The name was borne by the Norman lords Roger I, who conquered Sicily in the 11th century, and his son Roger II, who ruled Sicily as a king.

name: ROHAN  (2)
meaning: From the novel 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954) by J. R. R. Tolkien, where it is a place name meaning "horse country" in Sindarin.

name: ROHESIA
meaning: Latinized form of the medieval name Rohese (see ROSE).

name: ROKSANA
meaning: Russian and Polish form of ROXANA.

name: ROKUROU
meaning: From Japanese 六(roku) meaning "six" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". This name was traditionally given to the sixth son. Other combinations of kanji characters can be possible.

name: ROLAND
meaning: From the Germanic elements hrod meaning "fame" and landa meaning "land", though some theories hold that the second element was originally nand meaning "brave". Roland was a semi-legendary French hero whose story is told in the medieval epic 'La Chanson de Roland', in which he is a nephew of Charlemagne killed in battle with the Saracens. The Normans introduced this name to England.

name: ROLANDO
meaning: Spanish, Italian and Portuguese form of ROLAND.

name: ROLF
meaning: From the Germanic name Hrolf (or its Old Norse cognate Hrólfr), a contracted form of Hrodulf (see RUDOLF). The Normans introduced this name to England but it soon became rare. In the modern era it has occasionally been used in the English-speaking world as a German import.

name: ROLLO
meaning: Latinized form of Roul, the Old French form of ROLF. Rollo (or Rolf) the Ganger was an exiled Viking who, in the 10th century, became the first Duke of Normandy. It has been used as a given name in the English-speaking world since the 19th century.

name: ROMA  (2)
meaning: From the name of the Italian city, commonly called Rome in English.

name: ROMAINE
meaning: French feminine form of Romanus (see ROMAN).

name: ROMAN
meaning: From the Late Latin name Romanus which meant "Roman".

name: ROMANE
meaning: French feminine form of Romanus (see ROMAN).

name: ROMEO
meaning: Italian form of the Late Latin name Romaeus meaning "a pilgrim to Rome". Romeo is best known as the lover of Juliet in Shakespeare's tragedy 'Romeo and Juliet' (1596).

name: ROMILDA
meaning: Means "famous battle" from the Germanic elements hrom "fame" and hild "battle".

name: ROMULUS
meaning: Means "of Rome" in Latin. In Roman legend Romulus and Remus were the founders of the city of Rome.

name: ROMÁN
meaning: Spanish and Hungarian form of Romanus (see ROMAN).

name: ROMÁNA
meaning: Hungarian feminine form of Romanus (see ROMAN).

name: RONALD
meaning: Scottish form of RAGNVALDR, a name introduced to Scotland by Scandinavian settlers and invaders. It became popular outside Scotland during the 20th century. A famous bearer was American actor and president Ronald Reagan (1911-2004).

name: RONALDO
meaning: Portuguese form of RONALD. A notable bearer is the retired Brazilian soccer player Ronaldo Luís Nazário de Lima (1976-), who is commonly known only by his first name.

name: RONEN
meaning: Derived from Hebrew רוֹן(ron) meaning "song, joy".

name: RONG
meaning: From Chinese 荣(róng) meaning "glory, honour, flourish, prosper", 融(róng) meaning "fuse, harmonize" or 容(róng) meaning "appearance, form" (which is usually only feminine). Other Chinese characters can form this name as well.

name: RONI  (1)
meaning: Means "my joy" or "my song" in Hebrew.

name: RONJA
meaning: Invented by Swedish children's author Astrid Lindgren, who based it on the middle portion of Juronjaure, the name of a lake in Sweden. Lindgren used it in her book 'Ronia the Robber's Daughter' (Ronia is the English translation).

name: RONNE
meaning: Frisian short form of Germanic names beginning with the element hraban meaning "raven".

name: ROOS
meaning: Dutch vernacular form of ROSA(1), meaning "rose" in Dutch.

name: ROOSEVELT
meaning: From a Dutch surname meaning "rose field". This name is often given in honour of American presidents Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919) or Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945).

name: ROQUE
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of ROCCO.

name: ROS
meaning: Short form of ROSALIND, ROSAMUND, and other names beginning with Ros.

name: ROSA  (1)
meaning: Generally this can be considered a Latin form of ROSE, though originally it may have come from the Germanic name ROZA(2). This was the name of a 13th-century saint from Viterbo in Italy. In the English-speaking world it was first used in the 19th century. A famous bearer was civil rights activist Rosa Parks (1913-2005).

name: ROSA  (2)
meaning: Means "dew" in the South Slavic languages.

name: ROSABEL
meaning: Combination of ROSA(1) and the popular name suffix bel. It was created in the 18th century.

name: ROSALBA
meaning: Italian name meaning "white rose", derived from Latin rosa "rose" and alba "white". A famous bearer was the Venetian painter Rosalba Carriera (1675-1757).

name: ROSALEEN
meaning: Variant of ROSALINE. James Clarence Mangan used it as a translation for RÓISÍN in his poem 'Dark Rosaleen' (1846).

name: ROSALIA
meaning: Late Latin name derived from rosa "rose". This was the name of a 12th-century Sicilian saint.

name: ROSALIE
meaning: French, German and Dutch form of ROSALIA. In the English-speaking this name received a boost after the release of the movie 'Rosalie' (1938), which was based on an earlier musical.

name: ROSALIND
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hros meaning "horse" and lind meaning "soft, tender, flexible". The Normans introduced this name to England, though it was not common. During the Middle Ages its spelling was influenced by the Latin phrase rosa linda "beautiful rose". The name was popularized by Edmund Spencer, who used it in his poetry, and by William Shakespeare, who used it for the heroine in his comedy 'As You Like It' (1599).

name: ROSALINE
meaning: Medieval variant of ROSALIND. This is the name of characters in Shakespeare's 'Love's Labour's Lost' (1594) and 'Romeo and Juliet' (1596).

name: ROSALYN
meaning: Variant of ROSALINE using the popular name suffix lyn.

name: ROSALÍA
meaning: Spanish and Galician form of ROSALIA.

name: ROSAMOND
meaning: Variant of ROSAMUND, in use since the Middle Ages.

name: ROSAMUND
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hros "horse" and mund "protection". The Normans introduced this name to England. It was subsequently influenced by the Latin phrase rosa munda "pure rose". This was the name of the mistress of Henry II, the king of England in the 12th century. She was possibly murdered by his wife, Eleanor of Aquitaine.

name: ROSARIO
meaning: Means "rosary", and is taken from the Spanish title of the Virgin Mary Nuestra Señora del Rosario meaning "Our Lady of the Rosary". This name is feminine in Spanish and masculine in Italian.

name: ROSCOE
meaning: From an English surname, originally derived from a place name, which meant "doe wood" in Old Norse.

name: ROSE
meaning: Originally a Norman form of a Germanic name, which was composed of the elements hrod "fame" and heid "kind, sort, type". The Normans introduced it to England in the forms Roese and Rohese. From an early date it was associated with the word for the fragrant flower rose (derived from Latin rosa). When the name was revived in the 19th century, it was probably with the flower in mind.

name: ROSEMARY
meaning: Combination of ROSE and MARY. This name can also be given in reference to the herb, which gets its name from Latin ros marinus meaning "dew of the sea". It came into use as a given name in the 19th century.

name: ROSENDO
meaning: Spanish form of a Visigothic name composed of the Germanic elements hrod "fame" and sinths "path". This was the name of a 10th-century Galician saint, also known as Rudesind.

name: ROSHANARA
meaning: Possibly means "light of the assembly" in Persian. This was the name of a daughter of the 17th-century Mughal emperor Shah Jahan.

name: ROSHNI
meaning: From Hindi and Marathi रौशनी(raushani) meaning "light, brightness", ultimately of Persian origin.

name: ROSINA
meaning: Italian diminutive of ROSA(1). This is the name of a character in Rossini's opera 'The Barber of Seville' (1816).

name: ROSS
meaning: From a Scottish and English surname which originally indicated a person from a place called Ross (such as the region of Ross in northern Scotland), derived from Gaelic ros meaning "promontory, headland". A famous bearer of the surname was Sir James Clark Ross (1800-1862), an Antarctic explorer.

name: ROSTAM
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly from Avestan raodha "to grow" and takhma "strong, brave, valiant". Rostam was a warrior hero in Persian legend. The 11th-century Persian poet Firdausi recorded his tale in the 'Shahnameh'.

name: ROSTISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements rasti "growth" and slava "glory".

name: ROSWELL
meaning: From a surname which was derived from an Old English place name meaning "horse spring".

name: ROSWITHA
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements hrod "fame" and swinth "strength". This was the name of a 10th-century nun from Saxony who wrote several notable poems and dramas.

name: ROTEM
meaning: From the name of a desert plant (species Retama raetam), possibly derived from Hebrew רְתֹם(retom) meaning "to bind".

name: ROUBEN
meaning: Biblical Greek form of REUBEN, as well as a variant transcription of Armenian RUBEN.

name: ROWAN
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Ruadháin meaning "descendant of RUADHÁN". This name can also be given in reference to the rowan tree.

name: ROWENA
meaning: Meaning uncertain, possibly a Latinized form of a Germanic name derived from the elements hrod "fame" and wunn "joy, bliss". According to the 12th-century chronicler Geoffrey of Monmouth, this was the name of a daughter of the Saxon chief Hengist. Alternatively, Geoffrey may have based it on a Welsh name. It was popularized by Sir Walter Scott, who used it for a character in his novel 'Ivanhoe' (1819).

name: ROXANA
meaning: Latin form of Ρωξανη(Roxane), the Greek form of the Persian or Bactrian name روشنک(Roshanak) which meant "bright" or "dawn". This was the name of Alexander the Great's first wife, a daughter of the Bactrian nobleman Oxyartes. In the modern era it came into use during the 17th century. In the English-speaking world it was popularized by Daniel Defoe, who used it in his novel 'Roxana' (1724).

name: ROXANE
meaning: French and English form of ROXANA. This is the name of Cyrano's love interest in the play 'Cyrano de Bergerac' (1897).

name: ROXELANA
meaning: From a Turkish nickname meaning "Ruthenian". This referred to the region of Ruthenia, covering Belarus, Ukraine and western Russia. Roxelana (1502-1558), also known by the name Hürrem, was a slave and then concubine of Süleyman the Magnificent, sultan of the Ottoman Empire. She eventually became his wife and produced his heir, Selim II.

name: ROY
meaning: Anglicized form of RUADH. A notable bearer was the Scottish outlaw and folk hero Rob Roy (1671-1734). It is often associated with French roi "king".

name: ROYAL
meaning: From the English word royal, derived (via Old French) from Latin regalis, a derivative of rex "king". It was first used as a given name in the 19th century.

name: ROYCE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the medieval given name Royse, a variant of ROSE.

name: ROYDON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "rye hill", from Old English ryge "rye" and dun "hill".

name: ROYLE
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "rye hill" from Old English ryge "rye" and hyll "hill".

name: ROYSTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from an Old English place name meaning "town of Royse". The given name Royse was a medieval variant of ROSE.

name: ROZ
meaning: Short form of ROSALIND, ROSAMUND, and other names beginning with the same sound.

name: ROZA  (1)
meaning: Means "rose" in some Slavic languages. It is a cognate of ROSA(1).

name: ROZA  (2)
meaning: Old Germanic short form of feminine names beginning with the element hrod meaning "fame".

name: ROZALIA
meaning: Polish and Romanian form of ROSALIA.

name: ROZÁLIA
meaning: Hungarian and Slovak form of ROSALIA.

name: ROŽĖ
meaning: Means "rose" in Lithuanian. It is a cognate of ROSA(1).

name: RU
meaning: From Chinese 儒(rú) meaning "scholar", 如(rú) meaning "like, as, if", or other characters with similar pronunciations.

name: RUADH
