meaning: Means "future" in Old Norse. She was one of the three Norns, or goddesses of destiny, in Norse mythology. She was also one of the Valkyries.

name: SKY
meaning: Simply from the English word sky, which was ultimately derived from Old Norse sky "cloud".

name: SKYE
meaning: From the name of the Isle of Skye off the west coast of Scotland. It is sometimes considered a variant of SKY.

name: SKYLER
meaning: Variant of SCHUYLER. The spelling was modified due to association with the name Tyler and the English word sky.

name: SLADE
meaning: From a surname which meant "valley" in Old English.

name: SLAMET
meaning: Means "safety" in Javanese, ultimately from Arabic سلامات(salamat).

name: SLAVA
meaning: Short form of Slavic names containing the element slava "glory".

name: SLAVITSA
meaning: Possible medieval Slavic form of SLAVICA.

name: SLAVOMIR
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of SŁAWOMIR.

name: SLAVOMÍR
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of SŁAWOMIR.

name: SLAĐANA
meaning: Derived from Serbian and Croatian sladak meaning "sweet".

name: SLOANE
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from an Anglicized form of the given name SLUAGHADHÁN.

name: SLUAGHADHÁN
meaning: Derived from Irish sluaghadh "raid" and a diminutive suffix.

name: SLY
meaning: Short form of SYLVESTER. The actor Sylvester Stallone (1946-) is a well-known bearer of this nickname.

name: SLÁINE
meaning: Means "health" in Irish Gaelic. This was the name of a legendary high king of Ireland.

name: SMILJANA
meaning: From Serbo-Croatian word smilje, a type of plant, known as catsfoot or everlasting in English (genus Antennaria).

name: SMILTĖ
meaning: Means "sandwort" in Lithuanian, referring to flowering plants from the genus Arenaria.

name: SMITH
meaning: From an English surname meaning "metal worker, blacksmith", derived from Old English smitan "to smite, to hit". It is the most common surname in most of the English-speaking world.

name: SNEZHANA
meaning: Russian, Bulgarian and Macedonian cognate of SNJEŽANA.

name: SNJEŽANA
meaning: Derived from the Slavic word snežan meaning "snowy".

name: SNORRI
meaning: Derived from Old Norse snerra "attack, onslaught". This name was borne by Snorri Sturluson, a 13th-century Icelandic historian and poet, the author of the Prose Edda.

name: SOBIESŁAW
meaning: Derived from Slavic elements, possibly sebe meaning "for oneself", combined with slava "glory". This name (in the Czech form Soběslav) was borne by two 12th-century dukes of Bohemia.

name: SOCORRO
meaning: Means "succour, help, relief" in Spanish. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary María del Socorro meaning "Mary of Perpetual Succour".

name: SOCRATES
meaning: From the Greek name Σωκρατης(Sokrates), which was derived from σως(sos) "whole, unwounded, safe" and κρατος(kratos) "power". This was the name of an important Greek philosopher. He left no writings of his own; virtually everything that we know of his beliefs comes from his pupil Plato. He was sentenced to death for impiety.

name: SOFIYA
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian and Bulgarian form of SOPHIA.

name: SOHRAB
meaning: Probably from Middle Persian swhr "red" and ab "water". In the 11th-century Persian epic the 'Shahnameh' this is the name of the son of the hero Rostam. He was tragically slain in battle by his father, who was unaware he was fighting his own son.

name: SOILE
meaning: Possibly from Finnish soilu meaning "glimmer, blaze".

name: SOL  (1)
meaning: Means "the sun" in Spanish or Portuguese.

name: SOLANGE
meaning: French form of the Late Latin name Sollemnia, which was derived from Latin sollemnis "religious". This was the name of a French shepherdess who became a saint after she was killed by her master.

name: SOLEDAD
meaning: Means "solitude" in Spanish. It is taken from the title of the Virgin Mary, María de Soledad, meaning "Mary of Solitude".

name: SOLEIL
meaning: Means "sun" in French. It is not commonly used as a name in France itself.

name: SOLFRID
meaning: From the Old Norse elements sól "sun" and fríðr "beautiful". This name was apparently coined in the 19th century.

name: SOLOMON
meaning: From the Hebrew name שְׁלֹמֹה(Shelomoh) which was derived from Hebrew שָׁלוֹם(shalom) meaning "peace". As told in the Old Testament, Solomon was a king of Israel, the son of David and Bathsheba. He was renowned for his wisdom and wealth. Towards the end of his reign he angered God by turning to idolatry. Supposedly, he was the author of the Book of Proverbs, Ecclesiastes and the Song of Solomon....[more]

name: SOLON
meaning: Possibly from Greek σολος(solos) meaning "lump of iron". This was the name of an Athenian statesman who reformed the laws and government of the city.

name: SOLVEIG
meaning: From an Old Norse name which was derived from the elements sól "sun" and veig "strength". This is the name of the heroine in Henrik Ibsen's play 'Peer Gynt' (1876).

name: SOLVEIGA
meaning: Latvian and Lithuanian form of SOLVEIG.

name: SOMA
meaning: From Hungarian som meaning "dogwood, cornel tree".

name: SOMBOON
meaning: Derived from Thai สม(som) "worthy" and บุญ(bun) "merit".

name: SOMCHAI
meaning: Derived from Thai สม(som) "worthy" and ชาย(chai) "man".

name: SOMERLED
meaning: Anglicized form of the Old Norse name Somarliðr meaning "summer traveller". This was the name of a 12th-century Scottish warlord who created a kingdom on the Scottish islands.

name: SOMMER
meaning: Variant of SUMMER, coinciding with the German word for summer.

name: SOMPORN
meaning: Derived from Thai สม(som) "worthy" and พร(phon) "blessing".

name: SOMSAK
meaning: Derived from Thai สม(som) "worthy" and ศักดิ์(sak) "power, honour".

name: SONA  (1)
meaning: Means "gold" in Hindi, derived from Sanskrit सुवर्ण(suvarna) meaning literally "good colour".

name: SONAL
meaning: From Hindi सोना(sona), Marathi सोन(son) or Gujarati સોનું(sonum) meaning "gold", all derived from Sanskrit सुवर्ण(suvarna) meaning literally "good colour".

name: SONAM
meaning: Means "virtuous, good karma, fortunate" in Tibetan.

name: SONDRA
meaning: Variant of SAUNDRA. It was popularized in the English-speaking world by a character in Theodore Dreiser's novel 'An American Tragedy' (1925) and the subsequent movie adaptation (1931).

name: SONGÜL
meaning: From Turkish son meaning "last, final" and gül meaning "rose".

name: SONNY
meaning: From a nickname which is commonly used to denote a young boy, derived from the English word son.

name: SONYA
meaning: Russian diminutive of SOPHIA. This is the name of a character in Leo Tolstoy's novel 'War and Peace' (1869, English translation 1886).

name: SOPHIA
meaning: Means "wisdom" in Greek. This was the name of an early, probably mythical, saint who died of grief after her three daughters were martyred during the reign of the emperor Hadrian. Legends about her probably arose as a result of a medieval misunderstanding of the phrase Hagia Sophia "Holy Wisdom", which is the name of a large basilica in Constantinople....[more]

name: SOPHOCLES
meaning: From the Greek name Σοφοκλης(Sophokles), which was derived from Greek σοφος(sophos) "skilled, clever" and κλεος(kleos) "glory". Sophocles was a 5th-century BC Greek tragic poet.

name: SOPHRONIA
meaning: Feminine form of SOPHRONIUS. Torquato Tasso used it in his epic poem 'Jerusalem Delivered' (1580), in which it is borne by the lover of Olindo.

name: SOPHRONIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Σωφρονιος(Sophronios), which was derived from Greek σωφρων(sophron) "self-controlled, sensible". Saint Sophronius was a 7th-century patriarch of Jerusalem.

name: SOPHUS
meaning: From the Greek name Σοφος(Sophos) which meant "skilled, clever".

name: SOPHY
meaning: Variant of SOPHIE or a diminutive of SOPHIA.

name: SORA
meaning: From Japanese 空(sora) or 昊(sora) which both mean "sky". Other kanji with the same pronunciations can also form this name.

name: SORAYA
meaning: Persian form of THURAYYA. It became popular in some parts of Europe because of the fame of Princess Soraya, wife of the last Shah of Iran, who became a European socialite.

name: SORCHA
meaning: Means "radiant" in Gaelic. It is sometimes used as an Irish form of Sarah.

name: SORIN
meaning: Possibly derived from Romanian soare meaning "sun".

name: SORNE
meaning: Means "conception" in Basque. It is a Basque equivalent of Concepción.

name: SOROUSH
meaning: Modern Persian form of Avestan Sraosha meaning "obedience". In Zoroastrianism this was the name of a Yazata (or angel), later equated with the angel Gabriel.

name: SORREL
meaning: From the name of the sour tasting plant, which may ultimately derive from Germanic sur "sour".

name: SOSIGENES
meaning: Means "born safely" from Greek σως(sos) "safe, whole, unwounded" and γενης(genes) "born". This was the name of an astronomer from Alexandria employed by Julius Caesar to correct the Roman calendar.

name: SOSRUKO
meaning: Derived from Turkic suslä "menacing". This is the name of a trickster god in Caucasian mythology. He is the hero of the Nart sagas.

name: SOSTRATE
meaning: Means "safe army" from Greek σως(sos) "safe, whole, unwounded" and στρατος(stratos) "army".

name: SOUMA
meaning: From Japanese 颯(sou) meaning "sudden, sound of the wind" and 真(ma) meaning "real, genuine". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: SOUTA
meaning: From Japanese 颯(sou) meaning "sudden, sound of the wind" and 太(ta) meaning "thick, big". This name can also be formed of other kanji combinations.

name: SOŇA
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of SONYA.

name: SPARROW
meaning: From the name of the bird, ultimately from Old English spearwa.

name: SPARTACUS
meaning: Means "from the city of Sparta" in Latin. Spartacus was the name of a Thracian-born Roman slave who led a slave revolt in Italy in the 1st century BC. He was eventually killed in battle and many of his followers were crucified.

name: SPENCER
meaning: From a surname which meant "dispenser of provisions", derived from Middle English spense "larder, pantry". A famous bearer was American actor Spencer Tracy (1900-1967). It was also the surname of Princess Diana (1961-1997).

name: SPIKE
meaning: From a nickname which may have originally been given to a person with spiky hair.

name: SPIRIDON
meaning: Serian and Croatian form of SPYRIDON, as well as a variant transcription of the Greek name.

name: SPIRIT
meaning: From the English word spirit, ultimately from Latin spiritus "breath", a derivative of spirare "to blow".

name: SPRING
meaning: From the name of the season, ultimately from Old English springan "to leap, to burst forth".

name: SPURIUS
meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, which is of uncertain meaning, probably of Etruscan origin. It may be related to the Late Latin word spurius "of illegitimate birth", which was derived from Etruscan srural "public".

name: SPYRIDON
meaning: Late Greek name derived from Greek σπυριδιον(spyridion) meaning "basket" or Latin spiritus meaning "spirit". Saint Spyridon was a 4th-century sheep farmer who became the bishop of Tremithus and suffered during the persecutions of Diocletian.

name: SREĆKO
meaning: Croatian and Serbian cognate of SREČKO.

name: SREČKO
meaning: Derived from South Slavic sreča meaning "luck".

name: SRI
meaning: Indonesian and southern Indian form of SHRI.

name: STAAS
meaning: Dutch short form of ANASTASIUS or EUSTACHIUS.

name: STACIA
meaning: Short form of ANASTASIA or EUSTACIA.

name: STACY
meaning: Either a diminutive of ANASTASIA, or else from a surname which was derived from Stace, a medieval form of EUSTACE. As a feminine name, it came into general use during the 1950s, though it had earlier been in use as a rare masculine name.

name: STAFFORD
meaning: From a surname which was from a place name meaning "landing-place ford" in Old English.

name: STAMATIOS
meaning: Derived from medieval Greek σταματω(stamato) meaning "stop".

name: STAMEN
meaning: Derived from Bulgarian and Macedonian стамен(stamen) meaning "firm".

name: STAN  (1)
meaning: Short form of STANLEY. A famous bearer was British comedian Stan Laurel (1890-1965).

name: STAN  (2)
meaning: Probably a short form of STANISLAV.

name: STANA
meaning: Short form of STANISLAVA or other Slavic names beginning with the element stani meaning "stand, become".

name: STANE
meaning: Short form of STANISLAV or other Slavic names beginning with the element stani meaning "stand, become".

name: STANFORD
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "stone ford" in Old English.

name: STANIMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements stani "stand, become" and miru "peace, world".

name: STANISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements stani meaning "stand, become" combined with slava meaning "glory".

name: STANISŁAW
meaning: Polish form of STANISLAV. Two kings of Poland have borne this name.

name: STANLEY
meaning: From a surname meaning "stone clearing" in Old English. A notable bearer of the surname was the British-American explorer and journalist Sir Henry Morton Stanley (1841-1904), the man who found David Livingstone in Africa. As a given name, it was borne by American director Stanley Kubrick (1928-1999), as well as the character Stanley Kowalski in Tennessee Williams' play 'A Streetcar Named Desire' (1947).

name: STAR
meaning: From the English word for the celestial body, ultimately from Old English steorra.

name: STAVROS
meaning: Means "cross" in Greek, referring to the cross of the crucifixion.

name: STEFANIA
meaning: Italian and Polish feminine form of STEPHEN.

name: STEFANOS
meaning: Modern Greek form of Stephanos (see STEPHEN).

name: STEFANUS
meaning: Official Dutch form of STEPHEN, used on birth certificates but not commonly in daily life.

name: STEFFEN
meaning: Low German and Danish form of STEPHEN.

name: STEINAR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Steinarr, derived from the elements steinn "stone" and arr "warrior".

name: STEINN
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of STEN.

name: STELA
meaning: Romanian form of STELLA(1), derived from Latin stella meaning "star" (modern Romanian stea).

name: STELLA  (1)
meaning: Means "star" in Latin. This name was created by the 16th-century poet Sir Philip Sidney for the subject of his collection of sonnets 'Astrophel and Stella'. It was a nickname of a lover of Jonathan Swift, real name Esther Johnson (1681-1728), though it was not commonly used as a given name until the 19th century. It appears in Tennessee Williams' play 'A Streetcar Named Desire' (1947), belonging to the sister of Blanche DuBois and the wife of Stanley Kowalski.

name: STELLA  (2)
meaning: Diminutive of STYLIANI, with the spelling influenced by that of STELLA(1).

name: STELLAN
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps related to Old Norse stilling "calm", or perhaps of German origin.

name: STEN
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse name Steinn meaning "stone".

name: STEPAN
meaning: Russian and Armenian form of Stephanos (see STEPHEN).

name: STEPH
meaning: Short form of STEPHEN or STEPHANIE.

name: STEPHAN
meaning: German and Dutch form of STEPHEN.

name: STEPHANOS
meaning: Greek form of STEPHEN. In modern Greek it is usually transcribed Stefanos.

name: STEPHEN
meaning: From the Greek name Στεφανος(Stephanos) meaning "crown", more precisely "that which surrounds". Saint Stephen was a deacon who was stoned to death, as told in Acts in the New Testament. He is regarded as the first Christian martyr. Due to him, the name became common in the Christian world. It was popularized in England by the Normans....[more]

name: STERLING
meaning: From a Scottish surname which was derived from city of Stirling, which is itself of unknown meaning. The name can also be given in reference to the English word sterling meaning "excellent". In this case, the word derives from sterling silver, which was so named because of the emblem that some Norman coins bore, from Old English meaning "little star".

name: STEVAN
meaning: Serbian and Croatian form of STEPHEN.

name: STEVE
meaning: Short form of STEVEN. A notable bearer was American technology entrepreneur Steve Jobs (1955-2011).

name: STEVEN
meaning: Medieval English variant of STEPHEN, and a Dutch variant of STEFAN. The filmmaker Steven Spielberg (1946-), director of 'E.T.' and 'Indiana Jones', is a famous bearer of this name.

name: STEVIE
meaning: Diminutive of STEPHEN or STEPHANIE. A famous bearer is the American musician Stevie Wonder (1950-).

name: STEWART
meaning: From a surname which was a variant STUART.

name: STIEN
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of CHRISTINE or JUSTINE.

name: STIJN
meaning: Short form of CONSTANTIJN or AUGUSTIJN.

name: STINA
meaning: Scandinavian short form of CHRISTINA and other names ending in stina.

name: STINE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian short form of CHRISTINE and other names ending in stine.

name: STIRLING
meaning: From a surname which was a variant STERLING.

name: STITHULF
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements stiþ "hard, stiff" and wulf "wolf".

name: STJEPAN
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of STEPHEN.

name: STOJAN
meaning: Macedonian, Serbian, Croatian and Slovene form of STOYAN.

name: STONE
meaning: From the English vocabulary word, ultimately from Old English stan.

name: STORM
meaning: From the vocabulary word, ultimately from Old English storm, or in the case of the Scandinavian name, from Old Norse stormr.

name: STOYAN
meaning: Derived from Bulgarian стоя(stoya) "to stand, to stay".

name: STOŠIJA
meaning: Form of ANASTAZIJA, used in particular to refer to the saint.

name: STRATON
meaning: Derived from Greek στρατος(stratos) meaning "army". This was the name of a 3rd-century BC Greek philosopher.

name: STRIBOG
meaning: Possibly means "flowing god" in Slavic. Stribog was the Slavic god of the wind, cold, ice and frost.

name: STUART
meaning: From an occupational surname originally belonging to a person who was a steward. It is ultimately derived from Old English stig "house" and weard "guard". As a given name, it arose in 19th-century Scotland in honour of the Stuart royal family, which produced several kings and queens of Scotland and Britain between the 14th and 18th centuries.

name: STURE
meaning: Derived from Old Norse stura "to be contrary". This was the name of three viceroys of Sweden.

name: STYLIANOS
meaning: Derived from Greek στυλος(stylos) meaning "pillar". Saint Stylianos was a 7th-century hermit from Adrianopolis in Asia Minor who is regarded as a patron saint of children.

name: SU  (2)
meaning: From Chinese 素(sù) meaning "plain, simple" or 肃(sù) meaning "respectful", besides other characters pronounced in a similar way.

name: SU-BIN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 秀(su) meaning "luxuriant, beautiful, elegant, outstanding" combined with 斌(bin) meaning "refined". Other combinations of hanja characters can form this name as well.

name: SU-JIN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 收(su) meaning "gather, harvest" or 壽(su) meaning "long life, lifespan" combined with 眞(jin) meaning "real, genuine" or 珍(jin) meaning "precious, rare". Other combinations of hanja characters can form this name as well.

name: SUBHASH
meaning: Means "eloquent", derived from the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" combined with भाषा(bhasha) meaning "speech".

name: SUBRAHMANYA
meaning: From the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" and ब्रह्मन्(brahman) meaning "transcendent reality, eternal truth". This is another name for the Hindu god Skanda.

name: SUCHART
meaning: Means "born into a good life" in Thai.

name: SUDARSHAN
meaning: Means "beautiful, good-looking" in Sanskrit, derived from the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" combined with दर्शन(darshana) meaning "seeing, observing".

name: SUDHIR
meaning: Derived from the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good, very" combined with धीर(dhira) meaning "wise, considerate".

name: SUELLEN
meaning: Contraction of SUSAN and ELLEN(1). Margaret Mitchell used this name in her novel 'Gone with the Wind' (1936), where it belongs to Scarlett's sister.

name: SUERO
meaning: Medieval Spanish form of Suerius, probably a Latinized form of a Germanic name composed of an unknown first element combined with hari "army".

name: SUHA
meaning: Means "forgotten, overlooked" in Arabic. Al-Suha (also called Alcor) is the name of a star in the constellation Ursa Major.

name: SUHAIL
meaning: Derived from Arabic سَهُلَ(sahula) meaning "level, even". This is the Arabic name of the second brightest star in the sky, known in the western world as Canopus.

name: SUHARTO
meaning: From Sanskrit सु(su) meaning "good" and अर्थ(artha) meaning "wealth, property" (borrowed into Indonesian as harta). This was the name of an Indonesian general (1921-2008) who seized power to become the country's second president.

name: SUIBHNE
meaning: Means "well-going" in Gaelic. This was the name of a 7th-century high king of Ireland.

name: SUJAY
meaning: Means "great victory", derived from the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" combined with जय(jaya) meaning "victory".

name: SUK-JA
meaning: From Sino-Korean 淑(suk) meaning "good, pure, virtuous, charming" and 子(ja) meaning "child". Other hanja characters can form this name as well. Korean feminine names ending with the character 子 (a fashionable name suffix in Japan, read as -ko in Japanese) declined in popularity after 1945 when Korea was liberated from Japanese rule.

name: SUKARNO
meaning: From the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" combined with the name of the mythological hero KARNA. Sukarno (1901-1970), who did not have a surname, was the first president of Indonesia.

name: SUKHBIR
meaning: From Sanskrit सुख(sukha) meaning "pleasant, happy" and वीर(vira) meaning "hero, brave".

name: SUKHDEEP
meaning: From Sanskrit सुख(sukha) meaning "pleasant, happy" and दीप(dipa) meaning "lamp, light".

name: SUKHON
meaning: Means "fragrance, pleasant smell" in Thai, ultimately of Pali origin.

name: SUKHRAB
meaning: Kazakh and Kyrgyz form of SOHRAB.

name: SULAIMAN
meaning: Variant Arabic transcription of SULAYMAN, as well as the Indonesian and Malay form.

name: SULISŁAW
meaning: From an old Slavic name which was derived from an element meaning "good" combined with slava "glory".

name: SULLIVAN
meaning: From an Irish surname which was derived from Ó Súilleabháin meaning "descendant of Súilleabhán". The name Súilleabhán means "little dark eye" in Irish.

name: SULTAN
meaning: Means "ruler, king, sultan" in Arabic. In the Arab world this name is typically masculine, but Turkey it is given to both boys and girls.

name: SUMAN
meaning: Means "well-disposed, good mind", derived from the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" combined with मनस्(manas) meaning "mind".

name: SUMANTRA
meaning: Means "following good advice", from the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" combined with मन्त्र(mantra) meaning "instrument of thought, prayer, advice".

name: SUMATI
meaning: Means "wise, good mind", derived from Sanskrit सु(su) meaning "good" and मति(mati) meaning "mind, thought". In the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' this is the name of King Sagara's second wife, who bore him 60,000 children.

name: SUMAYYA
meaning: Means "high above" in Arabic. This was the name of the first martyr for Islam.

name: SUMIKO
meaning: From Japanese 澄(sumi) meaning "clear" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: SUMMANUS
meaning: Means "before the morning", derived from Latin sub "under, before" and mane "morning". Summanus was the Roman god of the night sky and night lightning, a nocturnal counterpart to Jupiter.

name: SUMMER
meaning: From the name of the season, ultimately from Old English sumor. It has been in use as a given name since the 1970s.

name: SUNA
meaning: From the Turkish word for a type of duck, the shelduck (genus Tadorna).

name: SUNDARA
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit सुन्दर(sundara) meaning "beautiful". This is the name of several minor characters in Hindu texts, and is also another name of the Hindu god Krishna.

name: SUNDAY
meaning: From the name of the day of the week, which ultimately derives from Old English sunnandæg, which was composed of the elements sunne "sun" and dæg "day".

name: SUNIL
meaning: From Sanskrit सु(su) meaning "good, very" combined with नील(nila) meaning "dark blue".

name: SUNITA
meaning: Means "well conducted, wise", derived from the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" combined with नीत(nita) meaning "conducted, led". In Hindu legend this is the name of the daughter of King Anga of Bengal.

name: SUNITI
meaning: Means "good conduct" from the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" combined with नीति(niti) meaning "guidance, moral conduct".

name: SUNNIVA
meaning: Scandinavian form of the Old English name Sunngifu, which meant "sun gift" from the Old English elements sunne "sun" and giefu "gift". This was the name of a legendary English saint who was shipwrecked in Norway and killed by the inhabitants.

name: SUNNY
meaning: From the English word meaning "sunny, cheerful".

name: SUNSHINE
meaning: From the English word, ultimately from Old English sunne "sun" and scinan "shine".

name: SUNČANA
meaning: Means "sunny" in Croatian, a derivative of sunce "sun".

name: SURAJ
meaning: Means "sun" in several northern Indian languages, derived from Sanskrit सूर्य(surya).

name: SURENDRA
meaning: Means "lord of gods" from Sanskrit सुर(sura) meaning "god" combined with the name of the Hindu god INDRA, used here to mean "lord". This is another name for Indra.

name: SURESHA
meaning: Means "ruler of the gods" from Sanskrit सुर(sura) meaning "god" and ईश(isha) meaning "ruler, lord". This is another name of the Hindu gods Indra, Shiva or Vishnu.

name: SURINDER
meaning: Variant of SURENDRA used by Sikhs.

name: SURYA
meaning: Means "sun" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the Hindu god of the sun.

name: SUSAN
meaning: English variant of SUSANNA. This has been most common spelling since the 18th century. A notable bearer was the American feminist Susan B. Anthony (1820-1906).

name: SUSANA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of SUSANNA.

name: SUSANN
meaning: German and Scandinavian short form of SUSANNE.

name: SUSANNA
meaning: From Σουσαννα(Sousanna), the Greek form of the Hebrew name שׁוֹשַׁנָּה(Shoshannah). This was derived from the Hebrew word שׁוֹשָׁן(shoshan) meaning "lily" (in modern Hebrew this also means "rose"), perhaps ultimately from Egyptian sšn "lotus". In the Old Testament Apocrypha this is the name of a woman falsely accused of adultery. The prophet Daniel clears her name by tricking her accusers, who end up being condemned themselves. It also occurs in the New Testament belonging to a woman who ministers to Jesus....[more]

name: SUSANNAH
meaning: Form of SUSANNA found in some versions of the Old Testament.

name: SUSANNE
meaning: German and Scandinavian form of SUSANNA.

name: SUSHILA
meaning: Means "good-tempered, well-disposed", derived from the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" combined with शील(shila) meaning "conduct, disposition". This is a transcription of both the feminine form सुशीला and the masculine form सुशील. This name is borne by wives of the Hindu gods Krishna and Yama.

name: SUSUMU
meaning: From Japanese 進(susumu) meaning "advance, make progress", as well as other kanji or kanji combinations having the same pronunciation.

name: SUZU
meaning: From Japanese 鈴(suzu) meaning "bell" or other kanji having the same pronunciation.

name: SUZUME
meaning: From Japanese 雀(suzume) meaning "sparrow", as well as other kanji or kanji combinations which are pronounced the same way.

name: SVANHILD
meaning: Scandinavian cognate of SWANHILD. In Norse legend she was the daughter of Sigurd and Gudrun.

name: SVANTEPOLK
meaning: Old Norse form of SVYATOPOLK. It was borne by the prominent 13th-century Swedish nobleman Svantepolk Knutsson. He may have been named after a relative of his Pomeranian mother.

name: SVAROG
meaning: Derived from Slavic svar "bright, clear". This was the name of the Slavic god of the sky and sun. He was originally the supreme god in Slavic mythology.

name: SVATAVA
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element svetu meaning "blessed, holy".

name: SVEA
meaning: From a personification of the country of Sweden, in use since the 17th century. It is a derivative of Svear, the Swedish name for the ancient Germanic tribe the Swedes. The Swedish name of the country of Sweden is Sverige, a newer form of Svear rike meaning "the realm of the Svear".

name: SVEN
meaning: From the Old Norse byname Sveinn which meant "boy". This was the name of kings of Denmark, Norway and Sweden.

name: SVERRE
meaning: From the Old Norse name Sverrir which meant "wild, swinging, spinning".

name: SVERRIR
meaning: Old Norse form of SVERRE, as well as the modern Icelandic form.

name: SVETLANA
meaning: Derived from Slavic svet meaning "light, world". It was popularized by the poem 'Svetlana' (1813) by the Russian poet Vasily Zhukovsky. It is sometimes used as a translation of Photine.

name: SVETOMIR
meaning: Serbian and Bulgarian form of ŚWIĘTOMIERZ.

name: SVETOPOLK
meaning: Possible medieval Slavic form of SVYATOPOLK.

name: SVETOVID
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements svetu "blessed, holy" and vidu "sight, view". This was the name of a four-headed Slavic god of war and light.

name: SVEVA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly related to the name of the Germanic tribe of the Suebi.

name: SVJETLANA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of SVETLANA.

name: SVYATOPOLK
meaning: Means "blessed people" from the Slavic elements svetu "blessed, holy" and pulku "people, host, army".

name: SVYATOSLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements svetu "blessed, holy" and slava "glory".

name: SWANHILD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements swan "swan" and hild "battle".

name: SWAPAN
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit स्वपन(svapana) meaning "sleeping, dreaming".

name: SWAPNIL
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit स्वप्न(svapna) meaning "sleep, dream".

name: SWARNA
meaning: Means "good colour" or "golden", a contraction of the Sanskrit prefix सु(su) meaning "good" and वर्ण(varna) meaning "colour". This is a transcription of both the masculine form स्वर्ण and the feminine form स्वर्णा.

name: SWATI
meaning: From the Indian name of the third brightest star in the night sky, called Arcturus in the western world.

name: SWITHIN
meaning: From the Old English name Swiðhun or Swiþhun, derived from swiþ "strong" and perhaps hun "bear cub". Saint Swithin was a 9th-century bishop of Winchester.

name: SYBIL
meaning: Variant of SIBYL. This spelling variation has existed since the Middle Ages.

name: SYBILLA
meaning: Polish form and Latin variant of SIBYLLA.

name: SYBILLE
meaning: German and French form of SIBYL.

name: SYDNEY
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of the surname SIDNEY. This is the name of the largest city in Australia, which was named for Thomas Townshend, 1st Viscount Sydney in 1788. Since the 1990s this name has been mainly feminine.

name: SYED
meaning: Urdu, Punjabi and Bengali form of SAYYID.

name: SYLVESTER
meaning: Medieval variant of SILVESTER. This is currently the usual English spelling of the name. The actor Sylvester Stallone (1946-) is a famous bearer.

name: SYLVI
meaning: Norwegian and Swedish variant of SOLVEIG. It is also used as a short form of SYLVIA.

name: SYLVIA
meaning: Variant of SILVIA. This has been the most common English spelling since the 19th century.

name: SYMEON
meaning: Old Testament Greek (though occurring rarely in the New Testament) and Latin form of SIMEON.

name: SYMON
meaning: Ukrainian form of SIMON(1) (mostly ecclesiastical usage).

name: SYMPHONY
meaning: Simply from the English word, ultimately deriving from Greek συμφωνος(symphonos) "concordant in sound".

name: SYNTYCHE
meaning: Ancient Greek name meaning "common fate". This is the name of a woman mentioned in Paul's epistle to the Philippians in the New Testament.

name: SZABOLCS
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly from a Slavic word meaning "marten". It was borne by a leader of the Magyars at the time of Árpád. This is now the name of a region in Hungary.

name: SZCZĘSNY
meaning: Means "lucky, successful, happy" in Polish, a vernacular form of Felix.

name: SZILÁRD
meaning: Means "solid, firm" in Hungarian, also used as a Hungarian vernacular form of Constantine.

name: SÁRA
meaning: Hungarian, Czech and Slovak form of SARAH.

name: SÆWINE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements sæ "sea" and wine "friend".

name: SÉBASTIENNE
meaning: French feminine form of Sebastianus (see SEBASTIAN).

name: SÉGOLÈNE
meaning: Possibly a French form of SIEGLINDE.

name: SÍLVIA
meaning: Portuguese and Catalan form of SILVIA.

name: SÍTHEACH
meaning: Means "peaceful" or "mysterious, fairy-like" in Irish Gaelic.

name: SÍTHMAITH
meaning: Means "good peace" from Irish síth "peace" and maith "good".

name: SÓLVEIG
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of SOLVEIG.

name: SÖREN
meaning: Swedish and German form of SØREN.

name: SØLVI
meaning: Norwegian variant of SOLVEIG. It is also used as a short form of SILVIA.

name: SØREN
meaning: Danish form of SEVERINUS. Søren Kierkegaard (1813-1855) was a Danish philosopher who is regarded as a precursor of existentialism.

name: SÜLEYMAN
meaning: Turkish form of SOLOMON. Süleyman the Magnificent was a sultan of the Ottoman Empire in the 16th century. He expanded Ottoman territory into Europe and Persia, reformed the government, and completed several great building projects.

name: SİNEM
meaning: Means "my bosom, my breast" in Turkish.

name: SŁAWOMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element slava meaning "glory" combined with meru meaning "great, famous" or miru meaning "peace, world".

name: TAAVI
meaning: Estonian and Finnish form of DAVID.

name: TABEA
meaning: German short form of TABITHA. This form was used in earlier editions of the Luther Bible.

name: TABITHA
meaning: Means "gazelle" in Aramaic. Tabitha in the New Testament was a woman restored to life by Saint Peter. Her name is translated into Greek as Dorcas (see Acts 9:36). As an English name, Tabitha became common after the Protestant Reformation. It was popularized in the 1960s by the television show 'Bewitched', in which Tabitha (sometimes spelled Tabatha) is the daughter of the main character.

name: TACEY
meaning: Derived from Latin tace meaning "be silent". It was in use from the 16th century, though it died out two centuries later.

name: TACITO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of TACITUS.

name: TACITUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which meant "silent, mute" in Latin. This was the name of a 1st-century Roman historian.

name: TADALA
meaning: Means "we have been blessed" in Chewa.

name: TADEÁŠ
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of THADDEUS.

name: TADHG
meaning: Means "poet" in Irish. This was the name of an 11th-century king of Connacht.

name: TADIJA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of THADDEUS.

name: TAFARI
meaning: Possibly means "he who inspires awe" in Amharic. This name was borne by Lij Tafari Makonnen (1892-1975), also known as Haile Selassie, the last emperor of Ethiopia. Rastafarians (Ras Tafari meaning "king Tafari") revere him as the earthly incarnation of God.

name: TAHA
meaning: From the Arabic letters ط (called ta) and ه (called ha). These letters begin the 20th chapter of the Qur'an (surah Ta Ha).

name: TAHMASP
meaning: Persian form of the Avestan name Takhmaspa, which was derived from takhma "strong, brave, valiant" and aspa "horse". This name was borne by two Safavid shahs of Persia.

name: TAHMURAS
meaning: Persian form of Avestan Takhma Urupi meaning "strong body". Takhma Urupi is a hero from the Avesta who later appears in the 11th-century Persian epic the 'Shahnameh'.

name: TAI
meaning: From Chinese 太(tài) meaning "very, extreme" or other characters pronounced in a similar way.

name: TAICHI
meaning: From Japanese 太(ta) meaning "thick, big" and 一(ichi) meaning "one", in addition to other combinations of kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: TAIKI
meaning: From Japanese 大(tai) meaning "big, great" and 輝(ki) meaning "brightness" or 樹(ki) meaning "tree". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: TAISIYA
meaning: Possibly a Russian form of THAÏS.

name: TAJANA
meaning: Derived from Croatian and Serbian tajiti "to keep secret".

name: TAJUANA
meaning: Combination of the prefix Ta with the name JUANA.

name: TAKAHIRO
meaning: From Japanese 貴(taka) meaning "valuable" or 孝(taka) meaning "filial piety" combined with 大(hiro) meaning "big, great" or 浩(hiro) meaning "prosperous". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: TAKAKO
meaning: From Japanese 孝(taka) meaning "filial piety" and 子(ko) meaning "child", as well as other combinations of kanji characters.

name: TAKARA
meaning: From Japanese 宝(takara) meaning "treasure, jewel", as well as other kanji or kanji combinations with the same pronunciation.

name: TAKASHI
meaning: From Japanese 孝(takashi) meaning "filial piety", 隆(takashi) meaning "noble, prosperous" or 崇(takashi) meaning "esteem, honour, venerate", as well as other kanji or kanji combinations which result in the same pronunciation.

name: TAKEHIKO
meaning: From Japanese 武(take) meaning "military, martial" or 竹(take) meaning "bamboo" combined with 彦(hiko) meaning "boy, prince". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: TAKESHI
meaning: From Japanese 武(takeshi) meaning "military, martial" or other kanji having the same reading.

name: TAKUMA
meaning: From Japanese 拓(taku) meaning "expand, open, support" and 真(ma) meaning "real, genuine". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: TAKUMI
meaning: From Japanese 匠(takumi) meaning "artisan" or 巧(takumi) meaning "skillful". It can also come from 拓(taku) meaning "expand, open, support" combined with 海(mi) meaning "sea, ocean" or 実(mi) meaning "fruit, good result, truth". This name can also be formed of other kanji combinations.

name: TAKUYA
meaning: From Japanese 拓(taku) meaning "expand, open, support" combined with 也(ya) meaning "also" or 哉(ya), an exclamation. This name can be formed with other kanji combinations as well.

name: TALBOT
meaning: From a surname which was perhaps derived from a Germanic given name composed of the elements tal "to destroy" and bod "message".

name: TALFRYN
meaning: From a Welsh place name meaning "high hill", derived from Welsh tal "high" and bryn "hill".

name: TALGAT
meaning: Kazakh and Tatar form of TAL'AT.

name: TALIA  (2)
meaning: From the name of a town in South Australia, perhaps meaning "near water" in an Australian Aboriginal language.

name: TALIB
meaning: Means "seeker of knowledge, student" in Arabic. Abu Talib was an uncle of Muhammad who raised him after his parents and grandparents died. His name was in fact a kunya (a nickname) formed using Abu; his real name may have been Imran.

name: TALIESIN
meaning: Means "shining brow", derived from Welsh tal "brow" and iesin "shining". This was the name of a 6th-century Welsh poet and bard. In later Welsh legends he is portrayed as a wizard and prophet, or as a companion of King Arthur.

name: TALIN
meaning: From the name of an Armenian town (meaning unknown) which is home to a famous 7th-century cathedral.

name: TALISHA
meaning: Combination of the popular name prefix Ta and LISHA.

name: TALITA
meaning: Portuguese form of TALITHA, popular in Brazil.

name: TALITHA
meaning: Means "little girl" in Aramaic. The name is taken from the phrase talitha cumi meaning "little girl arise" spoken by Jesus in order to restore a young girl to life (see Mark 5:41).

name: TALLULAH
meaning: Popularly claimed to mean "leaping waters" in the Choctaw language, it may actually mean "town" in the Creek language. This is the name of waterfalls in Georgia. It was borne by American actress Tallulah Bankhead (1902-1968), who was named after her grandmother, who may have been named after the waterfalls.

name: TALMAI
meaning: Means "furrowed" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this name is borne by both a giant and also the father of King David's wife Maacah.

name: TALON
meaning: From the English meaning "talon, claw", ultimately derived (via Norman French) from Latin talus "anklebone".

name: TALULLA
meaning: From the Gaelic name Tuilelaith, which was derived from Irish tuile "abundance" and flaith "princess".

name: TAMANNA
meaning: Means "wish, desire" in Hindi, ultimately from Persian تمنّا(tamanna).

name: TAMAR
meaning: Means "date palm" in Hebrew. According to the Old Testament Tamar was the daughter-in-law of Judah and later his wife. This was also the name of a daughter of King David. She was raped by her half-brother Amnon, leading to his murder by her brother Absalom. The name was borne by a 12th-century ruling queen of Georgia who presided over the kingdom at the peak of its power.

name: TAMARA
meaning: Russian form of TAMAR. Russian performers such as Tamara Karsavina (1885-1978), Tamara Drasin (1905-1943), Tamara Geva (1907-1997) and Tamara Toumanova (1919-1996) introduced it to the English-speaking world. It was also borne by the Polish cubist painter Tamara de Lempicka (1898-1980).

name: TAMELA
meaning: Probably a combination of TAMARA and PAMELA. It first arose in the 1950s.

name: TAMERLANE
meaning: Westernized form of Timur i Leng (see TIMUR).

name: TAMIA
meaning: Elaborated form of the popular name syllable Tam, from names such as TAMARA or TAMIKA. It was popularized by Canadian singer Tamia Hill (1975-), who is known simply as Tamia.

name: TAMIKA
meaning: Variant of TAMIKO, inspired by the American jazz singer Tamiko Jones (1945-) or the American movie 'A Girl Named Tamiko' (1963).

name: TAMIKO
meaning: From Japanese 多(ta) meaning "many", 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: TAMMARO
meaning: Italian form of the Germanic name Thancmar, which was composed of the elements thank "thought" and mari "famous".

name: TAMMY
meaning: Short form of TAMARA and other names beginning with Tam.

name: TAMSIN
meaning: Contracted form of THOMASINA. It was traditionally used in Cornwall.

name: TANCRED
meaning: Norman form of a Germanic name meaning "thought and counsel", derived from the elements thank "thought" and rad "counsel". This was the name of a leader of the First Crusade, described by Torquato Tasso in his epic poem 'Jerusalem Delivered' (1580).

name: TANCREDI
meaning: Italian form of TANCRED. Gioachino Rossini used this name in his opera 'Tancredi' (1813).

name: TANE
meaning: Means "man" in Maori. In Maori and other Polynesian mythology Tane was the god of forests and light. He was the son of the sky god Rangi and the earth goddess Papa, who were locked in an embrace and finally separated by their son. He created the tui bird and, by some accounts, man.

name: TANGAROA
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Polynesian mythology he was the god of the sea, the son of Rangi and Papa. He separated his parents' embrace, creating the earth and the sky.

name: TANIKA
meaning: Invented name, probably modeled on TAMIKA and influenced by TANYA.

name: TANIQUA
meaning: Combination of the popular name element Tan (from names such as TANYA) and the common name suffix qua.

name: TANISHA
meaning: Combination of the popular name element Tan (from names such as TANYA) and the common name suffix sha.

name: TANITH
meaning: Derived from Semitic roots meaning "serpent lady". This was the name of the Phoenician goddess of love, fertility, the moon and the stars.

name: TANNER
meaning: From an English surname meaning "one who tans hides".

name: TANSY
meaning: From the name of the flower, which is derived via Old French from Late Latin tanacita.

name: TANYA
meaning: Russian diminutive of TATIANA. It began to be used in the English-speaking world during the 1930s.

name: TAO
meaning: From Chinese 涛(tāo) meaning "large waves", as well as other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: TAPIO
meaning: Meaning unknown. Tapio was the Finnish god of forests, animals, and hunting.

name: TARA  (1)
meaning: Anglicized form of the Irish place name Teamhair, which possibly means "elevated place" in Gaelic. This was the name of the sacred hill near Dublin where the Irish high kings resided. It was popularized as a given name by the novel 'Gone with the Wind' (1936) and the subsequent movie adaptation (1939), in which it is the name of the O'Hara plantation.

name: TARA  (2)
meaning: Means "star" in Sanskrit. Tara is the name of a Hindu astral goddess, the wife of Brhaspati. She was abducted by Soma, a god of the moon, leading to a great war that was only ended when Brahma intervened and released her. This is also the name of a Buddhist deity (a female Buddha).

name: TARANIS
meaning: Derived from Celtic taran meaning "thunder", cognate with Þórr (see THOR). This was the name of the Gaulish thunder god, who was often identified with the Roman god Jupiter.

name: TARAS
meaning: Ukrainian and Russian form of the Greek name Ταρασιος(Tarasios), which possibly means "from Taras". Taras was an Italian city, now called Taranto, which was founded by Greek colonists in the 8th century BC and was named for the Greek mythological figure Taras, a son of Poseidon. Saint Tarasios was an 8th-century bishop of Constantinople. It was also borne by the Ukrainian writer and artist Taras Shevchenko (1814-1861).

name: TARIK
meaning: Bosnian form of TARIQ. It is also a variant transcription of the Arabic name.

name: TARINA
meaning: Perhaps an elaborated form of TARA(1).

name: TARIQ
meaning: Means "he who knocks at the door" in Arabic. This is the Arabic name of the morning star. Tariq ibn Ziyad was the Islamic general who conquered Spain for the Umayyad Caliphate in the 8th century.

name: TARMO
meaning: Means "vigour, energy, drive" in Estonian and Finnish.

name: TAROU
meaning: From Japanese 太(ta) meaning "thick, big" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: TARQUIN
meaning: From the Roman name Tarquinius which is of unknown meaning, possibly Etruscan in origin. This was the name of two early kings of Rome.

name: TARU
meaning: Means "legend, myth" in Finnish. It is also used as a diminutive of TARJA.

name: TARYN
meaning: Probably a feminine form of TYRONE. Actors Tyrone Power and Linda Christian created it for their daughter Taryn Power (1953-).

name: TASNIM
meaning: Means "a spring in paradise" in Arabic.

name: TASUNKA
meaning: From Lakota tȟašuŋke meaning "his horse". This forms the first part of the name of Tasunka Witko (1840-1877), translated as Crazy Horse, a Lakota war leader.

name: TATA
meaning: Old English name of unknown meaning.

name: TATANKA
meaning: From Lakota tȟatȟáŋka meaning "bull". This is the first part of the name of the Lakota holy man and chief Tatanka Iyotake (1831-1890), translated into English as Sitting Bull.

name: TATE
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Old English given name Tata, of unknown origin.

name: TATIANA
meaning: Feminine form of the Roman name Tatianus, a derivative of the Roman name TATIUS. This was the name of a 3rd-century saint who was martyred in Rome under the emperor Alexander Severus. She was especially venerated in Orthodox Christianity, and the name has been common in Russia (as Татьяна) and Eastern Europe. It was not regularly used in the English-speaking world until the 1980s.

name: TATIANUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was derived from TATIUS.

name: TATIUS
meaning: Roman family name of unknown meaning, possibly of Sabine origin. According to Roman legend, Titus Tatius was an 8th-century BC king of the Sabines who came to jointly rule over the Romans and Sabines with the Roman king Romulus.

name: TATTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "Tata's town" in Old English.

name: TATUM
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "Tata's homestead" in Old English.

name: TATYANA
meaning: Russian and Bulgarian form of TATIANA.

name: TAU
meaning: Means "lion" in Tswana and Sotho. Tau was the name of the last ruler of the Rolong in South Africa (18th century).

name: TAVISH
meaning: Anglicized form of Thàmhais, vocative case of TÀMHAS. Alternatively it could be taken from the Scottish surname MacTavish, Anglicized form of Mac Tàmhais, meaning "son of Thomas".

name: TAWFIQ
meaning: Means "good fortune", derived from Arabic وفق(wafiqa) meaning "to be successful".

name: TAWNY
meaning: From the English word, ultimately deriving from Old French tané, which means "light brown".

name: TAYLA
meaning: Probably a feminine form of TAYLOR influenced by similar-sounding names such as KAYLA.

name: TAYLOR
meaning: From an English surname which originally denoted someone who was a tailor, from Norman French tailleur, ultimately from Latin taliare "to cut". Its modern use as a feminine name may have been influenced by British author Taylor Caldwell (1900-1985).

name: TEA
meaning: Short form of DOROTHEA or THEODORA.

name: TEAGAN
meaning: From an Irish surname, an Anglicized form of Ó Tadhgáin meaning "descendant of Tadhgán". The given name Tadhgán is a diminutive of TADHG.

name: TEAL
meaning: From the English word for the type of duck or the greenish-blue colour.

name: TECLA
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of THEKLA.

name: TECUMSEH
meaning: Means "panther passing across" in Shawnee. This was the name of a Shawnee leader who, with his brother Tenskwatawa, resisted European expansion in the early 19th century.

name: TED
meaning: Short form of EDWARD or THEODORE. A famous bearer was the American baseball player Ted Williams (1918-2002), who was born as Theodore.

name: TEGID
meaning: Possibly derived from Welsh teg "fair", or possibly from the Roman name TACITUS. This is the Welsh name of a lake in Wales, called Bala Lake in English. It also occurs in medieval Welsh legends as the husband of Ceridwen.

name: TEGWEN
meaning: Derived from the Welsh elements teg "fair" and gwen "blessed".

name: TEIMURAZ
meaning: Georgian form of TAHMURAS. This was the name of several kings who ruled over kingdoms located in what is now modern Georgia.

name: TEKAKWITHA
meaning: Means "she who bumps into things" or "she who puts things in place" in Mohawk. Tekakwitha, also named Kateri, was the first Native American Catholic saint.

name: TEKLA
meaning: Georgian and Hungarian form of THEKLA.

name: TEKOA
meaning: Possibly means either "stockade" or "horn, trumpet" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a both a city and a son of Ashhur.

name: TEL
meaning: Short form of TERENCE or TERRY(1).

name: TELESPHORUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Telesphoros (see TÉLESPHORE).

name: TELLERVO
meaning: Meaning unknown. Tellervo was a Finnish forest goddess. She is variously described as either the wife or daughter of Tapio.

name: TELMA
meaning: Either a Portuguese form of THELMA or a feminine form of TELMO.

name: TELMO
meaning: Derived from a misdivision of Spanish Santelmo meaning "saint ELMO". This name is given in honour of Pedro González Telmo, a 13th-century Spanish priest.

name: TEMAN
meaning: Means "right hand" or "south" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of a grandson of Esau for whom the town of Teman in Edom was named.

name: TEMITOPE
meaning: Means "enough to give thanks" in Yoruba.

name: TEMPERANCE
meaning: From the English word meaning "moderation" or "restraint". This was one of the virtue names adopted by the Puritans in the 17th century.

name: TEMPEST
meaning: From the English word meaning "storm". It appears in the title of William Shakespeare's play 'The Tempest' (1611).

name: TEMPLE
meaning: From a surname which originally belonged to a person who was associated with the Knights Templar, a medieval religious military order.

name: TEMUJIN
meaning: Means "of iron" in Mongolian, derived ultimately from the Turkic word temür "iron". This was the original name of the Mongolian leader better known by the title Genghis Khan. Born in the 12th century, he managed to unite the tribes of Mongolia and then conquer huge areas of Asia and Eastern Europe.

name: TENGIZ
meaning: Derived from Turkic tengiz meaning "sea, ocean".

name: TENNYSON
meaning: From an English surname which meant "son of Tenney", Tenney being a medieval form of DENIS. A notable bearer of the surname was British poet Alfred Lord Tennyson (1809-1892).

name: TENSKWATAWA
meaning: Means "open door" in Shawnee. This was the name of a Shawnee prophet. With his brother Tecumseh he led his people in resistance against European expansion in the early 19th century.

name: TENZIN
meaning: From Tibetan བསྟན་འཛིན(bstan-'dzin) which means "upholder of teachings". This is one of the given names of the current Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso (1935-).

name: TEO
meaning: Short form of TEODORO and other names that begin with Teo.

name: TEOBALDO
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Italian form of THEOBALD.

name: TEODORO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of Theodoros (see THEODORE).

name: TEODOSIJA
meaning: Serbian and Macedonian form of THEODOSIA.

name: TEODOSIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of THEODOSIUS.

name: TEOFILA
meaning: Italian and Polish feminine form of THEOPHILUS.

name: TERAH
meaning: Possibly means "station" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament Terah is the father of Abraham. He led his people out of Ur and towards Canaan, but died along the way.

name: TERCERO
meaning: Means "third" in Spanish. This name was traditionally given to the third child born.

name: TERENCE
meaning: From the Roman family name Terentius which is of unknown meaning. Famous bearers include Publius Terentius Afer, a Roman playwright, and Marcus Terentius Varro, a Roman scholar. It was also borne by several early saints. The name was used in Ireland as an Anglicized form of TOIRDHEALBHACH, but it was not in use as an English name until the late 19th century.

name: TERENTI
meaning: Georgian form of Terentius (see TERENCE). It is also a Russian variant transcription of TERENTIY.

name: TERESA
meaning: Cognate of THERESA. Saint Teresa of Ávila was a 16th-century Spanish nun who reformed the Carmelite monasteries and wrote several spiritual books. It was also borne by the beatified Albanian missionary Mother Teresa (1910-1997), who worked with the poor in Calcutta. She adopted the name in honour of the French saint Thérèse de Lisieux, who is the patron of missionaries.

name: TERESE
meaning: Basque and Scandinavian form of TERESA.

name: TEREZA
meaning: Czech, Portuguese, Bulgarian and Romanian form of THERESA.

name: TEREZIJA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian form of THERESA.

name: TERHI
meaning: Short form of Terhenetär, which was derived from Finnish terhen "mist". In the Finnish epic the 'Kalevala' Terhenetär is a sprite associated with mist and forests.

name: TERI
meaning: Either a feminine variant of TERRY(1) or a diminutive of THERESA.

name: TERMINUS
meaning: Means "limit, boundary, end" in Latin. This was the name of the Roman god of boundaries.

name: TERPSICHORE
meaning: Means "enjoying the dance" from Greek τερψις(terpsis) "delight" and χορος(choros) "dance". In Greek mythology she was the goddess of dance and dramatic chorus, one of the nine Muses.

name: TERRA
meaning: Variant of TARA(1), perhaps influenced by the Latin word terra meaning "land, earth".

name: TERRELL
meaning: From an English surname which was probably derived from the Norman French nickname tirel "to pull", referring to a stubborn person. It may sometimes be given in honour of civil rights activist Mary Church Terrell (1863-1954).

name: TERRI
meaning: Either a feminine variant of TERRY(1) or a diminutive of THERESA.

name: TERRIE
meaning: Either a feminine variant of TERRY(1) or a diminutive of THERESA.

name: TERRY  (1)
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the medieval name Thierry, a Norman French form of THEODORIC.

name: TERRY  (2)
meaning: Diminutive of TERENCE or THERESA. A famous bearer was Terry Fox (1958-1981), a young man with an artificial leg who attempted to run across Canada to raise money for cancer research. He died of the disease before crossing the country.

name: TERTIUS
meaning: This was both a Roman praenomen and a cognomen which meant "third" in Latin.

name: TERÉZIA
meaning: Hungarian and Slovak form of THERESA.

name: TESNI
meaning: Means "warmth from the sun" in Welsh.

name: TESS
meaning: Diminutive of THERESA. This is the name of the main character in Thomas Hardy's novel 'Tess of the D'Ubervilles' (1891).

name: TESSOUAT
meaning: Meaning unknown. This was the name of several 17th-century Algonquin chiefs.

name: TETHYS
meaning: Derived from Greek τηθη(tethe) meaning "grandmother". In Greek mythology this was the name of a Titan associated with the sea. She was the wife of Oceanus.

name: TEUTA
meaning: Possibly derived from an Illyrian word or title meaning "queen". This was the name of a 3rd-century BC Illyrian queen.

name: TEX
meaning: From a nickname which denoted a person who came from the state of Texas. A famous bearer was the American animator Tex Avery (1908-1980), real name Frederick, who was born in Texas.

name: TEZCATLIPOCA
meaning: Means "smoking mirror" in Nahuatl. In Aztec and other Mesoamerican mythology he was one of the chief gods, associated with the night sky, winds, war, and the north. Like his rival Quetzalcoatl, he was a creator god.

name: TEÀRLACH
meaning: Scottish form of TOIRDHEALBHACH. This name is also used as a Scottish form of CHARLES.

name: TEÓFILO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of THEOPHILUS.

name: THABANI
meaning: Means "be happy" in Zulu and Ndebele.

name: THADDAEUS
meaning: Form of THADDEUS used in most English versions of the New Testament.

name: THADDEUS
meaning: From Θαδδαιος(Thaddaios), the Greek form of the Aramaic name Thaddai. It is possibly derived from a word meaning "heart", but it may in fact be an Aramaic form of a Greek name such as Θεοδωρος (see THEODORE). In the Gospel of Matthew, Thaddaeus is listed as one of the twelve apostles, though elsewhere in the New Testament his name is omitted and Jude's appears instead. It is likely that the two names refer to the same person.

name: THALES
meaning: Derived from Greek θαλλω(thallo) meaning "to blossom". This was the name of a 6th-century BC Greek philosopher and mathematician.

name: THALIA
meaning: From the Greek name Θαλεια(Thaleia), derived from θαλλω(thallo) meaning "to blossom". In Greek mythology she was one of the nine Muses, presiding over comedy and pastoral poetry. This was also the name of one of the three Graces or Χαριτες (Charites).

name: THAMAR
meaning: Form of TAMAR used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: THANASIS
meaning: Modern Greek short form of ATHANASIOS.

name: THANATOS
meaning: Means "death" in Greek. This was the name of the Greek god of death who resided with Hades in the underworld.

name: THANDIWE
meaning: Means "loving one" in Xhosa, Zulu and Ndebele, from thanda "to love".

name: THANDO
meaning: From Xhosa, Zulu and Ndebele thanda meaning "to love".

name: THANE
meaning: From the Scottish and English noble title, which was originally from Old English thegn.

name: THANH
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 青(thanh) meaning "blue, green, young" or 聲(thanh) meaning "sound, voice, tone".

name: THANKFUL
meaning: From the English word thankful. This was one of the many virtue names used by the Puritans in the 17th century.

name: THAÏS
meaning: Possibly means "bandage" in Greek. This was the name of a companion of Alexander the Great. It was also borne by a 4th-century saint from Alexandria, a wealthy socialite who became a Christian convert. She has been a popular subject of art and literature, including an 1891 novel by Anatole France and an 1894 opera by Jules Massenet.

name: THEA
meaning: Short form of DOROTHEA or THEODORA.

name: THEDA
meaning: Short form of THEODORA. A famous bearer was actress Theda Bara (1885-1955), who was born Theodosia Goodman.

name: THEIA
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek θεα(thea) meaning "goddess". In Greek myth this was the name of a Titan goddess of sight, glittering and glory. She was the wife of Hyperion and the mother of the sun god Helios, the moon goddess Selene, and the dawn goddess Eos.

name: THEKLA
meaning: From the ancient Greek name Θεοκλεια(Theokleia), which meant "glory of God" from the Greek elements θεος(theos) meaning "god" and κλεος(kleos) meaning "glory". This was the name of a 1st-century saint, appearing (as Θεκλα) in the apocryphal 'Acts of Paul and Thecla'. The story tells how Thecla listens to Paul speak about the virtues of chastity and decides to remain a virgin, angering both her mother and her suitor.

name: THELMA
meaning: Meaning unknown. It was a rare name when British author Marie Corelli used it for the Norwegian heroine of her novel 'Thelma' (1887). The name became popular around the end of the 19th century after the novel was published. It is sometimes claimed to derive from Greek θελημα(thelema) meaning "will", though this seems unlikely.

name: THELONIUS
meaning: Latinized form of Tielo (see TILO). A famous bearer was jazz musician Thelonious Monk (1917-1982).

name: THEMBA
meaning: Means "trust, hope" in Zulu, Xhosa and Ndebele.

name: THEMIS
meaning: Means "law of nature, divine law, that which is laid down" in Greek. In Greek mythology this was the name of a Titan who presided over custom and natural law. She was often depicted blindfolded and holding a pair of scales. By Zeus she was the mother of many deities, including the three Μοιραι (Moirai) and the three ‘Ωραι (Horai).

name: THEMISTOCLES
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Θεμιστοκλης(Themistokles) meaning "glory of the law", from θεμις(themis) "law of nature, divine law" (genitive θεμιστος) and κλεος(kleos) "glory". This was the name of an Athenian statesman and general who was victorious over the Persians in the Battle of Salamis.

name: THEO
meaning: Short form of THEODORE, THEOBALD, and other names that begin with Theo.

name: THEOBALD
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements theud "people" and bald "bold". The Normans brought the name to England, where it joined an existing Old English cognate. The medieval forms Tibald and Tebald were commonly Latinized as Theobaldus. It was rare by the 20th century.

name: THEOCRITUS
meaning: Latinized form of Θεοκριτος(Theokritos), a Greek name which meant "judge of god" from θεος(theos) "god" and κριτης(krites) "judge, critic". This was the name of a 3rd-century BC Greek poet.

name: THEODOAR
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements theud "people" and war "vigilant, cautious".

name: THEODOARD
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements theud "people" and wart "watcher".

name: THEODOR
meaning: German form of THEODORE, as well as a Scandinavian, Czech and Romanian variant of TEODOR. A famous bearer was American children's book creator Theodor Seuss Geisel (1904-1991), better known as Dr. Seuss.

name: THEODORA
meaning: Feminine form of THEODORE. This name was common in the Byzantine Empire, being borne by several empresses including the influential wife of Justinian in the 6th century.

name: THEODORE
meaning: From the Greek name Θεοδωρος(Theodoros), which meant "gift of god" from Greek θεος(theos) "god" and δωρον(doron) "gift". The name Dorothea is derived from the same roots in reverse order. This was the name of several saints, including Theodore of Amasea, a 4th-century Greek soldier; Theodore of Tarsus, a 7th-century archbishop of Canterbury; and Theodore the Studite, a 9th-century Byzantine monk. It was also borne by two popes....[more]

name: THEODORIC
meaning: From a Germanic name meaning "ruler of the people", derived from the elements theud "people" and ric "power, ruler". It was notably borne by Theodoric the Great, a 6th-century king of the Ostrogoths who eventually became the ruler of Italy. By Theodoric's time the Ostrogoths were partially Romanized and his name was regularly recorded as Theodoricus. The Gothic original may have been Þiudreiks.

name: THEODORUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Theodoros (see THEODORE).

name: THEODOSIUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Θεοδοσιος(Theodosios) which meant "giving to god", derived from θεος(theos) "god" and δοσις(dosis) "giving". Saint Theodosius of Palestine was a monk who founded a monastery near Bethlehem in the 5th century. This also was the name of emperors of the Eastern Roman and Byzantine Empires.

name: THEODOTUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Θεοδοτος(Theodotos) which meant "given to god" from θεος(theos) "god" and δοτος(dotos) "given". This name belonged to several early saints and martyrs.

name: THEODULUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Θεοδουλος(Theodoulos) which meant "slave of god", derived from θεος(theos) "god" and δουλος(doulos) "slave". This name was borne by several early saints.

name: THEOPHANES
meaning: Means "manifestation of God" from Greek θεος(theos) "god" and φανης(phanes) "appearing". This name was borne by a few saints, including an 8th-century chronicler from Constantinople and a 19th-century Russian Orthodox saint, Theophanes the Recluse, who is Феофан(Feofan) in Russian. Another famous bearer was a 14th-century Byzantine icon painter active in Moscow.

name: THEOPHILUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Θεοφιλος(Theophilos) which meant "friend of god", derived from θεος(theos) "god" and φιλος(philos) "friend". In the New Testament the evangelist Luke addresses his gospel and the Book of Acts to a man named Theophilus.

name: THEOPHYLAKTOS
meaning: Means "watched by god" from Greek θεος(theos) "god" and φυλακτεος(phylakteos) "to be watched". Saint Theophylaktos was a 9th-century bishop of Nicomedia who was banished to Caria.

name: THEOTIMUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Θεοτιμος(Theotimos), derived from the elemenets θεος(theos) "god" and τιμαω(timao) "to honour". Saint Theotimus was a 4th-century bishop of Tomi in Scythia.

name: THERESA
meaning: From the Spanish and Portuguese name Teresa. It was first recorded as Therasia, being borne by the Spanish wife of Saint Paulinus of Nola in the 4th century. The meaning is uncertain, but it could be derived from Greek θερος(theros) "summer", from Greek θεριζω(therizo) "to harvest", or from the name of the Greek island of Therasia (the western island of Santorini)....[more]

name: THERESE
meaning: German and Scandinavian variant of THERESA.

name: THERESIA
meaning: German, Dutch and Swedish form of THERESA.

name: THERON
meaning: Derived from Greek θηραω(therao) meaning "to hunt".

name: THERSA
meaning: Form of TIRZAH used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: THESEUS
meaning: Possibly derived from Greek τιθημι(tithemi) meaning "to set, to place". Theseus was a heroic king of Athens in Greek mythology. He was the son of Aethra, either by Aegeus or by the god Poseidon. According to legend, every seven years the Cretan king Minos demanded that Athens supply Crete with seven boys and seven girls to be devoured by the Minotaur, a half-bull creature that was the son of Minos's wife Pasiphaë. Theseus volunteered to go in place of one of these youths in order to slay the Minotaur in the Labyrinth where it lived. He succeeded with the help of Minos's daughter Ariadne, who provided him with a sword and a roll of string so he could find his way out of the maze.

name: THI
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 詩(thi) meaning "poetry, poem, verse".

name: THIHA
meaning: Means "lion" in Burmese, ultimately from Sanskrit सिंह(sinha).

name: THIRI
meaning: Means "radiance, splendour, beauty" in Burmese, ultimately from Sanskrit श्री(shri).

name: THOMAS
meaning: Greek form of the Aramaic name תָּאוֹמָא(Ta'oma') which meant "twin". In the New Testament this is the name of an apostle. When he heard that Jesus had risen from the dead he initially doubted the story, until Jesus appeared before him and he examined his wounds himself. According to tradition he was martyred in India. Due to his renown, the name came into general use in the Christian world....[more]

name: THOR
meaning: From the Old Norse Þórr meaning "thunder", ultimately from the early Germanic *Þunraz. Thor was the Norse god of strength, thunder, war and storms, the son of Odin. He was armed with a hammer called Mjolnir, and wore an enchanted belt that doubled his strength.

name: THORBURN
meaning: From a Scottish and English surname which was derived from the Norse name Þórbjörn (see TORBJÖRN).

name: THORLEY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "thorn clearing" in Old English.

name: THORNTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "thorn town" in Old English.

name: THOTH
meaning: Greek form of Egyptian Djhwty (reconstructed as Djehuti), which is of uncertain meaning. In Egyptian mythology Thoth was the god of the moon, science, magic, speech and writing. He was often depicted as a man with the head of an ibis.

name: THRACIUS
meaning: From a Roman name which meant "of Thracia". Thracia was a region in southeast Europe, now divided between Greece and Turkey.

name: THUCYDIDES
meaning: From the Greek name Θουκυδιδης(Thoukydides), derived from θεος(theos) "god" (genitive θεου) and κυδος(kydos) "glory" with the patronymic suffix ιδης(ides). This was the name of a 5th-century BC Athenian historian.

name: THULANI
meaning: Means "be quiet, be peaceful" in Zulu.

name: THURAYYA
meaning: Means "the Pleiades" in Arabic. The Pleiades are a group of seven stars in the constellation Taurus.

name: THURSTAN
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Norse name Þórsteinn (see TORSTEN).

name: THUTMOSE
meaning: From Τουθμωσις(Touthmosis), the Greek form of Egyptian Djhwty-ms meaning "born of Thoth", itself composed of the name of the Egyptian god THOTH combined with mesu "be born". Thutmose was the name of four Egyptian pharaohs of the New Kingdom, including Thutmose III who conquered Syria and Nubia.

name: THUẦN
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 純(thuần) meaning "pure, clean, simple".

name: THÉRÈSE
meaning: French form of THERESA. It was borne by the French nun Saint Thérèse de Lisieux (1873-1897), who is regarded as a Doctor of the Church.

name: THÙY
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 垂(thùy) meaning "let down, suspend, hang".

name: THỊ
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 氏(thị) meaning "clan, family, maiden name". This is a very common middle name for Vietnamese girls.

name: TIA
meaning: Short form of names ending with tia. It has been suggested that its use since the 1950s is the result of the brand name for the coffee liqueur Tia Maria. In the brand name, Tia is not a given name; rather, it means "aunt" in Spanish or Portuguese.

name: TIAGO
meaning: Portuguese form of JAMES, derived from SANTIAGO.

name: TIAMAT
meaning: From Akkadian tâmtu meaning "sea". In Babylonian myth Tiamat was the personification of the sea, appearing in the form of a huge dragon. By Apsu she gave birth to the first of the gods. Later, the god Marduk (her great-grandson) defeated her, cut her in half, and used the pieces of her body to make the earth and the sky.

name: TIANA
meaning: Short form of TATIANA or CHRISTIANA.

name: TIARA
meaning: From the English word for a semicircle crown, ultimately of Greek origin.

name: TIARE
meaning: Means "flower" iin Tahitian, also specifically referring to the species Gardenia taitensis.

name: TIBERIUS
meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, meaning "of the Tiber" in Latin. The Tiber is the river that runs through Rome. Tiberius was the second Roman emperor, the stepson of Emperor Augustus.

name: TIBOR
meaning: Hungarian, Czech and Slovak form of Tiburtius (see TIBURCIO).

name: TIBURCIO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of the Roman cognomen Tiburtius which meant "of Tibur". Tibur (now called Tivoli) was a resort town near Rome. Saint Tiburtius was a 3rd-century martyr from Rome.

name: TIEDEMANN
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements theud "people" and man "man".

name: TIERNEY
meaning: Anglicized form of TIGHEARNACH. In part, it is from a surname derived from the given name.

name: TIES
meaning: Diminutive of MATTHIJS as well as Dutch names beginning with the Germanic element theud meaning "people".

name: TIFFANY
meaning: Medieval form of THEOPHANIA. This name was traditionally given to girls born on the Epiphany (January 6), the festival commemorating the visit of the Magi to the infant Jesus. The name died out after the Middle Ages, but it was revived by the movie 'Breakfast at Tiffany's' (1961), the title of which refers to the Tiffany's jewelry store in New York.

name: TIGER
meaning: From the name of the large striped cat, derived (via Old French and Latin) from Greek τιγρις(tigris), ultimately of Iranian origin. A famous bearer is American golfer Tiger Woods (1975-).

name: TIGHEARNACH
meaning: Derived from Irish Gaelic tigern meaning "lord". This was the name of an Irish saint of the 6th century. In his youth he was kidnapped by Welsh pirates and brought to Wales, but he escaped to Scotland. Eventually he returned to Ireland where he was a bishop of Clogher.

name: TIGHEARNÁN
meaning: Means "little lord" from Irish Gaelic tigern "lord" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of a 12th-century king of Breifne in Ireland.

name: TIHANA
meaning: Short form of Slavic names beginning with the element tikhu "quiet".

name: TIHOMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements tikhu "quiet" and miru "peace, world".

name: TIITUS
meaning: Finnish and Estonian form of TITUS.

name: TIJN
meaning: Short form of MARTIJN or AUGUSTIJN.

name: TIL
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of MATHILDE.

name: TILDE
meaning: Short form of MATHILDE or MATILDA.

name: TILL
meaning: From Tielo, a Medieval Low German diminutive of names that began with Diet (for example DIETRICH), originally from Germanic theud meaning "people".

name: TILO
meaning: From Tielo, a Low German diminutive of names that began with Diet (for example DIETRICH), from the Germanic element theud meaning "people". Saint Tillo was a 7th-century man of Saxony who was kidnapped and brought to the Low Countries by raiders. After his release he became a Benedictine monk and did missionary work in France.

name: TIM
meaning: Short form of TIMOTHY. It was borne by the fictional character Tiny Tim, the ill son of Bob Cratchit in Charles Dickens' novel 'A Christmas Carol' (1843).

name: TIMAEUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Τιμαιος(Timaios), derived from τιμαω(timao) "to honour". This is the name of one of Plato's dialogues, featuring Timaeus and Socrates. Timaeus is also the name of a person mentioned briefly in the New Testament (Mark 10:46).

name: TIMO  (1)
meaning: Finnish, German and Dutch short form of Timotheus (see TIMOTHY).

name: TIMO  (2)
meaning: From Thiemo, an old short form of Thietmar (see DIETMAR).

name: TIMON
meaning: Derived from Greek τιμαω(timao) meaning "to honour, to esteem". It appears briefly in the New Testament. This is also the name of the main character in Shakespeare's tragedy 'Timon of Athens' (1607).

name: TIMOTEI
meaning: Bulgarian and Romanian form of TIMOTHY.

name: TIMOTEJ
meaning: Slovene, Macedonian and Slovak form of TIMOTHY.

name: TIMOTEO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of TIMOTHY.

name: TIMOTHY
meaning: English form of the Greek name Τιμοθεος(Timotheos) meaning "honouring God", derived from τιμαω(timao) "to honour" and θεος(theos) "god". Saint Timothy was a companion of Paul on his missionary journeys and was the recipient of two of Paul's epistles that appear in the New Testament. He was of both Jewish and Greek ancestry. According to tradition, he was martyred at Ephesus after protesting the worship of Artemis. As an English name, Timothy was not used until after the Protestant Reformation.

name: TIMUR
meaning: From the Turkic name Temür meaning "iron". Timur, also known as Tamerlane (from Persian تیمور  لنگ(Timur e Lang) meaning "Timur the lame"), was a 14th-century Turkic leader who conquered large areas of Western Asia.

name: TIN
meaning: Croatian short form of MARTIN, AUGUSTIN, and other names ending in tin.

name: TINA
meaning: Short form of CHRISTINA, MARTINA, and other names ending in tina. In addition to these names, it is also used in Dutch as a diminutive of CATHARINA and in Croatian as a diminutive of KATARINA.

name: TINASHE
meaning: Means "we are with God", from Shona ti "we", na "with", and ishe "lord, God".

name: TINATIN
meaning: Possibly related to Georgian სინათლე(sinatle) "light". The name was devised by the Georgian poet Shota Rustaveli for his 12th-century epic poem 'The Knight in the Panther's Skin', in which Tinatin is the ruler of Arabia and the lover of Avtandil.

name: TINE  (2)
meaning: Slovene diminutive of MARTIN or VALENTIN.

name: TINEK
meaning: Slovene diminutive of MARTIN or VALENTIN.

name: TINO
meaning: Short form of VALENTINO, MARTINO, and other names ending in tino.

name: TINUVIEL
meaning: Means "nightingale" in Sindarin. In the 'Silmarillion' (1977) by J. R. R. Tolkien, Tinuviel was the daughter of Thingol the elf king and the beloved of Beren, who with her help retrieved one of the Silmarils from the iron crown of Morgoth.

name: TIONGE
meaning: Means "let us be thankful" in Tumbuka.

name: TIRAS
meaning: Possibly means "desire" in Hebrew. Tiras is a grandson of Noah in the Old Testament.

name: TIRTA
meaning: Means "sacred water, place of pilgrimage" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit तीर्थ(tirtha).

name: TIRZAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name תִּרְצָה(Tirtzah) meaning "favourable". Tirzah is the name of one of the daughters of Zelophehad in the Old Testament. It also occurs in the Old Testament as a place name, the early residence of the kings of the northern kingdom.

name: TISHA
meaning: Short form of LETITIA or LATISHA.

name: TISIPHONE
meaning: Means "avenging murder" in Greek, derived from τισις(tisis) "vengeance" and φονη(phone) "murder". This was the name of one of the Furies or Ερινυες(Erinyes) in Greek mythology. She killed Cithaeron with the bite of one of the snakes on her head.

name: TITANIA
meaning: Perhaps based on Latin Titanius meaning "of the Titans". This name was (first?) used by Shakespeare in his comedy 'A Midsummer Night's Dream' (1595) where it is the name of the queen of the fairies. This is also a moon of Uranus, named after the Shakespearian character.

name: TITO
meaning: Italian, Spanish and Portuguese form of TITUS.

name: TITOS
meaning: Form of TITUS used in the Greek New Testament.

name: TITTY
meaning: Diminutive of LETITIA. This is now a slang word for the female breast, and the name has subsequently dropped out of common use.

name: TITUS
meaning: Roman praenomen, or given name, which is of unknown meaning, possibly related to Latin titulus "title of honour". It is more likely of Oscan origin, since it was borne by the legendary Sabine king Titus Tatius....[more]

name: TIVOLI
meaning: From the name of a picturesque Italian town, used as a summer resort by the ancient Romans.

name: TIWLIP
meaning: Means "tulip" in Welsh. This is a modern Welsh name.

name: TIZIANO
meaning: Italian form of the Roman cognomen Titianus, which was derived from the Roman praenomen TITUS. A famous bearer was the Venetian Renaissance painter Tiziano Vecellio (1488-1576), known in English as Titian.

name: TIÊN
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 仙(tiên) meaning "immortal, transcendent, celestial being, fairy".

name: TLALOC
meaning: Means "of the earth" in Nahuatl. He was the Aztec god of rain and fertility, the husband of Chalchiuhticue.

name: TOBIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name טוֹבִיָּה(Toviyyah) which meant "YAHWEH is good", from the elements טוֹב(tov) meaning "good" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. This was the name of an Ammonite in the Book of Nehemiah in the Old Testament.

name: TOBIAS
meaning: Greek form of TOBIAH. This is the name of the hero of the apocryphal Book of Tobit, which appears in many English versions of the Old Testament.
