It relates how Tobit's son Tobias, with the help of the angel Raphael, is able to drive away a demon who has plagued Sarah, who subsequently becomes his wife. This story was popular in the Middle Ages, and the name came into occasional use in parts of Europe at that time. In England it became common after the Protestant Reformation.

name: TOBIN
meaning: From an English surname which was itself derived from the given name TOBIAS.

name: TOBIT
meaning: From Greek Τωβιθ(Tobith), from the Hebrew name טוֹבִיה(Tovih) meaning "my good". The apocryphal Book of Tobit, which is canonical in many Christian traditions but not in Judaism, tells the story of Tobit's son Tobias. He is sent by his father to collect money in Media, aided by the angel Raphael in the guise of a man. At the end of the story Tobit's blindness is cured.

name: TOBY
meaning: Medieval form of TOBIAS. It was sometimes used as a feminine name in the 1930s and 40s due to the influence of American actress Toby Wing (1915-2001).

name: TODD
meaning: From a surname meaning "fox", derived from Middle English todde.

name: TODOR
meaning: Bulgarian, Serbian and Macedonian form of THEODORE.

name: TODORKA
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian feminine form of THEODORE.

name: TOLLAK
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórleikr, which meant "Thor's play" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with leikr "play, game (involving weapons)".

name: TOM  (1)
meaning: Short form of THOMAS. Tom Sawyer was the main character in several of Mark Twain's novels, first appearing in 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer' (1876). Other famous bearers include American actors Tom Hanks (1956-) and Tom Cruise (1962-).

name: TOM  (2)
meaning: Means "the end, innocence, simplicity" from Hebrew תּוֹם(tom). It can also be a variant transcription of TAM(2).

name: TOMAS
meaning: Swedish, Norwegian and Lithuanian form of THOMAS.

name: TOMI
meaning: Finnish, Hungarian and Welsh diminutive of THOMAS.

name: TOMIKO
meaning: From Japanese 富(tomi) meaning "wealth, abundance" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other combinations of kanji can also form this name.

name: TOMISLAV
meaning: Probably derived from the Slavic element tomiti meaning "torture" combined with slava meaning "glory". This was the name of the first king of Croatia (10th century).

name: TOMMIE
meaning: Diminutive of THOMAS, sometimes used as a feminine form.

name: TOMO
meaning: Either a variant of TOMA(2) or a diminutive of TOMISLAV.

name: TOMOKO
meaning: From Japanese 智(tomo) meaning "wisdom, intellect" or 朋(tomo) meaning "friend" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". This name can be formed of other kanji characters as well.

name: TOMOMI
meaning: From Japanese 智(tomo) meaning "wisdom, intellect" or 朋(tomo) meaning "friend" combined with 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" or 実(mi) meaning "fruit, good result, truth". Other kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: TOMÁS
meaning: Spanish, Portuguese and Irish form of THOMAS.

name: TOMÁŠ
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of THOMAS.

name: TONALLI
meaning: Means "day, warmth of the sun" in Nahuatl.

name: TONI  (1)
meaning: Short form of ANTTONI, ANTUN, and other related names.

name: TONINHO
meaning: Portuguese diminutive of ANTÓNIO or ANTÔNIO.

name: TONKA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian diminutive of ANTONIA.

name: TONYA
meaning: English diminutive of ANTONIA or a Russian diminutive of ANTONINA. In the English-speaking world its use has likely been positively influenced by the name TANYA.

name: TOPAZ
meaning: From the English word for the yellow precious stone, the birthstone of November, ultimately derived from Greek τοπαζος(topazos).

name: TOPSY
meaning: From a nickname which is of unknown meaning, perhaps deriving from the English word top.

name: TOR
meaning: Modern Scandinavian form of Þórr (see THOR). It was not used as a personal name until the 18th century. It is sometimes used as a short form of names of Old Norse origin that begin with the element Tor, which is also from Þórr.

name: TORBJÖRN
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórbjörn, which meant "Thor's bear" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with björn "bear".

name: TORBJØRN
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of TORBJÖRN.

name: TORE  (1)
meaning: Probably from the Old Norse name ÞÓRIR.

name: TORGEIR
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórgeirr, which meant "Thor's spear" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with geirr "spear".

name: TORGNY
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórgnýr meaning "Thor's noise" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with gnýr "noise, grumble, murmur".

name: TORHILD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórhildr, which meant "Thor's battle" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with hildr "battle".

name: TORIBIO
meaning: Spanish form of the Roman cognomen Turibius, of unknown meaning. Saint Toribio was a 16th-century archbishop of Lima.

name: TORKEL
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórketill meaning "Thor's cauldron" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with ketill "cauldron".

name: TORLEIF
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórleifr meaning "Thor's descendant" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with leifr "descendant, heir".

name: TORMOD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórmóðr, which meant "Thor's mind" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with móðr "mind, mood".

name: TORNIKE
meaning: Georgian form of Greek Τορνικιος(Tornikios) or Τορνικης(Tornikes), the name of a prominent Byzantine family that was of Armenian or Georgian descent. The family name may be derived from Armenian թոռնիկ(tornik), a diminutive of թոռն(torn) meaning "grandchild". Usage as a given name probably began in honour of the family, a notable member of which was a saint.

name: TORNY
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórný which was derived from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with ný "new".

name: TORSTEN
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórsteinn, which meant "Thor's stone" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with steinn "stone".

name: TORVALD
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þórvaldr, which meant "Thor's ruler" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with valdr "ruler".

name: TORY  (1)
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly a diminutive of SALVATORE.

name: TOSAHWI
meaning: Means "white knife" in Comanche. This name was borne by a 19th-century Penateka Comanche chief.

name: TOUSSAINT
meaning: Means "all saints" in French. This is the name of a Christian festival celebrated on November 1.

name: TOVE
meaning: Modern form of the Old Norse name Tófa, a short form of ÞÓRFRÍÐR.

name: TOVIA
meaning: Hebrew form of TOBIAH, also used as a feminine form.

name: TOYA
meaning: Diminutive of VICTORIA or CUSTODIA used among Hispanic Americans.

name: TOŠE
meaning: Variant transcription of TOSHE. This is the usual Romanized spelling of the name of the Macedonian pop star Toše Proeski (1981-2007).

name: TRACY
meaning: From an English surname which was taken from a Norman French place name meaning "domain belonging to THRACIUS". Charles Dickens used it for a male character in his novel 'The Pickwick Papers' (1837). It was later popularized as a feminine name by the main character Tracy Lord in the movie 'The Philadelphia Story' (1940). This name is also sometimes used as a diminutive of THERESA.

name: TRAFFORD
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "fishtrap ford" in Old English.

name: TRAHAEARN
meaning: Means "very much like iron", derived from Welsh tra "very, over" and haearn "iron".

name: TRAJAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Traianus, which is of unknown meaning. The Roman emperor Trajan (full name Marcus Ulpius Traianus) is considered among the most capable men to have led the empire. His military accomplishments include victories over Dacia and Parthia.

name: TRANTER
meaning: From a surname meaning "wagoner" in Old English.

name: TRAUGOTT
meaning: Derived from German trau "trust" and Gott "God". This name was created in the 17th century.

name: TRAVIS
meaning: From the English surname Travis (a variant of TRAVERS). It was used in America in honour of William Travis (1809-1836), the commander of the Texan forces at the Battle of the Alamo.

name: TREASA
meaning: Possibly means "strength" in Irish Gaelic. It is also sometimes used as an Irish form of THERESA.

name: TREASURE
meaning: From the English word, ultimately from Greek θησαυρος(thesauros) "treasure, collection".

name: TREES
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of THERESIA.

name: TRENDAFILKA
meaning: Derived from Macedonian трендафил(trendafil) meaning "eglantine, sweet briar".

name: TRENT
meaning: From a surname which originally denoted someone who lived by the River Trent in England. Trent is also a city in Italy, though the etymology is unrelated.

name: TRENTON
meaning: From the name of a New Jersey city established in the 17th century by William Trent. It means "TRENT's town".

name: TREVELYAN
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a Cornish place name meaning "homestead on the hill".

name: TREVOR
meaning: From a surname which was originally from a place name meaning "big village" from Welsh tref "village" and mawr "large".

name: TRI
meaning: Means "three, third" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit त्रि(tri).

name: TRIA
meaning: Perhaps a short form of DEMETRIA and other names ending in a similar sound.

name: TRINH
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 貞(trinh) meaning "virtuous, chaste, loyal".

name: TRINIDAD
meaning: Means "trinity" in Spanish, referring to the Holy Trinity. An island in the West Indies bears this name.

name: TRINITY
meaning: From the English word Trinity, given in honour of the Christian belief that God has one essence, but three distinct expressions of being: Father, Son and Holy Spirit. It has only been in use as a given name since the 20th century.

name: TRISTAN
meaning: Old French form of the Pictish name Drustan, a diminutive of DRUST. The spelling was altered by association with Latin tristis "sad". Tristan is a character in medieval French tales, probably inspired by older Celtic legends, and ultimately merged into Arthurian legend. According to the story Tristan was sent to Ireland in order to fetch Isolde, who was to be the bride of King Mark of Cornwall. On the way back, Tristan and Isolde accidentally drink a potion which makes them fall in love. Their tragic story was very popular in the Middle Ages, and the name has occasionally been used since that time.

name: TRISTEN
meaning: Variant of TRISTAN, sometimes used as a feminine form.

name: TRISTIN
meaning: Variant of TRISTAN, sometimes used as a feminine form.

name: TROND
meaning: From the Old Norse byname Þróndr which indicated a person from Trøndelag, a region in central Norway, possibly derived from þróast meaning "to grow, to prosper".

name: TROY
meaning: From a surname that originally denoted a person from the city of Troyes in France. This was also the name of the ancient city that was besieged by the Greeks in Homer's 'Iliad'.

name: TRUDI
meaning: Diminutive of GERTRUDE and other Germanic names ending with the element thrud "strength".

name: TRUEMAN
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of TRUMAN.

name: TRULS
meaning: Norwegian and Swedish form of ÞÓRGÍSL.

name: TRUMAN
meaning: From a surname which meant "trusty man" in Middle English. A famous bearer of the surname was American president Harry S. Truman (1884-1972). It was also borne by American writer Truman Capote (1924-1984).

name: TRYGGVI
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of TRYGVE.

name: TRYGVE
meaning: Derived from Old Norse tryggr meaning "trustworthy".

name: TRYPHENA
meaning: From the Greek name Τρυφαινα(Tryphaina), derived from Greek τρυφη(tryphe) meaning "softness, delicacy". This name is mentioned briefly in the New Testament.

name: TRYPHON
meaning: Derived from Greek τρυφη(tryphe) meaning "softness, delicacy". Saint Tryphon, a gooseherder from Syria, was martyred in the 3rd century.

name: TRYPHOSA
meaning: Derived from Greek τρυφη(tryphe) meaning "softness, delicacy". In the New Testament this name is mentioned briefly as belonging to a companion of Tryphena.

name: TSHERING
meaning: Means "long life" in Tibetan, from ཚེ(tshe) meaning "life" and རིང(ring) meaning "long".

name: TSISANA
meaning: Probably derived from Georgian ცის(tsis) meaning "of the sky", the genitive case of ცა(tsa) "sky, heaven".

name: TSISIA
meaning: Derived from Georgian ცის(tsis) meaning "of the sky", the genitive case of ცა(tsa) "sky, heaven".

name: TSIURI
meaning: Means "heavenly, celestial" in Georgian, a derivative of ცა(tsa) "sky, heaven".

name: TSUBAKI
meaning: From Japanese 椿(tsubaki) meaning "camellia flower", as well as other combinations of kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: TSUBAME
meaning: From Japanese 燕(tsubame) meaning "swallow (bird)" or other kanji which have the same pronunciation.

name: TSUBASA
meaning: From Japanese 翼(tsubasa) meaning "wing", as well as other kanji or kanji combinations with the same pronunciation.

name: TSUKIKO
meaning: From Japanese 月(tsuki) meaning "moon" and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other combinations of kanji are possible.

name: TSVETAN
meaning: Derived from Bulgarian цвет(tsvet) meaning "flower, blossom".

name: TU
meaning: From Chinese 图(tú) meaning "chart, map" or other characters with similar pronunciations.

name: TUATHAL
meaning: Means "ruler of the people" in Irish Gaelic.

name: TUBA
meaning: From the name of a type of tree that is believed to grow in heaven in Islamic tradition. It means "blessedness" in Arabic.

name: TUCKER
meaning: From an occupational surname derived from Old English tucian meaning "one who fulls cloth".

name: TUDOR  (1)
meaning: From the older Welsh name Tudur, possibly from the hypothetical Celtic name Toutorix meaning "ruler of the people" (cognate with THEODORIC). As a surname it was borne by five monarchs of England beginning with Henry VII in the 15th century.

name: TULLIO
meaning: Italian form of the Roman family name Tullius, which is of unknown meaning. A famous bearer was Marcus Tullius Cicero, a Roman orator and author.

name: TULLY
meaning: Form of Tullius (see TULLIO) used to refer to the Roman orator Marcus Tullius Cicero.

name: TUOR
meaning: Means "strength vigour" in Sindarin. In the 'Silmarillion' (1977) by J. R. R. Tolkien, Tuor was the mortal man who came to the hidden city of Gondolin to warn of its imminent doom. When Gondolin was attacked and destroyed he escaped with his wife Idril and son Eärendil, and sailed into the west.

name: TURIN
meaning: Means "victory mood" in Sindarin. In the 'Silmarillion' (1977) by J. R. R. Tolkien, Turin was a cursed hero, the slayer of the dragon Glaurung. He was also called Turambar, Mormegil, and other names. This is also the Anglicized name of the city of Torino in Italy.

name: TURNUS
meaning: Meaning unknown. According to Virgil's 'Aeneid', Turnus was a king of the Rutuli. He led the Latins in war against the Trojans led by Aeneas. At the end of the book he is killed by Aeneas in a duel.

name: TUTANKHAMON
meaning: Means "image of the life of Amon", derived from Egyptian tut "image" combined with ankh "life" combined with the name of the god Amon. This was the name of an Egyptian pharaoh of the 18th dynasty, most famous because of the treasures found in his tomb.

name: TUULIKKI
meaning: Means "little wind" in Finnish, derived from tuuli "wind". This was the name of a Finnish forest goddess, the daughter of Tapio.

name: TUUR
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of ARTHUR.

name: TUVA
meaning: Swedish and Norwegian variant of TOVE.

name: TUYẾN
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 線(tuyến) meaning "thread, line, ray".

name: TUÂN
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 遵(tuân) meaning "obey, follow, honour".

name: TWILA
meaning: Meaning unknown. Perhaps based on the English word twilight, or maybe from a Cajun pronunciation of French étoile "star". It came into use as an American given name in the late 19th century.

name: TY
meaning: Short form of TYLER, TYSON, TYRONE, and other names beginning with Ty.

name: TYBALT
meaning: Medieval form of THEOBALD. This is the name of a cousin of Juliet killed by Romeo in Shakespeare's drama 'Romeo and Juliet' (1596).

name: TYCHE
meaning: Means "fortune, chance" in Greek. This was the name of the Greek goddess of fortune, luck and fate.

name: TYCHO
meaning: Latinized form of TYGE. This name was borne by the Danish astronomer Tycho Brahe (1546-1601).

name: TYCHON
meaning: From Greek τυγχανω(tynchano) meaning "hit the mark, succeed". This was the name of a minor diety associated with Priapus in Greek mythology. It was also borne by a 5th-century saint from Cyprus.

name: TYE
meaning: From a surname meaning "pasture" in Middle English.

name: TYGE
meaning: Danish form of Tóki, an Old Norse diminutive of names containing the element Þórr, from the name of the Norse god THOR. This was the native name of the Danish astronomer Tycho Brahe (1546-1601).

name: TYLER
meaning: From an English surname meaning "tiler of roofs". The surname was borne by American president John Tyler (1790-1862).

name: TYR
meaning: Norse form of the name of the Germanic god Tiwaz, related to Indo-European dyeus (see ZEUS). In Norse mythology Tyr was the god of war and justice, the son of the god Odin. He carried a spear in his left hand, since his right hand was bitten off by the wolf Fenrir. At the time of the end of the world, the Ragnarok, Tyr will slay and be slain by the giant hound Garm.

name: TYRA
meaning: From the Old Norse name Þýri, a variant of the Norse names ÞÓRVÍ or ÞÓRVEIG.

name: TYRELL
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of TERRELL.

name: TYRESE
meaning: An invented name based on the popular name syllable Tyr (from names such as TYRONE).

name: TYRIQ
meaning: Probably a blend of TYRONE and TARIQ.

name: TYRONE
meaning: From the name of a county in Northern Ireland which is derived from Irish Gaelic Tir Eoghain meaning "land of EOGHAN". This name was popularized by American actor Tyrone Power (1914-1958), who was named after his great-grandfather, an Irish actor.

name: TYRRELL
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of TERRELL.

name: TYSON
meaning: From an English surname which could be derived from a nickname for a quarrelsome person, from Old French tison meaning "firebrand". Alternatively, it could be a variant of DYSON. A famous bearer of the surname was boxer Mike Tyson (1966-).

name: TÁHIRIH
meaning: Variant of TAHIRA. This was the title of Fatimah Baraghani, a 19th-century Persian poet, theologian and reformer.

name: TÉLESPHORE
meaning: French form of the Greek name Τελεσφορος(Telesphoros) which means "bringing fulfillment" or "bearing fruit". Saint Telesphorus was a 2nd-century pope and martyr.

name: TÉO
meaning: Short form of TEODORO and other names that begin with Teo.

name: TÍMEA
meaning: Created by the Hungarian author Mór Jókai for a character in his novel 'The Golden Man' (1873). The name is apparently based on the Greek word ευθυμια(euthymia) meaning "good spirits, cheerfulness".

name: TÓFI
meaning: Short form of ÞÓRFREÐR or ÞÓRFASTR.

name: TÚ
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 秀(tú) meaning "luxuriant, beautiful, elegant, outstanding".

name: TÜNDE
meaning: Derived from Hungarian tündér meaning "fairy". The Hungarian poet Mihály Vörösmarty created this name in the 19th century.

name: U-JIN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 宇(u) meaning "house, eaves, universe" or 佑(u) meaning "help, protect, bless" combined with 眞(jin) meaning "real, genuine" or 鎭(jin) meaning "town, market place". Other combinations of hanja characters can form this name as well.

name: UBIRAJARA
meaning: Means "lord of the spear" in Tupi. This is the name of an 1874 novel by José de Alencar.

name: UILANI
meaning: Means "heavenly beauty" or "royal beauty" from Hawaiian u'i "youth, beauty" and lani "heaven, sky, royal, majesty".

name: UILLEAG
meaning: Either an Irish form of the Old Norse name HUGLEIKR, or else a diminutive of UILLIAM.

name: UKKO
meaning: Means "old man" in Finnish. In Finnish mythology Ukko is the god of the sky and thunder.

name: ULDERICO
meaning: Italian form of HULDERIC, sometimes considered a form of ULRICH.

name: ULF
meaning: From the Old Norse byname Úlfr meaning "wolf".

name: ULLA
meaning: Scandinavian diminutive of ULRIKA or HULDA(1), or a German diminutive of URSULA.

name: ULRIC
meaning: Middle English form of the Old English name Wulfric meaning "wolf power". When it is used in modern times, it is usually as a variant of ULRICH.

name: ULRICH
meaning: From the Germanic name Odalric meaning "prosperity and power", from the element odal "heritage" combined with ric "power". It has long been confused with the Germanic name Hulderic. This was the name of two German saints. Another famous bearer was Ulrich Zwingli (1484-1531), also known as Huldrych, the leader of the Protestant Reformation in Switzerland.

name: ULRIKA
meaning: Swedish feminine form of ULRICH. This was the name of two queens of Sweden.

name: ULRIKKE
meaning: Norwegian and Danish feminine form of ULRICH.

name: ULTÁN
meaning: Means "of Ulster" in Gaelic. Ulster is a region in the north of Ireland. This name was borne by two 7th-century Irish saints.

name: ULVİ
meaning: Means "exalted, high" in Turkish, from Arabic عُلْوِيّ('ulwiy).

name: ULYSSES
meaning: Latin form of ODYSSEUS. It was borne by Ulysses S. Grant (1822-1885), the commander of the Union forces during the American Civil War, who went on to become an American president. Irish author James Joyce used it as the title of his book 'Ulysses' (1920), which loosely parallels Homer's epic the 'Odyssey'.

name: UMA
meaning: Means "flax" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu goddess Parvati. In Hindu texts it is said to derive from the Sanskrit exclamation उ मा(u ma) meaning "O (child), do not (practice austerities)!" which was addressed to Parvati by her mother.

name: UMAR
meaning: Means "populous, flourishing", derived from Arabic عمر('umr) meaning "life". Umar was a companion and strong supporter of Muhammad who became the second caliph of the Muslims. He is considered to be one of the great founders of the Muslim state. The name was also borne by a 12th-century poet from Persia, Umar Khayyam.

name: UMBERTO
meaning: Italian form of HUMBERT. A famous bearer was Italian author Umberto Eco (1932-2016).

name: UME
meaning: From Japanese 梅(ume) meaning "Japanese apricot, plum" (refers specifically to the species Prunus mume). In Japan the ume blossom is regarded as a symbol of spring and a ward against evil. Different kanji or kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: UMEKO
meaning: From Japanese 梅(ume) meaning "apricot, plum" (referring to the species Prunus mume) and 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: UMID
meaning: Means "hope" in Uzbek, ultimately from Persian امید(omid).

name: UMUT
meaning: Variant of ÜMİT. The Turkish words umut and ümit are etymologically related synonyms.

name: UNATHI
meaning: Means "he or she is with us" in Xhosa, from the prefix u- meaning "he, she" and nathi meaning "with us".

name: UNDINE
meaning: Derived from Latin unda meaning "wave". The word undine was created by the medieval author Paracelsus, who used it for female water spirits.

name: UNIQUE
meaning: From the English word unique, ultimately derived from Latin unicus.

name: UNITY
meaning: From the English word unity, which is ultimately derived from Latin unitas.

name: UNNR
meaning: Derived from Old Norse unnr "to wave, to billow" or unna "to love".

name: UPTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "upper town" in Old English. A famous bearer of this name was the American novelist Upton Sinclair (1878-1968).

name: URAL
meaning: From the name of the Ural Mountains, of uncertain meaning, possibly from Turkic aral meaning "island, boundary". This is the name of the title character in the Bashkir epic 'Ural-batyr'.

name: URANUS
meaning: From Greek Ουρανος(Ouranos), the name of the husband of Gaia and the father of the Titans in Greek mythology. His name is derived from ουρανος(ouranos) meaning "the heavens". This is also the name of the seventh planet in the solar system.

name: URBAN
meaning: From the Latin name Urbanus which meant "city dweller". This name is mentioned briefly in one of Paul's epistles in the New Testament. It was subsequently borne by eight popes.

name: URBANO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of Urbanus (see URBAN).

name: URD
meaning: From the Old Norse Urðr meaning "fate". In Norse mythology Urd was one of the three Norns, or goddesses of destiny. She was responsible for the past.

name: URI
meaning: Means "my light" in Hebrew. This was the name of the father of Bezalel in the Old Testament.

name: URIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name אוּרִיָה('Uriyah) which meant "YAHWEH is my light", from the roots אוּר('ur) meaning "light, flame" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. In the Old Testament this is the name of a Hittite warrior in King David's army, the first husband of Bathsheba. David desired Bathsheba so he placed Uriah in the forefront of battle so he would be killed.

name: URIEL
meaning: From the Hebrew name אוּרִיאֵל('Uri'el) which meant "God is my light", from אוּר('ur) meaning "light, flame" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". Uriel is an archangel in Hebrew tradition. He is mentioned only in the Apocrypha, for example in the Book of Enoch where he warns Noah of the coming flood.

name: URIEN
meaning: Means "privileged birth" from Celtic orbo "privileged" and gen "birth". In Welsh legend and Arthurian romances Urien is a king of Gore and the husband of Morgan le Fay.

name: URIJAH
meaning: Form of URIAH used in some English versions of the Old Testament (for a character in the Book of Jeremiah).

name: UROŠ
meaning: Serbian form of an old Hungarian name, possibly from úr meaning "man, lord" combined with a diminutive suffix. This was the name of five Serbian kings.

name: URS
meaning: German form of the Latin name Ursus, which meant "bear". Saint Ursus was a 3rd-century soldier in the Theban Legion who was martyred with Saint Victor. He is the patron saint of Solothurn in Switzerland.

name: URSA
meaning: Feminine form of URSUS. This is the name of two constellations in the northern sky: Ursa Major and Ursa Minor.

name: URSINUS
meaning: Latin name which was a derivative of Ursus (see URS).

name: URSULA
meaning: Means "little bear", derived from a diminutive form of the Latin word ursa "she-bear". Saint Ursula was a legendary virgin princess of the 4th century who was martyred by the Huns while returning from a pilgrimage. In England the saint was popular during the Middle Ages, and the name came into general use at that time.

name: URTĖ
meaning: Possibly a short form of DOROTĖJA.

name: USAGI
meaning: Means "rabbit" in Japanese. This name was used on the Japanese television show 'Sailor Moon', which first aired in the 1990s.

name: USHAS
meaning: Means "dawn" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the Hindu goddess of the dawn, considered the daughter of heaven.

name: UTHER
meaning: From the Welsh name Uthyr, derived from Welsh uthr "terrible". In Arthurian legend Uther was the father of King Arthur. He appears in some early Welsh texts, but is chiefly known from the 12th-century chronicles of Geoffrey of Monmouth.

name: UTHMAN
meaning: Means "baby bustard" in Arabic (a bustard is a type of large bird). Uthman was a companion of Muhammad who married two of his daughters. He was the third caliph of the Muslims.

name: UTTARA
meaning: Means "north" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the masculine form उत्तर (also written Uttar) and the feminine form उत्तरा (also written Uttarā), both of which occur in the Hindu epic the 'Mahabharata' belonging to the son and daughter of King Virata.

name: UTU
meaning: Derived from Sumerian ud meaning "sun". In Sumerian mythology this was the name of the god of the sun. He was the son of the moon god Nanna and Ningal.

name: UXUE
meaning: From the Basque name of the Spanish town of Ujué where there is a church dedicated to the Virgin Mary. Its name is derived from Basque usoa "dove".

name: UZZI
meaning: Means "my power" in Hebrew. This is the name of several minor characters in the Old Testament.

name: UZZIAH
meaning: Means "my power is YAHWEH" in Hebrew, from the roots עֹז('oz) meaning "strength, power" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. This is the name of several Old Testament characters including a king of Judah.

name: UZZIEL
meaning: Means "my power is God" in Hebrew, from the roots עֹז('oz) meaning "strength, power" and אֵל(el) meaning "God". This is the name of several minor characters in the Old Testament.

name: VAAST
meaning: Flemish, Norman and Picard form of VEDASTUS.

name: VADIM
meaning: Meaning unknown. It is used as a Russian form of BADEMUS, but it may actually be derived from the Slavic name VADIMIR or else from an Old Norse source.

name: VADIMIR
meaning: Possibly from the Slavic elements vaditi "accuse" and miru "peace, world".

name: VAHAGN
meaning: From Avestan Verethragna meaning "breaking of defense, victory". In Armenian mythology this was the name of the heroic god of war.

name: VAIHERE
meaning: From Tahitian vai "water" and here "loved, dear".

name: VAIMITI
meaning: From Tahitian vai "water" and miti "sea, salt".

name: VAISHNAVI
meaning: Derived from the name of the Hindu god VISHNU, meaning "belonging to Vishnu". This is the name of one of the seven Matrika goddesses in Hinduism.

name: VAKHTANG
meaning: Derived from Old Persian varka-tanu meaning "wolf-bodied". This name was borne by several kings of Georgia.

name: VAL
meaning: Short form of VALENTINE(1), VALERIE, and other names beginning with Val.

name: VALDA
meaning: Modern coinage from Germanic wald meaning "power, rule". It has been in use only since the 20th century.

name: VALDAS
meaning: Short form of VALDEMARAS and other Lithuanian names containing the Germanic/Baltic element wald "rule".

name: VALDEMAR
meaning: Scandinavian form of WALDEMAR. This was the name of four kings of Denmark.

name: VALDIS
meaning: Short form of VOLDEMĀRS and other Latvian names containing the Germanic/Baltic element wald "rule".

name: VALDÍS
meaning: Derived from Old Norse valr "the dead" and dís "goddess".

name: VALE
meaning: From the English word meaning "wide river valley".

name: VALENCIA
meaning: From the name of cities in Spain and Venezuela, both derived from Latin valentia meaning "strength, vigour".

name: VALENS
meaning: Roman cognomen (see VALENTINE(1)). This name was borne by a 4th-century Roman emperor.

name: VALENTE
meaning: Portuguese and Italian form of VALENTIN.

name: VALENTINA
meaning: Feminine form of Valentinus (see VALENTINE(1)). A famous bearer was the Soviet cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova (1937-), who in 1963 became the first woman to visit space.

name: VALENTINE  (1)
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Valentinus which was itself from the name Valens meaning "strong, vigourous, healthy" in Latin. Saint Valentine was a 3rd-century martyr. His feast day was the same as the Roman fertility festival of Lupercalia, which resulted in the association between Valentine's day and love. As an English name, it has been used occasionally since the 12th century.

name: VALENTINE  (2)
meaning: French feminine form of Valentinus (see VALENTINE(1)).

name: VALENTINIANUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was a derivative of the cognomen Valentinus (see VALENTINE(1)). This name was borne by three Roman emperors.

name: VALENTÍN
meaning: Spanish and Slovak form of Valentinus (see VALENTINE(1)).

name: VALENTÍNA
meaning: Slovak feminine form of Valentinus (see VALENTINE(1)).

name: VALERI
meaning: Bulgarian and Georgian form of VALERIUS, as well as a variant transcription of the Russian name VALERIY.

name: VALERIA
meaning: Feminine form of VALERIUS. This was the name of a 2nd-century Roman saint and martyr.

name: VALERIAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Valerianus, which was itself derived from the Roman name VALERIUS. This was the name of a 3rd-century Roman emperor. Several saints also had this name, including a 2nd-century martyr of Lyons.

name: VALERIE
meaning: English and German form of VALERIA and Czech variant of VALÉRIE.

name: VALERIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of VALERIUS.

name: VALERIUS
meaning: Roman family name which was derived from Latin valere "to be strong". This was the name of several early saints.

name: VALERIYA
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian feminine form of VALERIUS.

name: VALI
meaning: Romanian diminutive of VALERIU or VALENTIN.

name: VALKYRIE
meaning: Means "chooser of the slain", derived from Old Norse valr "the slain" and kyrja "chooser". In Norse myth the Valkyries were maidens who led heroes killed in battle to Valhalla.

name: VALLI
meaning: Means "creeping plant" in Dravidian. In Dravidian mythology the goddess Valli was the wife of Murunga.

name: VALTO
meaning: Finnish short form of VALDEMAR or other names containing vald.

name: VALÉRIA
meaning: Portuguese, Hungarian and Slovak feminine form of VALERIUS.

name: VALÉRIE
meaning: French and Czech form of VALERIA.

name: VALÉRY
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements walha "foreign" and ric "power". It has been frequently confused with the name Valère.

name: VAN
meaning: Short form of names containing van, such as VANCE or IVAN.

name: VANA
meaning: Short form of IVANA or JOVANA.

name: VANCE
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Old English fenn meaning "marsh, fen".

name: VANCHO
meaning: Macedonian variant transcription of VANČO, as well as the Bulgarian form.

name: VANESA
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of VANESSA.

name: VANESSA
meaning: Invented by author Jonathan Swift for his poem 'Cadenus and Vanessa' (1726). He arrived at it by rearranging the initial syllables of the first name and surname of Esther Vanhomrigh, his close friend. Vanessa was later used as the name of a genus of butterfly. It was a rare given name until the mid-20th century, at which point it became fairly popular.

name: VANJA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian (masculine and feminine) form of VANYA. It is also used in Scandinavia, where it is primarily feminine.

name: VANNA  (2)
meaning: Means "golden" in Khmer, ultimately from Sanskrit.

name: VARDAN
meaning: Derived from Armenian վարդ(vard) meaning "rose", ultimately from Persian.

name: VARDO
meaning: Derived from Georgian ვარდი(vardi) meaning "rose", ultimately from Persian via Armenian.

name: VARINIUS
meaning: Roman family name possibly derived from VARIUS.

name: VARIUS
meaning: Roman family name which meant "versatile" in Latin. Varius Rufus was a Roman epic poet of the 1st century BC.

name: VARPU
meaning: From the Finnish name for a type of berry bush.

name: VARUNA
meaning: Probably from a Sanskrit word meaning "to surround". In Hindu mythology Varuna is a god of water and the celestial ocean surrounding the world. He is one of the chief gods in the Hindu text the Rigveda.

name: VARVARA
meaning: Russian, Greek, Bulgarian and Macedonian form of BARBARA.

name: VASANTA
meaning: Means "brilliant" or "spring" in Sanskrit. This is the name of a Hindu personification of the spring.

name: VASCO
meaning: From the medieval Spanish name Velasco which possibly meant "crow" in Basque. A famous bearer was the 15th-century Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama, the first person to sail from Europe around Africa to India.

name: VASHTI
meaning: Possibly means "thread" in Hebrew, but it is most likely of Persian origin. In the Old Testament this is the name of the first wife of King Ahasuerus of Persia before he marries Esther.

name: VASIL
meaning: Bulgarian, Macedonian, Georgian and Albanian form of BASIL(1).

name: VASILIJA
meaning: Serbian and Macedonian feminine form of BASIL(1).

name: VASILIKI
meaning: Modern Greek feminine form of BASIL(1).

name: VASILKA
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian feminine diminutive of BASIL(1).

name: VASKA
meaning: Russian diminutive of VASILIY (masculine) or a Macedonian and Bulgarian diminutive of VASILIJA (feminine).

name: VASO  (1)
meaning: Diminutive of VASILIS, VASIL or VASILIJE.

name: VASU
meaning: Means "bright, excellent" in Sanskrit. This is an epithet of several Hindu gods. It also belonged to one of the authors of the Rigveda.

name: VASUDA
meaning: Means "granting wealth" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the earth.

name: VASUDHA
meaning: Means "producer of wealth" in Sanskrit, used to refer to the earth.

name: VASUNDHARA
meaning: Means "possessor of wealth" in Sanskrit, used to refer to the earth.

name: VAUGHAN
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of VAUGHN.

name: VAUGHN
meaning: From a Welsh surname which was derived from Welsh bychan meaning "little".

name: VAUQUELIN
meaning: Old French form of the Germanic name Walchelin, derived from the element walha meaning "foreign".

name: VAYU
meaning: Means "air, wind" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the Hindu god of the air and wind, one of the five elements.

name: VEASNA
meaning: Means "opportunity, good fortune, fate" in Khmer.

name: VEDASTUS
meaning: Possibly a Latinized form of a Germanic or Celtic name, possibly Germanic WIDOGAST. This was the name of a 6th-century saint who helped to convert the Frankish king Clovis to Christianity.

name: VEDRAN
meaning: Means "clear, cheerful" in Croatian and Serbian.

name: VEER
meaning: Dutch and Limburgish short form of VERA(1).

name: VEETI
meaning: Finnish diminutive of FREDRIK or FERDINAND.

name: VEGA
meaning: The name of a star in the constellation Lyra. Its name is from Arabic الواقع(al-Waqi') meaning "the swooping (eagle)".

name: VEIT
meaning: German form of VITUS or WIDO.

name: VELDA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly a derivative of the Germanic element wald meaning "power, rule".

name: VELIA
meaning: From the Roman family name Velius which possibly means "concealed" in Latin.

name: VELIBOR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements veli "great" and borti "battle".

name: VELIMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements veli "great" and miru "peace, world".

name: VELLAMO
meaning: From Finnish velloa "to surge, to swell". This was the name of a Finnish goddess of the sea, the wife of Ahti.

name: VELMA
meaning: Probably a variant of WILMA, the spelling with an e perhaps due to the influence of SELMA. This name has been in use since the 19th century.

name: VELVEL
meaning: Means "wolf" in Yiddish. This name can also be used as a Yiddish form of WILLIAM.

name: VELVET
meaning: From the English word for the soft fabric. It became used as a given name after the main character in Enid Bagnold's book 'National Velvet' (1935) and the movie (1944) and television (1960) adaptations.

name: VENA
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit वेन(vena) meaning "yearning". This is the name of an evil king in Hindu mythology.

name: VENCEL
meaning: Hungarian form of VÁCLAV, via the Latinized form Venceslaus.

name: VENCESLAO
meaning: Italian form of VÁCLAV, via the Latinized form Venceslaus.

name: VENCESLÁS
meaning: Spanish form of VÁCLAV, via the Latinized form Venceslaus.

name: VENDELÍN
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of WENDELIN.

name: VENERA
meaning: Russian, Bulgarian and Albanian form of VENUS.

name: VENETIA
meaning: Originally this was probably a Latinized form of GWYNEDD or GWYNETH. It also coincides with the name of the city in Italy, called Venice in English. This name was borne by the celebrated beauty Venetia Stanley (1600-1633). Benjamin Disraeli used it in his novel entitled 'Venetia' (1837).

name: VENIAMIN
meaning: Russian and Greek form of BENJAMIN.

name: VENKATA
meaning: From the name of a sacred hill in southern India.

name: VENTSESLAV
meaning: Bulgarian form of VÁCLAV, via the Latinized form Venceslaus.

name: VENUS
meaning: Means "love, sexual desire" in Latin. This was the name of the Roman goddess of love and sex. Her character was assimilated with that of the Greek goddess Aphrodite. As the mother of Aeneas she was considered an ancestor of the Roman people. The second planet from the sun is named after her.

name: VEPKHIA
meaning: Derived from Old Georgian ვეფხი(vepkhi) meaning "tiger".

name: VERA  (1)
meaning: Means "faith" in Russian, though it is sometimes associated with the Latin word verus "true". It has been in general use in the English-speaking world since the late 19th century.

name: VERCINGETORIX
meaning: Means "king over warriors" from Gaulish ver "on, over" combined with cingeto "marching men, warriors" and rix "king". This name was borne by a chieftain of the Gaulish tribe the Arverni. He led the resistance against Julius Caesar's attempts to conquer Gaul, but he was eventually defeated, brought to Rome, and executed.

name: VERDANDI
meaning: From Old Norse Verðandi meaning "becoming, happening". Verdandi was one of the three Norns, or goddesses of destiny, in Norse mythology. She was responsible for the present.

name: VERE
meaning: From a Norman surname which was from a French place name, which was itself derived from a Gaulish word meaning "alder".

name: VEREMUND
meaning: Latinized form of a Germanic name, probably Waramunt, derived from war "vigilant, cautious" and mund "protection". This was the name of a 5th-century king of Galicia (from the Germanic tribe of the Suebi). It was later the name of kings of Asturias and León, though their names are usually spelled in the Spanish form Bermudo.

name: VERENA
meaning: Possibly related to Latin verus "true". This might also be a Coptic form of the Ptolemaic name BERENICE. Saint Verena was a 3rd-century Egyptian-born nurse who went with the Theban Legion to Switzerland. After the legion was massacred she settled near Zurich.

name: VERICA
meaning: Serbian and Croatian diminutive of VERA(1).

name: VERITY
meaning: From the English word meaning "verity, truth". This was one of the virtue names adopted by the Puritans in the 17th century.

name: VERNA
meaning: Feminine form of VERNON, sometimes associated with the Latin word vernus "spring". It has been in use since the 19th century.

name: VERNON
meaning: From a Norman surname which was from a French place name, ultimately derived from the Gaulish word vern meaning "alder".

name: VERONA
meaning: From the name of the city in Italy, which is itself of unknown meaning.

name: VERONICA
meaning: Latin alteration of BERENICE, the spelling influenced by the ecclesiastical Latin phrase vera icon meaning "true image". This was the name of a legendary saint who wiped Jesus' face with a towel and then found his image imprinted upon it. Due to popular stories about her, the name was occasionally used in the Christian world in the Middle Ages. It was borne by the 17th-century Italian saint and mystic Veronica Giuliani. As an English name, it was not common until the 19th century, when it was imported from France and Scotland.

name: VERÍSSIMO
meaning: From the Latin name Verissimus which meant "very true". Saint Verissimus was a Portuguese martyr executed during the persecutions of the Roman emperor Diocletian in the early 4th century.

name: VESELA
meaning: Derived from South Slavic vesel meaning "cheerful".

name: VESELIN
meaning: Derived from South Slavic vesel meaning "cheerful".

name: VESELKO
meaning: Derived from South Slavic vesel meaning "cheerful".

name: VESLEMØY
meaning: Means "little girl" from Norwegian vesle "little" and møy "girl". This name was created by Norwegian writer Arne Garborg for the main character in his poem 'Haugtussa' (1895).

name: VESNA
meaning: Means "messenger" in Slavic. This was the name of a Slavic spirit associated with the springtime. In many Slavic languages this is now the poetic word for "spring". It has been used as a given name only since the 20th century.

name: VESPASIAN
meaning: From the Roman cognomen Vespasianus, derived either from Latin vesper meaning "west" or "evening" or vespa meaning "wasp". This was the name of a 1st-century Roman emperor, Titus Flavius Vespasianus, the founder of the Flavian dynasty.

name: VESTA
meaning: Probably a Roman cognate of HESTIA. Vesta was the Roman goddess of the hearth. A continuous fire, tended by the Vestal Virgins, was burned in the Temple of Vesta in Rome.

name: VIANNE
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps a combination of VI and ANNE(1) or a short form of VIVIANNE.

name: VIATOR
meaning: Late Latin name (see BEATRIX). This was the name of a 4th-century Italian saint.

name: VIBEKE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of WIEBKE.

name: VIBIANUS
meaning: Roman cognomen which was a derivative of VIBIUS.

name: VIBIUS
meaning: Roman family name of unknown meaning, probably of Etruscan origin.

name: VIC
meaning: Short form of VICTOR or VICTORIA.

name: VICENTE
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of VINCENT.

name: VICTOR
meaning: Roman name meaning "victor, conqueror" in Latin. It was common among early Christians, and was borne by several early saints and three popes. It was rare as an English name during the Middle Ages, but it was revived in the 19th century. A famous bearer was the French writer Victor Hugo (1802-1885), who authored 'The Hunchback of Notre Dame' and 'Les Misérables'.

name: VICTORIA
meaning: Means "victory" in Latin, being borne by the Roman goddess of victory. It is also a feminine form of VICTORIUS. This name was borne by a 4th-century saint and martyr from North Africa....[more]

name: VICTORINO
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of VICTORINUS.

name: VICTORINUS
meaning: Roman name which was derived from VICTOR. This was the name of a ruler of the Gallic Empire in the 3rd century. It was also borne by the 4th-century Roman grammarian and philosopher Victorinus Afer as well as a few early saints.

name: VICTORIUS
meaning: Roman name which was derived from VICTOR. This was the name of two early saints.

name: VID
meaning: Slovene, Croatian and Hungarian form of WIDO or VITUS. Saint Vitus, known in Slavic languages as Sveti Vid (or similar), has been conflated with the Slavic god Svetovid.

name: VIDA  (1)
meaning: Hungarian form of WIDO or VITUS.

name: VIDA  (2)
meaning: Slovene feminine form of WIDO or VITUS.

name: VIDAR
meaning: From the Old Norse Víðarr, which is possibly derived from víðr "wide" and arr "warrior". In Norse mythology Víðarr was the son of Odin and Grid. At the time of the end of the world, the Ragnarok, he will avenge his father's death.

name: VIDYA
meaning: Means "knowledge, science, learning" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu goddess Saraswati.

name: VIENNE
meaning: From the French name of the capital city of Austria, known in English as Vienna.

name: VIGGO
meaning: Short form of names containing the Old Norse element víg "war".

name: VIJAYA
meaning: Means "victory" in Sanskrit. This is a transcription of both the masculine form विजय and the feminine form विजया, both of which are used frequently in Hindu texts. It is the name of a grandson of Indra, a son of Krishna and it is another name of the goddess Durga. This was also the name of a semi-legendary 6th-century BC king of Sri Lanka.

name: VIKING
meaning: From the Old Norse name Víkingr meaning "viking, raider", ultimately from vík "bay, inlet".

name: VIKRAMA
meaning: Means "stride, pace" or "valour" in Sanskrit. This is another name of the Hindu god Vishnu. This was also the name of a semi-legendary 1st-century BC king (full name Vikramaditya) of Ujjain in India.

name: VIKTORIA
meaning: German and Scandinavian variant of VICTORIA. It is also a variant transcription of VIKTORIYA.

name: VIKTORIYA
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian and Bulgarian form of VICTORIA.

name: VIKTÓRIA
meaning: Hungarian and Slovak form of VICTORIA.

name: VILEN
meaning: Abbreviation of Vladimir Ilyich Lenin, the name of the founder of the former Soviet state.

name: VILHELM
meaning: Scandinavian and Finnish form of WILLIAM.

name: VILHELMINA
meaning: Swedish and Lithuanian feminine form of WILLIAM.

name: VILI
meaning: Diminutive of VILMOS, VILJEM or VILHELM.

name: VILKO
meaning: Slovene and Croatian diminutive of WILLIAM.

name: VILLE
meaning: Finnish and Swedish diminutive of WILLIAM.

name: VILTAUTAS
meaning: From the Baltic elements vil- "hope" and tauta "people, nation".

name: VINAL
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "vine hall" in Middle English.

name: VINCE
meaning: English short form and Hungarian normal form of VINCENT.

name: VINCENC
meaning: Czech and Slovene form of VINCENT.

name: VINCENT
meaning: From the Roman name Vincentius, which was from Latin vincere "to conquer". This name was popular among early Christians, and it was borne by many saints. As an English name, Vincent has been in use since the Middle Ages, though it did not become common until the 19th century. Famous bearers include the French priest Saint Vincent de Paul (1581-1660) and the post-impressionist painter Vincent van Gogh (1853-1890).

name: VINICIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of the Roman family name Vinicius, which was possibly derived from Latin vinum "wine".

name: VINKO
meaning: Croatian and Slovene form of VINCENT.

name: VIOLA
meaning: Means "violet" in Latin. This was the name of the heroine in Shakespeare's play 'Twelfth Night' (1602).

name: VIOLET
meaning: From the English word violet for the purple flower, ultimately derived from Latin viola. It was common in Scotland from the 16th century, and it came into general use as an English given name during the 19th century.

name: VIOLETTA
meaning: Italian, Russian and Hungarian form of VIOLET.

name: VIONA
meaning: Possibly a variant of FIONA influenced by VIOLA.

name: VIOREL
meaning: Derived from viorea, the Romanian word for the alpine squill flower (species Scilla bifolia) or the sweet violet flower (species Viola odorata). It is derived from Latin viola "violet".

name: VIRAJA
meaning: Means "ruling, sovereign" in Sanskrit. This is the name of an offspring of Brahma in Hindu belief.

name: VIRGIL
meaning: From the Roman family name Vergilius which is of unknown meaning. This name was borne by the 1st-century BC Roman poet Publius Vergilius Maro, commonly called Virgil, who was the writer of the 'Aeneid'. Due to him, Virgil has been in use as a given name in the English-speaking world since the 19th century.

name: VIRGILIO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of VIRGIL.

name: VIRGILIUS
meaning: Medieval Latin form of VERGILIUS, altered by association with Latin virgo "maiden" or virga "wand".

name: VIRGINIA
meaning: Feminine form of the Roman family name Verginius or Virginius which is of unknown meaning, but long associated with Latin virgo "maid, virgin". According to a legend, it was the name of a Roman woman killed by her father so as to save her from the clutches of a crooked official....[more]

name: VIRIATO
meaning: From the Latin name Viriathus or Viriatus, which was derived from viriae "bracelets" (of Celtic origin). Viriathus was a leader of the Lusitani (a tribe of Portugal) who rebelled against Roman rule in the 2nd century BC.

name: VIRVA
meaning: Possibly derived from Finnish virvatuli meaning "will o' the wisp". In folklore, will o' the wisp is a floating ball of light that appears over water.

name: VISHNU
meaning: Probably means "all-pervasive" in Sanskrit. The Hindu god Vishnu is the protector and preserver of the universe, usually depicted as four-armed and blue-skinned. By some Hindus he is regarded as the supreme god.

name: VISITACIÓN
meaning: Means "visitation" in Spanish. This name is given in reference to the visit of the Virgin Mary to her cousin Elizabeth.

name: VISSARION
meaning: Russian form and modern Greek transcription of BESSARION.

name: VISVALDIS
meaning: Latvian name derived from the Baltic elements vis "all" and vald "rule". It is thus a cognate of the Slavic VSEVOLOD.

name: VITALE
meaning: Italian form of the Late Latin name Vitalis, which was derived from Latin vitalis "of life, vital". Vitalis was the name of several early saints and martyrs.

name: VITALIJA
meaning: Lithuanian feminine form of Vitalis (see VITALE).

name: VITALIY
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of Vitalis (see VITALE).

name: VITALIYA
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian feminine form of Vitalis (see VITALE).

name: VITO
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of VITUS.

name: VITOMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements vit "master, lord" and miru "peace, world".

name: VITUS
meaning: Roman name which was derived from Latin vita "life". Saint Vitus was a child martyred in Sicily in the early 4th century. From an early date this name was confused with the Germanic name Wido.

name: VIVI
meaning: Scandinavian diminutive of names beginning with Vi, as well as OLIVIA and SOFIA.

name: VIVIAN
meaning: From the Latin name Vivianus which was derived from Latin vivus "alive". Saint Vivian was a French bishop who provided protection during the Visigoth invasion of the 5th century. It has been occasionally used as an English (masculine) name since the Middle Ages. In modern times it is also used as a feminine name, in which case it is either an Anglicized form of BÉBINN or a variant of VIVIEN(2).

name: VIVIANA
meaning: Feminine form of Vivianus (see VIVIAN). Saint Viviana (also known as Bibiana) was a Roman saint and martyr of the 4th century.

name: VIVIANE
meaning: French form of VIVIANA. It is also the French form of VIVIEN(2).

name: VIVIEN  (2)
meaning: Used by Alfred Lord Tennyson as the name of the Lady of the Lake in his Arthurian epic 'Idylls of the King' (1859). Tennyson may have based it on VIVIENNE, but it possibly arose as a misreading of NINIAN. A famous bearer was British actress Vivien Leigh (1913-1967), who played Scarlett O'Hara in 'Gone with the Wind'.

name: VIVIETTE
meaning: Diminutive of VIVIENNE. William John Locke used this name for the title character in his novel 'Viviette' (1910).

name: VIŠNJA
meaning: Means "sour cherry" in Croatian and Serbian.

name: VJEKOSLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements vyeku "age" and slava "glory".

name: VJERA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian cognate of VERA(1).

name: VLAD
meaning: Old short form of VLADISLAV and other Slavic names beginning with the element vladeti meaning "rule". Vlad Dracula, a 15th-century prince of Wallachia, was Bram Stoker's inspiration for the name of his vampire, Count Dracula.

name: VLADAN
meaning: Short form of Slavic names beginning with the element vladeti meaning "rule".

name: VLADILEN
meaning: Contraction of Vladimir Ilyich Lenin, the name of the founder of the former Soviet state.

name: VLADIMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element vladeti "rule" combined with meru "great, famous". The second element has also been associated with miru meaning "peace, world". This was the name of an 11th-century grand prince of Kiev who is venerated as a saint because of his efforts to Christianize his realm (Kievan Rus). It was also borne by the founder of the former Soviet state, Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924).

name: VLADIMÍR
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of VLADIMIR.

name: VLADIMÍRA
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of VLADIMIRA.

name: VLADISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements vladeti "rule" and slava "glory".

name: VLADLEN
meaning: Contraction of Vladimir Lenin, the name of the founder of the former Soviet state.

name: VLADO
meaning: Short form of VLADIMIR and other Slavic names beginning with the element vladeti meaning "rule".

name: VLASTA
meaning: Short form of names beginning with the Slavic element vlasti "rule, sovereignty" (the descendant word vlast means "homeland" in modern Czech).

name: VLASTIMIL
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements vlasti "rule, sovereignty" and milu "gracious, dear". In modern Czech vlast means "homeland" (a descendant word of vlasti).

name: VLASTIMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements vlasti meaning "rule, sovereignty" and miru meaning "peace, world".

name: VLASTISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements vlasti "rule, sovereignty" and slava "glory". In modern Czech vlast means "homeland" (a descendant word of vlasti).

name: VOLKER
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element fulc "people" combined with hari "army".

name: VOLODIMERU
meaning: Old East Slavic form of VLADIMIR.

name: VOLODISLAVU
meaning: Old East Slavic form of VLADISLAV.

name: VOLOS
meaning: Derived from Slavic volu meaning "ox". Volos was the Slavic god of cattle, also associated with the earth, wealth, the underworld, and poetry.

name: VONDA
meaning: Variant of WANDA, reflecting the Polish pronunciation.

name: VRAGI
meaning: Old Norse byname possibly meaning "mooring post".

name: VRATISLAV
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements vratiti "to return" and slava "glory". This was the name of two dukes of Bohemia. The city of Wrocław in Poland is named after the first.

name: VSEVOLOD
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements visi "all" and vladeti "rule". This was the name of an 11th-century grand prince of Kiev.

name: VUKAŠIN
meaning: Derived from Serbian vuk "wolf". This was the name of a 14th-century Serbian ruler.

name: VULCAN
meaning: From the Latin Vulcanus, possibly related to fulgere "to flash", but more likely of pre-Latin origin. In Roman mythology Vulcan was the god of fire. He was later equated with the Greek god Hephaestus.

name: VURAL
meaning: Possibly from Turkish vur meaning "strike, hit".

name: VYACHESLAV
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of VÁCLAV.

name: VYTAUTAS
meaning: From the Baltic elements vyti- "chase, drive away" or vyd- "see" combined with tauta "people, nation". This was the name of a 15th-century Grand Duke of Lithuania, revered as a national hero in that country.

name: VÁCLAV
meaning: Contracted form of the older name Veceslav, from the Slavic elements veche "more" and slava "glory". Saint Václav (known as Wenceslas in English) was a 10th-century duke of Bohemia murdered by his brother. He is the patron saint of the Czech Republic. This was also the name of several Bohemian kings.

name: VÄINÄMÖINEN
meaning: Derived from Finnish väinä "wide and slow-flowing river". In Finnish mythology Väinämöinen was a wise old magician, the son of the primal goddess Ilmatar. He is the hero of the Finnish epic the 'Kalevala'.

name: VÍCTOR
meaning: Spanish and Catalan form of VICTOR.

name: VÍGDÍS
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements víg "war" and dís "goddess".

name: VÍT
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of VITUS or WIDO.

name: VÍTOR
meaning: Portuguese and Galician form of VICTOR.

name: VĂN
meaning: From Sino-Vietnamese 文(văn) meaning "literature, culture, writing". This is a common middle name for Vietnamese boys.

name: VĚNCESLAV
meaning: Czech variant of VÁCLAV, via the Latinized form Venceslaus.

name: WADE
meaning: From an English surname, either WADE(1) or WADE(2).

name: WADUD
meaning: Means "lover, affectionate" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الودود(al-Wadud) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: WAFI
meaning: Means "trustworthy, reliable, loyal, perfect" in Arabic.

name: WAFULA
meaning: Means "born during the rainy season", from Luhya ifula meaning "rainy season".

name: WAHID
meaning: Means "peerless, unique" in Arabic. In Islamic tradition الوحيد(al-Wahid) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: WAHUNSENACAWH
meaning: Meaning unknown. This name was borne by a 17th-century chief of the Powhatan people. He was also known as Powhatan, as a result of confusion between his name and his birthplace.

name: WAIRIMU
meaning: From Kikuyu irimu meaning "ogre, giant". In the Kikuyu origin legend Wairimu is of one of the nine daughters of Mumbi.

name: WAKANA
meaning: From Japanese 和(wa) meaning "harmony" and 奏(kana) meaning "play music, complete", as well as other combinations of kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: WALAHFRID
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements walha "stranger" and frid "peace".

name: WALBURGA
meaning: Means "ruler of the fortress" from the Germanic elements wald "power, leader, ruler" and burg "fortress". This was the name of an 8th-century saint from England who did missionary work in Germany.

name: WALDEMAR
meaning: Germanic derivative of the Slavic name VLADIMIR (or perhaps a cognate composed of the Germanic elements wald "rule" and mari "famous"). It was introduced into Scandinavia by the 12th-century Danish king Waldemar (or Valdemar) who was named after a royal ancestor of his Ukrainian mother.

name: WALDO
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names containing the element wald meaning "rule". In the Middle Ages this name became the basis for a surname. Its present use in the English-speaking world is usually in honour of Ralph Waldo Emerson (1803-1882), an American poet and author who wrote on transcendentalism. He was (probably) named after the 12th-century Christian radical Peter Waldo, who was from Lyons in France. Though Waldo and his followers, called the Waldensians, were declared heretics at the time, they were later admired by Protestants.

name: WALID
meaning: Means "newborn", derived from Arabic ولد(walada) meaning "to give birth". This was the name of the Umayyad caliph who conquered Spain in the 8th century.

name: WALKER
meaning: From an English surname which referred to the medieval occupational of a walker, also known as a fuller. Walkers would tread on wet, unprocessed wool in order to clean and thicken it. The word ultimately derives from Old English wealcan "to walk".

name: WALLACE
meaning: From a Scottish and English surname which originally meant "Welsh" or "foreigner" in Norman French. It was first used as given name in honour of Sir William Wallace, a Scottish hero who led the fight against English invasion in the 13th century.

name: WALLIS
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of WALLACE. Wallis Simpson (1895-1986) was the divorced woman whom Edward VIII married, which forced him to abdicate the British throne.

name: WALTER
meaning: From a Germanic name meaning "ruler of the army", composed of the elements wald "rule" and hari "army". The Normans brought it to England, where it replaced the Old English cognate Wealdhere. A famous bearer of the name was Sir Walter Scott (1771-1832), a Scottish novelist who wrote 'Ivanhoe' and other notable works.

name: WALTHER
meaning: German variant of WALTER. This name was borne by the 13th-century German poet Walther von der Vogelweide.

name: WALTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from various Old English place names meaning "stream town", "wood town", or "wall town".

name: WALTRAUD
meaning: From the Germanic element wald "power, ruler" or walha "foreign" combined with thrud "strength".

name: WAMALWA
meaning: Means "born during the brewing season" in Luhya.

name: WAMBUI
meaning: Means "zebra" in Kikuyu. This is one of Mumbi's nine daughters in the Kikuyu origin legend.

name: WANDA
meaning: Possibly from a Germanic name meaning "a Wend", referring to the Slavic people who inhabited eastern Germany. In Polish legends this was the name of the daughter of King Krak, the legendary founder of Krakow. It was introduced to the English-speaking world by the author Ouida, who used it for the heroine in her novel 'Wanda' (1883).

name: WANGARI
meaning: From Kikuyu ngarĩ meaning "leopard". In the Kikuyu origin legend this is the name of one of the nine daughters of Mumbi.

name: WANGCHUK
meaning: Means "mighty" in Tibetan, from དབང(dbang) meaning "power" and ཕྱུག(phyug) meaning "wealthy, possessing". This is the Tibetan name for the god Shiva.

name: WANGUI
meaning: From Kikuyu ngũi meaning "song leader". This is one of Mumbi's nine daughters in the Kikuyu origin legend.

name: WANJALA
meaning: Means "born during famine", from Luhya injala meaning "hunger, famine".

name: WANJIKU
meaning: Meaning unknown. This is one of Mumbi's nine daughters in the Kikuyu origin legend.

name: WANJIRU
meaning: Possibly from Kikuyu njĩra meaning "way, path". In the Kikuyu origin legend this is the name of one of the nine daughters of Mumbi.

name: WANYONYI
meaning: Means "born during the weeding season", from Luhya enyonyi meaning "weeds".

name: WAPASHA
meaning: Means "red leaf" in Dakota. This was the name of several Dakota chiefs.

name: WARCISŁAW
meaning: Polish form of VRATISLAV. This was the name of several dukes of Pomerania.

name: WARD
meaning: From an occupational surname for a watchman, derived from Old English weard "guard".

name: WARDELL
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "watch hill" in Old English.

name: WARIN
meaning: Germanic name derived from the element warin meaning "guard, protect".

name: WARNER
meaning: From a Norman surname which was derived from the given name WERNER.

name: WARREN
meaning: From an English surname which was derived either from Norman French warrene meaning "animal enclosure", or else from the town of La Varenne in Normandy. This name was borne by the American president Warren G. Harding (1865-1923).

name: WARRICK
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of WARWICK.

name: WARWICK
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the name of a town in England, itself from Old English wer "weir, dam" and wíc "settlement".

name: WASHINGTON
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from the name of an English town, itself meaning "settlement belonging to WASSA's people". The given name is usually given in honour of George Washington (1732-1799), commander of the Continental Army during the American Revolution and the first president of the United States.

name: WASSA
meaning: Meaning uncertain. It may be a short form of a longer name such as Wāðsige, composed of the elements wāð "hunt" and sige "victory".

name: WATE
meaning: Possibly a Frisian short form of WALTER.

name: WATI
meaning: From a suffix meaning "woman" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit.

name: WAWATAM
meaning: Means "little goose" in Ojibwe. This was the name of an 18th-century chief of the Ottawa people.

name: WAYAN
meaning: From Balinese wayah meaning "old, mature", ultimately from Sanskrit वयस्(vayas) meaning "energy, strength, age". This name is traditionally given to the first-born child.

name: WAYLAND
meaning: From Weland, the Old English cognate of WIELAND.

name: WAYLON
meaning: Variant of WAYLAND. This name was popularized by country music singer Waylon Jennings (1937-2002), who was originally named Wayland.

name: WAYNE
meaning: From an occupational surname meaning "wagon maker", derived from Old English wægn "wagon". Use of it as a given name can be partly attributed to the popularity of the actor John Wayne (1907-1979). Another famous bearer is Canadian hockey player Wayne Gretzky (1961-), generally considered the greatest player in the history of the sport.

name: WAZO
meaning: Originally a short form of Germanic names beginning with the element wad meaning "to go" or warin meaning "guard, protect".

name: WEALDMÆR
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements weald "power, leader, ruler" and mær "famous".

name: WEALHMÆR
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements wealh "foreigner, Celt" and mær "famous".

name: WEBSTER
meaning: From an occupational surname meaning "weaver", derived from Old English webba.

name: WEI
meaning: From Chinese 威(wēi) meaning "power, pomp", 巍(wēi) meaning "high, lofty, towering" or 伟(wěi) meaning "great, robust, extraordinary". As a feminine name it can come from 微(wēi) meaning "small" or 薇(wēi) meaning "fern". This name can be formed by other Chinese characters besides those shown here.

name: WELDON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "hill near a spring" in Old English.

name: WEMBA
meaning: Byname derived from Old English wamb meaning "belly".

name: WEN
meaning: From Chinese 文(wén) meaning "literature, culture, writing", as well as other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: WENDEL
meaning: Old short form of Germanic names beginning with the element Wandal meaning "a Vandal". The Vandals were a Germanic tribe who invaded Spain and North Africa in the 5th century. The tribal name was later applied to other groups such as the Wends, a Slavic people living between the Elbe and the Oder.

name: WENDELIN
meaning: Old diminutive of Germanic names beginning with the element Wandal (see WENDEL). Saint Wendelin was a 6th-century hermit of Trier in Germany.

name: WENDELL
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the given name WENDEL.

name: WENDY
meaning: In the case of the character from J. M. Barrie's play 'Peter Pan' (1904), it was created from the nickname fwendy "friend", given to the author by a young friend. However, the name was used prior to the play (rarely), in which case it could be related to the Welsh name GWENDOLEN and other names beginning with the element gwen meaning "white, fair, blessed". The name only became common after Barrie's play ran.

name: WENONAH
meaning: Variant of WINONA. This spelling of the name was used by the American poet Henry Wadsworth Longfellow for the mother of Hiawatha in his epic poem 'The Song of Hiawatha' (1855).

name: WENZEL
meaning: Medieval German form of VÁCLAV, via the Latinized form Venceslaus.

name: WENZESLAUS
meaning: German form of VÁCLAV, via the Latinized form Venceslaus.

name: WERA
meaning: Polish form of VERA(1) or a short form of WERONIKA.

name: WERNER
meaning: From a Germanic name derived from warin "guard" combined with hari "army".

name: WERONIKA
meaning: Polish and Sorbian form of VERONICA.

name: WERTHER
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements wert "worthy" and hari "army". Goethe used this name in his novel 'The Sorrows of Young Werther' (1774).

name: WESLEY
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "west meadow" in Old English. It has been sometimes given in honour of John Wesley (1703-1791), the founder of Methodism.

name: WESTLEY
meaning: From a surname which was a variant of WESLEY.

name: WESTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "west town" in Old English.

name: WHITAKER
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "white field" in Old English.

name: WHITNEY
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "white island" in Old English. Its popular use as a feminine name was initiated by actress Whitney Blake (1925-2002) in the 1960s, and further boosted in the 1980s by singer Whitney Houston (1963-2012).

name: WICKANINNISH
meaning: Possibly means "having no one in front of him in the canoe" in the Nuu-chah-nulth (or Nootka) language. This was the name of a chief of the Clayoquot in the late 18th century, at the time of European contact.

name: WIDALD
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements witu "wood" and wald "power, rule".

name: WIDO
meaning: Originally a short form of names beginning with the Germanic element witu "wood" or wit "wide". From early times this name has been confused with the Latin name Vitus.

name: WIDOGAST
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements witu "wood" and gast "stranger, guest".

name: WIDUKIND
meaning: Germanic name composed of the elements witu "wood" and chind "child". This was the name of an 8th-century Saxon leader who fought against the Franks.

name: WIEBE
meaning: Medieval short form of Germanic names containing the element wig meaning "war".

name: WIELAND
meaning: Meaning uncertain, perhaps a derivative of Germanic wela meaning "skilled, artful". In Germanic mythology Wieland (called Völundr in Old Norse) was an unequaled smith and craftsman.

name: WIELISŁAW
meaning: From an old Slavic name which meant "great glory".

name: WIGAND
meaning: Germanic name derived from the element wig meaning "war".

name: WIGBERHT
meaning: Old English form of WYBERT. This is also a continental Germanic cognate.

name: WIGBRAND
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements wig "war" and brand "sword".

name: WIGBURG
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements wig "war" and burg "fortress".

name: WIL
meaning: Short form of WILLIAM and other names beginning with Wil.

name: WILBERT
meaning: Means "bright will", derived from the Germanic elements wil "will, desire" and beraht "bright".

name: WILBUR
meaning: From an English surname which was originally derived from the nickname Wildbor meaning "wild boar" in Middle English. This name was borne by Wilbur Wright (1867-1912), one half of the Wright brothers, who together invented the first successful airplane. Wright was named after the Methodist minister Wilbur Fisk (1792-1839).

name: WILBURG
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements wil "will, desire" and burg "fortress".

name: WILBURN
meaning: From a surname which was probably originally derived from an unknown place name. The second element corresponds with Old English burne "stream".

name: WILDA
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps from a German surname, or perhaps from the English word wild. It has been in use since the 19th century.

name: WILEY
meaning: From a surname which was derived either from a place name meaning "temple clearing" in Old English or from a nickname meaning "wily, tricky" in Middle English.

name: WILFORD
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "willow ford" in Old English.

name: WILFRED
meaning: Means "desiring peace" from Old English wil "will, desire" and friþ "peace". Saint Wilfrid was a 7th-century Anglo-Saxon bishop. The name was rarely used after the Norman conquest, but it was revived in the 19th century.

name: WILHELM
meaning: German cognate of WILLIAM. This was the name of two German emperors. It was also the middle name of several philosophers from Germany: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche (1844-1900), and Gottfried Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), who was also a notable mathematician.

name: WILHELMINA
meaning: Dutch and German feminine form of WILHELM. This name was borne by a queen of the Netherlands (1880-1962).

name: WILHELMUS
meaning: Latinized form of WILHELM. This is also the official Dutch form of the name, used on birth certificates but not commonly in daily life.

name: WILKIE
meaning: From an English surname which was originally derived from a diminutive of the given name WILLIAM.

name: WILL
meaning: Short form of WILLIAM or other names beginning with Will. A famous bearer is American actor Will Smith (1968-), whose full name is Willard.

name: WILLAMAR
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements wil "will, desire" and mari "famous".

name: WILLARD
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the Germanic given name WILLIHARD (or the Old English cognate Wilheard).

name: WILLEM
meaning: Dutch form of WILLIAM. Willem the Silent, Prince of Orange, was the leader of the Dutch revolt against Spain that brought about the independence of the Netherlands. He is considered the founder of the Dutch royal family. In English he is commonly called William of Orange.

name: WILLIAM
meaning: From the Germanic name Willahelm, which was composed of the elements wil "will, desire" and helm "helmet, protection". Saint William of Gellone was an 8th-century cousin of Charlemagne who became a monk. The name was common among the Normans, and it became extremely popular in England after William the Conqueror was recognized as the first Norman king of England in the 11th century. It was later borne by three other English kings, as well as rulers of Scotland, Sicily (of Norman origin), the Netherlands and Prussia....[more]

name: WILLIE
meaning: Masculine or feminine diminutive of WILLIAM. A notable bearer is the retired American baseball player Willie Mays (1931-).

name: WILLIHARD
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements wil "will, desire" and hard "brave, hardy".

name: WILLIRIC
meaning: Germanic name derived from the elements wil "will, desire" and ric "power, rule".

name: WILLIS
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from Will, a diminutive of WILLIAM.

name: WILLOUGHBY
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "willow town" in Old English.

name: WILLOW
meaning: From the name of the tree, which is ultimately derived from Old English welig.

name: WILLY
meaning: Diminutive of WILLIAM, WILHELM or WILLEM. It is both masculine and feminine in Dutch.

name: WILMA
meaning: Short form of WILHELMINA. German settlers introduced it to America in the 19th century.

name: WILMER
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the given name WILMǢR.

name: WILMOT
meaning: Medieval diminutive and feminine form of WILLIAM.

name: WILSON
meaning: From an English surname meaning "son of WILLIAM". The surname was borne by Woodrow Wilson (1856-1924), the American president during World War I.

name: WILT
meaning: Short form of WILTON. This name was borne by basketball player Wilt Chamberlain (1936-1999).

name: WILTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from the names of several English towns. The town names mean variously "willow town", "well town" or "town on the River Wylye" in Old English. The river name is itself of Celtic origin, possibly meaning "tricky".

name: WIM
meaning: Dutch and German short form of WILLEM or WILHELM.

name: WINDSOR
meaning: From an English surname which was from a place name meaning "riverbank with a windlass" in Old English (a windlass is a lifting apparatus). This has been the surname of the royal family of the United Kingdom since 1917.

name: WINFRED
meaning: Means "friend of peace" from the Old English elements wine "friend" and friþ "peace". This was the birth name of the 8th-century missionary Saint Boniface. It became rare after the Norman conquest, though it was revived in the 19th century.

name: WINIFRED
meaning: Anglicized form of GWENFREWI, the spelling altered by association with WINFRED. It became used in England in the 16th century.

name: WINNIE
meaning: Diminutive of WINIFRED. Winnie-the-Pooh, a stuffed bear in the children's books by A. A. Milne, was named after a real bear named Winnipeg who lived at the London Zoo.

name: WINONA
meaning: Means "firstborn daughter" in Dakota. This was the name of the daughter of the 19th-century Dakota chief Wapasha III.

name: WINSLOW
meaning: From a surname which was derived from an Old English place name meaning "hill belonging to WINE". A famous bearer of this name was American painter Winslow Homer (1836-1910).

name: WINSTON
meaning: From a surname derived from an English place name, which was in turn derived from the Old English given name WYNNSTAN. A famous bearer was Winston Churchill (1874-1965), the British prime minister during World War II. This name was also borne by the fictional Winston Smith, the protagonist in George Orwell's 1949 novel '1984'.

name: WINTER
meaning: From the English word for the season, derived from Old English winter.

name: WINTHROP
meaning: From a surname which was originally taken from town names meaning either "WINE's village" or "WIGMUND's village" in Old English.

name: WINTON
meaning: From a surname which was derived from a place name meaning "enclosure belonging to WINE" in Old English.

name: WIRA
meaning: Means "hero" in Indonesian and Malay, ultimately from Sanskrit वीर(vira).

name: WISDOM
meaning: Simply from the English word, a derivative of Old English wis "wise".

name: WIT
meaning: Polish form of VITUS or WIDO.

name: WITOLD
meaning: Polish form of VYTAUTAS. Alternatively it could be derived from the Germanic name WIDALD.

name: WOB
meaning: Frisian diminutive of Germanic names beginning with the element wald meaning "rule".

name: WOBBE
meaning: Variant and feminine form of WOB.

name: WODAN
meaning: Continental Germanic cognate of Óðinn (see ODIN).

name: WODEN
meaning: Anglo-Saxon cognate of Óðinn (see ODIN). The day of the week Wednesday is named for him.

name: WOJCIECH
