meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements voji "soldier" and tekha "solace, comfort, joy". Saint Wojciech (also known by the Czech form of his name Vojtěch or his adopted name Adalbert) was a Bohemian missionary to Hungary, Poland and Prussia, where he was martyred.

name: WOLF
meaning: Short form of WOLFGANG, WOLFRAM or other names containing the Germanic element wulf meaning "wolf". It can also be simply from the German or English word.

name: WOLFGANG
meaning: Derived from the Germanic elements wulf meaning "wolf" and gang "path". Two famous bearers of this name were Austrian composer Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart (1756-1791) and German novelist and poet Johann Wolfgang von Goethe (1749-1832).

name: WOLFRAM
meaning: Derived from the Germanic element wulf meaning "wolf" combined with hramn "raven".

name: WOODROW
meaning: From a surname which was originally derived from a place name meaning "row of houses by a wood" in Old English. This name was popularized by American president Woodrow Wilson (1856-1924).

name: WOODY
meaning: Either a diminutive of WOODROW, or else from a nickname derived from the English word wood. A famous bearer is film director Woody Allen (1935-).

name: WORKNEH
meaning: Means "you are gold", from Amharic wärk meaning "gold".

name: WREN
meaning: From the English word for the small songbird. It is ultimately derived from Old English wrenna.

name: WRIGHT
meaning: From an occupational surname meaning "craftsman", ultimately from Old English wyrhta. Famous bearers of the surname were the Wright brothers (Wilbur 1867-1912 and Orville 1871-1948), the inventors of the first successful airplane, and Frank Lloyd Wright (1867-1959), an American architect.

name: WU
meaning: From Chinese 武(wǔ) meaning "military, martial" (which is generally only masculine) or 务(wù) meaning "affairs, business", as well as other characters which are pronounced similarly. This was the name of several Chinese rulers, including the 2nd-century BC emperor Wu of Han (name spelled 武) who expanded the empire and made Confucianism the state philosophy.

name: WULFNOÐ
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements wulf "wolf" and noð "boldness, daring". This name became rare after the Norman Conquest.

name: WULFSIGE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements wulf "wolf" and sige "victory".

name: WULFSTAN
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements wulf "wolf" and stan "stone".

name: WYATT
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the medieval given name WYOT. Wyatt Earp (1848-1929) was an American lawman and gunfighter involved in the famous shootout at the OK Corral.

name: WYBERT
meaning: Middle English form of the Old English name Wigberht, composed of the elements wig "battle" and beorht "bright".

name: WYMOND
meaning: Middle English form of the Old English name Wigmund, composed of the elements wig "battle" and mund "protector".

name: WYN
meaning: Derived from Welsh gwyn meaning "blessed, white, fair".

name: WYNNE  (1)
meaning: Variant of WYN, sometimes used as a feminine form.

name: WYNNE  (2)
meaning: From an English surname which was derived from the given name WINE.

name: WYNNSTAN
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements wynn "joy" and stan "stone".

name: WYOT
meaning: Middle English form of the Old English name Wigheard, composed of the elements wig "battle" and heard "brave, hardy".

name: WYSTAN
meaning: From the Old English name Wigstan, composed of the elements wig "battle" and stan "stone". This was the name of a 9th-century Anglo-Saxon saint. It became rare after the Norman conquest, and in modern times it is chiefly known as the first name of the British poet W. H. Auden (1907-1973).

name: WŁADYSŁAW
meaning: Polish cognate of VLADISLAV. This was the name of four kings of Poland.

name: XABIER
meaning: Basque and Galician form of XAVIER.

name: XANDER
meaning: Short form of ALEXANDER. It was popularized in the English-speaking world by a character on the television series 'Buffy the Vampire Slayer' (1997-2003).

name: XANTHE
meaning: Derived from Greek ξανθος(xanthos) meaning "yellow" or "fair hair". This was the name of a few minor figures in Greek mythology.

name: XANTHIPPE
meaning: Feminine form of XANTHIPPOS. This was the name of the wife of Socrates. Because of her supposedly argumentative nature, the name has been adopted (in the modern era) as a word for a scolding, ill-tempered woman.

name: XANTHIPPOS
meaning: From the Greek elements ξανθος(xanthos) "yellow" and ‘ιππος(hippos) "horse". This was the name of a 5th-century BC Athenian general.

name: XANTHOS
meaning: From Greek ξανθος(xanthos) meaning "yellow". This is the name of several figures, mostly minor, in Greek mythology.

name: XAVIER
meaning: Derived from the Basque place name Etxeberria meaning "the new house". This was the surname of the Jesuit priest Saint Francis Xavier (1506-1552) who was borne in a village of this name. He was a missionary to India, Japan, China, and other areas in East Asia, and he is the patron saint of the Orient and missionaries. His surname has since been adopted as a given name in his honour, chiefly among Catholics.

name: XENA
meaning: Probably a variant of XENIA. This was the name of the main character in the 1990s television series 'Xena: Warrior Princess'.

name: XENAGORAS
meaning: Derived from Greek ξενος(xenos) meaning "foreign, strange" and αγορα(agora) meaning "assembly, marketplace". This was the name of a 2nd-century BC Greek historian.

name: XENIA
meaning: Means "hospitality" in Greek, a derivative of ξενος(xenos) meaning "foreigner, guest". This was the name of a 5th-century saint who is venerated in the Eastern Church.

name: XENOCRATES
meaning: From the Greek name Ξενοκρατης(Xenokrates), which was derived from ξενος(xenos) meaning "foreigner, guest" and κρατος(kratos) meaning "power". This was the name of a 4th-century BC Greek philosopher.

name: XENON
meaning: Derived from Greek ξενος(xenos) meaning "foreigner, guest".

name: XENOPHON
meaning: Derived from Greek ξενος(xenos) meaning "foreign, strange" and φωνη(phone) meaning "voice". This was the name of a 4th-century BC Greek historian.

name: XERXES
meaning: Greek form of the Persian name Khshayarsha which meant "ruler over heroes". This was a 5th-century BC king of Persia, the son of Darius the Great. He attempted an invasion of Greece, which ended unsuccessfully at the battle of Salamis.

name: XESÚS
meaning: Galician form of JESUS, used as a personal name.

name: XIA
meaning: From Chinese 夏(xià) meaning "summer, great, grand", 霞(xiá) meaning "rosy clouds", or other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: XIADANI
meaning: Possibly means "the flower that arrived" in Zapotec.

name: XIANA
meaning: From Xuliana, the Galician form of JULIANA.

name: XIANG
meaning: From Chinese 翔(xiáng) meaning "soar, glide", 祥(xiáng) meaning "good luck, good omen", 香(xiāng) meaning "fragrant" (which is usually only feminine) or 湘(xiāng), which refers to the Xiang River in southern China. This name can also be formed from other characters.

name: XIMENA
meaning: Feminine form of XIMENO. This was the name of the wife of El Cid.

name: XIMENO
meaning: Medieval Spanish or Basque name of uncertain meaning. It is possibly a form of SIMON(1), though it may in fact derive from Basque seme meaning "son".

name: XINYI
meaning: From Chinese 欣(xīn) meaning "happy, joyous, delighted" or 心(xīn) meaning "heart, mind, soul" combined with 怡(yí) meaning "joy, harmony". This name can also be formed from other character combinations.

name: XIOMARA
meaning: Possibly a Spanish form of GUIOMAR.

name: XIU
meaning: From Chinese 秀(xiù) meaning "luxuriant, beautiful, elegant, outstanding" or other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: XIULAN
meaning: From Chinese 秀(xiù) meaning "luxuriant, beautiful, elegant, outstanding" combined with 兰(lán) meaning "orchid, elegant". This name can be formed of other character combinations as well.

name: XIUYING
meaning: From Chinese 秀(xiù) meaning "luxuriant, beautiful, elegant, outstanding" combined with 英(yīng) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero". Other character combinations are possible.

name: XIÁN
meaning: From Xulián, the Galician form of JULIAN.

name: XOCHIPILLI
meaning: Means "flower prince" in Nahuatl. He was the Aztec god of love, flowers, song and games, the twin brother of Xochiquetzal.

name: XOCHIQUETZAL
meaning: Means "flower feather" in Nahuatl. This was the name of the Aztec goddess of love, flowers and the earth, the twin sister of Xochipilli.

name: XUE
meaning: From Chinese 雪(xuě) meaning "snow" or 学(xué) meaning "study, learning, school", besides other characters pronounced similarly.

name: XUN
meaning: From Chinese 勋(xūn) meaning "meritorious deed, rank" or 迅(xùn) meaning "snow", as well as other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: YA
meaning: From Chinese 雅(yǎ) meaning "elegant, graceful, refined" or other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: YACHNA
meaning: Perhaps a feminine form of YACHIN.

name: YADIRA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly derived from an Arabic name. It has been used in Mexico since at least the 1940s, perhaps inspired by the Colombian actress Yadira Jiménez (1928-?), who performed in Mexican films beginning in 1946.

name: YAFE
meaning: Variant and masculine form of YAFFA.

name: YAHUI
meaning: From Chinese 雅(yǎ) meaning "elegant, graceful, refined" combined with 惠(huì) meaning "favour, benefit". This name can also be formed from other character combinations.

name: YAHWEH
meaning: A name of the Hebrew God, represented in Hebrew by the tetragrammaton ("four letters") יהוה(Yod Heh Vav Heh), which was transliterated into Roman script as Y H W H. Because it was considered blasphemous to utter the name of God, it was only written and never spoken, which resulted in the original pronunciation becoming lost. The name may have originally been derived from the old Semitic root הוה(hawah) meaning "to be" or "to become".

name: YAHYA
meaning: Arabic, Turkish and Persian form of Yochanan (see JOHN). This name honours John the Baptist, a prophet in Islam.

name: YAKOV
meaning: Russian and Bulgarian form of JACOB (or JAMES), and a Hebrew variant transcription of YAAKOV.

name: YALE
meaning: From a Welsh surname which was itself derived from a place name meaning "fertile upland" (from Welsh ial).

name: YALING
meaning: From Chinese 雅(yǎ) meaning "elegant, graceful, refined" combined with 玲(líng) meaning "tinkling of jade". This name can be formed of other character combinations as well.

name: YAM
meaning: Means "sea" in Ugaritic. Yam was the Ugaritic god of the sea, also associated with chaos, storms and destruction. He was a son of the chief god El.

name: YAMA  (1)
meaning: Means "twin" in Sanskrit. This is the name of the Hindu god of death. He is also regarded as the first mortal being, or in other words, the first person to die. This name is related to Persian Jam.

name: YAMATO
meaning: From YAMATO, an ancient name for Japan. It can also refer to the Yamato period in Japanese history, which lasted into the 8th century. The individual kanji are 大 meaning "great" and 和 meaning "harmony".

name: YAMI
meaning: Means "twin, pair" in Sanskrit. In Hindu belief this is the name of the first woman, the twin sister of the first man Yama.

name: YAMILA
meaning: Form of JAMILA used especially in Latin America.

name: YAMUNA
meaning: From the name of an Indian river, which is possibly derived from the name of the goddess YAMI.

name: YAN  (2)
meaning: From Chinese 艳(yàn) meaning "beautiful, gorgeous" (which is usually only feminine) or 岩(yán) meaning "cliff, rocks", as well as other Chinese characters pronounced in a similar fashion.

name: YANA
meaning: Bulgarian, Russian and Ukrainian form of JANA(1).

name: YANCY
meaning: From a surname, which was an Americanized form of the Dutch surname Jansen meaning "JAN(1)'s son".

name: YANG
meaning: From Chinese 洋(yáng) meaning "ocean" or 阳(yáng) meaning "light, sun, male" (which is typically only masculine), as well as other Chinese characters pronounced similarly.

name: YANICK
meaning: Masculine and feminine diminutive of YANN.

name: YANNIC
meaning: Masculine and feminine diminutive of YANN.

name: YANNICK
meaning: Masculine and feminine diminutive of YANN.

name: YARED
meaning: Hebrew form of JARED. This form is also used in Ethiopia. It was borne by a semi-legendary 6th-century Ethiopian musician who is considered a saint in the Ethiopian Orthodox Church.

name: YAROMIL
meaning: Possible medieval Slavic form of JARMIL.

name: YARON
meaning: Means "to sing, to shout" in Hebrew.

name: YAROSLAV
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of JAROSŁAW.

name: YAROSLAVA
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian feminine form of JAROSŁAW.

name: YASEN
meaning: Means both "ash tree" and "clear, serene" in Bulgarian.

name: YASER
meaning: Persian and Turkish form of YASIR, as well as a variant transcription of the Arabic name.

name: YASH
meaning: Derived from Sanskrit यशस्(yashas) meaning "fame, praise, glory".

name: YASIN
meaning: From the Arabic letters ي (called ya) and س (called sin). These letters begin the 36th chapter of the Qur'an (surah Ya Sin).

name: YASIR
meaning: Means "to be rich", derived from Arabic يسر(yasira) meaning "to become easy". This was the name of an early Islamic martyr. It was also borne by Yasir Arafat (1929-2004), a leader of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

name: YASMIN
meaning: From Persian یاسمن(yasamen) meaning "jasmine". In modern times it has been used in the English-speaking world, as a variant of JASMINE.

name: YASU
meaning: From Japanese 安(yasu) meaning "peace, quiet", 康(yasu) meaning "peaceful" or 坦(yasu) meaning "flat, smooth, level", as well as other kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: YATING
meaning: From Chinese 雅(yǎ) meaning "elegant, graceful, refined" combined with 婷(tíng) meaning "pretty, graceful". Other character combinations are possible.

name: YAWEN
meaning: From Chinese 雅(yǎ) meaning "elegant, graceful, refined" combined with 雯(wén) meaning "cloud patterns". This name can be formed of other character combinations as well.

name: YAZHU
meaning: From Chinese 雅(yǎ) meaning "elegant, graceful, refined" combined with 筑(zhù) meaning "lute, zither, build". Other character combinations are also possible.

name: YE-JUN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 藝(ye) meaning "art, talent, craft" combined with 俊(jun) meaning "talented, handsome", as well as other hanja combinations.

name: YEFIM
meaning: Russian form of the Greek name Ευφεμιος(Euphemios), the masculine form of EUPHEMIA.

name: YEHOCHANAN
meaning: Original Hebrew form of JOHN (and JEHOHANAN).

name: YEJIDE
meaning: Means "image of the mother" in Yoruba.

name: YELIZAVETA
meaning: Russian form of ELIZABETH. This was the name of an 18th-century Russian empress.

name: YENTE
meaning: Possibly a variant of YENTL. It also means "gossip" in Yiddish.

name: YENTL
meaning: Yiddish form of the French nickname Gentille, meaning "noble, aristocratic".

name: YEONG
meaning: From Sino-Korean 英(yeong) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero", as well as other hanja characters which are pronounced similarly. It usually occurs in combination with another character, though it is sometimes used as a stand-alone name. This name was borne by Jang Yeong-sil (where Jang is the surname), a 15th-century Korean scientist and inventor.

name: YEONG-CHEOL
meaning: From Sino-Korean 永(yeong) meaning "perpetual, eternal" combined with 哲(cheol) meaning "wise, sage". Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: YEONG-GI
meaning: From Sino-Korean 榮(yeong) meaning "glory, honour, flourish, prosper" and 起(gi) meaning "rise, stand up, begin". Other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: YEONG-HO
meaning: From Sino-Korean 英(yeong) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero", 映(yeong) meaning "reflect light" or 泳(yeong) meaning "dive, swim" combined with 浩(ho) meaning "great, numerous, vast" or 皓(ho) meaning "bright, luminous, clear, hoary". Other hanja combinations are possible.

name: YEONG-HUI
meaning: From Sino-Korean 英(yeong) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero" or 泳(yeong) meaning "dive, swim" combined with 姬(hui) meaning "beauty" or 嬉(hui) meaning "enjoy, play". Other combinations of hanja characters can form this name as well.

name: YEONG-HWAN
meaning: From Sino-Korean 永(yeong) meaning "perpetual, eternal" or 泳(yeong) meaning "dive, swim" combined with 煥(hwan) meaning "shining, brilliant, lustrous". Other hanja combinations are possible as well.

name: YEONG-JA
meaning: From Sino-Korean 英(yeong) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero" and 子(ja) meaning "child". Other hanja character combinations can form this name as well. Feminine names ending with the character 子 (a fashionable name suffix in Japan, read as -ko in Japanese) were popular in Korea during the period of Japanese rule (1910-1945). After liberation this name and others like it declined in popularity.

name: YEONG-SU
meaning: From Sino-Korean 永(yeong) meaning "perpetual, eternal" and 壽(su) meaning "long life, lifespan", as well as other hanja character combinations.

name: YEONG-SUK
meaning: From Sino-Korean 英(yeong) meaning "flower, petal, brave, hero" and 淑(suk) meaning "good, pure, virtuous, charming". Other hanja character combinations are possible.

name: YERUSLAN
meaning: From Tatar Uruslan, which was possibly from Turkic arslan meaning "lion". Yeruslan Lazarevich is the name of a hero in Russian and Tatar folktales. These tales were based on (or at least influenced by) Persian tales of their hero Rostam.

name: YESENIA
meaning: From Jessenia, the genus name of a type of tree found in South America. This name was first used by Yolanda Vargas in the Telenovela 'Yesenia' (1970).

name: YESHUA
meaning: Contracted form of Yehoshu'a (see JOSHUA) used in the books of Ezra and Nehemiah in the Hebrew Old Testament. The form was also used in Aramaic, and was most likely the name represented by Greek Iesous (see JESUS) in the New Testament. This means it was probably the real name of Jesus.

name: YEVA
meaning: Russian and Armenian form of EVE.

name: YEVPRAKSIYA
meaning: Russian form of EUPRAXIA. This was the name of a daughter of Vsevolod I, grand prince of Kiev, who became the wife of the Holy Roman emperor Henry IV.

name: YEWUBDAR
meaning: Means "beautiful beyond limits" from Amharic wub "beautiful" and dar "limit, horizon, frontier".

name: YI
meaning: From Chinese 宜(yí) meaning "suitable, proper", 毅(yì) meaning "resolute, decisive, firm", 义(yì) meaning "justice, righteousness", 益(yì) meaning "profit, benefit", 怡(yí) meaning "joy, harmony" (which is usually only feminine) or 仪(yí) meaning "ceremony, rites" (also usually feminine). Other characters can also form this name.

name: YIJUN
meaning: From Chinese 怡(yí) meaning "joy, harmony" combined with 君(jūn) meaning "king, ruler". This name can also be formed from other character combinations.

name: YIN
meaning: From Chinese 银(yín) meaning "silver, money", 音(yīn) meaning "sound, tone" or 荫(yīn) meaning "shade, shelter, protect", as well as other Chinese characters pronounced similarly.

name: YITZHAK
meaning: Hebrew form of ISAAC. This was the name of two recent Israeli prime ministers.

name: YLVA
meaning: Means "she-wolf", a derivative of Old Norse úlfr "wolf".

name: YNGVI
meaning: Possibly an Old Norse cognate of ING. This was an alternate name of the god Freyr, who as Yngvi-Freyr was regarded as the ancestor of the Swedish royal family.

name: YOCHANAN
meaning: Hebrew form of JOHN (and JOHANAN). This is a contracted form of the longer name יְהוֹחָנָן(Yehochanan).

name: YOLANDA
meaning: From the medieval French name Yolande, which was probably a form of the name Violante, which was itself a derivative of Latin viola "violet". Alternatively it could be of Germanic origin....[more]

name: YOLANDE
meaning: French form of YOLANDA. A notable bearer of the 15th century was Yolande of Aragon, who acted as regent for the French king Charles VII, her son-in-law. She was a supporter of Joan of Arc.

name: YONG
meaning: From Chinese 勇(yǒng) meaning "brave" or 永(yǒng) meaning "perpetual, eternal". This can also be a single-character Korean name, for example from the hanja 勇 meaning "brave". This name can be formed by other characters besides those listed here.

name: YORI
meaning: From Japanese 頼(yori) meaning "rely" or other kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: YORICK
meaning: Altered form of JØRG. Shakespeare used this name for a deceased court jester in his play 'Hamlet' (1600).

name: YORK
meaning: From a surname, which was derived from York, the name of a city in northern England. The city name was originally Eburacon, Latinized as Eboracum, meaning "yew" in Brythonic, but it was altered by association with Old English Eoforwic, meaning "pig farm".

name: YOSHI
meaning: From Japanese 吉(yoshi) meaning "good luck", 義(yoshi) meaning "righteous", or 良(yoshi) meaning "good, virtuous, respectable", as well as other kanji with the same reading.

name: YOSHIKO
meaning: From Japanese 良(yoshi) meaning "good, virtuous, respectable", 芳(yoshi) meaning "fragrant, virtuous, beautiful" or 悦(yoshi) meaning "joy, pleased" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". This name can be formed from other kanji combinations as well.

name: YOSHIROU
meaning: From Japanese 義(yoshi) meaning "righteous" and 郎(rou) meaning "son". Other kanji combinations are also possible.

name: YOUCEF
meaning: Variant transcription of YUSUF, commonly used for Algerian Arabic.

name: YOUKO
meaning: From Japanese 陽(you) meaning "light, sun, male" or 洋(you) meaning "ocean" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other combinations of kanji characters are possible.

name: YOUSEF
meaning: Variant Arabic transcription of YUSUF, as well as a Persian transcription.

name: YOUTA
meaning: From Japanese 陽(you) meaning "light, sun, male" and 太(ta) meaning "thick, big". Other character combinations are possible.

name: YSEUT
meaning: Old French form of ISOLDE, appearing in the 12th-century Norman poem 'Tristan' by Béroul.

name: YSOLT
meaning: Old French form of ISOLDE, appearing in the 12th-century Old French poem 'Tristan' by Thomas of Britain.

name: YU
meaning: From Chinese 玉(yù) meaning "jade, precious stone, gem", 愉(yú) meaning "pleasant, delightful" or 雨(yǔ) meaning "rain". Other characters can form this name as well.

name: YUA
meaning: From Japanese 結(yu) meaning "tie, bind" and 愛(a) meaning "love, affection". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: YUDA
meaning: Means "war" in Indonesian, ultimately from Sanskrit युद्ध(yuddha).

name: YUI
meaning: From Japanese 結(yu) meaning "tie, bind" or 優(yu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness" combined with 衣(i) meaning "clothing, garment". It can also come from standalone 結(yui) using a different nanori reading. This name can be formed of other kanji or kanji combinations as well.

name: YUINA
meaning: From Japanese 結(yui) meaning "tie, bind" and 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: YUKI
meaning: From Japanese 幸(yuki) meaning "happiness" or 雪(yuki) meaning "snow". It can also come from 由(yu) meaning "reason, cause" combined with 貴(ki) meaning "valuable" or 紀(ki) meaning "chronicle". Other kanji or kanji combinations are also possible.

name: YUKIKO
meaning: From Japanese 幸(yuki) meaning "happiness" or 雪(yuki) meaning "snow" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Alternatively, it can come from 由(yu) meaning "reason, cause" with 喜(ki) meaning "joy" or 貴(ki) meaning "valuable" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations can also form this name.

name: YUKO
meaning: From Japanese 優(yu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness" and 子(ko) meaning "child", as well as other combinations of kanji.

name: YULIAN
meaning: Russian and Bulgarian form of JULIAN.

name: YULIANA
meaning: Russian, Bulgarian and Indonesian form of JULIANA.

name: YULIYA
meaning: Russian, Ukrainian and Bulgarian form of JULIA.

name: YUMI
meaning: From Japanese 弓(yumi) meaning "archery bow". It can also come from 由(yu) meaning "reason, cause", 友(yu) meaning "friend" or a nanori reading of 弓(yu) meaning "archery bow" combined with 美(mi) meaning "beautiful". Other kanji or kanji combinations are also possible.

name: YUMIKO
meaning: From Japanese 弓(yumi) meaning "archery bow" or 由(yu) meaning "reason, cause" with 美(mi) meaning "beautiful" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: YUN
meaning: From Chinese 云(yún) meaning "cloud" or 允(yǔn) meaning "allow, consent", as well as other Chinese characters which are pronounced in a similar way.

name: YUNUEN
meaning: Possibly means "half moon" in Mayan. This is the name of an island on Lake Pátzcuaro in Mexico.

name: YUNUS
meaning: Arabic and Turkish form of JONAH.

name: YURI  (2)
meaning: From Japanese 百合(yuri) meaning "lily". Other kanji or combinations of kanji can also form this name.

name: YURIY
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of GEORGE. The Soviet cosmonaut Yuriy (or Yuri) Gagarin (1934-1968), the first man to travel to space, was a famous bearer of this name.

name: YUSEF
meaning: Variant Arabic transcription of YUSUF, as well as a Persian transcription.

name: YUSUF
meaning: Arabic and Turkish form of Yosef (see JOSEPH).

name: YUU
meaning: From Japanese 優(yuu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness", 悠(yuu) meaning "distant, leisurely", 勇(yuu) meaning "brave", or other kanji which are pronounced the same way.

name: YUUDAI
meaning: From Japanese 雄(yuu) meaning "hero, manly" and 大(dai) meaning "big, great, vast", besides other combinations of kanji.

name: YUUKA
meaning: From Japanese 優(yuu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness" and 花(ka) meaning "flower, blossom". It can also be composed of different kanji which have the same pronunciations.

name: YUUKI
meaning: From Japanese 優(yuu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness" or 悠(yuu) meaning "distant, leisurely" combined with 希(ki) meaning "hope", 輝(ki) meaning "brightness" or 生(ki) meaning "living". Other combinations of kanji can form this name as well.

name: YUUKO
meaning: From Japanese 優(yuu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness", 悠(yuu) meaning "distant, leisurely" or 裕(yuu) meaning "abundant" combined with 子(ko) meaning "child". This name can be formed of different kanji characters as well.

name: YUUMA
meaning: From Japanese 悠(yuu) meaning "distant, leisurely" or 優(yuu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness" combined with 真(ma) meaning "real, genuine". Other combinations of kanji can form this name as well.

name: YUUNA
meaning: From Japanese 優(yuu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness" or 柚(yuu) meaning "grapefruit, pomelo, citrus fruit" combined with 菜(na) meaning "vegetables, greens" or 奈(na), a phonetic character. Other combinations of kanji are also possible.

name: YUUTA
meaning: From Japanese 優(yuu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness", 悠(yuu) meaning "distant, leisurely" or 勇(yuu) meaning "brave" combined with 太(ta) meaning "thick, big". Other combinations of kanji are possible.

name: YUUTO
meaning: From Japanese 優(yuu) meaning "excellence, superiority, gentleness" or 悠(yuu) meaning "distant, leisurely" combined with 斗(to), which refers to a Chinese constellation, 人(to) meaning "person" or 翔(to) meaning "soar, fly". Other kanji combinations are possible.

name: YUVAL
meaning: Hebrew form of JUBAL. It is used as a masculine and feminine name in modern Hebrew.

name: YUZUKI
meaning: From Japanese 柚(yuzu) meaning "grapefruit, pomelo, citrus fruit" and 希(ki) meaning "hope". Other combinations of kanji can form this name as well.

name: YVAIN
meaning: Form of OWAIN used by the 12th-century French poet Chrétien de Troyes for his Arthurian tales.

name: YVES
meaning: Medieval French form of IVO(1). This was the name of two French saints: an 11th-century bishop of Chartres and a 13th-century parish priest and lawyer, also known as Ivo of Kermartin, the patron saint of Brittany.

name: YVONNE
meaning: French feminine form of YVON. It has been regularly used in the English-speaking world since the late 19th century.

name: ZAAHIR  (1)
meaning: Derived from Arabic زهر(zahara) meaning "to shine, to radiate".

name: ZAAHIR  (2)
meaning: Derived from Arabic ظهر(zahara) meaning "clear, evident, manifest, outward". In Islamic tradition الظاهر(al-Zahir) is one of the 99 names of Allah.

name: ZABEL
meaning: Armenian form of ISABEL. A 13th-century ruling queen of Cilician Armenia bore this name.

name: ZACCAI
meaning: From the Hebrew name זַכָּי(Zakkai) meaning "pure". This is the name of a minor character in the Old Testament.

name: ZACCHAEUS
meaning: From Ζακχαιος(Zakchaios), the Greek form of ZACCAI. In the New Testament he is a tax collector in Jericho who gives half his possessions to charity.

name: ZACCHARIAS
meaning: Form of ZACHARIAS used in the Latin Bible.

name: ZACCHEUS
meaning: Latin form of Ζακχαιος (see ZACCHAEUS) used in the Vulgate.

name: ZACHARIAH
meaning: Variant of ZECHARIAH. This spelling is used in the King James Version of the Old Testament to refer to one of the kings of Israel (called Zechariah in other versions).

name: ZACHARIAS
meaning: Greek form of ZECHARIAH. This form of the name is used in most English versions of the New Testament to refer to the father of John the Baptist. It was also borne by an 8th-century pope (called Zachary in English).

name: ZACHARY
meaning: Usual English form of ZACHARIAS, used in some English versions of the New Testament. This form has been in use since the Middle Ages, though it did not become common until after the Protestant Reformation. It was borne by American military commander and president Zachary Taylor (1784-1850).

name: ZADOK
meaning: Means "righteous" in Hebrew. This is the name of several characters in the Old Testament, most notably the high priest of Israel during the reigns of David and Solomon. Solomon was anointed by Zadok.

name: ZAHARINA
meaning: Bulgarian and Macedonian feminine form of ZECHARIAH.

name: ZAHIR
meaning: Derived from Arabic ظهير(zahir) meaning "helper, supporter". This can also be a variant transcription of ZAAHIR(1) or ZAAHIR(2).

name: ZAHIRA
meaning: Feminine form of ZAHIR. This can also be a variant transcription of ZAAHIRA.

name: ZAHRA
meaning: Means "brilliant, bright" in Arabic. This is an epithet of the Prophet Muhammad's daughter Fatimah.

name: ZAHRAH
meaning: Derived from Arabic زهرة(zahrah) meaning "blooming flower".

name: ZAINAB
meaning: Variant Arabic transcription of ZAYNAB, as well as the Urdu form.

name: ZAIRA
meaning: Italian and Spanish form of ZAÏRE.

name: ZAKARIA
meaning: Georgian form of ZECHARIAH. This is also a variant transcription of Arabic ZAKARIYYA.

name: ZAKCHAIOS
meaning: Form of ZACCHAEUS used in the Greek New Testament.

name: ZAL
meaning: Means "albino" in Persian. In the 11th-century Persian epic the 'Shahnameh' this is the name of a white-haired warrior.

name: ZALMON
meaning: Means "shady" in Hebrew. This is the name of one of David's mighty men in the Old Testament.

name: ZAN
meaning: From Chinese 赞(zàn) meaning "help, support", as well as other characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: ZANE  (1)
meaning: From an English surname of unknown meaning. It was introduced as a given name by American author Zane Grey (1872-1939). Zane was in fact his middle name - it had been his mother's maiden name.

name: ZARA  (1)
meaning: English form of ZAÏRE. In England it came to public attention when Princess Anne gave it to her daughter in 1981. Use of the name may also be influenced by the trendy Spanish clothing retailer Zara.

name: ZARAH
meaning: Form of ZERAH used in some translations of the Bible.

name: ZARAMAMA
meaning: Means "grain mother" in Quechua. This was the name of the Inca goddess of grain.

name: ZARATHUSTRA
meaning: Possibly means "golden camel" in Old Iranian, derived from zarat meaning "golden" combined with ushtra meaning "camel". Zarathustra was the Persian prophet who founded the ancient religion of Zoroastrianism about the 10th century BC.

name: ZARIA
meaning: Possibly based on ZAHRAH or the Nigerian city of Zaria.

name: ZAUR
meaning: Azerbaijani, Ossetian, Chechen and Georgian form of ZAWAR.

name: ZAURBEK
meaning: Derived from Arabic زوار(zawar) meaning "pilgrim" combined with the Turkish military title beg meaning "chieftain, master".

name: ZAYD
meaning: Derived from Arabic زاد(zada) meaning "to increase". This was the name of a slave who became the adopted son of the Prophet Muhammad.

name: ZAYDEN
meaning: An invented name, using the popular aden suffix sound found in such names as Braden, Hayden and Aidan.

name: ZAYNAB
meaning: Meaning uncertain. It is possibly related to Arabic زين(zayn) meaning "beauty"; it could be from the name of a fragrant flowering tree; or it could be an Arabic form of ZENOBIA, a name borne by a pre-Islamic queen of Palmyra. Zaynab was the name of a daughter, a granddaughter, and two wives of the Prophet Muhammad.

name: ZAÏRE
meaning: Used by Voltaire for the heroine of his tragic play 'Zaïre' (1732), about a Christian woman enslaved by Muslims. The heroine is named Zara in some English translations. Voltaire may have based the name on ZAHRAH.

name: ZBIGNIEW
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements zbyti "to dispel" and gnyevu "anger".

name: ZBYNĚK
meaning: Diminutive of ZBYGNĚV, now used independently.

name: ZDENKO
meaning: Derived from the Slavic element zidati meaning "build, create", originally a short form of names beginning with that element.

name: ZDISLAVA
meaning: Czech feminine form of ZDZISŁAW. This name was borne by the 13th-century Czech saint Zdislava Berka.

name: ZDRAVKO
meaning: Derived from South Slavic zdrav meaning "healthy".

name: ZDZISŁAW
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements zidati "build" and slava "glory".

name: ZEBADIAH
meaning: Means "YAHWEH has bestowed" in Hebrew. This was the name of several Old Testament characters.

name: ZEBEDAIOS
meaning: New Testament Greek form of ZEBEDEE.

name: ZEBEDEE
meaning: From Ζεβεδαιος(Zebedaios), the Greek form of ZEBADIAH used in the New Testament, where it refers to the father of the apostles James and John.

name: ZEBULUN
meaning: Possibly derived from Ugartic zbl meaning "prince". In the Old Testament Zebulun is the tenth son of Jacob (his sixth son by Leah) and the ancestor of one of the twelve tribes of Israel. Genesis 30:20 implies two different roots for the name: זָבַל(zaval) meaning "to dwell" and זֵבֵד(zeved) meaning "gift, dowry". These are probably only folk etymologies.

name: ZECHARIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name זְכַרְיָה(Zekharyah) meaning "YAHWEH remembers", from זָכַר(zakhar) meaning "to remember" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. This is the name of many characters in the Old Testament, including the prophet Zechariah, the author of the Book of Zechariah. The name also appears in the New Testament belonging to the father of John the Baptist, who was temporarily made dumb because of his disbelief. He is regarded as a saint by Christians. In some versions of the New Testament his name is spelled in the Greek form Zacharias or the English form Zachary. As an English given name, Zechariah has been in occasional use since the Protestant Reformation.

name: ZEDEKIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name צִדְקִיָּהוּ(Tzidqiyyahu) meaning "justice of YAHWEH", from צֶדֶק(tzedeq) meaning "justice" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. In the Old Testament this is the name of the last king of Judah.

name: ZEDONG
meaning: From Chinese 泽(zé) meaning "moist, grace, brilliance" combined with 东(dōng) meaning "east", as well as other character combinations. A notable bearer was the founder of the People's Republic of China, Mao Zedong (1893-1976).

name: ZEFERINO
meaning: Portuguese form of the Roman name Zephyrinus, which was derived from the Greek Zephyros (see ZEPHYR). Saint Zephyrinus was a 3rd-century pope.

name: ZEKİ
meaning: Means "intelligent" in Turkish, ultimately from Arabic ذكيّ(dhakiy).

name: ZELIMKHAN
meaning: Combination of the name SALIM and the Turkic title khan meaning "ruler, leader".

name: ZELOPHEHAD
meaning: Possibly means either "first born" or "shadow from terror" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament, Zelophehad is a man who dies while the Israelites are wandering in the wilderness, leaving five daughters as heirs.

name: ZELPHA
meaning: Form of ZILPAH used in the Greek and Latin Old Testament.

name: ZEMFIRA
meaning: Meaning unknown, possibly of Romani origin. This name was (first?) used by Aleksandr Pushkin in his poem 'The Gypsies' (1827).

name: ZENA
meaning: Meaning unknown. It could be a variant of XENIA or a diminutive of names featuring this sound, such as ALEXINA, ROSINA or ZENOBIA. This name has occasionally been used since the 19th century.

name: ZENAIDA
meaning: Apparently a Greek derivative of Ζηναις(Zenais), which was derived from the name of the Greek god ZEUS. This was the name of a 1st-century saint who was a doctor with her sister Philonella.

name: ZENO
meaning: From the Greek name Ζηνων(Zenon), which was derived from the name of the Greek god ZEUS. Zeno was the name of two famous Greek philosophers: Zeno of Elea and Zeno of Citium, the founder of the Stoic school in Athens.

name: ZENOBIA
meaning: Means "life of Zeus", derived from Greek Ζηνο(Zeno), a prefix form of the name of ZEUS, combined with βιος(bios) "life". This was the name of a 3rd-century queen of Palmyra. After claiming the title 'Queen of the East' and expanding her realm into Roman territory she was defeated by Emperor Aurelian. Her Greek name was used as an approximation of her native Aramaic name.

name: ZENON
meaning: Older form of ZENO, as well as the modern Polish form.

name: ZEPHANIA
meaning: Variant of ZEPHANIAH. This form of the name appears to be used in southern Africa.

name: ZEPHANIAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name ץְפַןְיָה(Tzefanyah) meaning "YAHWEH has hidden", derived from צָפַן(tzafan) meaning "to hide" and יָה(yah) referring to the Hebrew God. This is the name of one of the twelve minor prophets of the Old Testament, the author of the Book of Zephaniah.

name: ZEPHYR
meaning: From the Greek Ζεφυρος(Zephyros) meaning "the west wind". Zephyros was the Greek god of the west wind.

name: ZERACHIEL
meaning: Possibly means "command of God" in Hebrew. The Book of Enoch names him as one of the seven archangels. His name is sometimes rendered as Sarakiel.

name: ZERAH
meaning: Means "dawning, shining" in Hebrew. This is the name of a son of Judah and the twin of Perez in the Old Testament.

name: ZEUS
meaning: The name of a Greek god, related to the old Indo-European god *Dyeus whose name probably meant "shine" or "sky". In Greek mythology he was the highest of the gods. After he and his siblings defeated the Titans, Zeus ruled over the earth and humankind from atop Mount Olympus. He had control over the weather and his weapon was a thunderbolt.

name: ZEYNAB
meaning: Variant transcription of ZEINAB (Persian) or ZEYNƏB (Azerbaijani).

name: ZHAKLINA
meaning: Macedonian and Bulgarian form of JACQUELINE.

name: ZHELIMIR
meaning: Possible medieval Slavic form of ŽELIMIR.

name: ZHEN
meaning: From Chinese 珍(zhēn) meaning "precious, rare", 真(zhēn) meaning "real, genuine", 贞(zhēn) meaning "virtuous, chaste, loyal", or other Chinese characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: ZHENG
meaning: From Chinese 正(zhèng) meaning "right, proper, correct" or 政(zhèng) meaning "government", as well as other hanja characters with a similar pronunciation.

name: ZHENYA
meaning: Russian diminutive of YEVGENIYA or YEVGENIY or a Bulgarian diminutive of EVGENIYA.

name: ZHI
meaning: From Chinese 志(zhì) meaning "will, purpose, ambition" or 智(zhì) meaning "wisdom, intellect", as well as other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: ZHIHAO
meaning: From Chinese 志(zhì) meaning "will, purpose, ambition" or 智(zhì) meaning "wisdom, intellect" combined with 豪(háo) meaning "brave, heroic, chivalrous". Many other character combinations are possible.

name: ZHIVKO
meaning: Derived from the Slavic word живъ(zhivu) meaning "living".

name: ZHONG
meaning: From Chinese 中(zhōng) meaning "middle" or 忠(zhōng) meaning "loyalty, devotion". Other characters can form this name as well.

name: ZHOU
meaning: From Chinese 舟(zhōu) meaning "boat, ship", in addition to other characters which are pronounced similarly.

name: ZHUBIN
meaning: Means "spear" in Persian, ultimately from Sanskrit.

name: ZIAUDDIN
meaning: Variant Arabic transcription of ZIYA AL-DIN, as well as the usual Urdu transcription.

name: ZIBA  (2)
meaning: Means "station" in Hebrew. This was the name of a servant of Saul in the Old Testament.

name: ZIBIAH
meaning: Means "roe, deer" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the mother of King Joash of Judah.

name: ZIEMOWIT
meaning: From an old Slavic name derived from the elements sem "family" and vit "lord, master". This was the name of a legendary Piast prince of Poland. It was also borne by several other Piast rulers.

name: ZIFA
meaning: Tatar and Bashkir form of ZIBA(1).

name: ZILLAH
meaning: Means "shade" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament she is the second wife of Lamech.

name: ZILPA
meaning: Spanish, French, Italian and Dutch form of ZILPAH.

name: ZILPAH
meaning: Means "frailty" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this is the name of the handmaid who was given to Jacob by Leah.

name: ZIMRI
meaning: Means "my praise" or "my music" in Hebrew. This is the name of a king of Israel in the Old Testament. He ruled for only seven days, when he was succeeded by the commander of the army Omri.

name: ZINNIA
meaning: From the name of the flower, which was itself named for the German botanist Johann Zinn.

name: ZINON
meaning: Modern Greek form of Zenon (see ZENO).

name: ZINOVIY
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of the Greek name Ζηνοβιος(Zenobios), the masculine form of ZENOBIA.

name: ZINOVIYA
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of ZENOBIA.

name: ZION
meaning: From the name of a citadel which was in the center of Jerusalem. Zion is also used to refer to a Jewish homeland and to heaven.

name: ZIPPORAH
meaning: From the Hebrew name צִפּוֹרָה(Tzipporah), derived from צִפּוֹר(tzippor) meaning "bird". In the Old Testament this is the name of the Midianite wife of Moses. She was the daughter of the priest Jethro.

name: ZITA  (1)
meaning: Means "little girl" in Tuscan Italian. This was the name of a 13th-century saint, the patron saint of servants.

name: ZIV
meaning: Means "bright, radiant" in Hebrew. This was the ancient name of the second month of the Jewish calendar.

name: ZIYA
meaning: Derived from Arabic ضياء(diya) meaning "splendour, light, glow". This was the name of a 14th-century Islamic Indian historian.

name: ZIYA AL-DIN
meaning: Means "splendour of religion" from Arabic ضياء(diya) meaning "splendour, light, glow" combined with دين(din) meaning "religion, faith".

name: ZIYA UR-RAHMAN
meaning: Means "splendour of the merciful" from Arabic ضياء(diya) meaning "splendour, light, glow" combined with رحمن(rahman) meaning "merciful".

name: ZLATAN
meaning: Means "golden", a derivative of the Slavic word zlato "gold".

name: ZLOTA
meaning: From Polish złoto "gold", used as translation of Yiddish Golda.

name: ZOE
meaning: Means "life" in Greek. From early times it was adopted by Hellenized Jews as a translation of EVE. It was borne by two early Christian saints, one martyred under Emperor Hadrian, the other martyred under Diocletian. The name was common in the Byzantine Empire, being borne by a ruling empress of the 11th century. As an English name, Zoe has only been in use since the 19th century. It has generally been more common among Eastern Christians (in various spellings).

name: ZOJA
meaning: Latvian, Serbian, Croatian and Macedonian form of ZOE.

name: ZOLA  (1)
meaning: Meaning unknown, perhaps an invented name. It has been in occasional use in the English-speaking world since the 19th century. It coincides with an Italian surname, a famous bearer being the French-Italian author Émile Zola (1840-1902).

name: ZOLTÁN
meaning: Possibly related to the Turkish title sultan meaning "king, sultan". This was the name of a 10th-century ruler of Hungary, also known as Zsolt.

name: ZONA
meaning: Means "girdle, belt" in Greek. This name was made popular by the Pulitzer Prize-winning novelist and poet Zona Gale.

name: ZOPYROS
meaning: Means "glowing" in Greek. This was the name of a Persian nobleman who aided his king Darius in the capture of Babylon. He did this by mutilating himself and then going to the Babylonians claiming that it had been Darius who did it to him. After gaining their trust he betrayed them.

name: ZORA
meaning: From a South and West Slavic word meaning "dawn, aurora".

name: ZORAIDA
meaning: Perhaps means "enchanting" or "dawn" in Arabic. This was the name of a minor 12th-century Spanish saint, a convert from Islam. The name was used by Cervantes for a character in his novel 'Don Quixote' (1606), in which Zoraida is a beautiful Moorish woman of Algiers who converts to Christianity and elopes with a Spanish officer.

name: ZORICA
meaning: Serbian, Croatian and Macedonian diminutive of ZORA.

name: ZOSIMUS
meaning: Latinized form of Ζωσιμος(Zosimos), a Greek name derived from ζωσιμος(zosimos) meaning "viable" or "likely to survive". This was the name of several early saints and a pope.

name: ZOTICUS
meaning: Latinized form of the Greek name Ζωτικος(Zotikos), derived from ζωτικος(zotikos) meaning "full of life". This was the name of several early saints.

name: ZOYA
meaning: Russian and Ukrainian form of ZOE.

name: ZOÉ
meaning: French and Hungarian form of ZOE.

name: ZOË
meaning: Dutch form and English variant of ZOE.

name: ZRINKA
meaning: Possibly from Zrin, the name of a village in Croatia, or from the noble Zrinski family which originated there.

name: ZULA  (2)
meaning: Meaning unknown. It has been in use since the 19th century. It is possibly related to the name of the African tribe that lives largely in South Africa, the Zulus. In the 19th century the Zulus were a powerful nation under their leader Shaka.

name: ZULEIKA
meaning: Possibly means "brilliant beauty" in Persian. According to medieval legends this was the name of Potiphar's wife in the Bible. She has been a frequent subject of poems and tales.

name: ZULFIQAR
meaning: From Arabic ذو الفقار(Dhu al-Fiqar) meaning "cleaver of the spine". This was the name of the Prophet Muhammad's sword, also used by his son-in-law Ali.

name: ZURIEL
meaning: Means "my rock is God" in Hebrew. In the Old Testament this name is borne by a chief of the Merarite Levites at the time of the Exodus.

name: ZUZA
meaning: Slovak and Polish diminutive of SUSANNA.

name: ZUZANA
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of SUSANNA.

name: ZUZANNA
meaning: Polish and Latvian form of SUSANNA.

name: ZVEZDANA
meaning: Serbian and Slovene form of ZVJEZDANA.

name: ZVIAD
meaning: Derived from Georgian ზვიადი(zviadi) meaning "proud, arrogant".

name: ZVONIMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements zvonu "sound, chime" and miru "peace, world".

name: ZYTA
meaning: Possibly a Polish form of ZITA(1), or possibly a short form of FELICYTA.

name: ZÁVIŠ
meaning: Derived from a Slavic root meaning "envy".

name: ZÉPHYRINE
meaning: French feminine form of Zephyrinus (see ZEFERINO).

name: ÁEDÁN
meaning: Older form of AODHÁN. This was the name of a 6th-century king of the Scots.

name: ÁFRICA
meaning: Spanish form of AFRICA(1). It is usually taken from the title of the Virgin Mary, Nuestra Señora de África, the patron saint of the Spanish enclave of Ceuta in North Africa.

name: ÁGUEDA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of AGATHA.

name: ÁINE
meaning: Means "radiance" in Gaelic. This was the name of the queen of the fairies in Celtic mythology. It is also taken as an Irish form of Anne.

name: ÁKI
meaning: Old Norse diminutive of names containing the element anu "ancestor, father".

name: ÁKOS
meaning: Possibly of Turkic origin meaning "white falcon". This was the name of a medieval Hungarian clan.

name: ÁLMOS
meaning: Possibly from Hungarian álom "dream", though perhaps of Turkic origin meaning "bought". This was the name of the semi-legendary father of Árpád, the founder of the Hungarian state. Álmos's mother Emese supposedly had a dream in which a turul bird impregnated her and foretold that her son would be the father of a great nation.

name: ÁLVARO
meaning: Spanish form of a Germanic name, perhaps ALFHER. Verdi used this name in his opera 'The Force of Destiny' (1862).

name: ÁNGELA
meaning: Spanish feminine form of Angelus (see ANGEL).

name: ÁRNI
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of ARNE(1).

name: ÁRPÁD
meaning: From Hungarian árpa meaning "barley". This was the name of a 9th-century Magyar ruler who led his people into Hungary. He is considered a Hungarian national hero.

name: ÁSA
meaning: Old Norse, Icelandic and Faroese form of ÅSA.

name: ÁSBJÖRN
meaning: Old Norse name derived from the elements áss "god" and björn "bear". It is therefore a cognate of OSBORN.

name: ÁSDÍS
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements áss "god" and dís "goddess".

name: ÁSKETILL
meaning: Derived from Old Norse áss "god" and ketill "cauldron, helmet".

name: ÁSLAUG
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of ASLAUG.

name: ÁSTRÍÐR
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements áss "god" and fríðr "beautiful, beloved".

name: ÁUREA
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of AUREA.

name: ÂNGELA
meaning: Portuguese feminine form of Angelus (see ANGEL).

name: ÅSA
meaning: Short form of Old Norse feminine names beginning with the element áss "god".

name: ÅSE
meaning: Danish and Norwegian form of ÅSA, as well as a Swedish variant.

name: ÅSMUND
meaning: From the Old Norse name Ásmundr, cognate of OSMOND.

name: ÆLFFLÆD
meaning: Old English name composed of the elements ælf "elf" and flæd "beauty".

name: ÆLFGIFU
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ælf "elf" and giefu "gift". This was the name of the first wife of the English king Æðelræd II.

name: ÆLFHEAH
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ælf "elf" and heah "high". This was the name of an 11th-century archbishop of Canterbury, a saint and martyr, who is commonly known as Alphege or Elphege.

name: ÆLFNOÐ
meaning: Derived from the Old English element ælf "elf" combined with noð "boldness, daring".

name: ÆLFRIC
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ælf "elf" and ric "power, rule".

name: ÆLFSIGE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ælf "elf" and sige "victory".

name: ÆLFSTAN
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ælf "elf" and stan "stone".

name: ÆLFSWIÞ
meaning: Derived from the Old English element ælf "elf" combined with swiþ "strong".

name: ÆLFWEARD
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ælf "elf" and weard "guardian".

name: ÆLFWIG
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ælf "elf" and wig "war, battle".

name: ÆLFWINE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements ælf "elf" and wine "friend". This name was not commonly used after the Norman conquest.

name: ÆLRED
meaning: Contracted form of ÆÐELRÆD. This was the name of a 12th-century English saint.

name: ÆSC
meaning: Means "ash tree" in Old English. This was the nickname of a 5th-century king of Kent, whose birth name was Oeric.

name: ÆTHELNOÐ
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements æðel "noble" and noð "boldness, daring".

name: ÆTHELWEARD
meaning: Derived from the Old English element æðel "noble" combined with weard "guardian".

name: ÆÐELBERHT
meaning: Old English cognate of Adalbert (see ALBERT). This was the name of a Saxon king of England and two kings of Kent, one of whom was a saint. It became unused after the Normans introduced their form of Adalbert after their invasion.

name: ÆÐELFLÆD
meaning: Old English name composed of the elements æðel "noble" and flæd "beauty". Æðelflæd was a 10th-century queen of Mercia.

name: ÆÐELFRIÐ
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements æðel "noble" and friþ "peace". The name was rarely used after the Norman conquest.

name: ÆÐELMÆR
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements æðel "noble" and mær "famous". It is a cognate of ADELMAR.

name: ÆÐELRIC
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements æðel "noble" and ric "power, rule". This was the name of several early Anglo-Saxon kings.

name: ÆÐELRÆD
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements æðel "noble" and ræd "counsel". This was the name of two Saxon kings of England including Æðelræd II "the Unready" whose realm was overrun by the Danes in the early 11th century. The name was rarely used after the Norman conquest.

name: ÆÐELSTAN
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements æðel "noble" and stan "stone". This was the name of an early king of England. The name was rarely used after the Norman conquest.

name: ÆÐELWINE
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements æðel "noble" and wine "friend". This name became rare after the Norman conquest. Saint Æðelwine was a 7th-century bishop of Lindsey, England.

name: ÆÐELÞRYÐ
meaning: Derived from the Old English elements æðel "noble" and þryð "strength".

name: ÇAĞATAY
meaning: From the Mongolian name Tsagadai (of unknown meaning), which was borne by the second son of Genghis Khan, known as Chagatai in English.

name: ÉAMON
meaning: Variant of ÉAMONN. This name was borne by American-born Irish president Éamon de Valera (1882-1975), whose birth name was Edward.

name: ÉIBHEAR
meaning: Meaning unknown. According to Irish legend this name belonged to two of the sons of Míl, Éibhear Dunn and Éibhear Finn, the first of the Gaels to conquer Ireland.

name: ÉIMHÍN
meaning: Possibly means "swift, prompt" in Irish Gaelic.

name: ÉLIANE
meaning: Probably from Aeliana, the feminine form of the Roman name Aelianus, which was derived from the Roman family name AELIUS. This was the name of an early saint and martyr.

name: ÉMILE
meaning: French form of Aemilius (see EMIL). This name was borne by French author Émile Zola (1840-1902).

name: ÉMILIE
meaning: French feminine form of Aemilius (see EMIL).

name: ÉMILIENNE
meaning: French feminine form of Aemilianus (see EMILIANO).

name: ÉNNA
meaning: Possibly means "bird-like" in Irish. This was the name of several Irish kings and heroes. It was also borne by a 6th-century saint who built the monastery of Killeany.

name: ÉOWYN
meaning: Means "horse joy" in Old English. This name was invented by J. R. R. Tolkien who used Old English to represent the Rohirric language. In his novel 'The Lord of the Rings' (1954) Eowyn is the niece of King Theoden of Rohan. She slays the Lord of the Nazgul in the Battle of the Pelennor Fields.

name: ÉRIU
meaning: From the name of an Irish goddess, who according to legend gave her name to Ireland (which is called Éire in Irish). In reality, the goddess probably got her name from that of the island, which may mean something like "abundant land" in Old Irish.

name: ÉTAÍN
meaning: Possibly derived from Old Irish ét "jealousy". In Irish mythology she was a sun and horse goddess who was the lover of Midir.

name: ÍDE
meaning: Possibly derived from Old Irish ítu "thirst". This was the name of a 6th-century Irish saint.

name: ÍRIS
meaning: Portuguese and Icelandic form of IRIS.

name: ÍÑIGO
meaning: Medieval Spanish form of ENEKO. This was the birth name of Saint Ignatius of Loyola, who changed it in honour of Saint Ignatius of Antioch. As such, this name is sometimes regarded as a form of IGNATIUS.

name: ÓRFHLAITH
meaning: Means "golden princess" from Irish ór "gold" combined with flaith "princess". This was the name of a sister of the Irish king Brian Boru.

name: ÓSCAR
meaning: Spanish and Portuguese form of OSCAR.

name: ÓÐINN
meaning: Old Norse and Icelandic form of ODIN.

name: ØYVIND
meaning: From the Old Norse name Eyvindr, which was derived from ey meaning "island" or "good fortune" and vindr possibly meaning "victor".

name: ÙISDEAN
meaning: Scottish Gaelic form of the Old Norse name EYSTEINN.

name: ÚNA
meaning: Possibly derived from Irish uan meaning "lamb".

name: ÚRSULA
meaning: Portuguese and Spanish form of URSULA.

name: ÜMİT
meaning: Means "hope" in Turkish, ultimately from Persian امید(omid).

name: ÞÓRA
meaning: Either a feminine form of Þórr (see THOR) or else a short form of the various Old Norse names beginning with the element Þór. In Norse myth Thora was the wife of the Danish king Ragnar Lodbrok.

name: ÞÓRARINN
meaning: Old Norse name derived from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with arn "eagle".

name: ÞÓRBJÖRG
meaning: Old Norse name which meant "Thor's protection" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with björg "help, save, rescue".

name: ÞÓRDÍS
meaning: Means "Thor's goddess" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with Old Norse dís "goddess".

name: ÞÓRFASTR
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements Þórr (see THOR) and fastr "firm".

name: ÞÓRFREÐR
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements Þórr (see THOR) and friðr "peace".

name: ÞÓRFRÍÐR
meaning: Derived from the Old Norse elements Þórr (see THOR) and fríðr "beautiful".

name: ÞÓRGÍSL
meaning: Old Norse name meaning "Thor's shaft" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with gísl "shaft, arrow".

name: ÞÓRIR
meaning: Means "Thor's warrior" from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with Old Norse vér "warrior, fighter".

name: ÞÓRR
meaning: Original Old Norse form of THOR.

name: ÞÓRVEIG
meaning: Derived from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with veig "strength".

name: ÞÓRVÍ
meaning: Derived from the name of the Norse god Þórr (see THOR) combined with ví "holy".

name: ĈIELA
meaning: Means "heavenly, from the sky" in Esperanto.

name: ČEDOMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements chedo meaning "child" and miru meaning "peace, world".

name: ČRTOMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements črt "hatred" and miru "peace, world". This is the name of the hero in the Slovene national epic 'Baptism on the Savica' (1835) by France Prešeren.

name: ĐURO
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of GEORGE.

name: ĐURĐICA
meaning: Croatian feminine form of GEORGE. It also means "lily of the valley" in Croatian.

name: İBRAHİM
meaning: Turkish and Azerbaijani form of ABRAHAM.

name: İLHAN
meaning: From the Mongolian title il-Khan meaning "subordinate Khan", which was first adopted by Genghis Khan's grandson Hulagu, who ruled a kingdom called the Ilkhanate that stretched from modern Iran to eastern Turkey.

name: İLKAY
meaning: Means "new moon" in Turkish, derived from ilk "first" and ay "moon".

name: İLKER
meaning: Means "first man" in Turkish, derived from ilk "first" and er "man, brave".

name: İREM
meaning: Turkish form of Arabic إرَم(Iram), the name of a beautiful city mentioned in the 89th chapter (surah al-Fajr) of the Qur'an.

name: İSLAM
meaning: Turkish and Azerbaijani form of ISLAM.

name: ŚWIĘTOMIERZ
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements svetu "blessed, holy" and miru "peace, world".

name: ŠIMON
meaning: Czech and Slovak form of SIMON(1).

name: ŠTEFAN
meaning: Slovene and Slovak form of STEPHEN.

name: ŠTEFANIJA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian feminine form of STEPHEN.

name: ŠÁRKA
meaning: Meaning unknown. In Czech legend Šárka was a maiden who joined other women in declaring war upon men. She tricked the men by having herself tied to a tree, and, after they came to her rescue, offering them mead laced with a sleeping potion. After the men fell asleep the other women slew them.

name: ŽAKLINA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of JACQUELINE.

name: ŽAN
meaning: Slovene form of ZUAN, GIAN or JEAN(1).

name: ŽANA
meaning: Slovene and Croatian form of GIANNA.

name: ŽARKO
meaning: Derived from Serbian and Croatian žar meaning "ember, zeal, fervour".

name: ŽELIMIR
meaning: Derived from the Slavic elements zheleti "to wish, to desire" and miru "peace, world".

name: ŽELJKO
meaning: Derived from South Slavic želja meaning "desire".

name: ŽIVA
meaning: Means "living, alive" in Slavic. This was the name of a Slavic goddess associated with life, fertility and spring.

name: ŽIVKA
meaning: Croatian and Serbian feminine form of ZHIVKO.

name: ŽIVKO
meaning: Croatian and Serbian form of ZHIVKO.

name: ŽYDRŪNAS
meaning: From Lithuanian žydra meaning "light blue" (using the patronymic suffix ūnas).
